Dr Amanda Zimmerman is a great doctor, she listens to me like I am the only patient that she has! She cares about my well being, not just my pain but my life! She asks questions to make sure that I feel safe in my living environment and if I need help with food insecurities!! She is very professional, but very caring at the same time. I highly recommend her especially if you are at an advanced age, like myself!!!|I have had the worst experience in my life dealing with this place. I went in to get help with my health issues willing to do what was asked of me to receive the help that I needed. They asked me to do physical therapy and I asked if they could fill out paperwork for me for my job in order for me to be able to go and keep my job. I was told sure no problem. I was thinking great but boy was I wrong. My first and only visit was in September I called every week several times each week reminding them that the paperwork needed to be sent back it had a deadline. I asked if they would fax the documents they said they didn't have a fax so it had to be picked up. When finally got word back from my job I found out that they didn't allow me enough time off for my situation and I gave them more paperwork to fix that one thing and they went right back to holding on to the paperwork it went past the deadline and when I finally received word from my job this time they left the time allowed away from work blank. Funny thing where they didn't have a fax machine before I found out that they fax the paperwork. Listen if you decide to go ahead and go to this facility in Winston Salem I would hope that you received better care than I did. The doctor was Christopher Gilmore and his nurse Maria. She was very rude he seemed nice but obvious didn't care because at the end of the day I called and left messages never got a call back so this my warning to you go and  see someone else.|Would not recommend this place. They did NOT ask for my co-pay when I would check in, which resulted in building a bill that I couldn't pay all together at once, so I wasn't "allowed" to be seen until paid. I've had 7 back surgeries and paralyzed twice. I'm in excruciating pain everyday all day. Office staff up front have bad attitudes all the time. The nurses also have bad attitudes and are very judgmental. The doctors nor PA's did not help me in the time I was there, prescribing medication I've taken before multiple times and told them it didn't help. Suggested a surgery I've been told no by other doctors about many times. When I would send a message through Mychart NONE were answered.|Dr North , Lena Ferris, FNP-C Tammy Burke FNP-C
Have provided some of the best Health Care I have ever experienced I feel in complete control and given options not pushed in one direction or treatment. Always feel like I in charge of my health care|If i could leave 0 stars i would. Since Dr. Ajam has left carolina pain clinic. The place has went to heck. They put me on a patch and I cant wear the patch because im allergic to it well they said they was going to switch to the film of the buprenorphine  but I have to fail a medication called tramadol or toridol im allergic to both. So they have left me with nothing for the pain. And I used to take oxycodone 5mg 4x a day so now I have nothing to take for my severe pain. And I've ended up in the er because im in so much pain. And Melissa Cole calls me to talks to me and then hangs up the phone on me in the middle of me talking. I DO NOT RECOMMEND GOING HERE FOR PAIN TREATMENT. Thank you so much Melissa Cole for hanging up on me I hope you one day experience what im experiencing and someone hangs up the phone on you also. I will not be going back to this pcheck. Also my name is Casey Moore|I've been suffering with debilitating chest pain that has destroyed my life for the past 3 years. I only slept a full nights rest a few nights a week, cried nearly every day from the excruciating pain, I had to give up my favorite hobbies because they triggered severe episodes. I was questioning if life was even worth it, and was hopeless! I just kept getting referred to specialist after specialist. No doctor would give me any sort of pain treatment at all until Dr Kapural. Some reviews say he is dismissive- in my case this is not true at all, he listened to my struggles, is very knowledgeable, has excellent bedside manner and most of all he actually cares enough to help manage my pain. I got my first injections today, and am hopeful for recovery now. I can't thank him enough for helping me. The staff is also wonderful!|Dr.Ward is the best doctor I've ever seen in my life, explained everything in detail, and ordered multiple tests that no other doctors would! He did an in-depth examination, and reassured me every step of the way. I have never felt more seen or heard!|The doctors and staff are great. You couldn't ask for any better than doctor Caldwell or Doctor Gilmore. I have been seen here for over 10 years but will be leaving due to the office Management. They need to do themselves a favor and find a new one she is turning this into a cluster.

Piedmont Interventional Pain Care serves the Salisbury, NC area with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialized clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients overcome chronic pain and return to their daily activities. With a team of board-certified specialists, we offer evidence-based treatments that focus on minimizing pain while maximizing function and quality of life.

At Piedmont Interventional Pain Care, we provide a wide range of specialized services including treatment for work-related injuries, alternative remedies for those seeking non-traditional approaches, and second opinions for patients looking to confirm their diagnosis or explore additional treatment options. Our holistic approach to pain management ensures that each patient receives personalized care that addresses their specific condition.

On-Site Facilities

For your convenience, our clinic features an on-site laboratory and X-ray facilities, eliminating the need for multiple appointments at different locations. These in-house diagnostic capabilities allow our specialists to make accurate assessments and develop effective treatment plans promptly. While waiting for your appointment, you can enjoy our comfortable WiFi-equipped waiting room, designed to make your visit as pleasant as possible.

Wake Spine & Pain Specialists serves Raleigh, North Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve mobility and enhance quality of life. Our team of board-certified specialists understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we've developed a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain. Since our founding, we've helped thousands of Triangle area residents find relief from debilitating conditions through our patient-centered care philosophy.

At Wake Spine & Pain, we recognize that effective pain treatment rarely comes from a single therapy. Our specialists carefully evaluate each patient's condition to develop customized treatment plans that may include advanced interventional procedures, pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy, and massage therapy. This integrated approach allows us to target pain from multiple angles, often helping patients avoid risky surgical interventions while achieving meaningful relief.

Specialized Services

Our practice offers state-of-the-art diagnostic capabilities and treatment options including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections

  • Regenerative medicine therapies

  • Comprehensive pain management programs

Visit Our Raleigh Location

Our conveniently located Raleigh pain clinic provides a comfortable, supportive environment for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. We're committed to creating personalized care plans that respect each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Address: 3801 Wake Forest Rd Suite 210, Raleigh, NC 27609, United States

Phone: +1 919-787-7246

Website: https://wakespine.com/locations/raleigh-pain-clinic/
column11: At Wake Spine & Pain, it is our mission to relieve pain so that our patients can attain more mobility and better quality of life. Pain is rarely treated effectively by any single mode of treatment alone. For that reason, we carefully evaluate, diagnose and design a patient-centric treatment plan that includes the most advanced interventional pain procedures with complementary modalities like pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy and massage therapy. Our unique, well-rounded approach gives patients the best results, often avoiding risky surgeries.

She's compassionate and very knowledgeable. The staff is welcoming and they exhibit great professionalism!|My entire experience was wonderful.  Every staff member was kind and knowledgeable.  My NP was so kind and understanding.  I will definitely recommend this practice to others.|Will not go there. Appointment was at 10:20, got there at 9:52, was told to hold on a minute, checked in at 9:58 then was told I was not there 30 minutes early so would have to reschedule my appointment. When I told her I was there at 9:52, she said i checked you in at 9:58, you're late. I saved money and also decided who not to see. Can't imagine how little attention they would actually give to my case. If you do go, take a picture of the time you stand at the desk. They will make you wait then you'll be late.|Not to happy with the current change up with the staff, and unfamiliar faces that are now there!.. But Dr. Jessica Salmon, is wonderful!!  Extremely thorough and detailed through every step!..  It's truly a blessing to have a personable doctor, who takes the time to get to know you as a person and not just view you as an appointment!|I'm an established patient who has been trying for 3 days to get an appointment setup.
I have tried to setup on the website as suggested. Called and left messages as well to please call me with no response. so after work I went by to do so in person as I need to get this scheduled.
Per Google you are open till 5pm.
Closed at 3:00 today. I literally drove here to do this.  It would be nice if someone would return my voicemail or answer the phones. Not a good way to run a business
Updated: They called me on Monday and apologized about the situation.  They also updated the open times on Google as well.
I am satisfied with the follow-up and they reached out to remedy the situation and helped discuss my concerns with my doctor. I dont leave a review unless I'm really upset so I appreciate they took my concerns seriously.

column2: Pain and Laser Centers of North Carolina
column3:
Pain and Laser Centers of North Carolina, located in Greensboro, NC, stands as the premier destination for innovative laser treatment solutions throughout the Carolinas. Our specialized clinic offers groundbreaking non-invasive pain management therapies designed to address chronic pain conditions without relying on medications, injections, or surgical interventions. As a patient-focused practice, we've established ourselves as leaders in alternative pain management by combining cutting-edge technology with personalized care plans tailored to each individual's specific needs.

At the heart of our practice is Lasera, a proprietary treatment protocol developed by Dr. Aaron Williams, DC. This innovative approach has transformed pain management for countless patients suffering from chronic conditions. The Lasera protocol utilizes advanced laser technology to target pain at its source, promoting natural healing and providing lasting relief where traditional methods have failed. Our evidence-based approach has demonstrated remarkable success rates across a wide spectrum of pain conditions.

Personalized Care Approach

The doctors and staff at Pain and Laser Centers of North Carolina work collaboratively with each patient to develop customized treatment programs. We begin with a comprehensive assessment to understand the specific nature of your pain issues, then create a targeted plan designed to address your unique circumstances. Our team remains committed to your progress throughout the treatment journey, adjusting approaches as needed to maximize effectiveness and ensure optimal outcomes.

Medication-Free Pain Management

Our primary goal is helping patients manage their pain without dependence on medications or invasive procedures. By focusing on the body's natural healing capabilities and enhancing them through advanced laser therapy, we offer a safer alternative to traditional pain management approaches. This medication-free philosophy reduces potential side effects while addressing the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Contact Information

To learn more about our innovative approach to pain management or to schedule a consultation, please contact us:

Phone: +1 336-299-3037

Address: 3831 W Market St, Greensboro, NC 27407, United States

Website: www.painandlasercenters.com
column11:
Pain and Laser Centers of North Carolina, pllc located in Greensboro, is the premier laser treatment center of the Carolinas. Using Lasera, a treatment protocol developed by Dr. Aaron Williams, DC, we are able to treat chronic pain efficiently and affordably.

The doctors and staff of PMCNC work with you to develop treatment programs targeted to address your specific pain issues. Our goal is to help you manage their your without medications or invasive procedures like injections or surgery.

column40:
Hi,
I was unfortunately involved in a car accident. My wife ask some friends for recommendations and the pain and laser center came highly recommended. I also visited my primary care the day after the accident and they also recommended pain and laser center. I had never been to a chiropractor. My primary care called and they opened a spot for me to come the same day. I have to say I was a bit skeptical at first but after a few visits and adjustments I am now a believer. I have made steady progress over the past 3 weeks. The treatments are great. This office has a very nice, modern, clean and relaxing atmosphere. The professional staff is wonderfully positive. I highly recommend this place of business if you have been in an accident or maybe have issues with pain in your back. Special thanks to Dr. Stafford.|Dr. Williams is an amazing Chiropractor as he is a person.  Every single visit has been very welcoming, pleasant, and beneficial.  The entire staff is equally amazing.  I look forward to seeing everyone and having my treatment sessions.  In a world where kindness, consideration and smiles seem to be less...you are guaranteed all three and more when you visit.  Thank you Dr. Williams, Dr. Evans, Ashley, Aileen, Melanie, Kelly and Jesse!!!!!!!!|Friendly and knowledgeable staff - Aileen the laser technician is wonderful as is Dr. Williams.  I came here in September with debilitating pain from an existing condition worsened by a slip and fall.  The treatment plan designed for me has effectively, and happily, got me back to 100%. I highly recommend this center!|Great Place!!! Friendly and caring staff.  Was having disk pain that was impacting my nerves and legs.  Aileen does a great job applying the laser treatments. Started receiving treatments with the last two weeks and the majority of the pain is gone.|I had some serious pain issues after I herniated a disk while working out a few months ago. On top of the normal back pain that comes with a herniated disk, I also developed a sciatic issue that would run down the left side of my leg that at times, was even more painful.  I met with Dr. Evans and she recommended laser therapy along with rehab and adjustments. I noticed the laser therapy really helped my back, especially my sciatic nerve. It really calmed the nerve down and gave me some much-needed pain relief. If you are active and need some help with you back pain, I would recommend to anyone that they speak with Dr. Evans.|PAIN AND LASER CENTER in Greensboro N.C. on West Market Street is an awesome place for any type of pain. The people that work there are professional, nice, and gentle.  The office is very organized and ran very professional. Each person that comes there is important to all the staff and the Doctors. The staff and the Doctors greets you every time by name. It truly is a place to heal and get rid of your pain.|Found them because of extreme pain in my hip.  Turned out I had 2 vertebrae turned and disks compressed.  They are getting it fixed.  Pain is gone.
Love the staff.  Victoria and Aileen take great care and make me feel very welcome every time.|P and L Center doctors and staff are knowledgeable, friendly and caring.  They listen and, having heard, respond to concerns to customize treatment to meet my individual needs.  With these professionals as partners, I find myself increasingly hopeful that I will be able to more successfully manage my health issues and improve the quality of my life.

column3:
Wake Spine & Pain Specialists serves Fayetteville, North Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located in the heart of Fayetteville at 260 Robeson Street, our dedicated team of pain specialists understands that chronic pain extends beyond physical discomfort, often causing emotional distress and financial burden for both patients and their families. We've built our practice on the foundation of compassionate care, utilizing evidence-based approaches to diagnose and treat various pain conditions.

At Wake Spine & Pain Specialists, we recognize that pain is a complex medical condition requiring personalized treatment plans. Our board-certified physicians employ a methodical approach, beginning with thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of your pain. We prioritize minimally invasive interventions before considering more advanced treatments, ensuring you receive the maximum relief with minimal risk. Our comprehensive services address conditions ranging from back and neck pain to neuropathy, joint pain, and complex regional pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes our practice is our unwavering commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We believe informed patients make better decisions about their healthcare journey. During your consultation, our specialists will carefully explain your diagnosis, discuss various treatment options, and develop a customized plan aligned with your personal health goals. This collaborative approach has helped countless Fayetteville residents reclaim their lives from debilitating pain.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our Fayetteville clinic offers state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic interventions, including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and medication management. We continually invest in the latest technologies and techniques to provide our patients with cutting-edge pain solutions that promote long-term relief and improved functionality.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management experts, call us at (919) 787-7246. Our Fayetteville office is conveniently located at 260 Robeson St, Fayetteville, NC 28301. For more information about our services and other locations, visit our website at https://wakespine.com/locations/fayetteville-pain-clinic/.
column11:
Welcome to Wake Spine & Pain Specialists!
Chronic pain is a complex condition that can inflict physical, emotional and financial stress on patients and their families. The specialists at Wake Spine & Pain have dedicated their careers to investigating the causes of pain and developing innovative ways to treat it. Our specialists will explore various pain management options, beginning with the least invasive alternative and arriving at a solution that provides the greatest amount of relief with the least amount of risk.
column38: Catherine Nickels|Nellie F|Terrie Jordan|Cornelia Hill|Pamela Woolen|Jessica Taylor|Faith Alexander|Sylvia Furgurson
column40:
Appt was set pretty quickly. I arrived 30 mins prior as told to by them. Instead I waited 2 hrs and 30 mins in waiting room, to see dr for 10 mins tops an told my condition is minor. Totally disregarded by dr that my medications worked for me an cut me off all medications to be put on basically one medication, an put on a medication I can't take. Then basically rushed out cayse it was 5 pm. The staff was rude, the front desk gave dirty looks, an never a smile. Were on cellphones. Now one tech ms. A. Garcia was kind an understanding of me being a parents whose husband is deployed. An apologized for the wait. I asked my pcp to be sent somewhere else.|I made an appt for 12/18. I needed to reschedule it for 2025. Called a week before my appt and left a message to reached. No one got back to me. Just called today 12/17 to confirm that appt was cx and to resched. I got a foreign operator who said they were gonna transfer me to the right department, waited over 20 mins for a person to pick up only for them to tell me to pick option 1 and transferred me back into the queue WHILE I was still SPEAKING TO THEM. Needless to say I will not be calling a third time.|I had horrible experiences at the Fayetteville location. The front desk and nurses are rude, uncaring and disrespectful. The only person who I felt was caring was the Nurse Practioner or PA. (She was not a doctor. She was pregnant the last time I saw her but unfortunately I can't remember her name.) My last visit was in July 2024. They had just moved to a new location. I was put into a large room with a GURNEY, 1 chair and a tiny table for the doctor to put his computer on. He wanted to see my lower back so he lowered my pants while I stood in the middle of the room since there was no exam table for me to even lean on. It felt odd and uncomfortable. I was in excruciating pain. I asked for a shot of Toradol to calm the pain down. The doctor refused. (I am not on any controlled substances so I was not trying  to get any "drugs". Toradol is not a controlled substance and works great for easing my pain temporarily.) The doctor checked me over and said "I'll be right back". I waited for a long time thinking he had a Eureka moment but he never came back! However, he did order an MRI. Since I knew I was NEVER stepping foot in that place again, I made sure my MRI results were sent to me and my Primary Care physician. Something showed up on the MRI that was unrelated to my spine. My PC called me the very next day and told me I had to go to another doctor to have the findings checked out immediately! Wake Spine and Pain never called me about the results. Thank God I had my results sent to my PC or I would not have had this concerning condition taken care of ASAP.  Weeks or possibly months later, I did get an unintelligible voice message from Wake Spine and Pain about rescheduling a follow-up appointment. Since my last visit with this disrespectful,  uncaring practice,  I have found a NEW clinic where I am treated with dignity and respect. For years, I put up with the hatefulness at Wake Spine and Pain because I thought it was the only pain clinic in Fayetteville. Due to my work schedule  I did not want to go to travel long distances. I just want people to know there is another option in the Fayetteville area!|I've been attending Wake Spine and Pain for a couple of years now and I have to say hands down I love the atmosphere, the staff members and especially my NP Tamesha Kamconteh. She is the best. Very empathetic, understanding, passionate and listens to her patients and gives the best service hands down. Thank You Mrs Kamconteh.|I saw PA Tameka. Wasn't a pleasant experience. Going to a new dr or PA is always stressful but it was much more. On my 1st visit, I asked if she would able to write my meds & if a nerve stimulator implant for my back would be helpful. A yr ago I decided to quit taking narcotics as they weren't doing much good. I told them when I made the appt I was NOT looking for medication other than my Lyrica. No problem. The 2nd visit was off the rails! She was short & disinterested in what I had to say. She reminded me of the tests she ordered the 1st visit. She went to check on something then sent another nurse in with the name of another clinic, telling me Ms Tameka said I was an "addict" & that was the name of a detox center. Say what? I asked to see Ms T but the nurse pointed her finger at the door & told me I needed to leave. I was flabbergasted! The only rx I asked abt was changing me back to my original muscle relaxer. So that makes me an addict? OK. But I'm a happy addict then. Lolol
Addicted to sobriety!!|I hate to post this as I was excited to see a doc. This post was my initial appt experience. I checked in early and completed my paperwork earlier in day since was coming from fort liberty. I arrive for my appt time but was told I was "supposed to come 30 minutes before my appt" time and i had to be rescheduled" was somone going to tell me that? The text doesn't say that. I declined and will not return.|The office staff at the front desk are rude and short with patients. Wait time is excessively long. You will be waiting over an hour after appointment times. Doctors do not inform you of your results in a timely manner. I have been inquiring about my results for a while and had to call back while awaiting a follow up appointment. Phone hold times are also extremely lone. While waiting in an exam room no one comes to tell you anything they just let you wait and hour or so over your appointment time.
The only staff member who pulled me in on time and explained my x-rays was Princy Paul. She was the only reason I didn't pull out but now I am having second thoughts about this establishment. Very unprofessional.|From the time I walked through the front door, I felt calm and peaceful. I did not know what to expect but Dr Prince did calm all my worries and fears. Thank her so much .

column2: Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas serves the Asheville and Arden, NC regions as the area's premier pain management specialists. Understanding that chronic pain is not merely a symptom but a disease requiring comprehensive treatment, our dedicated team provides personalized care for patients suffering from various pain conditions. With our state-of-the-art facility located at 1340 Patton Ave Suite J in Asheville, we've established ourselves as trusted healthcare partners committed to improving quality of life through effective pain management solutions.

At Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas, we take a fundamentally different approach to treating pain. Rather than simply addressing symptoms, we focus on identifying the underlying causes of your discomfort. Whether your pain stems from injury, disease, infection, arthritis, cancer, fibromyalgia, post-surgical complications, or other conditions, our specialists develop targeted treatment strategies designed for your specific needs.

Personalized Treatment Plans

We believe in creating custom treatment plans that prioritize minimally invasive and conservative approaches. Our process begins with attentive listening to understand your experience, followed by thorough evaluation and education about your condition. This collaborative approach ensures you're an informed participant in your own healing journey. We remain invested in your long-term wellbeing, focusing on sustainable pain relief rather than temporary fixes.

Serving Our Community

Conveniently located to serve patients throughout Asheville and Arden, our practice has become a trusted resource for those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. We welcome new patients and accept various insurance plans to ensure accessible care for all who need it. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.cpcdoctors.com or call us at (828) 505-4777.
column11:
As the Asheville regions premier pain management group, we fundamentally understand that chronic pain is not a symptom. Chronic pain is a disease, and must be treated as such.

This location serves pain management patients in Asheville & Arden, NC.
Our approach to pain treatment is unique. It is about identifying the underlying cause of your pain. Whether your pain is a result of injury, disease, infection, arthritis, cancer, fibromyalgia, post-surgical pain etc., we can help.

We aim to improve your quality of life by listening to you, creating custom treatment plans, and educating you as we learn more about your conditions. We're invested in your sustained relief from pain. Our treatment plans are minimally invasive and conservative.

column2: Spine & Pain Specialists of The Carolinas
column3:
Spine & Pain Specialists of The Carolinas serves Charlotte, North Carolina and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management care in a comfortable, patient-focused environment. Founded by Dr. Aashish Jay Kumar, MD, D.ABA, this premier practice specializes in identifying and treating the root causes of chronic and acute pain conditions that impact quality of life. The clinic's compassionate team works diligently to provide personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At Spine & Pain Specialists of The Carolinas, patients receive evidence-based treatments for a wide range of conditions including back pain, neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), fibromyalgia, and joint pain. Dr. Kumar's extensive training in interventional pain medicine allows the practice to offer advanced therapeutic options that minimize reliance on medication while maximizing pain relief and functional improvement.

Advanced Treatment Options

The practice distinguishes itself through specialization in cutting-edge interventional procedures including:

- Peripheral nerve stimulation

- Dorsal root ganglion stimulation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Minimally invasive interventional techniques

These modern, evidence-based approaches provide alternatives for patients who haven't found relief through conventional treatments, helping them regain control of their lives and reduce dependence on pain medications.

Patient-Centered Approach

What truly sets Spine & Pain Specialists of The Carolinas apart is their commitment to treating each patient with dignity and personalized attention. The welcoming environment at their Charlotte office creates a space where patients of all ages feel comfortable discussing their pain concerns and working collaboratively toward effective solutions.

Contact Information:

- Phone: +1 704-817-0147

- Address: 12610 N Community House Rd STE 100, Charlotte, NC 28277, United States

- Website: [www.spinepaincarolinas.com](https://www.spinepaincarolinas.com/?utmsource=GMBSocialClimb&utmmedium=Spine%26PainSpecialistsofTheCarolinas)
column11:
Spine & Pain Specialists of the Carolinas is a premier pain management practice in Charlotte, North Carolina, owned and operated by interventional pain medicine specialist Aashish Jay Kumar, MD, D.ABA. The practice serves adults of all ages in a comfortable and welcoming environment.
Dr. Kumar and his staff find the root cause of severe or ongoing pain. They treat back pain, neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), fibromyalgia, joint pain, and other pain-causing conditions.
Spine & Pain Specialists of the Carolinas specializes in peripheral nerve stimulation, dorsal root ganglion stimulation, spinal cord stimulation, and many other modern day evidenced based treatments to relieve discomfort.

column3:
Premier Pain Solutions serves patients across North Carolina and South Carolina with dedicated pain management services. With a commitment to compassionate care, our team of specialists provides innovative and minimally invasive treatments designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a comprehensive, patient-centered approach to diagnosis and treatment.

We proudly maintain multiple offices throughout the Carolinas to better serve our patients:

North Carolina Locations:

- Asheville

- Columbus

- Greenville

- Wilmington

South Carolina Locations:

- Easley

- Greenville

Our Columbus office is conveniently located at 155 W Mills St #204, Columbus, NC 28722.

Specialized Pain Management

At Premier Pain Solutions, we specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

- Arthritis - Joint pain and inflammation

- Back Pain - Acute and chronic spinal issues

- Cancer Pain - Pain related to cancer and its treatments

- Fibromyalgia - Widespread musculoskeletal pain

- Migraines - Severe, debilitating headaches

Our Approach

What sets Premier Pain Solutions apart is our dedication to personalized care plans. We recognize that each patient experiences pain differently, with unique circumstances and needs. Our specialists take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition before developing a tailored treatment strategy that addresses your specific pain concerns.

Our focus on minimally invasive procedures means we can often provide effective relief while minimizing recovery time and reducing the need for more aggressive interventions.

For compassionate pain management from an experienced team, contact Premier Pain Solutions today at +1 833-365-7246 or visit us online at [www.premierpainusa.com](https://www.premierpainusa.com/).
column11:
Premier Pain Solutions is dedicated to offering compassionate, patient-centered care through minimally invasive treatments. With offices in Asheville, Columbus, Greenville, and Wilmington, North Carolina, as well as Easley, and Greenville, South Carolina, we focus on delivering effective relief for acute and chronic pain conditions.
Our expert team specializes in treating a range of issues, including arthritis, back pain, cancer pain, fibromyalgia, and migraines. We understand that each patient is unique, so we create personalized care plans tailored to your specific needs.

column2: Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas serves Murphy, NC and surrounding Western North Carolina communities with specialized pain management solutions. At Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas, we work with our patients to heal from pain and resolve its physical, neurological, and psychological impacts.
We know that while pain may start as a matter of biology, it very quickly becomes a mental, social, and emotional burden, which exacerbates the physical components of chronic pain. Our clinical team and WNC pain doctors operate with an inherent understanding of this experience and uses an interdisciplinary approach to treating pain. We make every decision based on our end goal of helping our patients experience relief from all of the complications associated with chronic pain, and offer treatments accordingly.

column3:
Spine & Pain Associates, PLLC in Sanford, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout Lee County and surrounding areas. Our board-certified physicians specialize in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that minimize reliance on opioid medications. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain.

At Spine & Pain Associates, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain. Our expertise includes treatment for back and neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to accurately identify pain sources before developing targeted treatment strategies.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach that may include minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, medication management, and lifestyle modifications. Our team works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of a patient's health. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific condition, medical history, and personal goals.

Facility and Accessibility

Our modern facility at 1303 Carthage St in Sanford is equipped with state-of-the-art technology for diagnostic and therapeutic procedures. We offer a comfortable, welcoming environment with convenient parking and accessibility features. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans, including Medicare and Medicaid.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please visit www.spineandpainassociates.com or call us at (919) 292-2468.

column2: Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas serves patients throughout Asheville and Marion, North Carolina with specialized pain management solutions. Our board-certified physicians bring decades of combined experience in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. We've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider in Western North Carolina, offering personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas, we specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, fibromyalgia, diabetic neuropathy, arthritis, migraines, and sciatica. Our multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to provide comprehensive care. New patients are currently being accepted at our Asheville location, with convenient appointment scheduling available.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment strategies. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative therapies, we work to improve your quality of life and restore function while minimizing reliance on medication when possible.

Visit Our Practice

Our Marion office is conveniently located at 31 California Ave, Marion, NC 28752. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call +1 828-559-3399 or visit our website at https://www.cpcdoctors.com/ for more information about our services. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure accessible care for all our patients throughout the Carolinas.
column11: Our pain management doctors in Asheville are accepting new patients. We welcome patients with back pain, neck pain, fibromyalgia, diabetic pain, arthritis, migraines, sciatica and more.

column2: Center For Pain Management & Orthobiologic Medicine - Wilmington NC
column3:
Center For Pain Management & Orthobiologic Medicine serves Wilmington, NC with comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic or acute discomfort. Our dedicated team of interventional musculoskeletal and spinal pain specialists brings decades of combined experience to address pain throughout the body, offering personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Whether you're struggling with persistent shoulder, arm, back, leg, neck, or foot pain, our experts provide effective interventions designed to improve your quality of life. We also specialize in treating recent injuries, including whiplash and "weekend warrior syndrome," helping patients return to their normal activities as quickly and comfortably as possible.

Advanced Treatment Options

At Center For Pain Management & Orthobiologic Medicine, we pride ourselves on offering cutting-edge therapies including:

• Regenerative Medicine: Stem cell therapy and platelet-rich plasma (PRP) treatments that harness your body's natural healing abilities

• Neuromodulation: State-of-the-art spinal cord stimulation for difficult-to-treat pain conditions

• Radiofrequency Ablation: Precision techniques to target pain-causing nerve signals

• Non-Invasive Options: Laser therapy and sound-based shockwave treatments for those with needle anxiety

Patient-Centered Approach

Our practice is committed to creating a comfortable, supportive environment for patients and their families. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of your discomfort.

Visit us at 1602 Physicians Dr STE 103, Wilmington, NC 28401, or call 910-941-8815 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at www.portcitypain.com and take the first step toward a pain-free life today.
column11: Our interventional musculoskeletal and spinal pain management experts can treat your pain, no matter where it is located. We have decades of experience in helping patients with chronic shoulder, arm, back, leg, neck, and foot pain. We can also help you manage, and oftentimes eliminate pain resulting from more recent injuries such as whiplash or "weekend warrior syndrome". We specialize in advanced treatment options like stem cell and platelet rich plasma (PRP) therapy. We are also leading experts in the use of spinal cord stimulation and radiofrequency ablation. If you're afraid of needles don't worry! We have noninvasive laser and sound based shockwave therapy as well. We look forward to being of service to you and your family!
column38: george huffmon|William Bianchi|Haley C|cptnjack|Shawn Sanders|Fran Schiller|Victoria Mondragon|joe polychronis
column40:
Center for Pain Management is outstanding. I saw Dr. Knab and his team, they were extremely informative and personable. Dr. Knab was able to correctly identify the issue and provide treatment. I was positively blown away by the great care I received from the staff. I highly recommend this practice!|Very positive experience today. Respectful, gentle and very knowledgeable team. I'm looking forward to continuing care with them. First time in a while that I was treated like a real person. Thanks so much.

A follow up: four months, 3 procedures, both doctors and only temporary relief. Finally I was seen at a follow up by a PA I had not met. She informed me that I was 72, my back is in bad shape and they can't help me anymore. It's the first time I've ever been rejected by a medical practice and I didn't even see a doctor in the end! Medicine is the only service that demands payment even when the treatment fails. Draw your own conclusion.|Recommend Dr. Arora and this practice to all needing pain management care. You will be in the best expert, kind, and compassionate hands working with this practice and I am so grateful for being able to be their patient!! Recently had first lumbar sympathetic nerve block injection with Dr. Arora and was so nervous beforehand but he and his staff talked me through it with kindness and patience. I cried tears of joy at the relief this injection gave me! Highly recommend!!!|My first visit was 6 weeks ago. I have had back pain and leg pain off and on for 6 years which affected my leg all the way down to my ankle. In the past six years I had visited three other pain clinics in town and this was my last stop. When asked my level of pain it was 7.5.Sitting for more than 5 minutes was extremely uncomfortable in any chair including car seats. Driving, aggravated the pain immensely. Since I didn't have a current MRI, the staff sent me immediately for a current one. At my follow-up visit for the MRI, I was told that I have a thicken ligament at L4/L5. The staff  showed me my MRI in detail taking time to explain what they were showing me. I was pleasantly surprised when I was offered a procedure that would alleviate my pain. I was handed a brochure for a procedure called the M.I.L.D procedure. The staff explain this procedure to me and advised me to research it as well. I found what they explained to me was correct and it is a minimally invasive procedure. I accepted the surgery and it was done in a very timely manner. Three days after the surgery, I am pain free in my back and leg and I couldn't be more happy. The staff at the clinic are truly dedicated to helping people reduce their pain as much as possible with today's technology. I hope I don't need to visit this clinic again but it is very comforting to know that if I have any body pain in the future I have a clinic that offers me tried and true options with expertise. Thank you to all the clinical staff for your professionalism, expertise and above all caring enough not to rush me out the door and explain worth while options.|Dr. Knab and his staff are very personable, attentive and take the time to listen to your concerns.   Highly recommended!|Today was my first visit , everyone was super nice, professional and very informative. Dr Arora was wonderful, he took his time to explain everything and listened to all
of my concerns . I look forward to being treated by them in the future.|Dr. Sunil k. Arora messed up my spinal injection and when I confronted him he denied it. Now I'm in severe spinal and leg pain. I have reported him to the medical board and filing a medical malpractice lawsuit. Please DO NOT get a back injection or any injections from him. He does not take accountability for his actions. Only gets defensive. And his nurses will back him because they don't want to be out of a damn job. It's sad and pathetic that he messed up someone's life and not admitting to it.|I came across the Center For Pain Management when I started looking for PRP injections. I am 28 and have torn my bicep tendon 4 times now in the past 7 years. The surgeon wanted to try cortisone before surgery but after doing my research found that cortisone is short term and often creates more issues, especially when surgery is needed. Dr. Knab and his team were awesome, very helpful and very affordable. It has been six months since my PRP injections and while I still need surgery, the progress I have made is still pretty incredible. Before the PRP I couldn't even walk without my arm in a sling and now I can lift weights and do light swimming. Unfortunately my injury is pretty severe since It's happened so many times, so I will still need the surgery. But the improvements I made were legitimate and I would highly recommend seeking them out for alternative healing methods. I would be curious to know what we could have done if I had found them sooner.

column49: I received PRP therapy (similar to stem cells that cause your body to heal)  here about 1 months ago.... they are injections also. I have 3 degenerated disks and at least 1 bulging. I did the procedure After 1 week of heeling from the injections and I feal Amazing, I went from not being able to walk or sit or really do anything without being in so much pain to now I only have 20%-30% of the pain and I sometimes forget that I am even hurting... I'm just hopeful that it last a long time so I don't need to have surgery in the future. It cost about $5k for the total process but insurance will Not cover it because it's too new for insurance companies to get on board. Good luck with your pain. I know how bad it can be.

column3:
Carolinas Pain Center serves Huntersville, NC and surrounding communities throughout the Carolinas with comprehensive pain management solutions. At CPC, patients experience a unique approach to healthcare where they are empowered to take charge of their treatment journey. The center's philosophy centers on creating thriving partnerships between patients and medical professionals, encouraging individuals to become knowledgeable participants in their own health decisions.

The CPC team has established itself as a leader in treating diverse and complex painful conditions. Their innovative approaches rival those found at the most selective medical facilities nationwide, providing hope to patients who previously had limited options. The center's medical professionals are trained to think critically and maintain exceptionally high standards in patient care.

Patient-Centered Approach

What truly distinguishes Carolinas Pain Center is their commitment to patient education and involvement. The medical team works diligently to ensure each patient understands their condition and the available treatment options, fostering a collaborative environment where informed decisions lead to better outcomes.

Advanced Treatment Options

Patients at CPC gain access to cutting-edge pain management techniques and technologies that address both common and complex pain conditions. This advanced approach allows many individuals to find relief when traditional methods have failed.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit [www.carolinaspaincenter.com](http://www.carolinaspaincenter.com/) or call +1 704-500-2332. The center is conveniently located at 9735 Kincey Ave STE 100, Huntersville, NC 28078.
column11:
At CPC, we encourage our patients to be in charge of their healthcare. Success in good health comes from a thriving partnership between patients and our doctors and staff. We encourage patients to be knowledgeable about their health and be responsible about the decisions involved in their health care.
The CPC team has treated patients with diverse and complex painful conditions with some of the most innovative approaches in medicine. As a result, patients who once had few options, are now offered advanced medical treatment that can only be sought for in some of the most selective medical facilities in the nation.
Our team at CPC is encouraged to think critically, excel at their responsibilities and create higher expectations.

Please give them a try!|I went to the doctor today with Dr. shaw, I was told I had other meds in my system that I know nothing about. Only meds are what are prescribed for me. I feel disappointed because I have followed all the rules|My wife has been battling chronic pain for almost 3 years, and was referred to half a dozen different specialists before we found Dr. Shah. After reviewing all of the prior imaging and tests he took us through a series of progressively more intense treatments until we found one that works. My wife finally had her first pain-free days in years thanks to Dr. Shah.

I'm puzzled by the reviews saying that the staff are hard to reach. We've gotten the voice menu and left messages on occasion but that's been the exception for us, and when we do leave a message we've always gotten a prompt callback. Their insurance  team did all the heavy lifting for us with pre-approvals and, in the latest case, a successful insurance appeal.

It is no exaggeration to say that finding Dr. Shah was life-changing for us. I just wish we'd found him sooner.|I don't recommend the Carolinas pain center. I went there for my knees. Had a discussion with the doctor. They told me that they were going to follow up and we would start injections. No one ever contacted me back, but they did order injection medicine for my knees, but that was only after I contacted them and asked them why no one had reached out to me. Even though the medicine showed up in my chart, no one ever called me at all. The follow up was so poor no callbacks, no follow ups, I'm not going back. Don't waste your time. They also took a test to see if I was taking any drugs at the time and it took them over a month to get the results back.

column11: Midtown Spine and Pain Clinic is the Triangle area's elite pain management clinic. Would highly recommend.|When you go to a doctor they usually try to get you in and out as soon as possible, so they can go to their next patient.  It a business model.  Doctor Weber was not your typical doctor. He took the time and spent a lot of time with me explaining my lower back discs issues.  I am very pleased with him for not rushing me, listening to my medical problems, and answering my questions.  He also keeps an open mind for different treatments (very important). He also cares about the patient.|I love the experience I've had with her. I've been seeing her now for about 4 months. She listens and takes everything you are saying into consideration. Thank you|The office manager required me to sign the general consent form for release of information to respective third parties as needed to conduct business. However A separate sentence at the end of the document required me to waive liability of all employees agents, and Physicians of release here in As stated on the document which Makes me wave my rights under federal law for HIPAA violations by their employees and Physicians. I told the manager that I agreed with the bullet points that covered the necessary, third parties for billing purposes however, I did not agree with the last sentence that waived my rights for suit for violation of HIPAA law. They refused to let me see the doctor unless I did waive my rights. I would definitely recommend them.|If you have any children or young people with rare musculoskeletal disorders requiring treatment please seek help elsewhere. PA was uncomfortable and unwilling to seek proper treatment. You will be made to seem like you are burden for trying to seek any help beyond one size fits all regiments and will be told "if you don't like it go get a different opinion" by the PA and that "you're to young" regardless of whether or not you need treatment. I was told by the PA "we aren't an urgent care clinic if you are in pain go to the hospital" I've never experienced bedside manners this poorly as a patient and caregiver for those going through chronic pain. I Cannot stress enough do not come here if you have any rare genetic/musculoskeletal issues the PA's are not knowledgeable and will not tailor your care accordingly seek help elsewhere if you need|Great first visit. Dr Webber was great explaining my options and set   a clear, logical course of action to address my pain & recovery after a major car accident.

After reading some of the 1 star comments..... don't just show up expecting to be prescribed oxy. From the very first form I filled out, it was clear they must get addicts trying to scam on a daily basis.|If you are seeking treatment for chronic pain, DO NOT schedule with this practice. My husband had been prescribed pain medication in the past, and after two recent surgeries, he was referred to Midtown Pain and Spine for pain management services. In his first appointment with Heather Allen, NP, she informed him she would not be prescribing pain medication at that appointment. In fact, it was their policy not to prescribe for the first two weeks as he would need to provide a urine sample for drug screening. We found it highly unusual that a pain clinic made patients wait two weeks for a turnaround on the drug testing. Heather offered him a lidocaine patch and some gel, both of which could be purchased over the counter. It was a wasted appointment. Wouldn't it be reasonable for the clinic to share their two-week policy up front with new patients? My husband literally grit his teeth for two weeks, waiting for his second appointment. When we arrived, Heather told us they did not receive his urinalysis back yet; therefore, she would not be prescribing any pain medication for him. There was no indication of when that would be or any regard for our time or the inconvenience of coming early to an appointment when they were not prepared to treat him. When my husband reiterated his need for help, Heather replied with a genuine lack of empathy, "I feel for you." Her lack of patient care shocked me! I have been working in the medical field for 30 years and don't recall a time I saw a provider so dismissive. When we realized it was again a wasted appointment and my husband was not going to be treated with care and respect, we got up to leave and Heather commented, "It's my decision who I take on as a patient, anyway."  Very poor patient care. Enough said.

column3:
Pain Clinic of North Carolina serves the Huntersville, NC community with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life. Established as a premier medical facility in the region, our clinic brings together a dedicated team of specialists who collaborate to address chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches. We understand that pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why our multidisciplinary team works diligently to create personalized treatment plans that not only target pain relief but also focus on restoring functionality and independence.

At the Pain Clinic of North Carolina, we specialize in diagnosing and treating a wide spectrum of painful conditions, from acute injuries to chronic pain disorders. Our approach combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment modalities to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation, allowing our specialists to develop tailored treatment strategies that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and rehabilitative services.

Our Team Approach

What sets us apart is our collaborative team approach to pain management. Our providers work in concert to ensure that every aspect of a patient's condition is addressed comprehensively. This integrated methodology allows us to combine various specialties and perspectives, resulting in more effective pain relief outcomes and improved functional capacity for our patients.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We believe that effective pain management begins with understanding each patient's unique experience. Our goal extends beyond pain reduction—we aim to enhance overall quality of life by improving mobility, functionality, and independence. Through education, support, and advanced treatment options, we empower our patients to take an active role in their recovery journey.

Visit Our Huntersville Location

Our conveniently located Huntersville facility offers a comfortable, supportive environment for patients seeking relief from chronic pain. We welcome new patients and referrals from healthcare providers throughout North Carolina.

Address: 16511-A, Northcross Dr, Huntersville, NC 28078, United States

Phone: +1 704-896-3313

Website: https://www.ncpaincare.com/locations/huntersville/
column11:
The Pain Clinic of North Carolina is a pain management clinic in Huntersville, NC.
The providers at Pain Clinic of North Carolina work together as a team to provide the highest quality medical and rehabilitative services in North Carolina. Our goal is to effectively diagnose painful medical injuries and conditions, and then tailor a comprehensive treatment plan to alleviate the pain and increase overall function to improve the patient's quality of life.

column40:
First time going to this clinic, I was nervous and did not know what to expect as previous experiences, Doctors get you in and out and shove meds at you. The staff was very nice and welcoming and eased my anxiety right as I checked in. Dr Grey was very easy to talk to. At first he just listened and I was a little unsure but by the end he starting joking and really wanted to get to know me personally. Anything I mentioned in the beginning of the appointment he repeated at the end and I would not have thought he would have remembered. Very detail and will ask you multiple times before you walk out..."do you have any questions" he made me feel comfortable. It's simple, follow the rules and this practice will help you if you truly need it.|Love this place . The only pain Dr I've been to that don't judge u or treat you like a drug seeker.  He listens to you and hears you . He helped me recover from my addiction by giving me a chance to be in the Suboxone program and has continued to support me thru this journey and monitors me biweekly because I don't have the strength yet to go monthly and he knows this. I'm grateful for him for what he's done for me and I wanted to praise him for  taking me as a patient knowing I had failed a drug test in the beginning but he didn't give up on me . So I didnt give up on me either    if your struggling don't wait. Call today and make a appt for help . It's here! With support  no judgement|Dr. Gray and his staff were extremely professional and organized. The offices are very clean and sanitized; mask are required. Dr. Gray conducts a thorough exam ensuring all of your questions and his are properly addressed. I highly recommend PCNC for your Pain Center needs.|Dr Gray cares about his patients and i never felt judged or looked down on my him he listens and does whats in your best interest . i totally recommend this practice give it a chance . get off the pps and this place can save your life|This is the best place I have been. The staff is very friendly and actually cares about you. Dr. Gray is the best caring doctor I have met with the best bed side manors.  I recommend Pain Clinic of North Carolina to anyone.|I had a very unfortunate experience with this practice.  I signed up for the Pfizer vaccine (this would be my 2nd one and very time sensitive).  I believe I got a few reminders from the office prior to my appointment, to make sure that remembered.  I even called myself to verify the appointment and time, and to reiterate and verify that I was getting the Pfizer vaccine.  Always, this was confirmed.  I showed up on time on the day of my appointment, sat on the exam table, and was asked if I was ready for my shot.  I said yes, and then again verified with them that I was getting the Pfizer vaccine.  Shocked, the medical assistant said that all they had left in stock was the J&J vaccine.  I explained that I could not get that, as I had already received the Pfizer.  The medical assistant then went to get Tanya.  I'm not sure of Tanya's role in the office, but it appeared that she had some sort of authority.  Tanya explained that the office had run out of Pfizer.  She said that she would be picking up or having delivered more of the Pfizer at the Health Department that day around lunch time, and that I would call me back that very afternoon to give me a time to come back.  I called the office after lunch to find out if the office had the Pfizer.  Was told Tanya was busy, but she would call back.  I then decided to drive back to the office late that afternoon, only to be told Tanya was busy, but would call me.  It is now been a few weeks.  I never got a call back.  I was able to get an appointment at a Walgreens in  Shelby, NC within the appropriate timeframe.|Diligent care. I've never felt rushed, respectful to my holistic values, always accommodating to my awful schedule giving I travel for work. Could not be more grateful for both Dr Bourne and Dr Gray.|My medical care experience at this clinic is impeccable.

It is a very comfortable environment with very caring and skilled medical professionals.

Dr. Grey is a top notched medical professional !

column3:
Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Premier serves High Point, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services. Located in the heart of Guilford County, this specialized medical facility offers evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's multidisciplinary team combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

The Pain Center at Premier Drive provides a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management solutions. Patients benefit from customized treatment plans that may include nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, physical therapy, medication management, and integrative approaches. The center's affiliation with Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist ensures patients have access to the latest research-backed therapies and clinical innovations.

Expert Medical Team

Led by board-certified pain specialists, the medical team at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Premier includes physicians, nurse practitioners, and support staff dedicated to addressing complex pain conditions. Their expertise spans various pain disorders including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, the center emphasizes individualized care plans and patient education. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, supportive environment designed to put patients at ease during their visits.

Location and Contact Information

Conveniently located at 4515 Premier Dr, High Point, NC 27265, the center welcomes patients from throughout the Piedmont Triad region. For appointments or information, patients can call +1 336-716-7246. Additional details about services and providers can be found on their website at wakehealth.edu.

column40: Dr. Janus Patel is extremely knowledgeable and set up a treatment plan for me after I described the hip/back pain that I have been dealing with for over three years. He explained the steps he would take to alleviate my pain in a  concise and understandable manner. Even though I have had numerous steroid injections through a different healthcare system with little pain relief over the last three years, the first steroid injection Dr. Patel administered to me relieved my pain tremendously. I was in disbelief. I could actually walk again with no hip pain. I still have slight back pain, but he is already investigating the cause of that. I have great confidence that he will solve that issue too. I highly recommend Dr. Patel and his staff. They are all down to earth and truly care about your wellbeing.|All my experiences have been great.  Last ablation took a while to kick in but had injections afterwards which helped immensely. column2: Pain and Wellness Solutions of the Carolinas
column3:
Pain and Wellness Solutions of the Carolinas serves Durham, NC and surrounding areas throughout the Carolinas with comprehensive pain management services. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Manoj Bobby Wunnava, a board-certified anesthesiologist with specialized fellowship training and accreditation in pain management, the practice delivers personalized care for patients suffering from both chronic and acute pain conditions. Their patient-centered approach addresses a wide spectrum of issues including neck pain, back pain, musculoskeletal pain, headaches, and neuropathy through evidence-based interventional procedures and innovative therapeutic options.

The clinic offers an extensive range of interventional pain management procedures, including:

  • Cervical epidural steroid injections

  • Lumbar sympathetic blocks

  • Medial branch blocks

  • Nerve blocks

  • Stellate ganglion blocks

  • Trigger point injections

Advanced Treatment Options

Beyond traditional pain management approaches, Pain and Wellness Solutions of the Carolinas provides cutting-edge therapies such as:

  • Ketamine treatment for chronic pain and treatment-resistant depression

  • Virtual reality therapy for pain management

  • IV infusion therapies

  • Natural therapeutic approaches

Their holistic philosophy places each patient at the center of their own care plan, ensuring individualized treatment strategies that address the unique aspects of each person's pain experience.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, patients can visit their website at painwellnesssolutions.com or call +1 984-464-7972. The clinic is conveniently located at 5322 Highgate Dr #143, Durham, NC 27713, United States.
column11:
At Pain and Wellness Solutions of the Carolinas, our mission is straightforward: to treat chronic and acute pain (neck pain, back pain, musculoskeletal pain, headache, neuropathy, etc.) while placing the patient at the center of his or her care.
Dr. Manoj Bobby Wunnava is an expert in interventional and comprehensive pain management. Dr. Wunnava is a board certified anesthesiologist with additional fellowship and accreditation in pain management.

Services include:
cervical epidural steroid injection
lumbar sympathetic block
medial branch block
natural therapies
nerve blocks
stellate ganglion block
trigger point injections
other treatments for common pain symptoms

column40: I have had problems with the disc's at L3, L4, L5 & S1 since 1990 when I suffered an On the job injury working at Duke University Medical Center and I never received any treatment that helped alleviate my  pain until I was seen by Dr. Wunnava at Pain & Wellness  Solutions of The Carolina's.  I am greatly appreciative of the care that I received and especially (the pain that I did NOT leave The Pain  & Wellness Solutions Office with.  It felt Sooooo Good to not be in pain.|Every visit that I've attended has been a comforting experience. Whenever I have questions or concerns about my health they have been met with complete answers and solutions for maintaining my lifestyle. I am a 66 year old single woman who maintains an active work requirement and with the advice and assistance the doctor and his staff I've been able to maintain going to work. Without the care and treatment I receive from the Pain and Wellness Solutions of the Carolinas I fear my life would become a downward spiral. I have placed my complete confidence and concerns about my life in the hands of Dr. Wanava and from my experience so far he has shown me he cares about maintaining my ability to stay active.|The staff is always well trained , communicative, benevolent, and pleasant in attitude. Dr. Wannavu is a professional who is accessible and like his staff pleasant and communicative. The whole team evokes an informed, educated approach to pain and wellness treatment. I am a patient entering my third year of interaction with this team and I appreciate knowing they have understood and engineered treatment for the pain i have.experienced for twenty years.|Dr. Wunnava addresses all my concerns and truly listens.  I have a rare disease that is very painful and he constantly researches all the available information related to it, as well as a condition related to shingles in the eye which is also difficult to treat.  He is both concerned with easing pain, but also doing it safely with medications being constantly reviewed for my safety.  I appreciate his efforts very much.|Dr. Wunnava is patient, kind, listens well and knows his stuff! He is treating me for arthritis pain until I get my hip replacement. I don't know how I would be functioning without his treatment. His staff is super on top of things and as equally kind.|Excellent doctor and staff.  I receive injections at their office and it is a simple and effective procedure which helps me greatly.  Very professional and efficient care.|Dr Wunnava is an excellent, professional and caring doctor. He was quite thorough, which really pleased me.i am returning for follow up visits and shall remain under his care.|I have been seeing Dr. Wunnava for many years. He is a good listener and makes me feel like we are in a partnership with my care. I am grateful for his expertise and care. I wouldn't go anywhere else!

At Johnston Pain Management, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options designed to address various pain conditions. Our team specializes in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our Approach to Patient Care

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Contact Information

column40:
I want to start this post with that Dr. Kitchen is now the only person I will at this location. The reason for 1 star is because of certain NP that don't read all the paperwork that is being included with a referral that they demand to see before you can be a patient. Plus, I'm not trying to knock down people who become NP and I have worked with some great ones but there are certain NP that they know everything under the sun.bit do they have a MD behind their name. No they don't. So, if you want to be a MD then put in the time and effort to be a great doctor who listens to this patients. Without patients then how will the medical field get paid. So, people need to listen to their patients.|Excellent Facility! The Staff definitely performs their knowledge well, by taking very good care of many people, needing their medical services.The building is large, spacious,clean; inside & out.Paired with efficient medical equipment,the combination is nicely fabulous! Truly making  a nice union,by finalizing the delicate complete recovery process. My friends,if you are interested in their medical services, please, don't hesitate to call & make an appointment; oor have your medical case manager do it for you.....|Dr. McCutcheon and her team are phenomenal! She is on target with direct communication while caring for my mother. Doesn't set false expectations while still delivering effective treatments, but most of all not allowing my mother  to become drug addicted despite the pain. Bravo!! Front desk staff and nurses are wonderfully accommodating & helpful. Phone answering people to the main line (I assume in Jax) leave a little be desired, but they won't ruin the stars for the MHC office in my eyes. Thank you guys for your care and your professionalism!|My name is Chris Ajinga.

On 13 June I had a follow up appt with Dr Harum. The appt was for a facet block/injection. I initially met Dr Harum on 31 May where he looked at my MRIs.

We discussed my pain issues and my recent diagnosis of terminal bone cancer throughout my spine.

I was seeking pain relief for the bone pain. Dr Harum prescribed a pain patch that unfortunately does not work on this pain.

As I entered the Crystal Coast Pain Management center for my scheduled appt with Dr Harum I was met by Michael who was to prep me for the facet block procedure.

I told Michael of my pain issues and it would not be possible to lay on my stomach for the procedure and that I needed to talk with Dr Harum about the pain patch he prescribed.

Michael left me and when he came back he said he spoke to Dr Harum. Dr Harum told Michael he did not remember me.

No problem as I said if he just stepped in to see me he would.

Michael said the facet block procedure was canceled as I could not lay on my stomach.

Again I asked to speak with Dr Harum regarding the ineffective pain relief prescribed and never saw him.

Michael said this day was reserved for office procedures and Dr Harum could not/would not see me and to schedule a follow up appt for next week.

I was shocked that Dr Harum could so easily dismiss a patient's request to see him during a time of urgent need.

Michael was apologetic and helped me schedule the follow up appt.

Based upon the lack of attention/ compassion demonstrated by Dr Harum, I cannot recommend this office to any patient.

It appears as though the procedures day of multiple facet blocks is their money making process.

Cannot for the life of me understand how a Doctor could be so callous and indifferent to a patient. He didn't even take the time already allotted to me to respond to my request for assistance. Not even to step in and see if he could "remember" me.

I will not be returning to your practice.|Chose this pain management practice because I was desperate for help and relief after weeks of constant pain and they were able to get me in to be seen sooner than other practices. I've now realized, there was a reason they had availability. Horrible experience. Rude office staff, no compassion, MD had no knowledge about my diagnosis, no medications prescribed, no calls returned, and the one test that they ordered, they didn't even do prior authorization for (even though requested multiple times), so I couldn't have it done. Major waste of my time and money.|Horrible place. Wife was in the hospital so we missed our appointment. They charged us a $150 no show fee and refuse to ever see us again unless we pay it. Apparently making sure that they knew we were not gonna make it should have been my main concern while my wife was hospitalized. Try Johnston pain management instead.|I must say that the staff have been so welcoming and friendly.  Dr. Foley is a treasure.  She doesn't make you feel awkward or embarrassed because we are in pain medication. She very tentative to my needs and makes sure I'm comfortable with her decisions.  I would recommend them in a heartbeat.  It took us over 2 months to find her and finally found her a few months ago.|I have to say the staff is the absolute best! From the doctors who alway have time for me, the assistants who make sure everything is done in a timely manner, to the reception greeting me with a smiling face. Never once have I had a problem with this office nor their staff. They truly care about their patients. They do make patients on narcotics sign an agreement. Seems pretty simple. Easy to follow and the staff really explains it. Seems to me maybe a bad review or two maybe due to their lack of following the agreement? That's just my personal opinion. 10 stars for this clinic if I could. Thank you guys for all your hard work!

column11:

With offices in Asheville, Columbus, Greenville, Southern Pines, Wilmington, and Charlotte, North Carolina, as well as Easley, Greenville, and West Columbia, South Carolina, we focus on delivering effective relief for acute and chronic pain conditions.

column3:
Johnston Pain Management, P.A. serves patients throughout Jacksonville, New Bern, and Hampstead, North Carolina with specialized pain management solutions. Our integrative approach combines the expertise of board-certified pain medicine specialists, clinical psychologists, and dedicated clinical professionals to address chronic pain conditions at their source. We believe effective pain management requires a comprehensive understanding of each patient's unique circumstances, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans designed for long-term relief rather than temporary fixes.

At Johnston Pain Management, we treat a wide spectrum of pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Post-surgical pain

Our Integrative Approach

What sets our practice apart is our multidisciplinary methodology. By combining medical interventions with psychological support and physical therapies, we address not just the physical symptoms of pain but also its emotional and functional impacts. This holistic strategy helps patients regain control of their lives and improve their overall quality of life.

Convenient Locations

Our practice maintains three convenient office locations to serve patients throughout eastern North Carolina:

  • Hampstead Office: 14057 US-17 #220, Hampstead, NC 28443

  • Jacksonville Office: Serving the Jacksonville community

  • New Bern Office: Serving the New Bern area

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit www.johnstonmd.com or call us at (910) 741-0801. Our compassionate team is ready to help you find relief from chronic pain and improve your quality of life.
