About Johnston Pain Management, P.A.
Johnston Pain Management, P.A., is an anesthesiology and pain medicine practice with offices in Jacksonville, New Bern, and Hampstead, North Carolina. The practice takes an integrative approach to care, utilizing a team of pain medicine specialists, clinical psychologists, and compassionate clinical professionals who strive to provide comprehensive pain management plans for long-term relief.
Johnston Pain Management, P.A., cares for many pain conditions, including back pain, arthritis, cancer pain, and complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS).

column40:
I've chosen to stay with this practice even when there were closer options and it meant driving nearly 2 hours each way in traffic because of the AMAZING staff, caring and genuinely concerned providers and the overall non-judgmental atmosphere. I bet they already know who left this review without a name bc I openly share my feelings about the few great medical establishments we have so they get the full respect deserved!|I went to the clinic with some questions about a procedure I'm supposed to be getting.  The clinic manager refused to answer, all she would say was "your doctor discussed that with you".  No, if they did I would not still have questions, and gate keeping information like that when you intend to stick needles into me?  No.  This place is worse than the VA.  Seriously, flat out refuse to answer questions then drop you as a patient when you won't let them out needles in you without asking what's in them.

I'm also not taking fitness advice from someone who has never seen the inside of a gym.|First of all, their answering service are whatever you want to call. It is crappy as ever. There's no way you can get hardly no way you can get to anyone. You can make several calls and everytime you get recordings and every time you push buttons, they switch to something else but nobody ever talks to me. And so, finally, after 2 days of calling a woman calls and I think she was the assistant for Vanessa beir and I told her, I said, I took only one of the pills that she gave me and I broke out in a sweat and I got itchy skin and all things started happening I just felt awful.  And they don't really do a heck of a lot about it, they said, well, the Doctor said those aren't real symptoms that the medicine doesn't have that symptoms, apparently they haven't investigated it because that is one of the symptoms of a side effect. That's why I didn't take anymore. And I wanted to talk to the Doctor and they said no. You have to come in and the doctor won't talk to me on the phone. So I'm not really sure what I'm supposed to do from now on.|We had to see the physician's assistant Vanessa Bair today and I do NOT recommend her, I would definitely reschedule to see someone else if she's the one you have to see. I understand that she needs to hear stuff from my husband and that's fine but I am apart of his support system, even through the V.A. I am my husbands caregiver and she acted like she didn't want to hear anything from me at all. Very unprofessional since he has a problem expressing everything that is going on (because on top of physical disabilities he also is treated for mental disabilities through the V.A.) and I DO have to help him explain everything that goes on and I KNOW everything because I am with him and help him with his everyday tasks 24/7, even his V.A. doctors understand and respect that.

There was other things that needed to be said in this appointment that my husband will have to suffer through all because I wasn't able to talk and elaborate on the things going on because she had a chip on her shoulder and wanted to show her "authority" or whatever. Not to mention, she put that my husband reported the side effects of constipation and such and he did NOT say that at all!! My main concern is that my husband gets the proper care needed to help relieve his pain and it was very evident that she didn't want to work with me for the better management for my husbands care.|Today was my second visit to Johnston pain management in Hampstead. I am extremely impressed by the competence, efficiency and compassion of SunnyFranken, PA and her medical staff. Prior to referral to JPM, my experience with another pain management group was filled with stress. I have had a very positive experience at JPM.|Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Able to get me in without weeks of waiting. I received an injection for nerve pain related to disc degeneration and aside from the prick of the needle for the local anesthetic, did not feel a thing! I felt significant improvement each day for about 2 weeks and at that point would say pain was about 95% resolved and only and 1-2 level. This after being at a 9-10 pain level for weeks and barely able to function in daily required tasks. They are awesome!!!!|I cannot recommend this clinic. The staff is very friendly. It appears clean. The wait times were at least an hour. I  never saw or met Dr. Holder. They only took vitals like weight, blood pressure, pill count and temperature. They never did any physical exam. Had they done a simple pelvic exam, they would have found the undissolved sutures in my pelvic area that has been causing my severe pain. They referred me out and I never received a call from the clinic I was referred help. I have met several people who have received a great deal of help but I cannot say that about my case after seeing them for about 6 months. Now, after investigating on my own, with the help of my general practitioner, we finally found the problem. I have undissolved stitches that my body has been treating like foreign objects for years and now we have found an OBGYN that will take them out. We are looking forward to having them removed. Thank you and good luck to any patients going to this clinic.|John Holder M.D is God sent he listened he understood everything I am going through. He is so knowledgeable so understanding, compassionate. I almost gave up after so many bad experiences but I am so thankful I did not THANK YOU!!! Also to the staff you are amazing so kind and helpful.

column2: Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Consultants of the Carolinas serves Waynesville, NC and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Founded on the principle that chronic pain is not merely a symptom but a disease requiring comprehensive treatment, our medical team delivers personalized care for patients suffering from persistent discomfort. Located conveniently at 90 Haywood Office Park, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for residents throughout Western North Carolina seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions.

At Comprehensive Pain Consultants, we differentiate ourselves through our diagnostic methodology. Rather than simply addressing symptoms, we work diligently to identify the underlying causes of your pain. Whether stemming from injury, disease, infection, arthritis, cancer, fibromyalgia, post-surgical complications, or other conditions, our specialists develop targeted treatment strategies designed for your specific situation.

Personalized Treatment Plans

We believe effective pain management begins with listening. During your consultation, our physicians take time to understand your complete medical history, pain patterns, and how your condition affects daily life. This collaborative approach allows us to create custom treatment plans that are both minimally invasive and conservative, prioritizing your long-term wellness while providing immediate relief strategies.

Commitment to Patient Education

Education forms a cornerstone of our practice philosophy. We ensure patients understand their conditions, treatment options, and self-management techniques. This empowerment helps you become an active participant in your recovery journey, leading to better outcomes and improved quality of life.

For appointments or additional information, contact us at (828) 558-4134 or visit our website at www.cpcdoctors.com. Our Waynesville office welcomes patients from across Western North Carolina who seek compassionate, evidence-based pain management solutions.
column11:
We understand that chronic pain is not a symptom. Chronic pain is a disease, and must be treated as such.

This location serves pain management patients in Waynesville & surrounding communities.
Our approach to pain treatment is unique. It is about identifying the underlying cause of your pain. Whether your pain is a result of injury, disease, infection, arthritis, cancer, fibromyalgia, post-surgical pain etc., we can help.

We aim to improve your quality of life by listening to you, creating custom treatment plans, and educating you as we learn more about your conditions. We're invested in your sustained relief from pain. Our treatment plans are minimally invasive and conservative.

column2: Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Clemmons
column3:
Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Clemmons serves patients throughout Clemmons, North Carolina and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services. Located conveniently at 2341 Lewisville Clemmons Rd in Clemmons, NC 27012, our specialized center combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists utilizes evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life and restore function for patients suffering from various pain disorders.

At the Pain Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative medicine techniques. Our specialists are experienced in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of the individual patient.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life. Our compassionate team works closely with patients to understand their pain experience and develop strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle. The center features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology in a comfortable, supportive environment designed to put patients at ease during their visits.

Contact Information and Appointments

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, patients can call us at (336) 716-7246. Our facility is part of the renowned Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist network, ensuring patients receive care backed by the latest research and medical advancements. For additional information about our services and providers, visit our website at www.wakehealth.edu/locations/clinics/p/pain-center-clemmons.

column2: Cape Fear Valley Interventional Pain Specialists
column3:
Cape Fear Valley Interventional Pain Specialists in Fayetteville, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Judit Cope (formerly Dr. Judit Staneata). Our specialized clinic is dedicated to helping patients throughout Cumberland County and surrounding areas find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through innovative interventional techniques and personalized treatment plans.

At Cape Fear Valley Interventional Pain Specialists, we understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Dr. Cope brings extensive experience in pain medicine, offering advanced interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive techniques designed to target pain at its source.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining interventional procedures with comprehensive care plans that may include physical therapy, medication management, and lifestyle modifications. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs and circumstances of every patient, with the goal of improving function and reducing reliance on pain medications.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating a wide range of painful conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

Visit Our Practice

Cape Fear Valley Interventional Pain Specialists is conveniently located at 1205 Walter Reed Rd, Fayetteville, NC 28304. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care in a comfortable environment.

column2: Raleigh Spine and Pain Center: Daljit Buttar, MD
column3:
Raleigh Spine and Pain Center in Raleigh, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Daljit Buttar, MD. Serving the Triangle area since 2005, our practice specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. Our state-of-the-art facility on Lake Boone Trail provides patients with access to cutting-edge interventional pain procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

At Raleigh Spine and Pain Center, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Dr. Buttar brings over 20 years of experience in pain medicine, utilizing advanced diagnostic tools to identify the root causes of pain and develop targeted treatment strategies. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and kyphoplasty for vertebral compression fractures.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation and customized treatment plan that may incorporate medical management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Our compassionate team works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care and optimal outcomes for every patient we serve.

Practice Information

Physician: Daljit Buttar, MD

Address: 4201 Lake Boone Trail, Suite 100, Raleigh, NC 27607

Phone: +1 919-510-0688

Website: www.paindoctorbuttar.com

Hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

Dr. Buttar is board-certified in Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology, with fellowship training in interventional pain management. Our convenient location near Rex Hospital offers ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility challenges. New patients are welcome with appropriate referrals, and we accept most major insurance plans including Medicare and Medicaid.

column2: ECU Health Pain Management Center - Ahoskie
column3:
ECU Health Pain Management Center - Ahoskie serves residents throughout Ahoskie, North Carolina and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized team understands that effective pain management extends far beyond medication alone. We provide personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs, offering a wide range of treatment options from conservative therapies to advanced interventional procedures. Our integrated approach focuses on improving quality of life and restoring function for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

At ECU Health Pain Management Center, we believe in a multifaceted approach to pain relief. Our services include nerve blocks, spinal injections, joint injections, ablations, epidurals, and epidural blood patches. For patients with more complex pain issues, we offer advanced interventional procedures such as spinal cord stimulators, MILD procedures, and Vertiflex procedures. Our goal is to determine the right treatment path for your specific condition and circumstances.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Arthritis

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Spinal injuries

  • Cancer pain

  • Nerve damage

  • Orthopedic conditions

  • Trauma-related pain

  • Trigeminal neuralgia

  • And many other chronic pain conditions

Community Support Resources

We understand that managing chronic pain often requires additional support beyond medical treatment. Our team connects patients with valuable community resources and support groups specifically designed for individuals struggling with chronic pain, helping to address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain management.

Contact Information

Address: 606A S Academy St, Ahoskie, NC 27910, United States

Phone: +1 252-209-3360

Website: https://locations.ecuhealth.org/Details/91

column40:
I have been a patient with Carolina pain clinic for over a decade supposed to had a procedure done. They called me two days before the procedure stating that they have to reschedule. I said OK reschedule my procedure for the following week then the following week happened. Call me again to reschedule my appointment on a Sunday morning by this time, I have been frustrated dealing with pain morning and night. I've been to the ER because of the pain I The pain has gotten unbearable . The last time I had to reschedule my procedure to the pain center  off of Mallard Creek. Got to the doctor office or Mis. Howard  we rescheduled your appointment  at 3:15 I said no because the nurse called on Sunday stated my appointment was at 3:45. No a call or text  This is very unprofessional for a doctor office to constantly do this to a patient that was with them for over a decade Dealing with chronic pain|After a horrible experience with a lumbar puncture at another location,
my experience here was easy, painless and pleasant - the difference between night and day.  The staff was over the top friendly, considerate and professional.
Just one stick and my x-ray guided lumbar puncture was accomplished. Dr. Ajam talked to me the whole time - making me feel informed and comfortable about my spine. Everything went well.
The office itself is convenient and in a very pleasant neighborhood. Traffic was not bad at all.  I couldn't have asked for a better experience.  (Dr. Ajam was wonderful!)|Lee Campbell thank you! I have never had a physician work with me like this and I will never forget the level of care you have given me. I'm never a number. You listen and keep me assured of our plan. I know there is light at the end of this and I know you will be by my side as we work to the end. I'm blessed to have you and I'm able to live a functioning life because of you and your care. I can work and care for my children. This wouldn't be possible without you.|I've been a patient here I believe for tough to 2 years or longer. The doctors here do excellent work medically speaking. Currently I'm suffering from sciatic pain in my right leg severely. I have scheduled an appointment with therapeutic rehabilitation for my first appointment on October 18. I requested for a few pain pills until I could make my earliest appointment October 17. I was refused. I am in total disagreement with their refusal. I myself have pumped thousands of dollars into this office. I am severely dissatisfied with their decision to allow me to stay in pain. Therefore I terminated them all.b They'll never receive another penny from me. I wrote this to make everyone aware of how I have been treated.|I've been going to Dr Lee Campbell for several years now and I know that he is the sweetest person out there. I've never had a  specialist like him. He will always listen to what I would say to him and when he came into my room he would say hello, how you doing and a handshake. I have been blessed with a great man and friend who has not only been there for my pain but he has been there for me. There were several times he would pray for me and the situation I was in, and sometimes gave me a hug to reassure me that I am worthy, and nobody has ever done anything like this before. Maybe some Drs are scared to, but I thank God he sent me a great Dr who cares about my health, family and my life. God Bless you Dr. Lee Campbell.|Awesome staff to say the least! Dr. Deering completely calmed my anxious he took the time to listen. I wasn't rushed or hurried. The procedure for the injection went really well, exactly as he described. He talked to me throughout the entire process, explained each procedure. I'm so Happy on my way to pain free.  I feel great! We highly recommended!|Dr Deering was giving me injections for my painful lower spine due to arthritis. During the second visit for injections, my right leg jumped up off the table and I let them know it hurt a lot because I vocalized my pain. I never saw Dr Deering, only his shoes through the little hole in the table for my face as I was laying on my stomach. After that procedure, I couldn't walk! My right knee went numb and collapsed! Andrew, I guess that was his name, said it happens sometimes and said it should go away in a few minutes. Well, it didn't and he called my husband from the waiting room so he could help me walk out and leave. Occasionally my left knee collapsed also. I was very scared not knowing what had happened to me, nor was I given any explanation. I was supposed to return for a RFA treatment yet I was never called to schedule this. In Dr Deering's notes it says that I was monitored for 30 minutes! That's totally false! We were ushered out asap. After a day in bed, I had to use a walker for a week until I trusted my legs again. I even had my husband drive me to appointments because I never was told what happened, so I couldn't trust myself. It finally passed after a week.
Never going back to him and because of him I'm starting to loose my trust in doctors! I'm 63 yrs young and I won't stand for this rudeness and unprofessionalism, and I'd prefer a two-sided conversation! My first visit he walked out of me when I was talking! I should have noticed the red flag then, especially when I had several concerns that he refused to listen to! Never! Never! Never again! This happened in early June of 2022. My advice, look more into a doctors background. Spinal issues should not be taken lightly. You're only mm's away from paralysis!!|Sub-par at best.
Doctor Deering seems trustworthy and Boston Scientific as well so far for my internal back stimulator, but the office/practive overall is somewhat of a joke. They don't answer the phone, ever. If and when they do, it's someone in Winston-Salem, NC., someone who clearly does not know what's going on in Charlotte as I was supposed to have an appointment this morning with Dr. Deering but upon arrival was told he is on vacation and they are not sure how I got scheduled for today. Fine. Unacceptable, but fine. Next appointment with the Dr. wasn't for two weeks. No thanks, in too much pain to wait that long. Will go elsewhere from now on. If this were the first instance of having difficulty reaching ANYONE at the practice I wouldn't even be writing this review, but as it has been this way EVERY SINGLE TIME, my patience has run out. Avoid CPI in Charlotte if you can IMHO.

column40:
Dr Buzzanell and Blue Ridge Pain Management need to be closed down. After noticing Dr Buzzanell exhibiting serious memory problems and the entire staff refusing to answer legitimate questions, I did a little research. If you are a patient or are considering becoming one, please check into why this doctor was allowed to have his medical license reinstated after one of his patients died. Then check into ALL patient deaths associated with this doctor.|Had high hopes my chronic spinal pain would be remedied. Had a long talk with Dr. Buzznell, felt pressured to agree to schedule an ablation, without seeing any MRIs, or surgeon findings. I should have asked him about why he doesn't practice medicine in Pennsylvania anymore. Do your own research before dealing with any of these "pain" doctors. They aren't interested in your pain level, only your insurance level. I was hoping this place was legit.|If you're in pain, there is no better place to go than going to the Blue Ridge Pain Management . From the minute you walk in with being greeted and staff member that brings you in for your appointment
could not be any more friendlier and professionalism. Dr Charles Buzzanell will listen to what you got to say about what is going on with your pain issues . You will feel like your being listened to and not being rushed.  It's nice to feel there are other options to your care and not a one fits all attitude.|I've been going to Blue Ridge Pain Management now for quite a while. I got to the point where my pain was under control and I left for approximately 7 months but had to go back. I'm not one to take narcotics unless absolutely necessary and that's one thing that this pain management clinic knows about me. Of course they do other things besides give out medications. I was having injections for various conditions and I was being sent to physical therapy where I actually had what is called dry needling in my arms, where I was having pain for some unknown reason and the dry needling worked a miracle where the pain in my arms has never returned and I owe that suggestion to Spencer Maney. Dr. Buzzanell and Spencer Maney are both very professional and very personable and easy to talk to. So if you need someplace to help you deal with your pain in a multitude of ways, I recommend giving Blue Ridge Pain Management a try.|I really like Dr. Buzzanell. He's very professional. I was in a car accident & because of the blunt force to my upper body, he diagnosed a trapezius injury. Usually someone might have that trauma from a sports injury. I went to several Doctors, they all just gave me steroid shots nothing was helping. He recommended I have my nerves blocked in the area most effected.
What a difference!! If you saw before & after pictures. WOW.!!!! Soft tissue damage is not detected in MRI's,          C-SCAN or X-Rays. He is the only one to help my severe pain & it wasn't with pills. It was a treatment!!!|I am sure worried about Dr buzznell and staff after this awful hurricane if anyone has any info can u please share and thank you so much|This practice is filled with wonderful, caring, and knowledgeable professionals! Their practice and office environment seems to function like a very close family. That's exactly the way they've treated my dad. He's a 76 year old with impaired vision and Dr. Buzzanell has tended to him with sincere compassion. My dad talks about him for days after each visit. He's so happy to finally have a doctor that has the skills and genuinely cares enough to help him with the back pain that has ailed him for 55 years. Taking him to this practice was the best healthcare decision I've ever made for my dad.|My past experiences with pain management clinics/ doctors had left me feeling pretty much invisible. When they treat you like cattle being branded you lose all confidence in their ability to actually HELP you.
Dr. Buzzanell has never treated me that way in the slightest.  Right away he took a sincere approach to my situation and all that I had been through, which was quite a lot. He didn't rush me in the front door and out the back. The treatments we agreed to were very helpful. When I didn't get the best results with a treatment another procedure has been offered and I look forward to this next step. It seems as if no matter how busy his day has been (and they always are) he  always takes plenty of time to listen to me. He and his staff have always treated me respectfully which is a rare act to find in this day and time. (Especially for an older lady on Medicare!)
Thank you Dr. Buzzanell and staff. Y'all have been a Godsend.
I am on disability due to severe arthritis and severe fibromyalgia.  I underwent 10, yes ten, surgeries in 2018 alone due to my arthritis. So some relief from the chronic pain that has ruined my life is greatly appreciated and finally  a doctor that gets it!!!

Pain Management Plus, PLLC in Forest City, NC offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Rutherford County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain through personalized care plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

At Pain Management Plus, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach combining medical interventions, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Our board-certified specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and post-surgical pain. We offer innovative treatments such as nerve blocks, joint injections, medication management, and minimally invasive procedures designed to provide lasting relief while minimizing dependency on pain medications.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing strong doctor-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and pain experience before developing customized treatment plans. This comprehensive assessment ensures we address not just the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological impacts, promoting holistic healing and improved functionality.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at (828) 919-2393. Our clinic is conveniently located at 249 Oak Street, Forest City, NC 28043. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at www.painmgmtplus.com.

column2: Wilmington Health Interventional Pain & Regenerative Medicine
column3:
Wilmington Health Interventional Pain & Regenerative Medicine serves Wilmington, NC and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with regenerative medicine to address chronic pain conditions at their source. Located in the heart of Wilmington, our practice is dedicated to restoring mobility, reducing discomfort, and improving overall quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain disorders.

Our medical team is led by Dr. Christopher Hess, who brings exceptional credentials as a board-certified specialist in regenerative medicine. Dr. Hess and our skilled practitioners work collaboratively with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that address individual pain concerns. We believe in a patient-centered approach that focuses not just on symptom relief but on identifying and treating the underlying causes of pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

At Wilmington Health Interventional Pain & Regenerative Medicine, we offer a wide range of advanced treatments including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Regenerative medicine therapies

  • Joint injections

  • Spinal interventions

  • Innovative non-surgical approaches

Our Commitment to Your Recovery

We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your daily activities and overall wellbeing. Our team is committed to working with you to find effective pain management solutions and innovative restorative options that help you return to the activities you love. We take pride in our patient-focused care that emphasizes education, communication, and collaborative decision-making.

Visit Our Practice

Our clinic is conveniently located at 1202 Medical Center Dr, 1st Floor, Wilmington, NC 28401. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (910) 341-3459 or visit our website at wilmingtonhealth.com. We look forward to helping you achieve the pain-free quality of life you deserve.

column3:
Carolina Pain & Spine serves the Triangle region of North Carolina, including Wake Forest, Raleigh, Durham, and surrounding communities. Since the early 1980s, this premier pain management practice has established itself as a leader in providing non-surgical solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Their dedicated team combines decades of specialized expertise with compassionate care, ensuring each patient receives personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

With over 100 years of combined experience, the multi-disciplinary team at Carolina Pain & Spine brings together specialists in anesthesiology, neurology, and pain management. Their medical staff consists of board-certified physicians, advanced nurse practitioners, physician assistants, and registered nurses—all with specialized training in pain medicine. This comprehensive approach allows them to address complex pain conditions from multiple perspectives.

Comprehensive Services

Patients at Carolina Pain & Spine benefit from cutting-edge diagnostic and therapeutic procedures specifically designed to provide non-surgical pain relief. Their state-of-the-art facilities house advanced technology that enables precise diagnosis and targeted treatment of various pain conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

Hospital Affiliations

Carolina Pain & Spine maintains strong affiliations with major hospital systems throughout the Triangle area, ensuring seamless coordination of care for patients with complex medical needs. These partnerships enhance their ability to provide comprehensive pain management services and facilitate continuity of care.

Visit Their Practice

Located at 110 Capcom Ave, Suite 200, Wake Forest, NC 27587, Carolina Pain & Spine welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain conditions. Their convenient location serves residents throughout the Triangle region.

To schedule a consultation, call +1 984-214-4070 or visit their website at carolinapainandspine.com for more information about their services and treatment options.
column11:
Since the early 1980 s, Carolina Pain & Spine has offered state-of-the-art non-surgical treatment of chronic and acute pain. Our multi-disciplinary team has over 100 years of combined experience in anesthesiology, neurology and pain management. Our team is comprised of board certified physicians, advanced nurse practitioners and physician assistants as well as registered nurses who have specialized training in pain medicine.

Our comprehensive services include cutting-edge diagnostic and therapeutic procedures designed to provide non-surgical pain relief to our patients. These services, combined with our affiliations with major hospital systems, make Carolina Pain & Spine the leader in pain management services in the Triangle.
column38: Jenn Mcwilliams|Barry Simmons|Petina Hobgood|Barb Estevez|Doug Gibson|Dale Baril|Tara Edwards|dave Peters
column40:
Dr Shrimanker is kind , patient and he actually listens to you. He spends quality time and I never feel rushed. He is throrough  and cares about insurance and cost. My husband and I have be patients of his for years. Wouldn't ever go anywhere else. Have also seen his partner Dr. Yelle and he is just as great. I love that their practice is small.|The doctors at Carolina Pain & Spine in Raleigh NC are the ONLY doctors I'll let anywhere near my spine with a scalpel in their hand.  In fact, even though it is a 140-mile round trip from my home, this year marks my 25th year as a patient of Carolina Pain & Spine.  So yes, I've traveled a considerable distance for many years to/from Raleigh NC simply to be treated by this clinic for the extremely painful injuries from which I suffer. And as you'll see below, that's not even the half of it.

I'm a retired US diplomat, & the last 5 years of my career were spent in postings at the US Embassy in the Philippines & the US Consulate General in Shanghai, China.  If you're familiar with the globe, then you no doubt realize it's well-nigh impossible to get further away from Raleigh NC than the Philippines & China, unless of course you're launched into SPACE!  Well during those 5 years, I made quarterly trips back to Raleigh to see my doctor at Carolina Pain & Spine.

If you dislike air travel as much as I do, you'd no doubt consider slitting your wrists before undertaking such a burden.  Moreover, the financial cost alone would be enough to dissuade most people.  Nonetheless, if that  medical care was indispensable to continued full-time employment, as it was in my case, & you had 6 kids, most parents would at least try to do as I did.

Perhaps the ONLY tangible benefit such an insane travel regimen bestows is the enormous cache of frequent flyer miles (650k++ when 'doubling' & 'tripling' of mileage is triggered).  But when one is in severe pain in Asia, where the medical profession has a considerably different philosophy vis-a-vis the relief of chronic pain, it should come as no surprise that an American with adequate funds would be prepared to take drastic steps in order to continue working in his/her chosen profession.|Everyone was friendly and it was nice and clean. I love the PA that I have, because she explained everything to me and helped me out a lot. She understood where I was coming from when I explained to her what was going on and she answered my question truthfully. I just love the place over all and will send anyone there to get treatment if they having any type of trouble with their spine. And I learned that it was not what people were telling me about the pain clinic it was just as I was expected.|I moved to NC from PA and the laws are very different, I had a lot of trouble finding a doctor that would even see me and no one would give me a reason why, they just said they couldn't help me. Carolina Pain & Spine took me in and guided me to not only fit NC laws but to do it the way that worked best for me, my voice was heard and I knew that from the start! I have now moved two hours away from them and have considered finding something closer to me, but after reading reviews of other places and the horrendous horror stories, I will not be going anywhere else. They are well worth my routinely 4 hour drive to see them and know that I'm being given the best possible care. I get examined routinely, I get tests done instantly when something feels off.. I have had falls, and they don't just do what they want, they seriously listen and to me, Being heard, especially after dealing with your pain for many many years and knowing what works, what doesn't and what even aggravates the pain is everything!! I would recommend them to anyone, not one particular doctor or PA, they are all great and this includes all staff there, I have never once gotten an attitude or had a bad experience and I've been going for about a year now. Even issues I've had with the pharmacy to where I've had to call the office we're always handled quickly and efficiently. They don't always answer the phone, I mean they are working, but leave a message and they are on it that day! All rooms are clean, the wait is never too long, waiting room is always open with plenty of seats. As long as I'm in NC, I will be going here regardless of the drive.|Worst customer service you have to constantly keep on them to get prescription sent in and taking care of on time however you must be in the office 15 minutes early or you're not on time just all around bad customer service|I have been a patient of Dr. Schrimanker's for over a decade.  His treatment plan allowed me to continue as an RN for many years with help for my back issues.
My thanks are not only for his excellence in treatment but also the warmth and kindness
He owns as a medical provider. Grateful.|Brookie Wood,NP. is wonderful! Honestly the most personable medical practitioner I've ever had, she always makes you feel at ease and truly cares about you as a person including working with you on any issues that may arise.|My wife and I have been dealing with Carolina Pain and Spine for years. Nurse Practitioner Sarah Baxt is thorough with great people skills. We highly recommend the practice along with Sarah.

Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain serves Asheville, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our multidisciplinary approach combines traditional medical treatments with innovative solutions to provide effective relief for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. I recently came in for an appointment with Dr Hutchinson who is supposedly a specialist in Pain Management. Still wondering if I got bamboozeled as I never noted one degree or license to practice on the wall. The entire experience was incredibly frustrating as I've seen multiple physicians who have referred me to Pain Management to help manage my pain only to get to this physician who is completely Unsympathetic with a small man complex on a Drs high and thinks you should worship the ground he walks on because he supposedly went to medical school and  could quite frankly care less about his patients. Boy was I disappointed and disgusted. he possessed less of the characteristics of a good doctor then I have ever seen before. He did less then a five minute exam and then made his conclusion. He bullied gas light and shot down every suggestion with no promise of hope or helping find a diagnosis. Leaving me in an incredibly unsafe position. then, had the audacity to shake my hand as he left the room ( I was in shock). I left the office in tears incredibly angry and extremely frustrated. Do yourself a favor and avoid this physician at all costs As he clearly Could care less about his Hippocratic oath|Kicked out for having two clean urine screens. Meaning I was punished because I didn't need meds a couple days (especially after injections) Never heard of being kicked out for not using more meds than you need.  Pill count was always okay. They went back months in my chart. No one talked to me about any problems. Then out of the blue PA decided to no longer treat me. Staff are uncaring. They have a large turn over of doctors lately.
.|The staff is unbelievable. They are always putting the patient needs first and go out of their way to accommodate me. Thank you Kim. Dr. Haasis is a first class physician. I have experienced many pain physicians since 2000 and he and Dr. Huh at Duke are my favorites. He is very knowledgeable, personable and empathetic. I consider myself blessed to be with a top ranked Pain Clinic. Thank you to all|I have been a patient for 4+ years and am very pleased with the care I am given at Carolina Center  for Advanced Management of pain. The entire staff is friendly, professional, and extremely helpful.  There is adequate parking, a very clean office, and all the latest equipment for diagnostics and individual treatments. The individual care given by Dr. Haasis and his entire staff is amazing.  THEY ACTUALLY LISTEN AND CARE!!!  Due to the reason I am there (chronic pain), not having to wait long periods for my appointment (sitting is worse than standing) is a true blessing. I know this does not occur without a dedicated team effort and respect regarding the patient's time. Even though you are in pain, the  positive   environment there is very beneficial.   I get injections 4 times a year with extremely good results. Dr. Haasis is very skilled and reassuring during procedures.   When I lived in Dallas, I had to go to a hospital to get them.  It is so much easier here and because I have so much trust in my doctor and his staff, anxiety free.  I feel I am so lucky to have found Dr. Haasis and his wonderful staff.  I know they are a great team:  caring, intelligent,  professional, dedicated, patient, and helpful.  I am a retired RN (25 yrs) and am familiar with both sides of the coin.... PEOPLE IN CHRONIC PAIN are often extremely difficult to deal with!!! I trust this team  with my emotional, mental, and physical health 100%!!!!|I had a procedure scheduled. I did not feel comfortable having done in their office. I waited 3 weeks then called them to reschedule an appointment. I have called everyday twice a day. I continue and continue to call and leave message after message. They will not return my phone call. WHATS UP??|I have never felt so attacked and disrespected by a health care provider. I left my appointment in tears. I have tried calling the office for the two days and nobody answers and no option to leave a message. I am considering filing a formal complaint after reading the visit notes.|Dr. Hassis accused my 85 year old mother of seeking drugs and was quite rude to her, both in pwrson and via messages in her chart. He refuses to put her on a helpful dose of her medication. Thankfully, we were switched to Kayla, who has been kind, compassionate and wonderful. She cannot make dosage changes but at least she rreats my mother respectdully. Jennifer, one of the nurses, is outstanding.|I had and absolutely horrible experience with Dr. Sakla. He was completely dismissive of my concerns, reviewed all the paperwork from my previous doctors detailing the various chronic conditions of the spine and nervous system that i have and he came to the conclusion i was DEHYDRATED. He EVEN REFUSED to order an MRI for my mid back where my scoliosis five bulging discs and degenerative disc disease is. Did not even even acknowledge my severe nerve issues.  -10/10 Waste of hard earned money

column3:
Wake Spine & Pain Specialists serves Garner, North Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve mobility and enhance quality of life. Located at 510 Timber Drive East, Suite 105, this specialized clinic takes a multidisciplinary approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. The team of board-certified physicians understands that effective pain management rarely comes from a single treatment method, which is why they develop personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Wake Spine & Pain Specialists, patients benefit from a well-rounded treatment philosophy that combines advanced interventional procedures with complementary therapies. Their integrative approach includes pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy, and massage therapy working in concert with medical interventions. This comprehensive methodology often helps patients avoid risky surgical procedures while achieving significant pain relief and improved function.

Specialized Services

The clinic offers state-of-the-art diagnostic evaluations and innovative treatment options for various pain conditions. Their patient-centric approach begins with thorough assessments to identify the root causes of pain, followed by customized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation therapies. The goal is always to address not just the symptoms but the underlying conditions causing discomfort.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Serving the Garner community from their convenient location at 510 Timber Drive East, Suite 105, Garner, NC 27529, Wake Spine & Pain Specialists welcomes patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Their dedicated team can be reached at (919) 787-7246 to schedule consultations and learn more about their services. Additional information about their approach and treatment options is available on their website at https://wakespine.com/locations/garner-pain-clinic/.
column11: At Wake Spine & Pain, it is our mission to relieve pain so that our patients can attain more mobility and better quality of life. Pain is rarely treated effectively by any single mode of treatment alone. For that reason, we carefully evaluate, diagnose and design a patient-centric treatment plan that includes the most advanced interventional pain procedures with complementary modalities like pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy and massage therapy. Our unique, well-rounded approach gives patients the best results, often avoiding risky surgeries.

She made me feel very confident in her expertise!!|I hadn't been seen since 2019 however the staff was accommodating and worked me in for my debilitating sciatica flareup. Everyone was very friendly from the front to the clinical. The nurse and doctor both took time and actually listened to me. I would definitely recommend this practice!|Every one was very nice Dr was very nice and very thorough explained everything my only issue is I was looking for a actual pain clinic and this clinic is more holistic physical therapy epidurals facets things of that nature.|Do yourself a big favor and keep looking for a credible doctor or clinic. Disappointed 100%... after being referred to these folks and waiting several days for a 1st visit appointment, the admin. staff at Garner location were very gracious and professional.
However, in my opinion, the doctor is a 100% useless, money grabbing loser who didn't seem to have a clue about how to treat back pain or be willing to help my wife while in his office. He had "negative attitude / chip on his shoulder" manner and made no effort whatsoever to help relieve pain except to prescribe a muscle relaxer pill that did ZERO good. He said "after he had a chance to look at x-rays he'd call us back in and then recommend treatment.  He could have seen the x-rays then but said we'd have to come back at another time.
Now, almost two months and three messages left for him later, I still have not had call, email or text from the office.  I did get a $125.00 bill from them saying my Medicare and BCBSnc didn't fully cover his bill.  I wish I have never heard of
Wake Spine & Pain Specialists: Timber Dr.
Now, my wife has been in awful pain for another two months and having to start all over trying to find relief.      Good Luck.|This office of professionals is top notch! Super nice people with great attitudes who treat you like family. Candace at the desk is an outstanding professional, friendly person who is so kind and sweet. Jennifer is a phenomenal PA, who is attentive and sweet and always shows compassion as well as professionalism.|I should've avoided this place when I read the initial reviews from others. I went in for a physical exam from a referral from my provider several weeks ago in order to schedule the pain injection to my SI joint. The doctor indicated there are 2 different injections that can be done to the area (1 of which isn't approved by insurance, so we went with the one that is). Taking that into account we scheduled the injection appointment 2 weeks' out to ensure ample time to everything to be processed. Additionally it was important to get the appointment in before the end of the year since I have hit my out of pocket max for 2023 already.

I received a call the day of indicating that insurance had denied the claim due to insufficient information from the doctor, and the out of pocket cost would be $550. When I communicated the information, they indicated I would have to come in for another physical exam so the doctor could resubmit to insurance, and therefore would be unable to get the injection before the end of the year.

I then asked if it was possible to pay the out of pocket amount of $550, and then if/when the insurance claim is approved to receive a reimbursement. They responded with no unfortunately once I paid the $550 it would be gone.

So not only has several weeks of my time been wasted (looks like the denial happened a week ago), but now that the injection can't happen anywhere before the end of the year Wake Spine and Pain has cost me several hundred dollars regardless of who I go through since I'll have to get it done in 2024.

Completely unreasonable responses and timing from them at every corner, and incompetence (and a laziness on completing notes to the insurance provider) from the doctor as well. If I could give 0 stars I would, and this place should be avoided.|One of the worst experiences I've ever had. I've had chronic pain for 12 years. I have tricare. I was referred to this "pain management" clinic by my primary docter. This place will do nothing but push physical therapy and steroid injections. I waited a month for this appt. I left in just as much pain as I showed up in due to the physican assistants negligence. She treated me like I was someone off the street trying to get opiates. I asked for the lowest dosage pain killer she could give me to take the edge off till mri results came back and immediately shut me down because she insisted I take the same tests I've taking with other doctors and wanted to just prescribe me another brand of the same medicine that wasn't working. If you have tricare and expect to have some sort of pain relief from this place look else where. The physician assistant there is rude, doesn't listen to anything you see, and jumps to conclusions. She ended my appointment after I refused to take the same tests I've already taking. DO NOT RECOMMEND

column2: Interventional Pain Management of Lake Norman
column3:
Interventional Pain Management of Lake Norman serves patients throughout Mooresville, NC and surrounding Lake Norman communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by board-certified specialists, this premier medical practice combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Their state-of-the-art facility on Medical Park Road houses the latest diagnostic and therapeutic equipment, allowing for precise treatment delivery in a comfortable, patient-centered environment.

The clinical team at Interventional Pain Management of Lake Norman offers a diverse range of minimally invasive procedures and therapeutic approaches. Their expertise encompasses spinal injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's condition, medical history, and lifestyle needs, with an emphasis on improving functionality and quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes this practice is their commitment to collaborative care. Patients benefit from thorough consultations, detailed diagnostic assessments, and clear communication about treatment options. The physicians work closely with referring providers, physical therapists, and other specialists to ensure comprehensive pain management strategies that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with the pain management specialists at Interventional Pain Management of Lake Norman, patients can call +1 704-360-4378. Their modern facility is conveniently located at 170 Medical Park Rd, Mooresville, NC 28117, with accessible parking and wheelchair access. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and offers assistance with insurance verification prior to appointments.

column40:
I highly recommend, Dr.Edmiston is the most compassionate interactive Doctors Ive EVER been treated by, his bedside manner is amazing. He truly cares & listens to his patients, he developed a plan to manage my pain through various complex issues. He has always been available as needed. He is such a nice man! He is rare find !|Today was my first visit with Dr. Edminston & his wonderful staff!  After being in so much pain for so many years, I had almost given up on of having any improvement in my symptoms or the quality of life.  I was very  pleasantly surprised with how much time the doctor took to listen to me, explain things & offer suggestions.  He made it clear that it wouldn't be a quick fix & also was honest about things I would also need to change in my lifestyle.  All of his staff was so kind & caring! I now have hope that the possibility of having more good days than bad can be achieved!|Dr Edmiston is the best Doctor I have had since my accident. He is and has been the greatest.  He listens and is very attentive. I love being his patient because I know I can count on him.|Dr Edmundson and staff are kind and caring!  He takes the time to listen to me and help me understand my pain issues.  I have gone to other doctors and he's the best!  Wouldn't go to any other doctor!|Dr. Edminston is one of the best physicians I have been to and sadly I have been to many.  He is very caring and empathetic.  As well, he is very knowledgeable.  I would and have recommend him to just about anyone.|I rate Dr. 5++++ stars his staff..
Well now that's totally different rating. Unfortunately "The One" nurse definitely needs attitude check especially when it comes to working with PEOPLE WHO ARE IN PAIN !
Patient has to sign contract & part of the agreement is RESPECT for staff/nurses or BE DISCHARGED!!! SHE could at least FAKE a smile & Pretend to have COMPASSION. Not that SHE does.... time to Retire or find another area of nursing.. bothers me to even say this.. Nuff said.|Be careful all you patients if u test positive it can be a false positive if u have a high kidney and liver count this dr will cut u off without any notice or forewarning and no recommendations which he is supposed to supply I was a perfect patient never missed a pill count or test for 2 1/2 years not even a retest to confirm especially when the patient has a debilitating incurable disease and relies on medication to survive. That's not compassion or good practice . I lodged a complaint with the A.M.A. As well
Would not recommend|By far Dr. Edmiston is one of the best doctors around.  Very kind, patient and takes his time to speak to you and work with you.   Give this doctor an A+.

column3:
Crystal Coast Pain Management Center in Jacksonville, NC offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Onslow County and the surrounding Crystal Coast region. Established as a premier medical facility, our center specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches and personalized treatment plans. Our board-certified physicians combine extensive clinical experience with advanced medical technologies to address a wide spectrum of pain-related disorders, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

At Crystal Coast Pain Management Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary team provides a range of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and minimally invasive techniques designed to improve your quality of life. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, ensuring each individual receives thorough evaluation and customized care plans.

Our Facility and Location

Conveniently located at 57 Office Park Dr in Jacksonville, North Carolina, our modern medical facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The center offers a comfortable, supportive environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns and receive expert care. Our central location makes us accessible to patients throughout Onslow County and neighboring communities.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (910) 353-6008. You can also visit our comprehensive website at http://www.crystalcoastpm.com/ for detailed information about our treatment options, physician credentials, and patient resources. Our dedicated staff is available to answer your questions and assist with appointment scheduling.

Our Commitment to Patient Care

Crystal Coast Pain Management Center is committed to helping patients regain function and improve their daily lives through effective pain management strategies. We work closely with referring physicians and other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of our patients' health and well-being. Our goal is not just to treat symptoms but to help our patients achieve lasting relief and enhanced quality of life.

column40: I have been a patient for a few years , and I just got a phone call today telling me they are no longer taking my insurance for my appointment three weeks away. My issue is the fact that they let me know three weeks before as opposed to three months ago . Now I'm going to have a lapse in care and treatment when I could have started the process at a different location. If they truly cared about their patients' well being, they would have e given notice to avoid lapse in treatment or care. I would have even been willing to pay out of pocket. It is unfortunate that they don't care about their patients' well being.|16 months and not a moment without s reaming pain! Thanks to "Dr" Tellis and PA Foley. Tellis did a nerve ablasion and did not numb L5/S1. L4/5 was deadened. This caused me to hyperextend coming up off the table. This herniated L3/4, and ripped both hips. Then they want to dump you. Starting multiple corrective surgeries. Horrid place!!! Go to New Bern!|Lindsay Smith has been my pain management professional for almost five years. I've got neck and back injuries from a challenging law enforcement career; now retired. Every time I've had breakthrough pain, Lindsay has known exactly what to do to resolve the issue. She's professional, knowledgeable, experienced, empathetic, and her people skills are outstanding. Being her patient is a genuine asset to my quality of life, and as long as she's at Crystal Coast Pain Management, I'll keep going there.|My pain was originally dismissed as psychological even before any work up was completed. I requested to be transferred to Dr Auman and I had the most wonderful experience with her. She had taken her time with me, explained things, and really made me feel like my concerns were validated, she treated me like a person. Highly recommend Dr Auman!!!!|Elizabeth J. Raynor FNP-BC, FNP-C is who I saw Today I actually got in my car and cried all the way from the office to my house I drove 1 hour and 20 mins to this appointment to be treated so  so nasty and rude she was disgusting her attitude her behavior!  first thing she said was I don't treat RA with opioids. I'm confused why that was the first thing she said she never actually told me what her plan was? or how? she actually treats RA for her patients. The worst part she looked me in my face several times and said well that is life life is unfair she repeated that multiple times felt like somebody punch me in my stomach I have never had a doctor treat and talk to me like that ever in my life! I pray she never gets cancer because it would suck for a doctor to look at her and say that is unfortunate, unfortunately  life is not fair wow!!! as patients we come in already dealing with so much we didn't ask for this to happen so the comment well life is just unfair is extremely unacceptable. She does not need to be working for a pain managment practice if she feels like that. Worst experience of my life!|The office received my physician's referral 10 Jan, but when I called twice to see if they needed me to have other records transmitted I was lied to both times about the time of receipt. Today I was told the processor was still working on referrals from the first week of Jan, so I would not get a call until the middle of Feb at the earliest.  Her time problem was explained as "the doctors aren't here all the time." It is clear the office staff is not efficient & not always truthful. My guess is that the doctors & the corporate office are not aware that many of their patients are suffering because of the attitude & inefficiency of the support staff.  When I asked for a referral (to anyplace) from the office of my neurologist I was warned about staff inefficiency.  (Note:  Johnston Pain Management also suffers from the same problem.)  Update:  By going through the office manager I finally got an appt., which went well. However, my records were not rec'd, which prevents me from my treatment. I called the previous practice & was told the request had never been rec'd. I called Coastal to report that & spoke to Carla, who would only refer me to Naomi, who wasn't there, & would not notify Dr. Auman of the problem. I had to repeat the problem 3 times, as she didn't seem to understand, & then she reprimanded me, "Don't be ugly!"  So I still can't get treatment, & have no idea what happened to my record request.  Whether it is the fault of one practice or another, I just want to get the problem resolved so I can receive treatment. I don't need to be treated with disdain, but like a respected patient in need of medical care. I like my doctor, but the staff attitude is blocking our relationship & my care.|I have had the opportunity to be referred to Dr. Auman at Crystal Coast Pain Management a few months ago. I have been treated with the utmost respect and dignity, while undergoing; epidurals, cervical facet blocks, as well as gel knee injections and RFA's. I would like to commend Dr Auman for treating her staff with kindness and displaying a positive roll model to her staff. I'm very lucky that my primary care physician, Dr Manalukas recommended me to Dr. Courtney Auman. She has taken an active roll in my recovery and I'm very appreciative for her caring attitude.|Today was my very first appointment. Everyone  there was so very pleasant and professional.  I had a good experience with my doctor, went on to the pharmacy after and there was a small issue with my insurance.  When I  called the doctors office they were already on it. Amazing. Overall a very good first appointment it made me feel confident that i would definitely be able to get help here . Thanks  to the entire team.

column3:
Neurology & Pain Management Center in Lillington, NC provides comprehensive neurological care and pain management services to patients throughout Harnett County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical facility combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with personalized treatment plans to address a wide spectrum of neurological disorders and chronic pain conditions. Led by board-certified specialists, our center takes a multidisciplinary approach to patient care, integrating the latest evidence-based treatments with compassionate service.

At Neurology & Pain Management Center, we offer comprehensive evaluations and treatments for conditions including migraines, neuropathy, back pain, fibromyalgia, multiple sclerosis, epilepsy, and movement disorders. Our diagnostic capabilities include electrodiagnostic testing, nerve conduction studies, and detailed neurological assessments. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, potentially incorporating medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modification guidance.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that neurological conditions and chronic pain can significantly impact quality of life. Our compassionate team works closely with each patient to develop effective management strategies that address both symptoms and underlying causes. We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected throughout their treatment journey.

Visit Our Center

Located at 350 Pine State St, Lillington, NC 27546, our modern facility is equipped with the latest medical technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans. To schedule a consultation, please call us at +1 910-893-9700 or visit our website at www.neurologyandpain.org for more information about our services and providers.
column38: RJ|Jessie Perez|Tadream45 tadream45|Tina Harrington|Bianca|stacie hair|Dare Devil|My Fathers Son
column40:
Being seen for a severe spinal injury, I was nervous going in for the first time however everyone was helpful and kind. The doctor spoke to me about a treatment plan, understood my concerns, and gave me options that I felt comfortable with (I wanted to avoid specific "hard" medications). They listened to me and have set me up with a plan to help until I have a surgery date scheduled.
They also were advocates to the insurance company for me when the insurance company didn't understand the treatment plan. I am beyond thankful for their team and happy I go to this office!|I've never had a bad interaction with anyone at this location. Upon arriving the facility is clean and welcoming. The reception ladies are kind and respectful. The patient rooms are clean in smell and looks. I am usually seen by Jazzmene, Meredith, and Angel. They have always took my concerns in to consideration, and allowed me to be an active participant in my own care. They take the time listen, educate, and comfort when needed. Meredith has been the primary doctor that I see. I am fortunate, because with her help I went from being in agonizing facial pain and headaches 95% of the time to less than 5 severe episodes a month. If you're on the fence about this place, just go. You're in great hands!|To the Owner :
Last week I called this location  and spoke to a very friendly voice and i mentioned that I was confirming my appointment  for a few days in advance.

When I arrived there were 3 young women that check you in.
Each one was  friendly  and professional.

I have been going to this place for many years but one thing I like about it is the people who work up front.

Even when I was checking out all three of these women were very cheerful and helpful.

Jasmine
Michelle
 Evelyn

I would give all three five stars for customer excellence !


Thank you!
*Gary Stewart|The staff and doctors here are absolutely awesome.  Today was my first appointment and I had anxiety about my condition and whether the doctor would be empathetic to my needs.  The doctor was extremely caring; I didn't feel rushed, and they took the time to address all my concerns. I am very pleased with this center.  I would definitely recommned them for your neurology and pain management needs.|If I could give zero stars, I would!  I had a referral put into this office and when I went to my 9:00 a.m. appointment Michelle at the front desk told me my appointment was not here and I'm not in the system at all. She explained where the other Neurology clinic is so I drive there. When I get there, I'm not in their system either. So I call my insurance and she tells me it is the first place I went to...so I drive all the way back to first place. After 5-10 minutes of looking me up in their system they finally locate my referral. Michelle hands me the phone to talk to Hayley and she tells me she located my referral and she schedule me an appointment for me. I tell her well I'm here now- I got here before my appointment time and i paid for a babysitter as well. I have to be seen today. Hayley then talks to Jasmine and Jasmine tells me to have a seat in the lobby and they will talk to the doctor to see if they can see me. After waiting 10 minutes, they tell me they cannot see me today and Jasmine asks me "how far is Sanford from you?" Now this office is wanting me to commute to Sanford?!?! I told her I'm here for my scheduled appointment now. I had all the arrangements and got to my appointment before 9:00a.m that I wasn't one minute late to. This was so stressful, lack of communication and care. I hardly write reviews but I am in so much pain and they have me go back and forth- wasting gas, time, money on babysitter and energy! I do not recommend this place! I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else!|Thanks to Dr. Nailesh Dave and Neema Dave, PA-C I am no longer fully dependent on my wheelchair!  The care and support I have received over the past 5+ years has been a God send.  After a through evaluation and diagnostic testing, I found out that my pain wasn't just related to one issue but a combination of several issues.  The providers treat me with respect,  care, and compassion that is easily missed nowadays in the healthcare arena. I am listened to fully and understand my care plan every step of the way. There is honestly no comparison to where my pain level was and where I am now today.  I am thankful to have such a great team to help cheer me on and help get back what pain took away. Do not hesitate in being seen by this practice-you will be thankful you did!|I have been a patient of this company for nearly ten years. I have always been a fan of the staff in lillington, but in recent months, one of my medicines has become difficult to find, causing me to be a pain in the butt to the nurses as I switch my pharmacy, often. The nurses always call back quickly, answer my requests with cheery voices, etc., despite me causing more work for them. The Sanford office is much closer for me, but I go out of my way to lillington because of the people and how I am always treated. The nurses, especially, make this facility worthwhile and each one of them has been an absolute gem to deal with, every single time!! Thank you for always being incredible! <3|I had a appoint with the PA Bianca in Fay. My appointment was at 815 a.m. I got there 817a.m. the Receptionist said 820a.m. but she wasn't at the window for 3 minutes.
Im a Marine Vet pride myself with being on time. Some might say they were wrong no I was wrong .  I was late I knew when my appointment was.
My Dad had a saying Mr Leon when your wrong your wrong. I'm excepting responsiabilty for my action. So now I to Sanford tommorrow.   This is 2025 stop blaming people for your mistakes. This is a good Officer I never had any problems I've been going here for a long time.have to

ECPC Pain Specialists in Greenville, NC offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Eastern North Carolina. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our establishment, we have been committed to improving quality of life by addressing pain at its source rather than merely masking symptoms.

At ECPC Pain Specialists, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections

  • Nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Patient-Centered Approach

Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans addressing various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery and better outcomes.

Visit Our Practice

ECPC Pain Specialists is conveniently located at 2430 Emerald Place in Greenville, NC 27834. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to provide the highest standard of care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services:

Phone: +1 252-561-8218

Website: www.ecpc1.com

Address: 2430 Emerald Pl, Greenville, NC 27834, United States

We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all patients in Eastern North Carolina.

column40: I was a bit nervous because this was my first time going to pain management but the staff put me at ease and made me feel comfortable. My doctor was very nice and answered all my questions. He explained everything that he was doing to me as he was doing it. Overall was a great experience.|I had 3 level ACDF surgery 9 months ago in another state and have since moved to NC. My entire process from telling my PCP about my pain to surgery, took about 5 months; PT, MRI, X-rays, day of surgery, (no pain management) etc. My pain sadly started back around Thanksgiving and I knew what it was and am not really happy but here I am. From making it known to my Dr., I JUST went to ECPC today but on par with everything, due to wonderful insurance, gotta wait for that injection! I've done most of the work basically from start, and can't say I'm thrilled about the ECU health system, but ECPC was probably one of my most favorite and best medical appointments ever. After a fairy long wait for everything I've done before coming here, I was shocked to be called Tuesday for an appointment Thursday. I was adamant about no injections, but I have to have some relief and pray I don't regret changing my mind. I hope the rest of this long road is as easy of a time as I had today. Just 1 wish: I wish Dr. U was my PCP!!! Kudos to your company, job well done.|I can't stress enough how great the staff & providers are at ECPC pain specialists. They are so very caring, attentive, and nurturing in ways that made me feel understood, cared for & most importantly validated.  I would 10/10 recommend this clinic, staff, and facilities. I had a consultation on a Tuesday & received my first treatment on Thursday. Again, everything was explained thoroughly & as I waited for the procedure to begin I was kept calm and assured that I would be well taken care of. Dr. Doerr was so professional yet down to Earth. Even though I pray to have less pain in the upcoming days, months, years... I know exactly where I will be returning to in the event that things persist. I love being treated well and humanized without judgement. Thank you ECPC for being amazing.|Dr. Unnithan did my prior procedures I have to say I felt with his experience I felt I was in very good hands . Dr U explained every procedure to me and during procedure what he was doing. Dr.U when he spoke to me he has a very calming and supportive way I felt like he really was listening to my concerns he really put me at ease I wish more physicians were like this|Dr Firnhaber is Awesome Staffing and Dr was very helpful and Kind during all my procedures and Office Visits.  Highly recommend|The doctor and staff were very helpful and kind and understanding of my situation|Excellent medical team - from the nurses, PA to the doctor. They took care of my concerns, explained the procedure and told me what to expect moment by moment during the procedure. Great doctor!|Dr.Firnhaber& the nursing team have made my experience positive .Thank You All!
