column2: Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Lexington
column3:
Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Lexington serves residents throughout Lexington, North Carolina and surrounding Davidson County communities with specialized pain management services. Located within the Lexington Medical Center campus, this comprehensive pain treatment facility combines the expertise of Wake Forest Baptist's renowned pain specialists with the convenience of local care. The center offers multidisciplinary approaches to both acute and chronic pain conditions, utilizing evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

The Pain Center provides evaluation and treatment for a wide spectrum of pain disorders, including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Their team of board-certified pain specialists employs various interventional procedures, medication management strategies, and integrative therapies to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. The center's affiliation with Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist ensures patients receive care informed by the latest research and medical advances.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, the specialists at the Lexington Pain Center develop individualized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain. Their collaborative approach often involves coordination with primary care physicians, physical therapists, and other specialists to provide comprehensive care. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, supportive environment designed to put patients at ease.

Location and Contact Information

The Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - Lexington is conveniently located at 10 Medical Park Dr, Suite 1, Lexington, NC 27292. Patients can schedule appointments or request information by calling +1 336-716-7246. For additional details about services, physician credentials, or to request an appointment online, visit their website at www.wakehealth.edu/locations/clinics/p/pain-center-lexington. The center accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to coordinate benefits and referrals as needed.
column11: at Lexington Medical Center
column38: Summer Kennedy|Tracy Young|JoAnn Koslowsky|Roxanne Johnson|Suzanne P|Eleder's Best|Kenny Goodman|Barbara Morris
column40:
I cannot say enough good things about Dr Bullard and his fellows. He has improved my pain tremendously and always makes me feel heard. My concerns are addressed quickly and he explained procedures and education in a way that I understand. I do recommended him for sure to my friends or family needing his help.
I drive an hour from my house to be seen in his office and it is 100% worth it.|They kept pushing for the ablation..looks at me and says we dont give opiods here.. i did not ask for them I just want to stop hurting so much so they gave me gabapentin.. now Im seeing double and still hurting.|My husband has had five back surgeries and has a ten-level fusion with extensive hardware. We saw Dr Hamsher for a pain management consultation so my husband could have his internal pain pump re-installed and managed. Dr Hamsher was wonderful BUT he told us there are "politics" associated with pain pumps and that in order for him to do the pain pump, my husband would have to be off his oral opiates for six weeks. If my husband could be off oral opiates for six weeks and still manage activities of daily living like bathing, eating, etc. HE WOULD NOT NEED A PAIN PUMP!!!!! His PCP and spine surgeon could not believe such a ridiculous policy, no doubt made by pencil-pushing administrators who never see patients and have no idea what they are going through. I suggest you find a different pain management facility, as this one cares NOTHING about patients! Avoid Atrium and go to Novant Health instead.

To the "owner's" response to my review.......you have his information, including his phone number. If you were so concerned about making things better, YOU would have someone reach out to HIM. You want HIM to waste more of his time to reach out to YOUR customer service line so they can learn how to make things better??? Again, you are ridiculous!!!! You have the complaint right here. YOU do something about it!!!!!!!!!!!!!! No wonder all the negative reviews on here. Your "politics" are a joke. You care nothing about the patients.|My 93 year old mother is a patient of Dr. Brooks for her severe arthritis and she is one of the best doctors I have ever encountered. She is patient, personable, genuine and gives excellent care to my mother. Dr. Brooks always listens, questions and interacts with her kindly. I never write reviews but was shocked by the negative comments and felt a fair review was in order from someone who does not seek narcotic drugs. Thank you Dr. Brooks for your excellent service to your patients.|I've been going here for a year to have my back pain treated.  I had a shot last August that worked great, had another on in July this year (2022).  It didn't work as well, then I developed piriformus syndrome, pain of which I never felt.  I called their office and couldn't be seen for a little over a week.  They scheduled an injection for Sept 19, it has now been over a month since my pain began.
The day before my injection, my left side started hurting just like my right side.  I told them before I got the injection, they showed no concern.  Today the nurse called to see how I was doing and I told her about the pain on the left side.  She said there wasn't anything they could do so basically I have to be in excruciating pain.  Whenever I try to walk every few steps my leg gives out with me causing me to almost fall.  I almost passed out earlier because of the pain.
I'm going to have to find another practice that will help me.|This place is the worst pain clinic I've ever attended. Takes them a week to return phone calls. The doctors claim not to believe in opioid therapy for chronic pain patients only cancer patients. The don't listen to you as a human being just quote back CDC guidelines like they're regulations that are immutable. They've forgotten their hippocratic oath and chose to instead to protect their license and let their patients suffer. Don't waste your time or money.|I suffered from a serious hand and arm injury 7 months ago.  (Parchel Amputation) . After 4 surgery's and months of therapy I am still experiencing pain from damaged nerves.  My surgeon referred me to pain management as treatment for my condition.  His orders were for a opioid taper which means slow reduction of pain meds.  They refused to follow my Drs orders and refused to give me anything to ease the burning pain that is pure torture.  It's also very dangerous for someone to be taken off pain meds COLD TURKEY.  They don't care about the patient or what the surgeon who has been treating you says.  I will be filing a complaint with the NC medical board  !!! They placed a nerve stimulator in my arm and 60 days later when they removed it they broke a wire off in my arm that got infected which required surgery to remove when it got infected.  Stay away from this place !!|Have been taking friend there as referred. She has accute pain.  Lots of lip service,no action.  Asked if they had handheld MRI machine to look at shoulder. Answer," we have one but don't use it because we're not proficient in using it".  Let's get an x-ray instead.
Really!!

Carolina Pain Relief Center serves High Point, North Carolina and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists focuses on providing personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Established with the mission to improve quality of life through effective pain relief strategies, our center combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address the unique needs of each patient.

At Carolina Pain Relief Center, we offer a diverse range of treatment options designed to target pain at its source. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates both traditional and innovative therapies, including medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and holistic pain relief methods. We specialize in treating conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain.

Our Facility and Location

Conveniently located at 2766 Eastchester Dr, Suite 109, along NC-68 in High Point, NC 27265, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The center provides a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns and receive expert guidance on management strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in developing strong doctor-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and personal goals before creating customized treatment plans. This comprehensive assessment ensures that we address not only the symptoms but also the underlying causes of pain.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 336-740-9580. Our friendly staff is available to answer your questions and assist with appointment scheduling. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to make our services accessible to those in need of pain relief solutions.

Brought up my Plantar Fasciitis and Urinary Incontinence and decided to see if those areas could be helped. It's been several weeks and I am very pleased to say that the Incontinence is on hold. ECPC Holly Springs Interventional Pain and Spine serves the Holly Springs, NC area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans designed to address your specific needs. As part of the ECPC Pain Specialists Wake network, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering.

At ECPC Holly Springs, we treat virtually any painful condition including neck and back pain, sciatica, degenerated or herniated discs, and unrelieved pain after surgery. Our expertise extends to complex regional pain syndrome, vertebral compression fractures, diabetic and other neuropathies, migraines, arthritis, and sports injuries. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique circumstances of your pain condition.

Cutting-Edge Treatment Options

We pride ourselves on offering a wide variety of innovative, non-surgical and interventional pain treatment options. Our evidence-based approaches utilize the latest advancements in pain management technology to provide effective relief while minimizing recovery time and avoiding the risks associated with major surgery.

Our Commitment to Patient Care

We understand how debilitating pain can be and the profound impact it has on your relationships and enjoyment of life. Our promise is to provide you with a compassionate, thorough pain management experience focused on helping you return to the activities and lifestyle you love. Your well-being is our priority as we work together toward meaningful pain relief.

Visit us at www.ecpcwake.com or call us at +1 984-777-8787 to schedule your consultation. Our facility is conveniently located at 333 Earnie Ln, Holly Springs, NC 27540.

column38: April Villines|Miss|Chrissy Tarlton|Sarah Steel|Beatrice Hall|Tamara Hord|Jules Nickelson|Lori Kasprzak
column40:
I think it's awful that I have to even give a star at all. Let me start by saying that I have been managed at a pain doctor for the last seven years with no issues, and my doctor has gotten me to be able to live my life again. I went from walking with a cane and barely able to stand up to being able to work a little bit again. Unfortunately, my doctor has decided to close her practice and sent my entire file to this pain clinic as a referral. I did not check the reviews prior to my visit. My mistake and one I will never make again.

This practice is extremely corporate focused. From the minute you walk in you can tell that they're more interested in volume of patients then really truly assessing your needs. It's part of the reason why our pain epidemic in this country is so bad in my opinion. Even though my entire chart had been sent to this doctor, he did not review it ahead of my appointment, and spent a total of nine minutes with me, which included my four minute exam.

I suffer from multiple issues, including fibromyalgia, and lupus, along with nerve pain. It has been very well managed for a number of years and I was not looking to make any changes or add any additional medicines of any kind.

Not only was the doctor rude, but he barely made eye contact and he ran from room to room seeing three other patients at least in the same amount of time I was waiting for him to come back to do the exam after changing into a gown.

During my exam, I was asked to walk around the room, bend over, stand on my tiptoes, and was basically chastised because I'm well managed pain wise. His comment to me was that "see, you're fine". Of course, I'm doing fine, I've been managed well for many years. He told me that "I'm on too much medicine for someone my age" even though I've been on the same medication for many years and I am going to have issues down the road.

You could tell Dr. Hancock was rushed and did not have time or an interest in me.

I realize that there are a lot of people that seek drugs, but I've been to physical therapy, gotten massages and swim, stay active to help control my pain, but he didn't even ask about that. My entire 9 year battle with pain had been diminished to 9 minutes.

I left the practice in tears, and the nursing staff didn't even ask me if I was OK. The front desk girls are rude and could care less about the people. It was painfully obvious that every single person there has a time limit for patients, and that they hold that very seriously.

I left this appointment feeling violated. I was terribly shaking the rest of the day, and still find myself emotional now. No doctor should ever have the right to treat you that way. I am going to do a follow up with the practice to let them know how I feel but from what I've seen on here it won't matter. I'm sure I'll get the same comment everybody else's getting with we'd like to hear more, please call us at...

Sadly, I spent more time with a girl accepting my copayment than I spent with the doctor. I will never return, but I did learn a valuable lesson and that's that we are our own advocates, and that we have to stand up to people/companies like this.

I hope if Dr. Hancock reads this he checks in with his compassion once in a while.|Last week was my first time visiting this practice.  I was called back into the room really quickly, but that's where the appointment really began to transition to dog time.  By the time Dr Manepalli made it to my room I had nodded off several times.

As far as the good doc himself, he conducted himself very professionally.  He actually seemed like he was taking in what I was saying about my symptoms.

I can't speak the treatment that one might receive from any of the other practitioners,  but I would certainly recommend Dr Manepalli to anyone looking for a nice, competent and professional doctor.|Had my first appointment today Ive been in pain for the last 30 days severe pain. Nurse practitioner comes in and says that I need to see a psychiatrist you have no idea how bad I've been feeling. I'm there for my pain not for you to recommend for me to see a psychiatrist. This pain management office was the worst place I've ever been to. The nurse that I had she was very rude. I wouldn't recommend this pain management clinic very very unprofessional. Drug tested me you asked do I do drugs I tell you no I don't and you drug test me anyway this was the worst experience and I was embarrassed.|I would leave zero stars if I could. 1st off I was NOT seeking medication! I have a type of arthritis that has affected my SI joint. Was sent here for an injection. Was told Dr Manipelli was the best and he does 100s of these a year. No medication to calm my nerves was offered before the procedure. Got in the procedure room and the attendants were very nice. As he began he said you'll feel pressure.. It was PAIN! After multiple attempts he couldn't access the joint. I could feel him scraping my bone, so much it reverberated in my teeth. Finally he was able to administer meds to the  joint. My body was in shock after the excruciating procedure and I was shaking uncontrollably. All staff was concerned about was getting me out the door as quickly as possible, ignoring the fact that I was struggling after the procedure. In the midst of all this Dr Manipelli stuck his head in the recovery area and was very nonchalant that he couldn't access the joint after multiple attempts and "oh yea, you're going to be sore."After being told I'd feel like a new person, I left in a wheelchair. My husband and son had to carry me in the house and pick me up to take me to the restroom for 3 days. I absolutely couldn't walk. They offered me no post op care. Procedure was done Dec 6, and I still have pain from the procedure now in Mid Jan. I was so traumatized from this that I canceled the follow up because there's no way I'd ever go back to this office. Literal PTSD. I have been waiting on a survey from the office but of course none was ever sent so I decided to leave a google review. I pray that this helps someone to decide to NOT go to this office. Worst medical experience of my entire life.|Dr Ashok Manepalli had my mother sign paperwork on August 15 for pain management medication.  He never send a prescription to the pharmacy.   I call to request he call regarding her medication on September 11 and he returned the call to my mother on September 12th.  She has memory loss so I am not exactly sure of the conversation but she agreed to wait until her appointment on September 15 before being given a prescription for pain medication.  We have been seeing this Doctor since July and feel he has been dragging out her care.  She has extreme back pain.  I had to cancel a procedure since she was admitted to the hospital and sent an email via my chart.  He claims he called but I have no record of receiving a call from him on my cell phone.  He did not leave a message either.  The number provided was correct.  I called the office to be told he did call me and read off notes recorded in her chart.  I did not receive a call from him.  I am moving her care to another pain management doctor.  I do not suggest anyone go to this pain management clinic.  I ask who was over this clinic and was told Dr Hancock.  I requested to have him call me and was told he most likely would not call me back.|I wish I didn't have to put a star here, I was send to this pain clinic for back pain for herniated disk in my back, the front desk help was rude and unfriendly, the PA is less than helpful, the doctor only seen me one time for back injection, that hasn't helped. I'm not on anything for pain except hydrocodone 1month supply, and was told there would be no more prescribed to me, yet there are people in the waiting area nodding out. Seems the people with legitimate problems get no help but drug addicts are welcome with open arms. I wouldn't recommend you go here if you're in pain. You would probably get better attention somewhere else. It seamed a little sketchy from the beginning, but I was referred there by my PA that I trust but have let him know. This place is truly a joke. Not funny when you need help go elsewhere!!|1st the nurses we're very nice. HOWEVER!I gave extensive history to the Dr and he treated me like a straight up druggie. They will disregard someone who is truely suffering with background and Xrays but pass prescriptions out to ppl nodding off in their own office how sad and ridiculous! I have been sick since I was 12 yrs old and at that time had no control over what they chose to treat my pain with. I was trying to switch Drs to get care form a Dr. That was associated with the hospital. I was treated with such disrespectful bedside manner and disregard for my pain. Also as a matter of fact I just lost my husband in 2022, and he was a patient there and they let him suffer needlessly until we had to call in hospice. That should speak volumes right there. 2 different doctors same disregard for the pain and suffering. You draw your own conclusions! Personally I think this place is just in it for the Almighty Dollar! God have mercy on anyone who is truly needing help and goes to this facility!!!
J, E. N.|I was extremely disappointed in the care. NP was running behind and barely spent time with me going over my history. She made one suggestion that was not feasible for me. I brought in previous dr notes. I was told that they didn't treat headaches and migraines and that opioids were not prescribed in the office.  I explained that they work for me and how they help. Waste of my time and do not recommend this office.

column40:
Had my first appointment today at 2pm. Message said to arrive 30 minutes early. Mkay, no problem. I leave my house THREE HOURS before my appointment (I live 2 hours from there). Mind you, this was my first time EVER driving to Greenville alone and I hate traffic. I run in to dozens of road construction sites, loads of traffic, and then arrive at my appointment at 1:32p. Receptionist is like "yeah, we have to reschedule, you're late".  I explain to her it wasn't my fault about the road work and everything else, only for her to reply "well, you need to leave earlier then"! When I tell you I stormed out of that building and had to sit in my car for a good 20 minutes before leaving, and driving another 2ish hours..NEVER again.|Dr. Weaver is very nasty and unprofessional. I have a permanent thumb injury and possible nerve damage. I refused the injection because I've heard/seen bad reviews about it. He had the nerve to ask why did I come there! He lied and said that they didn't have my X-rays and said they couldn't give me pain medicine, then he just walked out without saying have a good day or nothing! Like how were you going to give me an injection If you didn't have my paperwork from my family doctor!! There's so much more but too much to type!

UPDATE!!! I just recently picked up my paperwork because I no longer wants to be a patient anymore and Dr. Weaver noted in my paperwork that "he thinks I'm only there to seek narcotics" all because I refused the injection! That makes me look terrible to others doctors! How can I fake an injury when you have my xray on file! There's always other options like I told him but nothing works! pain medicine is my only option smh. I just don't understand the discrimination. I've never failed a drug test under their contract! I've never been on drugs before !!!! I've been in so much pain. It's bad because doctors do not treat my pain because of what he noted! Wow, if that's what they think of us BLACK PEOPLE then I never want any pain medicine! I'm good!!!!|If you are on any benzos for anxiety or PTSD, etc he will not treat you until you have passed 3 clean urine test over 3 months. he will have you sign a contract that only he can prescribe you meds when he doesn't prescribe meds. this doctor is ONLY INTERESTED IN GIVING SHOTS. I've had 2 or 3 different kinds and they did not work. his answer was bc the other Drs who gave me the shots were not sophisticated in that area. so when I asked what was the success rate of his proposed treatment he didn't have a definitive answer. it was a rabbit hole conversation. I do not recommend going here. it was a waste of time and money. shots are big business and they do not work for everyone. but imo if you have insurance I'm not sure that part matters.
*IF EVERY PERSON IS DIFFERENT, HOW CAN THIS DR PRESCRIBE THE SAME TREATMENT FOR EVERYONE? UNLESS IT'S NOT ABOUT THE PERSON BUT ABOUT THE MONEY. IMO.|My experience with National Spine and Pain center was excellent. Dr Weaver was great very nice man very professional. The receptionist was so nice and sweet but Nurse Erica, she was awesome she was very nice and caring and she made me feel so at ease after my procedure. Just so you know, Nurse Erica you Rock!|The staff is always very friendly. The check-in and check-out process is handled quickly. I'm always called back not long after I arrive. It's nice to not have to sit around and wait at a doctor's office. They always listen to what I have going on and try to help me as much as possible. I highly recommend them!|The staff and Doctors have always treated me with respect and have listened to what I have to say. The check in and out process is quick and easy. Have always had a pleasant experience. The wait times have not been an issue, Called back on time or before appointment time. Have been going here for years and have never had an issue that they haven't been able to work out.|I wish I could say I had been treated fairly and listened to, but that wasn't the case. The doctor didn't listen to any of the facts(proven) and surprisingly wasn't well versed on treatments for my conditions or alternate medication options. He left me with no option knowing that I can barely even function at home. He instead told me to continue with what I've been doing even though I told him it was unbearable as is and that was why I had sought further treatment. I have well documented conditions. I've been in different versions of pain management for almost half my life. He wasn't even willing to work with me.

I feel a large part was because he knew I had no money which is why I went so I could get control of my pain and work again. Usually if you're not able to do the shots/ nerve blocks/ procedures side of things there, you are not accepted because that and drug tests are how they make their money. So if you have hope that they will help you get your life back together, squash it now before they do. Now I don't know what to do because pain management was my only option for a life. He literally didn't care that I'd be homeless if if I couldn't get my pain under control to get a job. Where the compassion and understanding?|I have never had any of the experiences that the other reviewers have posted.  My mother, 94, was a patient and was given respect and courtesy at all times.  The doctor spent time with us and made us feel like my mother was the only patient he had and never rushed her.  We usually were seen in a timely manner, and always had positive interactions with the staff. The treatment she received helped decrease her pain in the last weeks of her life.  The only reason that I give four instead of five stars is because the bathroom is handicap accessible, but not easily so, as is the front door.  I would recommend this office to anyone who asked.

Wake Spine & Pain Specialists serves Cary, North Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve mobility and enhance quality of life. Our dedicated team understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we've established a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain. Located conveniently at 115 Kildaire Park Dr STE 205 in Cary, our clinic combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with complementary therapies to create personalized treatment plans for each patient.

At Wake Spine & Pain, we recognize that effective pain treatment rarely comes from a single approach. Our patient-centric methodology begins with thorough evaluation and precise diagnosis, followed by customized treatment plans that may include advanced interventional procedures, pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy, and massage therapy. This integrated strategy often helps patients avoid risky surgical interventions while achieving significant pain relief and functional improvement.

Specialized Services

Our Cary clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions affecting the spine and other areas of the body. The team employs state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment modalities to address complex pain issues. By combining medical expertise with complementary therapies, we create a healing environment that supports long-term recovery and pain management.

Patient-Centered Care

What truly sets Wake Spine & Pain Specialists apart is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We take the time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly explain treatment options, and involve patients in decision-making about their care plan. This collaborative approach ensures that treatments align with individual goals and lifestyle needs.

Visit our Cary pain clinic to experience our unique approach to pain management. Contact us at (919) 787-7246 to schedule a consultation or learn more about our services at https://wakespine.com/locations/cary-pain-clinic/.
column11: At Wake Spine & Pain, it is our mission to relieve pain so that our patients can attain more mobility and better quality of life. Pain is rarely treated effectively by any single mode of treatment alone. For that reason, we carefully evaluate, diagnose and design a patient-centric treatment plan that includes the most advanced interventional pain procedures with complementary modalities like pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy and massage therapy. Our unique, well-rounded approach gives patients the best results, often avoiding risky surgeries.

column40:
The PA did not do any thorough provocative testing to assure the recommended treatment was appropriate for my issue then I had two injections for treatment that didn't work. I should have been a better advocate for myself - my mistake.
I finally got a third injection that did work and I was scheduled for a follow up appointment on a Tuesday at 3:20. My babysitter called me the Sunday before my Tuesday appointment and needed to cancel for the week (I have five kids 7 and under that I didn't want to bombard a clinic with). I didn't call to cancel the follow-up appointment on Sunday since the office would be closed but I called at 8am Monday morning to cancel for Tuesday afternoon. I was told that I would incur a $50 late fee and after speaking with the manager she said I should have called and left a message on Sunday so that it was 48hrs in advance. I asked when she would have received the message and she said "this morning.".......So the information would have been received at the same time Monday morning regardless but you want me to pay you $50 to have one less non-productive patient on your schedule. Sure. Cooperate offices are the absolute worst. Take your $50 Kyra SWAK.|Friendly, courteous and professional service.  The doctor communicated very well and explained my treatment options in a way that mafe sense.  All the staff were very friendly and courteous as well.|My first visit was on Monday. Tuesday I was called to schedule an MRI for Wednesday. Steroid injection scheduled for the following Tuesday. Within 8 days I will have had my initial appointment, MRI, and injection. That is quite remarkable!!|I have been going to Wake Spine And Pain for more than a year now. I have to see Julia for assessments and then Dr. Hertzberg for injections. They are both very good at what they do. The whole staff is super friendly. I highly recommend Wake S&P. I have tried others and drive almost 100 miles to get to them but they are worth the drive!|Had an appt at 9:40, got there about 9:30. Was told we were suppose to be there 30 minutes early when our message only said arrive early. Not 30 minutes, not 20 minutes not 15 just early. And if they want  you to be there a whole 30 minutes early just make the freaking appointment for the time they want you to be there!!!|Unless you want a cortisone injection, this is not the place to go. I went in with a history of having had cortisone injections which were at best a temporary solution, but experienced decreasing efficacy over time. Even though I told the PA that, they evidently didn't listen. In fact, he interrupted me twice as I was explaining him my admittedly complex history, and literally told me: "I have to get through this form." Mind you, I didn't talk to him for more than 5 minutes. What he basically was telling me was to shut up and just get an injection. If you want a pain specialist who actually listens to you (and treats you as a human being) go elsewhere. Very disappointed that my PCP referred me to this practice.|Absolutely terrible experience PA hurt me as I have torn labrum in my hip, supposedly sent in prescription for pain, yet never happened. I have been laid up unable to move for three days. I called monday morning because office closes at noon not open during weekend and no support holiness. Yet person answering phone didn't know how to do job, and supposedly office manager and clinical supervisor don't work there.....joke of an establishment.....filing a complaint with North Carolina General Assembly|My experience at this office has been stellar in terms of my dealings with in office staff. The doctors and PAs and nurses have been kind and helpful but my favorite staff member is the woman at the front desk. She is courteous, so helpful, and empathetic. If I could give her service in particular 20 stars I would!

column40:
I haven't had any problems. The waiting time can be long at times but I always plan ahead of time. The staff is nice and will answer all of your question. Parking is not a issue. If you need a wheelchair they do have some available to use with your appointment. If the appointment time they have available isn't right for your schedule you can fix it at the desk before you leave.|This is probably the most unorganized and inefficient doctor I have ever been to. Plan on staying all day. Also I have seen numerous doctors other than them and have had urine and blood tests at each of them and NOT ONCE have my tests come back with ANYTHING illegal yet supposedly twice in a row I tested positive for meth. I was told that if a positive result showed up LabCorp was supposed to do a second different test which would rule out anything I was prescribed that would cause a false positive. Apparently heag didn't feel it was necessary. Were you guys aware that among other prescription drugs that Vicks vaporub and some cold medicines will cause a false positive? I tried to tell them that and also informed them I had never tested positive for anything other than a small amount of thc. I occasionally use CBD gummies for pain. Rather than trying to resolve the issue Dr Dakwu kicked me out and gave me a paper with counseling recommendations. I would not recommend this place even to someone I disliked.|I've been coming to Heag Pain Management for 4 months and I must say I've had nothing but great experiences. The doctors and staff are extremely nice and caring. Doc addresses all your concerns and only strives for your best interest!|The Dr. and staff are very knowledgeable, and caring. They take the time to listen and make sure that you understand everything before leaving their establishment. I wouldn't want to be treated by any other Dr. but Dr. Dakwa and his amazing staff. What blessing it is that God allowed for me to find this clinic. Thank you all so much!!! Be Blessed|Dr. D is the best on time doctor that I have. He and his staff are super friendly and professional. Thank you for being my doctor. Happy New Year|I'm so very grateful to have an amazing doctor as Dr. Dakwa and his staff. My health began to get worst after I revealed to Dr. Robert Foster that my baby cousin was the one that was the serial killer that murdered the jogger and art gallery owner in Mecklenburg county. At one time I believed in Dr. Robert Foster because he once told me Mrs. Lopez I'm not just your doctor I'm your friend. I believe in him and this particular day I was in serious pain and remorseful of the suicide of my baby cousin . See they found him hanging in his jail cell. My advice to you come here to dr. Dakwa for your pain . I pray all the time that one day I will at least get 75 percent better. Dr. Dakwa I pray to God will get me there. I'm that confident in Dr. Dakwa. At Bethany I had to pay for 3 up to 4 hundred dollars per visits. Although I showed them my Medicaid and Medicare card. Im grateful for all Dr. Dakwa did he and his staff made sure that even how difficult Dr. Robert Foster made my end of life a living hell. I'm 61 years old with one working lung. I can't afford to die having Dr. Robert Foster which is impatent to practice anymore. Retire, die of go straight to hell or something Dr. Robert Foster cause I feel like you must have been in that prison cell torching my baby cousin.like the guards that took his life.  I don't need any doctor at all like Dr. Robert Foster, his nurse Channel nor the  CMA Quinn for that matter. I have a beautiful life. My husband and I have endured enough hardship over the past 28 years of marriage to last 1000 marriages put together. I have one working lung and my husband 15 years my senior almost lost his life to COVID in 2020 the month of December. We are nesters and all our children are grown and gone except our 23 year on. Therefore we really need good doctors. Cause this son of ours born 1 month and 3 days before the twin towers attack. We have a 3 year old grandson. I have to prove to his mom I can hold him in my arms without dropping him. That's to Dr. Dakwa he made it finally happen. Thank you Dr. Dakwa and your staff.
Warm regards,Angela Lopez CNA First Responder|My husband is a patient here I find that the doctor is very tentative to his needs he cares about his patience I recommend this doctor to anyone kudos to you keep up the good work.|Dr Dakwa is an excellent doctor but his staff I think he need to change some of those secretaries or the people that work at the front desk. Because not only my appointment was at 10:00 a.m. I didn't leave there until after 2:00. Everybody was gone in the office no one's there but me and Mr Randall. They completely forgot about me. I believe 4 hours in a doctor office is way too long especially for someone with the pet kind of pain that I'm in. When I went to give a urine sample. I went back to my room and the computer head froze which needed a pen to get in it so that was another 45 minutes I had to wait before someone could open my note pad back up. I had to start over in the beginning with my paperwork on the tablet. I believe there should also be someone there to help you to use the tablet there are people that has vision issues like me and also cognitive issues like me.. I'm not giving out any insults I'm only given these statements so that Doctor Dakwa can be aware and better improve his office, staff as well as his personnel so everyone can have a shorter visit.

column3:
Appalachian Regional Pain Management Center in Boone, NC offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout the High Country region of North Carolina. Established as part of the Appalachian Regional Healthcare System, this specialized center combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

The center provides a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Their approach emphasizes identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term outcomes. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's specific condition, medical history, and personal goals.

Expert Medical Team

Led by board-certified pain specialists, the medical team at Appalachian Regional Pain Management Center brings decades of combined experience in treating complex pain conditions. Their physicians stay current with the latest advancements in pain medicine through ongoing education and research, ensuring patients receive the most up-to-date care available. The center's staff includes not only physicians but also specialized nurses, physical therapists, and patient coordinators who work together to provide comprehensive support.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life, the center takes a holistic approach to treatment. They emphasize patient education, self-management strategies, and lifestyle modifications alongside medical interventions. This comprehensive methodology helps patients regain function and improve their overall wellbeing. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, supportive environment designed to put patients at ease.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, contact Appalachian Regional Pain Management Center at +1 828-265-5493. They are conveniently located at 261 Longvue Dr, Boone, NC 28607. Visit their website at https://apprhs.org/paincenter to learn more about their services and approach to pain management.

column40:
Everyone at this clinic are nice and helpful. They take great care of me every time I am there. However I have had problems with the hospital who carries out of the procedure authorizations dropped the ball with me. They had 5 weeks to submit my referral for my next procedure and they waited until the Friday before my appointment which was early Monday.  I had to call my insurance company just hours before and all they could do was put in a note of urgency. Thankfully I got a call saying it was approved with enough time to make it to my appointment. It is my understanding that this is a far to frequent  occurance and it needs to be seriously addressed.  No one should be this stressed leading up to an appointment and this is a pain clinic for heavens sake. We are already stressed enough as it is.|I called to make an appointment (after having already left a voicemail and unsuccessfully trying to get ahold of them for a week), and was told that a doctor here denied my referral from my PCP.
Might have been good for someone to at least contact me and let me know about that as soon as possible, so I could have gone ahead and tried to get an appointment at a different doctor that's willing to see me.

**

Update: Around 2 hours after posting this, the office called me to tell me that they saw this review, and they said they're sorry I didn't understand that my PCP was supposed to have updated me.

My issue is that despite leaving a voicemail HERE a week ago, and continuing to try to call since then, I never got ahold of anyone until today-- only to ultimately be denied care and sent somewhere else. It just seems like my initial call, when I left a voicemail describing my situation, could have quickly and easily been returned before now, and I could have avoided spending the past week waiting.

When someone gives you critical feedback, the best response is perhaps not actually to call them and tell them they are wrong. Especially when you know that they are seeking care for chronic pain.|Yes, I echo the review by Kayla below, since we also spent weeks repeatedly calling this center, almost always getting a voicemail initially. To their credit, they did usually return calls within a day, but after finally being told we WOULD be notified of an appointment time by a certain date and NOT hearing anything on that date or the day after, and calling again repeatedly, we were eventually told the doctor denied our referral and that "our doctor" should have notified us? (At least three doctors were involved in the referral, so we don't even know which one they might have intended and why couldn't they just provide the details of why we were denied, or at least which doctor we should contact?) I echo Kayla's sentiments that there are much better ways to communicate more efficiently, compassionately, and completely, especially for a person already suffering from severe pain who has been specifically told to contact pain management for the "best and most lasting solution". Can't even get started on a solution at this place, but instead wasted weeks trying (literally a pain) . . .|I have had back pain since I was 20 years old now 71. I was diagnosed with human functioning problems that I would have to live with.  My second visit here cured, repeat CURED, my back pain, totally.  50 years of pain for nothing!!! My life has changed,  attitude lifted and friends and family see a different a different man. Shows Doc. Stork actually delivers life back to baby's at 71!!!! Thanks Doc to you and your team.|The ladies at the Pain clinic are always so kind and so professional. Ashley always listens to what i have to say. She communicates in a clear and concise manner and answers questions very effectively and efficiently. I always have a positive experience each time I visit this clinic.|I have been coming here for several years and ALWAYS get The Best Treatment EVER! The Staff is Wonderful--Soo Thoughtful/Caring/Thorough! Dr Stork is my current provider here and Try's Soo Very Hard to Help Me with the continued Back Pain!
He Really Attempts to give me Relief from Pain/Discomfort!! In Feb. 2022 the injection relieved me of All Pain---Sooo I think he has Found the Right Spot!!! All who work here are Exceptional "Folks"
A Big Thanks to All!|Went to appointment without the information I needed to receive the treatment I needed. I hold my orto. Dr. Responsible as well as the pain clinic.  I should have been sent the information I needed, like having a driver with me because I would be receiving shots that would numb me from my waist down. I had been looking for this appointment, thinking I would be on my way to being pain free. To say the least,
I'm upset and disappointed.|So thankful for ARPMC. Awesome people. From the front desk to the nurses, docs. Nobody here has ever known my grandkids but have had a huge effect on them because Popa is off the couch & active with them. So many many smiles on the faces of my grandkids are the result of ARPMC. Sometimes when a grandkids & I are doing something together I can't help but think " Yeah, APRMC, thank you". Pretty good drive for me but well worth it. Been going for 10 yrs now. They almost kin now. Won't stop 100% of the pains, but if you realize that going in you'll be more than satisfied. Just absolutely blessed to have them for treatment. 5 stars  is somewhat inadequate as a rating.

column40:
In looking for pain management in my lower back and bursitis in my hip joint, I found Dr Jon Hoppenfeld. He was God sent. After having a steroid injection in my spine back at the beginning of January 2025. To this day I do not have any pain in my lower back. Yesterday I had the steroid injection for the bursitis of my hip joint. It all went well. With any steroid injection, I will know in a few days how successful and pain free I am. The staff was excellent and the office and procedure room was spotless. I would highly recommend Dr Jon Hoppenfeld to my friends.|This pain center is by far the very best I've ever encountered in this region!! Dr Jon Hoppenfeld is very compassionate about his clients and goes above a beyond to ensure the proper procedure is being done for the pain management! The nurse staff is highly motivated and very friendly as well from getting you checked in to getting the vitals needed. Having a spinal burst fracture from a tornado which I need specialist to help with the pain I endure, this facility is by far the best I've been to and I've been to quite a few places. This facility is highly recommended!! Special thanks to Dr Hoppenfeld for your bedside manner and the excellent service you provide!!|I became a patient of Dr John Hoppenfeld a couple years ago and I am forever grateful that I did. I had suffered for years with arthritis in my back, neck, hands and my left knee. Playing sports and lifting weights growing up took its toll on me and 20 years at my job has not helped. There was even a time a few years ago I did not know if I would be able to continue my line of work. Thanks to Dr John Hoppenfeld I feel like I honestly got a second chance. This man is a genius and extremely knowledgeable at what he does. He has totally changed my life and I am able to do things again pain free. I will always deal with arthritis on some level but at least I can function now on a day to day basis and not  feel like collapsing when I get home.  "Thank you " Dr Hoppenfeld for all that you do and also "Thank you" to the staff who are as every bit concerned with my care as the Doctors. They are always friendly, compassionate and professional. I sincerely hope Atrium realizes and recognizes what they have with this Doctor and his staff.  Thanks again.|After years of back and hip pain, the pain management team here finally found effective treatments for me. The doctor is great at pinpointing the pain and providing relief. The nurses are all very friendly and helpful, too!|Wonderful assisting nurses, receptionist, & Dr. Hoppenfeld was equally as awesome!
I had the Stellate Ganglion Block performed on the right side for the second time. This procedure has greatly improved my long-covid & PTSD symptoms. It increased my mental clarity, improved my breathing isssues, and decreased my anxiety, panic attacks, & hypervigilance. After years of dealing with these symptoms, things went from feeling like I was always on 10 to about a 4 or better. Almost like someone turned down the noise, making it so I'm better able to manage my emotions and plan my day to day life. Thank you all for doing what you do.|The Doctor Himself Was So Dismissive. Only Wanted to Talk About Surgery, Shots or Physical Therapy, Which Put Me on A Cane Before. Would Not Discuss My Injuries or Any Other Pain Management Options. The Nurses and Assistants Were Great. Only This Particular Doctor Was So Non-Caring. Need to File a Complaint Against Him.

column2: Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - North Elm
column3:
Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Pain Center - North Elm in Greensboro, NC offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout the Piedmont Triad region. Our specialized medical facility combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Staffed by board-certified pain management specialists and supported by a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals, we provide personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At the Pain Center, we utilize evidence-based interventions including medication management, minimally invasive procedures, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, and integrative therapies. Our approach focuses on improving quality of life while reducing reliance on opioid medications whenever possible. Patients benefit from our comprehensive evaluations that identify the underlying causes of pain rather than simply treating symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our care extends beyond medical treatments to include psychological support, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Our facility features state-of-the-art equipment in a comfortable, accessible environment designed to put patients at ease during their visits.

Location and Contact Information

New patients and referrals are welcome to contact us at (336) 716-7246 to schedule consultations. For additional information about our services and providers, visit our website at wakehealth.edu.

column3:
Guilford Pain Management in Greensboro, NC offers comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the Piedmont Triad region. Established as a trusted healthcare provider within the Cone Health network, our practice specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. Under the medical direction of Dr. Mark Phillips, our team combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At Guilford Pain Management, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and patient education. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific needs, medical history, and lifestyle factors.

Our Medical Expertise

Dr. Mark Phillips leads our clinical team with extensive experience in pain medicine. Board-certified and fellowship-trained, Dr. Phillips employs the latest techniques in pain management while maintaining a compassionate approach to patient care. His comprehensive evaluations focus on identifying the root causes of pain rather than simply treating symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing collaborative relationships with our patients, empowering them to participate actively in their treatment decisions. Our staff provides thorough education about pain conditions and available interventions, ensuring patients understand their options and expected outcomes.

Location and Contact Information

Conveniently located at 522 N Elam Ave, Suite 203, Greensboro, NC 27403, our office is easily accessible from major roadways. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (336) 852-8444. Additional information about Dr. Phillips and our practice can be found on the Cone Health website at www.conehealth.com/find-a-doctor/doctor-profile/mark-phillips/.

Insurance and Referrals

Guilford Pain Management works with most major insurance providers and accepts referrals from primary care physicians and specialists throughout the region. Our administrative team is available to assist with insurance verification and referral requirements prior to your first appointment.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr Phillip for 18 years after I had lost my right hand.  When I met Dr Phillips he had me at ease within a few minutes with his sense of humor and his promise that he wouldn't do anything to me that I didn't feel comfortable doing. He promised never to touch my neck with a needle since a different clinic hurt me. He is always professional and has the best bedside manner and he is very intelligent. Dr. Bodea is also a wonderful doctor, she does my Carpel Tunel shot and she is very nice and friendly with me. She tries to make it as easy  as possible and it isn't that bad of a shot when she does it. The staff there are all so nice and friendly and understanding, they make you feel comfortable being there. The nurse always stay with me after an injection to make sure I'm good. Thank you guys for taking such good care of me.|I've been seeing Dr. Bodea for several years now. She is very professional and listens to you. She is very knowledgeable of the human body. She's able to perform spinal injections and has been the best at it for me. She keeps it as painless as possible. I've heard horror stories about cortisone shots for your knees, I can tell you that she didn't make me have a horror story. Probably the most painless injections I've ever had. Shes just great!|Dr. Phillips is caring, understanding, and really listens to you. My husband has been his patient for years. We will never go to anyone else. It took us many years to find a doctor that actually takes his time and makes sure he does what is best for the patient and the symptoms.|Dr Phillips at Guilford Pain Management is nothing short of a miracle worker. His care and concern for his patients is matched by his amazing knowledge of managing the pain process in the human body.

I noticed that someone went to the effort to give this practice one star and made  the comment, "no good."  Perhaps that person was looking for the notorious, "Dr. Feelgood." He doesn't work at Guilford Pain Management...only professionals do.|Dr. Phillips is A wonderful Dr. He listens , cares makes you feel like your concerns are his as well. I have alot of good Dr.s and Dr. Phillips is one of them. I am blessed.|I've been seeing Dr. Phillip's for years.  When I'd given up hope of ever seeing a minute pain free he gave hope again. I now see Dr. Bodea as well and along with Dr. Phillip's they are the answer to a prayer.  They listen and understand. I highly recommend them to anyone suffering!!|Dr. Phillips has made my life worth living over the last few years. When I gave up on life, he helped me make it thru the pain. He is a caring, empathetic man.|I had a nerve ablation performed here that greatly reduced my pain. Dr Bodea is extremely skilled and is truly dedicated to helping her patients. Can't recommend highly enough.

column2: Southeast Pain & Spine Care - Cameron S. Cunningham, MD
column3:
Southeast Pain & Spine Care serves patients throughout Rutherford College, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Cameron S. Cunningham. Our practice specializes in interventional pain management techniques, utilizing advanced diagnostic tools and minimally invasive procedures to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine and musculoskeletal system. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, developing customized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Dr. Cunningham brings exceptional credentials and specialized training to Southeast Pain & Spine Care. After completing his medical education at the University of Missouri, he pursued his residency in Anesthesiology at the prestigious Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center. His dedication to pain management led him to complete a fellowship in Pain Management at the same institution, providing him with advanced expertise in the latest interventional techniques and comprehensive pain solutions.

As a Board Certified specialist in both Anesthesiology and Pain Management, Dr. Cunningham offers patients the highest level of specialized care backed by extensive clinical experience and ongoing professional development.

Professional Affiliations

Dr. Cunningham maintains active membership in several prestigious professional organizations, including:

  • American Society of Anesthesiologists

  • North American Neuromodulation Society

  • Society of Interventional Spine

  • NH ASA Resident Delegate at ASA Legislative Conference

Academic Achievements

Dr. Cunningham's commitment to excellence is evident through his numerous academic achievements, including:

  • Dean's Scholarship (UMKC)

  • Robert Bruce and Sue Ellen Reed Scholarship (UMKC)

  • ORCA Grant for Research (BYU)

  • Brigham Young Academic Performance Scholarship (BYU)

Beyond his professional accomplishments, Dr. Cunningham is an active community member who enjoys marathon and half-marathon running, indoor soccer, church service, and fundraising for children's services.

Contact Information

Location: 720 Malcolm Blvd, 4th floor, Rutherford College, NC 28671

Phone: (828) 383-8227

Website: www.sepainandspinecare.com/continue-care/

column40:
Dr. Cunningham is wonderful.   He is so knowledgeable.  He explains things well and is easy to understand.  He takes his time to answer all my questions.  The staff is great.  They are so caring and treats their patients well.  You don't feel like just a number at this pain clinic.  I highly recommend them to anyone I know that needs this kind of care.|Due to some unfortunate heath issues and injuries I have been a patient for 10 years I think.  The staff at the Valdese clinic are amazing and caring.  It's a little thing but they always remember something from my prior visit, personal not medical and ask about it.  They make me a PERSON not a patient.
I have seen both Dr Evans and Dr Cunningham.   Dr Evans is the kind of doctor who will stand up for his patient and their needs up and to the point of threatening to end a partnership with a third party provider if I did not receive the level of care he expected.
Then there is Dr Cunningham.   He listens.   Please understand I mean more than nodding and hearing the words.  He hears what you don't say too and has a gift to see the whole picture.   He is not a Dr who accepts the concept of 'it's the best we can do' or 'those are the only options '.  He will search and research and not give up on you as long as you don't give up on him.
Once I was told that unfortunately all the pain clinic had were bandaids.  Well their 'bandaids' have given me my quality of life back more than once, and they are working to do it again.  That's more than many other Dr's have done, combined.

If you are in search of a simple source of narcotic pain meds, go somewhere else where the Dr's don't care.  If you want your life back from pain, solutions that may include some medication but with a more permanent solution as the hopeful end goal, go to Southeast Pain Care in Valdese.  You will not regret it.|I love Dr. Cunningham; he is the best doctor ever. He specializes in pain management, and that is what he assisted me with. He has helped me so much. I would never have trusted a doctor with my procedures except him. He listens to me every time and makes sure I am comfortable before having them done. I do not really remember much during the procedures because of the medication he gives me for my nerves. People say back shots and knee shots hurt, but they do not with Dr. Cunningham; he is the best. He not only is an amazing Dr but he really cares about his patients and listen to you where most others do not. His team is also amazing and I love them all. I had blood clots in my leg and my whole leg was solid red and It was absolutely killing me. I had went to my regular doctor and a vain dr both said just let it desolve on its own there is nothing we can give you for it now but when Dr Cunningham saw how red my leg was and swollen he said oh my Vivian have they gave you any antibiotics because that's infection I said no and he prescribed me the medication and by the next day my leg felt much better. That is why I love Dr Cunningham he is the best|He has saved my Life and since my July surgery of the Spinal Stimulator I have been able to have a major improvement and not be bed bound anymore. He's the best in the game . And has a Big heart considering that soon I will be able to walk without any assistance.|Dr Cunningham is very professional and great at his job.  He listens well snd wants to fo the best for you.|Love Dr Cunningham and his staff. Always very nice and Dr Cunningham does a great job with my injection.|Today was my first time seeing Dr. Cunningham. He replaced Dr. Sullivan who retired.  Having driven a city bus for 30 years my pain issues are quite severe.  Dr. Cunningham administered my pain medication injections and I barely felt the needle.  He is both professional and completely understanding of my pain needs and I highly recommend his services!!  A+++|This is a very fine young physician who genuinely cares about the services he and his staff provide. Further he has the unique all in one facility to provide all most all types of major pain management services in house with his flouro suite.

Ive been going here for a while. Dr. Bertrand is a one of the most caring doctors I've seen in a while. She has helped keep my pain managed and for that i thank her. The staff is nice and polite. Thank you National Pain and Spine|the staff is ridiculously friendly!!! I've had several RFA procedures on both my knees with a different DR at another practice. this is the first time I've had the procedure numbed for me! I can not say enough about how different that makes the process of this procedure!!! she simply told me that I shouldn't have to feel the pain of that part and that she didn't like causing pain. I don't think I've been more grateful for a DR! And she was VERY knowledgeable about the procedure!!! im very grateful for my referral here!|I've Been Going To Intervention Pain/ National Spine For 12 Years and I Still Do But It's Really Terrible For Patients, the Atmosphere Is Tense And It's Just People Who Have Been Fired and Terminated. It's Rude Receptionist, Who Were Trained To Be Rude. Office Manager Brenda Williams Who Always Treats Patients and Staff Horrible.paperwork And Procedures And Follow Up She Is Very Vindictive, With Patients Who Complain, Three Black" PA'S Fired, A Korean, PA Fired! She Doesn't followup on the Situation Like MRI'S and Paper Work Sent to Wrong Institutions. The Reviews are Not Published, Lots of Patience Have Left because Brenda" Will GET YOU GONE! Patients Or STAFF!! I'm Suffering Right Now Because She Doesn't FOLLOW UP WITH PHARMACY IF THEY CALL HER AT THE OFFICE SHE DOESNT REPOND, FOR QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE PATIENCE QUALITY OF LIFE IM A CANCER SURVIVOR AND JUST HAD HAND AND ELBOW SURGERY SHE IS COLD!! AND I SUFFER.. BECAUSE OF INCOMPETENCE. ARROGANT, OFFICE MANAGEMENT!??|Dr. Bertrand is AMAZING. She has helped me tremendously over the last few months, and has listened politely to all my questions and concerns. She is honest, and has been extremely professional this entire time. I would leave a 5 star review, however, I have called multiple times throughout the month and they've only answered the phone twice. I have left messages and they ask you only leave one, but they never call back. It's extremely frustrating and I hope it can be fixed.|I'm a prior cancer patient, and after all the treatment my body was left pretty beat up. This clinic is by far the BEST pain management clinic in N.C. The rules you must follow are clear, and the ENTIRE staff listens. Dr. Bertrand genuinely cares for her patients - she doesn't treat us like we are just a number. She's caring, thoughtful, and truly wants what's best for her patients. Ms. Brenda always greets me by name and runs a tight ship. She's amazing, and I never have to wait longer than 15 minutes from my appointment time. When I come out she has my next appointment ready to go. By far the smoothest running clinic I've ever been to. I HIGHLY recommend this clinic if you genuinely suffer from chronic pain.|Do not walk but run away! This is the worst run practice I have ever seen and I have worked in the medical profession for years. I was ordered an MRI over 6 months ago and they will not get insurance approval for me to get it done. My orthopedist can do it in under 24 hours. This is not the first time for this either nor am I the only patient this is happening too. The PA's openly lie to patients. The list goes on and on but I am tired of typing. Just listening to the other patients in the waiting room talk is scary enough. There are signs in the exam rooms threatening expulsion for recording your visit, that should be a huge red flag to anyone. Why would they be afraid of this if everything was being done properly.|Dr Bertrand is truly a wonderful lady and and even better Dr. One that genuinely cares which is an unfortunately rate trait from my experiences. She listens, gives honest feedback, and wants you to get better. She should be cloned, or at the least, new DRs and PAs should be required to learn from her on how to be decent human beings n physicians. I honestly can't say enough about great job she does, from treatment to just listening to her patients. I hope everyone that sees this had a Dr Bertrand in their life!!!
Again she deserves countless raises and awards for what she does and the amazingly wonderful Dr/person that she is. A gift just to meet her|IM  not being seen on time or in  order of mynappointment since the departure of the Spring Lake PA that left to spend more times with his kids.
Last month 3 people who came in after me who appointment was after mine was seen before me.  I was there almost two hours I brought it to the attention of the Dr.
Today I was there an Hour and forty five minutes my husband brought it to attention to the young lady who worked the front desk she said only one person but believe she was mistaken it was actually 2 for sure maybe 3. My husband and I know they young lady up front  catches it and she actually a very nice professional member of Staff so are all the Dr's Ive seen.  All I want is to be treated fair to be seen on time in order then if it takes longer I understand. Treat me like you would like someone to treat you or your family member.  My husband and I have always treated Staff members with respect and will continue to do so you don't have to be disrespectful to resolve a problem
Thank You

Atrium Health Huntersville Pain Management serves Huntersville, NC and surrounding communities as a specialized facility of Atrium Health University City. Our comprehensive pain management center is dedicated to providing relief for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. With a team of board-certified specialists, we address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues including back and neck pain, arthritis, muscle and joint discomfort, nerve pain, neuropathy, and numerous other painful conditions that impact quality of life.

Our facility offers diverse therapeutic approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. These include:

  • Joint injections for targeted relief

  • Nerve block injections to interrupt pain signals

  • Advanced spinal cord and peripheral nerve stimulation

  • Botox treatments for specific pain conditions

  • Therapeutic massage

  • Medication management and prescription services

Integrated Care Advantage

As part of the broader Atrium Health network, our patients benefit from seamless access to additional specialized care when necessary. This integration ensures comprehensive treatment options and continuity of care across the healthcare system.

Patient Information

We accept most insurance policies and are conveniently located at 16455 Statesville Rd, Suite 310, Huntersville, NC 28078. Don't allow pain to control your life any longer—contact us at (704) 801-2501 to schedule an appointment with our pain management specialists.

For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at atriumhealth.org.
column11: At Atrium Health Huntersville Pain Management, a facility of Atrium Health University City, we specialize in helping patients manage their pain, including back and neck pain, arthritis, muscle and joint pain, nerve pain, neuropathy, and more. And as part of the Atrium Health family, you'll have access to more specialized care if it's needed. Don't wait in pain any longer. Call us to make an appointment. CAROLINA PAIN CENTER in Morehead City, NC is a specialized medical facility dedicated to comprehensive pain management and treatment. Serving the Crystal Coast region since 2007, our center combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain control of their lives. Our board-certified physicians and experienced medical staff are committed to addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions with compassion and clinical excellence.

At Carolina Pain Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management. Our specialists treat a wide range of conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery and improved outcomes.

Our Facility

Located at 4251 Arendell St, Morehead City, NC 28557, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The center features comfortable consultation rooms, procedure suites, and recovery areas designed with patient comfort in mind. We've created a welcoming environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns openly with our medical professionals.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects each person differently, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and goals. Our team works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care and optimal outcomes. New patients are welcomed with comprehensive evaluations to determine the most effective path forward.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 252-222-3340. column40:
Great doctor and staff. Appointments are quick with no waiting more than 10 minutes!|I've been coming here for 5 years and have seen all 3 doctors. They are all fantastic. I seen so many doctors before finally being referred to CPC. They did tests that were never suggested before to find and pinpoint my problems. They go above and beyond to work with you about what's best for your particular issues. The staff is also wonderful.  So grateful I found this clinic.|My mother, who had lung cancer, was referred here.  She was in a great deal of pain, and women of her generation, suffer in silence.  Radiation, surgery, chemo, cancer, caused her tremendous pain.
She had seen pain management doctors in Greenville, but they were of little help.
Dr. Swiber was outstanding.  He said that he would do whatever was needed to make her pain free and increase her quality of life.  He was a true blessing.|I must say both me and my wife go here and for my wife who has been told for years to just deal with pain the Dr's here have helped her. Dr.Jason Mcneese and other staff have been great. She has so many back issues that make her daily life unlivable, they have helped her be able to enjoy life again. As for myself I am a disabled veteran and they have helped me so much I got my life back. We thank you all at Carolina Pain Center.|I have been to two other Pain Doctors before coming here. Both were unresponsive when it came to answers and treatments. On my first trip i met with Jason (PA) and he was great. He did a couple of test to figure out my source of pain. I was never given any tests like this at any other place i went. He was friendly and knew what he was talking about. They scheduled a steroid shot in the same week. Where in the past i would have to wait a month or two. The day of the shot i was greated by Doc Swiber who made the experience of the shot better by humor. After a few days i got a call by the staff of Doc Swiber office asking how i was feeling. Due to the friendliness of this practice and how they treat their patients. I will be recommending this place for my friends amd family.|This place had me attend four appointments before telling me that they didn't take my insurance for the actual procedure. I don't understand how they would do the injections and then not do my procedure. I do not recommend this place because they should have told me in the first place that they didn't take my insurance. This is as a waste of my time. I had to take personal leave from my work so now I won't be able to spend quality time with my family during the holidays because I had to waste leave days for attending appointments that eventually did nothing for my injury/disability. The receptionist also seemed clueless on how to do the most simple task on the computer. When I needed all appointments for my job they had no idea how to pull up all appointments to give to me I have no respect for this Clinic.|With all my medical conditions, surgeries, and test. I've seen far too many doctors to know that to find a great Dr like Dr Swiber is extremely hard. So when you do find them you make sure you realize there aren't many doctors around this knowledgeable, and caring. So don't screw it up and take advantage of him. Because when you get dropped as a patient and think you will find another doctor with the same knowledge and this caring... You'll be begging him up to take you back as a patient. I've seen Dr Swiber for a few years now. This man is kind, caring, and understanding. He's not looking to just see patient after patient after patient just write scripts for narcotics and send you on your way. He (Swiber) genuinely cares, he explains his thoughts, concerns, symptoms, treatment option, the works... he will go through it all with you. He will tell you what he thinks will work for you and your conditions. If you were thinking of a different approach to help you. You just discuss it and come to a common ground. So if you're just looking for drugs find a different doctor. If you're really in pain and you need help. He will be the man to see. After 20 + doctors, 10 + surgeries over the last 5 years alone. Plus countless others prior. All the workers compensation doctors, evaluations, and functional capacity exams/evaluations. This doctor is by far the best and I will be his patient until he retires. If you happen to read this Doc. You and your staff are amazing. Everyone at both of your offices are great and I know that you are wearing off on them. In a great way. Thank you so much!!!!

Sincerely, Michael Mann|My wife had an appointment here for an epidural for pain management. The lady at the front desk refused to let me go back with my wife and proceeded to say I wasn't allowed in the building at all. Worse facility I have been to so far.

The doctor came in and she already had her mind made up. That she was not going to help with my current situation . I felt very judged bc of my past.  Doctors should listen to present situation|I've been seeing Dr. Fallin for about 18 months now. I have a bulging disc in L5 and Arthritis in my SI joints and arthritis in my right ankle with bone spurs. My pain is under control and I live a much fuller life now. I sleep better and don't wake up with shooting pains, my mobility has improved and I am able to continue doing hobbies that I love.|I've been seeing Dr Fallin for several months now and I have nothing but praise for him and his staff. Chelsea, Stacy, Amy, and Pam have all been outstanding in providing the care I received.|Have had two visits, the whole staff from lady answers the phone, to the MA ,nurse practitioner, and Dr fallens assistant during the epidurals I had, Dr fallen took his time with me and explained everything  to step by step and after the shots he took a Lil more time and shows that he really does care about the pain that his patients are in, THANK YOU TO THE WHOLE STAFF AND DR FALLEN IS AWESOME|Poor health care. PA said I was going to get a referral. Was never contacted. Dr.and staff amazing!
