column3:
Carolina Pain and Weight Loss in Mooresville, NC serves patients throughout the Carolina region with specialized care for chronic pain management and weight loss solutions. Our integrated approach recognizes the interconnected nature of bodily systems, allowing us to address multiple health concerns under one roof. With a team of dedicated healthcare professionals, we provide evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique circumstances and health goals.

At Carolina Pain and Weight Loss, we firmly believe that the body functions as an interconnected system. By treating one component of this system, we can positively impact overall health outcomes. This holistic philosophy guides our dual-focused practice, allowing us to address both pain management and weight concerns simultaneously when appropriate. Our integrated approach often leads to better results, as improvements in one area frequently benefit other aspects of health.

Personalized Treatment Plans

We understand that no two patients are alike. Each individual who walks through our doors receives thorough evaluation and a customized treatment plan designed to address their specific needs. Whether you're struggling with chronic pain, seeking weight management solutions, or dealing with both issues, our team develops strategies that align with your unique health profile, preferences, and goals.

Our Mooresville Location

Our welcoming Mooresville office provides a comfortable environment for patients seeking relief and improved health. Located at 131 Welton Way, Mooresville, NC 28117, our facility is equipped with modern technology and staffed by compassionate professionals dedicated to your care. We serve patients from across the region who are looking for effective solutions to pain and weight management challenges.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 704-360-4564. You can also visit our website at https://carolinapainandweight.com/our-offices/mooresville-office/ for additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources.

column11: Carolina Pain and Weight Loss provides care for patients who are struggling with pain or who wish to lose weight. Because we believe that the body is a system and that treating one component of the system improves the health of the body as a whole, we offer both of these services in the same facility. We recognize that every patient's condition is unique, and therefore requires personal attention and an individualized treatment plan. At Carolina Pain and Weight, patients receive the personalized, comprehensive care that they need in order to become healthier.

column40:
One of the worst experiences I have ever had. Rude staff and also a lying staff. Will not respond to voicemails and will say they do. Also impossible to get ahold of the nursing staff! Please do not go here!|I only moved here 2 1/2 months ago and I've been on paid medication for 21 years. I was very nervous and worried that due to all of the restrictions and rules relating to pain medication I would have a really hard time finding a doctor that would take on a new patient and listen to me and prescribe only what I need to function daily. I went to Carolina Pain and Weight Loss and saw Dr. Lauren Murphy and what a blessing it was. Dr. Murphy set and listened to me for a good amount of time, asking me very good questions, letting me ask questions while devising a strategy to help me. She didn't make me feel like she had to hurry me out  because she had other patients or she already had in mind what she was going to do before she even talked to me, to me these are traits of a very good doctor. Also the staff including the nurse who helps her are absolutely awesome they really are. I wish I could remember the nurses name because she as well as Dr. Murphy have made me feel at home, have really helped me and have been so very kind. I am so very grateful for Dr. Murphy and her nurse and would like to thank both and I would 100% highly recommend Dr. Murphy for your medical care. This truly is a great medical facility.|I have been coming here for about two years. The nurse practitioner was wonderful. The owner however, who is also a nurse practitioner (CarolynDavis) doesn't belong in the medical profession. She sees every patient as a revenue stream to pay for her light blue Porsche. Judgemental, absolutely no empathy for the well-being of the people her staff sees, incompetent in the NP field. This was made clear on more than one occasion. Most recently after wasting MY time for 90 mins to misdiagnose my needs and I refused to pay the $25 to correct the previous appointment. Instructed her staff to NOT render care because of it. This is NOT anyone you want to trust with any part of your health. You are simply a revenue stream. Steer clear. I feel for her staff that clearly see what I see on a daily basis.She will be getting a formal complaint with the NC Nursing Board this very afternoon.|So originally my experience here was excellent Dr. Amy really seemed to get me and care about my treatment...then even though I never failed a drug test and always complied they "dismissed me" because a pharmacist slandered me... she called her up and told her I was abusing xtampa (a medicine you can't even abuse) and that I told her "but don't tell me dr" like anyone would ever say that. Currently suing that girl and Publix pharmacy over slander and defamation of character ... later found out the pharmacist was sleeping with my now ex and when I yelled at her for flirting with him right in front of me she decided to take revenge and call  my dr. And LIED. Well Carolina pain and weight loss took her accusations seriously and dismissed me without even letting me know, hearing my side ... even though my dr admitted her claims didn't make sense since you can't abuse xtampa as it's  tamper proof... Then and here's the worst they agreed to take me back as a patient but would only prescribe me Belbuca which I couldn't afford my dr. Started treating me like a drug seeker and told me that everyone has pain and I need to deal with it. Then Even though I was still a patient they refused my multiple calls to set up my next appointment... so my doctor basically abandoned me after promising me care! and also refused to fill my medicine that she had already called in for me! , I recently found out through a better doctor, a specialist is scapuology that I have a serious injury where a fascial tear is causing all the other muscle on my shoulder and back to overcompensate so my shoulder doesn't basically fall off! My  great new doc told me my options are: surgery to oversew the tissue and my rhomboids or start micronized stem cell therapy or PRP therapy to try to regrow my scapular fascia...now i have a real diagnosis and treatment  to go along with pharmacology (which my doctor says even with these therapies I may need to continue the rest of my life :(....but at Carolina pain and weigh loss after the incident with the lying pharmacist they just started to  treated me like a drug seeker (which I am not and never have been) and told me "everyone deals with pain" that I needed to ween of the medication and just deal with pain like everyone else does... Yes you heard that right they told a chronic pain patient that my pain is the same as theirs...I can't believe they showed so little compassion and now that i have a real diagnosis (not provided by them) I am so angry since they ripped me off my meds and showed 0 compassion while I have been suffering deeply. By the way they made me pay all this money for drug tests that my insurance company covers and refused me treatment if I didn't pay and then Next Day... discharge! Horrible horrible place do not go here.|I did not have a positive experience at this center. I paid $600 dollars for the HCG diet and honestly it was a total waste of money. They basically hand you some HCG diet book (you can find more useful info on online blogs for free), the first 7 injections, and push you out the door. Every 7 days when I went for my "check ins" I felt rushed and this vibe like they really could care less about your overall success. You don't even see a doctor you see what I assume is a nurse each follow up. I saw the doctor once very briefly the day they take your full payment. But each follow up a nurse injects you, takes your weight, and sends you on your way. For the large amount of money you pay I expected a lot more from this center. My 2nd visit I had some major concerns and they sent in the clinics receptionist/sales lady to address my concerns after I asked to speak to the doctor. Totally unacceptable.They don't even call to confirm your next follow up appointments weekly. I will say I lost 15lbs in 3 weeks. However, I have gained it all back very quickly. After my last set of injections I never even got so much as a call from this clinic to follow up. You're suppose to get 3 months of "support" with that fee paid. After my 3 weeks and finishing my first "round" of injections I stopped going. I have not heard a word from them since. Not even a phone call about why I never returned. Very disappointed and I would never refer anyone to this clinic or to the HCG diet.|I went here in 2010 they treated me poorly did not explain they're active and I was out on alot of medicine much more than us expected or imagined I could've needed I've battled my addiction on and since.  I have legitimate issues but chose to remove myself from the clinics scene all together for many years now that I'm older and informed I am seeking my service pain clinic again who treated me well and with kindness and listened to me and my needs not told me my needs from day 1 and overwhelming my system with too many types of medications and way to high doses of the medications. I'm glad the DEA took action the Dr I saw here Dr fohr is no longer with them and I'm glad to hear it cuz she never once asked me what I wanted she just threw a bunch of medication at me and I hope that's not how they practice things there in general or that was just how she practice things there. I hope the corruption had been dealt with.|This is the Best  Pain Doctors office I have ever been to. I have been going to them for 4 years. Carolyn and Jennifer,  and the whole staff are very attentive and compassionate.
I have been to 6+ pain Dr.'s before I found this place. I had some REALLY BAD EXPERIENCES TOO ie; balls thrown at me, excessive intrusive ? about my marriage and then said that my marriage was going to end. Another one said I was crazy and it's all in my head. Still others only wanted money. I have all the medical records to show what was wrong. The first time I got help was with Ms.Tina Kiwajaski P.A. She helped me then she left. I was able to get a recommendation from her to here.

They're helpful and try to do whatever  they can to get your pain under control.  Mrs. Carolyn treated me so kind. I had come to her because my previous Dr. refused to listen and was syco. analysing me. I  was not seeing him for that. It started getting worse from  there. Thankfully I  got recommend to this office and now I'm so excited to help others find  an EXCELLENT LEVEL OF CARE.
They also  do medical weight  management My husband is having great success with this service. He has lost 6 inches of his waistline and all over his body.

I have read some other post that are bashing this practice. I  know that everyone has a right to tell there story. I can say they DO NOT put up with people  faking and drug seeking. They pull your records and are if you are lieing. They will  dismiss you if you're going to  multiple third-party places in order to  get more pain medication ie; E.R.  urgent care or hospital.  With so many people trying to cheat the system it affects  people who really need HELP. Carolyn,  and Jennifer,  are trying to getting you  on the Best medication for  your  pain. I have had 2 knee replacement and they HELPED ME. Jennifer  McLain worked  with my surgeon to keep me as pain free as possible. And the process takes time, " this is not Burger King," it's  medical pain management. It takes time to  find what works! It is a process that can take time. If you have financial constraints talk about and just be honest. They will do there best to help you find a cost effective way to afford your pain medication.|I love the people who work there. Very nice.  Very helpful.  My docter is Andy she is so easy to talk to. You are LOOKING for help to manage your pain to have a happy life Andy is Awesome.  Please do not come if drug  seeking. You will get treated .  People with a true need and these wonderful docter work hard to get where they are the miss use of medication has made it hatd on true pain patients. And medical care workers. They go to school for years to help patients  not to be taken ADVANTAGE, or lose licenses.  Do amy bad reviews to CAROLINA pain and weight loss Morrisville N.C.  Is not anything I seen.  My visit have neen welling,  listened, cared.  I was worried going to Dr cause of how the miss use of medication has made some Docters scared to even believe in the words a patient says. I am so happy to found ANDY SHE IS THERE TO HELP.  BUT DONT THINK SHE IS GOING TO GIVE OUT TO THE DRUG SEEKERS.  I THANK ANDY FOR BEING HERSELF WHICH IS A CARING EADY TO TALK TO PERSON.

column2: Carolina Pain Associates, PA merged with Ubylee
column3:
Carolina Pain Associates, PA serves Charlotte, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services. Since merging with Ubylee, our practice has expanded its capabilities to offer patients enhanced treatment options and specialized care for chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At our Billingsley Road location, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, and innovative therapies designed to improve quality of life and restore function. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from debilitating pain conditions including spinal disorders, neuropathy, arthritis, and post-surgical pain.

Our Facility

Located at 330 Billingsley Rd, Suite 206 in Charlotte, NC 28211, our modern medical facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The office is designed with patient comfort in mind, offering a welcoming environment where individuals can discuss their pain concerns and receive expert guidance. We're conveniently situated to serve patients throughout the Charlotte metropolitan area.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, patients can reach our office at (704) 347-3447. Our dedicated staff is available to answer questions about treatment options, insurance coverage, and appointment availability. New patients are welcome, and we strive to accommodate urgent pain management needs promptly.

Since our merger with Ubylee in 2019, we have continued to expand our treatment protocols and patient resources, maintaining our commitment to excellence in pain management while embracing innovative approaches to care.

column40:
8/16/24 It's 10:48pm N I'm sitting here in pain.  Didn't get my back shot yesterday. Missed a FULL DAYS WORK for a follow up appointment. Really! This clinic is the worst.
The appointment was supposed to be for my back shots. Then they told me my authorization wasn't in cause I said I'd wait to see if they could still get me in to get my back shot.  I'm there already.  Im in mad pain can't think it. !!!  Went straight to the VA they confirmed my auth was in since Aug 6. I just got my neck shot last week. Liers!!!
And that took forever to get my neck shot, doc request neck x-ray. That didn't put thru. My VA doc had to put in the request. Then that took n act of God for the clinic to confirm they finally  got the x-ray.
The staff is excellent to deal with.  Their process stink a**!!!!  I'm so done with them.  Finding another pain clinic.   EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED|Edit: The helpful staff were suddenly fired and/or quit. The clinic is no longer in business.

This place has saved my life. If you are truly suffering, they will listen, they will help. Laura Liston is incredibly knowledgeable and her passion for helping patients is commendable. The staff is great as well, I've been treated exceptionally at every visit, by all staff, for several years now. The lower ratings are not deserved. The clinic has rule rules, as do as any place of business, but when you are on controlled medication, these rules can save your life. Expect urine and blood screening, pill counting (to ensure that you are not selling the meds or taking too much) and these checks are for trust. Some people have problems with these rules and get very upset when the doctors enforce them. Then, they jump online to voice their unhappiness. Follow the rules, as they are safeguards for your life, and I hope you receive relief from your pain. - Samantha|I reviewed them after my first visit. Dr. Aranoff is the best, he spent so much time with me. Every month I go in and see the nurse practitioners, who spend an hour with me talking, checking vitals, they are more thorough and caring about my health than any dr. I've ever gone  to. I never have to wait.
Plus if I need to talk to someone in their office or have them send a form, they answer immediately and do everything immediately.
And no,  I don't work for them or are related,they are just that good.
Also front desk people and other nurses are friendly and wonderful|All I have to say is yikes on bikes! I've been a patient now for over 4-5 years. I strictly see dr.a and love him to pieces. The office staff however will make you spit nails. I called in after being told by Dr.A I needed to have them fix my appointment times as the ones they have randomly given me aren't conducive to my personal life. When I explained this I was told it didn't matter because it was telemedicine....it does matter, at the time they have decided to randomly move my appointments to as to when I have always scheduled my appointments is when I'm getting my kiddo from school and cannot do a telemedicine appointment. When explaining this to whomever was on the other end of the phone she copped a massive attitude and hung up on me because I told her I always had my
Appointments in the morning and that's where they needed to stay for my schedule. It wasn't April it was someone else in the office. I've told many people about the amazing care Dr.A has given me over the years and I'm thankful for his care, I am super turned off by the office staff and their attitude. Thank you Dr.A for amazing care, PLEASE for the love of all that's holy get better and well trained office staff . The ones in the office now make me cringe when  I call in to fix an issue.|Dr Aronoff couldn't be bothered to care for his patients. He often went to lunch but didn't return until several hours later. Most everything was handled by his inciopient staff. When I called to ask when my next appointment is, they hung up. Didn't know the answer or where to dumb to help
Paul Fagan was great. He listed to me an ordered my prescriptions.
Aronoff didn't pay for anything like healthcare overtime travel or anything else. He is a stingy old man|The only reason I gave two stars is that the PAs and nurses work really hard.

Problems:
The front office staff is horrible.  Their turn over is extreme there's probably 20 different receptionists over the years.  They are rarely experienced and obviously not trained well.
They will hang up on you.  Threaten to put you on the Drug abusers list.   Been called a drama queen and a lier.  Messages do NOT get passed on to the doctors in a timely fashion.
More than one patient has come into the office while I was there upset sometimes crying because  no one fixed their
Prescription.  I've had my appointments rescheduled to different days, times, and doctors without notice.

The Pain Clinic
It's uncomfortable to sit in the lobby.
Vitals, drug tests, getting chats always seems to happen almost as an afterthought.
The nurses are ok.  But they never return calls anything medical that you may have called about.  Instead, it's all relayed through the front office.   Frustrating and time-consuming to get answers.
More than once  I've been in the
Elevator and overheard the staff discussing a patient by name.

The clinic does do not have an on-call doctor or emergency line.  Which is a big deal when to write your prescription wrong and you have to wait through a weekend or holiday.

A few years ago I made it to the zero copay part of my Insurance in early spring.  They charged me a copay for months.  I was never reimbursed.  The only reason they stopped charging me is that my insurance sent them a letter.

Dr. Aronoff
He's either in a great mood or a horrible one.  When he's in a bad mood you are barely allowed to talk, he makes decisions about your care without getting your agreement.  If you complain then he will threaten to discharge you.
If he's in a good mood he may let you get one or two thoughts in.  He will not talk about more than one pain problem at a time.  I have four different issues that cause me pain. He only notates one and your records end up looking like your other pain problems aren't an issue.

Good Points about the clinic
I here for a couple of reasons love the PAs.  They are intelligent, well-informed, caring people.
The office does not routinely do injections.  I react horribly to injections and have had issues with pain doctors strong-arming me into doing one anyway so I can get something to ease the pain.
Dr. Aronoff really does know his stuff when it comes to pain.  If your case interest him he can be a great asset.|I've been a patient here since around 2019... Everything was ok until COVID. I've sent the drug tests back every time they sent one and went there, over an hour drive, multiple times. Always passed the drug screens. Well, today I called to find out when my next appointment is, they informed me that I have Missed 2 scheduled drug screens. Mind you, these are appointments that they just MADE FOR ME, without even contacting me. Anyway, I'm out of medicine and they say they can't see me for 6 more days!!! So, there goes 7 years of "sobriety". Thanks alot for the push to relapse. I can't go 6 days without my med, I have to work to support my family. I can't do that without my med. I would never recommend this place. Very unprofessional staff. After 3 years of going here, they just screwed my whole life up.|Went here for well over 2 years and had a great experience. The past 2 times I went they told me my urine was positive for morphine. The first time I figured it was something on their end, but the second time (a week later) had me very concerned. And of course they didn't believe me when I said I didn't take anything. I went straight to my pcp after the second visit and my urine did NOT have morphine. I also took an at home test which was clean. I truly believe that lady who handles the urine either wanted me gone or just didn't handle the cups correctly. I voluntarily stopped going here.

column3:
Amara Pain & Spine serves Charlotte, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by board-certified physicians dedicated to treating chronic and acute pain conditions, our clinic combines advanced interventional techniques with holistic approaches to address the root causes of discomfort. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome through customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Amara Pain & Spine, we offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine therapies. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment strategies that minimize medication dependence while maximizing functional improvement and quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment journey. Our compassionate staff ensures every patient receives attentive care in a comfortable, supportive environment. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to make our services accessible to those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Visit Our Charlotte Location

Located at 6429 Bannington Rd, Charlotte, NC 28226, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. Contact us at +1 704-503-9338 to schedule a consultation or visit www.amarapain.com to learn more about our services and approach to pain management. Same-week appointments are often available for new patients seeking relief from persistent pain conditions.

column3:
UNC Hospitals Pain Management Center in Chapel Hill, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services as part of the renowned UNC Health system. Our multidisciplinary team specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located in the Quadrangle Office Park, our facility provides a comfortable, accessible environment where patients receive compassionate care from board-certified pain specialists.

At UNC Hospitals Pain Management Center, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including neuropathic pain, spinal disorders, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Our treatment options range from medication management and minimally invasive procedures to advanced interventional techniques and integrative therapies designed to improve quality of life and functional capacity.

Expert Medical Team

Our center brings together specialists from anesthesiology, neurology, physical medicine, and rehabilitation who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans. This team approach ensures comprehensive care addressing both the physical and psychological aspects of chronic pain management.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment journey. Our goal extends beyond pain reduction to helping patients regain function and improve overall well-being through sustainable pain management strategies.

Location and Contact Information

The UNC Hospitals Pain Management Center is conveniently located at 6330 Quadrangle Dr, Suite 200, Chapel Hill, NC 27517. For appointments or inquiries, please call +1 984-974-6688. Additional information about our services can be found on our website at www.unchealth.org/care-services/locations/unc-hospitals-pain-management-center-quadrangle-office-park.

column40:
My doctor was super nice but the person that answers the phone was a complete jerk. When I addressed it nothing was done. She kept being rude, condescending and hanging up on me. She actually hung up on me 3 times. Nurses, doctor, and other staff were very kind though. Love how clean and nicely decorated it is, but one person can ruin the whole experience.|My review is specifically for the nurses. Every single nurse that I encountered during my procedure was attentive, caring and very professional. I worked primarily with Renee, Janelle, and Britney. They were all amazing.|No compassion, care or concern for their patients. With all the extensive training that providers receive they will try very little and then give up on you. It is very apparent that they do not empathize, care or even understand what it means to help a patient in chronic pain.|When someone is in pain or knowingly has a chronic illness, they should not be dismissed due to missing appointments. I have Long Covid and I'm assuming some people don't understand what we endure. There are days I can barely get out of bed and when I'm sick, it is impossible! I think each person's situation should be looked into before automatically judging them and I have numerous Doctors that understand when I have to reschedule, even with referrals. No chronically ill person should be made feel like this!!|I have been in Dr Mauck's care for years and he is GREAT! If you need help, see him, period. I have been dealing with my insurance, I won't say which company, all year. They are refusing to pay for my procedure even though they did when I had them years ago with Dr Mauck. UNC accepts this company's insurance and they DO cover other patients throughout the UNC system. When Dr Mauck found out I applied for a loan to pay for this procedure he found a colleague that he would use himself. This then may be covered by my insurance or cost me much less due to administration fees. That is a doctor that cares for his patients not his wallet.|WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!
They lied about my records from 4yrs in pain management from Texas. The doctor here told me I had repeatedly asked for my Rx to be called in early to the TX clinic. Funny thing, though, one of the rules of the TX clinic was that you had to have an appointment every 30 days to get a new paper prescription. When I brought this fact up, the Dr said she had proof, but would not let me see said proof. So, I ended up in the hospital extremely sick shortly after moving here.|If I could give 0 stars I would do that...this place is a joke I deal with chronic back pain I also have degenerative disc disease, and from what 10 other doctors at UNC told me I have the back of a 60 year old man (I'm only 29) and will be in a wheelchair by the time I'm 40, they sent me in for another MRI, and the PA  looked over an image of my spine (which after seeing 4 different images of my spine I knew it wasn't mine) she proceeded to tell me that there is nothing work with my back and that it must have magically healed even though I was barely able to walk.she gave me muscle relaxers and I told her they were not working then basically called me a junky in front of my daughter and wife even though I told her I didn't want narcotics and wanted them to explore different treatments even though they never once discussed any type of treatments to begin with. This place is very bad especially for having to be on a waiting list for 12 months minimum before being seen it is not worth your time and they will not help you nor discuss any treatment options with you.|I am a 14 year Army veteran, who was looking for a second opinion on the way my pain management, and procedures had been going. I currently have a pain management who has not used current CDC guidelines regarding chronic pain management. So when my wife sent UNC my records, MRI's, and previous pain management findings they suggested that we come and check them out they have different treatments to try. So we get to the initial visit after 40 minutes of paperwork I see a PA there that basically tells me that they don't know what they can do for me. Then she brings the DR in here is where things got strange. The DR wouldn't tell us what method or how they would even go about testing and treating me ( refused to say anything) to the point of her words " I am not going to tell you". My wife and I have been to a couple of these places so far so we looked at each other and had our answer right after she said that. But the icing on the cake was the fact that I was not a patient yet but before I left that day the wanted a urine sample from me. I guess the fact that I have long hair, a moustache, and beard threw all that " hey we really think we can help " to the reality of what the actual visit was. I would not recommend this place to anybody, the administration staff was great and friendly but the DR I saw was a clown shoe and incompetent.

column3:
Revival Pain Management serves Elkin, North Carolina and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management and addiction treatment services. For over two decades, our dedicated team of specialists has been helping patients reclaim their lives from chronic pain and substance dependency. Located conveniently in the heart of Elkin, we combine evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address the complex needs of individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

At Revival Pain Management, we understand that pain is a deeply personal experience that affects every aspect of life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes customized treatment plans that may incorporate medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health strategies. We specialize in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and post-surgical pain.

Addiction Treatment Expertise

Our practice has developed significant expertise in addressing substance dependency issues, particularly those related to pain medication. We offer comprehensive addiction treatment programs that focus on recovery while still effectively managing underlying pain conditions. Our physicians are certified in addiction medicine and work closely with patients to develop sustainable, long-term solutions.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Revival Pain Management apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just their symptoms. We take time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop individualized treatment strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle. Our team maintains ongoing communication with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 1925 N Bridge St #101, Elkin, NC 28621, our modern facility is designed with patient comfort in mind. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (336) 835-5330 or visit our website at www.revivalpainmanagement.com.

column40:
Absolutely wonderful staff and physicians!!!  They care for the patients and have different avenues of pain relief. I myself had radial ablation to my lower back and within a couple weeks I was completely pain free in my lower back. I actually drive a hour and a half to get there because of the quality of care.|The only reason I come here is to get my medications that require a monthly refill by law, otherwise I would never consider this provider. I've been coming here for many years and the waits are unbelievably long, from 1 to over 2 hours just to get a script filled. After sitting in those terrible chairs, I'm horribly sore for several days after. At least provide seating that doesn't make the pain WORSE than when I came in. To his credit, Dr. November apologies for the long waits, but I've been hearing that for years with no improvement.|I feel like i was discriminated against I failed one drug test for subutex and wasn't given the option for probation and i know several people who go there and failed the drug test for the same thing and only got probation. They refuse to help me in any other way and cancelled my future appointment.|I have been going to Revival and seeing Dr November 8 for at least a few years now and I would have given it five stars if it wasn't for the wait time sometimes but Dr November does see patients and do the injections both his self so he's a very busy doctor and I have no doubt does his best for every patient he has so sometimes it's a little longer wait but other than that I have had no problem stuck on November he has tried to his best to help me with the pain I have in my hands and feet and has been very accommodating to my allergies and so forth I couldn't recon them recommend them enough now. I went there about 7 or 8 years ago maybe and it was a totally different story back then you waited for three or four hours just to be seen and then a lot of times they only wanted to offer you injections and yes if you have your chance to see Dr November or the female doctor there she's not a doctor excuse me the female nurse practitioner see Dr Novembre she seems to me like she just wants to kind of get you in and out and when she does talk to you she likes to change your medicine from what the actual doctor has you on at least I've heard she's never tried to change me so I only see Dr Novembre unless absolutely necessary|Sometimes they're a little slow and they are a little behind there but the doctor that does all the injections is well worth the wait!! Just remember that he's giving someone else the same attention that he's going to give you when he's running behind!!
Thank you, Revival Pain Clinic for restoring my quality of life!!
I'm so grateful to you all!|I used to think that this was a good place to go. I felt like they cared. Dr. Novembre was always really good to me. But, the last few times I had to see that woman and she took it upon herself to change my prescriptions to lower strength and decreased number and differentdirections. Now my pain is a lot worse and I will be out of medicine before my appointment.|Had a referral from my primary care doctor since December 26th, called a week after and was told they were moving locations they would call me soon.  Called back on Jan 29th to be told "You were at another pain clinic (In Winston, my PC doctor had been handling my pain medication until I got somewhere closer) and your medicine was stolen once, we don't accept patients like you. "   They should be ashamed to call themselves Christians.|Had an appointment with them just to be told by the Doctor that he couldn't touch me. Treatment hadn't been approved yet but they still brought me in. Was going to do it a second time until I questioned them. A little over $500.00 owed to be payed. The only thing done was an urine drug test. So before first appointment make sure everything is approved.

Specialized Treatment Approaches

column40:
PATIENT BEWARE! Awful staff and when I finally fired Dr. Scott due to negligence he then put so many incorrect things in my record! Like addiction when I have never had addiction in my life! He is currently being investigated. Rightfully so.  Skip this place, I'm sure all the "perfect" comments are not genuine patients OR. the soon will see his true colors and STOP REMOVING MY REVIEWS IF YOU HAVE NOTHING TO HIDE. Worse doctor.|Dr Scott and his staff are very patient, understanding, and professional. Dr Scott is very knowledgeable and always answers all of our questions thoroughly and shares pertinent information with us.|Everyone here was extremely nice. Dr. Scott was very thorough and is going to work on having me pain free as much as we can.  I was very happy with my first visit. It did take 2.5 hrs but he spends time with you and not herding patients in and out with a blink of an eye. I would recommend them.|Dr Scott has treated me for several years and is a wonderful dr.  He is knowledgeable and is able to treat patients in the office.  This helps keep the cost down of overall medical expenses.  Dr Scott is a great doctor and helps keep pain control lower and that is important for me and my medical needs.|Dr. Scott and his FNP, Krissy, are absolutely wonderful! They are very caring and compassionate about anyone in pain and will do all possible to make you comfortable. Their staff are the same. Usually it's about a twenty minute wait, but if they've had to do unexpected procedures, yes, you could wait a while. They don't over-prescribe medicine either. Dr Scott isn't very talkative, but Krissy and the rest of the staff make up for it. I've never once regretted going there for help. Most procedures can be done there in the office, which is wonderful considering if you're in pain, you don't feel like running around to different places.|I had a great experience with Dr. Scott and his staff. My wait times were not bad at all, but I also understand that it's a doctor's office and it could be different in the future. Dr. Scott is the first doctor to help my pain in the 10 years I've had it. Glad I found this office!|I have been dealing with Cronic Pain for 29 years, after fracturing a disc in my neck (1972) in car accident and dislocating 3 vertabrae in my neck (1990) during a swimming accident,  also 3 neck surgeries, one of them Spinal Cord Surgery.
Dr Scott has been taking care of me since 2006. The treatments and medication he has offered have been very helpful. It hasn't taken all the pain away, but it has certainly helped to reduce my pain about 50%. He and his staff have always shown high respect to me and willing to see me and make changes quickly. I have been very pleased with my experience there.
When I first went to Dr Scott I was maxed out on Percaset ,and was using ice 3 to 4 times per day just to be able to function at maybe 25%..  The treatments and medication he prescribed got me completely off Percacet and now  i am using ice once per day to reduce the swelling of nerves  in my spinal canal, able to function at about 60%.
Needless to say, I am happy I was referred  to this clinic. i would highly recommend Dr Scott and his staff to anyone with terrible pain.
He is not the kind of doctor that gives you a warm fuzzy feeling, but I do believe he is very serious about treating his patients and getting the treatment right.
Thank you for helping me!|Dr Scott is very thorough. He can be a bit brash but I appreciate his forthcomingness .The Nurse Practioner is awesome. I appreciate they respect my concern of not using opiods and work hard to find other solutions to manage my chronic back pain.

column48: What is palliative care
column49:
It's  specialized treatment used in all stages of life, so people can live better despite their pain. It's goal is providing relief of both their pain & the huge stress that comes with it. 
It's not end of life care, that is usually referred to as hospice care. 8-)

column3:
Wake Spine & Pain Specialists serves Greenville, North Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to enhance mobility and improve quality of life. Our dedicated team of pain specialists understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we've developed a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain management. Located conveniently at 2573 Stantonsburg Rd Suite A in Greenville, our clinic provides accessible care to residents throughout eastern North Carolina.

At Wake Spine & Pain, we recognize that effective pain treatment rarely comes from a single therapy. Our patient-centric treatment plans integrate the most advanced interventional procedures with complementary modalities to create holistic healing experiences. Each treatment plan is customized following thorough evaluation and precise diagnosis of the underlying causes of pain.

Our Specialized Services Include:

• Advanced interventional pain procedures

• Pain psychology services

• Acupuncture therapy

• Physical therapy programs

• Therapeutic massage

• Non-surgical pain management solutions

Patient-Focused Care

Our mission extends beyond simply managing symptoms—we aim to help patients reclaim their lives from debilitating pain. Many of our patients have successfully avoided risky surgical interventions through our comprehensive treatment approaches. The Wake Spine & Pain difference lies in our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the pain condition.

If you're struggling with chronic pain, contact our Greenville clinic at (919) 787-7246 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services and approach by visiting our website at https://wakespine.com/locations/greenville-pain-clinic/.
column11: At Wake Spine & Pain, it is our mission to relieve pain so that our patients can attain more mobility and better quality of life. Pain is rarely treated effectively by any single mode of treatment alone. For that reason, we carefully evaluate, diagnose and design a patient-centric treatment plan that includes the most advanced interventional pain procedures with complementary modalities like pain psychology, acupuncture, physical therapy and massage therapy. Our unique, well-rounded approach gives patients the best results, often avoiding risky surgeries.

column3:
ECU Health Pain Management - Greenville serves the Greenville, North Carolina area with comprehensive pain management solutions that extend far beyond medication. Our integrated approach combines advanced medical interventions with supportive therapies to address chronic pain at its source. We understand that each patient's experience with pain is unique, which is why our specialists develop personalized treatment plans tailored to individual needs and circumstances.

At ECU Health, we offer a diverse range of treatment options designed to provide effective relief for various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach includes nerve blocks, spinal injections, surgical procedures, physical therapy, and psychological services such as biofeedback. The goal is always to determine the right combination of treatments for your specific situation, focusing on both immediate relief and long-term management strategies.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating numerous pain-related conditions, including:

  • Arthritis

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Spinal Injuries

  • Cancer Pain

  • Nerve damage

  • Orthopedic conditions

  • Trauma

  • Trigeminal neuralgia

Treatment Options

Our facility offers innovative and evidence-based treatments including:

  • Aquatic Physical Therapy

  • Baclofen Pump

  • Spinal treatments

  • TENS Application

Community Support and Resources

Living with chronic pain can be isolating, which is why we connect patients with valuable community resources and support groups. These connections provide additional emotional support and practical guidance for managing daily challenges associated with chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information

Location: 2010 W Arlington Blvd, Greenville, NC 27834, United States

Phone: +1 252-847-0601

Website: https://locations.ecuhealth.org/Details/92

I gone here for years. They do not care about your pain. They only care about liability and coving their behind.  They will change your med and leave you in excruciating pain. They will not make a change before your next about no matter how bad you hurt or if the medication that they changed you to is ineffective. They are nasty. The nurses have hung up on me. Avoid this clinic. I had a family emergency they refused to help me and left me without meds for a month and I went through withdrawal. I have been to other pain clinics and was treated much better.|I went 3-4 time, a different story every time i went , another shot, I felt like a pin cushion, they did nothing to help me, after my last injection, (shot) they said don't come back, go see a neurosurgeon, which they didn't recommend are suggested a neurosurgeon, but a neurosurgeon in Greenville recommend them ,so I was on my own, I personally wouldn't recommend this firm are medical doctors. So I am see a neurosurgeon in Chesapeake Va. So far test show nerves damage. This all started with a pain management doctor in Ahoskie, who screwed my back up, his name is Dr.Chafin stay away from him and probably this pain clinic.|They are literally the worst. You'll see a different NP every visit, no continuity of care whatsoever.  They'll let you run out of medicine and not call anything in (even when you were just there the day prior).  Don't bother if you're in any REAL pain because they'll just give you Bup and act like it's supposed to help.|I have been going there for two years. They have my previous records from FL. Rather than giving what I was on in FL. They have giving everything else. Saying it's a regiment with my insurance. Same insurance from FL. They want you to be a Ginny pig. I'm so over this place. I need to find a new place. I'm calling my insurance and see if I drive 14 hrs will they pay the bill. This ridiculous. I was given injections in FL and was always  put to sleep. Minor anesthesia for the Dr was great. Here because they don't prescribe that medication. But everything that has been given is a waste of pharmacy go pay. I've paid more money for stuff that doesn't work. Everything that have prescribed I interferes with my migraines or gives more problems. I'm really upset I'm beginning to think it's a racial thing. Everyone is not drug seekers.|I met with Dr. Nunez from this facility. She was very informative and she was nice as hell to me. My appointment was the last one for the day , but instead of rushing the appointment she took her time with me. She asked me how I would like to go about handling my pain and she made suggestions. My boyfriend went with me and he also said she was a nice doctor. I'm glad to have met her and I am looking forward to future visits.

Update 
So my last appointment with her was awful. She wouldn't see me because I got new insurance and she said they weren't gonna pay her for my visit so she was not gonna see me. Before I had no health insurance and I was paying her. I couldn't afford it anymore so she just left me with no meds or appt and while my daughter was there. How unprofessional.|I've been going to this pain clinic sense 2015 and I've never had any bad experiences. The staff is excellent the environment and the atmosphere has been very professional but kind everybody is shown the best level of care. From my first visit until the last appointment nothing but courtesy. I'm an patient that has a appointment every 3 months. Each visit has been the same. The physician Dr. Nunez is a beautiful, compassionate individual. She has a very soothing spirit and always words of comfort and grace.|We moved my 88 yr old mom here to Brookdale Assisted Living a few months ago and needed to continue her care here. We mainly chose this pain clinic as it was right across the street from Brookdale. It ended up being a great choice! This facility and its staff have been super to work with from the get go. Transferring moms current pain management regime from her Raleigh Dr to here was seamless. All of the staff involved in moms visits have been engaged and thoughtful and professional and personable in assessing and addressing her chronic pain management needs. They have made her feel comfortable and understood as her pain needs change.
We would recommend this clinic highly!|Im truly disappointed I'm my doctor's here. Number 1 they have repeatedly given me meds I'm allergic to. I have to take benadryl with it. So then I'm getting sick a lot. Num 2 I had a death on my family had to leave town for a while and they have refused to send 7-10 days of my meds on so I can handle this emergency. So now I'm 3 States away with no meds suffering. I hope I can find a different doctor that listen to their patient. Thanks y'all.

column3:
Solas Health has been serving Pinehurst, North Carolina residents for over 20 years, establishing itself as a premier addiction treatment and pain management center in Moore County. Our comprehensive approach combines evidence-based medication-assisted treatment (MAT) with psychotherapy to achieve exceptional recovery rates for those struggling with addictions to opiates, methamphetamine, alcohol, and other substances. Conveniently located at the corner of Murdocksville Road and Olmsted Boulevard, our facility provides accessible care to the local community while extending telehealth services throughout North Carolina.

Our addiction recovery program has consistently delivered superior results through our specialized use of Suboxone and other medication-assisted treatments. We understand that addiction is a complex disease requiring individualized care, which is why our medical professionals develop personalized treatment plans for each patient. The Pinehurst rehab center combines medical intervention with behavioral therapy to address both the physical and psychological aspects of addiction.

Comprehensive Pain Management

At Solas Health, we offer specialized pain management services for a wide range of conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Neuropathy

- Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

- Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy (RSD)

- Arthritis

- Various chronic pain conditions

Our doctors take a patient-centered approach, working closely with each individual to develop effective pain management strategies that minimize medication dependence while maximizing quality of life. We're committed to helping you return to the activities you love with reduced pain and improved function.

Integrated Mental Health Services

Understanding the connection between physical and mental health, our on-staff counselors provide expert psychotherapy addressing underlying issues such as:

- Anxiety disorders

- Depression

- Trauma and PTSD

- Substance use disorders

- Chronic pain-related psychological challenges

Our integrated approach ensures that patients receive comprehensive care addressing all aspects of their health and wellbeing.

Contact Solas Health

Whether you're seeking addiction treatment, pain management, or mental health services, our team is ready to help. Visit our website at https://solas.health/ or call us at +1 910-295-7246 to schedule an appointment. Our Pinehurst facility is located at 285 Olmsted Blvd #1, Pinehurst, NC 28374. For those unable to visit in person, we offer telehealth services throughout North Carolina.
column11:
For 20+ years we've helped Pinehurst residents addicted to drugs like opiates, meth, and alcohol and have been getting the best recovery rates with medication assisted (MAT), using Suboxone.

Our Pinehurst rehab (in Moore County) is on Olmsted Blvd, on the corner of Murdocksville Rd and Olmsted Blvd road.

Pain Management: We offer pain management, for back/neck pain, neuropathy, CPRS, RSD, arthritis, and more. Our doctors work with you as an individual to help you manage & reduce pain. We'll help you return to doing all the activities that you love.

Psychotherapy: we have counselors on staff who are able to address the underlying issues such as anxiety, depression, and trauma.

We service the entire state of North Carolina via telehealth.

If I could I would leave this clinic no stars! I have severe medical conditions, am in constant pain and see multiple doctors a week. I have never seen such incompetence. I had an epidural scheduled for months! I drove  an hour to this appointment only to be turned away because they got the wrong prior authorization. Dr. Kim stood in front of me with no emotion uncaring and said it's the insurance's fault. I use to work at a doctors office and when I did prior authorizations I always checked to make sure it matched so that way I didn't waste the patients time. Then he proceeded to say it was my doctors fault for writing the notes wrong! So what is it? Did my doctor mess up, is someone just not doing their job, or does Dr. Kim have so many patients he doesn't care about the individual. Needless to say I will not be back to Pine Hurst! I can't get my time and money back so thanks a lot! And I'm still in extreme pain!|Every appointment I feel like I am treated with Dignity and Respect. My Dr. Bradley Hicks is amazing. Carolina Spine & Pain serves patients throughout Mooresville, North Carolina and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating various spinal conditions and chronic pain disorders using evidence-based approaches. With a team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists, we're committed to improving our patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced medical techniques with physical therapy and lifestyle modifications to provide holistic care for conditions such as:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radiculopathy

  • Herniated discs and spinal stenosis

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Post-surgical pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment strategies that align with your goals and lifestyle. Our state-of-the-art facility is designed to provide a comfortable, supportive environment where patients can receive the highest standard of care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at:

Phone: +1 704-360-2260

Address: 170 Medical Park Rd, Suite 310, Mooresville, NC 28117, United States

We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to those who need it most. Take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain by contacting Carolina Spine & Pain today.

column2: Southeast Pain and Spine Care - Hickory
column3:
Southeast Pain and Spine Care - Hickory serves patients throughout Hickory, North Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded in 1997 by Southeast Anesthesiology Consultants, our practice has evolved into one of the region's premier destinations for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. With a commitment to patient-centered care and innovative treatment approaches, our Hickory location continues the tradition of excellence that has defined our network of pain management clinics.

At Southeast Pain and Spine Care, we take pride in our highly qualified medical team. All of our pain management physicians are double board certified or board eligible in pain management and have completed specialized fellowship training in pain management techniques. This advanced training ensures that our patients receive the most current, evidence-based treatments available for their pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our Hickory facility offers a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management services, tailored to address various chronic pain conditions. We utilize a multidisciplinary approach that may include:

  • Interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Advanced diagnostic techniques

  • Minimally invasive treatments

Part of a Larger Network

The Hickory location is part of Southeast Pain and Spine Care's extensive network of 14 pain management clinics that collectively serve more than 85,000 patients annually throughout the region. While maintaining an independently owned facility in Virginia, we work closely with our hospital partners, including Atrium Health and Piedmont Medical Center, to provide exceptional care at our North Carolina and South Carolina locations.

Continuity of Care

We understand the importance of consistent, ongoing care for chronic pain conditions. Our practice is committed to providing continuity of care for all patients. For more information about our continued care programs, please visit our website at https://www.sepainandspinecare.com/continue-care/.

Contact Information

Address: 2134 14th Ave Cir NW, Hickory, NC 28601, United States

Phone: +1 828-373-1543

Website: www.sepainandspinecare.com
column11: Southeast Anesthesiology Consultants founded Southeast Pain and Spine Care in 1997. Southeast Pain and Spine Care has grown rapidly, currently operating a network of 14 pain management clinics serving more than 85,000 patients each year throughout the region. Our pain management doctors are all double board certified or board eligible in pain management and are also fellowship trained in pain management.Southeast Pain and Spine Care operates an independently owned facility in Virginia but is also committed to working with our hospital partners, Atrium Health and Piedmont Medical Center in providing excellent care and services at the North Carolina and South Carolina locations.

column40:
I came to the pain clinic while experiencing low back and bilateral leg pain for months. They were useless. They said they would call after urine testing results and they did not. This happened twice and after I called and left 3 messages both times. I would not recommend this place for any kind of help.|Dr. Evans was terrible today. He said I am too young for pain medication and that I should get a spinal fusion. Which I was told not to get because I am too young. Also I have no one to watch my son while I would be recovering from surgery but he ignored that. I am in a lot of pain from him poking and prodding my back today during the exam I certainly don't trust him for the injection he recommended. I told him I had already tried the injections and they don't work. He wanted me to do more X-rays and injections. What a waste of my time and now my back hurts more. He is a BAD LISTENER or just didn't understand I don't have any childcare to help me with these injection appointments or post op recovery. He didn't even ask me what happened to my back until right before he left. He seemed angry for me even asking for pain medication and just had an argumentative attitude with me from the moment I suggested it until the end of our appointment. I told him NSAIDS don't work he ignored me and called them into the pharmacy anyway. Don't waste your time with him.|I had my first visit today and I was pleasantly surprised of how great their sincere care was. After reading so many bad reviews on here, I honestly wasn't given much hope, but they are great! Deborah Johnson was amazing and treated me with great respect in understanding my pain. They are very strict in their pain management which they should be and have to be.  I don't know what future visits will be like but I do know they have my best interest at heart and if there happens to be any problems it will be because of my own failure in following what is required of me. Disregard all the bad reviews you read, these are great doctors and I highly recommend them!

My second visit was great as well! Amy Patel was so pleasant and caring in all my concerns. When I look back at bad reviews, I realize it's a patient problem, not a doctor problem... I'll leave it at that and not say more.  I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for true sincere help  with pain and problems.|I used to see Dr Evans and now see Dr Gregory...Dr Gregory is the best doctor I have ever had.  He listens to all my concerns and actually remembers what he says from one appointment to the next.  He is very professional and also compassionate. I give him 5 stars and highly recommend!|I agree with the reviews posted before me.  I had been to Southeast previously when Dr. Peacock was there and he was wonderful, but would not suggest anyone go there now.  I had gotten all of my records per their request and had them review them before my appointment, to ensure that they would take my case (which they said they would).  The only thing they did was talk down to me about what type of medicine I was on and that they didn't agree with it.  I am not a Doctor, so obviously those choices were not mine to make.  I am a professional, so I expect to be treated like such from "professionals".  I had all of my x-rays done previously twice, but they wanted me to pay for those again before doing ANYTHING at all.  I was completely embarrassed when I left and would never go back.  The girls at the front and the medical assistants in the back were very nice, but Amy and the Dr. were a nightmare.|Hey this is a wonderful place to go for help. Dr.Peacock is very good , I've been going for 6 months now and he is starting to get my pain under control. Like with anything it takes time. And from the front to the back of the staff you ladies do your job well. Thank you for your kindness you show my as well as my daughter and grandbaby Pineapples. Big shout out to Kim front desk. Rachael and Michelle Nurses in back always so kind to me. Keep up the good work!!!|I have been a patient here for a few years. I saw Dr. Peacock, when he left I saw Dr. Evans, Amy, Deborah, and now I see Dr. Gingerich. They all are professional, caring people. I highly recommend them. The ladies at the front desk at the hickory location are super sweet and efficient.
I have recieved injections at another practice, the injection site was not prepped properly and became infected. I have NEVER had any issues with the injections recieved from Southeast. A great healthcare team for chronic pain.|As a former nurse, I have always had high expectations of quality in care of myself and family. With that said,I'm surprised at some of the comments listed. Dr Evan's is VERY personable, VERY Respectful, LISTENS to ALL my concerns, changes etc regarding my back pain and care. Yes at one as with ALL places you go to these days there are 2 billing areas. One for the dr and one for the clinic as it's part of a chain of offices just like other places. This is normal.Since I have been there they have worked hard on the kinks in the system to try to make things easier on their clients. Insurance changes all the time folks. It's not easy to keep up with.and when you see hundreds or thousands of clients at different facilities....give them a medal for keeping up. As to injections....Dr Evan's is the best. Yes when I wait till it's more inflamed to get one due to my personal finances (not dr scheduling)...the more inflamed the more discomfort you can have for these moments it takes to receive a shot. But the staff is with  you in such a caring and respectful manner all the way. Sometimes I see Amy, (PA) and she does a good job. I think when people are sick or in pain and seeing a specialist most just prefer a dr title. Any time I've ever needed to ask Dr Evan's a question, Amy is sure to make sure He gets to answer it or that I get scheduled to see him on the next visit. I also love that there isn't a long wait time to be seen. They run a nice schedule and it's extremely rare that you have to wait long to be seen. The law and insurance has made some really strict rules regarding prescription pain meds and that has to get passed down to facilities having to keep tight records and rules. Each year you have to sign a new contract. And you have to go through the yearly and occasional random drug screens because of the rules that govern prescribing narcotics. They do a great job here on that too. And yall if you have a problem in following the rules ..don't complain about the facility...they are doing their legal duty. Complain to the thousands of drug users and dealers who caused the insurance companies and law to enforce such measures to make it difficult on those who need it most. That's the frustration facilities go through daily that we don't see. And I think SE Pain Care does a superb job of explaining this and following rules isn't a hard thing to do if you truly need your meds.  K. I'll get off my soap box LOL. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRACTICE and Dr Evans!! Have a blessed day!

column3:
Carolina Pain Center in Clinton, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout Sampson County and surrounding areas. Established as a specialized division of Sampson Regional Medical Center, our center combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified specialists develop personalized treatment plans utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management approaches to improve patients' quality of life.

At Carolina Pain Center, we treat a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates cutting-edge diagnostic tools to identify the root causes of pain, allowing for targeted treatment strategies that focus on long-term relief rather than just symptom management.

Our Treatment Approaches

We offer various interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. These minimally invasive techniques are performed in our state-of-the-art facility equipped with advanced imaging technology for precision and safety. For patients requiring medication management, our physicians provide careful oversight with regular monitoring to ensure optimal outcomes while minimizing risks.

Patient-Centered Care

Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, our team works closely with each patient to develop comprehensive care plans that address physical symptoms while considering emotional and psychological well-being. We coordinate with primary care providers and other specialists to ensure continuity of care and holistic treatment approaches.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 910-596-4288. Carolina Pain Center is conveniently located at 518 Beaman St, Clinton, NC 28328. For additional information about our services and affiliation with Sampson Regional Medical Center, visit our website at http://www.sampsonrmc.org/CPC.

At Integrative Pain & Spine Institute, we believe in addressing pain before it progresses to require surgical intervention. Our proactive approach helps patients manage various chronic pain conditions including:

column40:
Dr. Manvar and his staff are highly competent professionals and are friendly,  courteous and respectful. As a primary care physician I recognize Dr. Manvar's knowledge and expertise and appreciate the pain relief I got from his treatments of my significant back pain.  I recommend Dr. Manvar highly.  He uses healthy and effective modalities for pain relief rather than prescribing potentially habit forming pain pills. If you're suffering from chronic musculoskeletal pain syndromes he's your man!|Dr Manvar and staff have been extremely professional from the staff as you enter their office, including the nursing staff and every person I have contact with.
Dr Manvar has been very caring and helpful with my issues.  I highly recommend Dr Manvar for your medical issues!|Dr. Manvar and the staff at Integrative Pain & Spine Institute were all very kind and helpful. I greatly appreciate the way Dr. Manvar spoke to me -- he is authentic, a great listener and was able to ease my "new doctor anxiety". He also said something that most doctors fail to understand: "Only you know how it feels to have your body." THANK YOU!|I was looking forward to this disappointment, hoping that I would get some relief and assistance with some chronic pain issues. I was referred here by the doctor standing in for my PCP and I have been disappointed in how they handle new patients.

The automated system called me several times sent me multiple text messages about the appointment, but I never actually received the email that I was told I was gonna receive with the new patient paperwork. I figured that was an oversight so I just decided to show up for the appointment prepared with my insurance information, photo ID and ready to fill out paperwork if necessary on site.

At arrival, I was informed that that there would be a $60 co-pay this was never discussed at any point in time during the numerous outreaches by the office to confirm my appointment.  Being someone that has dual health insurance, the co-pay is not something that is even supposed to be required at time of service because billing must be done to both insurances before you can determine if anything is owed. I am saying this as a Medical healthcare insurance specialist. I've been doing this professionally for over 10 years.

After explaining the process to the woman in the front office, she asked someone else who also said the co-pay was due, then also went to someone else in the back, and the person in the back did not even come to the front to speak to me they condescendingly said well this is not a Primary Care office therefore billing is done differently. Having worked for a primary care specialist and surgery centers I do know that this is incorrect. I do know that if you have a state based insurance like Medicaid and nothing is supposed to be paid until both insurances are paid. I did bring that up and I was informed that the reason why they collect co-pays from the primary insurance is Medicaid has not been paying their secondary claims.

I informed them that Medicaid gives a whole year for you to submit your claims and then if they are denying claims, you do then have a whole year to find out why the claims were denied and get them to re-Submitted. I also explained that normally if Medicaid is not paying it's because there is some documentation missing or some coding has gone wrong that the billing department has not done their research.

I'm just really frustrated with this as a new patient and has someone that is seeking medical guidance for ongoing chronic issue to show up to an appointment when I could've been working today just to find out that there was funds due that should not have been due to someone else, not knowing how to properly do their job.

Also, for those that no insurance taking the co-pay and then billing Medicaid if you do not refund the co-pay back to those patients once Medicaid pays, you are committing fraud.

This has been a horrible experience and I really hope they do better|Dr. Manvar and his team are fantastic. I have been under his care for over a year because of pain stemming from back surgery 15 years ago. They have maintained a high level of service, communication,  and professionalism. They fought with my insurance company through three appeals to get approval for a spinal cord stimulator. I had the trial a few weeks ago and it was very effective in reducing my low back pain. I would recommend Integrative Pain and Spine to anyone suffering with chronic pain.|Dr. Manvar is great. He listens to you and makes suggestions. I've had the implant and it's the best thing I've had done.
I suggest him to everyone!|This is what you call family. Been seeing Dr. Manvaar for over a year and he is amazing. Staff is amazing always courteous and office is always clean. Leaving with a smile even after an injection, will always be your end result!|Dr. Ankur Manvar and staff are very professional and you will feel very comfortable with them. I highly recommend Dr. Ankur Manvar, he is very patient with his clients. He's very kind and will answer all of your questions and concerns that you may have.
