column38: Cyndy Robinson|Teresa Case|Mary White|Nadia Hunter|Christine Szilagyi|Jamee Lynne|Kerry Williamson|Tina Smith
column40:
I was dismissed as a patient here, because my phones voice mail was full and they couldn't reach me to call me in for a pill count. I have been going here for several years and I've only had one issue and that was because I took a gummy that I thought was permitted and it tested positive.  I have never had a bad urine before or since. I don't understand.
I was out of state with my fiance, who was in a terrible car accident and unfortunately I forgot my phone at home. I checked it as soon as I got home and called them the next day. I was told then that I was dismissed and they wouldn't allow me to talk to Ashley, to tell her what happened. I still have not been able to talk to Ashley to explain, so I'm stuck with no pain Dr and they won't even refer me to another pain clinic. I was up to 6 Perc 10s a day and when they dismissed me, they even called my drug store and canceled the prescription that I was gonna fill that day. So, I don't even have enough medication to get me through, till I find another Dr.  If anybody has any ideas on a pain Dr that won't screw over their patients, please let me know.|I have been seeing Dr. Ashley for about 2 months. She is very caring and has always listened the what I had to say. I had been to about 4 pain clinic's and was not able to get the help I needed. I don't understand why some people on here post that everyone in the office is rude. I have not had any problems whatsoever with anyone. They do have their rule, and if you follow them everything seems great. With all the rules that the US Government has on any doctor that writes pain medication for someone, I can understand why the rules are there. They don't want to loose their job, not to mention their license.|DO NOT GO TO THIS OFFICE , I was discharged because I could not get to office within a time limit they set for a random urine test , I begged them to allow me to come in later that same day but the nurse was  VERY RUDE and told me if I wasn't there in time I would be discharged , at this time I had been a patient there for 5 years and had NEVER HAD ANY ISSUES WITH MY MONTHLY URINE TESTING.... And this has followed me for years , makes me look like a drug seeker AND THAT I AM NOT , I HAVE LEGITIMATE PAIN !!!!!!!|As a new patient, I would have never expected, the rudeness, nastiest, and unprofessionalism of the staff/receptionist ,they care nothing about the patients or their needs, all of them need to be retrained or fired! There is no scale to rate them only zeros apply.In turn this hurts the business..My doctor was exceptional,however the receptionist/staff determines if you're ever  get an appointment to even see them!! They are so rude ,nasty and so unprofessional!!|Dr. Brockman is an excellent doctor. I would highly recommend him. Since he sold his business to Carolina Comprehensive Pain Management it has been nothing but a nightmare. My 76 year old mother had to sit in the waiting room up to 5 hrs. She now has to see the doctor every month instead of every 3 months (not a big deal). The front desk staff is rude. They performed $1,400 worth of unnecessary tests that her insurance ultimately denied. They advised that if she didn't do the tests than she wasn't going to get her medicine. Also, advised that she is leaving for NJ for the holidays on Dec 16th and they still made her appointment on the 16th advising that we need to change our flight arrangements. Are you kidding me? No matter how much we love Dr. Brockman, we have to change doctors. What a shame that such a profitable, pleasant business has turned to this.|I agree with another commenter.  I have been seeing Dr Brockman for years and while there are times his bedside manner left more to be desired, he was always advocating for my care. He never once made me feel that I was crazy or a drug seeker. He always affirmed my pain, listened to my experiences,  and allowed me ro be an active participant in my care.  The nurses were always the sweetest too. However,
since he sold his business to Carolina Comprehensive Pain Management it has been nothing but a nightmare. The whole front office staff was replaced and I believe they must ride in on broomsticks as they are incredinly rude and condescending. I have been an established patient there for years but treat me like I know nothing (especially since I am younger). The paperwork is a nightmare. You are forced tp wait much longer to be seen (& heaven forbid you need to pee before the nurse calls). You are forced to come every month instead of every three months which costs significantly more time and money. It is sad and incredibly frustrating as a long-term patient.|In defence of Dr. Steven Brockman I would like to give my honest review from over 2 years of being under his care/ watchful eye of the government.. If you can follow all of the rules that our caring government has forced upon the pain management doctors of our day, then you will not have any complaints about Dr. Brockman or his service. Recently due to a change in his business there are a lot more patients at the Shelby Clinic. With the patient flow increase this has lead to several complaints that I have found online. Most are from clients that have had to wait too long in the waiting room. My advice to anyone that feels like there may have been a mistake, or that they have been lost in the shuffle is to walk up to the receptionist and speak up for yourself instead of sitting there getting upset.|Dr. Brockman is strict. But as you follow the rules you'll have no trouble. I've been going to him since 2002! And I think he's the most professional doctor around! I wouldn't ever change doctors!

column3:
Advanced Pain Consultants serves Raleigh, North Carolina and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. As the premier pain management clinic in the Triangle region, our practice combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our facility at 3200 Blue Ridge Road offers a welcoming environment where patients receive individualized attention from our experienced medical team.

At Advanced Pain Consultants, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our mission is to provide patients with the most advanced treatment options and specialized one-on-one care. We employ a multi-disciplinary approach in treating your pain, considering both interventional procedures and conservative management techniques tailored to your specific condition.

Our practice is led by a double board-certified physician with over 15 years of experience in pain medicine. This expertise allows us to offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments that address the root cause of your pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our Specialized Services

As Interventional Pain Services of North Carolina, we provide numerous advanced procedures including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections

  • Nerve blocks

  • Medication management

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Advanced Pain Consultants apart is our commitment to personalized care. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment plans specific to each patient. Our goal is not just pain reduction, but improving your overall quality of life and functionality.

Visit our practice at 3200 Blue Ridge Rd, Suite 216, Raleigh, NC 27612, or call us at (919) 510-7901 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at www.apcpaincare.com.

column38: Syed Quadri|lacy elkins|Christine M|Thurman Grove|Holly Clausen|Robert Brady|John Donnee|quincy dozier
column40:
Dr.Pasi's care is the best and unmatched in the triangle area. For all my hassles with workers comp claim, she was the only care provider to give satisfactory Time & Effort for my well being above all. Thank you doctor!|I can't express the relief it has been to have found Dr. Pasi and her colleagues. For over a year, I've been trying to get quality neurology care, and in just a few weeks, Dr. Pasi has helped reduce my pain, pinpoint multiple abnormalities, and improve my quality of life. I would recommend anyone in need of pain management or neurologic evaluation to this team! Thank you for helping me to spend fewer days in pain, without additional prescription drugs.|Stay far away. I went here for my back pain and the doctor disregarded my past procedures done, glossing them over as unimportant or irrelevant. She then proceeded to do the most bizarre physical evaluation I've ever had, including repeatedly pulling on my legs even though I said that hurt my lower back and stabbing the bottom of my foot with a blunt spike. The doctor also said she doesn't want to look at the MRI because her "computer doesn't do that" when it works perfectly fine for my home computer with no setup required. At checkout they asked at least 10x when I want my next appointment when I kept saying I'm unsure what I want done and wish to think it over. They called to ask me what pharmacy I want to use even though I had written it down 3x, I had a bad vibe about them so I told them I don't want any prescriptions from them, and the receptionist says "you don't want it???" (Tramadol prescription) like I was wasting her time at a garage sale. Now we're receiving bills  for procedures/tests that were either never done or never requested because there was no reason to do so. The doctor also put in a request to my insurance to do a procedure when I had told her I want to wait and consider my options. This place is just an operation to gain money not to treat patients.|My experience at APC has been very positive.  After more than 2 years of suffering from a painful hip and pains shooting down both legs my primary care physician referred me to Dr. Pasi at Advanced Pain Consultants. MRI and X-ray confirmed a bulging disc and advanced arthritis in my lumbar vertebrae. Dr. Pasi treated me with an eipdural shot of steroids and shots in the facet joints of the lumbar vertebrae. I had nearly instantaneous relief of the pain that has persisted for nearly 5 months and has allowed me to resume my normal activities.|I will never have another major surgery without their help. My first back surgery took me through a year of hellish pain. I never knew that a pain specialist could help with my recovery. When I needed another back surgery, I swore to never go through that kind of pain again and found Dr. Pasi. I came home from the hospital with a 9 out of ten pain level for the first two days (it was a weekend) knowing I had an appointment on Monday. After receiving the low dose proper pain medicine, my pain level went down to a 2 only four days after a more involved back surgery. I didn't want to suffer for another year. I am frequently monitored to make sure that I am taking the correct dosage and not abusing the medication which is how it should be. The people who abuse prescription medication makes it difficult for those of us who truly need the medicine for a period of time to get through a surgery. My surgeon said that the DEA only approves five days of narcotics post back surgery. I only am able to take a certain few medications due to intolerance or ineffective problems. That's why I asked my surgeon prior to seeing Advance Pain Specialist if this is what I need to have a positive experience with minimal pain after major back surgery. It has been the best decision to aid in my recovery. I don't have an addictive personality and assume Advance Pain Specialist can spot someone with one quickly. I absolutely recommend any person who knows they will have a painful recovery to contact them and make the best decision of their lives. Dr. Pasi is a sweet, calm and caring person who can help with either short term pain or long term pain management. Call her...you owe yourself that.|I was referred to Dr Pasi by my GP 2 yrs ago for severe back pain that was progressively getting worse and going into my hip and down my leg. Dr Pasi began with injections, then nerve block with very little relief. She started giving me medications for relief and referred me for PT. After PT did not help she progressed to stronger pain meds, constantly monitoring my dosage and effects.  When stronger opioid meds did not help and my pain was getting worse Dr. Pasi suggested I consider having a neuro stimulator implanted.  She referred me to a surgeon that would install the stimulator. The surgeon said surgery was not recommended due to the condition of my back and he also recommended I try the stimulator. The stimulator was put in a little over a month ago and although I still have some pain, I can now have some periods of no pain. I can finally enjoy having a life again. My thanks to Dr Pasi for being so knowledgeable and caring over the past two years.|I have been seeing Dr. Sonia Pasi for the past three years. I had tremendous pain in my neck and whenever I turned my head you could hear the bones cracking. The MRI said advanced arthritis. I was also a former Navy carrier pilot. I was 76 and an avid golfer. Through an Internet search I found Advanced Pain Consultants. Dr. Pasi evaluated me and and based on her recommendation, over the course of eight months had two rounds of Faucet shots and radio ablation. I was pretty much pain free after the first round of shots. After three years, I have full rotation of my neck and no pain.

Scroll forward three years and because of golf and old age I have had major lower back pain. Again Arthritis. Dr. Pasi gave me bilateral shots in my lower back and within a week, I am pain free.

I highly recommend Dr. Pasi and Advanced Pain Consultants. I call her my "Miracle" Doctor.

John|I been a patient of Dr. Sonia Pasi almost 2 yrs. I highly recommend Dr. Pasi. When I first went to Dr. Pasi I was in a great deal of pain, I feel a lot better than when I first went. She the best Doctor that I ever been too. She is a people person, and she know how to comfort her patients. And I can"t say enough about her wonderful staff, Yolanda, Marissa. and Jay thank you.

Cone Health Interventional Pain Management Specialists at Alamance Regional in Burlington, NC offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. This specialized clinic, operating as part of the respected Cone Health network, provides evidence-based interventional treatments designed to improve quality of life and restore function for residents throughout Alamance County and surrounding communities.

The clinic is distinguished by its team of caring physicians who hold dual board certifications in both pain management and anesthesia. This specialized training enables them to offer a sophisticated understanding of pain pathways and deliver precise interventional procedures. Their expertise spans a wide range of pain conditions, from spinal disorders and neuropathic pain to complex regional pain syndrome and post-surgical pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Approaches

Patients benefit from a variety of advanced pain-management methods tailored to individual needs. Treatment options may include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. The specialists take a multidisciplinary approach, often coordinating care with physical therapists, psychologists, and other healthcare providers to address all aspects of a patient's pain experience.

Patient-Centered Care

The team at Cone Health Interventional Pain Management Specialists prioritizes personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and goals. Their compassionate approach focuses on not just reducing pain but improving overall function and quality of life. The clinic's affiliation with Alamance Regional Medical Center ensures patients have access to comprehensive medical resources within the Cone Health system.

Location and Contact Information

Located at 1236 Huffman Mill Rd, Suite 2000, Burlington, NC 27215, the clinic is easily accessible to patients throughout the region. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available pain management services, patients can call +1 336-538-7180. Additional information about the clinic's services and approach to pain management can be found on their website at conehealth.com/locations/profile/alamance-regional-pain-clinic/.

Dr Adams has given me the best care possible.  I get injections w/o sedation and he never hurts me. He is gentle and caring and listens to me.   I highly recommend ARMC Pain Clinic.
The staff is wonderful from Kathy at front desk to all the nurses. They are always so happy and treat me so well.|Great service! Dr. Naveira  and staff are caring, prompt and reliable.  I totally TRUST Dr. Naveria. I recieved several lower back shots under light sedation, one time i forgot and ate so i said ok do it with no sedation and i did not feel anything but a little pressure which is expected with lower back injections. Dr. Naveria is highly skilled and very professional and respectful of his patients. ( i always say if i had patience i would be a Dr.) But No thank you. Lol  the Nurses are also Great and caring i've had many laughs with them and that's what makes for a happy enviorment. Thank you Dr. For treating me and to Nurse Corey, Jennifer and others thank you for what you do, you all are important to your profession. You truely are the 1st line of treatment and i again say Thank You.  I would'nt go anywhere else even if the Treatment was free. Thank you Kathy at the front desk, your an essential worker as well. You know the patients as soon as we walk through the front door. Your professionalism is also top notch. I highly recommend them.|I have had a great experience here dealing with a slipped disc stemming from a car wreck. Dr. Jas has gone way beyond the expected to communicate with me post procedure which is much appreciated!  I'm very excited about the results of my platelet-rich plasma therapy and very glad that I had this done!|The best care ever from the moment you step through the door. Every member of staff are so friendly and profession and seem to wear a smile at all times. My doctor, Dr. Dhaliwal, has taken care of my needs for approximately 7 years and has always discussed my treatment and answered every question I have ever asked. If there was enough stars I would give them at least a 20 out of 10. Thank you Spine and Pain for your care for all these years.|Everyone was very nice. Dr. Bhat listened to me and responded to all my questions. The practice helped sort out issues I was having with my insurance. I highly recommend them and I will continue to go there for my back pain!|Dr. Bhat and his team are top-tier! They never disappoint! Highly experienced, professional, courteous, relatable, and caring. Dr. Bhat and his team are a true rarity in that they still provide care with compassion.|Our experience with Spine & Pain Associates was overall amazing! Everyone in the office took such great care of my mother. She is 85 years old. They treated her like family. They really cared and paid great attention to her needs. Thank you for helping her to be pain free. I will recommend this place to everyone!|Dr. Bhat is one of the best doctors I've ever seen. I have been dealing with so many health issues that are debilitating. I was desperate to find a doctor that cared enough to listen and truly wanted to help me.

Dr. Bhat is extremely thorough. He has an excellent bedside manner. I felt that he cared about my long-term plan of care to help manage my medical issues in the safest and most effective way possible. Oh and the office is beautiful and very organized too!

I believe this practice truly cares about their patients. I am SO grateful to find Dr. Bhat. The front desk check-in professionals  as well as the medical assistants in the back are very professional  warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this practice.
Thank you!|I've been seeing Dr Dhaliwal for many years.  I have always received excellent and caring service from this practice.  I would highly recommend them.
Update: 12/23/24 - I went to Dr Dhaliwal 2 months ago for a Regenexx procedure on my lower back.  I'm very pleased with the staff and the service I received.  So far I have noticed about an 85% reduction of pain in my lower back.  Judging from the pain relief I've received, I would recommend to anyone to try this procedure.  I know there are no guarantees, but it has worked for me and I have been in chronic back pain for many years.|Spine & Pain Associates has been a life-changing experience for my mother. I cannot speak highly enough about all the staff and their outstanding work. From the first appointment, the experience here was vastly different from her previous pain clinic. Rebecca NP took the time to listen and put together the whole story of my mother's pain. She treated her as more than just a patient and proposed a detailed treatment plan that she has made appropriate changes to based on my mother's feedback. Dr. Dhaliwal has been one of the best physicians she has ever had the pleasure to experience. He is not one of those physicians who try to leave as quickly as possible. He does an excellent job explaining every procedure to my mother and answering all questions thoroughly. He truly wants her to be involved in her treatment. Lastly, she always looks forward to seeing Jay at her appointments. He provides a friendly and inviting atmosphere in the office. If you are looking for a Pain clinic, I can say with the utmost confidence that you will not find a better one than Spine & Pain Associates.

Pardee Pain Center in Hendersonville, NC offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout Henderson County and Western North Carolina. As part of the respected Pardee Hospital network, this specialized center combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center provides a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches, including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Patient-Centered Approach

column38: Vincent Luizzi|Mike Duke|Amy Wald|Tiffany Dockery|Mary Davis|NoraLynn Childress holmes|Mandy Bates|Ann Beauchesne
column40:
Thanks to Pardee Customer Relations for listening to my concerns about Nurse Practitioner Megan Scarborough and saying they would do what they can to address these concerns. This review pertains only to this nurse.

This nurse has poor interpersonal skills and turns dialogue with the patient, that should be therapeutic, into an adversarial confrontational,  and disrespectful interaction, creating a toxic encounter for the patient. She said multiple times, in response to questions  about alternative treatments, that they wasted her time and declined to answer them. These comments echo other negative comments about her on the web. I am disappointed that this conduct still needs to be addressed and that I had to be subjected to the same sort of objectionable behavior that others have reported.|My wife and I moved up to Hendersonville, from Florida to be closer to our daughter. I was in Pain Management for 7 plus years in Florida, without incident. I went to Pardee Pain management once we moved up and initially saw Dr. Lewis. Very straight forward, but no issues. For the subsequent visits it was the ARPN Megan Scarborough. Please if you see her, leave. Her approach to patients is aggressive and uncaring. (See other patient reviews with similar complaints.) I had shoulder surgery end of January 2024, on my last visit with Pardee, Megan accused me of getting additional pain meds from my surgeon in March. I explained my last refill from my surgeon was mid-February (which she was aware of from my February visit). She told me she was looking at the additional refills. I stated let's call the surgeon and she said no, she would call the pharmacy. She returned about 15 minutes later and stated that I was correct, no refills in March as she had falsely accused me of. How do you falsely accuse someone of something like that, especially in Pain Management. What was she looking at? Isn't this an ethical violation. I have since terminated my contract with Pardee and now have to start all over again. I will be reaching out to the NC Medical review board to file a complaint.|Most doctors will go over what they will be doing, might tell you "this will hurt", tell you how long it will last, etc. So the patient will understand what Is going to happen.   Dr. Mansfield greeted me, then didn't say a word until the procedure was over.  I was very clearly writhing in pain at several points in the procedure.  He didn't say a word, or show any concern whatsoever.  He asked if I had any questions when we were done.  I did, but he didn't answer any of them, letting the nurse answer them.  He should pick a specialty where he can deal with cadavers only.  He shows no empathy or concern for his patients.  I have NEVER had such a poor excuse for a caregiver.|I'm am really torn with this place right now!!! I read the reviews on Mychak and it was right. I understand they have to be tough and hard because of the pill epidemic. I was mad because they called me a month out talking about we need your records from Florida and when I showed up a month later there were no records from my pain center in Florida. Y'all all need to understand in the reviews is this is a business model. They will run that insurance any which way they can and still not help you! Idk I guess I'm so immune to working with bad drs it's seemed no different to me! At least Dr. Mychak was cute!!!! He looks like Donald Trump Jr.... But a cuter version. At least if I didn't get the help I needed that day I got a piece of eye candy!!! Lol I see Megan next so we shall see what she is about and I'll update!!! Even if she has an attitude maybe she will be cute too!!!! Lol|My husband will never go there again period !!!!!!!! I was sitting in there with him and the nurse was rude and Dr. Mycheck was very rude!!!!! There is no need for him to say what he did. "" Is anyone holding a gun to your head to go to the pharmacy to go get pain medication that your heart surgeon prescribed you "". A little update on my husband. He had a triple bypass surgery last month so of course he is going to be subscribed pain medication. He had his ribs cracked opened!!!! Well  needless to say he will not be back and guess what we reported him. Should have reported the nurse also treating my husband like he was dumb!!!!|Floors were nasty with what looks like blood splatter on the floor, spills, and dust stuck to the floor in those places. The dr was rushed, didn't look at my ct, made a plan for injections, but never told me where they were injecting, what they were injecting or how many. I tried to ask questions, but dr Mansfield was walking out or the room, leaving,  as he answered them short and curt. It's like he came in, said yep, n left. I was left with so many questions. He said he was only addressing the pain that the referral was for n didn't want to look at my other problems.  We made an appt for injections. Then 6 days before procedure, staff called and said they had to cancel bc they forgot to call in lovenox  bridge and I would had to have stopped blood thinner 5 days before procedure. But this was 6 days before. She just kept repeating it. I don't understand. The star was super nice and helpful, but the dr scared me and my husband and I cancelled second appointment. What a relief while still being in pain.|I find the staff very polite and easy to engage.  I was not as pleased with my doctor.  She spent all of about 5 minutes with me each visit only to send me to another specialist.  After 5+ appointments there, I finally got a chance to work with the PA who was WONDERFUL!! She listened, answered all my questions and finally started me on a pain management course of medication - explaining it would take time to get the medication dose correct.|I want to thank all of the staff that I encountered on my first appointment today.
I was treated with dignity and respect. Most importantly competent care with compassion to help me through the process of achieving pain relief .
Dr. Ed Lewis has previously provided me with compassion while being highly skilled in pain relief.
The doctor I saw today and who performed a  procedure that I have undergone previously under another doctors care. While my experiences as a patient and also as a RN, I will best evaluate Dr.B. as being highly skilled in the procedure he performed on me.

column3:
Duke Pain Medicine Clinic in Durham, North Carolina serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management services within the renowned Duke Health system. Established as a specialized center of excellence, this clinic brings together a multidisciplinary team of board-certified pain specialists, neurologists, anesthesiologists, and physical therapists dedicated to addressing complex chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches.

At Duke Pain Medicine, patients benefit from individualized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and integrative medicine approaches. The clinic specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain conditions including neuropathic pain, spinal disorders, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Their holistic approach focuses not just on pain reduction but on improving overall function and quality of life.

Advanced Diagnostic Capabilities

The facility utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and imaging technology to accurately identify pain sources, allowing for targeted treatment strategies. This precision medicine approach helps patients who have struggled with undiagnosed or poorly managed pain conditions find effective relief and sustainable management solutions.

Patient-Centered Care

Duke Pain Medicine Clinic emphasizes collaborative care, working closely with patients to develop customized treatment plans that align with their specific needs and goals. The team prioritizes patient education, empowering individuals with knowledge about their conditions and self-management techniques to complement clinical interventions.

Location and Contact Information

The clinic is conveniently located at 4309 Medical Park Dr, Durham, NC 27704, United States. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 919-668-7600. For more information about services and treatment options, visit their official website at https://www.dukehealth.org/locations/duke-pain-medicine.

As part of the Duke University Health System, the clinic maintains the highest standards of medical excellence while advancing pain medicine through ongoing research and clinical innovations. Their team remains committed to helping patients navigate the challenges of chronic pain with compassionate, evidence-based care.
column11: Duke Pain Medicine is dedicated to the evaluation and treatment of chronic pain.
column38: Mary Teague|Debbie Pilon|Monica Thompson|Lemon|Nancy Lundquist|Carly F|Jessica Howell|Keith
column40:
My husband has a chronic pain patient with Duke Pain Center for 15 years. He received the most unempathetic care I have witnessed by a nurse practitioner today. Her name is Joshi Susmitha. She does not belong in the care of patients seeking care for this speciality because she lacks the understanding and compassion to do her job professionally. I question her choice of practice along with questioning her ethics to hold a license.  I will be submitting a complaint to Duke Hospital system and the North Carolina Board of Nursing|I should've read reviews before going to this clinic. Dr Peter Yi did not address my pain needs at my visit and won't take the time to respond to my messages- he instead responded to my wound care Dr who informed me Dr Yi wanted me to make an appointment!! His nursing staff is rude, is bothered when you call. There are so many other pain clinics/Drs nearby. I am switching and if you want to be treated by a Dr and staff that actually cares about you and your needs, I recommend you go elsewhere as well.|Had a steroid injection on 10 February Been an excruciating pain since and they won't see me same day and they don't really give a damn they keep sending me to my primary care or the emergency room. This place sucks and so does the staff hate to even go back in March Duke emergency room is not any better.|Specifically for the Biofeedback Clinic. I like the provider and the experience during our appointments. I am almost never able to get in touch with/have my calls returned by the front desk, however. Coupled with how busy they are, and that the appointments often cannot be made or rescheduled on MyChart, I have lost steam in wanting to make or attend appointments because I have essentially no assistance from the staff.|Actually they deserve a negative 5 star rating!
I have been referred multiple times and was even given an appt with only less than 2 hours notice which was impossible to make.
Now they will not make another appt for me, without giving me a reason.  They have told me to go to the Raleigh pain clinic. I have gone to the patient advocates requesting a review and still I am being denied access for no legitimate reason.
Dr's Diamond, Vorenkamp, and Anwar deserve to have a complaint filed against them for
Irresponsibility, and slander to start with. The clinic doesn't responsibly act on referrals!
Very poor judgment on their part.  They don't care about anything but themselves!|Front desk staff is amazing! The psychology/biofeedback side of the clinic has staff that are above and beyond. But, the other side of the clinic that handles nerve and tissue pain has doctor's supporting staff that needs bedside training or pursue a career that doesn't require care and patience. Some of them seem like they hate their job and respond rudely. I won't call them out but the atmosphere is extremely different on one side of the clinic versus the other.|I am in disbelief at the moment. I can't fathom how such a respected institution can treat patients in such careless and dispensable manner. My physician referred me to this clinic for a second opinion and I was told that it would be 10 weeks before I would know if I was "approved" as a patient. So, I waited and waited and then decided to call an follow up. Apparently I was denied and no explanation was given. Not only that, but I was never notified that my referral was denied. So, basically Duke expects you to continually call in to see if your referral will be accepted since they won't be taking the time to notify the patient that they will need to find another option. More over, they apparently don't think it is worth their time to explain why they aren't accepting another physician's referral. Clearly, Duke knows that patients are referred to them because their current physician feel their patient needs the next level of expertise. But, Duke doesn't have the respect to communicate or consider the amount of time a patient is kept waiting. What an outright disregard to patient care and respect.|My doctor referred me to Duke Pain Medicine Clinic. Within a couple days I received a  call from them. They acknowledged the referral but said they have no appointments available. I asked when they thought something would become available and she said she didn't know. I asked for a guesstimate and she said she couldn't give me one. Never experienced anything like this; however, after reading reviews of other people's experience I understand where they are coming from. I think I will find other options.

column2: V Pain Clinic: Ratko Vujicic, MD
column3:
V Pain Clinic serves Charlotte, NC and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services under the expert direction of Dr. Ratko Vujicic, MD. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address the complex nature of pain. We understand that pain affects not just the body, but every aspect of a patient's life, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's specific needs and circumstances.

At V Pain Clinic, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options designed to target pain at its source. Dr. Vujicic specializes in advanced diagnostic techniques and therapeutic interventions including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our approach focuses on minimizing dependency on opioid medications while maximizing function and comfort through multidisciplinary strategies.

About Dr. Ratko Vujicic

Dr. Vujicic brings extensive training and experience in pain medicine to his practice. Board-certified and fellowship-trained, he stays at the forefront of pain management advancements to provide his patients with the most current and effective treatment options available. His compassionate approach and commitment to patient education ensure that each person understands their condition and participates actively in their treatment decisions.

Our Facility

Located at 12610 N Community House Rd in Charlotte, NC 28277, our modern clinic is designed with patient comfort in mind. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a welcoming environment. We prioritize accessibility and convenience for our patients, with ample parking and a layout that accommodates those with mobility challenges.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 704-405-1747. Additional information about our practice, including patient resources and forms, can be found on our website at www.vpain.us. Our dedicated staff is available to answer questions and assist with appointment scheduling Monday through Friday during regular business hours.

column40: Dr V was the first doctor, out of so many, in 14 years to perform an actual physical exam on my hips/legs. He determined what the problem may be, came up with a treatment plan and so far...it's been helpful in that area! I'm thankful he has an office in Charlotte. Dr V and his staff are caring, professional, knowledgeable and friendly.|We are extremely pleased with both Dr V and all of his staff.  Everyone was polite, personable and professional.  We are especially impressed with Dr V who gave my husband the most comprehensive and thorough examination he's had in many years.  He asked lots of questions and really listened and thoroughly addressed all our questions and concerns.  We will definitely be recommending him to our neighbors and friends.|Dr. V and all his staff are wonderful!! If anyone needs a Doctor for their long term pain needs, I don't believe you could find anyone better than Dr V and his staff!! I have gotten to know each one of them over a period of years and I can genuinely recommend Dr V without question.|It was a nightmare. He never paid attention to what I was saying. His staff is the rudest I have ever encountered|I've been going to the Ballantyne office of V Pain Clinic for several years now for pain management. I love Dr. V and his staff. Dr. V cares about people and helping them to manage chronic pain and physical issues. I have always found him to be personable, always answering questions patiently and in a way that's totally understandable. It was difficult to go into pain management when my PCP quit handling pain meds but I'm so glad (after much research) that I chose to try V Pain Clinic. Dr. V is the only one I would trust with medication management and procedures to help in managing my physical issues.|Dr. V and his staff are incredible. I suffer from back pain that radiates down my leg. His injections have helped so much. He has the the best personality and everyone there is so helpful. Highly recommend!!|Scott has been a patient for over a decade and has always had a positive experience with Dr. V. He is an incredible diagnostician and his treatments have always been extremely effective in relieving pain. He is very kind, personable, and responsive. We highly recommend him to anyone who needs an intervention for pain issues.|The V Pain Clinic cares and listens to their patients to understand your condition, worsening pain, and suggest treatments. Not only did Duke Medical agree with his suggestion but also is now tapering me off the Gabapentin and will start me on Lyrica as  suggessted. Moreover, Dr. V  suggested that Duke Medical consider ordering an MRA and this was also found to be justifiable and has been ordered for my my brain and neck. Of course V Pain Clinic will get a 5 star rating from me. Just wanted to say thank you for caring about your patients. It's very much appreciated. And for those who are nervous about getting on the steroid injection wheel...Dr. V did not suggest that form of treatment for my spine as it would not have proven  beneficial. In other words, he will only treat you with injections if it is truly warranted. I would definitely recommend Dr. V.

National Spine & Pain Centers - Fayetteville serves patients throughout Fayetteville, North Carolina with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists focuses on addressing the unique needs of each patient through a comprehensive, team-based approach that ensures everyone receives expert, personalized treatment. Conveniently located at the intersection of Robeson and Village Drive, our facility offers advanced interventional pain management techniques designed to improve quality of life and restore functionality for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

At National Spine & Pain Centers, we understand that pain affects everyone differently. Our physicians employ evidence-based treatments tailored to each individual's specific condition and circumstances. From spinal conditions to joint pain and neuropathic disorders, our specialists utilize the latest diagnostic tools and therapeutic approaches to develop effective treatment plans.

Patient-Centered Experience

We strive to create a comfortable environment for all patients visiting our Fayetteville location. Due to cool indoor temperatures maintained in our office, we recommend bringing a sweater or light jacket to your appointment. This attention to detail reflects our commitment to patient comfort throughout every aspect of care.

Location and Contact Information

Our Fayetteville office is located at 2153 Valleygate Dr STE 102, Fayetteville, NC 28304. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (910) 321-7246. Additional information about our practice and treatment options can be found on our website at www.treatingpain.com/fayetteville.

Our Approach to Pain Management

We believe in addressing not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. Through careful evaluation and personalized treatment plans, our specialists work to reduce pain, improve function, and enhance overall quality of life. Our multidisciplinary approach may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to achieve optimal results.

column40:
0 stars out of 5. Go elsewhere.
My last appt with Dr Viji Shankar was 12-23. I went for chronic back pain and treatment fibromyalgia. My first visit, the Dr spoke very fast and quickly dismissed what I told her. I told her that I had steroids psychosis prior and I didn't want steroid injections. She told me that was rare and scheduled me for a diagnostic test with steroids. The test was uneventful on my part. The alternate side was done a few weeks later on Dec of 23. As she numbed the area, I felt each shot. Horrible pain. I told her I felt that and it was painful, she told me to relax. As she proceeded with the injections, I told her I wasn't numb. She didn't stop. Just relax she told me. I cried out in pain and was sobbing. Her assistant apologized. I asked the assistant if the Dr could prescribe something for pain. She said she prescribed patches but I never got them. I had left 5 messages using the Patient Portal. I was told by their office that don't use the Patient Portal. Why would I go to ANYONE that I would pay to treat me like this.|Of I could leave 0 or negative stars I would have. I'm 65, in a wheelchair,  have lung cancer that I'm not going to have treatment for and have had heart bypass surgery. This woman wouldn't give me meds without knee shots I've already tried or burning my nerves off in my knees. She couldn't speak enough English so that I could understand her but my wife was able to make out most if it. I do not recommend this place for anything except making sure they get their money|Nice staff worker's but the doctor she speaks to fast and barley understand what she's saying and if you have a question good luck if you get to ask it because she doesn't give you a chance to ask her anything, I had went there to get injections three times and nothing worked so I was referred to a surgeon by them couldn't get ahold of them so I called back to the so I called this place back and asked to get referred to my suggested surgeon and it's been a month since I've asked them to do that and nothing , I've been trying to call them every day and ask why they haven't sent my paperwork to the  surgeon and yet they have answered the phone. I'm very very very very unhappy with them right I'm in so much pain and I just want some kind of relief so y'all do better!!|2022 was the worst summer of my life. I never knew that pain could be that bad. I had never heard of NSPC.  I just went to the same office where my mother had her pain issues treated years prior. Her doctor wasn't there anymore, but Dr Shankar and Noli were. I was in too much pain to be picky. They did right by me|I have to admit that I prejudged this office based on an experience from a few years ago and I have to apologize in the biggest way possible. The entire staff has been nothing but nice and welcoming since the first time I went back. If they had told me to find another office because of the attitude I had, I wouldn't have blamed them. Again my sincere apologies to everyone.
I have to give the entire team here 5 stars because they greet me with nothing but respect and I am very grateful for the way they treat their patients.|Never answer the phones, front desk is cover they have a ring camera to see if somebody is there if you are lucky and they see you they open the window. The doctor I see speak fast I can understand her good go strait to medicines without putting a hand on my and explore more of my situation. I call last week to cancel my appointment because of my bad experience I leave a mesage, nobody contact me yet. Find another place , even talking in the waiting room with other patience have the same issues I have experience.|I don't understand how they can practice medicine, but their patients have to have a certain insurance for them to see you. I've been with Ambeter of NC for the last 4 years and never had someone tell me they don't take my insurance. Soon as I got off the phone with them, I called Cape Fear Orthopedic and made an appointment no less than 3 minutes! Better make sure you have the correct insurance, or they'll turn you away!|Some office staff seem less than qualified/trained. Communication (returning calls) and follow through with requests are impacted. It's unfortunate since patients are already in so much pain.  New ins denied medication for reason not medically necessary based on information provided or not provided by office staff. My diagnosis is occipital neuralgia and failed cervical fusion for which I have undergone multiple procedures by this office. The doctors are fine though they seem rushed, poor client relations overall. I can not recommend this office. I pulled the email from other posts and also sent.

column3:
FirstHealth Interventional Pain Medicine - Pinehurst serves residents throughout Pinehurst, North Carolina and surrounding communities with specialized care focused on chronic pain management. Our comprehensive pain center combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from persistent, debilitating pain conditions that impact quality of life.

At FirstHealth Interventional Pain Medicine, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living. Our team provides thorough evaluations and develops personalized treatment plans utilizing the latest evidence-based approaches. We specialize in addressing complex pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain related to cancer treatments.

Advanced Treatment Options

Patients benefit from access to the most innovative and effective interventional procedures available today. Our specialists are trained in cutting-edge techniques including:

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Nerve blocks

  • Joint injections

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

Our primary goal is to reduce or eliminate chronic, debilitating pain so patients can return to active, fulfilling lives. We work collaboratively with each individual to develop treatment strategies that address their specific needs and circumstances, focusing on both immediate relief and long-term pain management.

Visit Our Pain Management Center

Location: Specialty Centers, 35 Memorial Dr Bldg, Pinehurst, NC 28374, United States

Phone: +1 910-715-1794

Website: https://www.firsthealth.org/medical-care/interventional-pain-medicine/

Contact us today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief and improved quality of life.
column11: FirstHealth Interventional Pain Medicine, Pinehurst provides chronic pain sufferers with thorough evaluations and access to a complete range of pain relief options, including the newest and most advanced back and neck pain treatments. Our goal is stopping chronic, debilitating pain or reducing it to the greatest extent possible so that patients may resume their active lives.
column38: Terrie Jordan|Lightning Computers INC|cd g|Jessica Krissa|Jill Neeld|Nzaria|Lynn Cain|Katie M
column40:
I had a great experience today when I had to have injections in my back. I was a new patient and was SHOCKED when  Dr. Brian Thwaites actually came into the room, sat down and talked to me about my pain and procedure. He was very informative and kind. The nurse was great, too. I have had injections at other clinics where I never ever laid eyes on the doctor because I was face down on the table when they walked in. My only complaint is that they need better signage outside. It was my first visit and I had no idea how to get into the right building. My "not so patient" husband was irritated that we had to walk around in the rain to find the correct entrance.|Dr Kenneth Fulp is amazing. He takes his time with you if you need it. Answers your questions and is direct with it. Best pain management doctor in town in my option. Thank doc for everything you do.|What a disaster this place is. The doctor was ok the rest of the staff are arrogant, rude, incompetant and clearly no nothing about customer service.
In addition, like everyone else that is required before you get service, I paid my copay of $30. Apparently, the office did not forward proof to billing and billing has been harrassing me for payment. I asked billing to request a copy of the receipt from the front desk. They refuesed and said it required me to walk into the clinic, get a copy and hand carry it to them.
I told them i would not do that and they could just request it intraoffice. Instead they turned it over to a debt collector.
Its either incompetence or its First Health's way of double billing to increase revenue. There is no support or help they provide to assist those who have been impacted by their mistakes/incompetence.|This used to be a great place, but ever since Dr. Lauren Williams took over Dr Steve Collins' practice it's been going downhill.
I was recently out of the Country and ran out of my meds. When I came home, I advised the ofc that I was out of my meds and requested a refill which was denied.  Long story short, Dr Williams and her staff were negligent and unprofessional having a chronic pain patient be without any medication for days and going through withdrawal symptoms as a result. The office staff lied about her being out of town and having a prescription sent to the pharmacy on my behalf.
Despicable behavior for a medical doctor, especially a chronic pain specialist.  I have since transferred back to Dr. Collins where my health and well being are paramount.|I had been seen at FHBN Clinic since 2018 for my Back and Neck Pain issues. I love the care I received from both Dr Winkly and Dr Mokris - both very caring and concerned. After years of seeing PA Steve Collins since 2018, on one visit in March of 2022  I calmly questioned him that his charting  was confusing and did not reflect my pain diagnosis (it looked like he was cutting and pasting )   and that he failed to  order a very needed MRI of my neck. PA Collins became very angry, yelled at me  gaslit me that  that I was verbally attacking him and then cancelled all of my appointments with the clinic - in the middle of a major issue with my neck pain. I question why a Physician's assistant should have  so much control over whom Dr's see and that I was never even further evaluated by the Dr's  Mokris for really poor care and a lack of trust in these Medical Providers. First Health should know about this  really loose canon of a provider|I have been going here for 2 years now and the staff is horrible with customer service. They tell you there are going to call you back with updates on medication or appointments and you don't hear anything from them the whole day. Communication is key especially with chronic pain patients who rely on pain meds and chronic pain management. Then when you call them multiple times you may be seen as aggressive or drug seeking especially if you are on pain meds. I think this may be last go round with this clinic.|NO stars if possible! Dr Thomas has been excellent but his STAFF, rude and no empathy. Was late due to traffic, in pain, plus driving in from our of town. Tried to give me an appt TWO months out when foot specialist said I need to see my back and pain doctor. Then they said the clinical manager or nurse would call me. Called finally claiming I was a no show that day and two other times! No longer a patient but that lady wasn't nice that morning I arrived 15 minutes late. Dr Thomas was awesome, on to another specialist hopefully with professional staff and I'm not achild! Don't talk to me any kind of way bevayse I look young but have grown children. I will never refer nobody else due to STAFF|I've been a patient of Dr Thomas for over a year. I used to like him very much. However his staff is HORRENDOUS & EXTREMELY RUDE not only that they DON'T HONOR THE FIRST HEALTH LATE POLICY NOR does Dr Thomas, I couldn't be MORE disappointed in this so-called business. I was late about 2-3 different times. I was shy of being 10 minutes late one time, and twelve minutes late another time. The policy is that you have to be there within 15 minutes of the appt time. Life happens and especially unpredictable traffic in this town. But they don't care, they overbook ALL THE TIME so the policy CAN'T be honored. It makes NO SENSE. I always wait 15 minutes or more when I do arrive on time.

I've also requested NUMEROUS times to not be called before 9:30am. I've suffered from horrible insomnia ever since I was small. I have the worst time getting to sleep and staying asleep. I was forced to block their number as I had to function on very little sleep that day since they felt the need to call me 3 times about 1 appt. They failed to send over all of my prescriptions to my pharmacy(& blamed it on the pharmacy)which resulted in me randomly seeing spots for over a week. I wish the staff matched the care I receive from Dr Rob. After my next appointment I'll be transferring my care to another pain clinic. Dr Thomas' nurse laughed at me and sternly said that "they're not changing the policy JUST for me". She's clearly in the wrong field.  She doesn't care about the patients, just what's most convenient for herself and the staff. Oh and the fact that they DOUBLE CHARGE YOU isn't great either.

Today was the final straw, I'll be seeking another provider, which really is a shame. PA Thomas and Dr Mocris are great. The staff is EXTREMELY RUDE!!!

column38: A. B.|Lisa VanHorn|Roni Williams|C. Drake|verbss Espiritu|William Rountree|John W|Trish T.
column40:
I'm what one would call a frequent flyer here, and I must say, ALL the staff are the absolute BEST! Dr. Swiber is a gem, and I'm so grateful to have such an amazingly talented, empathetic, exceptional physician so close to home. They truly welcome me and make me feel at home. I always look forward to my never blocks as they best help me manage my pain, but I also look forward to seeing everyone and hearing how they're doing! Pain clinics are run differently than most, so just understand that the intake process takes time, you'll have regular office visits and med checks and that's completely normal and to be expected, as every other pain clinic I've been to does the same! HIGHLY recommend!!|The behaviour of the staff, with the exception of Megan, is absolutely reprehensible! I can't even fathom how they could be so completely incompetent without trying. Months of confusion, un-professionalism and attitude and no closer to seeing a doctor.|Dr. Swiber is a true blessing! He is extremely knowledgeable in all aspects of pain management, and is always willing to listen and try different things to help manage your pain. It can be so hard for patients with chronic, life altering pain to find a caregiver who actually cares about their patients, but that's exactly how Dr. Swiber makes you feel.
When my pain management doctor in Wilmington moved away, I was so scared that I would never find a doctor to help me like he did. Before he left he made sure that I was set up with Dr. Swiber, and I'm so thankful that he did! I'm coming up on two years being in the Cedar Point office and hopefully will never have to go anywhere else.|I moved here last July and was a regular at my previous pain clinic, so I was very worried about finding someone who not only I trusted, but also understood my situation and my unique needs. I have been a patient with Dr. Swiber and Jason for about a year now and I must say, I didn't anticipate finding an anesthesiologist not only so close to home, but also with an incredible team who makes me feel like I'm their one and only patient!

The quality of care is the best of the best, (and I've been to a ton of specialists), and we have a plan and routine that works well! I'm so grateful for their wonderful care, and would recommend them to everyone who is seeking help. Please understand that pain clinics have different protocols than other types of physicians and so the complaints I see in other reviews are pretty common with most any pain clinic, because I think people don't understand how things are done differently and why they must be. None of this is out of the ordinary and is what all pain centers do. So please know that Dr. Swiber and Jason and the entire team have your best interests in mind and will do their absolute best to take good care of you! That's been my experience anyway, so I'm taking the time to share my thoughts as I'm so grateful for them! Thank you, and I'll see you again soon. :)|Big thank you to this group of professional people MD Mr.Swiber amazing and MD Ms.Megan Frank amazing and to all the staff of carolina pain management for always taking care of my Mom. God bless you all.|My migraine doctor at a different clinic ended up out unexpectedly and was no longer able to do the occipital and trigeminal nerve blocks I had been receiving every 6 weeks for years. I spent a few months getting referrals to other neurologist but their appointments were past the date of my next appointment with my old doctor so I decided I had to just wait until Jun for the appointment which was 6 months from the time of my last nerve blocks. My doctor ended up canceling the appointment in Jun because he was still not expected back in the office so I scrambled calling around to see where I could go. Carolina pain center got my referral bit could only do 1 of the 2 nerve blocks. I took the appointment because anything was better than nothing at that point. I get to my first appointment and they recommend a cervical MRI to rule out a cause of te migraines from my neck. I agreed because it has never been do e before. I get scheduled for the MRI and they schedule me for the nerve block a month later. A family member who also deals with migraines sent me the information. For a nearby migraine clinic and I called. They said they could do both nerve blocks and get me I. Sooner for them. I took the appointment and let carolina pain center know when they called me about my mri results. They let me know I had 2 disc in my neck with issues and recommended cervical epidural.  I declined initially because I wasn't sure about it. They understood and stated if I decided to do it to give them a call and they would be happy to do that. I get in with my migraine specialist and after talking to her she recommended I get it done. They don't do them so I called carolina pain center to get scheduled for the cervical al epidural. That same day I received a letter in the mail informing me I was not able to have them as part of my Healthcare team anymore. Surely this was a mistake. The receptionist was polite and said she'd talk to the doctor. I received a call back this morning informing that they were unable to do the epidural. The doctor refused to works with another doctor because I decided to go someplace that could administer both the nerve blocks.

The migraine specialist does not do cervical epidurals so I have to find a different doctor to provide treatment for an issue identified by the carolina pain center.

The doctor's at the carolina pain center are the kind of doctors that make other doctors look bad.

Punishing a patient because they found a different doctor to provide thr treatment they needed is absurd.|Always received fantastic care.  Would highly recommend.|UPDATE: Unfortunately, Jason has left the practice. Now I'm left with another PA who said at the appointment that she would call in another med for migraines then she didn't call anything in. When I called her back, she told me to try supplements. I have liver disease, she didn't bother to check interactions. When I suggested that she change meds, she said that she would if I brought in my current meds so that she could make sure they were destroyed. Jason has never treated me like a kid in kindergarten. Apparently, Shanee thinks I'm a circus monkey who needs to be put in a cage and unable to function as the responsible adult that I am. Frustrated and disheartened.

I just received proof that this provider lied when I attempted to switch pain clinics. They told the pain clinic that they had discharged me. I asked how they just called in a higher dose of a med if they discharged me in May of 2023.

I'm not the sharpest tool in the shed, but that would constitute a deceptive, intentional interference in continuity of care. Ultimately forcing me to not be able to find another provider outside of them. They have now committed defamation of character.

column2: Harsh Govil, MD - Pain & Spine Center
column3:
Pain & Spine Center in Statesville, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Harsh Govil, MD. Established with the mission to improve patients' functionality and quality of life, our center has become a trusted healthcare provider in the Statesville region. Dr. Govil brings over 12 years of specialized experience as a non-surgical spine specialist, delivering personalized care that addresses the root causes of pain rather than just treating symptoms. Since joining Piedmont HealthCare in 2010, he has built a reputation for compassionate, patient-centered approaches to pain management that minimize medication dependence and maximize long-term relief.

At Pain & Spine Center, we offer comprehensive treatment for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Low Back Pain

  • Neck Pain

  • Arthritis of Spine

  • Failed Back Surgery Syndrome

  • Joint Pain

  • Nerve and Muscle Pain

  • Work-Related Injuries

Our Approach to Pain Management

Dr. Govil's approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with holistic pain management strategies. Each treatment plan is individually tailored after thorough evaluation, considering the patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals. Our center utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to precisely identify pain sources, allowing for targeted treatments that provide lasting relief while minimizing side effects.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. Our compassionate team works closely with each patient, providing education about their condition and involving them in treatment decisions. This collaborative approach helps patients regain control over their lives and achieve optimal outcomes. Dr. Govil's extensive experience with complex cases makes our center particularly effective for patients who have not found relief through conventional treatments.

Contact Information

Address: 1404 Fern Creek Dr, Statesville, NC 28677, United States

Phone: +1 704-978-4025

Website: painandspinecenter.com

If you're struggling with chronic pain or spine-related conditions, contact Pain & Spine Center today to schedule a consultation with Dr. Harsh Govil and take the first step toward a more comfortable, active life.
column11:

column40:
I recently visited pain and spine center for chronic pain management, and my experience has been overwhelmingly positive. From the moment I walked in, the staff was welcoming and attentive, making me feel comfortable and at ease.

Dr Govil took the time to listen to my concerns, thoroughly evaluate my condition, and tailor a treatment plan that suited my specific needs. They were patient in answering all my questions and explaining the options available to me.

The treatment I received was highly effective, and I noticed a significant improvement in my pain levels within a few sessions. The clinic offers a comprehensive range of services, and I appreciated the holistic approach to managing pain, including both medical and non-medical therapies.

Moreover, the support staff, including the nurses and receptionists, were always professional and accommodating. Scheduling appointments was easy, and I never felt rushed during my visits.

Overall, I highly recommend them to anyone struggling with chronic pain. The combination of expert care, a compassionate team, and a welcoming environment makes this clinic a top choice for pain management.|So I got here early for my appointment since it was nasty weather today. Appt was at 10:40 am, it is now 11:14 and I still haven't been seen. I have asked twice about how much longer am I going to have to wait to only hear it will be a few more minutes each time. A few minutes and now I am over 30 minutes past my appointment time. What kind of service is this from a doctor and staff! So not thrill at this time but he is the only one listed with my carrier!!! This place needs to learn how to do better at this time!|Been getting spine injections. Dr. Govil has been very good about not hurting me and has helped the pain a lot. Nathan is very good at scheduling the injections.|I was really impressed with Dr. Govil, during my visit. Dr. Govil is very thorough and takes his time with and explains everything to where you understand it. He's very knowledgeable in his profession. I'm very grateful for his help. Thank you. The office staff are wonderful, and very helpful, and patience. Thank you to them.|Dr. Govil listened, asked questions, explained the cause for my pain and treated me with great compassion.  He gave treatment options and started me on the road to recovery.  His entire staff was kind and respectful.|The staff is always very professional and extremely polite, along with my Doctor, Dr Samuel Sackenheim. He listens attentively to my needs,as well as addresses each issue I'm concerned about , and always feel comfortable talking with him . Toe that the most important part and I always enjoy my visits|Dr Govil and Nathan Barkley have been great! I have been coming here for years and the entire staff is friendly and accommodating!
I recommend them highly!|Dr Govil explained everything about the injection beforehand, and what was happening during the procedure. He is both very professional and personable in his approach.

column2: UNC Health Pain Management at Southeastern Health Park
column3:
UNC Health Pain Management at Southeastern Health Park serves Lumberton, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services. As part of the renowned UNC Health network, this specialized clinic offers evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and improve their quality of life.

The clinic provides a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management solutions. Their board-certified specialists utilize the latest diagnostic tools and therapeutic approaches to treat various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Treatment options may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, nerve blocks, spinal injections, and coordinated physical therapy.

Patient-Centered Approach

At UNC Health Pain Management, patients benefit from a collaborative approach that may involve consultation with multiple specialists to ensure comprehensive care. The team works closely with primary care physicians and other healthcare providers to coordinate treatment and provide continuity of care. Their goal is not just to reduce pain but to improve function and help patients return to their daily activities.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently located at 4901 Dawn Dr Suite 2400, Lumberton, NC 28360, the clinic is easily accessible to residents throughout Robeson County and neighboring areas. The modern facility at Southeastern Health Park offers a comfortable environment with state-of-the-art equipment for diagnostics and treatment. For appointments or inquiries, patients can call +1 910-671-9298 or visit their website at unchealth.org.
