column2: The HEAG Pain Management Center, P.A.,
column3:
The HEAG Pain Management Center, P.A. in Durham, North Carolina offers comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the Triangle region. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our medical practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At The HEAG Pain Management Center, our board-certified physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. From interventional procedures to medication management and physical therapy recommendations, we develop multidisciplinary approaches that target the source of pain while minimizing reliance on opioid medications whenever possible.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinical expertise extends to numerous pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Cancer-related pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing collaborative relationships with our patients, taking time to understand how pain affects their daily activities and overall wellbeing. This patient-centered philosophy ensures treatment plans address not just physical symptoms but also the emotional and functional impacts of chronic pain.

Visit Our Practice

The HEAG Pain Management Center is conveniently located at 2609 N Duke St #303B, Durham, NC 27704. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technologies in a comfortable, welcoming environment.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services:

Phone: +1 919-220-0107

Website: www.heagpmc.com

Our dedicated staff is available to answer questions about insurance coverage, appointment availability, and treatment options. New patients are welcome with appropriate referrals from primary care physicians or specialists.
column38: Beverly Ramsey|Kimberly Edwards|Hopie|Judith Bullock|Roman L|Lauren Carey|AnG!e|Pat B
column40:
This is most unprofessionalism I have ever experienced let's. Start with appointment time 8:30am he comes in the room about 9:45 for about talk all but 4 seconds done something needs to be done about this clinic they are stealing from people too their insurance is in danger I experienced having to pay 25 dollars for an appointment that was made intentionally and said missed where I had to pay He begs for coffee from you when you come and when you don't show up with it he's some kind of way they write prescriptions that you don't use he claims and says things that are fause my next step is to report this clinic something here is not correct they are also constantly arguing amongst themselves today they wanted 200 dollars and when I stood up for myself he said I was being disrespectful and to add the place reeps of urine|During my intake Dr. Dakwa spent nearly an hour with me. In that time he provided me information concerning treatment of my autoimmune disorders that my specialists of   10 years had not suggested. He's extremely knowledgeable and obviously interested in medical sciences -- a forever learner. It doesn't take a special skill to notice that his face gives him away in his compassion for people; he cannot bear to see them suffer. He offered me a simple solution for my pain that other doctors had overlooked and it has changed my life completely. It helps not only my nerve pain but other issues within my neurological system that he obviously took note of during my intake as I wasn't even entirely aware of them myself. The rest of the staff are equally as impressive. They are kind and genuinely down-to-earth. Randall is my favorite! He ushers patients in and out overseeing that things are moving along. He chats with everyone and seems to get to know each patient. He's sweet, cheerful and interesting. He is personable and feels as if you've known him all your life; his overall demeanor is naturally attentive. It's an overall pleasant experience which is a relief and even a distraction from the constant mental torture that comes with chronic physical pain. My last couple of appointments have been extremely quick! If an appointment is longer it is only due to the fact that he happens to have a new patient and he invests extra time in that critical intake -- which I've gathered from experience he does with every single patient. If you're an established patient, have grace for others and hang tight. There is one doctor and too many people in this world suffering; a single person can only do so much. Last of all, it is refreshing to meet a doctor who is firm in his oath, conducting himself as a medical doctor and not a politician.|I don't understand the negative comments. I love the Dr here! I came in for my appointment with tears running down my face and he told me not to worry he will help figure it out. He's always kind but busy. There aren't a lot of pain clinics in my area so we drink 2 1/2 hours each way. Blessed to have found this place. Comments about him making sure to cover his butt needs to realize he could lose his license if he just hands out scripts.|This doctor's office is far better than what I have had for the past 15 years with the same PCP. Doctor doesn't dilly dally around with my health! He pins it down with the "nail on the head!" My last doctor was not reading my labs or MRI'S. This office knows their "stuff" and they are courteous, respectful, caring, polite and meticulous.  Here, I'm not waiting for 5-8 hours to be seen. Five minutes tops. I don't have to worry or wonder about my healthcare which was issues I had with my last doctor who never read my tests.  But God!!!|It hasn't been easy to deal with pain. I was ignorant to my problem. But thanks to Dr. Dakwa and staff my life whent from worst to better. I recommend The HEAG Pain Management for treatment. Thank you Dr. Dakwa and staff, for all your patience.
Sincerely,
R.L.|Personally, Doctor and Staff are Very pleasant and professional. It's very hard to receive treatment for pain that people cannot see.
I do not understand why there are reviews from 5 and 6 years ago. I have always been treated with kindness and professional care.|Terrible place. I was in horrible pain and yet made to wait just initially for an hour in their hard seats in the waiting area. After 45 mins i went to my car to grab Advil. While heading back in, I was approached by one of their long standing patients who literally BEGGED me to give them my pain medication! That I didn't have but NEVER would've given had I of had it! Already there was a bad taste in my mouth from that.
But then, while back in the FULL (to capacity) waiting area waiting even longer, one woman came in who was halfway in her seat/ halfway out, literally falling asleep in between her sentences. It was to the point that her own husband was embarrassed and BEGGING her to stop and sit up straight! When staff noticed, they asked her what was wrong with her and she replied, "I'm just sooo tired." They let her stay and be seen. And..she walked out (only a half hour later) with more prescriptions and seemed happy, even a little more awake. But here most of us were in visible pain, so uncomfortable that breathing was hard. ..and we were questioned relentlessly like addicts!

I went through about 11 tests of their choosing and spent 9 hours there! No exaggeration! All of this to be scolded for the medications that I have been on -for years -that work very well for me ..I just happened to of been displaced due my doctor of years getting very sick and out on medical leave. I had to find someone in a pinch. But they were so bad about sending my records to my referring doctor that his group grew seriously frustrated and decided to continue my care through another MD at their office. HEAG did NOT ever send the whole record, It came in pieces over weeks. And still. ..never all of the record. Even 2 years on!! Also, they weren't able to justify some of their tests they forced me to have either. Not To my medical group OR to my insurance. Some of those tests they TRIED to charge ME for - because insurance didn't cover the tests they CHOSE. They know which ones are covered. I never paid them. And I'll fight it forever.

The words of my referring group were, "We are so sorry that you had to endure all of that! I don't even know how he's still able to work in the field. Obviously he cares little for his patients. Rest assured this will never happen to one of our patients again." They even canceled other patients appts who had been referred to HEAG by my then doctors office. Luckily the doctors within the group where my doctor went on medical leave at kept great records so they could easily see the kind of patient I had been for 11 years. They treated me like a patient in pain. ..not someone who had to prove myself at every single turn. Not some addict that needed to prove I wasn't. This experience was absolutely traumatizing for me. I dont know how they're still there with the reviews I've read, those I've heard from patients and other doctors alike. I'm shocked. ..but at the same time, I'm not. Healthcare in the USA has seriously gone downhill ESPECIALLY where pain management is concerned. Sad state we're in here. Avoid this place though! There ARE better ones!|Disorganized, long wait times and they are way too over cautious. They are more interested in protecting their own arses than the care of a patient.  Basically, you are treated as a drug addict unless you can prove otherwise. The testing is extensive, some without merit, including a breathalyzer test. I've never been subject to this kind of testing and waste of time before. They test for kratom so if you're using it responsibly for pain management, (yes, it is still legal) you'll be scolded, talked down to, and asked to attend drug counseling. yikes. I ran like hell.

column3:
Carolina Pain Care in Rutherfordton, North Carolina is a specialized medical practice dedicated to comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Rutherford County and surrounding areas. Established with a patient-centered approach, our clinic combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to address acute and chronic pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians and experienced clinical staff work collaboratively to develop personalized care plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Carolina Pain Care, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify the root causes of pain and develop targeted treatment strategies.

Patient-Focused Care

We understand that pain affects each individual differently, which is why we take the time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop customized treatment plans. Our compassionate team strives to create a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected throughout their healing journey. We emphasize education and self-management techniques to empower patients in their recovery process.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our facility is equipped with modern technology to provide various interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and peripheral nerve blocks. These minimally invasive techniques often provide significant relief with shorter recovery times compared to traditional surgical approaches.

Visit Our Practice

Carolina Pain Care is conveniently located at 141 Laurel Hill Dr #3, Rutherfordton, NC 28139. Our office features comfortable waiting areas and private treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to coordinate benefits for our patients.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (828) 286-2603. You can also visit our website at http://carolinapaincare.com/ for additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources. Our friendly staff is available to answer questions and assist with appointment scheduling Monday through Friday during regular business hours.

column40:
What I am really hoping is that this meeting with Dr. Wolf is not who he really is. If you read his bio it looks like he has his heart  in the right place but his life experiences have not caught up .This was an Incredibly disappointing experience. I was not seen through a lens of compassion or treated like a responsible individual. Dr. Wolf treated me like a child and I am old enough to be his mother. He pushed me to either drop my anxiety medication or forfeit pain medication. I use anxiety medication perhaps twice a month. I told him so and he simply refused to budge. I told him I've had other practitioners who knew my history and knew I would never combine those kinds of medications. He answered by saying," you can go back to them." ( no ,I cannot, one is retired and the other was with a different insurance). With muscular skeletal pain through out my body, osteoarthritis and a labor intensive business as an alternative medical practitioner , I felt interrogated and unseen. At 55 with a spotless record and wide knowledge of medication and interaction ,Dr Wolf's protocols were held above common sense and kindness. It's all about law suits and malpractice. I have to start over with someone that can actually help me with my pain so I can recover. Dr. Wolf I am in a lot of pain. Daily. That is why I came. I have a long term plan to find my health again. I think you have missed the plot. I hope , really hope you find it. Take people on a case by case basis. Listen hard . I see true goodness in you. I believe you will learn that fine balance  in healthcare. I would recommend taking a medical communication course on how to speak to people that won't put them on defense . Blessings...|This facility and Doctor are very unprofessional and the front office as well as the manager.  I was seen there for a year but after I didn't agree with Dr. Wolf treatment he punished me by not filling my medication early as he did all year and then discharging me...knowing I am moving to Europe in weeks he left me with just enough refills to stop right before my move as if this is morally right to do to anyone. Punished me further by the discharge not just for him but their entire facility, all locations. Then and to this day are witholding me records so I can't get treatment anywhere else in the area. I've tried over 30 Doctors and noone will see me. I've emailed them begging for help, just ignored. No records, no medication and no Doctor. They just abandoned me. I even drove over an hour to be seen by the same place and a different Dr. They wouldn't let me see the Dr because this Dr, Wolf, made sure to discharge me from all locations just to be extra mean. Now with me leaving and no records, I can't get treated anywhere and all I needed was one more refill, which he refused today. As if he hasn't done enough harm, now just making sure I don't have relief from this debilitating disease right before my international move. He is pure evil and I wouldn't trust him with my worst enemy.

Understand, I am a single mom of 2 with a chronic pain disease through all limbs, incredibly painful. This Doctor put his ego above his oath and left me and my kids in harms way. If you go here beware, the minute you disagree or speak up about the many problems here, your out and they will make you pay even if it threatenes your life. They don't care. Save yourself the future pain and find another place to go.|In my time as a patient of those office I've seen several providers. For the most part they have all been excellent at listening to my description of complaints and working with me to design a treatment program specific to my needs. I am currently seeing Cathy and it's my pleasure to say that her skills and knowledge is exceptional. She takes the time to consider alternate therapies and then goes the extra mile to look into insurance coverage for potential procedures. I am completely comfortable with her as my provider. The fact that the support staff is fantastic is just icing on the cake. Thank you all for the amazing things that you've done for me.|I truly have NEVER seen anything as unprofessional as this place in my entire life.  I myself am a medical professional It was an awful experience that cost me a lot of wasted time.  They treated me as if I was some dope addict from the street.  The md filled a prescription with the pharmacy and refused to correct it I was given 2 appts where the doc was out "sick".  Then I was told by the receptionist not even a med tech that she was giving me permission to take meds.  Go somewhere else.  These people r the bottom of the barrel.  Find a professional and this practice is not it!!!  I gave the 1 star but it does not rate that|First off, all of the staff have all been super friendly and helpful each time I have come for a visit. Dr. Ju is also really nice, very knowledgeable, and takes pride in his work which I really appreciate. He very quickly pinpointed the source of my pain, and tested that his hypothesis was truly correct (it was). Now we are moving forward with longer term relief options, and I am excited about being mostly pain-free again with his help!|I'm amazed at some of te reviews here.
Some make me wonder if the reviewer is just angry about every place they go.

I've been treated here for 4-5 at least, through multiple doctors & multiple staff. The only bad experience I've had or seen is right after the place was purchased and went under a new ownership.
During that transition phase things were a bit chaotic, but it wasn't because of the staff or doctors, they were doing the best they could. (Yes, I too had a

I have witnessed however, more than once, where a patient came in the door with a nasty attitude that radiated from them to everyone in the waiting room. I've seen them start out with an attitude toward the staff, and I've seen the staff just take it and remain professional. I seen/heard these type of patients start out with a combative or "the world revolves around me attitude".
I've over heard some of these patients in adjoining rooms or a hallway, very clearly (and loudly) interrupting the doctor, unwilling to even listen to what he/she is saying, & displaying demanding, entitled attitudes, and the moment they meet any hesitation to meet their demands, I've seen/heard them go into the "offended" victim mode, and I've gotten the strong impression that they were going to be very vocal to everyone they know, everyone that would listen, about "how horribly they were treated".

I haven't witnessed this kind of behavior at this place for a good while now, so I'm thinking maybe a majority of those patients have moved on when they weren't able to dictate their own treatment, and their displays were met by Dr Ju's, no-nonsense, "I refuse to break the rules and put you at risk by caving to your demands" demeanor.

I've also personally, firsthand, had situations where I didn't understand something, or had questions about potential treatment & didn't have all the information, or even questioned Dr Ju's decision/treatment/procedure. Never one time did he react the way some of these reviews suggest.
Even in those times I was questioning, not understanding, or in painful frustration, I tried to show him/them the same type of respect I prefer to receive myself.
EVERY ONE of those times, Dr Ju was willing to listen  AND CONSIDER what I had to say, ask, question or explain. He truly wanted to understand my concerns, questions, conditions and needs.
He was willing to explain his thoughts, reasoning, decisions & treatments.
With both of us being willing to ask questions, RESPECTFULLY confront misunderstandings or confusion.... with both of us willing to explain our thought process and reasons, we've been able to understand boast his treatments & reasons AND my conditions, concerns & needs much better. That has resulted in finding FAR better medications and solutions for my specific needs. Quite frankly, it's resulted in the best pain management I've ever had.

I realize no one is perfect, everyone can have a bad day or whatever. I realize that sometimes a patient doesn't get what they expected or deserved.
I acknowledge that some of the negative reviews may be 100% legit. I know I've certainly experienced some very poor service & treatment at OTHER pain centers/doctors. So I know firsthand it can happen, & what it's like.
(especially if you have to change doctors/locations and all they look at is the medication you're seeking refilled, with no knowledge of your conditions, treatment history, what's been tried & failed, etc. and they treat you as if you're just another junkie trying to get pills for your next buzz or quick cash...)

Yes, I understand that stuff happens, patients do encounter such nonsense....
But I've never encountered that with Dr Ju, I've never seen/heard anyone else treated that way by him, or his staff.
In fact, I've personally experienced the exact opposite.

So yes I do recommend this center & doctors. I also recommend people listen to the doctor, ask questions, show the respect you want to receive, and realize/trust his decisions are in your best interest.|Dr Ju and the staff were amazing. They were incredibly friendly and prompt. Dr Ju spent about 45 minutes with me teaching and developing a plan to help manage my chronic lower back pain. I can't recommend the team at National Spine and Pain in Cary enough.|I'm glad my mom got her refund from this place two years ago. I definitely would not recommend taking anybody to this management center. When I took my mother her at 1:30pm, it was a horrible experience. First, we had to wait over forty five minutes until she had to be examined for back pain. Secondly, when she got into the back room for examination, they would not give her what she wanted, like prescription medications for her back. My mom was fed up with this poor treatment along with the regular check up procedure including lifting her leg up. It was so obvious that neither the receptionists nor the doctors cared about her needs. That wasn't godly at all. As a matter of fact, we Shook the dust off our feet, and went somewhere else for change. Like I said before, I definitely would never recommend this place for a visit any time soon. This is poor business and unprofessional, so... we definitely would not want to waste time with this so-called service. Let those doctors and receptionists play the victim all they want, but at the end of the day, they reap what they sow. I'm sorry it took me two years to post reviews. Have a good day.

column3:
Atrium Health Lincoln Pain Management serves Lincolnton, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating a wide spectrum of chronic and acute pain conditions that impact daily life. As part of the renowned Atrium Health network, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief and improve their quality of life.

At our state-of-the-art facility, we address numerous pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Arthritis

  • Muscle and joint pain

  • Nerve pain

  • Neuropathy

  • Post-surgical pain

Advanced Treatment Options

Our board-certified providers utilize evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Treatment options include:

  • Interventional procedures: Joint injections, nerve block injections

  • Neuromodulation: Spinal cord and peripheral nerve stimulation

  • Therapeutic treatments: Botox, massage therapy

  • Medication management: Customized pharmaceutical approaches

Integrated Care Approach

As part of the Atrium Health family, our patients benefit from seamless access to a broader network of specialists when needed. This integrated approach ensures comprehensive care for even the most complex pain conditions.

Patient Information

We accept most insurance policies and are committed to making quality pain management accessible. Our clinic is conveniently located at 1585 Forney Creek Pkwy, Suite 1200, Denver, NC 28037.

Don't wait in pain any longer. Contact us at (704) 801-1760 to schedule your appointment or visit us online at atriumhealth.org for more information.
column11: At Atrium Health Lincoln Pain Management, we specialize in helping patients manage their pain, including back and neck pain, arthritis, muscle and joint pain, nerve pain, neuropathy, and more. Located in Lincolnton, NC, our board-certified providers offer a wide variety of treatment options including joint injections, nerve block injections, spinal cord and peripheral nerve stimulation, Botox, massage, medication and medication management, and other services. And as part of the Atrium Health family, you'll have access to more specialized care if it's needed. Don't wait in pain any longer. Call us to make an appointment. Most insurance policies are accepted.
column38: N White|Kristina|Adam Nygren|Toni Johnson|Dana calloway|Chris Fredell|Lenora Salvetti|Chrystal Druckemiller
column40:
Dr. Costello is an exceptional physician who provides excellent care to his patients. His gentle demeanor and informative approach make patients feel at ease during procedures, such as injections. He takes the time to explain the process thoroughly and ensures that patients are comfortable throughout. Overall, Dr. Costello's expertise and compassionate bedside manner make him a highly recommended doctor for anyone seeking quality medical care.|They called me to see if I was coming back to see them. I was a new patient and I have high blood pressure because of nerve damage and she wanted me to go er and I been in the er 3x in one week. I had a little migraine because of the rain of driving in it. I  was trying to get help with my pain for my blood pressure to go down to be told I need to go to the er. How can my BP go down without help from them. Now they called to reschedule me but I told them I want someone else and I got hang up on very rude. Very rude people and don't care about you.|Complete waste of time and money. I was referred here by my primary care doctor. I didn't even get to see a doctor, I saw a nurse practitioner.

They did absolutely nothing to help alleviate my pain. In fact, when I ask the nurse what I was supposed to do between now and the next appointment, which will be at least a month away, she just looked at me. I asked her,. I just supposed to sit with this excruciating pain in the meantime and her answer was literally yes..

What kind of health care professional says that to a patient? I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone. This is my first time with atrium health and if this is the way they treat their patients it will probably be my last.|This is not concerning Dr. Ava or her staff.
. This is concerning the lady that books the appointments. This is not the first time this certain lady has been rude to me. Very unprofessional.  I told her that she was rude and she added it to my chart that I was the rude one which is not correct. You can't just talk to people anyway you want. Dr Ava and all her staff are great and they do everything they can to help their patients.|I've Keeney had any problems with anything and Dr. Costello is wonderful of giving my injections! He's great! And the staff is great!|Dr. Costello and staff at the pain clinic are fantastic. Josh at the front desk is always happy, kind, considerate, and helpful. Dr. Costello is attentive, passionate, and wants to help reduce the pain of his patients.|Very argumentative staff. They put you in a room and go to the nurses work area to get on their cell phone. If you use the Denver location take a double dose of your blood pressure medication!|My experience has been ok there

column3:
Novant Health Pain Management - Thomasville serves patients throughout Thomasville, North Carolina and surrounding Davidson County communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic, acute, and post-surgical pain conditions. With a team of board-certified pain specialists and advanced practice providers, we develop personalized treatment plans that address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain management.

At our Thomasville location, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management options, and integrative approaches to pain relief. Our specialists are experienced in treating various conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain related to cancer treatments. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and therapeutic techniques to identify and address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our team takes time to listen to each patient's concerns and goals. Our multidisciplinary approach may include collaborations with physical therapists, behavioral health specialists, and other medical providers to ensure comprehensive care. We emphasize minimally invasive treatments whenever possible and focus on improving function and quality of life while reducing reliance on opioid medications.

Visit Our Clinic

Located at 211 Old Lexington Rd, Thomasville, NC 27360, our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology for pain management procedures. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (336) 474-7922. For detailed information about our practice and to access patient resources, visit our website at www.novanthealth.org/locations/clinics/pain-management-thomasville. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all members of our community.

column40:
Lori and the nurses were very helpful and kind to me. I was terrified to go to pain management and they really helped put me at ease. I appreciate all of their help and their knowledge. I like that they are no nonsense as well because I don't want to be in a place that just caves to people who try to push their weight around. They truly care about not making the opioid epidemic worse.|I'm giving it two stars because of the information below.
If I had to rate just the doctor I would give her five stars.

I've been on hold for almost 45 minutes.
I even called the Lexington office and was on hold for 30 minutes till I just gave up !!! SMH
They finally answered the phone and they told me they were having computer problems so she had to reboot the system but I would think if no phone calls are coming in or something you would notice it right away I am so not impressed with this and it's not the first time this has happened !!!
I'm so mad right now !!!

As for Lori she is a amazing !!! She's very nice, she's very knowledgeable, she pays attention to all the details and she jumps on everything that needs to be done immediately.
I don't know why so many people complained in the past maybe it was a different doctor.
If you want to see a great doctor this is the person you need to go see.

You definitely will not regret it and you will not find another doctor as good as her.

I even drive 1 hour to see her because she's so good.|I've only been going to the pain clinic for a short while but so far everyone has been very friendly and I can get an appointment in a short period of time. The nurse practitioner Lori Love put me on 3 medications on my first visit which has helped me so far. She also made a schedule for me to get spinal injections which I'm very excited about getting. None of my medications are narcotics or opioids which I'm happy about. They only mask the pain by altering how your brain perceives the pain. I believe that the shots will act on the source of the pain. So far I'm loving the experience at the pain clinic.|The only reason I'm giving them two stars is because of the kindness of the nurse we had. Otherwise, they treated my grandmother like a drug addict who needed to be monitored constantly. I must note, my grandmother barely takes the pain pills prescribed to her. If I see her taking one, I know that she is in extreme pain and really needs it. Not once had she ever abused her medication. It is also worth noting that they wanted her to come in for spontaneous drug tests. Due to my grandmother's condition, she is not always able to get out of bed. Yet, they told her if they called, she would have to come in that day, no matter how she felt. All in all, it was a ridiculous experience and we will not be going back. My grandmother was so upset with how she was made to feel.|Lori Love told me to forget all the issues with my lower back. Wanted to give me injections which I did not want. She is a quack and should not be allowed to practice. Will never go back.|HORRIBLE! Loreen Morris insulted my niece. She yelled. She made a fist. And she had no idea who she was talking to. She should be FIRED. I can't believe a good organization like Novant would keep a terrible employee like this around.|Never go to this facility!!!!! The nurse's are dumb and you only see a PA WHO don't know her ass from a hole in the ground....they will violate HIPPA BY TALKING TO YOU IN OF WHOLE LOBBY. WHILE WOUND CARE AND OTHER PAIN MANAGEMENT PATIENTS ARE SITTING THERE. I WILL BE CALLING A LAWYER.|One of my family members had THE WORST experience there. They are extremely disrespectful.
We wish we would have seen all these reviews earlier!!

column3:
Integrated Pain Solutions serves Southern Pines, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services designed to address the root causes of chronic pain. As a premier pain management clinic in Moore County, our team of specialists combines advanced medical techniques with personalized care plans to help patients regain control of their lives. We understand that pain is more than just a physical sensation—it affects your emotional wellbeing, relationships, and overall quality of life.

At Integrated Pain Solutions, we believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach integrates various therapeutic modalities to create customized treatment plans for each patient's unique needs. From interventional procedures to medication management and physical therapy recommendations, we offer comprehensive solutions that address pain at its source while minimizing reliance on opioids whenever possible.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to compassionate care. We Are Real People - Helping Real People - Manage Real Pain. Our specialists take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that align with your goals and lifestyle. We emphasize education, empowering you to participate actively in your recovery journey.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our state-of-the-art facility at 695 S Bennett St in Southern Pines offers advanced diagnostic capabilities and treatment options for various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. We utilize evidence-based interventions such as nerve blocks, epidural injections, radiofrequency ablation, and other minimally invasive procedures to provide effective pain relief.

If you're struggling with chronic pain that affects your daily activities, contact Integrated Pain Solutions at +1 910-687-4888 to schedule a consultation. Visit our website at https://integratedpainnc.com/ to learn more about our services and how we can help you reclaim a life with less pain and more possibilities.
column11: REDUCING PAIN. PROVIDING HOPE. At Integrated Pain Solutions, we understand that pain affects more than just the injured area. It affects your daily life in almost every way. We strive to improve your pain and put you back in control of your day. We Are Real People - Helping Real People - Manage Real Pain.
column38: Robert Jones|Lee Barbee|Jessica King|Chuck & Robin Safrit|Debbie Redmond|Kristi Newton|Jamie Suzanne|Ellyn Worthy
column40: Awesome caring staff. This location, Integrated Pain Solutions in Southern Pines,  offers a group setting on a monthly bases which not only is informative for personal growth but also provides one with an ability to find peer support which is amazing. Highly recommended for those who suffer with chronic pain and sometimes feel as if no one really cares. These folks CARE!|Dr. Reiter is great he really put you at ease and is very skilled with injections. Kimberly Box has been an outstanding provider, she is patient and understanding . My experience with IPS has been great.|The staff here at Integrated Pain Solutions are an absolute pleasure to be in contact with. Since being seen here, I've been able to work after almost 10 years of not being able to. I would highly recommend this office if you're not satisfied with your current Dr or if just trying to find answers for pain or discomfort.|My husband has been treated at IPS in Pinehurst on numerous occasions.  He had back surgery 22 years ago and badly needed a nerve root block injection.  Kim Box provided excellent and timely care and ensured he received treatment quickly.  Dr. Mike Brown is simply the best.  The rest of the staff is professional and took care of our needs.  Thank you so much!|I have been going to this clinic for nearly two years. I have found them to be extremely helpful to me in relieving my pain issues. Dr. Patel is very compassionate as is Ms. Box. I have also seen Ms. Bowen for awhile too, but she moved to their Fayetteville location. They have all been supportive in trying different avenues to relieve my pain, not just sticking with one coarse of treatment. The appointments do sometimes take awhile, but I am ok with that since, when it is my turn to see them, they take their time with me and make sure we have covered everything relevant or that I feel is important to discuss. If you are honest and genuinely there to get pain relief, they will help you. Ms. Box is always kind and compassionate to me, and the treatments I have had with Dr. Patel have been helpful and he is great. They also have yoga classes which you can try and they are on a donation basis for cost, but I live about an hour away so I have not taken part in them because of the distance. But I think it is great that they offer this. I drive all the way from Raleigh to go here and it is worth it to me because of the kindness and care, as well as the effectiveness in helping me reduce and manage my pain.|From start to end everyone there was very rude and treated me as if I was there  just for a prescription. I was asked about my back pain and then continually interrupted, then was told that my medical notes only showed lower back pain. I have had severe back issues for 20+ years and knew that was not true. I went back to my primary physician 2 days later to ask for another suggestion. I also asked what notes were sent over. My doctor read everything off. There were other people in the physician's office that I spoke with that had very similar experiences at IPS|I have been going to IPS for quite some time now and my experiences have almost always been helpful and pleasant. First I went to Jeri who stood behind me 100%. She fought for me and did her very best to help me get the care I needed. Well as she should have , she got promoted and I switched to Kim Box. I've read the reviews on here and I really don't know who stole her name tag the day these reviews were written but Kim has never been anything but kind and respectful. She's attentive, direct, and she listens. I feel like she's really on my side as a patient. I urge anyone who has been to her to give her another chance. Maybe she was having a rough day. IPS has always been by my side since day 1 and I can't imagine going to anyone else for help. Although I look forward to the day I don't need them anymore I'm grateful they are there from Joanne at the front desk to Kim. They are all wonderful people and great medical professionals.  I only gave them a 4 because their phone system is terrible but their new web app does a great job in helping me communicate.|My experience with Kim Box was horrible. I have never been treated so unfairly. She was very rude. She wasnt personal at all. She seemed as though she didnt care for me because I was African American. I was referred to this office because my regular physician couldn't prescribe the quantity of my regular medicine that I had been taking for 10 years. Mrs Box refused to give me my medicine. She treated me as if I was a liar. She actually called me a liar in so many words to my face. She should be in the law enforcement field instead of the medical field. It concerns me that someone like Mrs. Box is in the medical field where she is supposed to help people instead she is trying to treat people like they are addicts

Our specialized medical practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care to address chronic pain conditions affecting the back, neck, joints, and nervous system. Located conveniently in North Durham, our team of board-certified physicians brings decades of combined experience in interventional pain management techniques designed to improve mobility, reduce discomfort, and enhance quality of life.

At Durham Pain & Spine, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Our services include:

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects each person differently. Our physicians take time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and lifestyle factors before developing customized treatment plans. This comprehensive approach ensures we address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain whenever possible.

State-of-the-Art Facility

column40:
The bad reviews are about masks and not getting seen while sick, etc. The providers here are talented and compassionate and they're still willing to treat pain, which is very rare in this anti-opioid-obsessed world. Doctors are being paid money not to prescribe opioids and the govt and DEA are terrorizing physicians who do prescribe them. Despite this, the providers do everything possible to help people live lives full of quality and comfort. Every day that I am able to get up and live a full, active day, I owe gratitude to this clinic.|Went Thursday sick. I paid $68.75 was sent to car. No one came. Went back in and he receptionist said can't see me sick. By Monday my money was gone. He jumped up to hit me because I wouldn't give more money. He yelled at me and upset me so I fell and got hurt in waiting room them threw up from nerves coming home. I still had to pay more money to get another appointment. Very unprofessional! Do not give these people cash money!
As far as the doctors, great but reception staff are thieves!|My mother was referred here by her doctor and she went to check in with the receptionist not wearing a mask and then patients were seated right against one another in a small waiting room! How is this even a doctors office when no precautions are taken at all? She even asked to wait outside because it was crowded and was told no they were not going out there to get her. She felt is was more of a place to get drugs than a place to get help for your spine!!!! Please don't send your elderly loved ones here! We will be letting her MD know to not refer anyone else here.|Dr. Cross listened to me, he didn't make me feel like I wanted medication for any other reason than to have a better quality of life. There are also rules to go by when receiving the medications. Those rules are not hard, but he is very serious about them. No surprises, he lays it all out on your first visit. I really like him.|I've been going to Durham Pain and Spine for about a year and a half. I've always been treated nicely. The staff and the Dr's I have dealt with have been wonderful. I'd recommend this place to anyone that needs help.|Harry Cross is a delight to work with
Great doctor. Good personality.|Very nice staff and Dr's. Fast service.  All around pleasant experience,  Highly recommend this place.|Front desk workers are lazy. Very unprofessional.  They are on THEIR personal phones.

Neurology & Pain Management Center in Sanford, NC provides comprehensive neurological care and pain management services to patients throughout Lee County and surrounding areas. Our dedicated team of board-certified neurologists and pain specialists combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to address a wide range of neurological conditions and chronic pain disorders. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving patients' quality of life through evidence-based approaches and compassionate care.

At Neurology & Pain Management Center, we offer specialized care for conditions including:

- Migraine and headache disorders

- Neuropathic pain syndromes

- Spinal disorders and back pain

- Multiple sclerosis management

- Seizure disorders and epilepsy

- Movement disorders including Parkinson's disease

- Stroke recovery and rehabilitation

Advanced Treatment Options

Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and treatment modalities including:

- Electromyography (EMG) and nerve conduction studies

- Interventional pain procedures

- Medication management

- Physical therapy coordination

- Cognitive behavioral therapy for pain management

- Minimally invasive procedures

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of neurological conditions and chronic pain.

Contact Information

Address: 1212 Central Dr #101, Sanford, NC 27330, United States

New patients are welcome, and most major insurance plans are accepted. Please call our office to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management and improved neurological health.

column38: Ricky Glenn|Shannon Butner|Debra Sparks|Dare Devil|Cyndilu Who|Robert Keith|CJ D|Mary Fortenberry
column40:
I have been going to this office for over nine years.   All of the care providers have always been super nice,  take time to understand my concerns and always provide very satisfactory care.   I am often seen earlier than my appointment and rarely wait more than 15 minutes.   Different individuals have worked the front desk over the years but all have treated me respectful and courteously.|There was a mix up with my appointment because I originally cancelled the appointment due to the poor reviews I had read but I received a confirmation text on Monday to confirm my appointment. I called the office as soon as I received the text to see if I was still scheduled for a Tuesday afternoon appointment, I was told I was still scheduled for an appointment and to arrive 30 minutes early. I decided to go to the appointment and give the office a chance. When I arrived for my appointment 30 minutes early, the front desk person was originally rude but as we kept talking she become friendlier and polite. She said that she did not have me down for an appointment, I explained that someone the day before confirmed I was still on the schedule. That time slot had not been filled so she put me back on the schedule and had me fill out the new patient forms. I finished the forms 10 minutes before my appointment. The PA sent the nurse upfront to tell me my appointment would have to be rescheduled because it was scheduled for 3:15. I explained to her it was 3:05. She said she would talk to the Pa but the front office person said she would not see me. I would need to reschedule. I explained I had originally cancelled the appointment due to the bad reviews but decided to give them a chance.  I did not reschedule. If I could write this review without having to submit one star I would. I never write reviews but this was the worse experience at any doctor's office I have ever encountered. I would not recommend this facility at all!!!|I have been a patient at the Sanford location for a couple of years. I have no negative complaints. Neema has always been very nice and professional. She has worked with me and, keeps my pain level tolerable. If any changes in my condition, she tries her best to help. I really appreciate the time she takes to listen. I have never had more than a 15 min wait.|I would otherwise give this facility a five, but the receptionist makes me want to give it zero stars. She is cold, rude, and sometimes makes me feel like a child who is being scolded, despite me always being polite and following the instructions asked of me. Sanford is much closer for me, but I go the extra distance to Lillington simply so I can avoid the Sanford receptionist. Recently I had to drop something off at the Sanford office, took my son with me, and he said as soon as the lady looked up at him, he knew she was the mean one I had warned him about.
I certainly understand customer service jobs are NOT EASY, and I am not taking away from this, however, when I mentioned this issue to the staff in Lillington, they said they heard this complaint many times before me. That is telling, if you ask me.
Please consider getting a receptionist like the staff in Lillington. They are incredible! Also, every other member in Sanford is amazing and makes me feel cared for!! It is only the main receptionist who makes me waste my time and gas simply to avoid her. Sad.|I have been going to them for a while and the Sanford office has been nothing but very kind to me and professional. I have never waited longer than 30 min for my appointment and my dr gives me all the time I need during the appointment. It is never rushed. They treated my mother and she recommended them to me. Now the parking is brutal at times but manageable. It all depends of the appointment time. They have several offices throughout the area. And I have experienced wait issues and staff problems from other locations but not at the Sanford office. So.....other than that. I am very happy/pleased with them.|I have been at this clinic for over 5 years. Sure there are times you wait longer than 15 mins but overall I am seen within 30 mins. On the flip side to the wait, the PA takes her time with me and makes sure I am good before she leaves. They don't rush me out like other clinics do.... As far as the Staff, they have been very understanding and have treated me with respect. People come there in pain and are not the nisest people to be around. So for those that say the Staff is rude, I can say that has not been my experience|They are so rude every single visit. If I could give them a zero I would. They don't care about the patient at all .You always wait at least 45 minutes. Just to wait for the PA in the back. They told me they sent my prescriptions to my pharmacy but when I called the pharmacy they had nothing. I asked the PA for my prescription at the appointment and she made herself very clear. She HAD sent them over. Treating me with such anger like how dare I ask her again. So when I called the pharmacy and they did not have it. I called the office and they told me oh she sent you with a written prescription.  While laughing at me in the background. Finally she sighed and said ok I'll send you an email prescription over. I've went in for tests and came back for my results. They didn't have them!!! They did this twice then finally told me oh we will call you. They NEVER did and when I asked at my next appointment the PA became angry and told me she had talked to me about them. Which isn't true. We are looking for a new neurologist and if you read this you should too. Only send someone you hate here .|First off, the lady at the desk is very very rude. The doctor or PA whoever it is I see talks 5 minutes and gives me my pain medicine and that's it. I am not pleased with this place at all anymore. The parking is terrible. I do not recommend this place.

column3:
Duke Raleigh Pain Clinic in Raleigh, North Carolina is a premier pain management center dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs. Located within the Duke Health network, our clinic leverages cutting-edge research and evidence-based approaches to improve quality of life and restore function for residents throughout the Triangle region.

At Duke Raleigh Pain Clinic, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-invasive treatments designed to target the source of your pain. Our specialists provide expert care for conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. We also specialize in perioperative pain management, helping patients control pain before, during, and up to 90 days after surgical procedures to improve outcomes and recovery experiences.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our team takes the time to listen to your concerns and develop treatment strategies that align with your goals. Our multidisciplinary approach may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative techniques to provide comprehensive relief and improved function.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at (919) 954-3584. We're conveniently located at 3404 Wake Forest Rd, Suite 300, Raleigh, NC 27609. For more information about our services, visit our website at dukehealth.org.
column11: The pain management specialists at Duke Raleigh Pain Clinic provide personalized care to relieve pain and improve your quality of life and function. This includes care to help you control pain before, during, and up to 90 days after a surgical procedure.
column38: A B|Doug Fischer|Barbara McGrew Hedman|Jeff Cobb|Rene|David Brown|Darlene55|Jeannene Nester
column40:
This is more about the tv show they have playing in the waiting area. It's not appropriate to push politics in a doctors office. It's not on silent and not everyone wants to be forced to hear this while waiting for a doctor. Put it on silent or change to something normal like most offices. This is not the time or place for this.|Beware, this clinic bills itself as a hospital. This is an extremely important detail because 9/10 insurance companies bill differently for this tax ID  (the patient is responsible to pay more in this situation if the deductible has not been met).
The reason I'm rating 1 star is not my experience in office, but because I called Duke billing PRE-PROCEDURE to ensure I was covered, which they stated I would be in full. Was later charged $3500 for a steroid injection (which my insurance didn't fully cover, left with over $1000 bill, solely because this clinic bills itself as a hospital).
Hope this saves at least 1 person money.|I have always had great care with Duke Hospital clinics until my recent experience with this particular clinic. The staff is not consistent with their providers and their policies such as counting pills upon follow up visits. I experienced 11 visits and saw 6 different providers making it challenging to build a relationship with a provider. I was humiliated during my last and final visit. Situation is too long to write about but the front desk clerk is not properly trained to handle patients who are upset and did not know the protocol for finding a member of the leadership staff to handle a sensitive patient. The providers never offered other avenues for pain management, just medication. I will not be returning. However, I will note that the nurse staff are excellent and compassionate.|My wife goes to this clinic and sees Doctor Smith. They have given her first class service. The staff as well as Dr Smith are compassionate and extremely proficient. I would (and have) recommended this clinic to anybody in pain. I am blown away by the bad reviews posted. Our experience has been excellent. This does not mean my wife is no longer in pain. It means this group has made the pain more manageable. There is no cure for most cronic pain.|Clearly they're in it for the money, because they no nothing about CHRONIC PAIN!
You can read  about PAIN all day everyday but you will never no what it's like! Dogs are treated better than humans in pain.|I've been going to this pain clinic for over 10 years!!
I've had 4 back surgeries and scheduled for a 5th next month.  I've taken Zanaflex for 8 years, written by this clinic.  Since they took away my pain medication because of this "crackdown", I've been trying to just get if from the back doctors I'm still seeing or primary care, but it's always written 1 month at a time.  So I figured I'd go back and get it filled there where it's been filled for 8 years.  When I called, woman was very abrupt, saying I hadn't been in for 8 months and  couldn't even be seen because I was considered a new patient!!  Duke is just hell bent on screwing the people over that need the help the most.  I mean, this is not a narcotic, but a "short"  acting muscle relaxer.  Its ridiculous!!  For "pain management", this is NOT the place to go!!|I have been a client of this clinic for some time now. Have not been satisfied since the practice who had been there left to establish a clinic in Wake Forest. Since Duke's doctor's have taken over the clinic I've had a different care provider every time I have had an appointment. There's no way you can establish a relationship with your caregiver.|I have gone there two times,  and was treated very well.  The doctor didn't rush me and listened to me.  My nurse was very understanding and caring.  I've been to plenty of doctors and so far this practice is really the best.

Neurology and Pain Management Center in Morrisville, NC offers comprehensive neurological care and pain management services to patients throughout the Triangle region. Established with a patient-centered approach, our clinic combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment protocols to address a wide spectrum of neurological conditions and chronic pain disorders. Our board-certified specialists bring decades of collective experience to provide personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At the Neurology and Pain Management Center, we diagnose and treat various neurological disorders including migraines, epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, neuropathy, and movement disorders. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic tools that enable precise assessment and monitoring of neurological functions. We emphasize both interventional treatments and holistic approaches to manage symptoms and improve quality of life.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our pain management specialists address acute and chronic pain conditions through multidisciplinary approaches. We offer treatments ranging from medication management and nerve blocks to advanced interventional procedures and physical therapy coordination. Our team works diligently to identify the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, creating sustainable relief strategies for our patients.

Patient-Focused Experience

We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and valued. Our staff coordinates care with primary physicians and specialists to ensure continuity across all aspects of treatment. New patients typically receive comprehensive evaluations during their first visit, establishing the foundation for effective long-term care relationships.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 919-234-6016 or visit our website at http://neurologyandpain.org/. Our clinic is conveniently located at 6402 McCrimmon Pkwy, Morrisville, NC 27560, with accessible parking and proximity to major highways serving the greater Raleigh-Durham area.

column38: Ashley Curry|tye hamlin|Amar Bhattarai|Kevin L|Charlie Tate|Andrea Bailey|Eckland Maynard|M J
column40:
I visited this neurology office throughout 2023 after I started having seizures in late 2022. Dr. Dave was never an empathetic ear for me during my visits with him and he would rarely talk to me for even 5 minutes during my appointments, consistently interrupting me throughout. During my 2nd visit last April, he requested that a nurse draw my blood. This nurse, and the entirety of his nursing and admin staff, was very kind and made me feel heard during all of my visits. However, after drawing my blood, she requested that I hold the first vial of my blood while she filled a 2nd vial. Being squeamish around blood, holding the hot vial made me incredibly woozy and nauseous. I told the nurse this and she said I looked pale so she ran to get me some water. While she was gone, I vomited in the sink. The nurse came back and was very empathetic. However, she was shooed out by Dr. Dave and he took this as an opportunity to scold me for being so anxious. I apologized before he said anything, then Dr. Dave said, "You cannot go through life with this level of stress and anxiety. If you continue like this, you WILL feel like you are 55 years old when you turn 40. You cannot keep going like this," before quickly leaving the room. To me, this was a disproportionate reaction to what happened, and in that moment, I needed his help and empathy which he provided me with neither. I saw Dr. Dave once more before switching to another provider at this same office, just to explain to him the effect his words had on me as they were swimming around my head for weeks. When I confronted Dr. Dave a month or two later, he dismissed my words and DID NOT apologize in any way, shape, or form. This was appalling behavior to me as I was in tears talking to him about how this made me feel. His main response was that I "didn't understand what he meant by that." The provider I saw after Dr. Dave wasn't much better and I was very unhappy with the care provided to me from this office until my last visit in late 2023. I moved back to Western North Carolina in 2024 and the care that I've received here is night and day compared to this office. As I said, the admin and nursing staff here (especially Crystal, she is the hero of that office) were always empathetic and willing to help in any way they could. However, I was more than disappointed with the doctors in this office and how little they seem to care about some patients.|If I could give this place a -0 rating I would my experiences with this place has been horrific no compassion whatsoever I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Total waste of
my time energy and money and for what
absolutely Nothing! These folks have no care in the world about me as a patient and having a background in healthcare I have never and would have never worked in this field if my heart wasn't in it and for some if not most of the staff here they need to go work somewhere they can play in the field like a park and pray one day they're never in need of any kind of care because God don't like ugly and ugly is all you'll receive going to this place.|My experience with them was extremely disappointing. Right from the start, they were unwelcoming and treated me rudely, which made me feel uncomfortable and unwanted.

Adding to the frustration, they never picked up their phone when I tried to reach out. It was impossible to get any updates on my reports or even have a simple conversation with them.

They made false promises of calling me back the next day but never followed through. The level of customer service was shockingly poor, making it one of the worst experiences I've had.|Wow this clinic is really professional Alan the PA is really informative and attentive to your needs she even requested blood work to check my kidneys and liver, which is something doctors should do when your on long term meds. Also my experience with Crystal who runs the office was great as well wonderful person, Both had great bed side manner. which is important when your not feeling well.|In contrast to the scathing review above, I was treated as I would have expected for a walk-in cold contact - the receptionist/scheduler was professional, courteous, and pleasant.  My contact and insurance info was taken on the spot, and  I left with an appointment card (for within a week) and instructions on how to proceed.
As appropriate, I'll post comments after my actual consultation with the doctor and/or PA.|Omg , I love the staff at this Morrisville office ! Very professional and understanding, they really make you feel like family not just a patient! I would highly recommend this office to the world if I could ! I've dealt with Mrs kristal , mr Wagner and Mrs Judy.. even tho I am young they still respect as a young lady knowing the situation I've been in ! I would give 12 stars if I could !|Incredibly rude staff. I should've trusted my instincts after being spoken to disrespectfully over the phone TWICE. I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt. And no, the reason for this bad review isn't because I'd have to pay upfront even though my insurance covered my visits there, which is information that could have been given over the phone if the staff CARED enough to give it. ("Ohhh, sweeetie, we don't take Blue Local "*snickers with the rest of the front staff*"Barely anyone takes THAT insurance")  I'd be more than happy to cover those costs, as I am at my current doctor,  if I was spoken to respectfully even ONE time that I spoke with someone there.  I was given no information about that AT all, even though I asked about it. And I was spoken to incredibly disrespectfully every single interaction that I had with them. I'm not even sure why. From the second I called in to make an appointment, to the moment I left, this location was unprofessional and rude. I was stared at with disdain from the moment I walked into their facility and it's completely unacceptable.
The call I got to confirm the appointment was from a woman named Sarah, and it sounded the same as the woman who I saw at the front, but I can't confirm if it was her or not that was rude to me.  I do know that there was a blonde girl directly behind the young lady who was rude to me, that stared at me as if I'd grown a 2nd nose out of my forehead and I'm not exactly sure why.  Take a picture, "Sweetie", it will last longer.|I've been seeing Dr.Dave off and on for a decade now. All I can say, is to disregard the negative reviews that people leave. He, and his entire staff, treat you like a human.....not an addict. I appreciate all that NPMC has done for me. Dr. Dave is a man possessed of prodigious intellectual power. His medicinal capabilities are many.

Our specialized clinic focuses on treating a wide spectrum of chronic and acute pain conditions, providing relief and improved quality of life for patients suffering from persistent discomfort. As part of the respected Atrium Health network, we combine compassionate care with advanced medical techniques to address your specific pain management needs.

At our Mount Holly location, our board-certified providers offer a comprehensive range of treatments for various pain conditions including:

Advanced Treatment Options

Part of the Atrium Health Network

Wake Spine & Pain Specialists: Greensboro serves the Greensboro, North Carolina community with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located at 1511 Westover Terrace, our specialized clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine and other areas of the body. Our team of board-certified physicians brings decades of collective experience in interventional pain management, offering hope to patients who have struggled with persistent pain issues.

At Wake Spine & Pain Specialists, we firmly believe that a multidisciplinary approach is the most effective way to minimize pain and restore functionality. Our treatment protocols address not only the physical manifestations of pain but also consider the psychological and emotional aspects that often accompany chronic pain conditions. This holistic perspective allows us to develop more effective, long-lasting solutions for our patients.

Personalized Treatment Plans

Every patient who walks through our doors receives an individualized pain management strategy. We begin with a thorough assessment to understand the root causes of your pain, then develop a customized treatment plan that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. This comprehensive approach empowers each patient to take back control of their lives and move toward improved function and reduced pain.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our Greensboro clinic is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies that allow us to provide cutting-edge care in a comfortable setting. From fluoroscopy-guided injections to minimally invasive procedures, we offer solutions that target pain at its source while minimizing recovery time and discomfort.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at (336) 398-5155. Our Greensboro office is conveniently located at 1511 Westover Terrace, Greensboro, NC 27408. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at https://wakespine.com/locations/greensboro-pain-clinic/.
column11: The Wake Spine & Pain Specialists acknowledges a multidisciplinary approach is the most effective way to minimize pain and restore functionality. column40:
Drove 20 mins out, had to cancel all my meeting today, was in severe pain, doctor Sakla refused to see me even though I arrived 20 mins prior to my appointment, paid my copay and filled out all necessary paperwork prior to visit. Highly unprofessional will not recommend the facility or provider to anyone.|I had been going here for well over 10 years and was pleased with their service as long as I didn't see Dr. Spivey. He's the rudest, most hateful, doctor I've ever dealt with in my life (and I've seen a lot). The only good thing the people at Wake have done is "let him go". Otherwise, I'll NEVER recommend this place. I went in March for my usual appointment and, without warning, was kicked to the curb. From what I understand everyone taking pain meds got the same treatment. Just as bad the employees weren't warned and neither were the other pain clinics. Such bad business in so many ways. So most of us are desperately trying to find a doctor and can't. I wouldn't take my fish to them. Trust me.. when I find the proper entities, I will report this practice. Whatever happened to "Do No Harm"? Oh snap; money and CYA!|Excellence service, front desk is super polite and very helpful. My MA is always so great and on top of everything. I had an injection and back feels great. Definitely recommend if you are having body pain.|My fiancee has been a patient here for over 10 years and today the new NP dismissed her from the practice all because they didn't like the fact that she takes medication for her anxiety alongside what they prescribe her here. This has never been an issue or brought to her attention as she knows how to take all her medication safely. I seen another review stating another patient was dismissed because the same NP advised her, she needed to go off her pain medication. This is a pain management practice, what are they doing to these poor patients?!?! This is not at all professional and it needs to be addressed. Not to mention that Dr. Spivey retired without even telling his patients. Very unprofessional and very dangerous for anyone who takes medications to abruptly stop. Someone needs to talk to her or us immediately.|My father has been a patient at this location for many years. They've always treated him well. Recently, new ownership converted this clinic to Wake Spine & Pain Specialists. Dad has inoperative spinal damage and lives with incredible pain 24/7. He now suffers from dementia as well. After seeing the same two doctors for many years, he now sees a different physician for every appointment. In light of recent memory loss, this has become very problematic. He has severe anxiety and difficulty preparing for appointments, without having to see a doctor he is not familiar with every month.

I believe the amount of care that any pain patient requires, includes a regular physician who knows their patient's needs. It is difficult enough for an elderly, disabled, and severely injured individual to make it to the clinic every month. The clinic now seems to have more patients than they are able to provide appointments for.  As a result, we sometimes wait more than an hour to see the doctor. An old man who forgets where he is, & can't sit longer than 15 minutes without agonizing pain, deserves better care.

Though we did not care for the arrogant, and rude, Dr Spivey, things don't appear to be getting much better with new ownership. My dad was taking a medication that insurance no longer covers. After asking the doctor to make it clear to the insurance provider, that this is the only medication that works for him (which we discovered these last 2 years), they seem to have forgotten to do so. He is now SUFFERING, day and night, with no relief from pain and confusion. This medication costs $1000/month without insurance. I truly fear for his life as the replacement medicine seems to be a catalyst for his dementia. 

I believe America's healthcare, DEA laws, and insurance companies are doing more harm than good. I hope physicians, and nurses, come to understand the impact they have on all of their paints and continue their personal research in pain management during the opioid crisis.

I am grateful for the care this clinic has provided for my father in the past. I hope this new clinic improve, for the sake of all patients who live in incredible pain.|My overall experience was great and easy to understand. The provider did take the appropriate steps to ensure me of the  best treatment plan needed. Im looking forward to a successful outcome.|My husband started going to this office when it was Preferred Pain Management. We both loved Dr. Spivey and had no clue issues with his staff. Since Wake Spine and Pain took over, it's been nothing but Trouble. Because of slack office/scheduling personnel, my husband is now two months over due for his RFA treatment. He's in excruciating pain and we can't get anyone to refill his meds. We will be looking for a new Pain Center.|I have had great service and help from Wake Spine and Pain Specialists since starting to see them in January 2023. Everyone has treated me well and my provider Jessica Salmon NP has been fantastic. She is compassionate and listens to all my issues. Thanks for great all around service and especially my provider!

column40:
I want to give this practice a 5 I love the doctor's I love love love the nurse practitioner Angela sweet and compassionate...the nurses in the back who work with here are a special breed of person that truly care about their patients the reason I had to give the practice a 1* is because the ladies in the office let down the whole practice.
Why don't they answer the phone....ever...and I don't know if the office ladies get pissed but the never call you back. Never ever . I have anxiety and control it without medication ...after dealing with the office staff I am so frustrated and angry my anxiety is so bad it takes me hours to calm down. I am willing to amend my rating anytime your office staff starts to answer the phones...|My doctor referred me here, and at first, it took over three months just to reach someone. (They were supposed to call me, but never did). Every phone number either says the office is closed, or sends me to a disconnected wireless number. The one working phone number sends me to someone's voicemail, and I left many messages but never gotten a call back.

Update: After these fruitless months, I finally got an appointment. The wait times are long, but I was reasonably pleased with the staff. The nurses were all helpful and friendly, and they did a really good job of addressing my pain issue. One doctor was great, but he's gone. The other, not so much, but he was adequate. Same with the NP I was eventually assigned to. I know they are perfectly qualified, but sometimes NP's seem much more reluctant to try different procedures than doctors. That's been my experience, anyway.|The Nurses would rather Gosip, than treat their, clients.|Ashley the P.A. has finally got my moms pain pretty much under control. We are very satisfied with the level of care Dr. Cain was established here. All the physicians and nurses are great!|I love this place when I started going about 3 years ago I could not hardly walk and they started giving me injections in my back and gave me my life back amazing Drs and staff love them all|||

column11: Chronic pain can cause significant physical, emotional, and financial stress. At Wake Spine & Pain, a top pain management clinic in Winston Salem, our specialists are dedicated to uncovering pain causes and developing innovative treatments. We start with the least invasive options and work toward solutions that offer the most relief with minimal risk.
