column40:
Dr. Faller  and her assistant Cynthia  are  the best for back pain relief! She is a lot more helpful than the first male doctor there that casted me off quickly. I never feel like a burden or a number when I'm treated by her. Dr. Faller and her assistant  Cynthia have great bedside manner and truly cares about her patients. Her compassion and gift of giving great injections/ procedures is rare in the chronic pain world. She is a breath of fresh air and doesn't give up on complex/persistent pain. I highly recommend Dr Faller for any chronic pain patient needing pain management other than medication. She is the person to see!!! Thank you for all your help and the lady at the front checking people in has always  been friendly.|Over the past two months, I have had zero help from this place.  Not sure what happened here, but when I went to the Greensboro location last fall, they were tremendous.  This place is supposed to be a place to go to assist with pain and to help with issues, but this time around, I have never felt so neglected and ignored from any "doctors" office, EVER.  To sum it up:
May 8: requested an appointment online
May 15: FINALLY received a call to schedule
May 29: appointment.  The two individuals I saw before the doctor were nice and attentive and made me feel better than I did during the 2 minutes the doctor spent with me.
They received my MRI results and after a few days I finally called them to see what was going on. Did I need to schedule a follow up? Was someone going to call me? No, I was told the doctor doesn't look at the images until I go in there again. I was told a scheduler would call me back to schedule a procedure... they ensured me someone would call me back.

A couple days later: got a phone call, still waiting on insurance.. whatever I know it takes a while for approval.

FAST FORWARD TO TODAY: JULY 11TH: over TWO MONTHS after my initial communication to get an appointment and get in there to get help and some relief for debilitating headaches and neck pain...
Someone called me to schedule my procedure.
My insurance approval was only good until July 11th.
Since all of this, I've scheduled with an actual neurologist and have gotten the help I needed.
When I told the lady (Marie, Maria(?)) that I went elsewhere and I was so unhappy and wasn't returning.  She said she'd put a note in my file. When I said okay yes you need to do that.....
SHE HUNG UP ON ME.

I AM SO DONE WITH THIS PLACE.
I will make sure every single person that I can share this with will know just how horrible they treat their patients.
Absolutely no empathy at all. It's unbelievable and I'm disgusted by the entire experience.|Drove a full hour to be turned away, when I arrived on time. Don't waste your time scheduling an appointment. You won't be seen.|Thankfully transitioned from Bethany to this office about 3 years ago. Michael Roche takes care of my daily pain management and is terrific, but I also have had the good fortune to visit Dr. Faller (wonderful communicator and gives painless injections), who took the practice over several months ago.  There were uncomfortable adjustments that had to be made but all were for the enhancement of the Dr/patient relationship.  These people are very educated, kind, thorough, experienced and I have to say: even though some days I would like to change the parameters I must adhere to to remain a patient here, I know the quality behind their decisions about my care far exceed my personal opinion.|Coldest most unprofessional doctor I've EVER encountered. Save your time and money. Dr. Rouche has a chip on his obviously not hurting shoulder.|I did not know this practice was for issues over 6 months, chronic pain, they still took me in and came up with a plan for improvement of my pain/discomfort although they could have sent me to another practice that was for my particular immediate issue. Still listened, came up with a plan of action and made me important to them. Thank you|Nancy faller is an excellent provider ! She deserves a raise!|Dr.Faller and office staff are very professional and very involved with their clients. I trust Dr. Faller and have followed her since she has been in my care plan. Office staff is very helpful, supportive and patient with the patients and their families.

column38: Billy Owens|Lillianna Mayo|Karen Midgett|Pamela Colston|Wanda Chandler|Jenna Ferrari|Jonsi Mora|jennifer lynn
column40:
I currently use brier creek pain and spine, However there needs to be disciplinary actions taken on those individuals who would see a person suffer over something as simple that's picking up a phone to talk to me or better yet by calling the patience pharmacy to make sure that that person is taken care of . I could not begin to tell you. How many times I called in just 1 day to speak to a human being but I can tell you. It was more than 20 and a course of 4 and a 1/2 hours. I spoke to somebody who told me that it would be taken care of. And them knowing I was out of medication still left me at the beginning stages detox.|If I could give 0 stars I would. The hours of this facility are not accommodating. Any option you select over the phone leads you to a robot. I've called 5 to 6 different times and never get through to an actual human. I have left messages every single time with my call back number and have yet to receive a call regarding my questions. I am my grandmothers health power of attorney and made it very clear they were to call me to schedule the appointment.
After the 7th time calling and leaving a message, I received a call from Robin, the referral lady. She informed me that they called my senile grandmother instead. (My grandmother has no recollection of this)
At the end of the call Robin hung up abruptly and did not apologize for the multiple inconveniences she had caused my grand mother and I.
Needless to say, this staff and company do not care about their patients nor the people taking time out of their life to take care of their love ones.
I would never recommend this place to anyone.
Oh, and a plus : my grandmother was referred here because she had fractured her back in 3 locations as well as had a collapsed lung. Her primary doctor Agape, does not prescribe pain meds.
So my grand mother has had to live this last month in severe pain, with no idea of when she would be receiving help.
Thank you Greenbrier!|I gave been going there for few years and always been treated with respect and compassion,  I had reconstructive back surgery a full 10 hour surgery and have serious chronic pain issues with 4 rods and screws from top to bottom of back and Billy Smith and Harry Cross always treated me with compassion and found the right medicines that have made my life a little more manageable. I can function more as a person without the chronic pain I was having!! Thanks to both Doctors for making my life alot more functional!!|I had an absolutely horrible experience. The African American woman sitting at the front desk was rude before I could even get started. She said because I was new, I was late because I should have gotten there earlier. I explained I wasn't "new", I transferred from the Garner location. So then she says let me see if the doctor still will take you. She stays in the back for a long time then come back and ask me for my money. I ask first, well is he going to see me? Shakes her head yes. After all of that, the doctor, questions why I have not had a pain stimulator put in my back. I told him because my insurance said I had to have other things first!! NOW LISTEN UP ALL MY AFRICAN AMERICAN PEOPLE BECAUSE HERES THE KICKER, he looks at me and says don't you have Medicaid? I answer no and tell him what I have. He then says what is that insurance? I answer it's through the hospital. He asks Oh you work at the hospital? I answer, No my HUSBAND does, he's a doctor. He then says, well there's not much more I can do for you!! So yes, I have filed a complaint against this doctor and this establishement. Horrible, horrible experience!!!|My husband has been going to Greenville Pain and Spain for many years. We love Joanne!!!! She takes time to explain all aspects of his health and pain management. He has a very rare form of cancer.....most oncologists have not heard of it. He was the first patient at the Leo Jenkins Cancer Center to ever have it! She researched it until she understood his diagnosis. She has been so sympathetic to his situation and continues to try to think of things that may help him. Mrs.Joanne is a very caring but professional person. I've read some of the comments and it sounds like to me, most people do not understand the new NC laws pertaining to pain meds. We have had experiences with 2 other pain clinics and they ALL count your pills. They are held accountable for someone taking their medication incorrectly! Not only can they loose their license, but could face jail time if they don't follow every letter of the new laws!! One Office we went was like they were herding cattle....the huge waiting room was always full....we waited anywhere from 3-5 hours EVERY time!! At Greenville Pain and Spine we have never waited over 30 minutes!!  The only thing that I think they could improve on is their phone system. But Joanne told me to use their "my chart" app to send her messages...it is called Healow. It works much better!! If you have an issue, just discuss it with your provider. There may be a reason or a solution. I thank God for all the help with my husband's pain!!|When I first started going to Greenville pain and spine I loved it. I attended this office for almost 2 years. It was quite to distance from me but I didn't mind traveling just to be under their care. One time I caught the flu and had to reschedule and they called me a week worth of meds in so that I wouldn't have to go without them on top of being sick with the flu, another time my tire blew on the way there and they are very strict on there 15 minutes late at most policy so I rescheduled for the following day and everything in my eyes was fine. Almost a year later my son picked up a stomach bug which all of us had the weekend before so I called them to let them know I was going to have to reschedule only to be told that if I rescheduled, I would be discharged. I had to carry my 2 year old son with me on a 2.5 hour drive with him puking just not to be discharged from there. The last time I went to this office on my drive there we ran into a fatal car accident where they weren't letting any traffic through, I called them immediately to let them know what was going on and see if maybe they could give me an extra hour as there was no way I'd be there within their strict 15 minute policy. Once again was told if I wasn't there I would be discharged, the receptionist shakenna, is rude constantly, she always acted as if she completely hated her job and would take it out on her patients by being rude and judgemental to everyone. Even though I was told I would be discharged I still drove the entire way there to see if there was anything I could do, Shakenna refused to let me see my doctor, I asked for a last prescription as the withdrawal effects of my medication are very serious and shakenna very rudely told me no, as I walking out to leave the medical assistant at the time stopped me and said Joann is going to write a prescription for you if you'll just have a seat in reception and wait. So I sat there waiting for them and sobbing as I felt so mistreated and I hadn't done anything wrong, when she handed me the prescription it was for half my regular dosage, and half the amount I would normally take. They only lasted a little over a week. I left that practice feeling right abused. I transferred over to the office Tracey Smith new location and I've never been happier with them. No more dealing with people who are rude. The receptionist there Shakenna should be fired. She is not a people person and should not work with the public. I later figured out I was discharged because they had a few to many patients and because I had medicaid I wasn't a big enough profit for them. I don't want a doctor who sees me as a paycheck I want a doctor to genuinely cares for me and my well being and health.|Joanne is the best doctor I have ever had! They have the best staff, the most caring an understanding women I've ever met!|I'm writing this review for the fact I can't believe anyone would have anything bad to say about Mrs.joanne! She is the type you do your part and she does hers! I will never forget how valued she has made me feel in times in need..she also has a line she draws to those who takes her kindness for weakness..I love her as if she was my mom..in my eyes an  in disguise..I could go on and on about her kindness and generosity! Best one there in my book!

column2: Advanced Sports & Spine - Pain Management Charlotte, NC
column3:
Advanced Sports & Spine serves the Charlotte, NC area with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to address a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions. Established in 2016, this specialized medical practice has built a reputation for its holistic approach to treating chronic and acute pain. Under the expert guidance of physiatrist Dr. Usman Ahmad, patients receive personalized care plans that combine exercise regimens, dietary recommendations, medical interventions, and innovative pain management techniques designed to target the underlying causes of discomfort rather than merely masking symptoms.

At Advanced Sports & Spine, we believe in addressing the root cause of pain to restore your quality of life. Our integrated treatment protocols combine:

- Exercise rehabilitation programs customized to your specific condition

- Nutritional guidance to reduce inflammation and support healing

- Medical management using evidence-based approaches

- Interventional procedures that target pain at its source

Specialized Services

Our practice offers a range of advanced treatments including:

- Regenerative Medicine: PRP and stem cell therapy for sports injuries

- Radiofrequency Ablation: For long-lasting pain relief

- Diagnostic Services: Comprehensive evaluation of spine arthritis

- Nerve Testing: Precise identification of nerve-related conditions

- Therapeutic Injections: Including occipital nerve blocks and joint injections

Conditions We Treat

Whether you're suffering from persistent back pain, debilitating neck discomfort, knee problems, or shoulder injuries, our specialized team provides expert care for all musculoskeletal conditions. Our goal is not just pain relief but helping you return to an active, fulfilling lifestyle.

Visit our state-of-the-art facility at 8035 Providence Rd Suite 340, Charlotte, NC 28277, or call us at +1 704-444-0598 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at [advancedsportsandspine.com](https://www.advancedsportsandspine.com/?utmsource=google&utmmedium=organic&utm_campaign=gmb).
column9: Alternative medicine practitioner|Anesthesiologist|Medical clinic|Medical office|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Physiatrist|Sports medicine clinic
column11: Advanced Sports & Spine, established in 2016, is a Charlotte-based pain management practice in Charlotte, NC, dedicated to helping patients alleviate pain and discomfort. With a holistic approach, our physiatrist, Dr Usman Ahmad, combines exercise, diet, medical, and interventional pain management sessions to address the root cause of the pain and restore your quality of life. We offer regenerative medicine treatments such as PRP and stem cell therapy for sports injuries in addition to radiofrequency ablation, diagnosis of spine arthritis, nerve tests, occipital nerve blocks, joint injections, and more. If you are experiencing any musculoskeletal condition (back pain, neck pain, knee pain, shoulder pain, etc.), visit us in Charlotte, NC.
column38: Megan|Dorena Brayboy|Precious B|theresa oursler|NL3 Training|C7 Soccer|Brian Weaver|Carter Schanck
column40:
Dr. Ahmad is fantastic! I have a chronic leg issue that I have seen countless doctors and physical therapists for over the last several years and he is by far the best that I've seen. Not only does he thoroughly review and consider your history, he also listens and takes the time to explain things to you in a way that makes sense and is easy to understand. I never feel rushed when I am speaking with him, the way I do with so many other doctors. He approaches my treatment with a curiosity and willingness to explore options in a way that intuitively feels like the right way to go about this, and leaves me  feeling hopeful that I will finally find some relief. He also acts quickly and making appointments is both easy and also convenient. I truly cannot express how wonderful my experience has been here so far, and I highly recommend anyone considering coming here for treatment to please do so!

Additionally, Tasha and the other woman who manage the front office (I'm sorry I don't know her name!) are just as sweet as can be and also incredibly helpful when making appointments and arranging logistics. Such an amazing exprerience all around, which really means a lot when you've been dealing with an issue for years and are experiencing appointment fatigue. Thank you so much.|I have one word to describe my experience with Advanced Sport & Spine it was "Fantastic!"
The staff is great, friendly and knowledgeable. Dr Ahmed took time to listen to my problem and did not rush through the appointment. He knew exactly what I needed to help with the problem I was having. I would recommend this practice to family and friends. Thank you for getting me though this rough patch.|I adore Doctor. Ahmad, he is such a treasure! I do not mind traveling 30 minutes to visit him. I am writing to express my sincere gratitude for the exceptional care you provided during my recent visit. Your expertise in sports medicine and your compassionate approach have made a significant difference in my recovery process.

I was particularly impressed by your ability to truly listen to my concerns and thoroughly understand my medical history. Unlike previous experiences, I felt genuinely heard and valued as a patient. Your attentive demeanor created a comfortable and trusting environment, which allowed me to openly discuss my symptoms and goals.

I was also very satisfied with the comprehensive treatment plan you developed. Your detailed explanation of each step and your willingness to answer all my questions demonstrated your commitment to my well-being. The plan you created is not only effective but also realistic, which gives me hope for a full recovery.

Thank you again for your outstanding care. I am confident that with your guidance, I will be able to return to my active lifestyle.|From initial phone call to front desk to medical assistants, everyone was so helpful. My appointment with Dr was Ahmad timely.  I could not get an appointment in Asheville due to hurricane Helene and his staff worked me in without much wait.  He was kind and knowledgeable. They always make us smile when we walk thru the door and make us feel better leaving with the pain management! column48: What's the best treatment for Plantar Fasciitis?
column49: Managing plantar fasciitis using over-the-counter (OTC) medicine and at-home treatments is easy. However, our physiatrist in Charlotte, Dr. Ahmad, can suggest some effective non-surgical treatment options for plantar fasciitis. These treatments will quickly relieve your symptoms and reduce the chances of experiencing plantar fasciitis again. The common plantar fasciitis treatments are NSAIDs which include aspirin, ibuprofen, and naproxen, Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy, and Corticosteroid injections. For more detailed information about each treatment, visit us in Charlotte, NC today!

column2: Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain
column3:
Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain in Anderson, South Carolina, is a premier pain management clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life through effective pain management strategies, the center has become a trusted healthcare provider in the Upstate region. Their team of board-certified physicians and specialized medical staff combine years of clinical expertise with the latest advancements in pain medicine to deliver personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain, patients have access to a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management options, and innovative therapies designed to address various pain conditions. The practice specializes in treating back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain among other conditions. Their multidisciplinary approach integrates cutting-edge diagnostic techniques with evidence-based treatments to identify and address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes this practice is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. The medical team takes time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop customized treatment plans that align with individual goals and lifestyles. This collaborative approach empowers patients to actively participate in their pain management journey while receiving expert guidance and support throughout the process.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 1506 N Fant St, Anderson, SC 29621, the center provides convenient access for residents throughout Anderson and neighboring communities. Their modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure accurate diagnoses and effective treatments. For appointments or inquiries, patients can call +1 864-260-6995 or visit their comprehensive website at http://www.carolinapain.com/ to learn more about available services, treatment options, and patient resources.

column40: My husband's Nurse Practitioner, Amy A. Is absolutely wonderful.  She is so attentive to his needs and helps find the origin of his new issues. He is Wonderful & They know what treatment I need to take when I am in So much Pain!! He has The Best Bedside Manners, especially for A Dr. All the Nurses are so sweet and caring and Willing to help when needed with Any situations or Concerns you may have. So sweet and, good natured. Thanks to everyone I there office for getting me in and out in a timely manner.|I don't know what I would do without Amy Nash, NP.  She is so empathetic about my pain and wellbeing. She makes my life better!  She truly cares about her patients!  Everyone, from the receptionist to the nurses, are friendly and caring!  I highly recommend Carolina Center for Advanced Management of Pain!|First I have to say I can't complain at all about Dr.Westrol.  He was very pleasant and I was very satisfied with the injection he did to help relieve some hip and back pain I was having from a spinal cyst.  He was able to drain some fluid from the cyst and surround it with a steroid injection to help shrink it to help avoid or postpone surgery to remove the cyst. The office staff however  will be the reason I choose to go elsewhere.  They are never friendly and act like they don't even want to be there much less help you.  They have canceled multiple appointments last minute or made me reschedule once I have already made it to my scheduled appointment.   It should have been a red flag when I showed up for my first appointment and it had been canceled prior to my arrival even though the letter they mailed to me for my first appointment had the date and time written on it yet I was told it had been canceled and they couldn't give me a reason why.  I've wasted multiple hours taking off work for them to cancel or reschedule me.  The doctor recommended a second injection which i was never able to get.  After showing up to the appointment for the injection I was told my injection would have to be rescheduled because my insurance had not given authorization yet only to be told when I  tried to reschedule the appointment that the type of injection I was getting didn't require a prior authorization. Just sharing my experience in an effort to save others from wasting their time trying to be seen at this office.  I've worked as a medical assistant for 20 years and from my personal experience it seems like this office is just poorly managed and their front office staff needs better training.|My husband is experiencing neck pain and headaches.  He had an initial appointment with Dr. Patel last week.  Dr. Patel recommended a procedure that we were not familiar with so we both asked a number of questions about the procedure... what it does, risks, results, what if doesn't work.  At first Dr. Patel answered our questions.  Then he seemed irritated and abruptly said if my husband wants to proceed, schedule at the front desk our way out and he walked out.  I believe that our questions were reasonable.  The website states that Dr Patel  "takes time to understand each individual's needs and concerns".  That was not our experience.  We won't be back.|Dr Sakla is the best doctor I have met in over 20 years. Even after having surgery on my back didn't work. I was in severe pain. He helped me. I wouldn't trust any other doctor except Dr. Sakla and his whole staff. He is kind and listens to me and helps me to manage my pain. His injections and medicine have helped me when no other doctor would. Him, his nurses and receptionist's make me feel like family. I have had issues in the past where doctors didn't care, but him and all of his staff are truly amazing. If it wasn't for them I wouldn't be able to even function on a daily basis. I am truly blessed with Dr. Sakla and his whole staff. They are wonderful people!!! God bless them all and thank you from the bottom of my heart for caring so much!!|About two years ago, I called the office because the prescription I received from a PA was not valid.  I had made two round trips  in a day from GA to SC trying to get the script filled and ended up with nothing.  When I called the office about it from a drug store with the pharmacist standing next to me,  the lady who answered was very rude to me and hung up the phone.  I went without medication for the second time in a year.  So, I submitted a review that stated the truth about what happened.  Soon after,  I received a letter from the pain center stating that I had been dismissed because I left a negative review.  So, I sent a letter to my doctor with a list of complaints with documentation and soon received call from a Practice Manager. She was very nice, apologized to me, and assured me that "These matter would be dealt with."  I can see from recent reviews, that nothing has changed.  I am seeing a wonderful doctor in Athens now and the difference is like night and day.

column2: PSPR| Suboxone Insurance Accepted | Pain Management - WE ACCEPT INSURANCE - TELEMEDICINE & ONSITE VISITS
column3:
PSPR (Pain & Substance Abuse Prevention & Recovery) serves Charlotte, NC and surrounding areas with comprehensive addiction treatment and pain management services. Our dedicated medical practice specializes in Suboxone treatment with insurance acceptance, offering both convenient telemedicine appointments and in-person consultations at our comfortable Charlotte office. We've built our reputation on providing compassionate, judgment-free care that addresses the complex needs of those struggling with substance use disorders and chronic pain conditions.

At PSPR, we offer a full spectrum of treatment options including medication-assisted treatment with Suboxone, personalized pain management protocols, and supportive counseling services. Our dual approach to treating both addiction and pain allows us to address the interconnected nature of these conditions, providing more effective and lasting results for our patients.

Insurance Accepted

We believe quality care should be accessible to all. That's why we work with most major insurance providers to cover Suboxone treatment and pain management services. Our administrative team handles insurance verification and works diligently to maximize your benefits, making treatment financially feasible for more patients.

Experienced Medical Team

With over 20 years of clinical experience, Dr. Overton leads our team of compassionate healthcare professionals. Our practitioners understand that addiction has no face—it affects people from all walks of life. We approach each patient with dignity and respect, creating individualized treatment plans that address your specific circumstances and recovery goals.

Flexible Treatment Options

Understanding the challenges of seeking treatment, we offer both telemedicine appointments and onsite visits at our Charlotte location. Our telemedicine services provide the same quality care with added convenience, allowing you to receive treatment from the privacy of your home. For those who prefer or require in-person care, our office at 2315 W Arbors Dr, Suite 115, Charlotte, NC 28262 offers a welcoming environment for your appointments.

Contact PSPR today at (704) 817-6676 or visit www.pspronline.com to begin your journey toward recovery and improved quality of life. We're committed to standing beside you every step of the way.

At Sanford Pain Center, we provide evidence-based treatments for a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Arthritis pain management

Our Approach to Pain Management

First off... No, they are not going to just give you pain medication. All of the staff have been great to work with. Melisha Vannet was very caring and compassionate. He does a great job explaining the procedure and is very good at what he does in the procedure room. If you are looking for ACTUAL help with pain, I would highly recommend the Sanford Pain Center.|Update due to response:  I would just like to say Thanks Sanford for going out of your way to provide an automated response with a phone number that no one answers.   Thanks for showing how much you care about not helping patients, I expected exactly this, NOTHING!

One would expect a Pain Management Clinic to actually treat pain in patients.  Well, guess what?   NOT GOING TO HAPPEN.   What I received here was a 20 minute discussion on everything but what would help me.   They talked about all the wonderful procedures (which I have already done elsewhere) Acupuncture, Steroid injections, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, blah blah blah and so on.   All things that they can bill in repetition every 3-4 months like clockwork and offer no long term treatment or cure.    NP did not even bother to look at MRI scans, did not bother to touch me or examine me in anyway.   I am sure glad I drove 6 hours to spend an entire day wasting, once again, time and money on the farce that is Sanford Health Care.   Save your money, get proper treatment elsewhere because it won't happen at Sanford.    What you will get is an endless supply of bills and ZERO progress at treatment or better, a Cure for your problems.|I want to share  my experience  about  pain clinic the staff nurses doctor who takes care  of me are great and always  follow  up if theirs  a problem  with pain schedule  thanks for a job well done!|The First words the NP said to me was " your here because of the powers that be"! crazy thing- I cared for my daughter who was in critical ,morbidity state- Mayo had requested hospice.  New Year's Eve she wanted to attend church services.  I got her ready - had to change her fentynal patch which required removing a clear bandaid similar to what's placed over an IV - it is put onto a tape that is on her skin, as her skin was dying off and couldn't be touched.  Of course- had a pain test , and was told I was no longer Allowed pain mgmt .  My Dr couldn't believe it.  As the test was extremely minimal.
For me I didn't like the insinuation - especially considering my daughters medical status - which my PCM was aware of.
I would hope someone may care however what I got from NP OR PA in pain mgmt.

Altru's Interventional Pain Management in Grand Forks, North Dakota offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the region. Specializing in advanced interventional techniques, their dedicated team of pain specialists works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address both acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, Altru's Interventional Pain Management integrates cutting-edge procedures with holistic care strategies to improve quality of life and restore functionality for those suffering from debilitating pain.

What sets Altru's Interventional Pain Management apart is their multidisciplinary approach to pain care. The practice ensures pain is cared for appropriately by working with other specialties including Neurology, Neurosurgery, Occupational/Physical Therapy, and Behavioral Health. This collaborative model allows for thorough evaluation and treatment of complex pain conditions from multiple perspectives, resulting in more effective outcomes for patients with challenging pain syndromes.

Advanced Treatment Options

The clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source, including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. These minimally invasive techniques often provide significant relief while reducing the need for opioid medications and helping patients avoid more invasive surgical interventions.

column40: They saved my life. They literally saved my life. I went from being unable to walk unassisted, half of my face dropping, unable to use my left arm and in excruciating neurological pain to walking, running, lifting my arms above my head, holding my children again, cuddling my children again, being able to enjoy hobbies such as gardening, and spending time with the ones i love without constantly being bedridden separate scaring my children and missing out on life. They supported me through the process, and they had more compassion than any other medical staff I have ever interacted with. They actually care. They genuinely care about their patients, and that is something that we don't see much of these days. These nurses take time out of their personal lives to volunteer across seas even. Their compassion has no bounds and they do not judge. Whether you need neurological help or mental health assistance, these ketamine infusions are a life saver, and the staff at Thrive Anesthesia Services are the most compassionate you will find.

Center for Pain Management serves patients across Minnesota with specialized interventional pain management services. Our team of dedicated physicians focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source. Unlike traditional approaches that rely heavily on medication, our comprehensive treatment plans aim to reduce pain, improve functionality, and enhance overall quality of life through precise interventional techniques.

At Center for Pain Management, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our physicians are experts in identifying the underlying causes of persistent pain and developing customized treatment plans that address your specific needs. By utilizing advanced diagnostic tools and innovative procedures, we can effectively manage various pain conditions while minimizing reliance on medication.

Multiple Convenient Locations

With established clinics in Sartell, Baxter, Alexandria, and Bemidji, we're strategically positioned to serve patients throughout Minnesota. Our Bemidji location at 2300 24th St NW #100, Bemidji, MN 56601 serves as a vital resource for residents in northern Minnesota seeking specialized pain management care.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients, working together to develop treatment plans that align with your goals and lifestyle. Our team takes the time to understand your pain history, previous treatments, and how pain impacts your daily activities before recommending interventions.

To learn more about our services or to schedule a consultation, visit www.centerforpainmanagement.org or call us at (218) 444-2624.
column11:
At Center for Pain Management, our pain management physicians specialize in interventional pain management, the diagnosis and treatment of chronic pain conditions through a variety of minimally invasive procedures.
The goal of our pain management services is to reduce or alleviate pain, improve function, and enhance the overall quality of your life. Rather than relying solely on medications, our interventional pain management techniques involve the use of targeted procedures to address the source of the pain directly.
With locations in Sartell, Baxter, Alexandria and Bemidji, we're well positioned to treat Minnesotans who are living with diverse forms of pain.

Our facility features modern hyperbaric chambers that deliver 100% oxygen at increased atmospheric pressure. This specialized treatment helps:

- Improve circulation

- Support recovery from various medical conditions

- Enhance overall wellness

Limitless Male Medical Clinic in Fargo, North Dakota serves as the region's premier destination for men seeking comprehensive health solutions tailored specifically to male physiology and wellness needs. Our specialized medical team focuses exclusively on addressing the unique health challenges men face as they age, providing evidence-based treatments in a comfortable, confidential environment. With a holistic approach to men's health, we combine cutting-edge medical therapies with personalized wellness plans to help men reclaim their vitality, confidence, and overall quality of life.

At Limitless Male Medical Clinic, we offer a complete range of treatments addressing the core aspects of men's health:

  • Hormone Optimization - Specialized testosterone replacement therapy programs to address fatigue, decreased motivation, and diminished physical performance

  • Sexual Health Solutions - Effective treatments for erectile dysfunction and other performance concerns

  • Athletic Performance Enhancement - Medically supervised programs to improve strength, endurance, and recovery

  • Weight Management - Customized weight loss protocols designed specifically for men's physiology

  • Peptide Therapy - Advanced treatments to support tissue repair, immune function, and cellular regeneration

  • Anti-Aging Protocols - Comprehensive approaches to healthy aging and longevity

The Limitless Male Difference

What distinguishes our clinic is our exclusive focus on men's health issues and our commitment to personalized care. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation, including comprehensive lab work and a detailed health history assessment. Our physicians develop individualized treatment plans addressing not just symptoms but underlying causes of health concerns. We believe in transparent, ongoing communication with our patients, ensuring they understand their treatment options and expected outcomes.

Getting Started Is Easy

We invite you to experience the Limitless Male difference with a FREE consultation. During this initial visit, you'll discuss your health concerns, goals, and questions with our medical team. Contact our Fargo clinic today to schedule your appointment and take the first step toward optimal health.

Location: 3409 45th St S Suite 112, Fargo, ND 58104

Phone: 701-354-7479 or toll-free 866-227-9495

Trinity Pain Clinic in Minot, North Dakota offers comprehensive pain management services designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. As part of the respected Trinity Health network, our specialized clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address complex pain issues. Our team of board-certified pain specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Trinity Pain Clinic, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize creating individualized treatment plans that focus on both pain relief and functional improvement.

Our Facility and Location

Conveniently located at 1500 24th Ave SW, Suite 101 in Minot, ND 58701, our modern clinic offers a comfortable environment designed with patient needs in mind. The facility features state-of-the-art treatment rooms equipped with advanced medical technology for precise diagnosis and effective pain interventions. Ample parking is available for patients and their families.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing collaborative relationships with our patients, taking time to listen to concerns and thoroughly explain treatment options. Our goal is not just to manage symptoms but to address the underlying causes of pain whenever possible, helping patients return to their daily activities with improved function and comfort.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 701-857-5150. Additional information about Trinity Pain Clinic and our comprehensive services can be found on our website at http://www.trinityhealth.org/. Physician referrals may be required for some services, and our staff can assist with insurance verification and appointment scheduling.

Valley Vital Medicine serves Fargo, ND with a comprehensive approach to healthcare that addresses root causes rather than just symptoms. Founded on the principles of Functional Medicine as developed by The Institute for Functional Medicine, this practice views the body as an integrated system where underlying imbalances can manifest as various health concerns. Their patient-centered methodology involves thorough evaluation and personalized treatment plans designed to restore optimal function and vitality.

At Valley Vital Medicine, patients have access to a diverse range of advanced therapeutic options including:

  • BioIdentical Hormone Therapy for hormonal balance

  • IV therapy and high-dose vitamin C for nutritional support

  • Innovative peptide treatments

  • Ozone therapy and Prolozone for immune support and healing

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) treatments for pain management and tissue regeneration

Conditions Addressed

The clinic specializes in treating a wide spectrum of health concerns through their Functional Medicine approach, including:

  • Chronic fatigue and energy issues

  • Chemical sensitivities and environmental reactions

  • Digestive disorders including bloating, diarrhea, constipation, and food sensitivities

  • Mental health concerns such as anxiety, depression, and insomnia

  • Metabolic issues including blood sugar regulation

Visit Valley Vital Medicine

701 Chiropractic & Rehab serves Fargo, ND with comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services designed to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals specializes in addressing a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions through evidence-based chiropractic techniques and personalized rehabilitation programs.

At 701 Chiropractic & Rehab, we understand that chronic pain and injuries can significantly impact your daily activities and overall wellbeing. Our patient-centered approach focuses on identifying the root cause of your discomfort rather than merely treating symptoms. We combine traditional chiropractic adjustments with modern rehabilitation methods to create customized treatment plans that promote natural healing and long-term relief.

Our Services

- Chiropractic Adjustments - Gentle spinal manipulation to restore proper alignment

- Rehabilitation Exercises - Targeted movements to strengthen supporting muscles

- Sports Injury Treatment - Specialized care for athletes of all levels

- Auto Accident Recovery - Comprehensive care for whiplash and collision-related injuries

- Workplace Injury Rehabilitation - Getting you back to work safely and comfortably

Why Choose Us

Our hands-on approach distinguishes us from other providers in the Fargo area. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop personalized treatment strategies that address your specific needs. You're never just another patient at our clinic—you're a valued individual deserving of attentive, compassionate care.

column3:
Bicycle Health Suboxone Clinic in Fargo, North Dakota offers comprehensive treatment for opioid use disorder through evidence-based medication-assisted treatment. Serving the greater Fargo area and West Fargo communities, our specialized clinic combines medical expertise with compassionate care to help individuals break free from opioid dependence. With a proven track record of success, Bicycle Health has become a trusted resource for those seeking effective, accessible treatment options in North Dakota.

At Bicycle Health, we provide Buprenorphine/Naloxone (Suboxone) services tailored to each individual's unique needs. Our science-backed approach has demonstrated remarkable effectiveness, with 95% of our 20,000+ clients reporting no withdrawal symptoms after just 7 days of treatment. This medication-assisted treatment helps manage cravings and withdrawal symptoms, allowing patients to focus on their recovery journey without the debilitating effects of opioid withdrawal.

Flexible Treatment Options

Understanding that recovery looks different for everyone, we offer both in-person and virtual care options. Some clients may receive an in-person evaluation at our local Fargo office, while others can start and continue their treatment entirely online. This flexibility ensures that geography, transportation, or scheduling challenges don't stand in the way of receiving quality care.

Our Commitment to Your Recovery

The team at Bicycle Health is dedicated to helping you achieve easier days and a happier future. Our comprehensive approach addresses both the physical and psychological aspects of opioid use disorder, providing you with the tools and support needed for long-term recovery. We believe in treating the whole person, not just the addiction.

Contact Information

To learn more about our services or to schedule a consultation, please contact us at +1 701-401-5308. Our Fargo clinic is conveniently located at 1531 32nd Ave S, Office 124, Fargo, ND 58103. For additional information about our treatment programs or to explore our online options, visit our website at bicyclehealth.com.
column11:
Bicycle Health provides Buprenorphine/Naloxone (Suboxone) services for individuals suffering from opioid use disorder.

Our science-backed approach has 95% of our 20,000+ clients reporting no withdrawal symptoms at 7 days. We can help you achieve easier days and a happier future.

Some clients may receive an in-person evaluation at our local office, but we also offer the option to start and continue treatment with online options.

column3:
Resurgent Health in Fargo, North Dakota stands as the state's pioneering Direct Primary Care (DPC) clinic, transforming how healthcare is delivered across the region. Founded with a vision to restore the doctor-patient relationship to its rightful place at the center of healthcare, Resurgent Health has established itself as a leader in patient-centered primary care services. By completely eliminating the insurance billing model, the practice has created a streamlined experience that prioritizes quality time with patients rather than paperwork and administrative burdens.

As North Dakota's first Direct Primary Care clinic, Resurgent Health operates on a membership-based model that covers patients from birth through geriatrics. This innovative approach allows their medical team to maintain smaller patient panels, ensuring each individual receives the personalized attention and care they deserve. Without the constraints of insurance requirements, appointments can be longer, more thorough, and focused entirely on patient needs rather than billing codes.

Comprehensive Care for All Ages

The clinic provides comprehensive primary care services for patients at every stage of life. From newborn care and pediatrics to adult medicine and geriatric services, the Resurgent Health team delivers consistent, relationship-based healthcare. This continuity of care creates a medical home where providers truly know their patients and can offer more personalized treatment plans.

Exceptional Availability and Access

Located at 5621 36th Ave S, Suite 400 in Fargo, Resurgent Health offers patients unprecedented access to their healthcare team. The membership model ensures patients experience minimal wait times, extended appointments, and direct communication with their provider. This exceptional availability represents a fundamental shift from traditional primary care practices where patients often wait weeks for appointments and receive limited time with their doctor.

To learn more about becoming a member at Resurgent Health, interested individuals can email info@resurgenthealth.net, call +1 701-599-3950, or visit their website at https://www.resurgenthealth.net/. Their innovative approach to healthcare delivery is changing how North Dakotans experience primary care, one patient relationship at a time.
column11:
North Dakota's first Direct Primary Care (DPC) clinic.
We have embraced a unique approach to primary care by implementing a membership-based healthcare model, caring for all ages from birth to geriatrics. By eliminating insurance billing completely, we can instead focus primarily on building direct relationships with our patients. Our commitment to a smaller patient panel ensures that each individual receives personalized attention and exceptional availability from their dedicated primary care team.

Email: info@resurgenthealth.net to learn more!!

Troy D. Pierce, M.D. - The Bone & Joint Center in Bismarck, North Dakota offers comprehensive orthopedic care with a focus on personalized treatment plans for patients throughout the region. As a distinguished member of The Bone & Joint Center's medical team, Dr. Pierce brings specialized expertise in orthopedic medicine to the Bismarck community, helping patients overcome musculoskeletal conditions and injuries through both surgical and non-surgical approaches.

At The Bone & Joint Center, Dr. Troy Pierce provides evidence-based treatments for a wide range of orthopedic conditions. The practice combines advanced diagnostic technology with innovative treatment options to address joint pain, sports injuries, fractures, and degenerative conditions. Patients benefit from Dr. Pierce's commitment to thorough evaluation and personalized care plans designed to restore mobility and improve quality of life.

Comprehensive Services

The practice offers a full spectrum of orthopedic services including joint replacement surgery, arthroscopic procedures, fracture care, and rehabilitation services. Dr. Pierce works closely with physical therapists and other specialists to ensure coordinated care throughout the treatment and recovery process. The center's integrated approach means patients receive seamless care from diagnosis through rehabilitation.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Pierce and the team at The Bone & Joint Center prioritize patient education and shared decision-making. They take time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed choices about their orthopedic care. This commitment to communication has established the practice as a trusted healthcare resource in the Bismarck community.

Located at 310 N 9th St, Bismarck, ND 58501, The Bone & Joint Center offers convenient access to quality orthopedic care. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Troy Pierce, patients can call +1 701-946-7500 or visit their website at www.bone-joint.com.

column3:
Bicycle Health Suboxone Clinic in Fargo, North Dakota offers comprehensive addiction treatment services through their specialized Medication for Addiction Treatment (MAT) program. Located in the heart of downtown at 122 1/2 N Broadway Dr, this clinic has established itself as a trusted provider of evidence-based care for those struggling with opioid dependency. Their team of dedicated healthcare professionals delivers personalized treatment plans centered around Buprenorphine/Naloxone (Suboxone) therapy, which has proven highly effective in managing withdrawal symptoms and reducing cravings.

What sets Bicycle Health apart is their remarkable success rate—95% of patients report no withdrawal symptoms after just 7 days of treatment. This science-backed approach combines medication management with supportive care to address both the physical and psychological aspects of addiction. The clinic's comprehensive treatment philosophy focuses on long-term recovery, helping patients rebuild their lives and rediscover their potential without the burden of opioid dependency.

Accessible and Compassionate Care

Bicycle Health understands that seeking help for addiction can be intimidating. Their compassionate staff creates a welcoming, judgment-free environment where patients receive the support they need throughout their recovery journey. The clinic offers flexible scheduling options and can be reached at +1 701-401-5308 for appointments or inquiries. Their central Fargo location makes quality addiction treatment accessible to residents throughout the region.

Your Path to Recovery

If you or someone you love is struggling with opioid dependency, Bicycle Health provides a clear path forward. Their proven approach can help patients achieve easier days and work toward a happier future. Visit their website at https://www.bicyclehealth.com/suboxone-clinic/fargo to learn more about their services or to take the first step toward recovery.

Ketamine Care Clinic in Bismarck, North Dakota offers innovative mental health treatment solutions through ketamine-assisted therapy. Our specialized clinic provides evidence-based care for patients suffering from treatment-resistant depression, anxiety, PTSD, and chronic pain conditions. Located in the heart of Bismarck, we serve patients throughout North Dakota with compassionate, personalized treatment plans designed to address conditions that haven't responded to traditional therapies.

At Ketamine Care Clinic, we provide medically supervised ketamine infusion therapy in a comfortable, supportive environment. Our treatment protocols are tailored to each patient's unique needs, with sessions carefully monitored by our experienced healthcare professionals. We combine ketamine treatments with integrative support services to maximize therapeutic benefits and promote lasting wellness.

Our Approach to Mental Health

We believe in a holistic approach to mental health care that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes. Our team works closely with each patient to develop comprehensive treatment plans that may include ketamine therapy alongside other supportive interventions. This integrated approach helps patients achieve meaningful relief and sustainable improvements in their quality of life.

Patient Experience

From your initial consultation through treatment and follow-up care, our compassionate team provides guidance and support every step of the way. Our clinic space at 1120 College Dr Suite 100 is designed to create a calming, therapeutic environment where patients can feel safe and comfortable during their treatment sessions.

Contact Information

To learn more about our services or schedule a consultation, please contact us at +1 701-760-8606 or visit our website at www.journeytowellnesspllc.com. Our clinic is conveniently located at 1120 College Dr Suite 100, Bismarck, ND 58501, with accessible parking and amenities nearby.

column40:
I sought treatment through ketamine infusions for pain and other issues associated with CRPS. I have been in extreme pain for nearly four years, and the last year has been the worst yet. My experiences with doctors and treatments up to this point have not been stellar, to say the least. My first ketamine treatment with Jackie was just about a month ago. I was extremely nervous, however, Jackie walked me through it step by step. You can feel that she cares and that makes for a safe and supportive environment. The results were amazing and better than I anticipated! I am now walking without a cane for the first time in nearly a year! My pain level has been reduced significantly. I am able to get around and do things with my children again, which I have missed dearly. I cannot express how thankful I am for Jackie and the work she is doing! It has helped me to regain my life.|After reaching out to Jackie to discuss Ketamine Infusions I knew I needed them. Jackie was comforting and factual. She did her research about my CRPS, chronic pain, PTSD, and depression with anxiety. She made a plan that fit all of my issues the best. I felt at ease knowing she didn't just use a template to decide the amount of infusions I would need, but instead used my doctors notes and my own words to learn and understand how much I was suffering. The first time I met Jackie in person for my first infusion I felt like I could breathe again. She talked so calmly and since I am a nurse as well we talked nurse world which helped ease my nerves as well. Jackie has definitely found her calling in life. There is no doubt in my mind that without her, I would still be suffering day and night. Since finishing my last infusion I have been able to run around with my two small kids. They have noticed that mommy isn't sick all the time, too, which makes the expense and traveling all worth it. I text Jackie and tell her the little things I've been able to do to remind her she's found her calling in life. I would encourage others to look past the ignorance of ketamine and research how it truly works. It can give you your life back just like it gave me mine back.|I received very good care from Jackie, the nurse anaesthetist who runs Ketamine Care Clinic. She really covers all the bases for monitoring you during treatment. I have been to other ketamine clinics in the US and Jackie's setup is top notch. When I'm in treatment, I know I'm in good hands. She is professional, empathetic, and kind. I'd recommend her to anyone.|Jackie is an amazing provider for Ketamine treatments!
These treatments have literally changed my life!  (I actually have a life now!)  I feel so blessed to have such a wonderful, knowledgeable woman bringing these hard to find treatments to the Bismarck/ Mandan area!
If anyone is having trouble with Depression,  Anxiety, Pain etc. Please give Jackie a call.  This worked for me when NOTHING else did!|I have struggled with anxiety and depression for the last 13 years of my life. And as stress wore me down the anxiety grew and the depression got so bad I cried about EVERYTHING. Yes, everything!
Happy cries or sad cries, it didn't matter. I just couldn't get through even a few hours without crying. Job stress had gotten intolerable, so I cried often and realized I had to stop living this way. After the first 3 infusions I noticed a difference. After the initial 6, I was a different person. I've gotten 2 booster infusions since and moving on to a third. I am so thankful this treatment is an option for us here in Bismarck because of Jackie. It's great having a medical professional that doesn't want to cram useless pills down my throat like the rest of the industry. I highly recommend Ketamine Kare Clinic to anyone that can't continue living their life the way they currently are. There is help and happiness waiting for you!|After years of narcotic use I stopped in May 2017. Since then Ibuprofen is the pain reliever I have been using. Since I started the infusions I am taking half of what I was prior. Jackie is caring and truly wants a to help relieve pain, depression and anxiety. This is an amazing process. Thank you Jackie...for giving me my life back.|Our experience at the Ketamine Care Clinic was outstanding. From the first contact we were treated with professionalism and compassion. Our questions were answered no matter how many and Jacquelin genuinely cared about the outcome of the treatment. If you are suffering from depression, anxiety and more consider Ketamine an option for relief. Thank you, Jacquelin!|You literally have not "tried everything" in terms of depression /mental health treatments until you have tried this treatment. I have nothing negative to report, at all. Despite there being a bit of a time gap in completing the 6 initial recommended treatments (due to financial constraints), I don't feel that I had any backslide in my progress. This treatment may be compounded with more traditional approaches such as therapy etc., but if you've been through it all before like I have (though I've never been hospitalized) it isnt inherently necessary if the thought of that is annoying to you. Yes, it is expensive, but some health insurance coverage does cover it by reimbursement at least partially, you just have to file the claim yourself. I'll work on writing up a lengthier more detailed  review, but my experience has been extremely positive, and I have been on antidepressants my entire adult life.

Alternative Health serves Grand Forks, ND and surrounding communities with compassionate, holistic healthcare solutions. Founded by Dr. Ewals, a board-certified family nurse practitioner, this wellness center specializes in medical marijuana certification and ketamine therapy while connecting patients with complementary treatment modalities. Their patient-centered approach focuses on natural healing pathways and conservative interventions designed to enhance quality of life without excessive reliance on pharmaceutical solutions.

Dr. Ewals provides comprehensive evaluations for patients seeking medical marijuana certification in both North Dakota and Minnesota. After a thorough review of your medical records, qualifying patients receive same-day certification documentation submitted directly to state authorities. The clinic also offers innovative ketamine therapy for individuals with treatment-resistant conditions, administered under careful medical supervision.

Holistic Health Network

Understanding that optimal wellness often requires multiple approaches, Alternative Health connects patients with trusted local practitioners specializing in complementary therapies including:

  • Chiropractic care

  • Physical therapy

  • Acupuncture

  • Cupping therapy

  • Therapeutic massage

  • Yoga instruction

Patient-Centered Philosophy

At Alternative Health, Dr. Ewals embraces a philosophy that prioritizes natural healing pathways and conservative interventions. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual needs while minimizing unnecessary medications and invasive procedures. This approach empowers patients to take an active role in their wellness journey.

Contact Information

Location: 2502 S Washington St, Grand Forks, ND 58201

Phone: (701) 317-1747

Website: alternativehealthgf.com

The Bone & Joint Center in Dickinson, ND provides specialized orthopedic care under the expert guidance of Dr. Derrick O. Cote, who joined the practice in 2014. As a board-certified orthopedic surgeon, Dr. Cote brings extensive experience to the region, offering comprehensive treatment options for patients suffering from musculoskeletal conditions. The center serves as a premier destination for residents seeking high-quality orthopedic care without traveling to larger metropolitan areas.

Dr. Cote specializes in general orthopedics with particular focus on upper extremity and foot and ankle surgeries. His clinical expertise encompasses a wide range of procedures including:

  • Total joint replacements

  • Arthroscopic procedures

  • Treatment for degenerative diseases

  • Trauma care

  • Sports injury rehabilitation and surgery

Professional Background

Since joining The Bone & Joint Center in 2014, Dr. Cote has established himself as a trusted orthopedic specialist in the Dickinson community. His board certification reflects his commitment to maintaining the highest standards of patient care and surgical excellence. Dr. Cote's approach combines evidence-based medicine with personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently located in the Medical Office Building at 2500 Fairway St, 2nd Floor, Dickinson, ND 58601, The Bone & Joint Center offers accessible orthopedic care to patients throughout southwestern North Dakota. The modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies to support comprehensive orthopedic services.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Derrick O. Cote, patients can call +1 701-456-4694. Additional information about Dr. Cote's practice and The Bone & Joint Center's services can be found on their website at www.bone-joint.com.

Family Health Chiropractic PC in Bismarck, North Dakota offers innovative SoftWave Therapy treatments to help patients overcome pain and accelerate healing naturally. As a trusted provider of SoftWave TRT (Tissue Regeneration Technology), our clinic specializes in non-invasive therapeutic solutions that harness the body's innate healing capabilities. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals utilizes this cutting-edge approach to address a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions, sports injuries, and chronic pain issues that traditional treatments may not effectively resolve.

SoftWave Therapy at Family Health Chiropractic PC employs patented technology that works at the cellular level to activate and enhance your body's natural healing processes. Unlike other treatments that may only mask symptoms, SoftWave TRT addresses the root cause of pain and dysfunction by stimulating cellular regeneration and tissue repair. This advanced technology creates acoustic pressure waves that penetrate deep into affected tissues, triggering biological responses that promote healing without medication or invasive procedures.

Key Benefits of SoftWave Treatment

Our SoftWave therapy offers multiple therapeutic benefits, including:

  • Increased blood supply to injured areas, enhancing nutrient delivery

  • Effective modulation of inflammation for faster recovery

  • Repair, remodeling, and regeneration of damaged tissue

  • Accelerated wound healing for faster recovery times

  • Significant reduction in both acute and chronic pain

  • Natural antibacterial effects that support overall healing

Conditions We Treat

The versatile SoftWave technology at our Bismarck clinic effectively addresses numerous conditions, including joint pain, tendonitis, plantar fasciitis, back pain, sports injuries, and more. Many patients experience noticeable improvement after just a few sessions, with lasting results that continue to develop as the body's healing processes are activated and enhanced.

Visit Our Clinic

Experience the healing potential of SoftWave Therapy at Family Health Chiropractic PC, located at 117 E Century Ave, Bismarck, ND 58503. To schedule a consultation or learn more about how SoftWave TRT can help with your specific condition, call us today at +1 701-380-8991. Additional information about our innovative treatments can be found on our website at https://softwaveclinics.com/clinics/north-dakota/family-health-chiropractic-pc/.
column11:

-Accelerates wound healing
-Reduces acute and chronic pain
-Induces antibacterial effect

Precision Pain Care serves Lancaster, OH with specialized medical expertise focused on comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team, led by board-certified specialists, is committed to helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions and return to fulfilling, pain-free lifestyles. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans utilizing the latest advancements in pain medicine.

At Precision Pain Care, we provide a wide range of minimally invasive procedures designed to address various pain sources. Our advanced treatment options include:

  • Endoscopic Discectomy - A minimally invasive procedure to relieve herniated disc pain

  • Endoscopic Rhizotomy - Targeted treatment for facet joint pain

  • Kyphoplasty - Vertebral fracture repair and stabilization

  • Minuteman Spinal Fusion - Advanced spinal stabilization technique

  • Spinal Cord Stimulators - Innovative technology for chronic pain management

  • Translaminar and Transforaminal Steroid Injections - Precise delivery of anti-inflammatory medication

Our Expert Physicians

Dr. Ron Linehan, MD brings exceptional credentials to our practice. He is certified by the American Board of Pain Medicine and has earned the American Board of Anesthesiology's subspecialty certification in pain management, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of care.

Dr. Robert Stocum, DO complements our team with his expertise in emerging therapies, including advanced spinal cord stimulation techniques. His commitment to staying at the forefront of pain management innovations benefits our patients with cutting-edge treatment options.

Contact Precision Pain Care

If you're struggling with back pain, neck pain, or other chronic pain conditions, contact us to schedule a consultation:

Website: https://www.precisionpaincare.org/

Phone: +1 740-689-9500

Address: 1533 Election House Rd NW, Lancaster, OH 43130, United States

column3:
Integrated Pain Solutions in Columbus, Ohio offers comprehensive interventional pain management services for patients suffering from acute or chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists focuses on improving functionality and quality of life through personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Integrated Pain Solutions, we understand that living with pain can significantly impact every aspect of your life. Our Columbus clinic works in conjunction with the Gemini Surgery Center, providing access to minimally invasive outpatient procedures that can offer relief without extended hospital stays. For greater accessibility, we maintain a second location in Springfield, Ohio, allowing us to serve patients from throughout the state.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

- Cancer-related pain

- Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)/Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy (RSD)

- Sciatica

- Facet syndrome

- Spinal stenosis

- Neuropathic pain

- And many other chronic pain conditions

Advanced Treatment Options

We offer innovative and effective treatment approaches, including:

- Spinal cord stimulator implants for long-term pain management

- Intrathecal pain pump implants for precise medication delivery

- PRP therapy utilizing your body's natural healing properties

- Hormone replacement therapy to address pain related to hormonal imbalances

- Additional cutting-edge interventional procedures

Contact Information

Website: https://ipscolumbus.com/

Phone: +1 614-383-6450

Address: 1210 Gemini Pl Suite 300, Columbus, OH 43240, United States
column11: Integrated Pain Solutions in Columbus, Ohio provides interventional pain management for those suffering from acute or chronic pain. Our doctors specialize in pain management that helps you improve your functionality and quality of life. Conditions we treat include: cancer-related pain, CRPS/RSD, sciatica, facet syndrome, spinal stenosis, neuropathic pain, and more. Treatments we offer include: spinal cord stimulator implants, intrathecal pain pump implants, PRP therapy, hormone replacement, and more.

DOC Pain Management - Dayton serves the Dayton, Ohio area with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to help patients regain their quality of life. At DOC Pain Management, patients benefit from a multi-disciplinary methodology that incorporates diverse treatment options tailored to individual needs. Their specialists utilize cutting-edge pain management procedures designed to effectively reduce pain while simultaneously increasing mobility and functionality. This balanced approach helps patients return to their daily activities with improved comfort and capability.

Convenient One-Stop Facility

Located within the Dayton Outpatient Center at 1010 Woodman Dr, Suite 200, Dayton, OH 45432, DOC Pain Management offers the convenience of comprehensive care in a single location. This integrated facility streamlines the treatment process, allowing patients to access various specialists and services without traveling between multiple medical offices. Their central location makes quality pain management accessible to residents throughout the Dayton metropolitan area.

Patient-Centered Care

What truly distinguishes DOC Pain Management is their commitment to doing things differently. Their patient-first approach ensures individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. column40:
As a brand new patient my first impression is very positive, hence the 5 stars. The medical staff was very pleasant and attentive maintaining a smile throughout the visit. As far as Dr. Mosley is concerned, I like his demeanor. He was thorough and offered a treatment plan that I thought made perfect sense. Additionally he was open to my ideas on my treatment as well. Suffice it to say, I now have 2 more appointments established for treatment, I believe this should more than indicate how I feel about his ability to help me along my journey to a pain free life.|Both Capitol Pain locations New Albany and Pickerington are high class medical facilities with staff that are trained, experienced and equipped with all the newest procedures in pain management.  They closely monitor patients to be sure they are providing the best care possible.  Both Sara and her assistant are caring medical team.
5 Star service.|First of all - the staff is friendly. Everyone says "hi". Secondly - I have not had to sit in the waiting room past my appointment time. Mind you I show up a few minutes before my appointment, but still I don't have to sit in the waiting room very long after I arrive. Dr Mosley is friendly. He put together a treatment option for my lower back pain right away. I don't want to take narcotics for the rest of my life - so I was not going there for that. That made me happy he is trying to solve my problem with other treatments before discussing surgery. I have always been leery going to pain management clinics because I have had such bad luck in the last 24 years I have been sick. I developed Rheumatoid Arthritis when I was 30 years old. I have had joints replaced and I was in a wheelchair for 4 years at one point. Once I got out the wheelchair and got new knees so I could walk/drive/be independent again - my back pain kicked in high gear. I have been living with this back for about 12 years. I did actually see a surgeon a couple of years ago (Ohio Health Westerville) who fat shamed me. Dr Mosley did NOT fat shame me. Not once did he mention my 250lb 5'4" body and suggest I lose weight and my back pain will go away. My goal is to get this back pain under control (without a slew of narcotics) so I can go to the park and walk - so I can use my exercise machine for longer then 5 minutes because my back is killing me - so I can sleep in my bed (and not on the couch) because my back is not killing me. I think Dr Mosley can help me with that.|Staff was friendly,  understanding,  and professional. I was very impressed with my 1st visit today. Dr. Mosley listened and is assisting me with my Pain.  I would highly recommend.|Today was my first visit at the Capitol Pain Institute.  I was impressed with the staff as everyone smiled, said hello and helped when needed.  Dr. Mosley saw me promptly, was informative and gave me reason to hope for less pain.  I can't ask for more than that!|I really like the staff. They are willing to answer any questions I have. The treatment took away my pain and I am getting ready to have my second one.|Left messages for 3 weeks at call center and messages was not relayed to my doctors. The staff, Dr Mosley and Dr Bhutra are very good and nice.|My experience with Dr.Mosley I will not consider going anywhere else  this Dr. Gave me my life back and I am very grateful  thank you very much..I highly recommend ..

Under the expert guidance of Dr. Michael Danko, our specialized medical team combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions affecting residents throughout Highland County and beyond.

At Premier Pain Treatment Institute, we offer a diverse range of evidence-based treatments targeting various pain conditions, including chronic pain, persistent back pain, debilitating joint pain, sciatica, arthritis, and recurring migraines. Our approach emphasizes minimally invasive interventional procedures, precisely administered spinal injections, and effective non-surgical therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs and medical history.

Our Treatment Approach

Serving Our Community
