column40:
Very kind and caring and they listen!!! Zoe is so kind and sweet and I would love to just talk to her casually. Courtney is wonderful, kind, and knowledgeable. Very accommodating to me for appointments and my work schedule. They have given my life back to me! The staff at the desk are great!|My mom is a patient here and we go monthly for her appts. We wanted to leave a review for 'ShaLane', at each visit we're greeted with a friendly face and someone who truly seems to care. She's def a gem and they're lucky to have her. She was gone for a bit, but thankfully she's back. Hope they realize what an asset she is.|Everything went down hill for me when Jordan started being my nurse practitioner. I don't know why I couldn't have kept Courtney. She really cares about her patients. A false positive is what happened to me there. If I was a Dr I would have gotten another urine to make sure the results were correct. I'm really upset for being accused of something I didn't do. I've been going to Hillsboro location since 2017. This that happened to me seams so shady. I wonder if it was because I
had  wasn't taking the shots in the back of getting oaba stimulator put on ?  When you release your patients because it's all about the money I guess. I told the truth and God knows it. I was in the hospital for five days and the Dr gave me Ativan because they had me on a invasive ventilator and they gave it for me as bedtime. I had 90 0/0 carbon dioxide in my lungs. Do when I got released on the fifth day I had an appointment with Jordan and so she took urine. This past Tuesday I had another appointment and she told me I had Klonopin in my urine. There is no way. Pretty sure it was the Ativan. I am going to suffer for sure. My spine is in bad shape. The pain is terrible. I'm still in shock. I don't understand it at all. It seemed like Jordan was always waiting for me to fail. I really missed Courtney. She really cared and explained everything to me. She helped me so much. As you know Courtney I won't be coming back, but I truly want to thank you for everything you done for me and your kindness. God bless you all and God bless for the false positive test. And Jordan never said a word about the Ativan being in my urine, which it should have been there. Which I took while in the hospital under Dr care. Just that Klonopin was in the urine. What's up with that ? Shouldn't Ativan been in the urine ?|The staff treat me with respect and are genuinely concerned about my pain. I have been to other pain clinics in the past, but I feel so much more comfortable with Jordan.|Lindsay and Julia are very polite and always have smile on their face.|I love this office...Selena, Zoe, & Courtney are awesome people.|The folks at PPTI are absolutely awesome once they get to know you all the more better this is the best place in Ohio it's hard to say if this would be my favorite pain specialist but 10 years I had internal medicine when I was in Wisconsin he prescribed all my meds now I'm down here in Ohio and I had to go to every different doctor which is building overwhelming but the nurse and the nurse practitioner I see right on key they are phenomenal ladies and things to doctor who created PPTI 10/10 Stars|The service is good, but the wait time is crazy.  Sometimes I have waited in the room after having my blood pressure checked and everything 45 minutes for the nurse practitioner to come in and see me.  Other than that, I have no complaints

column40:
I've been coming here for years and stayed for one reading or another. However at my last appointment I was billed for "copays" for visits I was NOT present for. So the dr. can discuss care with the team, is what I was told. And my medication was due the following day to be picked up from my pharmacy. The pharmacy says they are missing a code for billing... I have texted, called, emailed, as well as had my pharmacy call. No response! I'm a week overdue on my medication that absolutely causes extreme side effects if stopped. I will be changing doctors and calling state on these people. This is absolutely unethical and abandonment of a patient.|The drs are good but the staff don't seem to care. They are super slow. I was told they didn't take my insurance,  but they do. They apparently didn't want to bother looking into it first. So i was charged $100 copay for no reason. And now I cant get it back?!? Not happy with this place like I used to be.|It's all hurry up and wait. I've been waiting weeks for a referral and all they do is make a note. Someone from the answering service made the referral yesterday and sent to the wrong place. Noone was willing to help me again today. The staff in the office treats us like cattle. Usually too many patients while understaffed. If I weren't so close to what I need, I would find a new clinic.|Do not come to this office! Dr. Tayeb will spend maybe 2 minutes in the room. Will gaslight you and disregard your problems, pain, and experience in the office. You will wait at least 3 hours for each appointment. And his staff is disrespectful and inappropriate in front of patients. They do not care about you. They just want your money, and every other pain patient in the tri-state apparently which will be lining the walls because they schedule more patients than they should take.|I have to go here every month and it is my least favorite thing to do. Not handicap accessible (how is that when everyone there is hobbling around in pain?) they book a million appts a day which means you will WAIT an extremely long time in a small, crowded room. Staff tries, but there's no way to manage the chaos.  Their obvious goal is to get as many people as possible and there's never more than 2 people at the desk. This leads to most people being frustrated when there, and makes for a tense environment in general. we've had to correct billing with our insurance because they were billing for services not received (urine test for example). It's a mess and since so many people need pain management there's no motivation to focus on the quality vs the quantity of care. It's a pill mill, don't expect anything more.|First visit today. Waiting room was small and crowded and very chaotic. Not a  relaxing environment if you have a long wait to see the dr., and long waits are apparently common. Patients were using their cell phones in the waiting room which I thought was extremely rude and no one said anything to them. The wait time was long. I waited about an hour before I saw dr. Exam room was cold as a meat locker. I was confused about the need for images from my CT scan. I wouldn't have gone through all the trouble to get a CD of them if I'd known they weren't needed. Dr. Tayeb himself was very nice.|I love going here.   Dr.  TAYEB and his staff are exceptional and treat you with courtesy,  respect,  and you feel so well taken care of when you leave this office.   Joanie, the receptionist, really goes out of her way to make you feel welcome too. They are always so very helpful everytime!
Dr. Tayeb is so knowledgeable medically, and always impresses me every time.   I have had several different types of procedures done by him that always seem to work way past my expectations.   I am just so impressed by him.
I would always recommend this office to anyone who is in need of pain management.   I drive an hour each way for appointments,  and that long trip is so very uncomfortable at times, if he wasn't such an excellant doctor I would find a pain management that's closer,  but because of the excellent treatment I receive here, it is well worth the long trip.
I actually have felt so blessed since finding Dr. Tayeb because he has helped to give me a so much better quality of life,  since I've been going to him.|The practice as a whole has issues that plague most Pain Management Offices, it is an overwhelming field.
But Dr. Tayeb is BY FAR the best PAIN MANAGEMENT doctor I have ever seen, and I started in PM 3 decades ago in 1993.
He also has the nearly medically unique qualification of being,  and treating patients as  "human",  while also being HONEST with them. (Yes, PM does tend to jade you as a patient, but Dr. T is the cure).
You cannot have a better doctor.

DOC Pain Management - West Chester serves the West Chester Township, Ohio area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Whether you've had a recent sports injury or you've been suffering with chronic pain due to back, neck, knee pain or any other condition, their dedicated team is committed to giving patients their quality of life back. With a patient-centered approach, DOC Pain Management stands apart from traditional pain clinics by ensuring patients receive the right care from qualified specialists with treatment plans that begin promptly.

At DOC Pain Management, the multi-disciplinary approach allows for a wide range of treatment options tailored to each patient's specific needs. Their specialists utilize the most up-to-date pain management procedures designed to decrease pain while simultaneously increasing activity levels. This balanced methodology helps patients not only find relief but regain functionality in their daily lives.

Convenient One-Stop Facility

Conveniently located within the Dayton Outpatient Center at 8230 Beckett Park Dr, West Chester Township, OH 45069, DOC Pain Management provides patients with a comprehensive one-stop facility for all their pain management needs. This integrated approach eliminates the need for patients to travel between multiple locations for different aspects of their treatment plan.

Services and Specialties

The clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including sports injuries, chronic back and neck pain, knee pain, and other persistent pain issues. Their team of specialists works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can call +1 513-870-1441 or visit their website at https://www.daytondoc.com/cincinnati/ to learn more about available treatment options.

Integrated Pain Solutions Springfield serves patients throughout Springfield, Ohio who suffer from acute or chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team specializes in comprehensive pain management utilizing minimally invasive strategies designed to improve functionality and quality of life. With both our Springfield location and our additional pain management clinic and ambulatory surgical center in Columbus, Ohio, we're positioned to provide exceptional care to patients across the region. Our approach focuses on targeting the source of your pain, developing personalized treatment plans that evolve with your needs to ensure optimal long-term results.

At Integrated Pain Solutions, we understand that pain affects each person differently. That's why we take a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, carefully assessing each patient's condition before recommending treatment options. Our minimally invasive techniques are designed to provide relief while minimizing recovery time and potential complications. We continuously adjust treatment plans based on patient response and changing needs, ensuring the most effective pain management possible.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinical expertise extends to a wide range of pain conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Post laminectomy syndrome

  • Degenerative disc disease

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Sacroiliitis

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain

Advanced Treatment Options

We offer numerous state-of-the-art treatments to address various pain conditions:

  • Spinal cord stimulator implants

  • Caudal epidural steroid injections

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy

  • Nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 937-342-1619

Address: 1117 E Home Rd, Springfield, OH 45503, United States

Website: www.ipscolumbus.com

We also have a pain management clinic and ambulatory surgical center in Columbus, Ohio. We try to target the source of your pain so that it becomes more manageable over time. Our approach is always minimally invasive and is adjusted over time to suit your needs. Conditions we treat include: post laminectomy syndrome, degenerative disc disease, fibromyalgia, sacroiliitis, and more. Treatments we provide include: spinal cord stimulator implants, caudal epidural steroid injections, PRP therapy, and more.

column2: Interventional Pain Center: Sachida Manocha, M.D.
column3:
Interventional Pain Center in Worthington, Ohio serves the greater Columbus area with specialized pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Sachida Manocha, M.D. Our comprehensive practice goes beyond conventional pain treatments, integrating multiple therapeutic approaches to address chronic and complex pain conditions. With a state-of-the-art facility located in the heart of Worthington, we've established ourselves as leaders in interventional pain medicine, particularly for patients who have not found relief through standard treatments.

At Interventional Pain Center, we focus on treating patients with complex pain conditions who have experienced limited success with conventional pain management approaches. Dr. Manocha and our dedicated team offer advanced interventional procedures including:

  • Implantable pain pumps for targeted medication delivery

  • Spinal cord stimulators for neurological pain management

  • Comprehensive medical marijuana consultations and treatment plans

  • Customized interventional procedures for specific pain conditions

Our Approach to Complex Pain Cases

What distinguishes our practice is our commitment to patients with challenging pain conditions. We specialize in evaluating and treating individuals who have undergone multiple previous treatments without achieving adequate pain relief. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with complementary pain management modalities to create personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Sachida Manocha and our team, please contact us at (614) 262-7246. Our clinic is conveniently located at 85 E Wilson Bridge Rd, Worthington, OH 43085. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at columbuspain.com.
column11: Primarily an interventional pain practice, we try to incorporate other modalities of pain management as well. Our special interest is in dealing with most complex patients who have failed most routine pain management procedures and medicines. We specialize in pain pumps and pain stimulators. We also use medical marijuana .

column40:
The problems I have had began in 1999, & I have seen around 17 different doctors.  A couple of them very good they were surgeons.  It's after the surgery & different difficulties arise this is when your experiences with Drs arise.  I have been seeing Dr. Munir for a few months he is an excellent listener also explains situations thoroughly.  So far all treatment has helped.  I would also like to say the staff is excellent and extremely helpful.  I would recommend to anyone.  Satisfied Patient Sherry|I would recommend this facility to anyone. They don't judge you. They are Very friendly. VERY trusting. Doctor Munir is very caring. He is the first doctor that has giving me options other than surgery.|Dr. Munir is the kindest and caring person! All the staff are so nice! If you are having pain don't hesitate to call them!|Finally a place that actually cares and doesn't judge you based on age. I seen Dr. Wang today and she was so caring and actually listens to what the root problems are.  I have had 4 surgeries on my knee and bulging discs in my lower back.  She really cared about me as a patient and my underline pain. Unlike other places I have been to, they treat you like a human and don't discriminate bc of your age. The staff is so sweet and caring as well. The clinic is very clean. Thank you Drs and staff for caring and being so nice to your patients.  You make me feel very comfortable there and not nervous.|I have a genetic disorder that generates chronic spine pain. I have been seeing Dr. Munir off-and-on for many years. Dr. Munir and his staff are not only effective at alleviating my discomfort but they are kind, concerned, and pleasant to interact with. I enjoy my visits not only for the relief that they provide but because the office treats me like a person, not just a patient.  They earn my trust with every interaction.|After having an accident in the Air Force more than 30 years ago, my back started to hurt like it did more than 20 years ago when a doctor at Walter Reed Army Hospital gave me 3 shots over 3 months to stop the pain.  My sister recommended Dr. Munir.  After initial visit and exercises were not relieving the pain,  he gave me a shot, and relieved the pain.  He is a doctor that will listen to you and give you the treatment for you, without going overboard|I have always had an active lifestyle. At age 42, I developed pain in the lumbar & sacrum regions. The pain worsened over the next year to where my lifestyle changed. I could no longer exercise or perform household tasks. I went to an ortho surgeon, who prescribed 18 PT sessions to strengthen my back/abdomen. The PT released me from therapy because I did not have a lack of strength in my back/abdomen and that my pain must come from elsewhere.

So, I went to see a chiropractor and after adjustments, he told me a story. His wife had suffered from chronic back pain. As a doctor himself, he had done research and came across a pain management doctor in the area. He sent his wife to that doctor and after several treatments, she was pain free and had remained pain free to that date.

That is how I came to meet Dr. Munir. I made an appointment at Southwest Ohio Pain Institute (SWOPI) and by this time, I was waking up around 3:00 AM in such pain that I could not fall back asleep. I had sleep deprivation and passed out during my first appointment. His staff was excellent and I felt like I was in the right place. This doctor was going to help me.

Dr. Munir completed a physical exam and asked questions to understand what triggers the onset of my pain. After a series of evaluations, he informed me that he did not believe it was an issue with my spine, but rather an issue with muscle spasms pulling at my spine, resulting in both muscle & structural pain. Dr. Munir outlined a program, which included steroid shots, a low dose muscle relaxer and a series of stretches to be performed multiple times a day that would target underlying muscles not often reached through traditional stretching. After a few days of following his program, I experienced my first good night of sleep in close to a year.

After about a month, I was experiencing about 50% relief, but I wanted to shoot for the stars and get back to my active lifestyle. Dr. Munir suggested adding red light therapy to my program. His studies had shown that when used in conjunction with steroid injections, the red light therapy (performed twice a week for 8 weeks) would add additional pain relief. And he was right, it did. Not 100%, but by that point my pain relief was about 85%. It was well worth the time and the investment.

Again, not one to give up or settle for anything less than 100%, I tasked him with finding that additional 15% of pain relief that would allow me to sleep each and every night, perform household tasks and get back to exercising. Dr. Munir suggested radio frequency ablation (RFA) and thus we started on the evaluation process to determine where most of the pain stemmed from. We decided to treat my left side first - it was a rather simple 20 minute procedure, local anesthesia, performed in the office. I walked out and soon realized that my pain was gone. It was 100% gone on my left side with about a 95% improvement on my right side as well! I could immediately tell the difference in muscle tightness from my left side to my right side.

I came back in a month to see Dr. Munir for treatment on my right side. By then my life had changed dramatically. I had been going to the gym, I had started running again and lifting weights. I was sleeping through the night - every night - and feeling rested in the morning. My physical state had improved and so had my emotional state. I was ecstatic with the results! I couldn't believe that I'd spent a year seeing different doctors (by the way, I also saw a neurologist, a rheumatologist and got a second opinion with another orthopedic surgeon) and Dr. Munir was only 5-minutes from my house.

It has been several months now and I am 100% pain free. I am also free to pursue the things in life that bring me joy. Thank you, Dr. Munir, for taking the time to ask me thorough questions and for spending the time to properly evaluate my physical issues and for developing a treatment program that was unique to me. Thank you for sticking with me and for not brushing me off because there wasn't a glaringly obvious reason for the pain.|I have been a patient of Dr. Pham for almost 6 yrs now. He is kind, caring and takes the time to talk/listen. He does the best spinal injections. The office staff is friendly. I recommend this group the anyone that's looking for a pain doctor

column40:
Dr. Danko is EXCELLENT at injections. For anyone who is afraid of getting an injection, please don't be. The procedure is done in a couple minutes. It's over quicker than you think. It relieves the pain and makes your life more manageable. The office staff are all sweet and helpful in checking in and out. The NP'S are all so nice and greet you with a smile. I see Mary Beth and her assistant Candi. Mary Beth is so kind and listens to all your concerns. Candi is so nice and professional and I enjoy talking with her. You can't beat this practice.|Candi is always friendly and courteous whenever we come to appointments. She is very thorough and makes sure we are well taken care of.|I adore most of the people at PPTI, but Sarah and April are awesome! They actually listen to what I say and make suggestions to help. It's nice to feel listen to, rather than being pushed thru!!!|I want to thank Shalane for her patience and help today. She was very professional and super nice. I'm thankful for kind people in today's world and greatful for her help. God bless you and thank you!!|If you like being 70 years old in constant pain and treated like a teenager this would be your place to go, was taken off pain meds so quickly nearly had stroke,thanks April also I don't feel comfortable around you as you seem to feel as though you are god. Would love for you to be in my pain 1 day,can't continue as I'm becoming too upset about this whole ordeal my whole family is in medical field and feel I should take this complaint a step further|Just when I thought I found someone willing to help, it all gotten taken away in an instant! I went to premier today only to get told they couldn't prescribe me medicine anymore because the urinalysis didn't show it in my system! I took it every day just like Mary Beth told me, I don't understand how a place can do this without testing again! Has this happened to anyone else? I don't understand how can they not even give you a second chance? I was finally getting my life back and now it's all gone! So I sit here in pain once again with no relief in sight ! Who do I call or talk to, to try and get my medication back?|Very nice people you deal with from the office people to the Dr's.|Dr. Danko put a pain pump in my spine. I've been in pain since I was 10 years old without finding anything as helpful by itself.

However, the fact that they lied about being willing to take over my gabapentin prescription resulted in me having to go through my GP for it, and it was reduced to 2/3rds of what it was before.

They also apparently put an arbitrary limit on how high they will increase the pump, which they informed me (with a little prodding) is determined by the pain management facility, and is not a limit set by the DEA.

Their arbitrary decisions which seem to have no goal other than to minimize their own liability at the expense of their patients are incredibly frustrating, and make me question how long-term a solution Premier actually is.

column40: I had my first appointment with Dr. Amin the other day and I was so impressed with her professionalism and empathy. I had to leave my previous doctor  because they stopped taking my insurance so I was very reluctant and nervous about finding a new doctor - Especially since he was the only doctor who ever treated me for my condition. Dr. Amin took her time to get to know me and my medical history, she gave me a lot of recommendations to help my condition aside from just medication and she was so easy to talk to. I'm so happy to have found her and for the rapport we began to build. Dr. Amin is a Gem and such a warm soul! I look forward to receiving my treatment from her and this practice going forward. I hope that I continue to have positive experiences like this at Premier Pain Treatment Institute. Thank you for investing in wonderful Physicians who truly care about their patients! You are a blessing!|My husband Willard has gone to this place for over 6 years. He's  really had a great experience with all the drs and nurses practitioners. They continue to help him with injections and other treatments. Really it's been a godsend. Thank you for helping him|Definitely recommend Dr. Danko this isn't just a place to get a band aid for your pain issues. Dr. Danko offers a wide variety of options to help not only   ease the pain but remove it. Amazing front office staff that helped with my insurance. The nurses are all top notch but Destiny really goes above to ensure you have a good visit with a pretty good music play list. Thank you Dr Danko and yout great team.|I've been a patient here for a couple years. I have a couple of debilitating progressive diseases that cause significant pain. I'm also a very neuro spicy individual with sailor vocabulary. Dr. Danko and the nurse practitioners not only actually acknowledge and don't gaslight me for my extreme chronic pain, they put up with my neuro spicy self with a lot of grace. They said my medication was not in my system and it should have been so I asked them to do another test and they said no and refused me the refill my medication that has been giving me my life back plus I can't afford the shots right now! I have been seeing Dr Essandoh since  2016 for my chronic back pain and other joint issues. I have lumbar fusion done many years ago that failed to fix all of my spine pain but this office has definetly restored my quality of life. I love that the care is consistent and I feel listened to. I am able to live my life more fully with the help of cortisone injections, ablations, and other therapies. The office staff is always helpful and courteous.|I have been a patient of Dr Essandoh for 8 years. I have had nothing but pleasurable experiences from the very first visit to present. They take the time to listen to you and answer any and all questions and/or concerns. Then time to work on those concerns. I have also had injections in a few different areas of my body with some working great and some not so good. I never felt forced to do the injections. The procedure was explained thoroughly and it helped me make my decision. I would highly recommend Dr Essandoh and his staff to anyone I know looking for a good trustworthy pain management dr.|I have been seeing Dr Essandoh for close to 11years.I work in construction these trades are hard on the person's body. I feel lucky to have found Dr Essandoh he knows the body, muscles and suggest exercises, therapy and or injections to help your injury. The staff is great to work with mainly on appointments and problems with prescriptions and insurances.
Dr Essandoh is a very fine doctor, and I appreciate all that he has done for me.
Thank you Dr Essandoh|Make sure you Record everything the Doctors tell you. They will lie to your face with no problem. You must be willing to let them do Procedures non-stop. I was there 1 year they did 2 spine injections on me. They also had 3 other procedures they wanted to do. If you don't want to comply with whatever procedures,  I once had a nurse tell me " No procedures No pills" meaning No needed pain meds. I'm not sure how legal or ethical that is.
Also watch out for the monthly visit to his office to get your medication refill. They hand you a medical Waiver to sign. Then you find out for the first time you have been scheduled for a procedure. I had that pop up procedure thing happen 3 times in my year there. I was coerced and did allow 2 of them just to get my meds. I did not allow the third and I was promptly dropped as a patient.  SO BEWARE!!|I have been a patient for over 10 years and have experienced nothing but positive from the staff to the Doctors. They genuinely care about their patients!|I have been a patient of Oracle pain clinic since 2017 the doctor is top-notch he has helped me tremendously his staff is very professional and they go out of their way to help you I highly recommend them|A RESPONSE TO FRAUD SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT LLC
Oracle Pain Clinic prides itself in doing over 5000 spine injections including Spinal Cord Stimulators and Radiofrequency Ablations without a single reported incident of an infection. We take infection control very seriously and we adhere to all recommended protocol by the CDC as our minimum standard of care.
We will strongly recommend that you report to Ohio Department of Health Infectious Disease Division if you believe you have contracted an infection from a procedure, this will ensure that an audit is carried out by the department to help improve standards.
Unfortunately, the reviewer did not give any name and the alleged named, Fraud Systems Management LLC cannot even be traced, and so we are not able to contact the patient or their primary care doctor to ascertain the veracity of this review.

At Oracle Pain Clinic (OPC) we take pride in providing excellent patient care, and we take that responsibility very seriously! Our staff are affectionate and will treat you with the respect that you deserve. Our goal is to ensure our patients get their life back to the best of our ability using Medication management, Procedures, Physical Therapy, Psychotherapy, Consultation referrals etc., whiles keeping our community safe. We employ stringent policies, abiding by State Medical Policies.
If you have a pain problem and are willing to seek help, then OPC is the right place for you but if your intention is pill seeking for other ulterior motives, then unfortunately OPC is not the right office for you.
Respect is mutual so we expect our staff to be respectful towards patients, and be attentive to their needs, and we expect our patients to show that mutual respect.

Thank you|I've been seeing Dr. Essandoh for a while now and if it's up to me, I will never leave his care. Everyone in the office are professional and take very good care of me. Dr. Essandoh and Dr. Alec take excellent care of me and I feel like they care about me as a person. They talk to me and ask questions concerning me and my life as well as doing MRIs, injections or whatever it takes to keep me as much as possible pain free. Thank you Oracle Pain Clinic for being the BEST in your field !

column40:
Stephanie is such a great, caring person.
My wife Connie was having sme medical issues while at the office, she strongly suggested that she be seen.my wife refused. She then called me a short time later...at home..and she got Connie to go to the hospital. Without her concern, and advise..might. have turned out much worse. Two days in the hospital.  She's fine now and we love you Stephanie.|I have been going to the Loveland location for over 4 years and it was horrible, sometimes I waited for 1-2 hours for my appt. I made the switch to the Middletown location and couldn't be happier. The staff is amazing, especially the receptionist Stephanie, she knew my name from day 1 and is so sweet. Also Darcy, the Xray tech, is always smiling and in such a good mood whenever I get any injections, and it puts me at a little more ease. And let's not forget Dr. Wray, easy to talk to, calm comforting voice, and so very sweet as well. Overall, this location is the absolute best.|I am having excellent care at PPTI. Dr. Danko, Paul and Danyell are wonderful. And all of the staff are so caring and nice. I never thought I could get help without surgery but they will not give up trying to help. I just love PPTI. I highly reccomend.|I started off seeing Dr. Wray. He took the time to hear me out and gave me options on what route I wanted to take. Then I started seeing Danyell. She has has been amazing aswell.  Down to earth. Gets to know you as a person. Takes her time talking to you, gives her opinion and listens to what you have to say. Never once have I felt uncomfortable there. The whole office has been welcoming and polite. I'm glad I chose this pain management for my care!|Dr. Ray and Danyell Has been very professional and has made me very comfortable with their treatments and advice. I highly recommend using Premier pain treatment for your pain relief.|I had dealt with back pain caused by disc herniation and spinal stenosis for years going without treatment because many doctors would not even look into my pain or take it seriously because of my young age. After having thoracic spine fusion (t10-12) I was referred to Premier for pain management and have made tremendous progress in terms of pain largely due to the doctors here actually caring about their patients quality of life and advocating for them when most won't. If you're someone like me who's been denied care or dismissed but dealing with chronic or post surgical pain then I'd highly recommend giving Premier a look and hopefully they can help you out as much as myself. If I could rate it any higher than 5 stars I absolutely would!|I have been going to premier pain treatment institute for a while. The staff has always been good to me
. I've always been very polite and nice.
Because of them my pain is minimal. Dr Danko is great. When I was receiving my epidural shot he was singing and it was calming me down and I asked him to continue to sing, he tried to think of a song. I loved it. For the first time ever since I have had my injuries and whatnot. That epidural shot worked longer than it ever has on me. The epidural used to not work or only work for 24 hours. The most I had ever gotten out of it before was 3 days. I don't know what he did or how he did it but it lasted for 5 days. That epidural shot took care of my inflammation for 5 days. To say I was impressed as an understatement.
I hope that Dr Danko and the staff continue to be as awesome as they have been to me.
Please keep up the good work.|Dr Wray is great but I was cut off of medication by Paul Seigwald which threw me into major withdrawls.
DO NOT SEE PAUL SEIGWALD. Maybe they will get rid of him if everyone refuses to see him.

Spine LLC serves Columbus, Ohio with exceptional pain management services under the leadership of Dr. Nikesh Batra, MD. Our specialized clinic has become a trusted healthcare destination for residents throughout central Ohio seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Since establishing our practice, we've built a reputation for combining advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care, ensuring each patient receives personalized treatment plans designed to improve their quality of life.

Dr. Nikesh Batra is a recognized name in the field of Pain Management with over two decades of clinical experience. After completing his pain fellowship at the University of Texas, Dr. Batra has been practicing interventional pain management since 2002. His extensive training and commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in pain medicine allow him to offer patients innovative solutions for even the most complex pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Treatment Services

Our friendly team of trained specialists at Spine LLC provides treatment and support for a range of painful conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica

  • Herniated discs

  • Diabetic neuropathy

  • Joint pain

  • Nerve pain disorders

Patient-Centered Approach

At Spine LLC, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why we take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of your pain. Our goal is not just temporary relief but long-term improvement in function and comfort.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Batra and our team, please contact us at +1 614-392-5336. Our clinic is conveniently located at 1090 Beecher Crossing N, Columbus, OH 43230. For more information about our services and to access patient resources, visit our website at columbusspinecare.com.

Zeeshan Tayeb, MD serves Cincinnati, Ohio and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. As a board-certified interventional pain specialist, Dr. Tayeb has dedicated his practice to helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions through comprehensive, personalized treatment plans. His clinic offers a wide range of advanced pain management solutions, combining cutting-edge medical techniques with compassionate care to address the unique needs of each patient.

At his state-of-the-art facility located at 3328 Westbourne Dr, Cincinnati, OH 45248, Dr. Tayeb provides treatments for various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. His approach integrates minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies to create effective pain relief strategies that improve patients' quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Tayeb believes in establishing strong doctor-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. Since establishing his practice in 2019, he has earned a reputation for taking the time to listen carefully to patients' concerns and thoroughly explaining treatment options. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that individuals feel empowered and informed about their pain management journey.

Contact Information

What doctor out there gives urine, blood test, mouth swab all @once in one day who does this the lab girl is very rude I don't care if she worked in the parole office you don't treat ppl in the doctor office like there in jail . This place will treat you like a dog cause they know you have to have the meds to function they say random drug test goes that when I go in there everyday none stop 4x a week and drug test and count pills then says go to rehab and will except you back in the office why would anyone go to rehab then call a pain doctor to come back you gotta be stupid to do that tayeb is way to busy he took on way to many patients and now he just hurry up with these injections don't care what he damages along the way as long as he gets paid and now I'm messed up for life in my neck cause he rushed thru the injection.DONT COME HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE TREATED LIKE A PRISONER OR A DOG CONSTANTLY DRUG TEST AFTER ANOTHER ON TOP OF INJECTIONS THE NURSES PRETTY MUCH TAKE OVER ITS UNORGANIZED|I have to go regularly and so does my mother and he not only pushed back surgery several times instead using steroid injections on something easily solvable WITH surgery and JUST MADE IT SO I HAVE NERVE DAMAGE IN MY SPINE. I'm at bare minimum taking this to some sort of governmental complain box and honestly more|I really REALLY appreciate Dr. Tayeb's comprehensive approach (meds,  treatments, nutrition, exercise, and mental/emotional health) toward treating pain mgt since all those factors play a role in keeping my Best Quality of Life Goals, while living w/ horrific chronic pain. He is incredibly understanding & caring, and the office staff is too! Very grateful to be a patient in their kind, expert care. Thank you Dr Tayeb for giving me my hope back again.|I am a new patient so I think I can give the most honest review. First the front desk they due there best for one person. Dr Tayeb is a very very busy dr didn't get to see him on my second appt I saw the PA she was nice but I felt like the appt was rushed but I understand they was behind but didn't get my questions answered I work full time so it's hard for me to keep coming back every 2 weeks but gonna do best. The MA seemed like she was in a very very bad mood. But overall I feel they are a good practice.|Dr. Tayeb gives you 110% attention while in the office and does not make you feel rushed. I personally ask tons of questions and he was more than happy to oblige and even further explain my concerns and inquiries. Developed a great rapport with me as a patient and has an excellent bedside manner. Overall, Dr. Tayeb made me feel very safe and comfortable with his diagnosis and treatment plan. One of the best doctors I have ever seen.|Today was my first time ever seeing dr Tayeb. I drove an hour to come see him. For the first time I felt I was listened too. He gave me great advise and was very confident we will at some point get to the bottom of my medical problems. I loved that he gave me options. I've been to other doctors and they strictly give you 1 or 2 options. I was given multiple! As pain medication does work for me I am so very excited to finally start doing alternatives along with that. All the staff was amazing! I am very young with A LOT of medical issues- I've had a hard time finding someone who will LISTEN to ME and not just look at me as "oh you're young you don't have issues you're just here for meds" Dr Tayeb absolutely DID NOT treat me that way. I've researched and researched pain doctors, and I'm beyond excited to start my healing process with him! I highly recommend this office and it's absolutely WORTH the drive.|I do not recommend this place. He is not conscious of your money at all and completely over the top! Never been to a pain management place that forces you to do bloodwork on top of urine tests and forces you to  see his behavioral specialist.
His lab girl is very rude also. Asked her a question about why getting a second urine test since I just had one  and her answer was " JUST PLAN ON GETTING ONE EVERYTIME YOU COME" .
Well I told her I won't do that. Drug test for me are $150. Out of pocket everytime I get one and they are supposed to be random. Anyway.... THIS PLACE IS A JOKE. Also no business doing bloodwork.  Was misdiagnosed there. Was told I was anemic and I was not AT ALL!!! My doctor saw the results of bloodwork and said in no way I was anemic!|First visit went fair. Basically, interviewing for a new Pain management.  Very strong opinions on pursuing alternative therapies. Examples: blocks, ablation, physical therapy, medical massage, chiropractor and more depending on the insurance coverage you have. Doctor interrupted the intake with the nurse, to me it set the wrong tone. Staff is very busy. Be prepared for a 2 to 3 hour wait time.  If you are going there for treatment, choose this place. If you have alternative motives other than trying to gain a better quality of life then find someplace else.  My hangup was injections that I had and failed but they insist you start over when transferring into their practice. Keeping my opinion open since it is a new experience and I hope a better one with these injections. Not a guarantee to work but a promising one if done correctly. Make your consultation and ask everything you want to know. The office staff are really dedicated, helpful and personable. The medical assistance are busy but will take the time to answer your questions and explain how the system works there. Remember. Every doctors office is different. Good Luck

column49: Dr Tayeb is a wonderful, thoughtful, kind doctor that prefers to never give you narcotic type medicines. But if you need them and/or have been on them for ruptured discs etc etc. then he will manage your meds in a safe way.  For anyone who calls him and this office a legal drug pushing place apparently isn't suffering from six ruptured discs, fibromyalgia, chronic migraines etc etc who are in severe non stop pain.  The staff here are kind and helpful.  You are usually here a very long time waiting for your appointment but that is the only downside.   May all the detractors suddenly come down with such horrible ailments for just a week then come back to me and let me know how you are fairing without this office and similar ones.  Thanks Dr Tayeb and your amazing office.  Ps they have always been kind to my hyperactive grand baby never losing their patience ever. And thank you Joanie at front desk for always being super helpful and like family!

column3:
Pain Zero in Westerville, Ohio serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice is dedicated to providing patients with effective alternatives to major surgery through innovative treatments and personalized care plans. The Pain Zero team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate patient-centered approaches to address chronic pain conditions, helping residents throughout central Ohio reclaim their quality of life.

At Pain Zero, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach targets the root causes of discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms. Our pain management experts utilize cutting-edge diagnostic tools and treatment modalities to develop customized care plans for each patient's unique needs. From interventional procedures to medication management and physical therapy coordination, we offer a full spectrum of services designed to maximize pain relief while minimizing invasive interventions.

Expert Medical Team

Our physicians have established international reputations for excellence in pain management, attracting patients from across the globe seeking alternatives to surgical intervention. The Pain Zero medical team stays at the forefront of advancements in pain medicine, consistently introducing innovative treatments to our practice. This commitment to medical advancement ensures our patients receive the most effective and current therapies available in the field.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

What truly distinguishes Pain Zero is our unwavering dedication to personalized healthcare. We take the time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop treatment strategies aligned with their specific goals and lifestyle needs. Our supportive staff creates a welcoming environment where patients feel valued and understood throughout their healing journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at +1 614-647-2526. Our modern facility is conveniently located at 450 Alkyre Run Dr # 340, Westerville, OH 43082. For more information about our services and treatment options, visit our website at https://pzohio.com/pain-zero-westerville.
column11: Pain Zero is dedicated to comprehensive patient care and pain relief. We strive to help patients avoid major surgery, and our pain management experts are deeply committed to excellence in personal healthcare. We are committed to bringing the newest treatments to our patients. Our doctors have changed the lives of patients from all over the world.

Integrated Pain Solutions serves the Greater Ohio area with specialized interventional pain management clinics in Springfield, Dublin, and Polaris. This network of pain practices brings together world-class physicians specifically trained in both anesthesia and pain medicine to address a comprehensive range of pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, their medical team focuses on identifying and treating the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing patients to regain mobility and return to active lifestyles.

At Integrated Pain Solutions, patients find effective treatments for numerous conditions including spinal stenosis, post-laminectomy syndrome, degenerative disc disease, and many other acute and chronic pain disorders. The practice utilizes advanced interventional techniques and customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and medical history.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

The cornerstone of Integrated Pain Solutions' approach is their commitment to addressing the underlying causes of pain rather than relying solely on symptom management. This philosophy guides their individualized treatment protocols, ensuring that each patient receives care specifically designed for their unique condition and circumstances.

Convenient Locations

With multiple locations throughout the Greater Ohio area, Integrated Pain Solutions makes specialized pain care accessible to more patients. Their Dublin office is conveniently located at 6397 Emerald Parkway, Suite 100, Dublin, OH 43016. Patients seeking consultations or treatment information can reach their team directly at (614) 777-5700 or visit their website at http://ipscolumbus.com/ to learn more about available services and treatment options.
column11: Integrated Pain Solutions is a network of interventional pain practices serving the Greater Ohio area in Springfield, Dublin, and Polaris. These clinics offer world-class physicians who are trained in anesthesia and in pain medicine, offering a wide array of treatment options to combat acute or chronic pain. Find solutions for spinal stenosis, post-laminectomy syndrome, degenerative disc disease, and much more. Our philosophy is to treat the source of the pain, not mask the symptoms. Here, you can expect a tailored, individualized approach to treating your pain and getting you back to living an active life.

Southwest Ohio Pain Center serves West Chester Township, OH and the surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our state-of-the-art facility is strategically located near Voice of America MetroPark, providing patients with a serene and accessible environment for their treatment journey. Since our founding, we have dedicated ourselves to addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based, multidisciplinary approaches tailored to each individual's unique needs.

At Southwest Ohio Pain Center, our board-certified physicians and specialized medical team offer a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management protocols, and integrative therapies. We treat conditions including but not limited to back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our goal is to improve functionality and quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications whenever possible.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating personalized treatment plans that address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of chronic pain. Our compassionate staff works closely with each patient to understand their pain history, establish realistic goals, and develop sustainable management strategies. This collaborative approach has earned us the trust and loyalty of patients throughout Southwest Ohio.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 513-860-0371. Our facility is conveniently located at 7760 West, Drive D, West Chester Township, OH 45069, adjacent to the Voice of America MetroPark. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans to ensure accessible care for all who need it.

column3:
Interventional Spine & Pain Management Center in Miamisburg, Ohio provides comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Miami Valley region. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Vivekanand "Vic" Manocha, MD, the center has established itself as a premier destination for those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility at 2835 Miami Village Drive combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide spectrum of pain-related disorders.

At Interventional Spine & Pain Management Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Dr. Manocha brings over two decades of specialized experience in interventional pain procedures, including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and minimally invasive techniques for disc-related conditions. Our comprehensive approach integrates medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and advanced interventional procedures tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our Commitment to Patient-Centered Care

What distinguishes our practice is our unwavering dedication to personalized treatment plans. Dr. Manocha takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each patient, considering their medical history, current symptoms, and personal goals. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that treatment strategies address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain, maximizing long-term outcomes and quality of life improvements.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Vivekanand "Vic" Manocha at Interventional Spine & Pain Management Center, please call +1 937-619-0724. Our welcoming facility is conveniently located at 2835 Miami Village Dr, Miamisburg, OH 45342. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making advanced pain management accessible to all patients in need.

column40:
I don't know what's wrong with Ohio pain management but geez it's impossible to find a doctor that actually cares. Just moved from Fl to Ohio and have been seeing a pain management doc for 6 years. I am not a patient here but I just called to schedule a new patient appointment. The receptionist explained that they only do steroid shots there (didn't even ask medical conditions). But I do find that his response was quick and effective unlike other offices. I've had over 10 surgeries bc the military screwed up the first one. Every doctor here wants to do more surgeries or shots. I'm not a huge fan of opioids either but it's the only thing that's helped with the pain. So 3-5 stars for being quick, direct, effective. I wouldn't be opposed to shots but if that's all they can offer then I've been there and done that with my previous pain management doc.|Dr. B was very careful about explaining everything to me, which is of the utmost importance to a scientific person like myself. The other thing that is drastically different between the way Dr. B went over my MRIs and X-rays with me and the way other doctors have done was astonishing. He saw things on my radiology that other doctors have seen but never noticed before. He had a good idea of where to start and I'm very satisfied with my SI shots because he had the right idea. My pain has lessened a great deal and without pain killing drugs, which I've been anxious to avoid. I'll be returning to talk with Dr. B about my other pain issues and I'm confident that he'll be able to help using the most recent and advanced techniques. In addition, his staff is superior, professional and friendly. The office is quiet, nicely decorated and relaxing. I could not be more pleased and optimistic about being able to keep working well into the future, thanks to Dr. B's careful attention to the kind of detail we should all expect from our doctors.|I have had several lumbar and cervical epidural snd facet injections over the years.  I have had no adverse reaction, the injections were expertly placed and have provided tremendous relief.  They have kept me functioning.  The staff there is wonderful and professional.  Dr. Buenaventura also offers minimally invasive procedures that may stave off major surgery.  I highly recommend Pain Relief of Dayton!|I've experienced back pain for quite a long time until one evening it became so unbearable I had to go to the emergency room.  After morphine, pain pills and an MRI, I was referred to Dr. Buenaventura.  He recommended the steroid injections to reduce the inflammation caused by my herniated discs.  After the injections I experienced a 90% improvement in my pain level within 3 days!  I went from using a walker to get around inside my home to practically no pain whatsoever.  Dr B's expertise as well as the friendly, knowledgeable staff is second to none.  I can't thank them enough for how well they treated me!|I went there inquiring about prolotherapy/PRP for chronic arthritis in my hips.  Dr. Buenaventura discussed other options and didn't push either one.  While only a day later, I have noticed a difference in how I feel and my pain in the hips.

I have to go back in about a month for a follow-up, but so far I'm very pleased.  The staff are really nice also, which for me makes a  huge difference in a doctor's office.|I am always greeted with a smile and seen promptly.  The staff is very professional. It is evident that Dr. B has a good relationship with them. As a health care professional myself, I appreciate the care and attention to my well being while receiving treatment.|I am AMAZED at how awesome I feel after having an injection in my lower back, sacrum area.  I'm a patient of Dr. Long, chiropractor at Dr. B's practice, and I can't speak highly enough of the professionalism and care received from the staff and doctors!  I will remain a long-time patient!!!!|Dr  Buenoventura and his staff were very caring and helpful with my 94 year old aunt. She is now back on her feet and enjoying life again after her injection and a non narcotic medication. Very efficient office. Thank You!

column3:
Miami Valley Pain Center serves Dayton, Ohio and the surrounding Miami Valley region with comprehensive pain management services. Located within the Miami Valley Hospital complex, our center brings together a multidisciplinary team of board-certified pain specialists, neurologists, and physical therapists dedicated to addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. Since our establishment, we have been committed to providing personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Miami Valley Pain Center, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and integrative pain management techniques. Our specialists are experienced in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects each person differently, which is why our treatment protocols are tailored to individual needs. Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and procedure rooms designed for patient comfort and safety. The center works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care and optimal outcomes for all patients.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 937-208-2723. We are conveniently located at 30 E Apple St, Suite 5250, Dayton, OH 45409. For additional information about our services and team, visit our website at http://www.miamivalleyhospital.org/digest.aspx?id=11756.

Miami Valley Pain Center is affiliated with Premier Health and accepts most major insurance plans. Physician referrals may be required depending on your insurance provider.

column40:
Dr. Smith and his staff are seriously amazing. I was seen in his clinic while admitted for back issues. For one they went so far out of their way to get my insurance to approve epidural injections then stayed late to be able to do them. I have anxiety and worked myself up way too much and him and his entire staff went so far out of their way to ease my mind and make me not only comfortable but laugh as well. Everything was explained so thoroughly to me and was continuously reassured that everything was my choice.. I genuinely enjoyed being aroud all of the staff and appreciate them treating me as a person and i feel like they actually cared about me as a person. If you've ever been to his clinic You'll understand that you have no choice but to leave there a buckeye fan. Just having injections yesterday I cant say if theyre helping yet but I really was so touched by him and his staff and will be forever greatful for their kindness. If I need future things I will look forward to going to this office.|Dr. Smith, is very thorough in explaining everything from how and why you are experiencing pain and then how he is going to attack the problem. The extra time explaining really calmed my nerves about the treatment. And then his treatment of my injury and pain worked incredibly well. Pain free and back on the tennis courts! Thanks Doc!|Visit Dr Townsend Smith a CPL times a year, he's awsum, we always get great results. Highly recommend to all our friends. & Everybody who works with him  is happy & helpful, actually look forward to going there to visit with all the employees|Very compassionate doctor and staff. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. Would recommend!|I have seen Dr Townsend Smith at this clinic for chronic back pain in various joints. He is very professional, knowledgeable and was able to relieve my pain every time. The entire staff is friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend the Miami Valley Pain Center!|Doc Smith has helped keep me mobile for many years. He & his staff are very efficient, knowledgeable & kind.
I'd recommend the Pain Center to anyone in need of relief of discomfort.|Staff is awesome and helpful as well as Dr Smith !!  Would never see another Dr for my shots for my pain!!  Great Dr for sure and makes u feel at ease|His office and him self have made such a major difference in my pain .... They are the best .

Lee Hungchih MD serves West Chester Township, Ohio with exceptional medical care and personalized attention. Our practice, established in the heart of Butler County, offers comprehensive healthcare services to patients seeking quality medical treatment in a comfortable environment. Dr. Hungchih brings years of specialized experience to our community, combining advanced medical knowledge with a compassionate approach to patient care.

At our West Chester Township location, we provide thorough examinations, preventative care, and treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique health needs. Dr. Hungchih's practice emphasizes building lasting relationships with patients while delivering evidence-based medical care that addresses both immediate concerns and long-term wellness goals.

Our Facility

Located at 7862 Kingland Dr, Suite 201, our modern medical office features state-of-the-art equipment in a welcoming setting. The convenient location offers ample parking and accessibility features for all patients. Our professional staff ensures a smooth experience from appointment scheduling through follow-up care.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Lee Hungchih, please call +1 513-755-7888. Our office is open Monday through Friday with select hours for urgent care needs. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. Our full address is 7862 Kingland Dr, Suite 201, West Chester Township, OH 45069, United States.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. column38: Tamra Ferguson|jeff black|scott grindstaff|Nora Suzanne Crane|Sunny Kat -3-|Hope Pierson|Marie Briggs-Williams|tyler rebholz
column40:
I absolutely love Dr. Lee and everyone who works with him. I've been going to him for a number of years and out of all of my other doctors that have for other stuff, he and his staff are the MOST CARING, COMPASSIONATE, UNDERSTANDING AND WILLING TO LISTEN to you about everything and will try everything to help you feel as close to normal as he can!! His appointments sometimes are late and that's only because of what I said above. So PLEASE don't complain if you are new and your appointment was at 2 and it's 3 and you haven't been called yet. Do like me, bring a book, play games on your cell,catch up on something ,watch part of a movie or series. Anything just don't complain . Because he will spend just as much time with you as the people before you if needed.|Best caring doctor I survived cancer and left with major issues. He takes time to listen and we have dramatically reduced my meds over time! He also fixes my back issues! Highly recommended|This staff and this doc are amazing!! I have an extremely detailed complicated health history. Everything from kidney transplant, open heart surgery, liver disease and an auto immune disease that destroys my soft tissue. So I've ruptured every major tendon in my body. I've had 19 surgeries on tendons alone not including surgeries for fractures because my disease also affects the density of my bones.

Everyone of my doctors are from Ohio state so that I can keep all of my medical records at one facility. However Dr. Lee. Is one dr I refuse to leave. I've seen other pain management dr and all they do is bring you in like herding cattle and urine test you and then wanna write your script and most of them already have that written before you even get there. Not dr Lee he's involved in every aspect of my care.

He ask every time I see him how this is going and how that is going.  Modalities that aren't even his field he takes an interest in. I can't tell you how refreshing it is to have a doc that genuinely cares and takes the time to understand your complete medical history.

And then there's his staff Brittany and Amy they are phenomenal. Because of my care team being in Columbus and needing to see them every week there are times that make scheduling a night mare. Now understand that they have numerous amounts of patients that they have to contend with. But there's never been a time wether I've been in the hospital and has to reschedule my appt or had a conflict with appt that they have resolved or Been able to resolve with me. And while I know it makes it difficult for them they do it with a smile and even make jokes about it.

I can't tell you how much I recommend this dr and his staff for you pain management needs I wish I would've found him sooner in my treatment but I'm happy that I did 3 years ago. It's changed my pain management for the better. I just want to say thank you to the doc and his staff for the care I've received while here.|I am very grateful to be back as a regular patient with Dr Lee at the Pain Center.  I have gone to 4 different pain clinics, it was because I changed insurance plans that I even left his clinic.  In my opinion both he and his staff (especially Amy) are the best and most caring of anywhere that I have been.  So much so that I changed back my insurance to just plain Medicare so that I could go back to them.  The other places treated me poorly and only seemed to care about getting money, especially Cincinnati Comprehensive Pain Center in Fairfield.|I have been seeing Dr Lee for 10 years and I am beyond impressed with his ability to help even the toughest cases get control of their pain and improve their quality of life. Dr Lee is  conservative with medication treatment, offers in office acupuncture and epidurals, and most importantly, will get you back to living life.
Dr Lee is amazing at acupuncture for those looking into acupuncture and epidurals. I would highly recommend him.|I have been to 4 pain clinics with no real relief.  No one has given me so much attention, much less tried different approaches towards giving me some relief from the intense pain I live with.  He is the most amazing doctor I've ever experienced and I am thankful for him every day.|He listens, reviews xrays, MRI'S and other necessary medical records. Good pain management doctor and Amy is great especially when it's time for me to get an injection....lol...great at keeping the schedule on-time lately!!|Do not recommend they don't follow simple instructions. I went in for back pain from a car accident and they think acupuncture is an appointment treatment (is not) and when I explicitly told them that the bill should be sent to the lawyers handling the case, they waited until the case was completely over and then sent the bill to me, and have been harassing me for the past 3 years.

column3:
Pain Evaluation & Management Center of Dayton, Ohio stands as the region's premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. Serving patients throughout the Miami Valley and beyond, our state-of-the-art facility combines cutting-edge technology with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently at 1550 Yankee Park Pl in Dayton, our center has established itself as a leader in innovative pain treatment approaches that prioritize patient comfort and long-term wellness.

At Pain Evaluation & Management Center, we pride ourselves on offering the most advanced treatments available anywhere in Ohio. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates the latest medical technologies and evidence-based protocols to provide personalized care plans for each patient. From minimally invasive procedures to comprehensive medication management, our specialists employ a wide range of techniques designed to target pain at its source while minimizing side effects and recovery time.

Our Patient-Centered Philosophy

The cornerstone of our practice is a commitment to restoring patients to their former lifestyle as free as possible from pain. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each case, identifying underlying causes and developing targeted treatment strategies. Our goal extends beyond simple pain reduction—we aim to improve overall quality of life, functionality, and independence for every individual who walks through our doors.

Expert Medical Team

Our facility is staffed by board-certified pain management specialists with extensive training in the latest interventional techniques and therapeutic approaches. Working alongside our physicians are dedicated nurses, physical therapists, and support staff who collaborate to deliver comprehensive care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of pain management.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, patients can reach us at (937) 439-4949 or visit our website at http://daytonpain.com/. Our Dayton office at 1550 Yankee Park Pl welcomes new patients and referrals from throughout Ohio who are seeking effective solutions for chronic pain conditions.
column11: Pain Evaluation and Management State of the art, the most advance treatments offered anywhere in the state of Ohio. Our goal is to restore patients to their former lifestyle as free as possible from pain.
