column38: Michael Sherman|Johnny Jackson|Andrea Lane|Sandra Scheve|Jon G.|Candice Rowland|Chris Walton|Otis B
column40:
Cancels without consult.. this place is a Joke.. get referred somewhere else or go to OSU ... They cancelled on a 81 year old lady with less than 6 months left to live who has a crushed back and is in incredible amounts of pain. Not to mention we've been waiting months for her to get in . Dr just looked at her file and canceled her appointment before she was ever seen by anyone from here .. I would avoid this place|I know this may sound cliche but if I could give no stars or negative stars here I would. Please, Please, Please do not go here or let one of your family get so called treatment here.

First off, when we tried to get an appointment we send an message through the website with not answer, called with no answer and left message with no return call. We chose to actually drive to the office and talk to someone about making an appointment. When we got to the office we were told to go to the second office behind the main office to talk with the scheduler. There were 4 employees outside smoking and were very surprised to see us walk into an unattended office. Conveniently the scheduler was not there at the moment so we left paperwork with another employee and left. Astoundingly we received a call the next day to schedule. Not surprised that the person I spoke to was very unprofessional, used street jargon, and was downright rude. Like she was doing us a favor. The appointment was set for a month out.

We get to the appointment and we have to wait an hour and a half past our appointment time to see Dr. Pauley who could not seem to get a string of two words out with out stuttering. She seemed very incompetent. She explained some prescription changes and scribbled instructions on the back of a piece of paper. Professional, I know. Then stated an addiction assessment was needed before any pain medications would be prescribed. She send a referral that was not sent until one and a half weeks later and the progress notes or report of the visit was not on any paperwork aside from the scribbled notes, or forwarded to the facility my mother resides. Of course they did not check to see if the referring doctor took our insurance. I know you are surprised that they did not. We contacted PEMCO to let them know this. Shockingly, it took about two weeks to get some sort of resolution regarding this manner. With an assessment that is so important to the treatment of a wide range of the patients that are seen at this practice they only have one doctor they refer to for this service.

AGAIN, DO NOT GO HERE FOR YOU OR A FAMILY MEMBER, THEY ARE HORRIBLE FROM START TO FINISH. STAY AWAY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY AND MENTAL HEALTH.|Too bad you can't select 0 stars!! I've been going to this clinic for 3 years, it was great starting out, seen Dr. Pauley only twice the other times it was a PA. I was sent to an addiction specialist, $150 out of pocket, he didn't accept my insurance, he told me he is going to recommend to continue treatment as they were, nope that wasn't going to happen. My own personal opinion, PEMCO & Dr. Mubarak have this little side deal going! was told I would only be getting injections, they don't work. Not one person. Will call me back or even email. So what was the point in sending me to the other doctor? Piss poor customer service, they have absolutely no concern for patient care. AVOID AT ALL COST!!
So we are going on 2 weeks with no phone call as to why they did what they did. But it gets worse, I was called in medication and was told to take for withdrawal symptoms, so I have low blood pressure, they called in a medication used for high blood pressure!! I kept getting really dizzy, seeing black spots and had to grab ahold of something so I would fall. Called left messages actually several messages and not one single person from this god awful office will return my call!! I've sent a complaint to the Ohio medical board as well!!|I asked why the federal and Ohio law that states pain patients in treatment on and before 2018 were NOT to be forced tapered but were.No answer to that one. I was taken from 100 mg to a 25 mg. .More people have died now from turning to illegal drugs and suicide, because of inadequate pain management
A pain patch fell into my dress, and I was blamed for that and she refused to prescribe after that.
I agreed to spinal injections with no relief,  but Dr.Dann reported to my family doctor I claimed 100% relief, which was absolutely untrue.
I requested to see another doctor in that practice but was refused.
When I told her a new Rx she prescribed nearly killed me, she dismissed me from the clinic.
That turned out to be a good thing because having a doctor giving bad vibes is not a helpful situation, besides being extremely unpleasant.
Her  insistence that my pain was caused by my spine was completely wrong and I've learned it's from an entirtely different cause.|Great Doctors, friendly staff. No problem with treatments.Been going here for a good while.Very Happy with Everyone at Pemco. Will recommend ... Always treated with Respect.|If I could give half a star I would, and the half star would only be because I didnt have to sit in the waiting room for very long. Upon Dr. Dann at this office walked in the room, before speaking to me or anything she says she wants to taper me down, then turns around a few minutes later and says she doesnt have all my medical records and needs time to obtain those. So she felt confident enough to know she wants to taper me but not confident enough to prescribe anything. I lost alot of weight and body mass after having my pancreas, spleen and gallbladder removed but my goal is to get the pain pump once I can add some body back (I was with an advanced pain clinic at IUH but the drive was becoming too much). She said she can still put it in, its just got to stick out. So im trading on pain for another. There is so much more I want to write on this review because I did go back for a follow up. I wanted to walk out in the middle of the appt. In the follow up I questioned her about making a decision to taper me down without records and asked if she documented that. You could tell me questioning her offended her and now the pain pump is no longer an option. Anything I suggested in what I thought would work for me, she denied. She humiliated me, made me feel 2 inches tall and has the worst bedside manner I have ever come across. I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND HER AT ALL!!|Tammy Dann, DO was my physician at PEMCO in Dayton, OH. My experience with her was very unsatisfactory. During my initial visit with her she told me I would be seen by a physician on every other monthly visit. In reality it was their policy that a patient would only see their doctor annually. My biggest complaint however relates to my cancellation of an appointment with her on the day of the appointment, rather than the required 24 or 48 hour advance notice. I had appointments on 12/4/23 with the CNP and an appointment with Dr. Dann on 12/27/23. I had COVID during that month. I canceled the first appointment ahead of time according to their policy. When it was the day of my scheduled visit with Dr. Dann I got up and got ready, fully intending to keep the appointment but by the time I was prepared to go I felt the fatigue and brain fog that had been symptoms of the illness. I called the office and said I felt too ill to make it there and asked if I could reschedule. After a short hold on the phone the staff member returned to the line and said the answer was no and that I needed to make my next appointment with a nurse practitioner. I made and kept that appointment but learned that Dr. Dann had written a note in my chart, reducing my monthly Rx from Norco 5/325 three times a day to twice a day. She added that no provider was to increase either dosage or frequency and was not to prescribe to me between monthly visits. Dr. Dann had originally prescribed the Norco tid. My pain hadn't decreased in December and the reduction felt more like a punishment than an appropriate medical determination. The late cancellation policies I was familiar with in other practices for physicians and dentists charged a monetary fee which makes sense due to the loss of revenue from canceling too late to schedule another patient. Reducing my dosage for a reason other than providing adequate care strikes me as the unethical and punitive and has no place in healthcare. I changed pain clinics and couldn't be happier with the care I am now receiving. I would never recommend Dr. Dann as a pain management specialist.|Dr Dann had to have been the most discriminatory person I have ever experienced in a medical sense. Forms an opinion of you the first time you meet and just goes downhill from there. Believes herself to be above the rest of the medical profession. Discussing her with other doctors who have spoken of her unprofessionalism and poor results. Enough said.

column3:
Cincinnati Pain Physicians serves Cincinnati, Ohio and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians combines extensive clinical experience with advanced techniques to provide effective relief for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address the root cause of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Cincinnati Pain Physicians, we specialize in treating all types of chronic pain using interventional methods. Our approach focuses on minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source, potentially reducing the need for long-term medication use or invasive surgeries. Our treatment options include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and various nerve blocks tailored to your specific condition.

Conditions We Treat

Our experienced physicians provide care for a wide range of chronic pain conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica

  • Joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating collaborative relationships with our patients, taking the time to listen to your concerns and thoroughly explain your diagnosis and treatment options. Our goal is to improve your quality of life by reducing pain and enhancing function, allowing you to return to the activities you enjoy.

Visit Our Clinic

Located at 8261 Cornell Rd, Suite 630, Cincinnati, OH 45249, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (513) 891-0022 or visit our website at www.cincinnatipainphysicians.com.
column11:
Interventional Pain Management Clinic

We treat all types chronic pain using interventional methods.

column40:
My father and I have been clients for over 6years. Dr G is very nice, courteous and listens. His staff is so sweet and caring. We just started seeing Shauna his PA and see is nice and listens. Definitely will refer people there.|Very impressed so far by the compassion and dedication of this Dr. He is a doctor that really gets to know his patients. The procedure was quick and painless. The entire staff was kind and made sure I was comfortable.|Everyone here is GREAT. They listen you your problems and treat you like a human. The injections they offer help so much I'd recommend them to anyone!|This is the most caring doctors office I have ever been to they treat you very good the staff are amazing. Even Michelle (NP)and Dr. G have done so much to make my back feel better than what it did when I first came here with the overall respect that they give you and how you're treated is just beyond greatness I would refer these doctors to anyone who ever ask me, they are the best There's nothing that they could do to make there doctors office better than what it is now . That's how great they are. Even the doctors office is very cleaned. Just love this place. Great job guys.
Thank you all,  Eva Lockard|I have had nothing but good experiences from Dr sadarshan. I was at the Va and they weren't treating my pain adequately. Came to this practice and didn't want meds and made that clear. I had a pain pump before morphine and baclofen and it worked well until I had to have emergency surgery for a Bowell obstruction and to save my life they needed access and removed it. Told him I would like it put in again. He agreed it made sense but due to me being a spinal cord injury patient with multiple spinal surgeries he thought it best to send me to a neuro surgeon at mayfield brain and spine. Got it implanted last month and first filled a few weeks ago and forgot how good it feels to not be in pain and groggy from being on oral meds. I know it will take a while to get the dosing right but they always make time for an increase when needed and I know of if I have issues the dr will always listen and assist the best he can. If you need a good pain doc who isn't going to just push drugs but will make an effort to actually treat what is causing the pain then look no further.|Phenomenal consistent care!
Very compassionate, comprehensive and caring group of medical professionals.
I've been a patient of Dr Sudarsan since 1995! I have two complex pain syndromes that have been well managed by Dr Sudarshan.

Very highly recommended|I've had two epidurals done by Dr. Sudarshan. His ultimate goal has been providing me total pain relief, and after the first one only providing me some relief he recommended doing another. The second one has provided me 100% pain relief the next day, and I had relief within hours after the procedure. This has dramatically changed the quality of my life and I'm very happy to have found him.|Dr. Sudarshan is the best Pain Management doctor I have been to.  I have been to 4 and he identified my problem immediately by looking at my MRI.  This something the other doctors were unable to do.  I am confident that Dr. Suharshan will be my Pain Management doctor going forward,

column3:
Integrated Pain Solutions in Columbus, Ohio offers comprehensive interventional pain management services for patients suffering from acute or chronic pain conditions. Under the leadership of Medical Director Dr. Gladstone McDowell II, MD, the practice has established itself as a premier destination for those seeking effective pain relief through innovative and personalized treatment approaches. The clinic's integrated care model combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with cutting-edge therapeutic interventions to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

The practice specializes in treating various pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques and evidence-based protocols. Patients benefit from the convenience of having the Gemini Surgery Center on-site, which facilitates outpatient procedures in a comfortable, specialized environment. This integrated approach allows for seamless coordination between diagnostic evaluations and therapeutic interventions, enhancing treatment outcomes and patient satisfaction.

About Dr. Gladstone McDowell II

As both the Medical Director and practicing physician at Integrated Pain Solutions, Dr. McDowell brings extensive expertise in anesthesiology and pain management to his patients. His commitment to advancing the field is evident through his active participation in professional conferences and his dedication to training the next generation of pain management specialists. Dr. McDowell maintains memberships in several prestigious professional organizations, including the American Academy of Pain Management, the American Society of Regional Anesthesia and Pain Medicine, and the North American Neuromodulation Society.

Location and Contact Information

Integrated Pain Solutions welcomes patients at their Columbus facility located at 1210 Gemini Pl Suite 300, Columbus, OH 43240. The clinic is easily accessible and offers a comfortable, patient-centered environment. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, patients can call +1 614-383-6450 or visit their website at www.ipscolumbus.com.
column11: Integrated Pain Solutions in Columbus, Ohio provides interventional pain management for sufferers of acute or chronic pain. The pain management clinic is complemented by the Gemini Surgery Center, which offers minimally invasive outpatient procedures. Dr. Gladstone McDowell II is the Medical Director of Integrated Solutions in Columbus, Ohio and its practicing physician. He is an anesthesiologist and pain management specialist who is active in the pain management community. He attends professional conferences and has led training sessions for future pain management physicians. He is a member of: American Academy of Pain Management, American Society of Regional Anesthesia and Pain Medicine, and the North American Neuromodulation Society.
column38: John Skidmore|Christina Trapasso|Robert Ceckitti|Brian Bayless|Susan Helmuth|Dave Knotts|Adrien Roberts|The Buzz (Tbuzz)
column40:
Dr. McDowell is compassionate, caring, and makes himself available for as long as necessary to answer questions and explain his diagnosis and treatment plan. I trust his judgment and value his opinion because he has the patient's best interests at heart. His goal is helping his patients and doing what is best for the patient whether it benefits his practice or not.|Dr McDowell is one of the best doctors I've ever had the experience of working with. He is very precise and knowledgeable in all things. His care for his patients is second to none. I wouldn't want to be under anyone elses care but his. He has helped me keep my pain under control for the past almost 18 years. Wonderful doctor and wonderful person. So glad and thankful to have came under his care all those years ago!|I have been a patient of Dr McDowell for a few years. My wife has also been a patient of Dr McDowell. I did not want surgery on my back. Dr. McDowell was able to to relieve my pain several years in a row, without the use of narcotics. And he also has a very good staff that works with him. From the good results I have experienced with Dr McDowell, I would recommend that you at least give him a try.|Waited over 90 minutes past my scheduled Appt time for an initial consult at Integrated Pain Solutions  to discuss options for ongoing chronic perineal pain after a surgery.  I got, at best, about  10 minutes of his time.  He went from zero to 60 regarding treatment recommendations skipping right to having electrodes inserted into my lower spine, despite my concerns about having anything that was invasive in nature. Oddly enough the manufacturer's rep who supplies the implantable device just conveniently  happened to be on site so I was shuffled off to him to ask questions.

I did not stay to ask much of anything but it did make me ponder how he gets such rave reviews if this is how a new patient is handled.

I was then surprised by a bill for the full amount of the visit instead of a co-pay because Integrated Pain Solutions said they were "in network" with my insurance provider but my provider is refusing payment despite me providing all info when the visit was scheduled.

I felt like my time was not valued, my concerns were not adequately considered before recommending a surgical procedure after I stated I did not want anything that required surgery and that it was really shocking that the very first consult went the way it did. It was a very disappointing (and now expensive) visit after hearing good things about Dr. McDowell.  If I could give 1/2 of a star I would have and that's only because he seemed like a nice person but my experience as a patient left me disillusioned and unimpressed.|I'm actually surprised that I have never posted a review before. Dr. McDowell has been my doctor for 18 1/2 years now! My accident was July 16, 2001 and he took me on as a patient and did my first spinal cord stimulator surgery in December of 2001. He has helped me through some of the most amazing yet difficult life challenges. He has done other surgeries since, yes. My most recent being Oct. 13 of this year. Had God not placed Dr. McDowell in my life I am not sure where I would be today! He has truly been a blessing to me and my family. I would and do recommend him to anyone that needs pain management.|Dr. McDowell was fantastic. I've been working with pain doctors for 6 years now and they have an extremely difficult job. Dr. McDowell is very patient, explains everything so you can understand it, is very professional and has a good sense of humor  that keeps you relaxed.  I only was able to see him once but he definitely made a great impression. I currently moved to Florida and I'm seeing Dr. Serria in Wesley Chapel. He has heard of Dr. McDowell and is very impressed by him.|Seeking care for a rare, chronic pain condition is scary, but Dr. McDowell and his staff provided me with an excellent experience during my initial visit. They took their time and answered all my questions. He is incredibly professional, kind, and knowledgeable on an extremely uncommon condition known as CRPS. I cannot express how thankful I am that I found Dr. McDowell. My only regret is that I did not see him sooner.|Dr McDowell is everything I could ever want in a physician.  At 40 years old, I was told by other pain doctors that opioids were my only treatment option for a debilitating back condition. After visiting with Dr McDowell, he assured me that there were several options available that may not give 100% relief, but they would greatly improve my quality of life. Today I am working full time and I'm able to participate in activities with my family that I previously only dreamed about. I still have pain, but thanks to Dr McDowell, it is manageable. He never stops looking for a solution because he cares for his patients.  I don't know where I would be without him. Obviously, I would highly recommend Dr McDowell to anyone suffering from chronic pain.

Genesis Interventional Pain Management Clinic serves Zanesville, Ohio and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists provides comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Since our establishment, we have been committed to improving quality of life through innovative interventional techniques and personalized treatment plans.

At Genesis Pain Management Clinic, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options designed to address various pain conditions. Our approach combines cutting-edge technology with evidence-based practices to deliver effective pain relief. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndromes through minimally invasive techniques.

Our Treatment Approach

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Patient-Centered Care

Our clinic prioritizes patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We work closely with each individual to develop customized pain management strategies that address their specific needs and goals. Our compassionate staff ensures patients understand their conditions and treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their care.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at:

Phone: +1 740-454-4712

Address: 2945 Maple Ave, Zanesville, OH 43701, United States

Website: www.genesishcs.org/find-locations/genesis-interventional-pain-management-clinic

As part of the Genesis Healthcare System, our clinic maintains the highest standards of medical excellence while providing compassionate care to our patients. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate their coverage options for pain management services.

column40:
This all happened a few years ago. I hope things are better there now. I wanted to share my experience so hopefully it never happens to anyone else. I went to Dr Moore for pain related to an old back injury. I was upfront about being a diabetic and was told no issues. Showed up at surgical center for procedure. Per their instructions I was told to NOT take my insulin because of no eating before procedure . Once in there I got changed and checked in with nurse. She took my sugar level and said she would be back. Almost an hour later she returned with the Dr. He told me he refused to give me the shots because my sugar was too high {197}. I reminded him it was under his orders to NOT take my insulin before procedure. He said he won't do the shot, said I was too high risk and walked out. Another Genesis fail.|Dr. Benjamin Gilliotte was so thorough and sincere. He did a nerve test on me. He was gentle and talked to me the whole time to make me comfortable. I would recommend if you need this type of testing to request him to do it.|Would probably try a different doctor. My 75 yr old father has a broken spine and neck. Pain is outrageous. These folks had us come in, pay co pay, then proceeded to tell us how sorry they felt for dad and while doctor was currently in surgery he would take care of getting us new pain prescription before the end of day. End of day came and nothing. I call office at open and 90 minutes later still get no response so I show up at the office. They proceed to tell me the doctor will not be giving my father a prescription and to take him to the ER and they'll take care of his pain. Yes, our pain doctor, Dr Moore, advised us to go to the ER. So Dr Moore takes our $45 and then sends us to ER for another co pay. Such a scam. Just worse that they lied to us and took our money. Almost laughing that our pain doctor is sending us to the Hospital to take care of my fathers pain. That's what you get in a small town I suppose.. this dude wouldn't have a business in a big city where I come from. Worth finding a different doctor or driving to Parkersburg.|Wasnt inpressed . The lady that i sent emails too never got back to me . They couldnt do nothing for me i denied the injections they do not help . They post to do a referral nothings been done so luckily i didnt need one .|Make sure your getting pain medicine before going here.  Strange you can get in in a week and be getting a 3K+ bill for a shot that didn't do anything.  Make a follow up and it takes a month to get back in.... Weird...  Then, we can put a shocker in it "may" help.  No thanks.  Thanks to all the druggies who made it impossible for responsible pain med users to get medicine that is helpful.
Eternally suffering,
Lance Foster|I don't understand how you can be a pain management clinic without the pain medicine. The injections does not work. At least not for everyone. So they take your money and do nothing for you.  I guess we shouldn't expect much, when it comes to Genesis. SMDH...|Dr. B did an ablation on my back and I feel great. Thank you Dr! The staff are professional and kind.|The Dr"s an staff are awesome .
I have been going there for years now. The Dr"s an Nurse Practitioners Listen to what you say an know how to give you the best treatment...

column41:
Dr. Lee has done more than give me faith in holistic pain management.
The acupuncture therapy for stress and pain is so subtle, you're not even aware he is applying.
As the physician , he sets the tone for the entire office and is something I wish more establishments could compare to. Simply genuine and humble to all.

Thank you for your care Dr.Lee & staff.|I have had 7 spine fusions and lost the use of some of my left leg from the knee down.  I was always in pain in my lumbar area.  My family doctor (Dr. Son Bach) recommended Dr. Lee.  I was very nervous.  His staff is absolutely wonderful.  Brittany is a charm and makes you feel right at home.   She also stayed late to accommodate me and has a excellent personality and great humor.  Dr. Lee was everything my family doctor said he would be.  Extremely through, explained everything in normal talk, not doctor talk.  He told me all the different procedures that could help me with my pain and how.  I now have two procedures schedule for this month and feel so relived that I may now get some relief and that I am in the right place to help me.  While I was in the waiting room, he was running behind, but a patient a head of me said to me "He is worth the wait."  She was 100% correct.|Doctor Lee is the Best doctor to consider if you need any pain relief with needles,  I've had acupuncture nerve pain relief in one area as well as trigger point injection in another, I'm in my 60s now and back to officiating High school basketball, thank you Dr Lee, a Beast with those needles, I ain't lying ask me!|Doctor lee is a great guy and a great doctor as well. Always takes the time to really connect with me and see how I'm doing. Highly recommend|Best Place around

Spine LLC in Columbus, Ohio provides comprehensive spine care services to patients throughout central Ohio. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating a wide range of spinal conditions using both conservative approaches and advanced interventional techniques. Located conveniently in northeast Columbus, our facility offers patients a comfortable environment where they can receive personalized care from our team of spine specialists.

At Spine LLC, we understand that spinal pain and conditions can significantly impact your quality of life. Our practice combines evidence-based treatments with innovative approaches to address various spinal disorders, including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, sciatica, and chronic back pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, with options ranging from physical therapy and medication management to minimally invasive procedures when necessary.

Our Comprehensive Services

Our practice offers a full spectrum of spine care services, including detailed diagnostic evaluations, pain management solutions, and rehabilitation programs. We utilize state-of-the-art imaging and diagnostic tools to accurately identify the source of spinal issues. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that patients receive coordinated care that addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term spinal health.

Visit Our Columbus Facility

Spine LLC is conveniently located at 1090 Beecher Crossing N, Columbus, OH 43230. Our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology to provide exceptional care in a healing environment. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit our website at www.columbusspinecare.com or call us at +1 614-392-5336. Our dedicated staff is ready to help you take the first step toward a pain-free life with improved spinal health.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr. Batra for about 10 years now. Dr. Batra is very kind, gentle and passionate. He's up to date on effective treatments. My pain includes upper and lower back along with hip pain from unloading trucks for many years. My kidneys are full of kidney stones and I pass them regularly. I could not imagine making it through these years without his treatments, advice and compassion. I have heard horror stories about other pain management offices. From being crowded, to the long waits, rushed in and out. Treated with no compassion. Dr. Batra spends time with you AND listens. If you are looking to help yourself with the best of the best. Dr. Batra is the Doctor for you. The staff is amazing. The waiting room is NEVER crowded. Wait time is short. More importantly you will be asking yourself, "why didn't I find you (Dr. Batra) sooner. Get your life back.|Dr. Batra and staff work VERY hard to make you feel like you matter. They listen to what is going on with you and figure out the best plan to take for every situation. I have a complicated case, but I never once felt like he has given up on me. I have felt this from other doctors in the past. Dr Batra is very knowledgeable on out of the box procedures. He will talk with the patient and actually wants your input on the treatment that he is suggesting for you. If you do not agree with what he suggests, he will come up with a different plan, with your help, to best care for your needs. The office staff will do anything to help get things done. Everyone at this office cares for the patients and it shows.|Dr. Batra and his staff are amazing. He is considerate and empathetic. Offers many types of pain relief. The staff is professional and kind. They have offices in Gahanna and Dublin. I would highly recommend this practice.|Dr. Batra gave me my life back!  He gave me hope when all I thought I had left to look forward to in life was constant worsening pain.  At 54 years old I felt like my life was over.  Dr . Batra and his staff are sweet, caring, and compassionate people who bring hope to people with chronic pain.  Dr. Batra shared solutions for my pain and let me know there were several things he could try to find relief for me.  My friends and coworkers have noticed a huge difference in me.  I can highly recommend this team because I know what they did for me!|The staff is wonderful and I never have to wait. The care and treatment are excellent. I got a 50% reduction of pain. I am blessed to have them. Highly recommend.|Dr Batra is a life saver. His office has worked me in on very bad days. He is very thoughtful and concerned that my surgery went well and he continues to encourage me by reminding me that the body takes time to heal. I would recommend him highly.
He has helped get me through some very painful days.|Dr. Batra is very attentive and helpful. He will suggest anything to help you become pain free. He is as gentle as he can be as well. Staff is okay, needs a bit of patience and manners, but they are okay. I highly recommend going to see Dr. Batra if you're in pain. Thank you so much for all your help!|Great doctor!  He really listens to you, and understands your problems.  Had spinal injections there that really helped, and trigger point injections.  He is personable, and compassionate.  His staff is great!  They are always hard working and very busy!  Waiting time is minimal, most days, but they let you know if there is a wait time. I would definitely recommend him to my friends!

Pain Management Institute in Wooster, Ohio provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout Wayne County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical facility focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches and personalized treatment plans. Since our founding, we have been dedicated to improving patients' quality of life by addressing the root causes of their pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Pain Management Institute, our board-certified physicians offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional treatments for various pain conditions. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative therapies to address conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary approach combines medical interventions with physical therapy and behavioral health strategies to provide holistic care.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances. During your initial consultation, our specialists will conduct a thorough evaluation of your medical history, perform a comprehensive physical examination, and may order additional diagnostic tests to accurately identify the source of your pain. This detailed assessment allows us to develop targeted treatment strategies that maximize effectiveness while minimizing side effects.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 546 Winter St #200, Wooster, OH 44691, our modern facility offers a comfortable environment designed with patient comfort in mind. We're easily accessible from major roadways and provide ample parking for our patients. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (330) 202-5580 or visit our website at www.woosterpaininstitute.com.

Why Choose Pain Management Institute

Our commitment to excellence in patient care, combined with our specialized expertise in pain management, makes us a trusted provider in the Wooster community. We accept most major insurance plans and work closely with patients to navigate coverage options. Our compassionate staff understands the significant impact that chronic pain can have on daily life and is dedicated to providing supportive, effective care that helps patients regain function and improve their overall wellbeing.

column40:
Was a patient here for years. Epidurals every 5 weeks for chronic leg pain. Had a spinal cord stimulator implanted for chronic leg pain. No relief. Found out 3years later I had a blocked artery in my knee and had been getting the wrong treatment for years. Had 3stents put in my knee and now I'm much better. I assume this clinic heard of my surgery since I've had no contact with this clinic since my stent surgery. My blood flow to my leg was at 38% and I was told no one walks at 38%. I did it for over 3years. Now I get no calls from this clinic. Like I was never a patient there for years. Well I'm asking for a meeting with the hospital and Basalis boss. Let's see what happens. I bet I NEVER hear from this clinic or hospital without retaining council. Stay away from this assembly lline at Wooster pain management.|I called his office without an appointment and without any advance notice and they got me in that moment.  To say the least Dr B and his staff ALWAYS GO ABOVE AND BEYOND. They've always treated my wife & I with the upmost respect. He even came in on his day off to take care of me and that isn't something that you'll find in the young Dr's  today. Now he's brought his son-in-law on board and he's got the best Dr to learn from the practice will definitely benefit from him on board. Thank you Dr B for all you do for me and my family.|The wait is the only bad thing here. The staff, nurses and Dr. Basali are great.|Dr Basalli is amazing. He is so kind and caring. I would not be walking without him. I had several issues with pain in my back, hip, knee, and neck. With his management, I can walk again. He has a gift to help people. Sometimes he runs behind because he does his job right. No short cuts  He really cares about his patients and their best interest is always top priority. I just trust him. He has never failed me yet.  Been with him about a year. My husband, daughter, and friends all go to him.  All positive experiences.|One of the most professional offices I have experienced.  The nurses, receptionists, and assistants are so friendly and professional.  They really extend themselves to meet your needs.  Dr. Basali also does a great job taking care of relieving my back pain.  I highly recommend the Pain Management Institute of Wooster!|Dr Basali - Good doctor, most nurses good, WAY OVERBOOKS APPOINTMENTS. Have had 3 appointments; Consultation appt. was hour late, 1st Procedure was an hour + late, 2nd Procedure appointment was today at 9:45, waiting room FULL, waited in hallway, was finally taken back at 12:13. They scheduled 40 procedures today with unknown number on consultation. I'd suggest packing your lunch except you can't eat 4 hours prior.
Fact 1 - this is true.
Fact 2 - I will not return.|I've been seeing Dr Basali about ten years. He has helped my pain tremendously. Very professional and the staff is very professional and caring. Highly recommend.|One of the best Doctors I have ever been to! I have been in pain for three years. My left side and lived in my recliner and he gave me a injection and today I feel great! His nurses are great to! I would recommend him to all my friends! Thank you Dr Basali for giving me back my life!

Center For Symptom Relief LLC in Columbus, Ohio is a specialized pain management clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in the northwest area of Columbus, our clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain control of their lives and find lasting relief from debilitating symptoms.

At Center For Symptom Relief LLC, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team of board-certified specialists offers a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management options, and integrative therapies designed to address pain at its source. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, migraines, joint pain, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets our clinic apart is our commitment to treating each patient as an individual with unique needs. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment strategies that align with your health goals. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures you receive the most effective care possible in a supportive, compassionate environment.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Conveniently situated at 1161 Bethel Rd Suite 203, Columbus, OH 43220, our clinic is easily accessible from throughout the greater Columbus area. We maintain a welcoming facility with modern diagnostic and treatment equipment to provide the highest standard of care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (614) 459-0350. You can also visit our website at https://painclinics.com/?clinics=center-for-symptom-relief-llc for additional information about our treatments, team members, and patient resources.

column40:
Update March 2022. My Doctor is Sidensticker. I love that name its different.  We have a good patient and Doctor relationship.
So I thought. I told him the truth,about a mistake I did.  And now I've been condemned.  Left to suffer in between visits . All along.  He hasn't been truthful with me. But I still kept trusting him. He kept telling me the shots I'm getting in my back will help. Well there not. He tells me the next injections will help. And again, and again.  he failed me.  It feels like a stabbing pain in my back afterwards . All along he was just using me as a Guinea  pig. For financial gain. I just heard. A friend of mine been calling all day today. April 18th 2022. To try to make an appointment.  No answer. So he called at, 4:40 pm. They  put a recording on. Saying, There Closed. Hours are 8 to 5pm|This Dr Seidensticker does not have any compassion for his patients. You can't just take someone cold turkey off pain medicine when they need it. I would never recommend him|I have been a patient of Dr. Patel for several years now.  The care that I receive there is excellent.  Nevertheless, the response time by the staff is atrocious.  I had to cancel my appointment do to illness per office policy.  This was on the 14th, I still have not heard back from them on rescheduling.  All my medications are due for refill on the 18th. Which is a Saturday.  On another issue it took them a week and a half to return my call in relation to post operation care. I was left suffering after major neck surgery due to lack of response by the office staff.  The medical care is top notch though. If you can get a call back.|I have been a patient here for a couple years now and I honestly couldn't ask for a better doc than Dr Siedenstsicker. He always listens to my concerns ad tries his best to reduce my pain levels and respects my wishes with regards to which meds I am unwilling to take. He is very compassionate and you can tell he genuinely cares about his patients. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend him to anyone.|Whomever does the return phone calls needs a course in communications. She got s serious attitude problem

How to Answer the Phone Tips
Answer all incoming phone calls before the third ring.
When you answer the phone, be warm, enthusiastic, and professional. Your voice on the phone is sometimes the only impression of your company a caller will get.
When answering the phone, welcome callers courteously and identify yourself and your organization immediately. Say, for instance, "Good morning. Cypress Technologies. Susan speaking. How may I help you?" Don't just say "Hello". No one should ever have to ask if they've reached such and such a business.
Enunciate clearly, keep your voice volume moderate, and speak slowly and clearly when answering the phone so your caller can understand you easily.
Control your language when answering the phone. Don't use slang or buzzwords. Instead of saying, "OK", or "No problem", for instance, say "Certainly", "Very well", or "All right". If you're a person who uses fillers when you speak, such as "uh huh", "um", or phrases such as "like" or "you know", train yourself carefully not to use these when you speak on the phone|The good: Excellent physician (Dr Patel), excellent staff. Very friendly, no judgement and, remarkably, I feel HEARD for the first time in my life about my chronic pain.  I've never had to wait and procedures as well as regular appointments are fast and efficient.
The not so good: Calling them with issues between appointments and trying to get a timely response is close to impossible.  I've waited a week or more to get a response to a phone message and sometimes didn't receive a return call at all and had to keep calling back. To their credit, they don't get exasperated, as if you're bugging them, but you kind of feel like you are, anyway, because you have to keep calling.  If they manage to improve in this area, then they'd easily be a 5-star office, in my opinion.

I still recommend them, though.  They really have been helping me get a handle on the chronic pain of fibromyalgia, among other issues.|I have been going to Dr. Bourne for 5 years now. column2: Capital City Paincare - Dr. Sarah E. Blake, MD
column3:
Capital City Paincare serves Columbus, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Sarah E. Blake, MD. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with personalized care plans. We specialize in treating various pain disorders including neuropathic pain, spinal conditions, joint pain, and post-surgical discomfort through minimally invasive procedures and innovative therapeutic approaches.

At Capital City Paincare, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Dr. Blake's approach emphasizes finding the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term relief and improved functionality for our patients.

About Dr. Sarah E. Blake

Board-certified in Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology, Dr. Blake brings over 15 years of specialized experience to her practice. After completing her medical training at Johns Hopkins University and fellowship at the Cleveland Clinic, she has dedicated her career to advancing pain management techniques and providing compassionate care to patients throughout central Ohio.

Visit Our Practice

Dr Blake has always taken exceptional care of my on-going lumbar spine/pain issues. Dr. Blake and her staff administers the back injections for me in a manner that creates minimum pain and discomfort. She explains things well and is an excellent communicator. Well, after sitting 42 mins and not seeing one person get called back to be seen, and the fact I had my other appt I had to be at, I had to let them know I had to leave. No apologies, no nothing. Kinda surprised me but oh well.

Dr. Blake, it's really unfortunate when physicians don't respect their patients time, like we're suppose to respect yours by showing up on time. Just something to consider. Really frustrating because here I am still sitting here with this back pain, and wasted nearly two hours of my day when you consider the drive time and sitting there waiting.|Dr. Blake genuinely cares about your concerns and pain. column38: Jessica Hackley|Stephanie Huertas|Sherri Smith|Dan Graves|Jenna Collins|Quincey Caldwell|Ashley Smith|Kent Vermilion
column40:
I can't say enough good things about Dr. Verma. I've seen many doctors for over a decade about my back pain, and not only is he the first one to accurately diagnose the problem, but he's the first doctor not to jump to surgery or a one-size-fits-all solution. I know my particular issue might take some experimenting to figure out, but I'm confident that Dr. Verma has my back (literally and figuratively!) in finding a way to relieve my pain. I would absolutely recommend him to anyone!|Dr.Verma is awesome. He's very kind and doesn't judge you. He will listen t9o you he has compassion and cares for his patient.|Dr Verma has been a game changer in my quality of life. I was doubtful in PRP injections improving my cervical pain.  However, I am 4 weeks out from PRP and already back to exercise. I finally feel like myself again and I owe it to Dr Verma and his staff. Thank you for giving me my life back!!|Dr. Verma is extremely professional, knowledgeable and easy to work with. Scheduling was easy and the results of my procedure have been outstanding. I will definitely go back to him if and when I need to again. I strongly recommend Dr. Verma and his practice.|Great office and fantastic doctor. Easy to get in for an appointment. Dr. Verma explains everything in detail and gets right down to business in dealing with your pain. Cash prices are very reasonable if you can't wait for insurance to approve your procedure. I was out of pain within a week and a half after making my initial call to the office. They made the transfer easy from my old doctor's office to their facility. Could not have had a better experience. Highly recommend.|I saw Dr. Verma for PRP injections in January and again for 10 sessions of MLS therapy in Feb to help with chronic pain in my toe due to a running injury I sustained back in June '22 (torn ligaments). Although my toe is still not back to 100% I am very happy with the improvements and outcome so far.

The MLS therapy is quick and painless. My sessions were 7 minutes long, but they could be slightly longer or shorter depending on your injury. I noticed an improvement in my pain level after my very first session! Like magic. After several sessions the improvement leveled off for me but where I'm at now is much better than where I was! If you have an injury, especially a chronic one that has been bothering you for a while, I recommend trying this!

The jury is still out on whether my PRP injections will offer more improvement because they take a while to start working and then the healing process onward is slow. I will update my review in a couple months. There is a potential it won't help or improve my injury at all, although my PT said he has noticed that my toe has stiffened up - a very good sign in my case, as it was much too flexible/unstable due to the ligaments being torn! He says it's due to the PRP.

I do want to warn you that the injections are very painful, but keep in mind that the toe/foot is highly sensitive compared to other areas of the body. I received 3 injections in my toe (one right after the other) which were guided by ultrasound. Dr. Verma performed them while someone else held the ultrasound tool. The area was not numbed and I had no pain meds beforehand. The needle going in was painful, but the injection... the injection itself was excruciating and felt like liquid fire! Worst pain I've ever felt. I'm not trying to scare anyone away, but want you to be prepared. Bring a friend. Luckily I had a wonderful nurse at my side (I think her name was Karen) who coached me through the pain. Even though it hurt like a... I'm happy I had it done because it is better to try something rather than do nothing.

I'll end by saying that Dr. Verma is great! He is kind and shows compassion. The young lady at the front desk is awesome too!|Dr. Verma has taken care of both family members and friends of mine. The thoughtfulness and care he takes with each individual is unmatched. We will continue to seek his expertise and highly recommend him and is wonderful staff to anyone looking for a care pathway for pain intervention.|I saw Dr. Verma due to low back pain and sciatica that intially kept me from playing golf but worsened to impact my sleep and daily life. Dr. Verma ordered an MRI and based on that offered multiple treatment options with varying benefits and recovery time. I was able to opt for the plan that got me golfing again and still have alternative options going forward. I appreciate how Dr. Verma worked with me to choose the best individualized treatment. He also left me future alternative treatments to consider which include acute control of pain and regenerative options with the potential for long term benefits.

column38: K H|Amy Hughes|Sonny Custer|Deborah Ellington|Rene Bechard|Renee Vinson|Ruben Gomez|Amina Husain
column40:
Dr Smith jerked me around on the back ablation, canceling it twice--once while on the procedure table--instead doing a sacroiliac block because he said it was acting like more of that type of problem. I said ~ the nerve ablation gave me 7 months of relief.  So, I reported him to Quality Control--an outfit under Center for Medicare Services called Livanta. Livanta had trouble getting the records: that's because Dr. Smith and his crew were busy rewriting them. That's all Livanta does--records reviews-- so they gave the falsified records a pass. I have offered to take a polygraph test. Those injections did nothing for me other than cause me pain and bleeding at the injection site. Livanta has a terrible record with the BBB; I think it's creating a moral hazard.  Naturally, all the doctor has to do is falsify the records, and they are in the clear. I was going to report him to the State Medical Board, but my attorney advised to just get on with my life since I have a new doctor, and it would be time-consuming and distracting. All I would want to do is have the records expunged, and maybe have a menace doctor reprimanded for altering my chart in his favor. I wouldn't be surprised if he does it often. My MRIs show osteoarthritis and NOT sacroiliitis. The nurse that wrote it up was saying that even if I got a little relief, I would be a candidate for joint fusion--trying to sell another procedure, I presume.|Him and his team are caring and very professional. I have hope of feeling better and this gives me hope!|Dr. Smith is a God's blessing. He definitely has helped me.
Thank  you  Dr.Smith.|I've been seeing Dr Smith on an off for about 10 years for 2 issues that I have, the attention to detail from Dr. Smith and staff is exemplary!
I have questions regarding my medical condition, they answer, I ask questions regarding pain meds or procedures, it's explained & sometimes meds are prescribed, I prefer appointments at a specific location and they do their best to accommodate my request.
I've been extremely happy with my care & the doctor and his team!|Dr. Smith is nothing short of excellent.  I suffer from bad back pain and the shots I receive from the Pain Center, head up by Dr. Smith, has really helped me enormously.  He is professional and so warm and friendly, talk about bedside manner!  Other physicians can learn a thing or 2 from this doctor.  His staff is just as wonderful too.  I am grateful my PCP referred me to Dr. Smith and I highly recommend his services.|This man is rude! He kept talking over me, not listening to anything I tried to discuss with him. He kept telling me he wasn't there to deal with my fibromyalgia or migraines...well, I wasn't there for that, nor was I asking him to deal with it! I know exactly what fibromyalgia is and how it affects me. He tried to blame my back on fibromyalgia.  It's not my fibromyalgia and the MRI proves it! I was referred to him by another Dr. I've been in severe pain for over a year! I was in tears. Thank God my husband who works there was able to meet me and witness it for himself. I received an epidural for my lower back issues and right leg issues. He may have been doing this for 29 years, but knows nothing about relating to patients. I do not recommend him.|I have been a patient of Dr. Townsend Smith for nearly a Decade. He is a gifted Doctor and even a better person. He is not a pill dispensary he treats you with Epidural Injection and Trigger Point injections. The staff are polite and professional.|Very caring, compassionate and competent physician. Great staff

column38: Kyle Fittro|Michael DiSalvo|Brenda Snider|Karen Nichols|William Schooler|John Patterson|Natalie MacDonald|Mark Holland
column40:
I tore my meniscus in 2022, had surgery and recovered well.

I tore my meniscus again in 2023, had surgery again. This time 40% of my meniscus removed and I never recovered.

I suffered debilitating, chronic knee pain.

After trying 22 separate therapies such as painkillers, cortisone shots, gel injections, specialized shoe inserts, three rounds of physical therapy, laser therapy, TENS unit therapy, chiropractic manipulation, DMSO cream,  genicular nerve ablation, various medications etc., I elected to have a NALU brand peripheral nerve stimulator implanted into my thigh/knee.

I went to Elite Pain Doctors for this treatment and eventually had Dr. Sloop perform the surgery to implant the peripheral nerve stimulator.

The employees here were always kind and courteous. Dr. Sloop was extremely good about explaining everything in great detail and listening to my surgical comments/concerns.

I was concerned that this procedure would be painful due to the fact your "awake" for it and it's a somewhat involved procedure.

Dr. Sloop and his team made sure I had a nearly pain free surgery and all went very well.

I'm still recovering as of the writing of this review, but so far-so good.

I give credit to Dr. Sloop and his team for being professional and courteous. But above all, actually listening to the patient, which can be rare anymore.|I'd like to thank Elite Physical Medicine for making me part of their family in my health challenges. No I didn't need to have surgery on my Right hip, since it wasn't very bad shape. My hip doctor let me know that the left tip that was looking in very bad shape. In fact should hold up for quite some time. It appears the stem cell injections there may save me both surgery and a painful recovery. I appreciate that I made big strides just in the past 3 years in my condition that has kept me down for thirty years with their ongoing chiropractic therapies.|This is the medicine of the future. Someday society will look back on today's medicine and call it barbaric and medieval. Forget pills and knives and come to Elite Physical Medicine.  Vibrational therapy that renews rebuilds rejuvenates the tissue in your body.
Saved my Quality of Life.....
Quite Frankly,
Saved My Life|They have really helped me with with my feet, I still have some issues. but the are much, much less! My feet world burn and tingle  so bad that I had trouble getting sleeping. Commonwealth Pain and Spine serves Cincinnati, Ohio with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using the latest evidence-based approaches. Located conveniently in the eastern part of Cincinnati, our clinic provides a welcoming environment where patients can receive personalized care focused on improving quality of life and restoring function.

At Commonwealth Pain and Spine, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and innovative treatments for conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome. We believe in addressing not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain to provide lasting relief.

Our Cincinnati Location

Our Cincinnati office is situated at 7991 Beechmont Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45255, making it easily accessible for patients throughout the Greater Cincinnati area. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to ensure the highest standard of care.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Commonwealth Pain and Spine apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We take the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. Our team works collaboratively with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated, comprehensive treatment.

Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward pain relief and improved function.

column3:
Eli Cianciolo, MD serves Cincinnati, Ohio and surrounding areas with specialized interventional pain management services. As a distinguished physician at RiverHills Neuroscience, Dr. Cianciolo focuses on minimally invasive techniques to diagnose and treat painful conditions. His practice embodies the core principles defined by the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians (ASIPP), which describes this medical discipline as being "devoted to the diagnosis and treatment of pain related disorders." Through a comprehensive multidisciplinary approach, Dr. Cianciolo works diligently to help patients find relief from chronic pain while improving their overall quality of life.

Dr. Cianciolo's practice emphasizes minimally invasive interventional techniques that aim to reduce patients' reliance on medication. This modern approach to pain management allows patients to return to their daily activities more quickly while addressing the root causes of their discomfort. Each treatment plan is individually tailored to address specific pain conditions, whether stemming from neurological disorders, spinal issues, or other chronic pain syndromes.

Practice Location and Accessibility

Located at 4805 Montgomery Rd, 2nd floor, Cincinnati, OH 45212, Dr. Cianciolo's practice provides convenient access for patients throughout the greater Cincinnati region. The office is situated within the RiverHills Neuroscience facility, offering comprehensive neurological care under one roof. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 513-322-7300 or visiting the practice website at www.riverhillsneuro.com/physicians/eli-r-cianciolo for more information about services and treatment options.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

What distinguishes Dr. Cianciolo's practice is his commitment to patient-centered care. Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life, he takes time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition and develop comprehensive treatment strategies. His goal extends beyond pain reduction to include functional improvement and enhanced quality of life, helping patients regain independence and enjoyment in their daily activities.
column11: According to the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians (ASIPP), interventional pain management is a "discipline of medicine devoted to the diagnosis and treatment of pain related disorders." Interventional pain medicine utilizes a multidisciplinary approach, the goal of which is to relieve, reduce, or manage pain and improve a patient's overall quality of life through minimally invasive techniques specifically designed to diagnose and treat painful conditions. Interventional pain management also strives to help patients return to their everyday activities quickly and without heavy reliance on medications.

column40:
I had an excellent experience at Dublin Pain Clinic. The staff was friendly, professional, and made me feel comfortable from the moment I walked in. The doctors and nurses were knowledgeable, attentive, and took the time to answer all my questions. The office was clean, well-organized, and the wait time was minimal. I truly appreciate the high level of care and would highly recommend this office to anyone looking for quality medical services|I was unfortunately referred to Dublin Pain Management by Ohio Health and the Riverside Community Medicine Program. Dublin Pain Management is without a doubt, Certainly, the single worst medical facility I have encountered in my lifetime. I have traveled and lived in third world countries for more than 60 years and have seen field hospitals established under challenging conditions whose standards, staff, cleanliness, and professionalism far exceeded this sad and ersatz excuse of a "Pain Clinic". The long list of atrocious shortcomings leaves one wondering exactly where to begin in describing the failures and abuses heaped upon any and all poor souls this "clinic" is supposed to serve. These unacceptable failures range from the mundane (dirty floors, broken and soiled furniture, inoperable trash containers, littered exterior, broken doors, unsanitary bathrooms often closed due to unperformed repairs) to life-threatening (sham physicals, misplaced records, prescription errors). Patients often wait hours for a 30-second physical examination.
The staff regularly insulted one another, swore, (the office manger yelled "f___ you" to another staff member) and seemed to last as employees only weeks. Staffers regularly complained about coworkers to patients when they would not be overheard. The entire staff less one individual was replaced at least once, some as many as four times in a little over one year. The Doctor who is in charge of the clinic I met exactly ZERO times during my treatment!
My case typifies the sad state of medical care, and pain management in particular, in our country, state, and community. These terrible circumstances into which patients are cast are mandated by lawyers at medical organizations such as Ohio Health, their subsidiary Riverside Hospital, and their clinic, Community Medicine. In the name of lessening their exposure to legal and medical complications they demand patients suffer indignancies and poor treatment rather than receive the treatment they deserve.
Run, yes run, run away as fast as you can from any referral directing you to Dublin Pain Management and any complicit organization such as Ohio Health and Riverside Hospital.
Caveat Emptor|I love this place!!! The staff is very helpful and accommodating every time I come in.   The ladies in the reception area are amazing and the sweetest.   Every appointment is always a pleasure they make the wait enjoyable  with humor and conversation.  Been going here for 4 years!!|I have fibromyalgia and mild osteoarthritis. At my appointment in December, Dr. Siddiqui claimed that the fibromyalgia was from my muscles locking up in response to the arthritis pain. I'm certainly not an expert, but that's not what fibromyalgia is based on the reading I have done and the other doctors I've spoken to.

He wanted to start me on opiates immediately and was dismissive of my worries about them. His plan was the opiates and twice-annual injections to kill my nerves. He didn't even plan to address the fibromyalgia beyond the above statement.

I have since found another provider who is addressing the arthritis AND the fibromyalgia without opiates or injections. I will not be back to Dublin Pain Clinic.|I really like Dr Minor. He listens to my concerns and works around my various hardware so I am able to tolerate injections easier. Only complaint is long wait time to be seen.|I have been coming to this office for several years now. The injections they have given me have sustained me throughout those years. The staff is always so nice also.|What a lovely and clean office, love the workers their amazing, love the doctors.|I love coming to this place. I feel like it's a safe space for me. I don't feel ashamed, it's such a welcoming environment. Thank you.

Dr. Sairam Atluri serves Cincinnati, Ohio and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. As a board-certified interventional pain specialist, Dr. Atluri has dedicated his practice to helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions through comprehensive, personalized treatment plans. His clinic offers a welcoming environment where patients receive compassionate care backed by the latest advances in pain medicine.

At Dr. Atluri's practice, patients benefit from a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options designed to address various pain conditions. His approach combines cutting-edge techniques with traditional methods to create customized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence. Dr. Atluri specializes in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Dr. Atluri apart is his commitment to truly understanding each patient's unique pain experience. He takes the time to listen carefully to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop treatment strategies that align with their specific needs and goals. This personalized approach has earned him numerous positive reviews from patients who have found relief under his care.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 7655 Five Mile Rd #117, Cincinnati, OH 45230, Dr. Atluri's office is easily accessible to residents throughout the Greater Cincinnati area. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to provide comprehensive care in a comfortable setting. New and returning patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 513-624-7525 or visiting the practice website at http://www.atlurimd.com/.

Education and Expertise

Dr. Atluri completed his medical training at prestigious institutions and has maintained a commitment to continuing education throughout his career. His extensive knowledge of pain management techniques and dedication to staying current with medical advancements ensures that his patients receive the highest standard of care. As an active member of several professional medical associations, Dr. Atluri regularly participates in conferences and research initiatives focused on improving pain management outcomes.

column40:
I have needed knee replacement for years, but can't have it done. I have RSD because of prior knee surgery and replacement is not an option. I was tired of hurting and tired of not being able to do anything. My pain  doc recommended Dr. Atluri as an alternative to surgery. I got in quickly and was evaluated and the procedure scheduled soon thereafter. It has been about 3 months and I truly can't believe the difference in my knee. I genuinely wish I had know about him 15 years ago. If you are hurting and think there is nothing you can do, call this doctor. He is skilled and he genuinely cared. And better yet - I can hike and do stairs again  without the pain.|I have been treated by Dr
Sairam Atluri. He is so professional and dedicated to all of his patients.   I have never seen him out of sorts.  He is always so cheerful and upbeat. No matter how much pain I have been experiencing  he has always been able to resolve everything for me and I am able to leave feeling so much better.  He always has the right answers and resolutions  to my pain.  His office runs smoothly and the ladies are very professional.

Even though I am in stage 4 metastatic breast cancer Dr Atluri has always been a shining light through the journey I am currently taking down that dark and scary path.
He is simply the best!|I have been seeing Dr. Atluri since the first of the year for my chronic back pain and cannot say enough  great things about him. He has taken me through every available procedure along the way and I had the stem cell injection yesterday. He is knowledgeable, thorough, so kind, and answers all my questions. A true expert in the field and I highly recommend Dr. Atluri to anyone in pain  (I drive all the way from Dayton to see him)!  I should add that Dr. Atluri's staff are amazing, as well-responsive, most helpful and kind!|Wonderful experience. Had been to Dr. Atluri 7 years previous for epidural injection. Had back/leg pain again and immediately called his office. They got me in quickly for appointment and injection and were very helpful. Was immediately virtually pain free when I got up from table. I trust Dr. Atluri's ability and judgment and will see him again if I have any issues.|Any time I am in need of an appointment his staff has always been thorough, compassionate and has done everything possible to get me in to see Dr. Atluri. The environment is always warm and welcoming. Dr. Atluri is a kind, compassionate, caring doctor who hears your concerns and truly tries to come up with the best results that makes you feel Comfortable. This is from a mother who loves her children and would send them to Dr. Atluri, he is that good.|Dr. Atluri has been my doctor for over 11 years. I couldn't imagine seeing anyone else. He has always been willing to help me and listen to my concerns. He is also highly skilled. I have had several back injections and barely feel them. He is a true expert in his field.|I have spent a year and a half searching for answers about my pain and Dr. Atluri took time to listen to me! He is very friendly and helped reduce my pain. I had a great experience in his office. He will most certainly take care of you and make you feel comfortable throughout the process.|Dr Atluri and his nurses are the absolute Best!!! Jennifer is awesome! I get nervous about any kind of shot or procedure and they do Great at making sure your calm and comfortable.  Highly recommend!

Beresh Pain Management in Hamilton, Ohio serves patients throughout Butler County with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. John E. Beresh. Established as a trusted medical practice, we specialize in treating chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans that combine innovative medical interventions with holistic approaches. Our state-of-the-art facility at 840 NW Washington Blvd offers patients a comfortable environment where they receive compassionate care from our experienced medical team dedicated to improving quality of life and restoring function.

At Beresh Pain Management, we provide a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Dr. Beresh employs evidence-based techniques such as interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our comprehensive approach addresses not only the symptoms but also the underlying causes of pain, helping patients achieve long-term relief and improved functionality.

2023 Holiday Schedule

Please note our upcoming holiday closures:

  • Thanksgiving: Closed November 22 and 23

  • Winter Holidays: Closed December 25 through January 1, 2024

Patient Information

New patients are welcome at our practice. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure a smooth experience from the first appointment through ongoing care. For appointments or questions, please contact our friendly staff at (513) 737-7246. Additional information about our services, patient resources, and Dr. Beresh's qualifications can be found on our website at www.bereshpain.com.

Location and Hours

Our office is conveniently located at 840 NW Washington Blvd, Hamilton, OH 45013, with ample parking available for patients. Regular office hours accommodate both early morning and late afternoon appointments to serve our patients' busy schedules. We strive to provide timely appointments, especially for those experiencing acute pain conditions requiring prompt attention.

When my insurance denied my first prescription the office staff helped get it approved in short order. I would recommend this office for pain management.|Dr. Buresh is fantastic but some of the other staff such as front desk staff are not. Very Rude as if they feel you are an inconvenience to them. All of the staff that you encounter for your appointment is very professional and polite but the ladies running the front desk who schedule your next appointment are not so friendly. If you can deal with the 5 minutes of rudeness from the Karen's scheduling your next appointment, you've got 3/4 of what you accomplished with your appointment won!|I have been going here 8 years. Dr.Beresh has always helped me manage my pain. Very knowledgeable about the meds I take & other alternative options.  He also did my spine stimulator which has helped me alot. Injections, referrals for orthopedic dr & PT. The nurses and office staff very friendly & helpful.|So today was my first appt let's start with the front desk staff 5 stars. Very kind and courteous. Next the nurse I saw to take my info if I could give 6 stars I would for her. Now for Dr Beresh I was called this morning told the Dr had a emergency  later in the day instead of them pushing my appt they got me in earlier. I will admit I was nervous cause of the reveiws as well as past experiences. Dr came in yes he was in a hurry and I was fine with that. We chatted quickly about my condition and he assured me that we will not be able to get me out of pain completely  but we will do our best he is awesome dr. We decided to see each other again to see how the meds work other Dr's don't care about you he truly cares. For people who left this fine man a bad reveiw you need drug rehab not a pain management dr. Keep doing God's work Beresh Pain mgnt
Update: the bad reveiws are right on please stay away from this place I accidentally took wrong medication and tried to explain to them and instead of understanding they kicked me out for one accidental mistake. And also stopped all medications which was hard on me with my condition but I dealt with it thank you dr for sooooo caring|I have never waited long in the waiting room at any visit. Never had a bad experience on any of my visits. I have been going for years and  have never had a complaint. I recommend Dr. Beresh if you are looking for good pain management.|Dr. Beresh and all his staff have been a lifesaver for me. I had a terrible car wreck and have paralysis and nerve damage. I never have to wait long and everyone there is so kind and caring. Thank you everyone at Beresh Pain Management for helping me and taking such good care of me. I truly appreciate all of you. God bless.
