Center for Pain Management at Knox Medical Center serves Mt Vernon, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located within the trusted Knox Community Hospital healthcare system, our specialized center offers a multidisciplinary approach to treating acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians, pain specialists, and supporting medical staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain challenges.

At the Center for Pain Management, we utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment modalities to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. Our comprehensive services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and integrative approaches to pain relief. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life. Our patient-centered approach focuses on not just managing symptoms but addressing the underlying causes of pain whenever possible. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific needs, medical history, and personal goals. Our team emphasizes education, empowering patients to take an active role in their pain management journey.

Contact Information

The Center for Pain Management is conveniently located at 1330 Coshocton Ave, Mt Vernon, OH 43050. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 740-393-9866. Additional information about our center and services can be found on our website at www.kch.org/center-pain-management.

As part of Knox Community Hospital's comprehensive healthcare network, we are committed to providing compassionate, evidence-based pain management services to improve the health and wellbeing of our community.

column40:
Dr. Akbik is VERY personable and knowledgeable...a rare treat with a physician.  He's  very capable at performing many procedures, but understands not everyone is capable of enduring all. He works with his patients and isn't rigid or unbending.

The office staff is very nice and accommodating.  With the size of the practice,  they even remember my name. I've had to call a few times for some complicated reasons and the appropriate staff was contacted and addressed the issues the same day.

His physician assistants and practitioners are great. They're on point, they listen and they care... even remembering issues that were discussed on previous visits.

This is not an office that just hands out opiates and the like just because you show up. They make sure the images,  physical and testing support a person's claims then acts accordingly with a combination of therapies. They gain information on your entire health history and apply the same to understanding the bigger picture and creating your treatment plan.

If you're there for the right reasons, you get the right care in my experience.|I was Leary about switching to a new pain Dr. I was born with rare birth defect ad have had a lot of surgeries. I'm so glad I did go to them. They understand about my medical issues. Give great recommendations. Explain things to me. So I understand why somethings work better than other things. They really care about my issues. Only problem I have, is getting a return call or reply to messages.|The doctor is the best, the office etiquette is wonderful! They care about their patients. Have been with them for years. There's no place else I would be interested in going. When you finally find the best, you should stick with it. I give Integrated Pain Solutions 5 stars ( )with no hesitation!|I was a little apprehensive when I first started going and that was basically because of the location. But as I continue to go I realize that the location wasn't as far away as I thought it was in the beginning.Office always very clean including the bathrooms I'm a stickler about a doctor's office bathroom. All of the staff that I have come in contact with are great and that definitely includes my physician Dr Akbick He is so personable and understanding, He doesn't treat you like a copay he treat you like a person. He is someone that really cares about his patient.So at that point the location didn't even matter. I had a procedure performed on my spine called a Nerve Ablation and I was really nervous about it because I thought it was going to hurt but in actuality it didn't and my back felt great for really good while but I guess with the nerve damage that I have that causes my back pain is something that I'm probably just going to have to live with. Anyway as far as the Practice is concerned I would recommend it to anyone that is struggling with back pain.|I always have great care with them.  Dr. Akbik is a fantastic caring doctor and always listens with care!  I wish they would not have a huge turnover of nurse practioners though.  Every month it seems one has left and a new one comes in.....but the receptionists are wonderful!|I have had no problems whatsoever with this office and staff.  Lobby is clean, staff is welcoming and out of the multiple Dr's and specialists i have to see chronically they have never had me wait more than 10 minutes.  I feel I'm in honest and good hands.|I have been with this practice for many years. From the doctor down to the secretary, I am treated with empathy and respect. Going to a pain management doctor was the last thing I wanted when it was first recommended for me. The first doctor I went to was only interested in inflating my bill. The second doctor seemed to have a "different" schedule for more important patients and I would sit for hours (literally) beyond my appointment time.  The third pain management doctor I saw was shut down by the government. I was so naive I had no clue anything was going on and still don't know if he was guilty of anything. Then I met Dr. Hammam Akbik. He, and his staff, are what everyone who needs pain management should be lucky enough to find.|Dr listens, and never rush you. Genuinely care and will reach out to your other doctors if they are concerned. Rarely are they running behind.  I recommend Dr Akbik and Iesha all the time. Several of my Doctors refer to them now. They truly want the treatment that will suit you, and not one treatment fits all.

column3:
OrthoNeuro Pain Management serves patients throughout Grove City, Ohio and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Led by Dr. Daniel Pap, our practice focuses on providing comprehensive, non-surgical solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment approaches to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Dr. Daniel Pap is a board-certified anesthesiologist specializing in interventional pain management. With extensive training and expertise, he has developed a special interest in Neuromodulation/spinal cord stimulation and Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS). Dr. Pap's approach centers on identifying the root cause of pain and developing personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs.

Services Offered

Our practice provides a comprehensive range of interventional pain management procedures, including:

  • Spinal injections

  • Neuromodulation/spinal cord stimulation

  • Selective nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)

  • Facet joint injections

  • Trigger point injections

  • Peripheral nerve blocks

Conditions Treated

Dr. Pap specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Persistent pain after back or neck surgery

  • Arthritic pain in the neck and lower back

  • Neuropathy or nerve damage

  • Myofascial pain

  • Muscle spasm

Contact Information

Phone: +1 614-890-6555

Address: 1325 Stringtown Rd #280, Grove City, OH 43123, United States

Website: https://orthoneuro.com/daniel-p-pap-md/
column11: Dr. Daniel Pap is a board-certified anesthesiologist specializing in interventional pain management. Dr. Pap provides a wide variety of services, including spinal injections, neuromodulation/spinal cord stimulation, selective nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation (RFA), facet joint injections, trigger point injections, and peripheral nerve blocks. Conditions he treats include: back and neck pain, persistent pain after back or neck surgery; arthritic pain in the neck and lower back; neuropathy or nerve damage; myofascial pain, and muscle spasm.

OhioHealth Physician Group Pain Management serves Mansfield, Ohio with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our dedicated team of pain management specialists understands that pain—whether resulting from trauma, accidents, injuries, surgical procedures, or complex medical conditions—can significantly impact your quality of life. We take a personalized approach to pain treatment, developing individualized care plans that address your specific needs and goals.

At OhioHealth Physician Group Pain Management, we offer advanced diagnostic and therapeutic interventions designed to reduce pain and improve functionality. Our experts utilize the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies to provide effective pain relief while minimizing reliance on medication when possible. We treat a wide spectrum of pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our compassionate team works closely with each patient to understand how pain affects their daily activities and develops comprehensive treatment strategies that align with their lifestyle and recovery goals. By combining medical expertise with genuine care, we help patients regain control of their lives and improve their overall well-being.

Convenient Location

Located at 558 S Trimble Rd, Mansfield, OH 44906, our facility is easily accessible to residents throughout northern Ohio. We're committed to providing excellent care close to home, eliminating the need for patients to travel long distances for specialized pain management services. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (567) 241-7222.

Visit our website at OhioHealth Pain Management to discover how we can partner with you on your journey toward pain relief and improved quality of life.
column11: If you are experiencing ongoing pain after a trauma, accident or injury, or following surgery, or as a result of a complex disease process or condition, we understand the impact your pain can have on your daily life. Our experts treat each patient's pain individually by offering advanced, compassionate care to help you achieve your best health and improve your quality of life. We are dedicated to providing the residents of northern Ohio with excellent care close to home in our convenient location.

column3:
OhioHealth Neurological Physicians serves Columbus, Ohio with exceptional neurological care through the expertise of Dr. Mark Nicholas Malinowski, DO. Our practice combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with compassionate patient-centered treatment approaches to address a wide spectrum of neurological conditions. Located in downtown Columbus, our clinic provides convenient access to specialized care for patients throughout central Ohio.

Meet Dr. Mark Nicholas Malinowski, DO

Dr. Malinowski is a board-certified neurologist with specialized training in treating complex neurological disorders. With years of dedicated experience, he brings a thorough and personalized approach to each patient's care plan. Dr. Malinowski completed his medical training at the Ohio University College of Osteopathic Medicine and further specialized in neurology, allowing him to offer comprehensive care for conditions ranging from headaches and seizures to more complex neurodegenerative disorders.

Our Neurological Services

Our practice offers a comprehensive range of neurological services including:

- Diagnostic evaluations for headaches, seizures, and movement disorders

- Treatment plans for multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, and epilepsy

- Neurological consultations for complex cases

- Ongoing management of chronic neurological conditions

- Coordination with rehabilitation specialists for optimal recovery

Contact Information

Phone: +1 614-533-5500

Address: 285 E State St, Suite 430, Columbus, OH 43215, United States

Website: [Dr. Malinowski's Profile](https://www.ohiohealth.com/find-a-doctor/profile/1457575961/Mark-N-Malinowski-DO?utmsource=yext&utmmedium=listings&utm_campaign=WebsiteClicksProvider)

Patient-Centered Approach

At OhioHealth Neurological Physicians, we believe in creating partnerships with our patients. Dr. Malinowski takes time to listen to concerns, thoroughly explain diagnoses, and develop treatment plans that align with each patient's unique needs and lifestyle. Our office staff provides seamless support from appointment scheduling to insurance coordination, ensuring a positive experience from the moment you contact us.
column38: Brian Corbin|Ashley Rockhold|Briana Peck|rebellion red|latrena holden|Brenda Farr|Krista Stewart|Penny Martin
column40:
My first appointment with Dr. Malinowski was earlier this week. I have chronic pain due to a motorcycle accident over a decade ago. Throughout my journey I've seen many physicians and tried many therapies. He didn't disregard any of my symptoms and listened to how I feel my other chronic diseases play a part in my chronic pain. I'm sure my appointment ran him late, but he allowed me the time anyway. That is a good doctor. A good one may run late because of giving to another patient.

I was very impressed to have him really look for himself at my actual MRI CD imagery. I felt validated he understood why I feel the way I do. He saw me as a whole person and put sincere thought into my situation. His willingness to learn and be up to date on current techniques is refreshing and appreciated. I can work with a doctor like him. I look forward to it.|Dr. Malinowski did an amazing job not only on my surgery but he's an all around amazing doctor. He cares about his patients takes the time to explains things in a way that won't make you feel stupid or silly for asking him. His staff is so helpful and they are amazing about getting back to you if you have any questions or concerns. I had a spine stimulator put in and the care and attention Dr. Malinowski and his staff gave was outstanding! Definitely highly recommend Dr. Malinowski and his staff.|I do not recommend Dr. Malinowski for several reasons.

During the appointment, I felt as if he was listening to me but not hearing what I was actually saying. I am not a typical pain management client as I'm easily 20 years younger than the average client and was seeking assistance to manage a new pain oriented diagnosis. A car ran out in front of me resulting in a car accident and now I have fibromyalgia.

He became exceptionally uncomfortable when I got upset/angry after he reviewed previous treatment suggestions post MRI, told me he couldn't change my medication because I have to try them for 3-6 months (which isn't true), and then asked me if I researched any methods of treating fibro. When I get upset/angry I begin crying. He asked if he said anything to result in me crying. Yes- I have a new chronic condition and was told that I have to try and "deal with it" for about 3-6 months when I'm barely functional. Of course I was angry/upset.

Then he proceeded to call my primary care doctor and left the office to finish the phone call. I felt like he was verifying if I was crazy- come to find out he didn't know what to do since I was upset/angry with him. Since he was on a phone call, he sent Tonya to check on me who was respectful and very kind. I declined talking to her because there was nothing else to say at that point. She said I was done with my appointment and could leave so I did.

Shortly after, I got a message on MyChart stating that he asked Tonya to talk to me while he spoke to my PCP. When he went back to the room to talk to me about their conversation, I had left. He knows that I was frustrated today and hopes I know their office is there for me and my PCP would be reaching back out to me.

To say the least, this was an awful experience. Who calls their PCP because their patient starts crying? Absolutely ridiculous....|My name is Heath. I've had neuropathy for seventeen years and about a year ago I seen an ad on Facebook about a spinal stimulator through nevro that would reduce neuropathy pain. I called nevro the next day and they made an appointment for me with Dr. Malinowski. During the consultation a representative from nevro came and explained what the stimulator could do.  After the pretesting. The trial stimulator was placed in my back. That night was the first night in years I slept all night without kicking my feet and keeping me awake. I was amazed how much better my feet felt. I did not want them to remove the stimulator because I knew I was going to be in pain again until it was put in permanently.  I cannot thank Dr. Malinowski and his staff, and the people with nevro for all of their hard work getting me approved for the procedure.

Sincerely,
Heath Pettry|Dr Mark Malinowski is an awesome doctor. He is very conscientious, friendly, engaging, and takes time to know his clients. He is great with recommendations  and referrals to other medical professionals to assist with your wellness. When I tell him and or his  staff of my concerns, they listen and make sure my needs are met as best as they can. Yes, his staff nurses are very thorough, insightful, and caring. If you want exceptional care, quality work, and professionalism, this is your go to Doctor and staff.|OMG.  He is one of the nicest and most caring doctor I have ever met.  I went to him for a medical condition I was misdiagnosed with and he figured out what was really wrong and set me up with a treatment plan that started me feeling better in a short period of time.  I was in a lot of pain and he showed empathy and listened to me explain in detail why I was there to see him.  Afterwards, he walked me through my options and possible outcomes.  I highly recommend him if you are in pain and need relief.|Dr. Malinowski is an excellent physician.  He is not only skilled, he is caring and able to understand each unique situation and patient.  There is no "cookie-cutter" feel to his care.  He understands that even though different patients might have the same issues, their lives and what is important to them are very different.  He takes the time to understand each patient and each situation and works with them to provide a treatment plan that is specialized to their needs.  His caring is evident during every office visit and every intervention performed.  Although he is always busy, the patient does not feel rushed or like "just another number".  I have, and will continue to recommend Dr. Malinowski.  He is truly the best of the best.|I was referred to Dr Malinowski by another doctor, I so glad I went . They were able to see me soon after the referral, and after years of chronic pain , chiropractor care, PT , massage therapy and injections. Dr Malinowski was able to pin point my issue on the first visit . It has been the most relief I have had in years ! He is so very kind and his staff is amazing too ! They really care about their patients !

Aultman Pain Management serves Massillon, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located within the Aultman West facility, this specialized clinic offers evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The dedicated team of board-certified physicians, nurse practitioners, and pain specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain challenges and improve their quality of life.

At Aultman Pain Management, patients receive access to a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies. The clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Their multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge medical interventions with rehabilitative strategies to help patients regain function and reduce dependence on pain medications.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

The clinic is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies in a comfortable, patient-centered environment. Located at 2051 Wales Ave NW, Suite 100, Massillon, OH 44646, the facility is designed to provide convenient access to pain management services for residents throughout Stark County and neighboring communities. The clinic is part of the broader Aultman Health Foundation network, ensuring seamless coordination with other medical specialties when needed.

Patient-Focused Care

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, Aultman Pain Management emphasizes individualized care plans and patient education. New patients undergo comprehensive evaluations to identify pain sources and contributing factors before treatment begins. The team maintains open communication with referring physicians to ensure continuity of care. For appointments or more information, patients can call +1 330-834-4154 or visit their website at https://aultman.org/home/services/support-services/pain-management/#/.

Memorial Pain Management serves Marysville, OH and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services focused on comprehensive, patient-centered care. Under the direction of Dr. Amish Patel, DO, the practice offers evidence-based treatments for chronic and acute pain conditions, emphasizing minimally invasive approaches that reduce reliance on medication. Located conveniently on London Avenue, Memorial Pain Management has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in Union County, delivering compassionate care that addresses the physical, emotional, and functional aspects of pain.

Dr. Amish Patel is a board-certified pain management specialist who takes a holistic approach to treating pain conditions. He works with patients aged seventeen and older, focusing on alleviating pain while minimizing medication usage, particularly narcotics. Dr. Patel's philosophy centers on identifying and addressing the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing patients to regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

Comprehensive Care Approach

Memorial Pain Management welcomes patients with various pain conditions, including those with Worker's Compensation-related injuries. Understanding that pain management often requires a multidisciplinary approach, Dr. Patel maintains a robust referral network. When necessary, he can connect patients with orthopedic specialists, neurosurgeons, and rehabilitation specialists to ensure comprehensive care tailored to each individual's needs.

Location and Contact Information

Memorial Pain Management is conveniently located at 660 London Ave, Suite B, Marysville, OH 43040. Patients seeking appointments or additional information can contact the office directly at (937) 578-4580. For more details about services offered, patient resources, and insurance information, visit their website at http://memorialohio.com/.
column11: Dr. Patel works with patients starting at age seventeen to alleviate pain while minimizing the use of medication, particularly narcotics. Patients with Worker's Compensation-related injuries are welcomed. If needed, Dr. Patel can refer patients to other doctors including orthopedic specialists, neurosurgeons, and rehabilitation specialists.

Memorial Pain Solutions in Marysville, Ohio offers comprehensive pain management services dedicated to improving quality of life for patients throughout Union County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, and post-surgical rehabilitation needs. With board-certified physicians and a multidisciplinary approach, we focus on both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies tailored to each patient's unique circumstances.

At Memorial Pain Solutions, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery and reduced reliance on opioid medications.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, our compassionate staff works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans addressing both physical symptoms and emotional well-being. We coordinate care with primary physicians and specialists to ensure comprehensive management of underlying conditions while focusing on functional improvement and enhanced daily living.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 937-578-4580 or visit our website at http://memorialohio.com/. Our facility is conveniently located at 660 London Ave, Marysville, OH 43040, with accessible parking and wheelchair access. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans including Medicare and workers' compensation.

The clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. Advanced Treatment Options

The facility offers a wide range of advanced procedures and treatment modalities designed to reduce pain and increase patient activity levels. By utilizing these state-of-the-art techniques, the team at DOC Pain Management aims to minimize reliance on opioid medications while maximizing functional improvement and quality of life for their patients.

Patient-Focused Care

Their compassionate staff works closely with patients to develop realistic goals and expectations, providing ongoing support throughout the recovery process. The ultimate objective is not just pain reduction but helping patients return to their daily activities and regain their independence.

I was referred by my family doctor and so far I'm grateful! Unlike some I do not want to be dependent on a pill so I can get around . I have had two back surgeries so far. We tried the trail pain disruptive probes and had good results. I will be getting the permanent unit this week. I will be forever grateful if this works!! Not sure why people are giving him a bad review, to me he is a down to earth kinda guy and is straightforward with you . He puts you at ease when doing procedures, makes sure you are numb enough so it doesn't hurt too much and has a awesome staff that follows up with calls to make sure you are OK and walk you through any questions .|Have followed him to 4 locations. He is now in Lima. He is a wonderful doctor. Listens to everything you say. Sticks with you until he finds therapy that works, so long as he can help you. The first appointment, he makes sure that he is able to provide treatment for you and will be honest if he can't. This can rub people the wrong way, but stick with it because he is both a wonderful doctor and person. Has great bedside manner with his dry, sharp sense of humor and is so good ar putting you to ease, especially when you are first seeing him most likely you feel terrible. I started seeing him in 2008 and he is both my favorite doctor and has become my friend. Since my therapy right now is mostly seeing him for refills, he spends the time he has with me asking about my general life and health and offers opinions that he thinks may be beneficial. God Bless him for all he has done treating my Chiari Malformation.|I have been with Dr. Prok for 25 years and have only known of him being in 2 locations. However Her issue is pain & she was shocked. My aunt has been through so many surgeries, back surgeries etc...  and trauma throughout her life to the point she had a pain pump in her & wanted it out but wanted to trustworthy doctor so she gave this guy a chance!  He drug her through the mud week after week with something different!!!
I hope no one goes to this guy and understands that he has a short temper, he clearly is taking care of patients that have addiction problems which that's GREAT if so but when you're going there for pain these are not the type of drugs in my opinion you should be offering. I hope he seeks anger management classes!! I'm tired of my poor aunt calling me and crying because he's trying her on a multitude of different strong addiction recovery narcotics! Arjun Sharma, MD serves Ontario, Ohio and surrounding Richland County communities with exceptional neurological care. As a dedicated neurologist at Avita Health System, Dr. Sharma brings specialized expertise in diagnosing and treating conditions affecting the brain, spinal cord, and nervous system. His patient-centered approach combines evidence-based medicine with compassionate care, ensuring each individual receives personalized treatment plans tailored to their specific neurological needs.

Dr. Sharma offers comprehensive evaluation and management for a wide spectrum of neurological disorders, including headaches, seizures, stroke, movement disorders, and neurodegenerative conditions. His practice emphasizes both acute intervention and long-term management strategies, helping patients navigate complex neurological challenges with confidence. Using advanced diagnostic techniques and staying current with the latest neurological research, Dr. Sharma delivers care that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes.

Patient Information

Dr. Sharma welcomes new patients at his conveniently located office in the Richland Mall medical complex. The practice features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and a supportive staff committed to patient comfort and care excellence. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 419-462-4547 or visit his profile at https://avitahealth.org/providers/arjun-sharma/ for additional information about services and insurance acceptance.

Location and Accessibility

Located at 600 Richland Mall, Ontario, OH 44906, Dr. Sharma's practice offers convenient access for patients throughout north central Ohio. The office provides ample parking and wheelchair accessibility. As part of the respected Avita Health System network, patients benefit from seamless coordination with other medical specialties and services when needed, ensuring comprehensive care for even the most complex neurological conditions.

column2: Dr. Fady Yacoub - Madison Health Pain Management
column3:
Madison Health Pain Management serves London, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life. Located in the heart of Madison County, our specialized clinic offers evidence-based treatments for both acute and chronic pain conditions under the expert guidance of our medical director, Dr. Fady Yacoub, DO. We understand that pain can significantly impact your daily activities, relationships, and overall wellbeing, which is why our approach focuses on personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Madison Health Pain Management, patients benefit from the extensive expertise of Dr. Fady Yacoub, a board-certified pain management specialist with advanced training in interventional techniques. Dr. Yacoub and our multidisciplinary team work collaboratively to address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain. We utilize the latest diagnostic tools and treatment modalities to identify the root causes of your discomfort and develop effective management strategies.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our clinic offers a wide range of treatments including medication management, minimally invasive procedures, nerve blocks, joint injections, and complementary therapies. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and sports injuries. Each treatment plan is designed to not only reduce pain but also to improve function and help patients return to their normal activities.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Madison Health Pain Management apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We believe informed patients make better decisions about their health, which is why we take the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. Our goal is to empower you to take an active role in managing your pain and improving your overall health.

Visit us at 210 N Main St, London, OH 43140 or call +1 740-845-7660 to schedule a consultation. For more information about our services, please visit our website at https://www.madison-health.com/hospital-services/pain-management/.

column48: What should I bring with me to my appointment?
column49:
To help make sure you get the best experience possible, we recommend you bring the following information and documentation to your appointment:

- Your insurance ID card(s) that are current and up-to-date
- Relevant medical records and reports
- List of your current medications
- Any questions for your doctor
- Any previously ordered test results, as applicable
- Relevant X-Rays, MRIs, Pathology slides and reports, as applicable

column2: Mercy Health - Red Bank Pain Management Center
column3:
Mercy Health - Red Bank Pain Management Center in Cincinnati, Ohio provides comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout the Greater Cincinnati area. As part of the broader Mercy Health network, this specialized facility offers evidence-based treatments designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's multidisciplinary approach combines advanced medical interventions with personalized care plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

The Red Bank Pain Management Center features board-certified pain specialists who utilize the latest diagnostic tools and therapeutic techniques. Patients benefit from a range of treatment options including medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy referrals, and integrative approaches to pain relief. The center specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Mercy Health's pain management philosophy is their commitment to treating the whole person, not just symptoms. The clinical team works collaboratively with patients to develop customized treatment plans that address physical symptoms while considering emotional and psychological aspects of pain. This comprehensive strategy helps patients develop effective coping mechanisms and long-term pain management solutions.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently located at 4760 Red Bank Rd #104, Cincinnati, OH 45227, the center is easily accessible from throughout the Cincinnati metropolitan area. The facility is part of Mercy Health's extensive network of pain management locations serving communities across Ohio and Kentucky. For appointments or inquiries, patients can contact the center directly at (513) 271-4488.

Visit their website at mercy.com to learn more about available services or to schedule a consultation with one of their pain management specialists.

column3:
OhioHealth Physician Group Pain Management serves Columbus, Ohio with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists understands that pain is a complex and deeply personal experience that can significantly impact your quality of life. Whether you're dealing with pain resulting from trauma, accidents, surgical procedures, or complex medical conditions, our comprehensive approach addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of pain management.

At OhioHealth Physician Group Pain Management, we offer individualized treatment plans utilizing the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies. Our multidisciplinary team evaluates each patient's unique situation to develop customized pain management strategies that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and integrative approaches. We specialize in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our compassionate specialists take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and work collaboratively with you to establish realistic goals for pain reduction and improved function. We understand that chronic pain can affect every aspect of your life, from sleep and mood to relationships and work performance, which is why we're committed to helping you regain control and improve your overall quality of life.

Convenient Central Ohio Location

Located at 285 E State St, Suite 430, Columbus, OH 43215, our facility offers a comfortable, supportive environment for your pain management needs. We proudly serve the residents of central Ohio with excellent care close to home. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call (614) 533-5500 or visit our website at OhioHealth Pain Management.
column11: If you are experiencing ongoing pain after a trauma, accident or injury, or following surgery, or as a result of a complex disease process or condition, we understand the impact your pain can have on your daily life. Our experts treat each patient's pain individually by offering advanced, compassionate care to help you achieve your best health and improve your quality of life. We are dedicated to providing the residents of central Ohio with excellent care close to home in our convenient location.

Marion Pain Clinic serves Marion, OH and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists is committed to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently at 1199 Delaware Ave, Suite 108, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to improve our patients' quality of life.

At Marion Pain Clinic, we understand that pain affects each person differently. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of your discomfort. We offer evidence-based treatments ranging from medication management and minimally invasive procedures to physical therapy recommendations and lifestyle modifications.

Conditions We Treat

  • Chronic Back and Neck Pain
  • Joint Pain and Arthritis
  • Neuropathic Pain
  • Post-surgical Pain
  • Sports Injuries
  • Work-related Injuries

    • Our Services

    Our comprehensive services are designed to provide effective pain relief while minimizing dependency on medications. We work closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that may include:

  • Interventional Pain Procedures
  • Medication Management
  • Nerve Blocks
  • Spinal Cord Stimulation
  • Joint Injections

column40:
I would not choose anyone else with my pain control.  He truly cares for his patients and gives the best care possible.  I have been on both sides of care with Dr Lingam, I worked for him in the 1990's and am now a patient.  He has always been a wonderful Dr and person and I would recommend him to anyone who needs help with pain control.|I have been to numerous pain Dr's. One had their medical license suspended for pushing certain medicines for drug companies. Another pain Dr lost his license for selling drugs out of his trunk. Another Pain Dr wanted to put me back on a pain medicine that put me on a ventilator for two days in the ICU. When he did not listen, I left his care.

I began seeing Dr Rao Lingam in 2011-2015 till my insurance said I could not see him anymore. All the other bad Dr's came after till I was able to return to him the beginning of this year 2022.

Dr Rao Lingam is one of the best Pain Dr's in the Columbus area you will be completely satisfied with his care.|Dr. Rao Lingam is one of the most professional, caring and terrific doctors I have ever met. He is able to identify the problem, and come up with a solution based on your personal needs. He is a wonderful doctor and I have never felt rushed. He takes his time when he is talking with me, and I never feel rushed, and he doesn't run out the door like some doctors before you've had an opportunity to ask questions. I highly recommend Dr. Lingam and Pain Care Specialists.|Most caring, professional, and experienced pain management doctor I've ever met, and he does workman's comp! Takes the necessary time with his patients. The practice is somewhat constrained ( as all are nowadays ), by politicians practicing medicine from the bench, but he's the best in Ohio, for sure!!|I suffer with chronic neck pain after a horse backing accident in 1993. I found Dr. Lingam online after searching for a provider who gets great reviews for trigger point injections. I started seeing him spring/summer of 2019. My appointment times were always delayed; sometimes I would wait 3 hours.  I waited patiently because I was getting a few days of relief after the injections. Initially he listened to my concerns. One of the gals, Kelly, at the front desk was always rude which I expressed to Dr. Lingam. Once Covid hit they stopped office visits and trigger point injections which was understandable. My pain wasn't being managed which is what they are supposed to do, that is their whole thing. When I needed prior authorizations for my medication, it was like pulling teeth. The staff was rude to my pharmacist, who I have a good relationship with. For my first telehealth visit, I called on 4/13/2020 to confirm my visit which was confirmed for aweek later on Monday. On Monday was told Tuesday, then on Tuesday was told Wednesday, finally got a call on Thursday. I was out of medication and in pain which did not seem to matter to them. I attempted to find a new pain management doctor but was unsuccessful.  Back in 2017, I pursued getting a cervical neurostimulator placed which my insurance denied same day of surgery. I have been on/off of narcotics and always chasing doctors down to do prior authorizations and making appointments which has been consuming most of my time. After all this, I decided to wean myself off of narcotics yet again. I returned to the neurosurgeon and we are trying again to get the neurostimulator placed. I am also on a wait list for a neurologist that specializes in my type of pain. To be continued...|I have been a patient of Rau Lingam for many years and he's a fabulous doctor! He remembers what you tell him and genuinely cares about people. Dr Kal is also a great doctor tho I haven't been to him very often.|Dr. Rao Lingam cares about his Patients.|Always excellent care.

He is a very caring, knowledgeable, kind professional Dr.   He actually takes time to talk to you and explain things to you in a manner that is understandable. I am blessed to have found him. I have been treated well by all the staff and the office and I look forward to working with them on a continued basis.|I have high praises and highly recommend Dr. Prayson! I was referred to him by Dr. Newton after finding that injections might help me rather than doing surgery.
I got in to see him rather quickly as he was seeing new patients. Our initial appointment went well as he described how the injections will help with the bulging disc in my lower back. He was very thorough in explaining everything to me.
Dr. Prayson scheduled me to come in a few weeks later for my injections. He explained everything that was going to happen before the 20 minute procedure and then reiterated it throughout. He came to check on me as I recovered after and said everything looked good.
I went for a follow up about 3 weeks following the procedure and they had worked wonderful for me!
He seems to be very involved in all aspects of the patient, which I find helped.
Dr. Prayson has a fantastic bedside manner and I would absolutely 100% recommend him to anyone looking into pain management. He knows what he's doing!|I had spent months in so much pain that I was living on OTC painkillers every 2 hours.  I could not mount on my horses and had trouble walk up and down stairs.  Once I was disgnoaed with femoral nerve impingement, Dr. Prayson was able to do an injection on it.  As soon as he started the injection, the pain went away.  It is post injection and I still feel wonderful.  Dr. Prayson also has a wonderful bedside manner.  He takes time to make sure he explains everything so you understand it and takes time to answer your questions.  I never feel like I am a number or money with him, I feel like a valued patient.|My husband went to Pain Mgmt and seen Dr. Prayson who prescribed Physical Therapy first for hip pain associated with his back pain. Sycamore Pain Management in Miamisburg, Ohio offers comprehensive pain management services as part of the respected Kettering Health network. Specializing in both acute and chronic pain conditions, our board-certified physicians utilize evidence-based approaches to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. We serve patients throughout the Miami Valley region with personalized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies.

Our multidisciplinary team addresses a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs following thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing. We emphasize minimally invasive interventions when possible to promote faster recovery and reduced reliance on medication.

Our Approach to Patient Care

At Sycamore Pain Management, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians work closely with physical therapists, psychologists, and other specialists to provide comprehensive care that addresses all aspects of pain management. We emphasize patient education and active participation in the treatment process to achieve optimal outcomes.

Facility and Accessibility

Located at 4000 Miamisburg Centerville Rd, Suite 420 in Miamisburg, our modern facility offers a comfortable environment with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. The office is easily accessible from I-675 and offers ample parking for patients. Our central location makes us convenient for residents throughout Montgomery and Warren counties.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (937) 384-4511. You can also visit our website at www.ketteringhealth.org/pain/ for additional information about our providers, treatment options, and patient resources. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans.

column40:
I went for DDD and bulging disc in my neck and back. I have to have injections regularly. She told me she would fax over an opioid medication where I'd take it once a day. Turns out she told my primary doctor something different and took me off of my muscle relaxers saying I'm not a good mom if I'm on them. I've been on this medication for over 10 years. They are very judgmental when they don't know you.|My father had an appointment with this Dr My father and I spoke with her she decided to prescribe him the medicine he was on from the nursing home, by time we got home an dropped the prescription off to the pharmacy, few hrs later they were cancelled. This Dr seemed very understanding, and from what we discussed I thought she was willing to be my father's pain dr, next thing we know she know she cancelled the prescription that she written out, She was well aware of my father's history ,etc. My father is in a wheelchair an can't walk or do anything on his own. I'm not sure if she did this to get us out of the office or what.  Very unprofessional she simply could of called us an discussed the issues/concerns she had before canceling prescription and agreeing to being his pain dr.|With Dr Abraham you are uniformed of exact location of injection or why that location. If it's a hard place to get into she forces the needle and in the end causing even more pain during and after injection. I now have very bad pain in my feet and have a hard time walking. I feel worse after seeing her and would not recommend her to anyone else. I'd research pain management doctors and find one that informs you of what your treatment will be and where exactly the injection will be and why.|I had a procedure done with Dr. Silverman today. He and the RN that took care of me did an excellent job.
I would name her, but didn't catch her name.
Hope the procedure succeeds as hoped for. She was excellent in taking care of me. He as well! I highly recommend!|Took my son. He's 23 and since a young age has had bulging disks, DDD, his knee keeps swelling up, arms and legs go numb or tingle. He can't sleep. It's affecting his whole life. Every Dr passes him to the next and no one does anything for him. It's frustrating. They all just want to give him anti depressants! I see everyone on here talking about the meds they prescribed. They told him they will not prescribe meds at all when they called to schedule him. Which is fine, he doesn't want anti depressants nor pain meds. He wants someone to HELP him. To figure out why this is happening and what we can do. He wants someone to listen, not pass him off because he's young. He does stretches, been to physical therapy, goes to a chiropractor. I just want someone to care enough to figure this out. He's had past testing, hence the few diagnoses. But that's been since he was 15ish. They don't do any testing to see progress of the issues. If anyone out there knows where I can take him, or anything that will help that we haven't done or thought of, please let me know. I don't want to lose my son because these Drs let him fall through the cracks.  Believe me, they didn't care either! So this place just evaluated him, told him to stretch, and is telling the referring physician to put him on anti depressants. He's told them them all those don't work, they make his depression worse. They ignore him. I'm allergic to all anti depressants, so I'm not surprised he can't take them. THIS IS A PLEA FOR HELP!|Dr. Nirmala Anrahams at Sycamore Pain Mngt is simply Awesome!!
She has been treating my back pain issues with tranforminal epidural Lumbar injections for about 3 years now and has done a marvelous job at relieving the pain and restoring my life and livelyhood.
Her treatments have completely ended the shooting, burning pain that ran from my L4 L5 down my buttocks, through the back of my knee and down to shin and big toe. The relief can last 3-4 month, and for me has lasted as long as 7 months on occasions.

Sycamore pain management is NOT a pill mill. This is not a place that writes pain med prescriptions if thats all you're looking for.

The negative and low scoring reviews, typically with no explanations, are nothing more than "pain med addicts" pissed off because they didnt get their "Fix" from this highly respected and ligit Doctor.|Dr. Silverman is friendly, personable, and professional.  He takes the time to listen and discuss options with patients without judgement. If you want medication free options for pain control, this is the place to go! Very highly recommended!|Dr Abraham is a God , absolutely love her, yes injection's are not fun but a great Dr definitely helps and again Dr Abraham is great, fantastic

column3:
Nirmala Abraham, MD serves the Miamisburg, OH area as a distinguished pain management specialist with extensive training and board certification in Pain Medicine. Dr. Abraham brings her wealth of knowledge and expertise to patients throughout the greater Dayton region, offering comprehensive pain management solutions at her Kettering Health practice. With her patient-centered approach and specialized training, she has established herself as a trusted healthcare provider for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Abraham's medical journey began at Loma Linda University where she completed her medical education. She then pursued her internship at Kettering Health Main Campus, building a foundation of clinical experience. Her specialized training continued with a residency in anesthesiology at the prestigious University of Pennsylvania, followed by an interventional pain management fellowship at the University of California, Los Angeles. This comprehensive educational path has equipped Dr. Abraham with the advanced skills needed to address complex pain conditions using the latest evidence-based approaches.

Professional Experience

Before joining Kettering Health, Dr. Abraham served as the Assistant Director for both the clinic and fellowship training program at the UCLA Pain Management Center. Her academic contributions continued as an Assistant Professor for the Department of Anesthesiology at the David Geffen School of Medicine, where she helped shape the next generation of pain management specialists. In 2010, Kettering Health recruited Dr. Abraham specifically to establish and develop their outpatient clinic and inpatient pain program, recognizing her exceptional skills and leadership in the field.

Services and Approach

At her Miamisburg practice, Dr. Abraham offers comprehensive pain management services, utilizing her interventional expertise to provide targeted treatments for various chronic pain conditions. Her approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with holistic pain management strategies, ensuring patients receive personalized care plans designed to improve their quality of life and functional abilities.

Location and Contact Information

Patients can schedule consultations with Dr. Nirmala Abraham at her office located at 4000 Miamisburg Centerville Rd, Suite 410, Miamisburg, OH 45342. For appointments or inquiries, call +1 937-384-4511. Additional information about Dr. Abraham's practice and services can be found on the Kettering Health website at ketteringhealth.org.
column11: Nirmala Abraham, MD, attended medical school at Loma Linda University. She completed her internship at Kettering Health Main Campus and her residency in anesthesiology at the University of Pennsylvania. Her interventional pain management fellowship was at the University of California, Los Angeles. She holds board certification in Pain Medicine. Dr Abraham began her career at the UCLA Pain Management Center as the Assistant Director for the clinic and the fellowship training program. She also served as an Assistant Professor for the Department of Anesthesiology at the David Geffen School of Medicine. In 2010, Dr Abraham was recruited by Kettering Health to establish an outpatient clinic and inpatient pain program.

column40:
Dr. Abraham is one of the best. She's been managing my back pain (without my having to have more back surgery) for a few years now with injections. From my first appointment to now, she has always been very professional and careful to explain exactly what I could expect every step of the way. I have always had needle, doctor, dental... anxiety; however, all of my fears went away after being treated at Sycamore Hospital by her. I am so thankful for physicians like Dr. Abraham, because there doesn't seem to be a lot who you can sense "genuinely care" as she does. There is just no reason for me to go anywhere else.|Dr. Abraham relieved the pain in my piriformus muscle after 3 years of being in pain after a fall. One injection. I felt relief before I even left the table. No drugs, which I did not want. I Highly recommend Dr. Abraham.|Dr Abraham is fantastic, as well as her staff.  Listened to my concerns and did everything they could do address my back pain and make timely appointments.  I would highly recommend her and the pain management staff.|What an amazing experience.  The staff was friendly and courteous.  Dr. Abraham listened to my problem and then showed me where my difficulty was located.  I was scheduled for an injection and luckily they had a cancellation and I was able to get it the next day. I am scheduled for follow up in 6 weeks.|The staff was very nice . But the Dr. doesn't seem to care as much about taking on new pt. She wasn't listening. I was referred to her because I moved and couldn't continue traveling over an hour to see my prior pain specialist. I wanted to be in the Kettering Network because all my other doctors and care received at Kettering were amazing.
She insisted that i continue to go to my old doctor didn't want to listen to facts! Being out of my insurance network was costing a small fortune. They requested MRI and x- rays I expected her to say she would schedule for my back after review of the MRI but she kept insisting she probably wouldn't take care of my back even after review of the MRI. Wow
I felt stereo typed and wouldn't let her touch my back after this meeting for my knee pain. Because of her attitude. Not a caring Dr. at all.|Updated review.

Dr. Nirmala Abraham and her staff at Sycamore Pain Management are absolutely  Awesome! The 4th injection in her series of treatment had me feeling fantastic, So much so that I had forgotten that I still need to be careful how I lift things. Several weeks ago while lifting a snowblower in an awkward and completely wrong body position I felt a pop. The next day I had some mild pain, took some ibuprofen and ignored it. 2 weeks later the pain grew even worse, still hoping ice packs and Ibuprofen were not doing much to help, but I still hoped it would go away. Two days later I was in so much pain I went to the E.R. at 4am, they gave me 2 shots in my butt which did nothing. I called Dr. Abraham office in terrible pain and desperate for help. This is where the "amazing" part starts. They immediately scheduled me for injections for the following day. Unfortunately my insurance company requires pre-approval, which usually takes a week to get. In the meantime they got me into the office examine me and applied a large patch to help dull the pain. Some how her awesome medical staff was able to get pre-approval in 24 hours and scheduled me for the procedure in 36 hours. Dr. Abraham and her awesome staff truly do care. Not only are they truly sympathetic to a patients misery, their actions are proof this team of healers are driven by empathy. If you read anything other than positive comments about Sycamore Pain Management, it's total bunk!

Original review:
Dr. Abraham is Fantastic. I just completed my 4th treatment and I feel GREAT!
The injection on my first treatment was something else. She was right on the money with her accuracy. I won't lie; it hurt like hell, but only for about 8 seconds and very quickly dissipated. I had almost immediate relief although there was an odd, hard to describe mild discomfort for a few hours. I think it's just from a having a needle penetrate that deep, it too goes away in a few hours.

The first injection removed 90% of main nerve pain. I have not had any reoccurrence of the pain shooting from my back to my toe since. Each subsequent treatment was easier and with much less brief pain from the previous. My latest shot (4th), I felt hardly a tingle which tells me she has relieved me of nearly all my pain. Yes, nearly all. I would stay I am 97% pain free and love the results. I honestly expected maybe slight relief, how wrong was I.

Dr. Abraham is a legit Pain Management doctor, NOT one of those bull$hit Pill mill places. If you're just looking for drugs and pain killers, like some of the other pissed off reviewers here, don't waste your time she's a REAL doctor with effect treatments,  NOT a drug dealer with a license.

- Living a whole new Pain-free life and loving every minute of  it -|Dr. Abraham is very friendly,  caring, and compassionate. She provided me pain relief and pur me at ease|Don't really want to give her one star. She was almost an hour and a half late, was uncaring, dismissive and short. She did not want to listen at all and did nothing to help me and did not want me as a patient. Very unprofessional.

UC Health Pain Medicine Center serves West Chester Township, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services. Established as part of the renowned UC Health network, this specialized center combines evidence-based treatments with innovative approaches to help patients experiencing acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary team includes board-certified pain specialists, anesthesiologists, physical therapists, and behavioral health professionals who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans.

The UC Health Pain Medicine Center offers a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management solutions. Their specialists treat various conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Treatment options may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, psychological support, and advanced interventional techniques such as nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 7759 University Drive in West Chester Township, the center features modern examination rooms, procedure suites equipped with advanced imaging technology, and comfortable recovery areas. The facility was designed with patient comfort and convenience in mind, offering ample parking in their dedicated lot. Their central location makes them accessible to patients throughout the Cincinnati metropolitan area and beyond.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes UC Health Pain Medicine Center is their commitment to treating the whole person, not just the pain. Their integrated approach addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of pain, helping patients improve their quality of life and functionality. New patients benefit from comprehensive evaluations that consider medical history, previous treatments, and personal goals to create customized care plans.

For appointments or more information, patients can call +1 513-475-8282 or visit their website at https://www.uchealth.com/pain-medicine/. The center accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to coordinate benefits and referrals when needed.

Southeastern Med Pain Management in Cambridge, Ohio serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions in the southeastern region of the state. Established as a specialized division of Southeastern Med healthcare system, this dedicated facility offers personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Their team of board-certified pain specialists combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues, from persistent back pain to debilitating migraines.

At Southeastern Med Pain Management, patients receive balanced treatment protocols customized to their specific needs. The clinic specializes in treating various painful conditions including chronic pain syndromes, back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, migraines, and post-surgical pain. Their multidisciplinary approach may incorporate medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary pain relief strategies—all designed to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Southeastern Med Pain Management is their commitment to accessible, local care. Patients no longer need to travel long distances to receive specialized pain treatment, as the clinic provides advanced pain management solutions right in Cambridge. The referral-based practice works closely with primary care physicians to ensure continuity of care and comprehensive treatment planning. Their modern facility at 1210 Neal Dr is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to address even the most complex pain conditions.

If you're struggling with chronic pain that affects your daily activities and quality of life, ask your physician about a referral to Southeastern Med Pain Management. Contact their office at (740) 439-8898 to learn more about their services or visit seormc.org/services/pain-management for additional information. Their convenient location in Cambridge, OH 43725 makes specialized pain care accessible to residents throughout southeastern Ohio.

Blanchard Valley Pain Management serves patients throughout Findlay, Bluffton, Ottawa, and Lima, Ohio with comprehensive pain management solutions. As a specialized department of Blanchard Valley Hospital, our practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians and highly trained clinical staff utilize evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on minimizing invasive procedures while maximizing pain relief and functional improvement.

At Blanchard Valley Pain Management, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team specializes in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions through the most current medical interventions available. We pride ourselves on offering the least invasive, most effective treatment options to help patients regain normal body function and improve quality of life.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the underlying causes of their pain. Our comprehensive treatment plans may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary approaches to pain control. We work collaboratively with other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of your pain management needs.

Contact Information

Our Lima location is conveniently situated at 310 S Cable Rd, Lima, OH 45805. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (567) 712-7741. Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Dr. Provenzano's expertise in interventional techniques allows many patients to find relief without resorting to major surgery or long-term opioid use. Patient-Centered Care

The practice emphasizes thorough evaluation, clear communication, and ongoing support throughout the treatment process. column40:
Dr. Provenzano was great again as always.  This was my second injection.  Both experiences were remarkable.  He walked me through the process and informed me what was going to happen.  Dr. Provenzano has vast knowledge and his experience is invaluable.  He demonstrates a level of skill that sets him apart as one of the best in his field.  I highly recommend him!!!!!|My post-lumbar steroid injection followup appointment with Dr. Provenzano was, as usual, reassuring and pleasant. We agreed that the procedure was a success. My stenosis is manageable and rarely interferes with daily activities. I am grateful!
He listens, welcomes questions, and remembers who I am, not just where I ache. (He always asks what I'm reading and really wants to know.) He genuinely cares about his patients' physical and psychological well- being as they struggle with the aches and pains of injury or age. His staff is great too -- cheerful and efficient. Good place, good people!|for 6 months i went to tristate ortho and physical therapy 3 weeks. back to ortho checked again and more p.t.. finally asked and got order for mri that took 6 weeks to get. pain clinic was another 4 weeks or so. i have never felt better after the shot at surgery center. i feel very good that i am a patient of dr. provenzano. dr. werries sent me there and i am comfortable for the future issues. office staff was top notch. thanks to all for where i am right now. james maccaglia|I am a 66 year old female who has had several back surgeries. I have been miserable with my back and all the surgeries that I have not been living, just existing.  Dr. Provenzano put a back stimulator in and it changed my pain level.  I am 75% out of pain and starting to live again.  The office staff are very helpful in all of my needs.  I would recommend Dr.Provenzano and his staff for pain management needs.  The office wait time is very minimal, yet you are never rushed during your appointment.  Thank you all for all your help!!|Dr. Provenzano and his staff have exceeded expectation on all fronts. My St. Luke Medical (now Abbott Labs) neurostimulator implant which had a  battery lifespan of 7 years, I had it for over 9 years of service. October 29th I went thru outpatient surgery with Dr. Provenzano to replace my older stimulator with the latest in technology from Abbott Labs. The surgery went according to plans and I was able to go home within 2 hours afterwards.
Over the next week, Karen from the Doctor's office called everyday to check on my progress, making sure I was doing well since the surgery. My followup exam with Doctor Provenzano and team at the 2 week mark,  November 13th, went better than expected and I was encouraged by the results. I am so appreciative for the care and help from everyone in Doctor Provenzano's office! Thank You, Dale Mihcko|Ive been seen by Dr P for several years and found him to be extremely caring and concerned.   He truly wants the best for me and so does his PA Vicki.    My pain is 24/7 and can be frustrating to me and sometimes I say stupid stuff w/o thinking. I also am a jokester and sometimes people dont understand my dry sense of humor.   Fortunately I am receiving excellent care and pain mgt. else I could not live with the pain but fortunately I found Dr Provozono and my pain is very well controlled.    Ray Mann  1-17-25|Dr Provenzano took the time to explain and answered all my questions so I could understand.  The staff was very professional as well.  Injections helped with pain as my disk healed.  Would recommend highly!|I went to Dr. Provenzano , whose office is nearly an hour from me, because he was the only one who could get me in for an appointment within 2 weeks.  All others were over a month.  Back pain is unbearable when you work a physical job. He not only helped relieve me of the pain, he and his whole office were so friendly and efficient.  The whole experience was amazing.  I highly recommend him to anyone dealing with pain.  Four stars for me

column2: Dr. Robert E. Gould, D.O., Spine Muscles Nerves
column3:
Spine Muscles Nerves serves Westerville, Ohio and surrounding communities as a dedicated interventional pain management clinic led by Dr. Robert E. Gould, D.O. Our practice stands as Ohio's premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions, offering evidence-based treatments designed to address acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, we focus on not merely masking symptoms but identifying and treating the underlying causes of discomfort.

At Spine Muscles Nerves, we provide a diverse range of interventional treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Dr. Gould and our specialized medical team combine decades of clinical experience with advanced diagnostic techniques to develop personalized care plans. Our comprehensive approach addresses pain originating from spinal conditions, muscular dysfunction, and neurological disorders.

Our Treatment Philosophy

We believe in proactive pain management that goes beyond temporary relief. Our clinical team collaborates to create customized treatment protocols that not only alleviate current pain but also work to prevent future discomfort. This forward-thinking approach helps patients regain functionality, improve quality of life, and return to activities they enjoy without the burden of chronic pain.

Expert Medical Leadership

Under the direction of Dr. Robert E. Gould, D.O., our practice maintains the highest standards of patient care. Dr. Gould's specialized training in osteopathic medicine brings a unique perspective to pain management, incorporating a whole-body approach that considers how the musculoskeletal system interacts with overall health and wellness.

Visit Our Practice

Experience the difference of truly comprehensive pain management at our modern Westerville facility. We're conveniently located at 450 Alkyre Run Dr, Suite 360, Westerville, OH 43082. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 614-918-9808 or visit our website at www.spinemusclesnerves.com.

As experienced pain management medical professionals, Dr. Robert Gould and the medical team at Spine Muscles Nerves aim to provide quality care, promote overall health and wellbeing, improve daily functioning, and help our patients live their best life possible. Our clinical team works together to create a pain management plan that is customized for each patient's specific needs. We do not just treat pain. I highly recommend Dr. Gould for pain management.|Dr Gould has personally reached out to me after hours at least 3 times in the last year or so still in the office to check on the situationwhen I left a message. Overtime, I believe we have built a trusting relationship to where we can be honest with each other about my problems, and he believes me when I tell him how I feel. Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. OConnell has given me the support I've needed throughout my time with her. She has literally saved my life.

column2: Adel Zakari, MD - Advanced Pain Management Institute - Primary location
column3:
Advanced Pain Management Institute serves Canton, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Adel Zakari, MD, our practice delivers cutting-edge procedures designed to effectively manage chronic pain while improving patients' quality of life and minimizing opioid dependency. Our team utilizes state-of-the-art fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance to ensure all treatments are performed with the highest levels of precision and safety, giving our patients confidence in their care journey.

At Advanced Pain Management Institute, we offer an extensive range of specialized treatments tailored to address various pain conditions. Our services include:

  • Epidural injections for spinal pain relief

  • Facet joint injections and radiofrequency ablation

  • Advanced spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Kyphoplasty for vertebral compression fractures

  • Targeted joint injections for arthritis and inflammation

  • Specialized nerve blocks (trigeminal, sphenopalatine ganglion, stellate ganglion, lumbar sympathetic)

  • Regenerative PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) injections

  • Trigger point and bursa injections

  • Occipital nerve blocks for headache management

  • Celiac plexus blocks for abdominal pain

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets our practice apart is our commitment to affordable, accessible care. We provide all our advanced interventional procedures without the additional burden of facility fees or ambulatory surgery center (ASC) charges. This approach ensures our patients receive the highest quality pain management care without unnecessary financial strain.

Contact Information

Our primary location is conveniently situated at 4368 Dressler Rd NW, Suite #201 A, Canton, OH 44718. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Zakari or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 330-493-2571 or visit our website at www.cantonpainmanagement.com.
column11: Advanced Pain Management Institute provides cutting-edge interventional pain management procedures to help manage chronic pain and improve quality of life, while minimizing opioid dependency. Our procedures are performed with precision and safety using fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance. We offer a range of treatments, including epidural injections, facet joint injections and radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, kyphoplasty, joint injections, nerve blocks (trigeminal, sphenopalatine ganglion, stellate ganglion, lumbar sympathetic), PRP injections, trigger point injections, bursa injections, occipital nerve blocks, celiac plexus blocks, and more. No facility (hospital) fees or ambulatory surgery center (ASCs) fees.

column3:
Beacon Orthopaedics & Sports Medicine in Cincinnati, Ohio has established itself as a premier destination for comprehensive orthopaedic care since its founding in 1996. What began as a multi-physician practice has evolved into a nationally recognized institution delivering exceptional sports medicine and orthopaedic services throughout the Greater Cincinnati region. Under the expert guidance of physicians like Dr. Atul Chandoke, MD, Beacon continues its tradition of excellence, combining cutting-edge medical technology with compassionate patient care. The practice's remarkable growth over nearly three decades reflects its unwavering commitment to improving mobility and quality of life for patients of all ages and activity levels.

Beacon Orthopaedics has strategically expanded its service offerings beyond traditional orthopaedic care to provide patients with a truly integrated healthcare experience. Their comprehensive approach includes state-of-the-art physical therapy facilities, advanced diagnostic imaging services, specialized athletic training programs, and durable medical equipment (DME) solutions. This holistic treatment model allows patients to receive all aspects of their orthopaedic care under one roof, streamlining the recovery process and ensuring consistent quality throughout the treatment journey.

Dr. Atul Chandoke's Expertise

As a distinguished member of Beacon's medical team, Dr. Atul Chandoke brings specialized knowledge and skill to the practice. Patients seeking consultation with Dr. Chandoke can visit him at Beacon's Cornell Road location in Cincinnati or learn more about his background and approach to care through his dedicated physician page at https://www.beaconortho.com/physician/atul-chandoke-md/. For appointments or inquiries, patients can reach Dr. Chandoke's office directly at +1 513-354-3700.

Convenient Location

Beacon Orthopaedics & Sports Medicine's facility at 8099 Cornell Rd, Cincinnati, OH 45249 offers patients easy access to world-class orthopaedic care. This location is equipped with modern treatment rooms, diagnostic equipment, and rehabilitation facilities designed to address a wide spectrum of musculoskeletal conditions. From sports injuries and joint replacements to spine care and fracture management, the Cornell Road location exemplifies Beacon's commitment to delivering exceptional medical care in a convenient, patient-centered environment.
