column40:
I came to Dr. Aminian due to a cervical injury that was causing vertigo and vomiting from the pain.
She and her staff have been very kind and professional each time I have been there. She performed a Nerve Ablation on my neck and the difference in the pain was incredible! First time in years I had relief.
I told her I don't like taking any prescription pain meds and unlike others she didn't try to push them on me.
The procedure I had done in the cervical area done can be very dangerous and I have absolute trust in her.
Eric C.|Seeing the comments I thought I was the only one. I Saw this Doctor 7 years ago I am a Minority Race. On the first visit this doctor said she does not give meds well she said that on the second visit as well but prescribed me Tramadol. She had no problem giving me injections when it came to it but
I asked if she could change my meds to something different she asked "what works". I asked what she recommended she said "she's not going change my medicine for me to take what she gives me". I told her the medicine makes my stomach hurts. The doctor than unprofessionally throws my chart to the floor and storms out of the door. If you are Minority find another doctor. She should not be a doctor.|Dr Aminian and staff are friendly, courteous and knowledgeable.  I was greeted by the front desk and waited a few mins then checked me in.  Nurse Victoria is awesome.  Took the time to know all the details and set expectations. Dr Aminian then came in to see me and explained everything in detail.  Wasnt being rushed or anything.  Very friendly too.  Finally Nurse Brenda checked us out and gave final details for scheduling my Sacroiliac joint injection on Wed Jan 11th.  Will update the review once shot and follow up is done!  Looking fwd to it!

Update 4/18/2023
Dr Aminian and staff are great every step of the way!|My mother has been seen by Dr. Aminian for a number of years for managing her pain from disability and neuropathy. Over the last year, after a number of significant life changes, mom is now in a retirement community where she no longer has to exert herself more strenuously, and is able to "take it easy" for a majority of her days. As a result, she hasn't needed to take as much of her pain medication aside from a low daily dose for maintenance to take the edge off her pain so she can sleep at night. Dr. Aminian wrote her prescription for 1-2x 1/2 pills AS NEEDED, then when she has only been generally taking a half pill per day, her three month script is able to last her nearly 6 months. At her last appointment, mom told them she was taking it daily, but then she was accused of lying about what she was doing with the medication because she didn't pick up a script in March when she wrote it... because she wasn't out yet and didn't need it. So instead of adjusting how much was being prescribed, listening to us about the change in her lifestyle, she just referred to mom as a "safety concern" in an overly accusatory tone and flat out refused to do anything further for her; told us we would need to pursue care elsewhere if we wanted her to continue on her maintenance level of the medication that she has been on for over 20 years.

But let's not address the issue that you're the one who is actually -= OVER PRESCRIBING THE OPIOIDS =-  but you want to get upset that you wrote the prescription and we didn't pick it up, because mom still has enough to maintain and it wasn't yet needed. Isn't the goal to have LESS of the opioids being out there? In fact, if we picked up 4x "3 month scripts" over a year of 90 pills, for 1-2x 1/2 pills as needed, this script would last between 3 and 6 months. If she only took a 1/2 pill for 6 months, we'd now have 180 pills, enough for her to maintain for an entire year... during which we would accumulate another unnecessary 360 pills.

Dr. Aminian didn't care to listen, showed zero concern for explanation of the change in lifestyle, displayed zero empathy for a person who has lived over a third of her life with chronic pain. All she appeared to be concerned about was how us not filling a unnecessary prescription made her (presumably) look like she was writing unnecessary pain medications. What's worse is the mental anguish she placed on our mother by making her feel like she did something wrong for trying to be responsible for how she took and maintained her pain medications.

Forget 1 star, 0 stars.
If you're looking for assistance with pain management, I would advise you to steer very clear of Dr. Aminian whose practice with her patients is a very real safety concern.|Dr. Aminian took the time to review my chart and discuss my options going forward. I would definitely, recommend her in the future. All of the staff from front desk, review staff, rn, and doctor were all very pleasant and helpful.
Thank you again,

S.D.Woste|I felt like she never listening to me at all she was all into the injection with messed with my sciatic nerve . She yelled at me for wanting my contract back I would not recommend her she made me uncomfortable and could not look at me.|Dr Aminian was rude, dismissive, and did not want to include me in my treatment. She already had her mind made up, and she was condescending when I tried to express my concerns. I was not drug seeking, however I was definitely treated like it. I am extremely disappointed with the level of care. Perhaps she should consider the patient's overall welfare before judging them.|She gives my boyfriend of 6 years, (Jack Higgins Jr). pills that he snorts, and then hes abusive and falls asleep sitting up slobbering. He uses narcotics with his meds.  Hes getting more unhealthy and more abusive.
Before giving him any more medication, check and see whats already in him.     Hes Sick.

Adena Interventional Pain Management serves Chillicothe, OH and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team of board-certified pain specialists combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address the root causes of pain, not just the symptoms. With state-of-the-art facilities at our 272 Hospital Road location, we provide a full spectrum of evidence-based treatments in a compassionate, patient-centered environment.

Our interventional pain management services include a wide range of specialized procedures:

  • Diagnostic Procedures: Nerve Blocks, Discograms

  • Epidural Injections: Cervical, Thoracic, and Lumbar Epidurals

  • Joint Treatments: Facet Blocks, Joint and Bursa Injections

  • Advanced Interventions: Nerve Ablations, Radio Frequency Nerve Ablation, Sympathetic Blocks

  • Implantable Therapies: Intrathecal Opioids, Intrathecal Baclofen, Spinal Cord Stimulators

  • Surgical Options: Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression, Facet Fusion

  • Specialized Care: Long Term Opioid Evaluation, Cancer Pain, Emergency Pain Management

Insurance and Accessibility

At Adena Pain Management, we believe effective pain relief should be accessible to all patients. We accept most insurance plans, including Medicare, Medicaid, and Bureau of Workers' Compensation, making quality pain care available to our community. Our administrative team works closely with patients to navigate insurance requirements and maximize coverage for necessary treatments.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 740-779-7460

Address: 272 Hospital Rd, Chillicothe, OH 45601, United States

Mid-Ohio Pain Care serves Mansfield, Ohio and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the direction of Dr. James R. Wolfe, MD. Our practice combines interventional techniques with medication management to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently in Richland County, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain while maintaining the highest standards of care and compliance.

At Mid-Ohio Pain Care, we primarily focus on interventional pain management, performing specialized procedures and injections for various painful conditions. Our comprehensive approach doesn't stop there—we maintain a significant patient base who benefit from carefully monitored medication regimens and alternative treatment options tailored to individual needs.

Medication Management Services

We continue to provide opioid therapy for carefully selected and monitored patients when appropriate. Our practice maintains strict compliance with current opioid prescribing guidelines and regulations, ensuring patient safety while delivering effective pain relief. Additionally, our office is authorized to provide medical marijuana recommendations in accordance with Ohio state law, maintaining rigorous adherence to all guidelines and regulations governing medical cannabis use.

Patient-Centered Care

Under Dr. Wolfe's leadership, our team is committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address the unique circumstances of each patient. We believe in a balanced approach that considers all available options to improve quality of life and functionality for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Website: www.midohiopaincare.com

Phone: (419) 709-8270

Address: 605 S Trimble Rd, Suite B, Mansfield, OH 44906

Oklahoma Pain Management serves Oklahoma City, OK and surrounding areas with specialized interventional pain management services. Our dedicated team of pain specialists focuses on identifying the root causes of chronic pain conditions and developing personalized treatment plans that restore quality of life. Using advanced diagnostic techniques and evidence-based interventional therapies, we help patients find relief from persistent pain that hasn't responded to conventional treatments.

At Oklahoma Pain Management, we utilize the latest technologies in interventional therapies to custom tailor a treatment plan that fits your specific condition and pain pattern. Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of painful conditions, including:

- Abdominal pain

- Chronic headaches & migraines

- Lower back pain

- Neck pain

- Sciatic nerve pain

- Peripheral nerve injury

- Joint pain

- Neuropathic pain

Our Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Rather than simply masking symptoms, our goal is to identify and treat the underlying causes of your discomfort. We want to get you back to a more active lifestyle and improve the quality of your day-to-day life through targeted interventions and ongoing support.

Visit Our Oklahoma City Location

If you're struggling with chronic pain that affects your daily activities and quality of life, contact Oklahoma Pain Management today to schedule a consultation with our experienced team.

Website: [backpainok.com](http://backpainok.com/)

Phone: +1 405-242-4100

Address: 3601 NW 138th St #200, Oklahoma City, OK 73134, United States

waste of a $50 co-pay|After dealing with relentless pain and searching for help high and low, this clinic has on a very short period of time helped me more than anyone ever. I wanted just to come back here and they turned me away they said that I had an attitude with the front lady at the desk which was not true I just wanted some help they were very cold nobody smiled I wouldn't recommend this place they seemed rather not friendly!!!! column2: Advanced Pain Management Center of Oklahoma
column3:
Advanced Pain Management Center of Oklahoma serves Tulsa, OK and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical facility focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our establishment, we have been committed to improving quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain through minimally invasive techniques and multidisciplinary treatment plans.

At Advanced Pain Management Center of Oklahoma, our board-certified physicians offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our approach combines cutting-edge medical interventions with holistic pain management strategies to address both the symptoms and underlying causes of chronic pain.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We believe in personalized care that considers each patient's complete medical history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and patient education. By addressing pain from multiple angles, we help patients achieve sustainable relief and improved functionality.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 3840 S 103rd E Ave STE 100, Tulsa, OK 74146, our modern medical center is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. Our comfortable environment is designed to put patients at ease while receiving the highest standard of care. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure accessible care for our patients.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (918) 921-9700. You can also visit our website at http://apmcok.com/ for additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

Oklahoma Pain Center serves Oklahoma City, OK and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. At our specialized facility, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians brings decades of collective experience in pain medicine, offering personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's unique needs and circumstances.

At Oklahoma Pain Center, we believe in the team approach to managing chronic pain. This means we utilize the knowledge and skills of various healthcare specialists to ensure you receive the best and most complete treatment possible. This approach starts with your primary care physician who first examines you to determine the history and location of your pain, any previous treatments you have tried, how well you cope with pain, and any other factors that may currently be affecting your pain.

Specialized Care for Chronic Pain

People suffering from chronic pain may be referred to a pain specialist, like the physicians at Oklahoma Pain Center. Our specialists are trained to evaluate complex pain conditions and develop comprehensive treatment strategies that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health approaches. We work closely with your referring physician to ensure continuity of care throughout your treatment journey.

Our Location and Contact Information

We welcome patients at our modern, comfortable facility located at 13921 N Meridian Ave #100, Oklahoma City, OK 73134. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 405-752-9600 or visit our website at www.oklahomapaincenter.com. Our dedicated staff is ready to assist you on your path to improved quality of life through effective pain management.

column40:
Husband was a patient for 6+ years here until the new physician Dr. Holeman came in.  They had him on a regiment that was working and keeping his pain away, then they started not scheduling within time frame and he was going a day or two sometime without his medication being refilled.  Started to treat him as an addict.   He called them out on their mistakes several times, was treated as a hostile patient.  They changed up his medication without providing clear justification on why.  Got a letter that they discontinued his treatment and that he will have to find another physician.  I am sad that now my spouse is now going through major pain again until the new physician can find a better treatment option.  He's never abused the system never tested positive and has always been on time.   But when you have someone living with chronic pain 27/7 you can't fathom the burden they carry.  This is a disgrace of this practice!|Rude office staff, esp office manager. I never saw the physician who writes my pain med orders. Poor communication, poor eye contact  with a demeaning approach from the team. Uses pain med prescription as a weapon of power over patients. Absolutely Would not recommend.|Would not recommend to anyone. The office staff are very nice and helpful. My husband and I have been there for 3 years. We have had numerous issues.  I couldn't tell you what Dr Kelly looks like we only saw him once when we started there. Last month we saw Dr Holman who is the dr on our prescriptions. We saw her because our PA we normally see was on vacation.  Wait time can be extremely long to get back to see you PA. We never get our prescriptions on the day we go. It usually takes at least 1 day usually longer.  You can not speak with anyone one the phone. You have to use email which can take up to 2 days for a response. Would not recommend to anyone. Doesn't rate 1star.|The entire staff is great! You're greeted with bright smiles when you check in. The front desk ladies are awesome! PA Stacey was a Godsend and I was so sad to see her go. PA Jennifer has been amazing. So personable and caring. I don't know where I'd be without their support.|I just want to thank Mikala and Dr. Kelly for giving my cortisone injection yesterday! He is so gentle and caring which I appreciate so much; this morning I woke up with no pain and don't need my walker at all! Thank you soooo very much!|I had horrible pain in my lower back. Went to several different providers who all seemed to think i was a pill seeker. I just didnt want to be in pain any longer. I wanted to be able to live life, work, be a good wife and grandmother . I saw Dr Kelly and we started treatment. I have had ups and down with pain however for the most part. We have been able to keep pain at tolerable range.  The staff is amazing. Front desk are always pleasant and professional. My nurseTeresa and the PA  Courtney, take great care of me.
If you are in pain, I would highly recommend Oklahoma Pain Management|It used to be a very stellar place. Drs. were so empathetic and so helpful. They no longer get it. I asked to be taken off a medication that was causing me to pass out on the job and they refused. I would think and Dr would be very concerned! Instead my Dr argued with me and refused to change it to something that didnt have this side affect. Also it took my Dr here 3 yrs to notice multiple fractures on my lumbar spine.|Since I made the original review a year ago I thought I would update. I'm very disappointed. I decided to leave when I had so much trouble getting out to the clinic and it seemed no one there understood that. I had to reschedule a visit because my ride didn't show up. This was always very stressful. The clinic has a text set up where the doctor or nurse can reply to calls through text. Everyone knows you shouldn't discuss anything important over text. I told the nurse that I had to reschedule again and this was on a Wednesday and my appointment wasn't until Monday. She stated "oh you'll be just fine" when I told her I would run out of medication by Friday evening. I decided then that if I were going to run short even though I would be 30 days out on Friday, that I would detox from the opioid medication and be done with it. My last visit was with Dr. Kelly for an injection. It really helped! I was eager to see if they would continue to help me but after dealing with the nurse I was completely done with the clinic. It's a shame really because for the most part it was helpful. I just had a problem with sooner ride getting me there.

I absolutely love my doctors. My overall health is always important to them. I feel free to discuss anything at all with them. Dr. Jennifer is always friendly, supportive and ask about my whole family. I'm never over medicated. I have a better relationship with my family and friends because of my relationship with my doctor.

column2: Access Pain Solutions | Tulsa Pain Management Doctor
column3:
Access Pain Solutions serves Tulsa, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with compassionate, timely pain management services. Established in 2015 in response to the critical shortage of quality pain management providers in the Tulsa area, our practice was founded on the principle that patients shouldn't have to endure month-long waitlists while suffering from debilitating pain. We understand that every day spent in chronic pain feels like an eternity, which is why we've built our practice around scheduling flexibility and prompt care. Our dedicated team works diligently to ensure patients begin their journey to relief without unnecessary delays.

At Access Pain Solutions, our treatment philosophy centers on relieving pain through interventional therapy while minimizing medication dependence. Our board-certified pain management specialists develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. We combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to deliver effective, long-lasting relief for our patients.

Specialized Treatment Programs

We offer cutting-edge treatment programs for various pain conditions, including:

  • Chronic Pain Management - Comprehensive solutions for persistent pain conditions

  • Neuropathic Pain Therapy - Targeted treatments for nerve-related pain

  • Advanced Knee Pain Interventions - Non-surgical and minimally invasive options for knee pain relief

Visit Our Practice

Experience the difference of patient-centered pain management at our conveniently located Tulsa facility:

Address: 4750 S Garnett Rd, Tulsa, OK 74146, United States

Phone: +1 918-710-4112

Website: accesspainsolutions.com

Don't let pain control your life any longer. Contact Access Pain Solutions today to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your quality of life.
column11:
Access Pain Solutions was started in 2015 because there was a shortage of quality pain management options in the Tulsa area. Patients were being put on month long waitlist before they were able to be seen. Here at Access Pain Solutions, we know that everyday is excruciating when living with chronic pain. We pride ourselves on our scheduling flexibility. We promise to get our patients help quickly to start their path to relief.

Our goal in treating patients is to relieve pain through interventional therapy and to minimize the use of medications as much as possible. Access Pain Solutions offers cutting edge treatment programs for chronic pain, neuropathic pain and knee pain.

column3:
Advanced Pain of Tulsa serves patients throughout Tulsa, Oklahoma and the surrounding Northeast Oklahoma region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence. Since our founding, we have established ourselves as a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from persistent pain conditions that have not responded to conventional treatments.

At Advanced Pain of Tulsa, Dr. Lam Nguyen and Dr. Kenneth Reed bring decades of combined experience in pain management. Both physicians completed specialized fellowship training in interventional pain management techniques and stay current with the latest advancements in the field. Their comprehensive approach integrates minimally invasive procedures, targeted medication management, and rehabilitative strategies to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our practice offers a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and specialized nerve blocks. We treat conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and circumstances of individual patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. Our team takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals reclaim their lives from the limitations of chronic pain.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 918-901-9701. Our modern facility is conveniently located at 9320 S Mingo Rd, Tulsa, OK 74133. For more information about our services and to access patient resources, visit our website at www.advpn.com.

Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers serves Oklahoma City, OK and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Under the leadership of Dr. Blake Christensen, D.O., a double board-certified physician, our center has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking effective, personalized pain relief strategies. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge medical interventions with holistic therapies to treat not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of your discomfort.

At Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers, we offer a diverse range of treatment modalities tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our services include:

  • Advanced injection therapy

  • Customized pharmacologic treatments

  • Integrative chiropractic therapies

  • Traditional and modern acupuncture techniques

  • Therapeutic massage therapy

  • Supportive psychological counseling

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to patient care. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a treatment plan that aligns with your goals and lifestyle. Our team works collaboratively to ensure you receive the most effective combination of therapies for your specific pain condition, whether it stems from injury, surgery, chronic illness, or other causes.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 13601 Memorial Park Dr, Suite 200 in Oklahoma City, our modern facility is equipped with the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. The comfortable, welcoming environment we've created helps patients feel at ease throughout their treatment journey.

Contact Information

Experience the relief you deserve by contacting us today:

Phone: +1 405-751-0011

Address: 13601 Memorial Park Dr Suite 200, Oklahoma City, OK 73120, United States

Website: www.oklahomapaintreatmentcenters.com

Take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain. Schedule a consultation with Dr. Christensen and discover how our personalized approach can help you achieve lasting relief and improved quality of life.

My pain was intolerable before seeing him. He did injections in my lower back and a few months later and did an ablation.  He definitely is an answer to prayers!  Also, his staff is wonderful and caring|I was referred to Dr Christensen this past spring for pain management for an acute back compression fracture that happened last Dec.  He was able to provide me with immediate relief with steroid shots and nerve ablation on a subsequent visit.  His office helped process my approval for a back brace for support.  This has helped in my healing and I am able to do so much more than I was able to before the treatment.  Visited today for some lingering nerve issues with my feet and ankles today. Very impressed with the equipment and how it worked when doing my procedures.|I have been seeing Dr. Christensen for several years now due to extreme back pain including muscle spasms that used to freeze me up in the middle of bending over like I had been stabbed in the back! He lacks empathy or complete knowledge of patient history.. MONEY/INSURANCE COMPANIES and Google Reviews describes him..|Dr Christiansen has been working with me for several years, including injections, kyphoplasty, and a stimulator. column3:
James W. Stephens, DO serves Norman, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with exceptional interventional pain management services. Dr. Stephens brings his extensive expertise as a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain physician to patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. His practice focuses on minimally invasive treatments that maximize pain relief while minimizing recovery time, allowing patients to return to their daily activities with improved function and quality of life.

Dr. Stephens offers a comprehensive range of advanced interventional pain treatments, including:

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation - Innovative therapy for chronic back and limb pain

  • Kyphoplasty - Minimally invasive procedure for vertebral compression fractures

  • SI Joint Fusion - Effective treatment for sacroiliac joint dysfunction

  • Lumbar Spinal Stenosis Treatments - Advanced solutions for narrowing of the spinal canal

Professional Qualifications

As a board-certified specialist, Dr. Stephens combines his medical expertise with a patient-centered approach. His training in both anesthesiology and pain medicine allows him to develop customized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, focusing on long-term pain relief rather than temporary solutions.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 3411 W Rock Creek Rd, Suite 120, Norman, OK 73072, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. New patients are welcome to schedule a consultation to discuss personalized treatment options.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Stephens, please call +1 405-759-8407 or visit our website at www.jamesstephensdo.com for more information about our services and to access patient resources.
column11: Dr. Stephens is a board certified anesthesiologist and pain physician focusing on minimally invasive interventional pain treatments. He is skilled in advanced interventions such as spinal cord stimulation, kyphoplasty for the treatment of vertebral compression fractures, SI joint fusion, and the treatment of lumbar spinal stenosis.

At the helm of Interventional Pain Center is Dr. James Stephens, DO, an accomplished anesthesiologist and fellowship-trained interventional pain medicine physician. Recently, the practice welcomed Dr. Tyler Phillips, MD to the team, strengthening their shared mission of helping adults of all ages find relief from chronic pain conditions. Together, these specialists practice the full scope of interventional pain management with a focus on decreasing patient discomfort, improving bodily function and mobility, and ultimately helping patients reclaim their quality of life.

Advanced Treatment Approaches

The center distinguishes itself through the implementation of cutting-edge technologies and innovative procedures designed to address persistent pain issues. By utilizing the latest advancements in pain management, the physicians at Interventional Pain Center develop comprehensive treatment plans that target the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

The practice emphasizes creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard, respected, and actively involved in their treatment decisions. column2: Oklahoma Spine & Pain Management - Dr. Darryl Robinson, MD
column3:
Oklahoma Spine & Pain Management serves Oklahoma City, OK with comprehensive non-surgical pain solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Darryl Robinson, MD. Our specialized clinic focuses on helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions without resorting to expensive and invasive surgical procedures. With a patient-centered approach, we've established ourselves as leading pain management specialists in the Oklahoma City metropolitan area, offering hope and healing to those suffering from persistent pain conditions.

At OSPM, we provide a wide spectrum of advanced interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. Our services include diagnostic procedures such as discograms and diagnostic discography to accurately identify pain generators. For treatment, we offer various injection therapies including epidural injections, facet joint block injections, and fluoroscopy-guided injections for precise medication delivery. Patients suffering from specific conditions can benefit from our specialized treatments like occipital nerve blocks, nerve root blocks, and radiofrequency ablation which effectively interrupts pain signals.

Specialized Treatment Options

Our clinic excels in treating specific pain conditions with targeted approaches. For patients with lower back pain, we offer comprehensive evaluation and customized treatment plans. Those suffering from hip or knee pain can access specialized interventions designed to restore mobility and reduce discomfort. Our neuropathy clinic provides cutting-edge treatments for peripheral neuropathy, addressing the tingling, numbness, and pain associated with nerve damage. For patients with severe, intractable pain, we offer advanced options such as spinal cord stimulator implants that can provide significant relief when other treatments have failed.

Integrative Approach to Pain Management

Dr. Robinson and our team of highly skilled pain management doctors believe in an integrative approach that addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. We combine interventional procedures with comprehensive pain management strategies that may include physical therapy recommendations, medication management, and lifestyle modifications. This holistic approach helps patients achieve lasting relief and improved quality of life without dependency on surgical interventions or long-term opioid use.

Contact Information

If you're struggling with chronic pain and seeking effective, non-surgical solutions, contact Oklahoma Spine & Pain Management today to schedule a consultation. Our clinic is conveniently located at 3110 SW 89th St #102, Oklahoma City, OK 73159. You can reach us by phone at +1 405-703-4950 or visit our website at https://oklahomapaindoc.com/ for more information about our services and to request an appointment.
column11: Struggling with chronic pain? Dr. Darryl Robinson, MD - OSPM, offers non-surgical solutions for a pain-free life. Avoid expensive surgery with our pain management services. Our highly skilled pain management doctors in OKC provide pain management, integrative medicine, discogram, diagnostic discography, epidural injections, facet joint block injections, fluoroscopy-guided injections, occipital nerve block, nerve root block, radiofrequency ablation, sacroiliac block, spinal cord stimulator implant, stellate ganglion block, trigger point injections, hip pain treatment, neuropathy clinic, knee pain treatment, peripheral neuropathy treatment, lower back pain specialists, and more. Contact us for pain management in Oklahoma City!

Overall it was a good experience|I love Dr. Robinson he is so respectful and treats you right he finds the solution to help your pain. I also see Dustin and he is awesome too it's never a dull visit with him and he takes care of you as well. The staff and nurses everyone in the office are awesome and very professional. I have been with this clinic for a few years and don't plan to go anywhere else...|Dr. Robinson office has the best staff. They always have my paperwork up to date and they help me  with all of my questions. You get in to see the doctor really quick. I have never had any problems with this office. I would recommend and have recommend Dr. Robinson to family and friends.|I have been a patient of Dr. Darryl Robinson for over 15 years and I would recommend him to everyone needing professional care. He has made me feel safe and secure in all phases of my care. I am very happy he placed Dustin his PA to handle my needs also.  I would like also thank my primary care physician for turning me over to Dr. Robinson for my care.|I've been going to Dr. Robinson for over 10 years to manage severe lower back pain, sciatic pain, and arthritis in my hips. I usually see his PA for my appointments. During this time I have received multiple epidural injections along with other treatments and daily meditation. Some of the reasons i keep seeing Dr. Robinson and his staff is that, he respects my decision of not wanting surgery, the treatments he performs, he does so with a mild sedative to ensure that you are as comfortable as possible. Ive heard so many horror stories about other pain management Doctors not using pain relief during procedures. I can't imagine having to suffer through a procedure that is supposed to bring relief. It doesn't make sense to me.
Lately I've have been fortunate enough to be seeing his PA Dustin Brooks. I can't say enough good things about this guy. He really cares about the pain your in and recommends the best treatments to bring relief. Out of the last 3 PA's Dr. Johnson has had, I have to say that Dustin is the best! Presently he suggested a procedure that hasn't been done before. Now all of the treatments have brought some form of relief. Having said that , the last one, was a life changer. If you live in constant pain, then you know what I'm talking about. For the last few years I've been worried about possibly having to start using a wheelchair. But after the last treatment, I no longer worry about it. I can move and walk better than ever! He brought a level of pain relief I've never experienced before. He was able to pin point where the pain was originating from, and recommend the appropriate treatment. For the last two months I have been able to manage the pain with just the daily medication. It feels like a miracle. I haven't felt this good in the last 10 years! I feel like I owe him a debt of gratitude. I've even given up my cane!
My name is Jerry McKnight. If anyone wants to talk to me about a referral, or what to expect, please reach out. I know how hard it is to live in severe daily pain. It's not hopeless. There is help out there. As far as I'm concerned, this is the place to start. In all honesty, I wouldn't see anyone else. Dr Robinson and his staff are the best!
May you find relief and peace.|I have had nothing but a great experience at Dr. Robinson's office.  PA Dustin as well as Dr. Robinson himself have went above and beyond to find the right treatment to alleviate my chronic pain and get straight to the source of it. Very grateful for them all!|You will have to wait a very long time in his office to see him. Appointment time means nothing to him. This has happened every visit. I asked why it was running so late and was told "He doesn't show up everyday until around 9:45." I asked why there are 8:00 appointments then and was told- he is SUPPOSED to be here by then, but isn't.

column48: Does your office handle cases of pain due to muscular dystrophy?
column49: While we see chronic pain patients from all pathology, muscular dystrophy is rare and thus, patients with MD are not common to our practice and might better be served in an academic setting. The current best evidence for MD pain remains conservative and we'd be happy to discuss these details further if you feel it would be helpful.

column2: Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers - Blake Christensen, D.O.
column3:
Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers serves patients throughout Oklahoma City and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Blake Christensen, D.O., our centers have established a reputation for excellence in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our board-certified physician leads a dedicated staff committed to delivering personalized care that addresses the unique needs of each patient, focusing on improving quality of life through effective pain relief strategies.

At Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers, we embrace a holistic approach to pain management that combines traditional medical interventions with complementary therapies. Our full-service offerings include advanced injection therapy and carefully managed pharmacologic treatments tailored to each patient's specific condition. We also provide expert guidance in alternative approaches including chiropractic care, acupuncture, massage therapy, and psychological counseling to address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Our state-of-the-art diagnostic services allow us to accurately identify and treat various pain conditions affecting the:

• Spine: Neck, back, and lower back pain

• Joints: Hip, knee, and elbow discomfort

• Other areas: Comprehensive treatment for various joint and musculoskeletal pain

Serving Communities Across Oklahoma

While our primary clinic is located in Norman at 3101 W Tecumseh Rd, Suite 102, we proudly serve patients from across the state including Moore, Edmond, Norman, Shawnee, Yukon, and El Reno. Our central location makes quality pain management accessible to residents throughout the Oklahoma City metropolitan area.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit https://oklahomapaintreatmentcenters.com/ or call us at +1 405-751-0011.
column11:
Our Centers are dedicated to a holistic approach to pain management. The staff is committed to high quality of care guided by a board-certified physician. We offer full-service pain management services including injection therapy and pharmacologic therapies in the management of acute and chronic pain. The center provides guidance in chiropractic therapies, acupuncture, massage therapy, and psychological counseling.

Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers offer a range of state of the art diagnostic services and treatment for a variety of pain including in the neck, back, lower back, hips, elbows, knees and joints. We serve customers from across the state at our clinic in Oklahoma City, including in Moore, Edmond, Norman, Shawnee, Yukon & El Reno.

I have repeatedly tried to contact the doctors with questions but have not received any call backs. On one occasion, I called to confirm whether I should avoid taking a specific medication, only to receive incorrect information. After receiving an injection, I was left to walk out on my own and nearly fell, with the front desk staff being the only ones to assist, as the nurse had no time to help.

Additionally, I had planned for an injection based on the quoted price of $95. I took time off work, rearranged my family schedule, only to find out the day before that the actual cost was $390. I submitted a respectful complaint, expecting to be heard and treated with respect. However, instead of addressing the issue, the office canceled all of my upcoming appointments without informing me.

The level of professionalism shown by the staff is disappointing. I would advise others to seek a medical office that values patient care and communication.|Amazing Care from professional well educated on cutting edge technology for all your pain management needs. Then we make the drive again the next week and the desk lady now says we called and cancelled her appointment. Like, excuse me? What?! We didn't call and cancel the appointment. Then another rude lady walks up and tell us regardless my mom can't be seen  and has to make another appointment. The desk lady said she can get her in to be seen in 2 months. 2 months!!!! I came in today for an appointment expecting my $40 copay and was hit with $130 which I didn't have and told the dr refused to see me without payment in full. I only saw the dr once and he never even introduced himself, just came in did my injection and was done. I actually didn't even see him. Just heard his voice. I've spent at least $500 on visits to this clinic for what amounts to 4 weeks of medication, none of my concerns met, and worsened pain due to the injection I was given. column40:
Im 23 with an overwhelming amount of health issues. My mom has used wasif for years for pain management of the same conditions, so I got in as well.
He is very thorough with his assessments and has done more for me in the last few months than at least 10 other doctors have (not including ERs and urgent cares).

The only complaint I has, if it's even that. It he fills up quickly, so there tends to be a waiting period in his office.
But it's something that's easily disregarded when you're actually being helped.|Dr Wasif is an amazing doctor Who listens and truly cares about his patients.  I've been a patient of his for almost 9 years and I truly would not be able to live a pain-free life without him.|Update: Back in July of 2021 I started having increased pain in both my back and head. I also have a medtronic spinal cord stimulater in both my back and head. Anyway after many months of feeling like Dr.Wasif and his staff was listening but not hearing what I'm actually saying. Dr.Wasif saw me one last time in December told me he thought I should check myself into Laureate to get some "rest". When I told him no and thought I thought it was messed up that he was wanting me to do that because he couldn't figure out what's going was going on with me. I left the room and my fiance stayed. Dr.Wasif told my fiance that he was dismissing me as his patient he would send me a certified letter in the mail and if I wanted him to he would take out my back stimulater but that's all he would do for me now. Then a week later I got a call from his office saying we misunderstood him he just wants me to go to another doctor to try to help me. After that though I ran out of medication before i could get into to see another pain specialists and Dr. Wasif would not give me any refills. It was a disheartening ending. I remember when I first started seeing him I was crying and I said I need to know you believe me that I'm telling the truth I am in pain. He grabbed my hands looked me in my eyes and said I believe you that meant so much. Turns out the leads in my back stimulater had moved my medtronic representative informed me that Dr.Wasif knew this when he wanted me to commit myself to the mental hospital. I still don't know exactly why he did that or what was going on. Dr.Wasif never talked to me just his staff would. So if by chance you see this Dr.Wasif I followed you from where you last worked. You actually told me when I called you and came to my first appointment at your new office that I was actually was your very first patient there ever. How could you throw away one of your loyal patients for no reason I can see and leave me in horrible pain with no resources even to get help.

Dr.Wasif is one of the best doctors I've had treat me in a long time. He is though and always seems to have my best interest in mind. He also seems to be caring and sympathetic to what im going through which means alot to me because not all doctors I've had in the past have been. He generally seems to help me get better which is ultimately what I want too.|I am always looking at reviews when I get referred, well I researched my own pain doc opting out of the one I was originally referred to. The reviews led me to Dr. Wasif. I recommend him and his staff to anyone and everyone. He is such a great Dr. He listens and is very informative. If you are looking look no further, he's right here.|Dr. Wasif and his staff Amanda, Michelle, and all the ladies are truly amazing!!! Dr. Wasif is truly gifted, compassionate, and highly skilled his knowledge,and education is a WOW FACTOR!! He takes all the time you need, he educates his patients, and takes full and truly amazing care of his patients. I have travelled from Tennessee and Florida to see Dr. Wasif. I have never had a pain management doctor who is this talented and gifted and has an amazing bedside manner. He has done everything for me gone above and beyond when all other doctors don't give the time or care to do so. His staff stay on top of everything Amanda is so amazing if your having a bad or painful day just talking to her sure makes you feel better!!! I am extremely thankful that I am under his care!!! I've had injections, and surgery from Dr. Wasif and was the second person in the state to get the newest technology in having my spinal cord stimulator replaced thanks to Dr. Wasif and Abbott Labs.  Thank you Dr. Wasif, Amanda and all the staff for the best, most amazing and compassionate care you all truly touch people's lives and do your best to make it better!!!!|Dr .Wasif ,Michelle, Laura ,drew ,are excellent. Dr .wasif has Patiences & understanding and listens to his patiences. I recommend,Dr wasif to everyone.Thankyou very much for the differents  you have made in my life and alot of my life back without  as much as pain.5*****|I've been seeing Dr. Wassif for about 3 years. I've been to other doctors that deal with chronic incurable medical conditions. But no doctor has ever been so kind, considerate and professionally managed my condition. Thank you!|I was very happy with Dr Wasif & his staff initially. He was very professional and the steroid injections were helping. I was a candidate for a spinal cord stimulator so we were working toward that.
I was also having severe hip pains from a wreck I was in and he suggested we do a steroid injection there, as well. This was in Nov. Being tapped out monetarily, we agreed to wait until after the first of the year to do the procedure. In the first part of January I'm notified I have an appointment for my procedure which I didn't schedule and I couldn't yet afford. I asked them to not schedule for me like that anymore as that was the SECOND time and unprofessional. In February I called and, of course, they never answer their phone to make an appointment for the procedure and was told I needed to see him again to DISCUSS it. Discuss what? I said we had already discussed it and I just needed to know what I would be billed and want to have the procedure done. You have to pay at time of service, mind you. They never called back. He wanted TWO visits! Also, the time before, the IV cap came off and I started bleeding everywhere on their floor unknowingly and he was irritated with ME. The girls are nice but I don't know what happened with him! GREED and OVERBOOKING maybe? My other PM doctors of 5 years referred him to me so I'll let them know how he treats his patients.

column3:
Oklahoma Pain Physicians serves Norman, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our board-certified specialists combine advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently in Norman's medical district, our practice has been helping patients regain mobility and improve quality of life since 2010, with a focus on minimally invasive procedures and multidisciplinary approaches to pain relief.

At Oklahoma Pain Physicians, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, arthritis, and post-surgical pain. We pride ourselves on developing individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient while focusing on functional improvement and reduced dependence on opioid medications.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our practice philosophy centers on compassionate, evidence-based care. We take time to listen to our patients, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology, allowing us to provide the highest standard of care in a comfortable environment. New patients typically receive comprehensive evaluations within one week of contacting our office.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 405-310-2715 or visit our website at www.oklahomapaindocs.com. Our clinic is located at 1215 Crossroads Blvd STE 100, Norman, OK 73072. We accept most major insurance plans and offer convenient appointment scheduling Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

INTEGRIS Health Medical Group Pain Management Moore serves patients throughout Moore, Oklahoma with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located on the campus of Southwest Medical Center, our specialized clinic offers a patient-centered approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans to address the root causes of pain while minimizing reliance on medication.

At INTEGRIS Pain Management South, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes diagnostic evaluations, interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation therapies. We treat a wide range of conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our focus is to help you get in control of your pain, so you can get back to the things in life that matter most. We work closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that address their unique needs and goals. Our specialists take the time to listen, educate, and involve patients in their care decisions.

Convenient Location

Located at 1401 SW 34th St #200, Moore, OK 73160, our clinic provides a comfortable, accessible environment for patients throughout the region. We're proud to be part of the INTEGRIS Health network, offering coordinated care with other specialists when needed.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call +1 405-945-4359. Additional information about our practice and services can be found on our website at integrisok.com.

column2: Align Interventional Pain - Dr. Morgan Pollard ***New Location 1810 E Memorial***
column3:
Align Interventional Pain serves patients throughout Oklahoma City, Edmond, and Enid, OK with specialized pain management solutions focused on minimally invasive procedures. Under the expert direction of Dr. Emily Morgan Pollard, M.D., the practice has established itself as a leader in interventional pain medicine, offering alternatives to traditional pain medication. The team at Align has recently relocated their Oklahoma City office to a new, more accessible location at 1810 E. Memorial Road to better serve their growing patient base.

Dr. Morgan Pollard's approach centers on addressing pain at its source rather than simply masking symptoms with medication. As a board-certified interventional pain specialist, she performs precise, targeted procedures designed to provide lasting relief for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. These minimally invasive techniques can be performed in-office or at an outpatient surgery center, allowing patients to return to their daily activities with minimal downtime.

Services and Treatment Options

Align Interventional Pain offers comprehensive treatment plans that may include:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Peripheral nerve blocks

  • Joint injections

  • Regenerative medicine options

Convenient Locations

With offices in both Edmond and Enid, and their new main location at 1810 E. Memorial Road in Oklahoma City, Align Interventional Pain makes quality pain management accessible to patients throughout central and northern Oklahoma. The practice's modern facilities are equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure the highest standard of care.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, patients can visit alignpain.com or call 405-906-4020. Dr. Morgan Pollard and her team are committed to helping patients find relief and improve their quality of life through innovative, non-narcotic pain management solutions.
column11: ***We have recently moved: 1810 E. Memorial Road*** Align Interventional Pain is the procedural pain practice of Dr. Emily Morgan Pollard, M.D. She focuses on pain relief without pain pills - specializing in minimally invasive procedures in the office or surgery center to relieve pain. Align has offices in Edmond and Enid, OK

The Fraley Clinic serves Edmond, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with comprehensive mental health services. Established with a commitment to compassionate care, our clinic offers evidence-based treatment approaches for individuals facing a range of psychological challenges. Our team of licensed professionals works diligently to create personalized treatment plans that address each client's unique needs and goals.

At The Fraley Clinic, we provide a diverse array of therapeutic services including individual counseling, family therapy, and specialized treatment programs. Our practitioners are experienced in addressing anxiety, depression, trauma, relationship issues, and other mental health concerns. We believe in a holistic approach that considers all aspects of wellbeing—mental, emotional, and physical—to support lasting positive change.

Comfortable, Confidential Environment

Located at 925 W I-35 Frontage Rd, Suite 100 in Edmond, our clinic offers a welcoming space designed to put clients at ease from the moment they arrive. We understand that seeking mental health support can be challenging, which is why we've created an environment that prioritizes privacy, comfort, and respect.

Accessibility and Scheduling

We strive to make quality mental health care accessible to all who need it. New patients are welcome, and we offer flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy lifestyles. To book an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (405) 471-5460 or visit our website at http://thefraleyclinic.com/.

The Fraley Clinic is committed to supporting our community's mental health needs with professionalism, empathy, and evidence-based practices. We welcome the opportunity to be part of your journey toward improved wellbeing and mental health.

column40:
My grandma has been coming here on and off for years. Currently she's needing more help from pain and immediately they got her back in, got her injections and medication going and made sure she was taken care of.
I can't speak more highly of this place and the way they treat their patients. You're not just a number, you're not just a face... you're a human. A human they listen to closely and will do everything in their power to help.
I will always recommend this place to anyone needing pain management.|I can't say enough kind things about this wonderful place. I am still what I would consider a new patient, and we are still working through my best options, but I have never felt more listened to by a team of medical staff than I have at Fraley. Their front office staff is incredible, the nurses are competent and empathetic and Dana (PA) and Dr. Fraley are hands down the best of the best. Their bedside manner is unmatched, their compassion radiates from them, and they are just downright SO FUN, even in situations that are less than ideal (spinal injections). They took incredible care of me and I will never go anywhere else for management of my chronic pain. They WILL listen to you and you WILL get help. Love Fraley Clinic!|Dr. Fraley is the second pain management dr I have seen in the last few months and I can 100% say with confidence that I have found the best dr in the business. Not only her, but the entire staff! All of the nurses, PAs AND Dr. Fraley actually listen to me and my concerns. While my pain is not completely gone, Dr. Fraley takes the time to discuss options, next steps and pours over my issues with the greatest detail. She takes notes when I am talking and never once have I felt rushed through my appointment or pushed in to a treatment. I am so thankful I was referred to her and her clinic because they really go above and beyond compared to some other pain management places I have been. I can honestly feel the difference in care I receive here because everyone actually cares about me and getting me to a place where I can manage and eventually eliminate my back pain.|Dr. Fraley and her team are some of the kindest, most professional and empathetic people I've had the pleasure of working with. They take all the time I need to make sure all my questions are answered. Dr. Fraley is extremely kind and is happy to share her knowledge. She also has a lovely sense of humor that helped put me right at ease during my first injection. Kudos to the Fraley Clinic. Highly recommended!!|Dr. Fraley and her staff are so kind and professional. The ladies as I call them always make me feel so comfortable. They take such good care of you. I was very Leary about having shots in my neck and back. But they answered all my questions talked me through the whole process. I could not be happier with the outcome. NO MORE PAIN!! I am over the moon with the results. I thank everyone at the clinic for everything they have done for me.|Amazing experience!!! I was referred to the Fraley Clinic for back pain management and through discovery I was told I need a nerve ablation.... however I was never worried about the procedure because Dr. Fraley was so FANTASTIC at the previous procedures (she make them almost painless) that I KNEW this one would be a cakewalk.

Dr. Fraley and her staff are caring, friendly, and make you feel like an individual and not just another #,. I would recommend the Fraley Clinic to ANY AND EVERYONE having back pain or any type of pain management you will feel very at home there.|Dr Fraley and staff are very efficient and professional.  The atmosphere in the clinic is complimented by b he friendly personalities of the  staff

However what I appreciate the most is their innovative, modern approach to pain management.  Having moved to many locations and suffered from severe pain for many years I am very grateful to have been referred to the Fraley Clinical|Doctor Andrea Frayley and her staff are always there for me. They have always treated me with such a professional level that make my life better. They take care of my pain like no other Doctor had.

Pain Management of Oklahoma serves Broken Arrow, OK and surrounding areas with specialized pain management services designed to improve patients' quality of life. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals takes a comprehensive approach to pain relief, offering personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs. With years of experience in the field, we combine medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering from chronic pain conditions.

The mission of Pain Management of Oklahoma is to serve our patients with a patient-centered approach to the management of their pain medication. Our goal is to ensure your healthcare needs are met while your pain level is diminished, either through a referral to outside services or through the proper management of your pain medications. We want you to be celebrated, not tolerated!

Our Approach

"Our goal is to better the quality of life of our patients in a safe, responsible manner." We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop treatment strategies that work for your specific situation. Our team stays current with the latest advancements in pain management to provide you with the most effective options available.

Services We Offer

At Pain Management of Oklahoma, we provide comprehensive pain management services including medication management, interventional procedures, and coordinated care with other specialists when needed. We treat various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain related to injuries or surgeries.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 918-794-6008. We are conveniently located at 1751 N Aspen Ave, Broken Arrow, OK 74012. For additional information, visit our website at painmanagementofok.com.

column40:
My father has needed pain management services for years but has always been hesitant about seeing doctors unless absolutely necessary. Our experience with the Pain Management Clinic in Sand Springs was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming. The nurses were friendly and engaging, making us feel at ease right away.

The doctor's soft demeanor and ability to explain dad's options in a clear and approachable way made a huge difference for my father. He didn't feel overwhelmed or judged for the first time in a medical setting. Most importantly, he felt truly listened to.

Thank you!|I truly like the staff. Crystal, Dr. Adkins, Candy... But would love to leave a 1 STAR regarding communication. Phone calls ignored for days at a time when all you're asking for is a simple refill. And I never have abused or used drugs. I've been very patient and nice doing w out my 1 RX. But there's no sensible reason!|They explained everything where I understood what was going on, and they were very nice, fast, and efficient. The facility is very clean and friendly. Thank you for the wonderful job you all do! Just had my 2nd visit and everything went just as well as my 1st. Would recommend to anyone. 3rd shots done and again would recommend this place. Great people and they do a wonderful job. Thank you so much!|These are the stupidest people who work here. Doctors and nurses alike. One of the front desk ladies are nice. I was in a car wreck mid October and EVERY appointment there was multiple problems with my pain medication prescription and even after multiple calls trying to get the problem fixed THERE was still more on their end. Then my last appointment I said I would just need my last two weeks from that first month prescription to just be sent in and they sent in over 100 pills when my last two weeks prescription would have only been about 48. After that I just gave up. This has been every appointment to the point where there was a problem with me getting the medication I needed. I just give up and would rather be in serious pain and just be walking on my broken pelvis and ankle with the help of medication my primary care can give or Tylenol. The only plus to them is you can have your medical card with this pain management.|I've had shoulder pain for over 20 years show up today Dr had read all mri and xrays and was aware of my situation before coming into the room. Gave me comfort and satisfaction that they cared enough about my situation beforehand and explained everything thoroughly before any procedure. Awesome folks!! BZ!!!|I went to my first appointment and to say I am soooooo impressed with the whole experience. The receptionist, the MA, the Dr 5
I was frist with Samantha the MA and she was so nice. I felt immediately comfortable.  She then went and got Dr Brewer. We had honest, real conversations about my issues which are a lot! I felt super comfortable, seen, heard and genuinely feel like they want to help me. That's been a huge struggle for me to find. Seriously come here! This is coming from someone who's lived in pain for more than half of my life!|I had high hopes for this office however, I was under the impression that I was being seen for the pain that is associated with the autoimmune disease that I have. I developed myopathy due to the fact that my primary care physician has changed my medication more than once (I'm guessing or it could actually be the autoimmune disease) however, I was told that I'm being treated for the myopathy pain, which was diagnosed AFTER the referral to this office? So the ACTUAL cause of my pain was kind of dismissed (in my opinion) I was hospitalized for 4 days because I couldn't walk.... I was given high doses of steroids, high doses of pain medication, muscle relaxers, blood thinners, potassium, high blood pressure medication and a few others. I was sent home with the necessary medication that I would need. At my follow up appointment, I was given pain medication to help me with the pain and inflammation until I was seen in the office today, at my appointment, the doctor read some of the diagnosis, took my medication from 6 times per day down to 4 times per day, I also asked if he could send the same medication that my primary prescribed because it actually worked more than any, he said that he would. He didn't, he wrote the medication that is mixed with acetaminophen which is causing me to have liver problems. Not to mention the fact that I showed the doctor in my chart along with telling him that the previous prescription would be completed today, he wrote that I couldn't get my refill until next week. I couldn't get anyone on the phone so I had to drive 20 minutes back to the office to NO AVAIL.  I have a very low risk of opioid addiction however after being on opioids for weeks, I have a very high chance of having opioid withdrawal because everything I said went in one ear and out the other. Now I don't have a prescription that can be filled until next week on Tuesday,  I'm in pain. I'm very frustrated, I wish I could find a pain management doctor who knows about my autoimmune disease that will take my health care in consideration, where I will feel heard and understood. I'm going to do another review to update this process and what I'm going through. I pray this helps someone in the decision making process. If you're under 45 and not on life support or cancer, take your time to have a consultation first, I promise everytime I go to the doctor, it's like I'm being set back.|I have been a patient here for almost a year. I have an auto immune issue called MCAS and that causes broad and wide spread chronic pain from my immune system causing massive inflammation. I was treated very well at my first appointment and then was made to see the lower level practitioners because I'm only permitted to see a Dr. Henderson once a year. I had zero issues with pain medication refills until I came down with COVID in August. I had to cancel my appointment last minute so that I did not come in with active COVID infection. Since then I have been treated abhorrently by Amber and Randy. I am not longer called back and I'm no longer able to have my medications refilled on time. I have tried multiple times to have this issue resolved and have only been treated worse with every attempt I make. I would strongly suggest you go to a pain clinic where the staff members actually practice compassion and empathy. Amber the office manager is anything but compassionate and kind. I have requested a call back from my physician or his assistant which was promised, only to be called back by Amber when I did not want to speak with her further. She quoted policy regarding prescription fill's. Advised me that only a Doctor can write refills on my medication. I have spoken to my Pharmacist and confirmed that is NOT the case. He also stated that this office " has many complaint issues". Please consider another office when seeking compassionate care from the ENTIRE staff. Being a chronically ill patient is hard enough. Being treated like you are not a human being is completely uncalled for and just morally wrong.

column3:
Oklahoma Pain Physicians serves patients throughout Oklahoma City and Norman, Oklahoma with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Rafael Justiz and his dedicated team of specialists, this practice has established itself as a trusted resource for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Their fellowship-trained and board-certified interventional pain management specialists bring years of specialized expertise to every patient interaction, ensuring personalized care plans that address each individual's unique needs.

The team at Oklahoma Pain Physicians offers expert treatment for a wide range of pain-related disorders including:

- Back, neck, shoulder, spine, and hip pain

- Migraines and chronic daily headaches

- Vertebral fractures

- Arthritis

- Degenerative disc disease

- Spinal stenosis

- Bulging or herniated discs

- Various other pain syndromes

Advanced Treatment Options

Patients benefit from access to cutting-edge pain management techniques, including Botox® injections for migraine relief and other specialized interventional procedures. The practice combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

Convenient Locations

Oklahoma Pain Physicians maintains two convenient locations to serve patients throughout the region:

- Oklahoma City Office: 4117 NW 122nd St #C, Oklahoma City, OK 73142

- Norman Location: Serving patients in the Norman area

column2: Tyler R. Phillips, MD: Pain Medicine
column3:
Tyler R. Phillips, MD serves Norman, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Our practice focuses on providing comprehensive, minimally invasive solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system. Dr. Phillips combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life without relying solely on medication management.

At our Norman clinic, we offer a complete range of interventional procedures tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our evidence-based treatments include:

  • Spine and Joint Injections - Targeted medication delivery to reduce inflammation and pain

  • Radiofrequency Ablation - Advanced technique to disrupt pain signals from specific nerves

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation - Innovative therapy using electrical impulses to modify pain perception

  • Kyphoplasty - Minimally invasive procedure to treat vertebral compression fractures

  • Basivertebral Nerve Ablation - Cutting-edge treatment for chronic vertebrogenic low back pain

Our Approach to Pain Medicine

Dr. Phillips believes in developing individualized treatment plans that address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our practice combines diagnostic precision with therapeutic interventions to provide lasting relief. We work closely with referring physicians, physical therapists, and other specialists to ensure coordinated care for optimal outcomes.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 3411 W Rock Creek Rd, Suite 120, Norman, OK 73072, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. We welcome new patients and referrals from throughout the Oklahoma City metropolitan area.

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Phillips, please call +1 405-759-8407 or visit our website at www.jamesstephensdo.com. Our dedicated team is committed to helping you find relief from chronic pain and return to the activities you enjoy.
