column40:
I WILL ALWAYS RECOMMEND BOTH DR. STEPHENS & DR. PHILLIPS TO ALL MY PEOPLE & FRIENDS. BOTH ARE REALLY TERRIFIC , KNOWLEDGEABLE & CARING DOCTORS!

I don't often find the time to keep up with my joint & trigger point injections like I need to, so to say I was a bit nervous because I have been having just awful knee pain in my right knee due to a nasty fall on cement over a year back, was an understatement.
It used to hurt from the moment I stood up getting out of bed in the mornings until the moment I fell asleep when I'm lucky to be so worn out I physicallycanxt stay awake anymore. We know pain can keep you up... my knee had been bugging me this much pre- injection. No joke. So sore! This weather has had it flaring like crazy.

But finally I found the time and asked about possible catching up on a few bothersome areas with Doc Phillips.  As I have 2 wonky knees and a hip that has significant nerve impingement also. IT was quite a relief he could start that same appt! I felt like it was my lucky day! I Was able to have Doc. P do the first one in my "bad knee" at my normal appt that morning....NO SCHEDULE AND COME BACK SILLINESS, IT WAS JUST SURE, I CAN DO THE FIRST ONE RIGHT NOW! (THAT was A TOTAL BONUS AS I Don't Live too close to this office and I really appreciated how there was no issue with scheduling)
He just had a consent form, came in the room got his PPE, GOT THE INJECTION SITE STERILECWITH AN ALCOHOL PREP OADN HAD THE INJECTION REASY & BOOM! EASY PEASY! I CAN HONESTLY SAY I DID NOT FEEL A THING! He is Fantastic with his needle skills... He had the full length of the needle in my knee and I had zero clue he had even started my injection! I looked down & just noticed the injection syringe was actually fully in my knee! Zero pain! (I have had a few where the old practitioner had to "dig" around in there to find the right spot to place the medicine ) Sadly, those were quite uncomfortable & left me sore for a few days after.... NOT HERE! Only Relief!

I was impressed & just really thrilled!  By the time I was checked out & getting back into my vehicle, I was expecting that familiar old crunch & burn lifting my leg up to get in.... It was already gone! Like no pinch, no burn, zero discomfort from the actual injection & the 3" needle being in my knee not 5 mins before. It was JUST total relief! !!!
To me that is worth more than gold. The things we get used to with chronic pain are always there & we just deal with it at a level 3 on good days and the bad ones can feel like we get repeatedly bashed either with a very large sledge hammer, or it's a achey burning nightmare you can't function well with..  I'm used to that.

I am Not used to total relief! It is actually Amazing to Not have the constant pain anymore, since this last injection. I will sincerely tell you this:

Don't ever be nervous about injections with Doc Phillips! He is THE Best! I cannot wait for my next one, looking forward to this "problem hip" also feeling brand new!

>Great "Needle Work"  He Has the calmest & most pleasant bedside manner too. The doctors here are both truly great listeners & will do everything they can to help you understand the treatment plan. The physical processes and with them, the difference thatcstands out to me is that you do not feel rushed or like just another number in a chart. They actually wait to be sure that you are fully ccomfortable & ready to have a procedure done. Both Docs here have that down!

Thank you again!|Dr. Phillips is amazing! He really knows how to treat his patients. He's very knowledgeable. He knows what to look for and treats you very quickly. He spends time with you and listens to you. I trust him. He's an excellent doctor. I highly recommend him!|Dr. Phillips is wonderful!! He takes the time to listen to your concerns, answers questions and walk you through the process of the procedures you'll go through  helping you feel more comfortable. His staff is also very good! Kaylee and Megan were always very kind when I called and helped every way they could. I would recommend Dr. Phillips to anyone who needed pain management.|Amazing. And very good at listening and figuring out what is going on. Haven't been pain free since I was 15. But thanks to this man I felt the feeling of no pain at all. Life changing. Highly recommend to everyone|Dr. Phillips and staff are exceptionally attentive to you and your concerns. Dr. Phillips is a rare find these days. He sincerely cares about me,  he understands why I am experiencing the severe chronic pain and has the compassion to treat me and provide a better quality of life. I am blessed and would highly recommend  this practice to everyone that is living in severe chronic pain. Thank you to all at Interventional Pain Center.|Dr Phillips takes the time to really listen and understand your needs. He's very thorough in his explanation and care.  Very highly recommend him for pain management!|Dr. Phillips very good at what he does. He will listen to what you have to say and explain in detail. Very nice man. Fast and efficient. I recommend him|Dr. Phillips is a caring Doctor.  I'm a senior citizen & it's very nice to find a Doctor that cares about the older people also.  If anyone was in my situation I would definitely recommend Dr. Philip's to them.

SOS Spine & Pain Wellness Institute in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma provides comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Ryan Vincent. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating both chronic and acute pain conditions resulting from injuries and normal bodily wear and tear. With a patient-centered approach, we strive to deliver effective pain relief through minimally invasive techniques that promote optimal long-term outcomes.

Dr. Ryan Vincent, MD is double board certified in Pain Management and Anesthesiology, bringing exceptional qualifications to his practice at SOS Spine & Pain Wellness Institute. As a graduate of the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine, Dr. Vincent completed specialized training through a fellowship in Pain Medicine at the University of Toledo Medical Center and his residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Oklahoma Health Science Center.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At SOS Spine & Pain Wellness Institute, we believe in collaborative care. Dr. Vincent works closely with SOS doctors and other physicians to ensure comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. This multidisciplinary approach allows us to address various pain conditions effectively, from spinal disorders to joint pain and post-surgical discomfort.

Services Offered

Our practice encompasses a wide range of pain management solutions, including but not limited to interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative approaches. Dr. Vincent specializes in identifying the root causes of pain and developing targeted treatment strategies that minimize reliance on medications while maximizing functional improvement.

Phone: +1 405-619-4470

column11:
Ryan Vincent, MD is double board certified in Pain Management & Anesthesiology. His practice encompasses chronic and acute pain from injury and normal wear and tear on the body. His goals are to reduce pain in the least invasive manner possible, while providing the best long-term outcomes.

Dr. Vincent is a graduate of the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine. He performed a fellowship in Pain Medicine at the University of Toledo Medical Center, and performed his residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Oklahoma Health Science Center.

Dr. Vincent works in coordination with the SOS doctors and with many other physicians. He is always willing to collaborate on your care.

Sailesh Arulkumar, MD serves patients throughout the Oklahoma City metro and Shawnee, Oklahoma areas with exceptional pain management care. As a board-certified specialist in both anesthesiology and pain management, Dr. Arulkumar brings advanced expertise to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. His comprehensive approach combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

Dr. Arulkumar's practice focuses on two primary areas of expertise: general pain care and interventional pain management. This dual approach allows him to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions through both conservative treatments and advanced procedural interventions when necessary. Patients benefit from his thorough diagnostic process and commitment to finding the most effective, least invasive treatment options.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Each patient receives individualized attention with treatment plans that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Dr. Arulkumar specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 800 NW 9th St, Suite 201, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, Dr. Arulkumar's practice offers a central, accessible location for patients throughout the region. The office is equipped with modern facilities and staffed by a compassionate team dedicated to patient comfort and care.

Patient Information

New and returning patients can schedule appointments by calling (405) 231-2900. Dr. Arulkumar is affiliated with SSM Health, ensuring patients have access to a comprehensive healthcare network. column3:
Southern Oklahoma Pain Management serves patients throughout Ada and Ardmore, Oklahoma with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists has expanded services to Ada, complementing our established Ardmore location to better serve the Southern Oklahoma region. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we've developed a patient-centered approach that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain management.

At Southern Oklahoma Pain Management, we believe effective treatment begins with listening. Every patient journey starts with a thorough interview, comprehensive physical examination, and careful evaluation of radiographic imaging. This detailed assessment allows our specialists to understand the unique nature of your pain and develop targeted treatment strategies.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

Our multimodal treatment philosophy incorporates:

  • Medication management with responsible prescribing practices

  • Physical rehabilitation programs tailored to your specific needs

  • Psychological support to address the emotional aspects of chronic pain

  • Innovative interventional therapies using advanced techniques

Patient Education and Empowerment

We believe informed patients achieve better outcomes. Our team takes time to educate you about your condition, treatment options, and self-management strategies that can help you regain control over your life.

Your Recovery Starts Here

Don't let chronic pain define your life any longer. Our personally-tailored approach has helped countless patients throughout Southern Oklahoma reclaim their quality of life and return to activities they love.

Contact Information:

Phone: +1 580-221-2022

Address: 1414 Arlington St #2000, Ada, OK 74820, United States

Website: www.specialtyclinicok.com
column11:
Southern Oklahoma Pain Management is proud to now offer services to Ada in addition to Ardmore.
We believe in a personalized approach to patient care that begins with a thorough interview, examination, and evaluation of radiographic imaging. Responsible pain management includes empowering patients through education, providing safe and effective options, and incorporating a multimodal treatment plan utilizing medications, physical rehabilitation, psychological support, and innovative interventional therapy. This personally-tailored approach helps patients regain their quality of life lost to chronic pain and get back to doing what they love.
Your recovery starts here. Don't wait another day.

column40:
I was treated by Dr. Porter for a back injury 3 years ago.  I couldn't walk without holding onto my husband, my legs kept buckling, and constant pain 24/7.  Plus alot of pain and sleep meds. He gave me 2 steroid injections.  in my back.  Then the ablation!!! HALLELUJAH NO PAIN for almost a year.  Then 2nd ablation after that and no pain for longer this time.  Q|I have been seeing Dr Porter for about 4 years now and I am incredibly lucky to have found him! He always takes the time to discuss with me what we think will be best to reduce my pain. He has awesome bed side manner and truly cares about his patients! He takes the time to listen, discuss a plan and do what's best for me. Couldn't ask for a better dr!|Dr. Porter was great to work with for my husband's back pain. They got him in quickly, addressed his problems and was answering questions before we could ask them. His knowledge on what he does is impressive and appreciated. Highly recommend using this doctor.|Dr Porter is the best pain management Dr I have used, if you are hurting he is the place to go. If you want a caring, informative, very professional, to the point and not waste your time pain management Dr then this is the place to go. I see some people complaining about the pain of some of the shots he gives (which is very short term as well as expected of some shots, it's the nature of the treatment) but anyone like me laying around on a daily basis in severe pain know those shots are nothing compared to the amount of pain we deal with on a daily basis and totally worth it. He will not waste your time or money if he believes his treatment will not benefit you, he is down to earth and one of the biggest reasons of me not hating every moment of my life due to crippling pain. The office staff is nothing but the best, very polite, very attentive and always accommodating to my needs which are sometimes very high and they have not once hesitated to make my visits the best as possible. As for some of the comments below complaining it's a busy place of course it is! Anyone who uses Dr Porter doesn't want to use anyone but him because he is incredibly good at his job, definitely go here if you are in pain and need help you will not regret it.|If you are searching for a pain management doctor...  Hooray!  Your Search is over.

Dr. Justin Porter is a fantastic doctor.  I've had 3 back surgeries and could use a 4th to fuse the Si joint.  Dr. Porter and his magical epidurals allow me to keep walking, doing everyday activities, play with my grandkids and just have months without constant debilitating pain.  Dr. Porter has great bedside manner, he is one of two doctors I see that actually remember the last conversation we had, he is compassionate and he genuinely appears to care about your health and well-being.  Oh and every time I get an epidural I want to sing "Come on baby make it hurt so good".

The staff at Oklahoma Pain Management is amazing.  From the person who answers the phone to the person who assists in the area where you receive epidural.  Every single person I have encountered has friendly, respectful, cheerful and caring.   The best group of staff members I have encountered at a physicians offices.  There's always that one, but not here.

Like I said at the beginning of this review.... Hooray!  Your Search Is Over!

Thank you Dr Porter and Staff!|Wish NO star. I was referred by Dr. Boggs. I tried to make an appointment.  I called and left messages, twice, within a month. When I finally got a call back, I was told it would be another 2 weeks. When I tried to explain, the office lady was rude and hang up on me. So, I went to Dr. Lopez. He has an amazing staff and I was scheduled the day after my call.  I had a consult before my injections and he's very thorugh, I will gladly pay and refer him.|A semi turned in front of me causing me to hit him at 55 mph. Had lower back and neck injuries. Dr. Porter assessed injuries and started epidurals in both areas. Oral medications and the epidurals managed to get my pain levels down so I could function. Dr. Porter and his team did not quit until I was able to function with low to no pain in my daily life. They are awesome and really care for the patients. I would HIGHLY recommend Dr. Porter if pain limits your life and activities.|Was very skeptical at first about getting a shot in my back. I've heard stories from other people going to other doctors saying that the shot doesn't work and is a waist of time. I also heard that each doctor is different and some are better than others with the mix that they put in the shot, don't really know how true that is but made sense to me.
I feel lucky to have found Dr. Porter, the shot was amazing and worked really well. I barely even felt it. Went back a few weeks later for a follow up shot. I haven't slept this good in months, and recommend Dr. Porter whole heartedly.
Now it made my therapy with my other doctor much more productive and am I'm almost done with it. I'll start my own self therapy/exercise to keep it in shape, it's so much easier when it doesn't hurt.
So yes I give 5 stars, and if anyone is skeptical like I was, you'll never know until you Give it a Shot. It's worth a Shot lol.
Thanks Dr. Porter!

column3:
Dr. Andrea Fraley, M.D. serves Stillwater, Oklahoma with exceptional medical care focused on comprehensive pain management solutions. Her distinctive approach combines traditional medicine with physical therapy techniques to address the root causes of pain rather than just treating symptoms. As a board-certified physician, Dr. Fraley brings a unique perspective to her practice, drawing from her background as a collegiate athlete who competed on full scholarships in both tennis and basketball. This personal experience with sports-related injuries and rehabilitation informs her patient-centered methodology, allowing her to connect with patients on a deeper level about their pain management journey.

Dr. Fraley's practice stands out for its integration of medical interventions with targeted physical therapy protocols. Her comprehensive evaluations consider the whole person—examining biomechanics, lifestyle factors, and underlying conditions that contribute to pain. This multidisciplinary approach enables more effective treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term functional improvement. Patients appreciate her thoughtful consideration of non-pharmaceutical options alongside traditional medical treatments when appropriate.

Athletic Background Informing Medical Practice

Having experienced the demands of high-level athletics firsthand, Dr. Fraley possesses an intimate understanding of how injuries affect both physical performance and quality of life. Her personal journey through sports medicine as an athlete provides valuable insights that benefit her patients, particularly those dealing with sports-related injuries or chronic pain conditions that impact mobility and activity levels. This perspective allows her to develop realistic rehabilitation goals and timelines that acknowledge both the physical and psychological aspects of recovery.

Practice Information

Dr. Andrea Fraley welcomes new patients at her Stillwater Medical office located at 1301 W 6th Ave, Suite 201, Stillwater, OK 74074. To schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 405-829-6452. Her comprehensive approach to pain management has made her a valued healthcare provider in the Stillwater community. For more information about Dr. Fraley's credentials and services, visit her provider profile at [Stillwater Medical](https://www.stillwater-medical.org/providers/andrea-fraley/?utmsource=GMBSocialClimb&utmmedium=Dr.AndreaFraley%2CM.D.).
column11: Dr. Fraley's passion for medicine has a holistic approach. She combines medicine with physical therapy to pinpoint and manage her patient's pain management needs. As an avid lover of sports and an athlete herself, Dr. Fraley understands the importance of physical therapy and pain management. She attended college with full athletic scholarships for tennis and basketball.

column40:
The nurse at the front was always helpful and nice, even after one visit she recognized me and remember with every visit.

The establishment is easy to fine, inside is easy to maneuver, but it's not like any other clinic I've been too. Looks pretty down graded with the equipment they have when it comes to bigger establishments but they do with what they have.

I didn't appreciate my last visit because it too way too long for me just to get sent to the back room to prepare. They had a new Trainee check me in and get me settled she looked lost and kept forgetting things she need me to do or have. Then once onto the operating room, she failed 3x getting to stick an IV lock on my hand while the gentleman RN/CNA cleaned me up and got me with the first stick as if he ABSOLUTELY knew what he was doing. A hour appointment became a 4 hour waiting period.

Just like now, I'm here for a MRI scan follow up, but no notes were direct or reports and instructions were given from this Medical Clinic to my PCM to which scans I need or what they wanted directly. I had to see if my reports were in my medical reports and send them a copy instead of working together.

Now, once again I'm sitting here hoping this was just a quick 45-1 hour follow up appointment to discuss what needed procedures or process for the future. But I have to reschedule because I know I'm going to be here more than 3 hrs again if I don't.

I believe this clinic double even triple stacks appointments which causes these very long waits. But once you get what you're here for it goes quick, but the wait is annoying.|I've been meaning to write a review for Dr. Shadid, for a while now. I really like the Dr. and his team. Dr. Shadid is kind and compassionate. Earlier today I had a CERVICAL RADIQEREQUENGX NEUROTOMY. As with previous procedures there were no complications. He will routinely ask how you are doing during the procedure.
My quality of life has drastically improved over the last two years. We cannot stop the aging process, but with a good Doctor it's much more bearable|Been trying to get my wife in for 6 months they won't send a fax and won't see her without records the clinic I called and said they never received the fax to send the records to the clinic that needs it they won't talk to each other so we're sitting here still mated for 6 months and no one will do anything but look at each other like they're stupid|I've seen so many neuro and orthopedic surgeons in my day and Dr. Shadid outshines them all! What a miracle worker this man has been to me and my family.  He's thorough, caring, and really took his time to understand my medical history.  What a blessing he is!!|Dr.Shadid was amazing we've waited 4 years with my husbands back injury in the military to finally be validated with his pain. He took his pain seriously and his scans were looked at in depth would recommend him to everyone|The staff are a blissful bunch. Loved interacting with them. Unfortunately, the PA and the doctor wasn't communicating very well and I ended being so confused that I didn't know nor remember if I was getting steroids or whatever else he was shooting in me. I didn't appreciate being treated like some stupid nobody or like a guinea pig. When the PA and I would talk after each appointment, we came up with a game plan but I guess she neglected to informed the. Doctor and he blamed me and said I was lying when I tried to explain what works best for me. He refused to do what I was supposing and did what he wanted. He yelled at me for trying to explain what the PA and I decided. How can you treat someone in chronic pain like they don't know anything about their own body. It's sad really,  before Covid he was quite pleasant.|The work and the care is exemplary! The staff is very caring and helpful! Dr. Shadid and the work he does is amazing. He explained everything to me with care and compassion. I could barely walk at best due to the pain level in my back and legs. He was able to give me back my life. I am walking without a cane and can ride my motorcycle again. Thanks for giving me back my quality of life!|I've been a patient with Dr Edward Shadid and Spine & Pain Care of Oklahoma since 2013.

First off, the highly exceptional supporting staff under his tutelage is absolutely fantastic. They work in sync with Dr Shadid, to ensure that each patient feels comfortable, and an important priority that's seeking medical advice and technical expertise in the field of professionaly managed pain management services rendered.

Dr. Edward Shadid is more than capable of providing excellent insight into pain causation, suggests available treatment avenues to approach, in order to pinpoint targeted feasible solutions to help his patients achieve measurable results that dismantle, and in some cases eliminate the pain issues that have impacted his patients lives.

I've unfortunately endured a series of significant injuries over the course of my 20+ years of service rendered in the military that requires an in depth and ongoing effort to help me manage my continuous pain levels to within tolerable parameters, and Dr Shadid does an excellent job of providing tremendous and lasting relief for my complex pain issues.

I thoroughly enjoy visiting his office, and interacting with him and his beloved staff. They've always been extremely helpful, genuinely friendly and caring, accommodating of my variations of schedule, proactive, professional at every level from the welcoming greetings received to each heartfelt farewell.

The local Lawton office, which Dr. Shadid and his support team travels to from Oklahoma City, offers a plethora of pain solutions. And unlike a number of other professionals in this field of practice, Dr. Shadid even offers treatment services on Saturdays, to assist his patients that might not be able to benefit from his rendered services during the regular work week.

I am overwhelmingly pleased with the high quality medical care provided by Dr Edward Shadid and the phenomenal staff of Spine & Pain Care of Oklahoma, that has designed and administered a wonderful medical environment that is designed around the mantra of helping you live your best life, through well managed oversight, assessment and exceptional excellence in execution of their highly valued medical services.

Advanced Pain Management of Oklahoma serves Oklahoma City, OK and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team understands that pain can consume your life, creating debilitating conditions that prevent you from enjoying everyday activities and causing unnecessary stress. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Nelson, we specialize in identifying and treating the root causes of various pain conditions rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Advanced Pain Management, we offer a diverse range of treatment options tailored to your specific needs. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Pump implants for controlled medication delivery

  • Trigger point injections for muscle pain relief

  • Epidural injections for spinal-related pain

  • Hormone therapy for pain management

  • Medical branch blocks for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes

  • Specialized nerve pain management protocols

  • Customized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions

Our Approach to Pain Management

What sets us apart is our commitment to finding alternatives to lifelong medication dependence. Dr. Nelson and our team leverage ongoing education and training to provide patients with multiple treatment pathways. Whether you're suffering from chronic pain, experiencing post-operative complications, or dealing with non-operative issues, we work diligently to develop personalized care plans that address your specific pain challenges.

Visit Our Oklahoma City Location

Ready to take control of your pain? Contact us today to schedule a consultation and discover how we can help you reclaim your quality of life.

Address: 5252 N Meridian Ave #101, Oklahoma City, OK 73112, United States

Phone: +1 405-702-8623
column11:
Pain can consume your life. It can be debilitating, a source of stress, and can prevent you from doing the things you love the most. Whether you're dealing with chronic pain, post-op complications, or non-operative issues, Dr. Nelson and the team will work to uncover the root cause of your pain and provide you with an appropriate treatment pathway. We'll use our expertise and ongoing education and training to give you options and avoid the use of ongoing or lifelong medication.

Advanced Pain Management offers pain management services that includes pump implants, trigger point injections, epidural injections, hormone therapy for pain, medical branch blocks, nerve pain management, and many more!

This individual would understand via non existence  osteoarthritis in the cervical spine in 2018 to full blown with 5 moderate herniated disc. I didn't research him prior to moving across country while providing my medical records to his facility which staff sat on i know I have a wonder relationship with my previous provider. Atrophy after 2 years of outer symptoms those out ward symptoms won't be noticeable its why you have to go into the internal medical records. Yet individuals like me its very dangerous to even consider using, from being in a coma to server toxicity to liver. My previous provider said don't you dare use it, because the moment you agree to you free that MD from any liabilities. column3:
OU Health Physicians - Pain Medicine Clinic in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the greater Oklahoma City metropolitan area. Our specialized team of board-certified pain medicine physicians combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Located in the heart of the OU Health Sciences Center campus, our clinic serves as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain that affects their quality of life.

At OU Health Physicians - Pain Medicine Clinic, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and psychological support. Our specialists are trained to treat a wide range of conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, with a focus on improving function and reducing reliance on opioid medications when possible.

Advanced Diagnostic and Treatment Options

Our clinic utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and treatment modalities including fluoroscopy-guided injections, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and ultrasound-guided procedures. As part of Oklahoma's leading academic health system, our physicians have access to the latest research and technologies in pain medicine, ensuring patients receive the most current and effective treatments available.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our team works closely with each individual to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and social impacts. New patients can expect a thorough evaluation and collaborative discussion about treatment options during their first visit.

Contact Information and Location

The OU Health Physicians - Pain Medicine Clinic is conveniently located at 825 NE 10th St #2b, Oklahoma City, OK 73104. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call +1 405-271-7255. Additional information about our practice, including physician profiles and accepted insurance plans, can be found on our website at https://www.ouhealth.com/find-a-location/ou-health-physicians-pain-medicine/.

Located in the heart of Oklahoma City, this premier pain management center takes a comprehensive approach to treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures. At Southwest Spine, Pain & Wellness Institute, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach that combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with holistic care strategies. The institute specializes in treating a wide range of conditions, from chronic neck and back pain to complex neurological disorders. Their goal is to restore functionality and help patients reclaim their lives through advanced procedures that offer relief without extensive recovery periods.

Minimally Invasive Treatment Options

The institute's treatment philosophy centers on providing near-instant relief through minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source. These specialized interventions often allow patients to avoid the burden of chronic medication use and the complications associated with major surgical procedures. Each treatment plan is carefully tailored to address the unique needs and circumstances of individual patients.

Expert Care Team

The medical professionals at Southwest Spine, Pain & Wellness Institute combine years of specialized training with a compassionate approach to patient care. Shadid, our clinic specializes in diagnosing and treating a wide range of acute and chronic pain conditions affecting the spine and musculoskeletal system. They are amazing! They are organized and very caring.  Dr. Meta is a great listener and makes good suggestions for what may work best for your body. Please remember no two people will respond the same to some treatments.

Dr. Meta also reviews your situation with you with X-rays and bone models when necessary to help you better understand your situation. If you will monitor and journal your aches and pains along with what you're doing to your body daily it can help the doctor better assess what your body is going through and make you good recommendations. Plan ahead and do what he tells you to do. It is a busy place for good reasons but you must schedule with them and keep real good notes in my opinion. Love this place and the staff and Dr. Meta.

column40:
I've had the best results from this clinic. From the time i walk in until I leave. Dr. Revelis has given me injections. It wasn't painful. He seems to understand and care about your problem and getting solutions. I lucked out with him, in my opinion. The staff is great and friendly, from check in staff to nurses. I highly recommend this clinic.

They also update "my chart" immediately. It's so convenient.|I have been receiving care from Dr. Traci White for approximately 5 years.  She has been attentive, communicative, listened to my concerns, and offered me different options for dealing with chronic back and leg pain. I also regularly see Kendra Hurst, P.A. and have found her to be caring and genuinely interested in my well being.  If I have a question or concern that I send to either of these caretakers via My Chart, I generally receive a very quick response. I am overall VERY pleased with the care I receive, and highly recommend Dr. White and Kendra Hurst to anyone who is suffering from chronic pain.|I've been going to PMT over 15 years under the care of Dr. Scott Anthony. Trust me, I wouldn't of been going there this long had I not trusted, respected & was totally comfortable with him. He's always done everything he could to be sure I was comfortable. I've had 3 back surgeries, a plate in my neck & both hips replaced. I've had some bad times, not his fault, was because his has were tied with the new laws that have come out. He continued to do as much as he could for me. If you want a 'pill pusher', go somewhere else. He is kind, compassionate & spends time with you until all your problems & questions have been addressed. You don't feel like just a number, in & out as fast as they can. You are in really good hands with him!  All of the office staff, PA, Scheduling  & nurses are all very nice & pleasant.|I absolutely love Pain management of Tulsa. Dr Traci White is a caring, excellent Doctor. She always spends quality time with me. She is concerned with my well being and I just love her. Her nurse is professional and sweet. And the staff are all caring, professional and concerned. I had a nice conversation with the lady that checked me in and also the gal that made my next appointment. Both were delightful. I highly recommend this facility|Dr Anthony was a compassionate Dr that treated his patients as individuals and NOT just a number $$$ walking through the door. Since his retirement this place has gone way down hill.  The way Dr Franklin is not willing to work with patients with the treatment plan they were on with Dr Anthony is cold and uncaring.  I was taking certain meds that I had been on and were working effectively at keeping me an active person with the least pain possible. Dr Franklin basically said everything Dr Anthony was doing was wrong and was treating the wrong issues.  This is absolutely false and just a ploy to do more injections which are not even approved by the FDA and will in the long wrong cause more harm than good. Healthcare in this country and government bureaucracy is making people feel devalued, causing more harm and effectively reducing quality of life.
Good job PMOT, Dr Franklin and Dr White for putting the government and money over patients you swore to do no harm.|This place has the best doctors and the nurses that bring you out are phenomenal but the nurse that checks you in and gets iv ready needs to go... she is sooooo rude to the patients and NOT friendly at all.... This place could really be 5 stars if not for her|The nurse was fantastic! Tracy White was not even cordial.  She walked in, didn't even introduce herself. I paid $45 copay to have a nice conversation with the nurse. White stated I needed a MRI of each before she could discuss anything! I was amazed that she wasn't going to discuss PT, TENS unit, an injection...NO! When I asked why I paid $45 to not do anything, she said she would call me with my test results rather than have me come in & pay again...WOW, thank you soooooo much for your help!!!! You are fired|I have been seeing Dr.Anthony going on 16 years... Trust me when I say he is a caring companionate Physician. never did I feel he was just a pill writer. Excellent bed side manner.     if your suffering from chronic pain he will suggest multiple options.

Note: I have research The opioid issue to death, May I suggest you do too. Pain Doctors are having to Re learn there craft. The DEA among other agencies absolutely are the ones restricting prescription! After all my years with him I assure you he will do everything in his power to keep you as comfortable as he can.

He is a Great Doctor, a Good Man, and does care! He has my respect and I have faith in him. Just like you will if you see him.
The staff, and Nurses are Top Notch, every single one!!!

Never rush you, take time and really do what they can to help you live a more pain free life. They recently put a spinal chord stimulator in my husbands back (trial one) and Paige the medtronics rep even called to check on him everyday during the trial. Allysia is awesome and has the best sense of humor, she does anything she can to make you feel welcome and comfortable. The stimulator has helped my husband so much and has truly been a blessing when it comes to pain relief for him. We can not wait to get the permanent one installed!!!! After seeing him for a few months my pain is manageable enough to where I can live life and get out again. The best part about dealing with Memorial Pain Clinic and Dr. Folk in particular is no bs and he will get down to your root issue and find a solution. They also offer flexibility for patients such as allowing me to do a virtual visit when the roads were covered in snow/ice a few weeks ago. Neuro Pain Care serves Edmond, OK and the greater Oklahoma City metropolitan area with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently at 1417 NW 150th St in Edmond, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those seeking effective pain management strategies tailored to their unique needs.

Our Comprehensive Services

At Neuro Pain Care, we offer a wide range of treatments addressing various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modification guidance to create personalized treatment plans for each patient.

Expert Medical Team

Our physicians bring extensive training and experience in pain medicine, neurology, and rehabilitation. The team stays current with the latest advancements in pain management to provide evidence-based care that addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of chronic pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Red River Medical Services in Lawton, Oklahoma serves the community with specialized interventional pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. David Hanley and Noelle Hanley, NP-C. As dedicated owners, they have established a medical practice focused on addressing chronic pain through scientific, evidence-based approaches. Their comprehensive care model emphasizes minimally invasive techniques designed to interrupt pain signal transmission, offering patients effective alternatives to traditional surgical interventions.

At Red River Medical Services, the clinical team specializes in interventional procedures that target the root causes of pain. By utilizing advanced diagnostic methods and treatment protocols, they work to identify specific pain generators and develop customized treatment plans. Their scientific approach combines multiple modalities to effectively disrupt pain signals traveling from nerves to the brain, resulting in significant pain reduction and improved functionality for patients suffering from chronic conditions.

Services and Patient Experience

Patients benefit from a range of minimally invasive procedures performed in a comfortable, professional setting. The practice prioritizes patient education, ensuring individuals understand their treatment options and expected outcomes. By focusing on less invasive techniques, Red River Medical Services helps patients experience shorter recovery times and fewer complications compared to traditional surgical approaches, while still achieving meaningful pain relief and enhanced quality of life.

Location and Contact Information

Red River Medical Services welcomes patients at their conveniently located office at 4411 W Gore Blvd, Suite A2, Lawton, OK 73505. For consultations or to learn more about their interventional pain management services, patients can call +1 580-699-8383 or visit their website at http://redrivermedicalservices.com/ to schedule an appointment with Dr. Hanley or Noelle Hanley, NP-C.
column11: Doctor David Hanley and Noelle Hanley NP-C, owners of Red River Medical Services, pride themselves in excellent care for Interventional Pain Management. Interventional Pain Management focuses on relieving pain and improving quality of life. These goals are achieved through applying multiple modalities of minimally invasive and non-surgical procedures to disrupt the transmission of pain signals from nerves to the brain. In doing so, the procedures are less invasive. They also focus on a more scientific approach to addressing pain and management techniques.

I come to the clinic monthly. I have always been treated with dignity and respect. Ashley is absolutely wonderful! She is kind and respectful. She truly cares about her patients. She takes the time she needs to ask me questions and does not rush me when I answer her. She truly makes me feel like they care about me and my issues! Dr. Lovell is a fantastic physician! He speaks to me with care and compassion. He listens to my concerns and always takes my thoughts into consideration. He never rushes me or makes me feel like he doesn't care! Thank you all So much for taking such great care of me! 10/10 I definitely recommend this clinic for all your pain management needs!|I have been a patient here since Dr B was around. He was compassionate and kind. He was one of few drs that actually had knowledge about my complex, rare syndrome. It was awful when he passed.
The Dr that took is place, Dr Lovell, is great.
He takes time to talk to me about all my concerns during my appointment. He makes sure that I stay on a medication that meets my needs, the lowest dose possible while treating my severe pain issues. I have an autistic child and I need something that won't make me drowsy or feel off in any way, i need to be at my best 24/7.
His staff are awesome, I'm always happy to see Ashley and the girl who does the UA cups (I'm bad with names). The other nurse, the guy, is always friendly and nice to talk to.
As I can tell, they follow all the rules and procedures and that makes me feel secure in my choice for a pain management dr, as others have been closed in the past.
When I call they always answer my questions about insurance or refills or whatever they may be.
They also allow me to bring my son which Dr Bs staff did not. I am grateful for that.|**only 5 stars so everyone can see this brutally honest review. Sounds like a certain office must be getting some medical kickbacks. Even when I was promised by the office manager that something would change- nothing changed at all. Fully incompetent- I would rather be in agony every day  than ever get put on the back burner  by this doctor again.|I've been a patient here for a few years now and I can't say enough good things about it. Highly recommend Dr.Alhaj for your pain management needs.|I have been with Dr Alhaj for 16 years. Before being referred to Dr Alhaj by VAFB I was in so much pain i tried suicide. After meeting and working with Dr Alhaj he got me loving life. He has a wonderful bedside manner, he doesn't rush you through like your just a number. I've personally seen him refuse patients that come into the office and start asking for pain medications. But after a thorough exam, working with other doctors, ex. Counseling and family practitioner and any other doctors. Then you have to agree to the state and his rules and must comply with a drug test. Oklahoma Spine Hospital in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Nathan Overbey, MD. Our state-of-the-art facility specializes in interventional pain management techniques designed to address chronic pain conditions and improve patients' quality of life. Located conveniently at 14100 Parkway Commons Dr #201, we serve patients throughout the Oklahoma City metropolitan area with compassionate, evidence-based care tailored to each individual's needs.

Dr. Overbey brings exceptional credentials and specialized training to his practice at Oklahoma Spine Hospital. With deep Oklahoma roots, he completed his undergraduate education at the University of Oklahoma in Norman before earning his medical degree from the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine in Oklahoma City. His commitment to excellence continued through his Anesthesiology residency at the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center, followed by specialized fellowship training in Interventional Pain Management at University of Oklahoma Hospital.

Credentials and Expertise

As a testament to his dedication to the highest standards of medical care, Dr. Overbey maintains dual board certifications from the American Board of Anesthesiology in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine. This specialized training enables him to offer comprehensive pain management solutions that address the root causes of discomfort while minimizing reliance on medication alone.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Oklahoma Spine Hospital, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain function and improve their daily living. Dr. Overbey's association with Oklahoma Spine Hospital ensures patients receive care within a specialized facility dedicated to spinal health and pain management.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Overbey or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 405-749-2765. Our office is conveniently located at 14100 Parkway Commons Dr #201, Oklahoma City, OK 73134. For additional information about our facility and services, visit our website at www.oklahomaspine.com.

Nevinson Sam, D.O. serves Oklahoma City, OK and surrounding communities as a Board Certified Interventional Pain Management Specialist dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. Sam combines advanced interventional techniques with comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each individual's unique needs. His practice focuses on identifying the root causes of pain while developing minimally invasive solutions that improve quality of life and restore functionality.

At his practice located at 10001 S Western Ave in Oklahoma City, Dr. Sam offers a wide range of interventional procedures designed to address various pain conditions. His expertise includes treatment for back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Dr. Sam's approach emphasizes evidence-based treatments that minimize medication dependence while maximizing pain relief through targeted interventions.

Comprehensive Patient Care

Dr. Sam's philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Each treatment plan begins with a thorough evaluation to understand the patient's medical history, pain patterns, and lifestyle factors. This comprehensive assessment allows him to develop personalized strategies that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and appropriate medication management when necessary.

Professional Credentials

As a Board Certified specialist in Interventional Pain Management, Dr. Nevinson Sam has completed extensive training beyond his Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine degree. His osteopathic background provides him with additional insights into the musculoskeletal system and how it relates to pain conditions. Patients benefit from his specialized knowledge and commitment to staying current with the latest advances in pain management techniques.

For consultations or to schedule an appointment, patients can contact Dr. Sam's office at +1 405-286-2725 or visit the OSSO Network website at https://ossonetwork.com/specialities/pain-management/nevin-sam-do for more information about available services and treatment options.

column38: Wanda Price|Cory Wells|Laura Williams|Antonio Singleton|Jeff Ward|Debbie Schweickart|Kelli Godfrey|Mollie Stavros
column40:
Integris North Community Hospital is a pretty good place to be treated. They hire exceptional Doctors as Dr Nevinson Sam is a great Doctor who has empathy and very much cares for his patients. Dr. Sam has been my Dr almost 5 years now and I couldn't ask for a better Doctor than him. At least he listens to you and lets you have a part in your plan of care . If anyone wants a great pain Doctor that cares you need Dr Sam. I wouldn't give him up for any other Dr. That's for sure|At first they did great, took care of my shoulder and everything was going smoothly. When it came to my back well that was a completely different story.

First he wanted me to pay $900 to do an mri at his hospital but my insurance covered 100% of my mri at a free standing clinic. He told me, "oh those free standing mri images are blurry". That was a lie because I spoke with both my insurance company and the mri staff and they said it's the exact same machine.

Then, after my mri I didn't hear anything back from him for almost a month,  my rheynauds dr asked me about it and I told her I haven't heard anything about it,  so she calls and WALA you guys call me back that same day.

Finally the best part, you guys call and tell me my insurance approved it and that you want to schedule me for injections at that hospital. I'm sure I'm not your first patient and I'm sure you knew this was going to happen but you didn't even question it or mention that just 4 days before my scheduled appointment the hospital calls and tells me I have to pay $7,511 by Monday.

After I already requested the day off work, so did my driver, now we both wasted a sick day from work because I can't come up with $7,511 in 4 days. You knew what insurance I have, I'm sure you knew that was going to be an issue, but rather than telling me that you went ahead and scheduled my appointment and wasted my time along with getting my hopes up of finally being out of pain.

I felt like you're just trying to keep your hospital afloat by doing everything there and telling people that they have to pay for everything done there rather than using what their insurance covers. Sorry but nobody has $7,511 to drop in a 4 days notice, or even $900 especially when it's covered 100% by insurance.

The very next clinic I called even said that was ridiculous and that they would make sure that my insurance covers EVERYTHING  before scheduling an appointment especially one that requires me having to get a driver to take me home.|Dr Sam has showed so much concern for me since the first day I walked into his office for a consultation 2 months ago. I was going in to see what he thought he might be able to do for some neck pain that I have been dealing with for close to ten years. This man actually listened to what I had to say about where my pain was and you could tell he was really trying to figure me out. The very next week after I had my consultation, I had another visit and walked away almost pain free. Not only did I walk away almost pain free, but the next morning he called me to see how I was feeling. Three weeks later I had another appointment with him to get an epidural in my spine and every person on Dr Sam's team has been nothing but phenomenal. Again, Dr Sam called me to make sure I was doing okay and he was making sure I didn't have any questions. If you're dealing with chronic pain, do yourself a favor and go see this man. If he can even do half of what he did for me, you'll be glad you did.|The visit to Dr Sam's office was the most pleasant experience.  The Doctor and his staff and very helpful and nice. He is like your Primary Physician and friend.|Terrible doctor and team. I believed at first he was going to be able to help me with my chronic pain I deal with every moment of my life. Even suggested once I get disability that he would put in a spinal cord stimulator. But after my follow up visit his demeanor changed and said that based on my images I should not be in pain and he was going to refer me to neurologist. He then started becoming increasingly agitated at me for not improving putting me on medications for treatment. I could t help that my pain didn't change. He then said that he couldn't help me and was dropping me as a patient. His office called me a few days later saying they didn't know of any doctors that took self pay and wished me luck. His office is all extremely difficult to get in touch with as well and very passive aggressive toward you if they do not like something you say about how they are writing down false statements from you about your pain and downplaying your symptoms. I told them one day my pain was an 8 and they labeled it a 6 and when I brought it up to them he aggressively wrote back at me saying his report is accurate. When it was in fact false.|They are great. The staff is always pleasant. Dr. Sam takes the time and listens. I believe they care about me and that's hard to find in today's medical world.|When I first saw Dr Sam he genuinely "seemed" to care. I'd only seen him a couple of times when things started to change. I have chronic pain, severe Fibromyalgia,  bone spurs in neck, frozen shoulder, low back and tailbone pain,trouble standing/walking/sitting amoung other things. First he made me feel like a liar and suggested pain therapy.  Like it was all in my head. Said he put in a referal for that. NOPE NEVER HAPPENED. He finally put me on muscle relaxers and a low dose nalocet. Very low dose. Not very helpful but I tried them. As I've lived with this pain without medication for years it's easy to say that it didn't put a dent in my pain. They werre to take as needed for pain.
Dr Sam also said he would refer me to a neurologist and maybe a surgical pain pump my help.NEVER HAPPENED NO REFERAL. He also said he would refer me to physical therapy for my shoulder. NEVER HAPPENED NO REFERAL! He also said he would up my dose to a whopping 5mg.
I went in for my appointment and had to pee in a cup. Didn't know why but I did. He called me later and said that he would no longer prescribe me pain meds because there was no trace in my urine of the low dose. Im sorry was there supposed to be? So dont get addicted  but take them all the time even if not needed? Im so confused. I am 51 years old. I took them as needed. He warned me they could be addictive so I tried to take them only when my pain level was over 6. Next thing I know I'm being treated like a common criminal. New prescriptions not filled and kicked to the curb without warning. Even the non-opiod pills not filled. Why? For not wanting to get addicted. My follow up appointment was canceled  without my knowledge and not rescheduled.  I called them to ask why with no return call! I am not a druggie/dealer and I hate that the damn addicts have messed it up for us truly suffering.
Dr Sam doesn't care about me or my suffering. Cut me off like extra baggage.  Maybe because I am low income on Soonercare! Not getting the money from those HMO's from me. Doctors seem to forget that they work for us! They are supposed to help us. You need to check your ego at the door, get off your soapbox, and get back to helping people. Unacceptable behavior from you and your staff!!!|In a decade and a half even with my Lupus, RA, Fibromyalgia And other auto immune diseases, Dr Sam it's the first doctor that ever wanted to do test to find out what the true cause of my pain.

column3:
Dr. Jeffrey Miller serves Edmond, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with specialized mental health and pain management services. Based in the heart of Edmond at 15132 Traditions Blvd, Dr. Miller has established a reputation for his integrative approach to treating complex conditions that affect both mind and body. His practice focuses on helping patients understand the interconnection between psychological well-being and physical pain, offering evidence-based treatments tailored to each individual's unique circumstances.

At his Edmond clinic, Dr. Miller provides a range of specialized services designed to address various aspects of mental health and chronic pain. His approach recognizes that these conditions often coexist and influence one another, requiring thoughtful, multidimensional treatment strategies. Patients benefit from his expertise in cognitive behavioral therapy, medication management, and innovative pain reduction techniques that target both the physical and psychological components of suffering.

Specialized Treatment Approaches

Dr. Miller's practice stands out for its commitment to treating the whole person rather than isolated symptoms. He works closely with patients to develop personalized treatment plans that may include therapeutic interventions, lifestyle modifications, and when appropriate, coordination with other healthcare specialists. This collaborative approach ensures comprehensive care that addresses all factors contributing to a patient's condition.

Patient-Centered Care

Understanding that seeking help for mental health or chronic pain can be challenging, Dr. Miller creates a welcoming, supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected. His compassionate approach emphasizes education, empowerment, and active participation in the healing process. New patients are welcomed with thorough assessments that form the foundation for effective, individualized treatment plans.

For more information or to schedule an appointment with Dr. Jeffrey Miller, visit mindmoodpain.com or call +1 405-703-0937 ext. 3. The office is conveniently located at 15132 Traditions Blvd, Edmond, OK 73013, with flexible scheduling options available to accommodate diverse patient needs.
column38: JIM FISTNER|Troy Phillips|Dr. James Osborne|Pete Fowler|Mary F.|Natasha Gatz|Jerry Cooper|Carla Thornton
column40:
DR MILLER rocks! He listens and he explains things in ways we can understand. His clinics are clean and modern. The staff are all Simply amazing.|Thank you,
Dr Miller and Staff Danvi, Kaitlyn and Becky!
Everyone in the office is awesome, helpful, carrying and understanding. Dr J. Miller is the best pain management doctor I have found since 2017 well worth my two hour drive. Did I say the staff is awesome and a  very clean and happy environment. Dr Miller has a winning staff and needs to clone them when it's legal. Or give them a pay increase. I would go one thousand miles to see Dr Miller and Staff it's rare to find a doctors office ran like a well oiled machine with excellent staff. 100|Dr  Miller is an excellent "example " of a good Doctor!
Addition:  I have continued to see Dr Miller over 2 years now.  In my professional "as a retired Law Enforcement official and a Clinical psychotherapist", he is an excellent physician!   His bedside manner is excellent, his expertise and explanation of procedures is outstanding.  I would recommend him to my family or friends!|Absolutely a great doctor. Just about the best I have ever had. I highly recommend him.|I have been a patient of Dr.Miller for several years. First I'm very picky in my HCPs. I will not stay with one that is not the best. It takes an intelligent mind and witty humor to keep me coming back. Dr appts are no fun , but I actually look forward to these appointments as his team are just as remarkable as he is as they take care of patients during routine visits and the occasional hiccup. This office doesn't scream clinical office which my CPTSD definitely can appreciate. The office is always clean as are the individual rooms that in itself are seemingly designed to calm your nervous system which it does quite well.
If you are searching for a great bedside manner, yet funny and knowledgeable and understanding physician Dr.Miller is the guy.
Give this Greatest Of All Time Physician a chance. You wont regret it as your anxiety and pain melts away and you leave in a better mood than when you entered.|I would NOT recommend Dr. Miller to anyone with life-long chronic pain. He does not take time to fully hear his patients concerns and lacks empathy. I have been in the room when a patient explains they are in horrible pain and he is very reluctant to give medication. He would rather his patients suffer and "deal" with pain than prescribe enough medication to keep them comfortable. He told us, "It will be a rough few days but hopefully things will be better in a few days", he acknowledged the patient would go through pain and didn't care. We even requested to add medications like steroids and hormones to help with pain management since he won't keep his patient comfortable with pain medication and he shut down those ideas also. He is inexperienced in nerve pain and has poor bedside manner.|My visit and trial with Dr Miller was great. His staff, they are very good. . Dr Miller has installed a pain pump, it's great. Down time is not bad. All in all, a great experience.|Dr. Miller has helped me SO much with pain control due to me having two major back surgeries and a hospital stay due to a flair up with my hiatel hernia. I can actually do things now, without pain, that I haven't been able to do in a very long time.Thank you, Dr. Miller!

Dr. Matthew J. Boeckman serves Del City, Oklahoma and the greater Oklahoma City metropolitan area with specialized pain management services. As a dedicated pain specialist, Dr. Boeckman has established a reputation for providing compassionate, comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. His practice at the Oklahoma Pain Institute offers innovative treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs, combining medical expertise with a patient-centered approach.

At the Oklahoma Pain Institute, Dr. Boeckman and his team provide a wide range of interventional pain management treatments. Patients benefit from advanced diagnostic procedures, medication management, minimally invasive interventions, and rehabilitation therapies. The practice specializes in treating conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 4600 SE 29th St, Suite 750, Del City, OK 73115, the Oklahoma Pain Institute features modern equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. The convenient location offers ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility challenges.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Boeckman believes in developing personalized treatment plans that address not only the symptoms but also the underlying causes of pain. His multidisciplinary approach incorporates the latest evidence-based techniques while considering each patient's overall health, lifestyle, and treatment goals.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Matthew J. Boeckman, patients can call +1 405-733-5900 or visit the practice website at https://www.okpaininstitute.com/. The office staff is committed to providing prompt assistance with appointments, insurance questions, and general inquiries.

Hours and Availability

The Oklahoma Pain Institute maintains regular weekday hours with some early morning appointments available to accommodate working patients. New patients are welcome, and the practice accepts most major insurance plans, including Medicare and workers' compensation cases.

column40:
Over all bad experience! Injections terrible experience no count down or warning before the needle is inserted !  all the 1 stars are true ! Wish I didn't waist my time and  insurance on this place! An I seem to be in more pain on the injection site! Horrendous experience glad I put a stop to this myself!|I've been helped by Dr Boeckman and his incredible staff for several years now.  First, I love his preference for injections over surgery.  Pain management is my preference over surgery.  However, when I had an accident, he immediately ordered an MRI (because of my neck injury I needed a standing up MRI).  When he realized I needed surgery (to avoid damage to my spinal cord) he/his staff secured me a fast track access to a great surgeon.   His follow-up and care for my neck - as well as his continued care for my lumbar and thorasic spine have been great.

His staff is also awesome. They take personal interest in you, and work to meet the needs of your schedule and care needs.  I'm almost 60 and while my need for doctors have increased in the past few years, there is no doubt their staff stands out as the most understanding and workable with your situation.  (They have no control of insurance limitations/rules, or state laws.  They maintain high integrity in these matters. So when they - on a rare exception - tell you they can't do what you are asking/wanting, you must understand their high ethics and standards!)

I continue to recommend everyone (among my friends/social connections) with pain management needs to go to Dr. Boeckman!|Holly his Nurse practitioner is really nice! She listens and does her best to help relieve your pain. Dr Boeckman is very good and very knowledgeable. He also has a great sense of humor! He listens and responds to your needs. I would recommend his practice without reservation!|Horrible doctor. He doesn't listen well and both his nurses lie. They say they will call you back and never do. Especially the fat one with glasses. If you are of color this office is not it. My partner was with this office when Dr. Meyer was around. Now he was a good doctor then boeckman took over. Glad we found another pain management office.
PROCEED WITH CAUTION!!|Dr. Boeckman is amazing! He's extremely thorough, patient, kind & understanding. He has never rushed my appointments, he listens to & answers all my questions in a way that I understand. He's very personable & an expert in his field. I completely trust Dr. Boeckman. My husband and I both have been seeing him for quite a while and we're 100% satisfied with the care we receive. I highly recommend him to anyone looking for a pain management doctor.|Dr Boeckman and his staff are wonderful people !  Dr. B always takes time to explain everything and answer all my questions, even the stupid ones! I have never been pushed to have anything done, always given time to think  and decide! When I had the procedure done on my lower back, which by the way is no where near your kidneys folks, it was the best decision I have ever made! Awesome  relief! His staff, including Ms Julia are the best!   From day one they have treated me well!  I love them all!  Since I think i have a nickname, my name is June Williams! Any negativity about this place is just not true! Dr B stays busy constantly! He must be doing something !  Makes sense! He may be young but he knows what he's doing! I reccomend to everyone looking for a good pain management doctor! Dr Matthew Boekman! #1 in my books!|Very satisfied with Dr Blackman and his staff. His staff is always nice and friendly and very helpful. Been going for about 6 months now when I was told I needed surgery and he has helped with my pain. He listens to my issues and will explain what my options are in detail and answers all my questions even the stupid ones. He takes the time nneded to make sure you understand everything and doesn't act like he is in a rush to get you in and out like so many other doctors do. Also, if he can't help you he will tell you instead of doing a procedure that won't work.I would recommend him to anyone looking for relief without all the pills other doctors seem to push.|Horrible doctor. My mother has had severe back pain and several surgeries to the point where she can barely walk now since retiring back in 2011. This doctor ONLY wants to give her shots to make money from whatever kickbacks he gets. He started out giving her pain meds then refused the meds because of a sleeping medication she is on( which she has been on for 20 plus years). I understood the concerns he had however he kept prescribing her meds to manage her pain then out of the blue WOULD NOT fill her medication. Then would refill her pain medication the next visit. It's like he gets a sick gratification out of making his patients suffer.  She finally was diagnosed with shingles along with her back pain and he decided to cut her off cold turkey. My mother is 70 years old and is having to deal with all this pain with no help at all. He called her on a Friday and said he could no longer do anything for her. Anyone of color do NOT go to this doctor as he does not care about you! I will be looking into how I can file a complaint against this monster as I can't believe he has treated my mother this way.

column2: Dr. Adam J. Wallace, MD Interventional Pain Management
column3:
Dr. Adam J. Wallace, MD serves Tulsa, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with exceptional interventional pain management services. As a board-certified specialist, Dr. Wallace has dedicated his practice to helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive techniques. His patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care, ensuring each individual receives a customized treatment plan designed to improve their quality of life.

At the Spine and Pain Center, Dr. Wallace offers a wide range of interventional procedures to address various pain conditions. His expertise includes spinal injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and advanced neuromodulation therapies. Patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome can find effective treatment options tailored to their specific needs.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 3336 E 32nd St #220, Tulsa, OK 74135, the practice features modern equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. The convenient location offers ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility challenges.

Patient-Focused Care

Dr. Wallace and his dedicated team prioritize patient education and collaborative decision-making. New patients receive thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of their pain, followed by detailed explanations of available treatment options. This comprehensive approach helps patients make informed choices about their care journey.

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Adam J. Wallace, MD, call +1 918-255-7246 or visit spineandpaincenter.com for more information about services and treatment options. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and works diligently to ensure patients receive the care they need with minimal financial stress.
