column38: H. Rabbit|Gina Mazarodi|Melissa Venegas|Liberal Loud Mouth|Mexican Smoothie|Lisa Morin|Lucy Martin|Carla Aley
column40:
Dr Wallace is the best. I was dreading leaving my old pain mgmt dr due to a change in my insurance, but I am so pleased with his care. His bedside manner is unmatched. Had a rocky start with the office staff due to some things being missed/delayed, but they've hired new people now, and when all is said and done, I got the pain relief I needed.|If I could give 0 stars I would.  My husband had an autoimmune and after over a year of this doctor and that doctor and waiting waiting and having the pain worsening we were recommended this place.   After the first visit we were so excited to get some answers.  We tried to wait a few months for the next appointment but his pain was out of control.  Long story short Dr. Wallace talked of all the things that could help him and didn't explain what was happening today then a nurse comes in talking about a contract that he needs to sign where he can't take any other needs including marijuana.  My hubby got upset at first because that's the only thing that was giving him any relief so they sent in another nurse.  He talked to her,  he calmed down,  he signed the contract and was to take a UA. He couldn't urinate because that's part of the pain and autoimmune and they said you can do it next time but they would send a script and referral for an MRI.  They would then not return calls, there was no prescription sent but finally the order for MRI came thru.  Months after that we called to get a followup and they said the doc will call you when he's reviewed everything and is ready.  Still nothing.  Come to find out they decided not to help my husband at all but instead referred him out without a word of this to us. This is horrible practice and if they can't tolerate upset people in pain why are they there? How can a professional "people helper"  not have the decency to tell people they aren't going to treat them? #worstplaceever|Dr Wallace is my mother-in-law's pain doctor. She called on a Friday to see if she could have her pain medicine called into the pharmacy. They advised her that this was against the regulations. She had an appointment for Monday I took her to that appointment. When she said something about not having her medication through the weekend they again told her that it was against their policy. But then the nurse look through her file and said actually they were supposed to call in a 30-day the week prior. So the whole thing was their mistake. When we got to the pharmacy the prescription still wasn't ready and after lunch it still wasn't ready. After trying to get ahold of them for quite a while finally they answered and they said that they would have it in by the end of the day. They said they would make sure this was the first one that they called in. 7:00 p.m. that night when the pharmacy closed they still didn't have her medicine in. I honestly didn't seem to care very much!!!|I had been seeing Dr. Wallace for over a year when he was at Pain Management of Tulsa and, I'll be honest, he seems like one of the nicest, most caring doctors you'll meet (besides Dr. White).

But the truth is that he turned his back on a whole lot of patients who were kicked out of Pain Management of Tulsa's practice because Dr. Wallace and Torgerson left 1 day after the new opiate prescription law passed.

My assumption is that they did this knowing that now, every person requiring pain medication for longer than 3 weeks is being forced by the DEA and a bunch of non-doctor politicians to go into pain management clinics.

This tells me that Dr. Wallace may seem as though he cares, doesn't. He saw a very lucrative opportunity and without a thought to those who might suffer as a result, he took his bundle of cash and left.

I don't fault Wallace for wanting to become super-wealthy; I fault Wallace for leaving his patients without an option and in pain. Their pain, his gain.

And from other reviews I've read about Wallace, it turns out he may be a shot-jock who wants to charge your insurance as much as possible for a 5-minute shot that does nothing but exacerbate your back problems and suppress your immune system unnecessarily - all for the sake of money.

Visitor beware.|Dr Adam J Wallace is the absolute best Dr I personally have ever seen for chronic pain treatment. (I really wish he was family practice as well)

The (1) negative reviewer has it quite the opposite, imho. I personally believe PMT mostly kept only the patients they could qualify to see every 4 weeks, hence more money. It would make no sense for these two doctors to leave any of their patients behind, what kind of medical practice would they have with no patients?? Actually, there are several things in that review that make no sense.

Dr Wallace genuinely cares about his patients as people, not simply chattle for dollars. He is so very supportive, kind and caring. He takes the time to know his patients as individuals, their life, and to fully understand their best interests in treatment plans. He's anything but a money grabber. Best pain management Dr I've had for helping my life be manageable while living with excruciating life debilitating chronic pain. Any legit pain patient would agree. He "gets" my desire to live life to the fullest with the utmost quality of life possible. I never feel like I've been farmed out to a pill mill clinic. And I will forever be grateful for the lifestyle I'm able to live thanks to Dr Wallace and the fabulous medical team at the new place.

They care. They make all the difference in the world for my treatment. I highly recommend Dr Adam J Wallace for pain management.

Personally, I only stayed on at PMT because it was well worth stepping thru the minefield to receive treatment from Dr Wallace. I'm very happy to support their new venture beyond PMT.

Sincerely,
B-|I switched Pain doctors back in Feb I believe cause I was NOT happy with my other pain Dr.. I had been with them since 2006..
I switched to Dr Wallace office.. First of all the ladies @ the front desk AND the nurse is so sweet & friendy.. They welcome you with a warm welcome. This doctors office actually ANSWERS THE PHONE & RETURNS YOUR CALLS...
Dr. Wallace is so friendly, very professional, takes his time to hear your pain and concerns.. He does is best to help you with your pain. I am very happy I switched to this doctor & his office..
Thanks  L.M
I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS OFFICE|Before Dr. Wallace I was seeing a pain doc. Who never run test! But looked at my chart an said there was no hope! That all he could do was pump me full of high power meds! An that's all he did! Until i was lucky enough to leave the clinic one day! That was when I met Dr. Wallace! The first thing he did was start running tests! An he changed my meds!! I'm not taking meds as powerful as I was! But he is still able to control my pain! He said he was determined to find cause! Where the other doc didn't care! I discovered two things the first year! (1) I have two things causing all the numbness an neuropathy " damage from surgery  and my bad kidney) that docs almost waited to long to remove! (2) an the tiny bones in my lower back have somehow been completely crushed! He's been trying to figure out how since he found it! An I believe he'll figure it out eventually!  It's not often you find a doctor who truly cares about what (he/she) does! Thank you Dr. Wallace for caring!|Excellent care!  Great doctor!  Dr. Wallace takes the time to understand what you are feeling and to present you with all options available to you.  Happy to have him as my spine doctor.

column40:
No respect for your time. I had a 9:30 am appointment. I left without being seen by the doctor at 12:30pm. In 3 hours I had a nurse take my vitals and someone else verify paperwork and nothing else. No one mentioned how behind they were. My wife asked what was up around 2.5 hours in and was told a 3 hour initial appointment is normal. If the appointment was actually happening, sure. I used a half day of PTO and had to return to work. Waste of my morning and PTO.
Do not recommend.|If you are a veteran referred hete for community care, AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Dr is verbally abusive. As a disabled veteran I came here referred from the VA. The Dr saw me 45 minutes after my scheduled appointment and became unprofessional and verbally abusive when he asked me how I was doing and I said I've been better. He pried at my response so I told him I wasn't expecting to see him 45 minutes past my appointment time. He responded that there's a lot of paperwork to complete. I responded that I arrived at 0930, 30 minutes early to my appointment in order to complete the paperwork. He said I could have arrived at 6 am and it wouldn't matter and that who's supposed to fill out the paperwork, the holy ghost? He then told me he has nothing for me and the appointment was over. He never treated me. Then he tried to make me leave the facility without getting a print out from the front desk to prove I came to the appointment. The receptionist refused and stated that "it would be faxed" and the Dr came to the waiting room 2 more times while I was on the phone with the VA to tell me to get out and yell at me. Absolutely abhorrent behavior.|Dr Nouh has been my doctor for the past 4+ years. He's always been kind, professional and attentive regarding my medical needs. He listens to me and helps me understand my diagnosis from some of the test results I get done. I couldn't have found a better than Dr. Nouh. Also, his staff are very professional and kind to me every time I have an appt. Highly recommend Dr. Nouh|I have to give Dr. Nouh hands down. 5 plus stars!!! He is a very smart patient may I have ever met.|Dr. Nouh had been my neurologist for over 7 years now. I trust all his teachings. He is involved, consistent and knowledgeable. He is the only doctor I have allowed to repeatedly do my spinal injections. I feel safe in his hands. He is also VERY dependable l have NEVER had him cancel an appointment. If your searching for a neurologist, you have found him: Dr. Amer Nouh with Neuro Pain Care in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.|Dr. Nouh always takes excellent care of me. He addresses every concern I have. I do my research so I can be prepared to discuss diagnosis with him, and he's always leaps and bounds ahead of me, which tells me he's mastered his craft.|DR Nouh is absolutely the vest Pain Specialist.   He doesn't give what's not needed and is always courteous and professional.   We have been to many pain specialists and hope we never have to leave his service.  He is the best there is!!|Dr Nouh has been great!! I see him for nerve block injections for my nerve pain & headaches. I've had nerve blocks done by 5-6 dr's in the past and Dr Nouh is by far the best. He ensured the care I received was exactly what I wanted and needed.

column2: The Spine and Pain Center - Dr. Brian Torgerson M.D., Dr. Adam Wallace M.D.
column3:
The Spine and Pain Center in Tulsa, Oklahoma offers comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of board-certified physicians Dr. Brian Torgerson M.D. and Dr. Adam Wallace M.D. Specializing in interventional pain management techniques, our center provides personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine and other areas of the body. We combine cutting-edge medical technology with compassionate care to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

Our practice focuses on minimally invasive procedures and evidence-based treatments that target the source of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. From epidural steroid injections and radiofrequency ablation to spinal cord stimulation and targeted medication management, we offer a full spectrum of interventional techniques tailored to each patient's specific condition.

Our Expert Physicians

Dr. Brian Torgerson M.D. and Dr. Adam Wallace M.D. bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine and anesthesiology to our practice. Both physicians completed specialized fellowship training in interventional pain management and remain at the forefront of advances in the field. Their commitment to patient education ensures that each individual understands their condition and participates actively in treatment decisions.

Conditions We Treat

We specialize in addressing various pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

Patient-Centered Approach

At The Spine and Pain Center, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our multidisciplinary approach may incorporate physical therapy recommendations, lifestyle modifications, and psychological support alongside medical interventions to achieve optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

Address: 1844 E 15th St, Tulsa, OK 74104, United States

Phone: +1 918-727-7246

Website: https://spineandpaincenter.com/

New patients are welcome, and most major insurance plans are accepted. Contact our office today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

column40: Doctor was nice and seemed understanding while in office. However, one week after my first appointment, I had to call in and see if she could adjust my medications. I called only once (and went to voice mail) and I waited for three weeks for a call back. I do not like constantly calling medical services as I know they get very busy. However, after not receiving a call for three weeks, I have decided to cancel any future appointments as I felt she did not have any concern for my wellbeing.|I'm giving the center 2 stars because Dr Torgerson is a good doctor and did his job well. However, his support staff was terribly incompetent. I was scheduled for a series of 7 injections. When I came in for the 1st injection, which my husband took off work so he could be with me, I was denied the injection because no one told me to stop taking the aspirin my cardiologist has me taking. Half a day of income lost and no pain relief. That seems like it would have been a good time for them to review pre- procedure instructions which were completely neglected before but I wasnt told anything else when I asked. Came back the next week and was turned away AGAIN because no one said I couldn't eat before the injection. I asked for the instructions to be emailed to me, but I never received them. Ridiculous|I've been going here for the last four months with everyday lower back pain, do my l5 and some sort of disc in my back super jacked up they have tried muscle relaxer. After muscle relaxer, and nothing gives me any kind of pain. And after going through this for so long, I swear it has been literally five months, at least i don't sleep more than an hour. If that a night trying to get through annoying a** pain, i'm having all the time in my back radiating down my leg well, when I set up appointments here I go in. We literally sit in there for about 20 minutes. Figuring out what medications to give me not what procedures we are going to do to make me better or anything like that. I have to bring it up if I want to talk about procedures. I'm not a doctor. I don't know what to ask. I feel like they take advantage of you. Yes, doctor wallace is a cool doctor it seems like he cares, but his staff are super lost and I don't think they know what they're doing. I just recently went to advanced orthopedics to reach for help for pain management. So I'm hoping this will help. I would stay clear from this place. They really don't help they let me leave everyday in pain, not really caring about what I was dealing with.|I had to wait forever. I've been in unending pain looking for help and the doctor said I had to redo all my MRIs and he wasn't going to do anything for me until that was done Even though he had the information, and my MRIs were all within a year or so. Dr. Torgensen is very not understanding. Very unprofessional all around, waiting room was packed and I feel I was rushed through everything after waiting for a full 30 minutes after my appointment time for the doctor. I question The professionalism and the credibility completely. You couldn't pay me to return to this place|if I could give zero stars, I would.... First and foremost I had to come with my two year-old who has autism so that's another stressor within itself. When I arrived the place was packed. I stood at the front desk for about five minutes which was packed also nobody acknowledged us so I went to go sit down. After about 10 minutes when the line slowed...I got back up to show them that I'm here and once again the front desk did not acknowledge me. so now I wait 20 minutes and go back up there and they finally acknowledge me by this time. I'm late for my appointment which was at 10:30... I didn't get seen till 1130 and I noticed that this place over packs the area... I don't know if they schedule people around the same time, but there was barely any place to sit and you would think with a lot of the clients being elderly that this place would take that into consideration but unfortunately they don't. so if you come here and get scheduled, bring u a chair...you'll be in the waiting room packed like sardines. lastly, after meeting with Dr. Torgeson, he was very offputting showed very little to no compassion and when I was trying to explain things to him on what I have been through up to now... He kept saying it sounds like you need surgery... It sounds like you want surgery, make a long story short he recommended me get a updated MRI of my neck which I plan on doing. but I also told him I was having issues with my middle spine. He didn't address that at all. But This is the kicker...why did Mr. Torgesen sign me up for a MRI in Edmond Oklahoma when we're obviously in Tulsa.... knowing I didn't have no vehicle and I'm there with my two year-old autistic child. We definitely won't be back.|I've seen many doctors in my 40+ years, and Dr. Wallace is the best I've worked with. I agree with another reviewer that his bedside manner is unsurpassed. He is kind and caring, he explains things in a way that's easy to understand, and he genuinely listens to my concerns. I just wish I could see him for all of my medical concerns! Thank you, Dr. Wallace, for being an amazing human being!|I'm sure the doctor is great, but the clinic has astonishingly unhelpful staff. My sister has been trying since Halloween to get them to finish the paperwork and red tape of approving a procedure everyone agrees she needs, leaving her in daily pain that is sometimes enough to leave her bedridden. SHE, the PATIENT IN PAIN, is having to use her limited functional time to nag them daily now, and is constantly being told conflicting things, or that there is one more thing to be done. There is something broken here, and nobody seems to give enough of a damn to fix it. It's beyond disgusting.|Dr. Torgerson is amazing . I always have pain relief after my visit and injection. Very attentive. Thank you Dr. Torgerson.

column3:
Alhaj George MD serves Oklahoma City, OK and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. Dr. George has established himself as a leading specialist in interventional pain medicine, offering comprehensive treatment options for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. His practice combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

At his practice located at 2124 Shadowlake Dr, Building O, Oklahoma City, OK 73159, Dr. George provides individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. His expertise encompasses a wide range of pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment modalities, Dr. George addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Dr. George's practice offers various interventional procedures, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. These minimally invasive techniques are performed with precision to target pain at its source while minimizing recovery time and potential side effects. The practice also incorporates medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications as part of a holistic treatment strategy.

Patient-Centered Care

What distinguishes Dr. Alhaj George's practice is his commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. He takes time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. His compassionate approach has earned him numerous positive reviews from patients who have found relief under his care.

For consultations or to schedule an appointment, patients can contact the office at +1 405-378-0600 or visit the practice website at www.nopainoklahoma.com for more information about services and treatment options.

column2: Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers - Blake Christensen, D.O.
column3:
Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers serves patients throughout Oklahoma City and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Blake Christensen, D.O., our centers have established a reputation for excellence in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions. We believe in addressing the whole person, not just their symptoms, which is why our approach integrates multiple therapeutic modalities designed to provide lasting relief and improved quality of life.

Our full-service pain management clinic offers a wide range of treatment options, including advanced injection therapy and carefully managed pharmacologic treatments. What sets us apart is our holistic philosophy that recognizes the interconnected nature of pain and overall wellness. In addition to medical interventions, we provide expert guidance in complementary approaches such as chiropractic care, acupuncture, massage therapy, and psychological counseling to address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain.

Specialized Treatment Areas

At Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers, we utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic services to accurately identify and treat various pain conditions affecting the:

- Spine: Neck, back, and lower back pain

- Joints: Hip, knee, and elbow discomfort

- Other areas: Comprehensive care for all types of musculoskeletal and nerve pain

Our Commitment to Excellence

Every aspect of patient care at our center is overseen by board-certified physicians who maintain the highest standards of medical practice. Our dedicated staff is committed to providing exceptional care in a compassionate environment, taking the time to understand each patient's unique circumstances and developing personalized treatment plans.

Serving Communities Across Oklahoma

While our clinic is located at 1315 N Washington Ave in Weatherford, OK, we proudly serve patients from across the state, including Moore, Edmond, Norman, Shawnee, Yukon, and El Reno. Our central location makes quality pain management accessible to a wide range of Oklahoma communities.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit us online at https://www.oklahomapaintreatmentcenters.com/ or call us at +1 405-751-0011.
column11:
Our Centers are dedicated to a holistic approach to pain management. The staff is committed to high quality of care guided by a board-certified physician. We offer full-service pain management services including injection therapy and pharmacologic therapies in the management of acute and chronic pain. The center provides guidance in chiropractic therapies, acupuncture, massage therapy, and psychological counseling.

Oklahoma Pain Treatment Centers offer a range of state of the art diagnostic services and treatment for a variety of pain including in the neck, back, lower back, hips, elbows, knees and joints. We serve customers from across the state at our clinic in Oklahoma City, including in Moore, Edmond, Norman, Shawnee, Yukon & El Reno.

column40:
I love Dr. Nelson and Murat, they really care about you and always treat you as of importance. They show their concerns and they let you know and go above and beyond. The ladies in the office are amazing and the atmosphere is great. I have  a few illnesses and see way too many doctors which gets tiring, so it is great to go there and everyone there treat you like family. They remember you, they are all down to earth, professional. They listen, they care, they are by the book as well. If another doctor doesn't do what they need to do Dr Nelson makes sure it gets done.|This office is very rude. Dr Nelson treats his patients like bad children and acts like he doesn't care what happens to them. Dr Murat no longer works there probably because he fired him. He's been known to go in and fire his entire office this is how Dr Nelson treats people including his staff. Doesn't treat his patients any better and calls some of his patients liars!!!  I don't recommend Dr Nelson to anyone!!!!  If I could give this doctor less then one star I would but since I can't I only gave him 1 star!!!!|I have been a patient of Dr. Nelson for a little under two years now. I have never not once felt like they dont care. Marute is the best always making me feel like a priority,very profeasional. The doctors are great, some office staff could use a course or two in sensitivity and patient satisfaction. I recommend Dr.Nelson to anyine living with pain, he is very knowledgeable and experienced in this area and will do everything he can to help you.|This is was a TERRIBLE experience!! He just wants to write you pain medicine and send you out the door...If that's what you want then great...NOT ME! I want a solution to my pain not to just put a Band-Aid on it. Not to mention, all the patient files are paper and he spends a lot of time flipping through your paperwork to figure out what's wrong with you....He doesn't know your history at all! I had a procedure done on a Monday and 3 days later had a follow-up for the procedure and he didn't even remember doing it...said "Oh yeah, well how did that go?" I'm like...uhh YOU DID IT!! The staff is not much to mention either. I was supposed to be scheduled for another procedure and they just didn't call to schedule me. I called a week later and they said their new "procedure suite" isn't ready yet and it will be another 2 weeks. Really?! Happy to find a new doctor.|This office is so unprofessional. I have had to drive over there due to them not answering phone calls. My mother shows up and they tell her that her appointment was the day before or last week. They were collecting $50 each visit despite her having met her out of pocket. By the time I caught on, they owed her over $800. Now, they are abruptly discontinuing medication she has been on for over 5 years. But they still expect her to come to the office? For what? Why are you still charging her insurance for doing nothing!? If you are no longer providing her with a service, stop scheduling appointments.
Irresponsible and negligent.  Pain management patients need to be weaned off medication. Of course, I just tried to call them to discuss this and I got a "voicemail isn't set up yet" message. Of course!|I had my first appointment a few days ago. I had no problem whit any staff or doctors. I spoke with a very nice and understanding PA. I love the structure of the clinic. if you take your meds in excess then this is not the doc for you. I wanted to comment on "DEEVA's" response by a staff member was very well written, and I thank you for taking the time to explain in detail. <3|Do no harm, Dr's code right? I really liked the place to begin with. They jack up self pay prices and dont post arrival policy in their office like everyone else. By the way you get to get there 15 minutes early at open and wait an hour to an hour and a half, stand crippled in line and usually pain doctors have comfortable chairs for people like me, but I guess lawn chair comfort suffices.
Went during a spine surgery, there was a complication requiring me to go to osu for a growth based off of their opinion, spend 26 hours there for a lance, MRI CAT scan ect. I have some weird growth under the fluid so they made me admit. Still dont know what it is.. Anyhow, i lost my contract in Houston due to collaborating care and finding a new pain dr. I finally have another contract starting Monday 12 hours away, get to the office that requires patients to be 15 minutes early (I was 10 late to UA and refill so maybe 13 minutes of work on their part plus the 2 or 3 minute call in to the pharmacist.
Today was my last day to get in before this 2 day 12 hour drive and the possibility of underperforming again from the pain should it flair up. I offered to wait for a cancellation, wait until after the last patient or do whatever to preserve my wellbeing..nope reschedule..can't reschedule it's a 4 month contract. Well dont know what to tell ya..|The Dr's are WONDERFUL! BUT I have not been able to get through to them, past leaving a message, since February 2, 2017!!!!!! Why won't they answer their phone or call me back? I keep leaving messages. I hurt so bad and can't get in to see them!

column3:
Western Oklahoma Pain Specialists serves patients across Elk City, OK and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Founded by Dr. Blick, this comprehensive pain clinic has expanded to multiple locations throughout Western Oklahoma, providing accessible care to patients who might otherwise need to travel long distances for specialized pain treatment. With a patient-centered approach, the practice offers evidence-based interventions for both acute and chronic pain conditions.

After graduating from the University of Kansas residency program, Dr. Blick and his wife, Lauren, moved to Elk City where he began practicing as Chief of Anesthesia at Great Plains Regional Medical Center under the company, Western Oklahoma Anesthesia Consultants. His expertise in anesthesiology provided the foundation for his specialized focus on pain management. Recognizing the need for dedicated pain services in the region, Dr. Blick later established Western Oklahoma Pain Specialists to address this critical healthcare gap.

Multiple Locations Serving Western Oklahoma

Understanding the challenges rural patients face in accessing specialized care, Dr. Blick focuses on traveling to his patients to provide the best quality care available. The practice now maintains offices in:

  • Weatherford

  • Clinton

  • Woodward

  • Elk City (Main Office)

Services Offered

The clinic provides comprehensive pain management solutions including diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, and coordinated care approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Contact Information

Main Office:

1007 N Main St, Suite 101

Elk City, OK 73644

United States

Phone: +1 580-339-8001

Website: www.westernokpainspecialists.com
column11:
Meet Dr. Blick -
After graduating from the University of Kansas residency program, Dr. Blick and his wife, Lauren, moved to Elk City where he began practicing as Chief of Anesthesia at Great Plains Regional Medical Center under the company, Western Oklahoma Anesthesia Consultants. He later started Western Oklahoma Pain Specialists and has offices in Weatherford, Clinton, Woodward and Elk City. Dr. Blick focuses on traveling to his patients to provide the best quality care available.

These Dr.'s are literally THE BEST TEAM I have seen in 15 years of pain management.  They listen, care, they actually want to know how things are and want you to be better. SHOUT OUT TO HALLIE SHE IS THE BEST NURSE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED IN MY LIFE!!!!!! I have no clue what I would do with out her. She has helped me immensely & I know that it isn't just me that gets this quality of care. I thank God that I found you guys n I am so blessed to be in the care of people who really care about you! Love Dr Mosel & Dr Sharah sorry they're just my faves! Dr. Blick is wonderful too I'm just now getting to know him! Trust & believe that this is a life cha ging experience when it comes to pain management! Xoxox|I've been going here for almost 4 years and I think they are great..I was.diagnosed with crps from a hospital injury. The girls in the front are helpful and very nice. I see Dr Sharrah most the time and I think he is terrific. He listens, he's polite , he also does my injections at the hospital.  I just think him and Dr Mosel are terrific humans and I feel anyone who sees either one will not be disappointed.You guys are terrific and I'm so glad that I have such great Drs close by.|Dr Blick is one of the rudest doctors that I have ever met. He not only is sarcastic but talks down to you. I was wondering why the staff was disappearing. They all QUIT!!!  And when I spoke up to him he let me go as a patient!
P.S. No wonder he doesn't no what the heck he's doing.....he went to medical school in Dominica, West Indies!!!!!!!! I wish I would have know sooner!!!!|My daughter in law goes there and loves him she has had a hard time getting doctors to listen to her and he actually does listen to her concerns about her chronic issues with her back and is always trying to figure out how to best help her, this is the 1st doctor that didn't treat her like it was all in her head|This is a new review after another good experience with these guys just yesterday.  I have chronic pain disorders and because of the very successful procedure of a nerve stimulator for my left knee, I went back for the same treatment for my right one.  Once again I am very pleased with the results. I've never had a bad experience with anyone who works here or any of their other locations.  A specific nurse yesterday was very encouraging and helpful when I needed it.  I was medicated for the procedure so I hope I have her name right.  I'm pretty sure it's Elizabeth and she goes by Bizzy or Busy.|Been going for about a year and so far I am satisfied that the doctors are doing all they can to help. I've never had a problem with my prescriptions as I don't abuse them. I get prescribed a pain med for a month and usually last about 3 months. They get a lot of flack from people who abuse their meds and keep wanting more and more and the doc can't and shouldn't accommodate them. We've tried injections in my back and hip. Sometimes they really help, and sometimes not very much. I don't blame the doc, backs are hard to treat it seems. Overall, I've gotten some relief and that is huge for me. For a few years I just existed and constantly in overbearing pain. They have given me much of my regular life back. I appreciate the care I receive from Dr. Blick and asscociates.|This doctor office is not accommodating. They make policy but only enforce them to make things better for themselves. They don't help with the pain. Staff isn't rude but they are not very nice either. I wouldn't recommend this clinic.|Joke.. all they care bout is collecting Ins. Money, Stabbing you with drugs that don't work, Scribing Meds. that don't work instead of fixing problem. Don't return or take your calls when too crippled to make it into your appt. then try to bill you for no show. Make up charges that Ins. & Medicade won't cover then drop you when after refuse to pay after 7-10 yrs of trusting them an want to get better & want 2nd Real Dr. opinion. Finally got to Neuro. Dr., found I had 2 more herniated disc., said he's had same complaints thru his patients said this should have been taken care of instead of shooting drugs into it to knumbing it till next treatment.
Also their billing department are idiots, no way someone with 2 Ins. should owe for & be billed for piss test 2-3 different fee's & NO SHOWS after 6 yrs ago & stopped seeing after Ins. even refused & called outrageous charges. They're crooks & wouldn't trust them with a dieing rat. Also, been fixed & off all pain meds. for over a year. Even have feeling back in left leg that I didn't have until I went to this place, do to his spine inj. where he damaged a nerve while doin injection. Leaving me in years of pain & wouldn't or couldn't fix..

Precision Pain Management serves Tulsa, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located in East Tulsa, our specialized clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and return to their daily activities with minimal discomfort.

At Precision Pain Management, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our practice offers both long-term and short-term pain management solutions, addressing everything from post-surgical recovery to persistent chronic pain conditions. We develop personalized treatment plans that may include medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to provide effective relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Specialized Addiction Treatment Options

Beyond traditional pain management, we proudly offer specialized addiction treatment services including Suboxone and Vivitrol therapy for patients struggling with opioid dependency. Our compassionate approach to addiction treatment recognizes the complex relationship between chronic pain and substance use disorders, providing a judgment-free environment where patients can receive the comprehensive care they need.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Precision Pain Management apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just their symptoms. We take time to listen to our patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop treatment strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle. Our convenient East Tulsa location at 4110 S 100th E Ave #201 provides a comfortable setting where patients can receive the highest standard of care.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about how we can help you find your path to pain freedom, visit our website at www.ppmok.com or call us at (918) 857-7246. YOUR PATH TO PAIN FREEDOM starts with Precision Pain Management!
column11:
YOUR PATH TO PAIN FREEDOM!

We offer long & short term pain management needs from post surgical care to chronic pain conditions. We also offer Suboxone and Vivitrol treatment.

column40: I have found these folks to be of the highest ethical standard.  The front desk staff - Taylor and one other young person who is equally as kind and competent - are the best I've seen - and I'm old - these young people have personalities and will show you if you let them.  I have seen the primary doctor and all the assistant physicians - I always accept whomever is available as I am comfortable with all of them - I talk too much and enjoy hearing from other people - I have never been rushed out even when taking the conversation way off topic.  Here's the deal - all the complaints you may read about are likely from folks who were treated within the regulations which Precision Pain has to follow - people who take opioid medications are not the most trustworthy people out there so be careful about making a decision based on someone who is unhappy because they did not get exactly what they wanted.  I have been denied a request at Precision because the medical professionals would rather keep me alive and help make life a little less painful after surgery.  Go here - treat the front desk staff with respect - treat the nurses with respect (nurses here are also freekin awesome) - listen to the Doc's and don't expect to control the show - that's not the way this works.  These people will do all they can within ethical standards to help you.|I have been with them for 4 years and haven't had any trouble they have taken very good care of me I am very thankful to them. This is the first time I didn't get my meds on time. Thank you all|I understand that some meds can counter act with the opioid they give you. But understand unfortunately the Doctors has stupid physicians assistant's there as well. These people would rather cover their a$$ than treat you for pain! I only went there for 5 months and my pain was getting worse and they didn't seem to care. The ladies at the front dest are awesome and extremely nice but the care you can find better places than them. I hate giving UA's every month just to get some pills that don't even kill the pain. Thanks for nothing Precision Pain management.|After being treated like I was "seeking pain pills" by my referring provider, it was incredibly refreshing to have a provider who understood that I was only seeking pain control, not "pain pills". This office is fully staffed by some of the most professional and compassionate healthcare workers I've dealt with in a very long time. They care about managing your symptoms while you work with other doctors and specialists to help find and treat the cause of your pain, which is the most important thing for me. Couldn't be happier with the care I'm continuing to receive.|My friend calapsed at their office and ended up in hospital now cannot get their meds the staff is very un fair to their patient.|My wife has been coming here for years and we were heartbroken to hear that Dr. Adkins was no longer there.  It would have been nice to know that before her appointment since she was supposed to discuss her change in medicine with him and instead got a PA. Jay a nurse was so awesome to help to get my wife rescheduled for her appointment.  My wife had gotten an infection from a surgery, and was in the ICU for 2 weeks which made her miss her appointment, and he remembered seeing the wounds that were infected and so was very sympathetic to the situation and told me to let him know once she got out of the hospital and he would get her back in to the schedule.  They have been so helpful during this stressful time...THANKS EVERYONE!|I don't like discrimination I didn't like how they handled their business I didn't like how they treated me as a patient how they singled me out how they judged me and how judgmental their staff is. I don't think people have a right to discriminate people for wanting to get better and I think they used the other medicine for another excuse. The medicine that I was on and was supposed to help me what a sad sad thing to do to somebody who's has such chronic pain from nine and half years and longer and a cancer patient who's trying to survive and trying to take care of a 94-year-old mother what a sad sad bunch of people that discriminate against a human being. And hopefully I'll get someone a lot better than they are.|The front desk goes above and beyond to accommodate patient appointments. My husbands neurologist referred him and the care they give him is amazing.  The entire office staff is wonderful.   THANK YOU!

Don't waste your time he doesn't listen. Ive struggle with chronic pain for 14 years but I'm still younger. I guess young people can't be in pain. We concluded that it's not migraines yet he insists it is. I was on pain meds but my insurance changed so I couldn't see him. Came back with good insurance again and was refused the same care I had previously received. Doesn't matter your history you are drug seeking if you don't agree with them. Found a better Dr. that actually ordered MRIs to find bulging damaged discs, pressure on my spinal cord and had no curve in my neck due to an injury. So NO I was not drug seeking and a pain management Dr. didn't want to provide care for a patient. Find a different specialty Mackey, your heart is not in the right place. Maybe take more time and order tests before providing meds so you could see the reasons for the pain.

Photos to show damage and repair from a competent doctor who cares

Also no longer need anything for pain whatsoever|My family member has received care at this clinic for over a year.  We have been treated with the utmost respect.  We are asked at every visit if we are satisfied with the current treatment plan and adjustments are made whenever needed.

In regards to masking, all of the doctors connected to my family members care require masking and not one, including Dr. Mackey's office has ever asked us for money when we forgot our mask.

I would highly recommend Dr. Mackey or any of the medical professionals that share his office.|Husband been seeing Dr. MACKEY for 7 years.  He is very caring.|Wonderful staff, always smiling and helpful!  And each of the Doctors that work with Dr. Mackey are kind and considerate.  They work well with you to help you live more comfortably, and respectfully so.  I've been going there for many years and gladly travel across the city for them.  I couldn't ask for better medical care!
*
*I left this review 4 years ago, and had my 10 year anniversary with Dr Mackey and his staff.  I can still say, confidently, that they're an amazing medical practice.  My needs are long-term, and they've been handled professionally and comfortably every month I've been there.  I really wouldn't recommend any other Doctors in the field!|Awesome doctor. Dr. Mackey, his two Physician Assistants, nurses, and other supporting staff are courteous, kind, friendly, thorough, and care deeply about their patients. Their problem solving skills are unmatched. The office runs smoothly and efficiently, with short waiting times, and plenty of time available for patient visits. If you follow their common sense rules, you be in good hands. I highly recommend to anyone who deals with disabling pain issues.|I've been a patient of Dr Mackey's for over 5 years.  Needing pain relief is not something anyone wants, but this clinic has always made me feel welcome and cared for.  They actively listen and make changes to your care when the current plan isn't working.  I love these people.  :)|I've been with the office of Dr. Mackey several months, and am impressed with the high level of care, expertise and professionalism. It is truly helpful and reassuring knowing that whether a person is managing chronic pain, post-surgical pain, or both simultaneously, they are there to help you get through it in the best, and safest way for you as an individual. If anyone needs a place with excellent care, and is willing to put in the effort outside the office to help with what you can control (good nutrition, gentle exercise, good sleep habits and positive thinking), I believe that together as a team, a successful plan can be achieved. I've seen Jamie several times, and he is so compassionate and very knowledgeable. Thank you,|I was Dr Mackey patient 4 yrs ago. He was my pain doctor for 4 yrs, never had any issues. He managed my pain quite well. After I lost my ins, I had to move and hated losing him and his awesome staff. Never did they treat me wrong. They always greeted me with respect. I miss him and his staff. I totally recommend him to anyone who needs a caring doctor.

Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists is committed to providing personalized treatment plans that address chronic pain conditions at their source. At Comprehensive Pain Management of Oklahoma, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates the latest evidence-based treatments, including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. My 1st visit was today.  I was a bit appearance due to the reviews on here .
I'm so glad I followed and instinct and we ahead with my appointment.
Could not have asked for a more detailed visit.  Staff was so kind and concerned about all details.
Dr . Nilson was so attentive,  took her time to understand my medical history. Went over every detail so I know exactly what to expect in the future.
I'm thrilled that I have the medical practice in my life now.|They absolutely need more workers. We sat in the room for 3 hours waiting for a SHOT. The person giving the shots was doing a procedure while a room full of patients waited for hours. They definitely need to change their ways.|Dr Nilson and her staff have always been exceptional. Between the ease of scheduling and how Dr Nilson truly listens to you and cares about your well being and comfort. It's amazing to have a doctor and her staff feel like family. I recommend Dr Nilson to everyone I see that is in need of a pain doctor.|Please read all the reviews before you go here. Because all of those bad reviews are absolutely true! I ignored them and went here, what an awful experience. I do not recommend this place at all. From the doctor, to the front desk, to the nurse, to the "office manager". They are all awful. Every single one of them are beyond rude, and outwardly disrespectful. Not one single one of them care about their patients. I promise you that. I've witnessed them being hateful to others but never thought they would do it to me. But they did. I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!! Please do your research before coming to this miserable place!|Myself and my sister followed Hannah Goodspeed here after Dr. Drabek at SSM retired.  Hannah is GREAT but as far as the doctors go and the staff especially on the south side go, it is absolutely horrible.  We have had more than one bad experience here, the latest being today.  I believe we are going elsewhere after our next visit with Hannah.|I was with the St Anthony's team when Hannah Goodspeed was with Dr. Drabek.  When Dr. Drabek retired I followed her to here.  Hannah makes you feel like she is very concerned about your care.  On my first new members appointment I had to have it with Dr. Blick.  He was knowledgeable and professional and I know since this was my first visit he doesn't know me, but with him it felt like i was being rushed.  I did find out that when the move took place comprehensive gained something like 600 new patients so the rushing I understand, but Hannah always makes you feel like when you are in with her you are her one and only patient.  I might be a little impartial because if it were not for Hannah I might not be here today.  I had a surgery go bad about a year ago and she pointed out that I needed to go back to the surgeon and make them see me and when I went it turned out that I had an infection in my gut that had gone septic.  The day I found out that Dr. Drabek was retiring, I was sad but when she asked me if I wanted to follow her I never had to think about that.  She was concerned if I would drive to Edmond, that didn't change my mind.  When I find excellent doctors I will stay with them even if I had to drive a little farther because a good doctor can be easy to find but an excellent doctor is hard to find.|I had one of the worst experiences ever with this place.. I noticed in their pre registration paperwork it mentioned in 3 or 4 places about patients being rude to doctor nillson and staff threatening immediate dismissal. In reality. The first visit I sat there in my wheelchair and took it, the second visit 3-5 minutes in it she started her behavior again. I told her the disrespect stops now she said you can leave an find another pain Doctor, at that point I proceeded to leave she was yelling obscenities across the office at me and telling her staffing i wouldn't be coming back. She's very bossy and downright hateful has a terrible attitude with patients who are already in severe pain ... Book an appointment there at your own risk..!!!!!|Doc and her staff a great to work with. Just follow all the given guidelines and rules in your care and you'll be fine. As a Disabled Marine I approve and recommend Dr Nilson and her staff for your care.

Emad Wasif, MD in Tulsa, Oklahoma provides specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. As the leading practitioner at Oklahoma Chronic Pain, Dr. Wasif combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Serving the greater Tulsa area, his practice has become a trusted destination for those seeking effective pain management solutions tailored to their unique needs.

At Oklahoma Chronic Pain, Dr. Wasif offers a multidisciplinary approach to treating various chronic pain conditions. His expertise encompasses interventional pain procedures, medication management, and collaborative care plans designed to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients benefit from individualized treatment strategies that consider their complete medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Wasif believes in establishing meaningful doctor-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. Each consultation begins with a thorough evaluation to understand the patient's pain experience, followed by a detailed discussion of available treatment options. This collaborative approach ensures patients are active participants in their care journey, leading to better outcomes and improved quality of life.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 10124 S Sheridan Rd in Tulsa, Oklahoma Chronic Pain features modern equipment and comfortable treatment spaces designed with patient comfort in mind. The clinic's convenient location makes it accessible to residents throughout Tulsa and surrounding communities, with ample parking available for all patients.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Emad Wasif, patients can call +1 918-986-7533 or visit the practice website at http://www.oklahomachronicpain.com/ for more information about services and appointment availability. The clinic welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans.
column38: Rachel Simmons|Ron-ba Sehon|Bobby Rogers|kathy alsobrook|Sue Stoll|Becky Blackwell|Lenda Hand|John Mullins
column40: I have been seeing Dr. Wasif for about 6 years due to chronic neck and back pain. I suffer from autoimmune diseases as well. I see several specialists for my health issues but Dr. Wasif is above all the rest. Dr. Wasif takes his time to explain everything to you and discuss risks/benefits of treatments and medications. Dr. Wasif also cares about you as a person, always asking how you're doing, how your children are and actually remembers things about you. Dr. Wasif is an amazing person and Dr. I would recommend him to anyone!|We have been going for 5 years to Dr.Wasif and his wonderful staff with great results. I am not curable but he has made me more comfortable  than anyone and I have had mine since 2004. Lots of other places and treatments but not with alot of relief. This great Dr.has helped me more than all the years of others before. He continues to come up with new technology to help me with my pain. His office and his faithful and compassionate staff are an extention of our family.  I wish I've could give a 10 for excellence.|If I could I would give them a 10 star review! I have been going to Dr Wasif approximately 3 years now. I receive the shots,  in my back which for me has been working! Here's a five star to Michell front desk, ( forgive me if I spelt your name wrong) I was suppose to pick up my medication but when I got there they were out of stock and every pharmacy within a fifteen mile radius. So of course I was not happy with that. I left a message for Dr Wasif and staff on Sunday night. Monday morning first thing Michell called me and was so nice and completely understood my stress and was apologetic about what had happen, which was out of her hands in the first place but she really cares and I could tell with her kind words and reassurance! Dr Wasif went above and beyond to get my medication I needed and I  got it in my hand by 2p.m. today Monday. He was busy with other patients but took a moment to help with my situation on his lunch time!!Today I was able to get them even though I had to drive 30 minutes each way he HELPED me! If you're looking for a place where you can get relief from your pain! He has a lot of options and he diligently will work with you to give you your Life back! Dr Wasif and Michell and staff are hands down the best pain relief place in all of Tulsa and in all of Oklahoma!! I've tried a couple before I found Dr wasif... one more thing when you go in to do your procedure back, neck, knees, etc he and staff makes you feel like family and does not just rush you through he talks to you and helps you not to be so nervous about the shots at least to me!!! I will always recommend them!!! Thank you Dr Wasif and Michell!!! Now I'm getting back to work!!!!|First visit today~ I'm super excited to start treatments with Dr Wasif what a great guy, in a league of his own. He also really takes the time to educate you and offer real options. Looking forward to feeling better the 29th ;)|I have been a patient of Dr. Wasif since April 2022 after my previous pain mgt doctor retired.  Dr. Wasif has done wonders in treating my chronic pain in a short time.  The medications he prescribes are spot on & the epidurals help a lot. He is very personable & is a very innovative doctor.  I am blessed to have found him & highly recommend him.  His office staff are great also.|I have been to 7 Neurologist since moving to Oklahoma!  I have been on every medication and other forms of Injections, inhalers, Botox, Nerve blocking and physical therapy! And chiropractor.    And not one knew what to do other then try to use medications.  After going to Dr. Wasif, he knew one thing to look for. I have chronic pain all day and every day.  I suffer from all forms of migraines, and the last three years chronic neck and back of head pain.   He has been great, I would recommend him to anyone.  As I find I am not curable, but he is trying to make me more pain comfortable.   Thank you Dr. Wasif.|Dr. Wasif and his entire staff, including Drew, are the epitome of excellent service and physician care. The entire office is professional,  courteous,  and respectful of patients' time and individual needs. Highly recommend this physician and office!|With an array of health problems that have included trips to the Mayo clinic I can sincerely say that Dr. Wasif is the best doctor I have ever seen. He doesn't just want to treat symptoms but rather is concerned with making the patient better long term or getting them to the best they can be health wise. Also, his nurse is great and Amanda at the front desk is really top notch.

  • Patient education and self-management strategies

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets our practice apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our physicians take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and explain treatment options in terms you can understand. We work collaboratively with your primary care provider and other specialists to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of your health and wellbeing.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 405-242-4100. Our office is located at 4409 N Kickapoo Ave, Shawnee, OK 74804, United States. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all patients in need.

State-of-the-Art Facility

column38: Tonya Louks|Megan McMahan|Mathew Grover|Cheryl Guest|Pat Delaine|jason wiggins|Celina Martin|Wes Lane
column40:
I have Complex Regional Pain Syndrome.  Unlike some of the pain specialists I've seen in the past, Dr Kelly takes the time to listen to me.  I don't feel like I am just a number.  The rest of his staff is great as well.  Anytime I send them a message, they respond very quickly.|I had my first visit at Oklahoma Pain Center this week! Unfortunately, I have been run through the mill when it comes to finding a good doctor. If you live in chronic pain, you know the anxiety of finding not only a doctor to treat you but to CARE. I am from Texas and have been having trouble finding a new pain management specialist here in OK. Right out of the gate, the staff was so warm and inviting. Definition of "Southern Hospitality" . I'm sure they knew I was nervous, but they couldn't have made me me feel more comfortable. Vivian specifically, went above and beyond for me. Just by getting to talk with her for a few minutes, I knew I wasn't anyone special, she just has a God given gift to make each customer she encounters feel like you've known each other your whole life!

When I met Dr. Blake Kelly, he was VERY black and white with me. Which as a patient, I appreciated because most doctors will just say anything to get you out and their next patient in. Dr. Kelly spent 2 hours with me listening to my story and doing his best trying to educate and guide me!

As a younger new patient, I have a little homework I have to do to HOPEFULLY get the relief I am looking for. However, I dont mind the homework at all knowing that I have a doctor that is willing to run behind the entire rest of his day to make sure I am feeling supported. The last time I had a doctor like that was in 2016 and I didn't think I would ever find another one.

I dont know what my future holds at OPC, but I can say that if I end up not getting the treatment I am seeking, it wont be because the doctor just doesnt care or didnt listen to me! In the meantime, I look forward to my future visits here and am so grateful for the hope that they gave me. I am going to hold on to it for as long as I can!

STRONGLY recommend Dr. Kelly Blake and his entire staff!|Dr. Kelly has been treating my wife for a few years now with a mystery condition that has felt like an episode of House. Over the last year she has been on a real downhill slide medically. He has been the rock to keep her going. Her other doctors care, so I don't want to downplay that, but are so busy they just honestly don't have the time for all the issues and day-to-day changes. Despite her high-needs Dr. Kelly has never left her to suffer and always pivots and adjusts medications to meet her needs. Most importantly he has never treated her like an inconvenience. His office staff is just as caring and Heather specifically has gone out of her way to help her.|Well managed chronic pain makes normal human functioning possible.  Without it, one is rendered unproductive, discouraged, and even hopeless.  Thank God for Dr. Kelly whose excellent pain management skills are only superseded by his genuine care for his patients.|The doctor and staff are very professional and caring. All my pain issues were addressed and taken seriously. As a new patient they were very thorough. Dr. Kelly listened and made himself available during the first week to answer my questions. I am doing better than I have in years thanks to him. I would recommend him to anyone needing relief from chronic pain.|I had to wait almost a month, than had to contact them for any information. At that time the receptionist inform me I needed to make another appointment with my referring physician pending further contact with Dr. Kelly, I was told that the phone call from them would be from a unknown number and not to miss it. I was relieved to have them contact me that same day. Upon receiving phone call it turned into a humiliating and degrading experience. I was informed they did a background check and criminal record, I did not consent to this as I was never informed of this process. I made poor choices over 8 years ago but I have since completed probation and paid any due fines. There has been no legal trouble since than. I have been in pain management for 6 months due to multiple surgeries resulting in a negligent driver hitting me. I do not abuse my medication, I never got to meet with Dr. Kelly, but due to this treatment I received in this phone call I highly recommend seeing another doctor. The lady was rude and condescending.|Dr Kelly made a great first impression. He listened and took his time explaining everything to me. He seemed very caring and like he truly wants to help his patients. I feel like he is looking out for what's best for me, and how to help me reach that goal. I appreciate the time he spent starting a plan. I feel encouraged. Thank you Dr Kelly!|I've been taking my elderly mother to Dr. Kelly now for at least a couple of years and Dr. Kelly and his staff have been outstanding! If I had the option for more stars, I'd give them. I've not met one staff member that hasn't been kind and caring to my mom - and she simply adores Dr. Kelly! My thanks to all of you. It's tough needing pain meds, but you and your staff light up my mom's heart with every visit. I'm deeply grateful.

Olympia Neurological Institute at Wagoner serves Wagoner, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with specialized neurological care. Our dedicated team provides comprehensive treatment for a wide range of conditions affecting the brain, spine, and nervous system. Located in the heart of Wagoner, our institute has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans and cutting-edge medical approaches.

At Olympia Neurological Institute, we deliver compassionate, timely care in pain management, neurological and behavioral health conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses both surgical and non-surgical treatment options for pain, brain, spine, and behavioral health conditions. Our philosophy centers on utilizing the least invasive treatment options available while maintaining the highest standards of medical care.

Expert Medical Team

Our facility is staffed by three highly qualified physicians and four experienced Advanced Practice Registered Nurses (APRNs) who specialize in neurology and psychiatric conditions. This team of professionals works collaboratively to ensure each patient receives individualized attention and treatment plans tailored to their specific needs.

Services and Approach

We offer comprehensive evaluations, diagnostic testing, and treatment plans for conditions including chronic pain, headaches, seizures, movement disorders, and various behavioral health issues. Our integrated approach considers both the physical and emotional aspects of neurological conditions, providing holistic care that addresses the complete well-being of our patients.

Visit Us

We look forward to providing you and your loved ones quality care in your time of need. Our facility is conveniently located at 1317 S Dewey Ave, Wagoner, OK 74467. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (918) 401-1002 or visit our website at olympiadoctors.com.
column11: Olympia Neurological Institute at Wagoner delivers compassionate timely care in pain management, neurological and behavioral health conditions. With three physicians and four experienced APRN we look forward to providing you and your loved ones quality care in your time of need.

column40:
Very, friendly from the front desk all the way through the visit.
Note the clinic is kept clean and sanitary.
When I was a new patient the staff became familiar with my medical records.
Dr. Baird was able to work around my needs to assess me.
When I needed an update to my spinal cord stimulator again Dr. Baird and his team were on top of the situation.
I very much enjoy the hometown feel of the clinic. Yet knowing if I need anything they are on top of it.
Oh and the staff will help, should an appointment need changed.
Also, I would add the main switchboard and office have been able to access my records in a tick and assist me with last minute issues. No frustration just a cheerful staff.
You'll find the main office, in Tulsa
just as nice and helpful.
Lastly parking is not a problem.
My only complaint is the chairs. Not comfortable at all.|Always quick and efficient. Kamil is just so thorough and sweet. She takes the time to listen and explains anything that needs to be explained. Brittany is just so sweet and kind. I love my everyone at the Wagoner clinic and Tulsa clinic. The nicest, most professional people ever. I couldn't ask for a better pain doctor and his staff.|Had a wonderful visit today as always my doctor Kamille Case, is awesome enjoy talking with her and she really listened and addresses my needs and accordingly and fast and finds solutions that help me. The staff is very helpful and friendly as always as well. So happy to have them as my doctors. 5 stars  awesome job guys thanks for everything|I've been a patient of Dr. Baird for several years.  I've also seen Dr. Camille Case in his office as well.  I've found them to be knowledgeable and truly concerned about my pain issues.  Their advice and methods of managing my pain from years of spinal issues and arthritis have kept me mobile and moving forward. The staff in Dr. Bairds office are enjoyable to interact with.
Thank you Dr.Baird & Staff for giving me a pleasant experience with caring individuals over the years. Deb Carlton|This clinic has been the biggest blessing. I ultimately came here because my doctor moved out of state with little to no-notice. I was so stressed out then, but in hindsight, it was the best thing that could've happened. I say that because the doctors I've worked with here have always gone above and beyond. If they are unsure on something, they'll consult other doctors and do extensive research. I have a complicated medical history. I wasn't supposed to live past my 17th birthday. I had a Make A Wish as a kid and several surgeries. Thankfully, due those surgeries, I am still alive & I'm able to live a productive & meaningful life. The doctors at this clinic have helped me so much. I had the honor of having Savannah Doughty as my doctor for a couple years. She worked so diligently for me & helped guide me through a pregnancy. Now I work with Kamile & she has been great. I can't say enough how great this clinic has been.|They are always polite and will listen to what you are going through and help find solutions for your pain. I have been refused in many pain clinics but not there. They welcomed me and did their best to find solutions to my problems even with medicine sensitivity they were able to find me help.|I have been going a few years now and I love the staff and Dr's.  Was glad they were in Wagoner. I didn't like driving to Tulsa. The office is easy to get to. I would suggest anyone with pain to try this place.|100% Recommend Kamile Case. She listens, explains, recommends things to help with circumstances that are happening in our lives. She has got my medication regulated to where I can make it thru day to day life with as much ease as possible. I am happy ur office has made it to our little town

Traci White, M.D. at Utica Park Clinic serves Tulsa, Oklahoma with specialized pain medicine expertise. Dr. White combines over a decade of experience in pain management with a compassionate, holistic approach to treating patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. As a board-certified Family Physician with advanced training in Pain Medicine, she understands that each patient's experience with pain is unique and requires individualized attention and care plans.

Dr. White develops customized treatment plans that address not just the physical symptoms of pain but also its emotional and psychological impacts. Her comprehensive approach recognizes that chronic pain affects all aspects of a patient's life, from sleep quality to daily activities and overall well-being. By focusing on personalized solutions, Dr. White helps patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Education and Credentials

With impressive academic credentials, Dr. White earned her medical degree from the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine. She further refined her expertise through an anesthesiology residency and specialized pain management fellowship at Washington University, providing her with advanced techniques and knowledge in pain intervention strategies.

Patient-Centered Care

Currently accepting new patients, Dr. White welcomes those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Her practice accepts most insurance plans, making quality pain management accessible to the Tulsa community. The comfortable, modern facilities at Utica Park Clinic provide an ideal environment for comprehensive pain treatment.

Location and Contact Information

Dr. White practices at Utica Park Clinic located at 6802 S Olympia Ave, Suite 100, Tulsa, OK 74132. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available pain management services, patients can call 918-447-9300. Additional information about Dr. White's practice and approach to pain medicine can be found on the clinic's website at https://uticaparkclinic.com/physicians/traci-white-md.

Dr. White obtained her medical degree from the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine and completed her anesthesiology residency and pain management fellowship at Washington University. She is currently accepting new patients and accepts most insurance plans. To schedule an appointment or for more information, please call 918-447-9300.

column40:
Dr White is the best. During first consultation she was interested in me, not in a rush,
reviewed my MRI and expressed her concerns.
Dr White was very compassionate about my symptoms.
I have had multiple back injections in the past from others, but Dr White's procedure seems to have longer lasting results. Very pleased|I have been seeing Dr Traci White since 2013 and I have found her to be professional, knowledgeable and compassionate. I believe she has done everything she can to relieve my pain. I am so much more mobile and independent than I was when I first started with Dr White. Her and her staff have truly made my life better and easier. I have always highly recommended her and will continue to do so.|Do not use this facility. I was referred here for a spinal steroid injection which I have had multiple times at another facility back in Texas. I experienced multiple issues.
1- They experienced a "glitch" in scheduling and it took 3 weeks after receiving the request from my surgeon to actually let me discuss scheduling the shot. They did apologize for this error.
2- At the time of the injection I could tell this wasn't normal and I let them know the pain was much worse and they could not care less.
3- I called in the next day and had to call 4 times before someone would actually speak to me instead of trying to pass me off. The doctor did call me back but didn't address pain concerns, just the allergic reaction to the medication I had been given
4- 1 week later I am still unable to hold my newborn or rock him due to the pain these people caused and they are not interested in having me come in for pain management they instructed me to visit the local ER instead.

I would highly suggest finding another facility as these people do not care if they cause you pain and will do nothing to help relieve it.|My daughter has serve physical and mental disabilities and was needing injection for her back pain.  I have seen some reviews about Dr White and staff not being pleasant or having a good bed side manner and I can say I had the complete opposite experience. My daughter has a true phobia of needles and the staff was beyond understanding an patient with her.  They not only took care of her and took the extra time needed they took care of my wife and myself as well.  They were kind, informative, and understanding.  They adapted their approach to accommodate my daughter specific needs.  Every person we talked to was this way.  My interactions with Dr White and her staff is amazing and I feel blessed to have them care for my daughter.|I made an attempt to get scheduled with Traci White, MD for a cervical neck injection following a 4 day hospitalization for pain control. Her office did not call me back after 3 days of leaving messages. I drove to the office and was told the phone lines were down and  I needed a referral. I obtained the referral and had to call several times to get scheduled. Spoke with Serena who said they had me scheduled but it was for the wrong area and wrong procedure. The referral was resent  and again could not get through to the office. Once I did get through the call was given to Serena who told me I was scheduled on Thursday and would be getting a call with the time. Did not receive the call , left several messages. Finally I got through to the front office and they gave the call to Serena who was very rude, raised her voice with me (I never raised my voice with her) she told me they didn't take my insurance which had already been confirmed that they did and when challenged on that she hung up. I called back and left a message for the practice manager after confirming with my insurance company that they are in network and that NO requests for insurance authorization or confirmation had been attempted by this office. The practice manager never returned my call.  I work in healthcare and this is absolutely unacceptable. The physician herself may be skilled but it takes a team to care for a patient. Do not put your care in the hands of these people. This is an embarrassment to the healthcare profession.|I have had the worst pain since my neck surgery. I am here to tell you Dr. White  is magical. She has helped me so much with the pain. 5 stars is no where near enough. I always tell her she's my hero. If you have pain and you need relief please call her get a referral she is the best!!|I have been under Dr. White's care for about 5 years.  I have found her to very knowledgeable and feel like she always seeks to help me receive the best pain relief possible.  She treats me with respect, listens to my concerns, and responds with her thoughts and recommendations.  I completely trust her with my care and plan to continue under her care for as long as I need help with chronic pain.  Additionally, I have always found the office staff to be friendly, competent and helpful.|My wife and I are both patients of Dr White. We have been under her care for many years. I have gone through 2 neck, 1 shoulder and back repair due to an auto accident years ago. She has performed many procedures and medication therapy for me with great success. She is caring and compassionate. The entire staff at the office and Spine hospital are caring and compassionate professionals. Don't agree with DEA  and state law makers on pain medication controls, but Dr White and staff are the best.
