Mercy Pain Management - Ardmore serves patients throughout Ardmore, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently in the heart of Ardmore, our team of board-certified pain specialists works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, focusing on improving quality of life and restoring functionality.

At Mercy Pain Management, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management treatments. Our approach integrates evidence-based medical practices with innovative therapies to address various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Our Facility and Team

Patient-Centered Approach

column3:
Neuropathy Treatment Clinic of Oklahoma serves Oklahoma City and surrounding areas with specialized care for patients suffering from neuropathic conditions. As a leading pain management center in the region, our clinic has established a reputation for combining innovative treatments with compassionate care. Our dedicated medical professionals understand the debilitating nature of nerve pain and work diligently to provide effective solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At our Oklahoma City facility, we address a comprehensive range of conditions including diabetic neuropathy, shingles-related nerve pain, sciatica, and various forms of joint, back, and neck pain. Our treatment protocols are designed to target the underlying causes of neuropathic symptoms rather than merely masking them. Patients experiencing burning sensations, numbness, tingling, or muscle weakness find significant relief through our specialized approaches that focus on nerve regeneration and pain reduction.

Our Patient-First Philosophy

What distinguishes our practice is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We begin with thorough evaluations to understand the specific nature of each patient's condition, followed by the development of personalized treatment plans. Our goal extends beyond temporary symptom relief—we aim to improve overall quality of life through comprehensive wellness strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of living with neuropathy.

Advanced Treatment Modalities

Our clinic employs state-of-the-art technologies and evidence-based methodologies that have demonstrated success in treating even the most challenging neuropathic conditions. We particularly excel in managing diabetic neuropathy, offering hope to patients who have previously been told their condition was untreatable or irreversible.

If you're struggling with neuropathic pain or related symptoms, contact Neuropathy Treatment Clinic of Oklahoma at +1 405-347-7390 to schedule a consultation. Our clinic is conveniently located at 6001 NW 139th St Suite 104, Oklahoma City, OK 73142. For more information about our services and treatment options, visit our website at https://neuropathyok.com/.
column11: The Neuropathy Treatment Clinic of Oklahoma, a premier neuropathy clinic and pain management center in Oklahoma City, specializes in innovative and effective neuropathy treatments. Our expert team is committed to alleviating a wide range of conditions such as shingles, back pain, joint pain, Sciatica pain, neck pain, knee pain, and particularly diabetic neuropathy. We employ a patient-first approach, focusing on long-term relief from symptoms like pain, burning, numbness, tightness, and tingling. We don't just treat symptoms; our comprehensive wellness plans are designed to improve your overall health. If you're seeking effective neuropathy treatment and pain management solutions in Oklahoma City, schedule an appointment with us today.

column3:
Tulsa Pain Consultants in Tulsa, Oklahoma provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the greater Tulsa metropolitan area. Established with a mission to improve quality of life through effective pain relief strategies, our board-certified specialists combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We take pride in our multidisciplinary approach that considers each patient's unique circumstances, creating personalized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies.

At Tulsa Pain Consultants, we offer specialized treatments for a wide range of pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive techniques designed to provide lasting relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering our patients through education and active participation in their treatment journey. Our team takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, ensuring patients can make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has helped countless Tulsa residents reclaim their lives from debilitating pain.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 10810 E 45th St #400, Tulsa, OK 74146, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The comfortable, welcoming environment reflects our commitment to patient comfort and clinical excellence. column40:
I was referred here from my surgeon, to try out less invasive options. So glad I was!  I inaccurately thought "pain management" clinics were just focused on refilling opioids. Instead, I received targeted treatments to reduce pain that I never knew were available. I have a lot of confidence in Dr. Martucci and his team. Thank you for helping me regain movement with less pain!|Very dependable and caring.
I have been living with back pain for years. I can't imagine how miserable I would be without a skilled and truly compassionate doctor and staff helping me along. Sadly, there is no magic wand to eliminate my pain or anything that can take me back to the day before my injury.
I am grateful for Dr Martucci's commitment to patient care in spite of the limitations of insurance.  I am grateful for this practice and encourage you if you are not a patient but are searching for a doctor this is a really dependable place if you're serious about your own care.|First, do not get me wrong.  I love Dr. Martucci.  I believe he truly cares about your pain.  I was in for a procedure, but had a question about a most recent MRI.  He did not have to look at it at the time, but he did glance at it. He mention that there are some different  tactics that we can use.my dissatisfaction came with my discharge.   I am a LONG time patient at Tulsa Pain, and I, myself, had had no major issues.  However, all three of my drivers have, and I figured it was time to say something because I know for a fact, I was in no shape to leave yet, but I was made to.  I am extremely upset about this last visit.  I tried calling the office, but got nowhere.  Maybe if the right person sees my post, I can get some answers.|I had my last procedure with them on 2/13/24
There's a reason it's my last appointment. If they want to allow the patient to continue to have pain, because insurance guidelines require time between injections, and the office staff informed me the doctor will not see me until insurance pays again.....
Why not do a better job during the injection so there isn't any pain.
Instead they cut back on the amount of medicine being injected.
I know because I feel it as it goes into my tissue!!!
Dr revalis wasn't very easy without sedation but I walked out minutes afterwards and had zero pain.
Now dr martucci is a nice enough man for sure.
But he doesn't do the job up to the standards they used to have there before the split!
If you're having pain I recommend staying away from here.
Good luck to you|We've been with this office a very long time. They are able to provide services our local clinics cannot do as an "all-in-one" service. However, they seem to have entirely too many patients crunched into too little of time. These appointments always take all day, doesn't matter if we schedule early in the morning or early afternoon, it's still an all day ordeal. The last visit was probably the worst (even though they've progressively gotten worse), we showed up early, they took awhile to call him back, when it was his time, they blew his vein and didn't fix it. They decided to go ahead with the procedure which he should've been asleep for but wasn't and felt the entire thing. I call this a fail, a huge one. I've called around to see if a closer to home option was available but unfortunately, nobody offers all the same services. This is completely devastating considering these treatments are needed for back degeneration relief. And to top it off, his prescription wasn't even called in. It just seems their services have gone downhill as their practice grows. There is a lack of care missing.|Don't waste your time the staff doesn't care don't want to help you said if you don't like then don't come

Had the time to call me and harassed me for leaving review but didn't have the time to help me|Took my friend here for a procedure that she needed a driver for. MOST of the people were very nice. BUT, Amanda W was a complete b*t*h to us from the minute she called us back. I could hear her talking to other patients and she was completely nice to them all. So why is? We done absolutely nothing to deserve that treatment. I heard her asking othe pts if they got relief from their last procedure and how much it helped. My friend was asked zero questions about her last procedure. She just threw an IPad in her face and said initial and sign her. My friend and I both work in Dr.'s offices and I can guarantee no pt in the office I work in would ever be treated the way we were treated here. And if one of us were ever that rude to a pt we would be fired on the spot. I would never use this office for anything. And I will voice my opinion to the Dr.'s I work for so maybe they will reconsider where our referrals are sent.

It's sad that one person can ruin a first impression like that.|I have been a patient here for 5 years they have always treated me great always willing to help and truly concerned for me. I have nothing but great things to say about everyone that works here. Dr. Korbe is so smart, caring, and truly wants to help me as safely as possible. That's saying a lot because I have a lot of compounding medical issues that makes it hard to manage them all and still try to get me pain relief as well as following the ever so changing laws but he does it. I think most doctors would have given up on me by now but he is still trying to help me and I will never be able to thank him enough. Great doctors are hard to come by and he truly is an amazing doctor who wants to help his patients.

column2: T. Luke Cramer, MD & David P. Ellis, MD
column3:
T. Luke Cramer, MD & David P. Ellis, MD in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma provides specialized pain management services to patients throughout the greater OKC metro area. Our board-certified physicians bring decades of combined experience in treating chronic pain conditions through comprehensive, individualized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

At our practice, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Dr. Cramer and Dr. Ellis utilize the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies to address a wide range of pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary approach may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health strategies.

Our Facility

Located at 1226 N Shartel Ave in Oklahoma City, our modern clinic is designed with patient comfort in mind. We've created a welcoming environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns and receive compassionate care. Our central location makes us accessible to patients throughout Oklahoma County and surrounding areas.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Cramer or Dr. Ellis, please call us at (405) 232-8003. You can also visit our website at www.ellispainmanagementok.com to learn more about our services and treatment options. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans.

We are committed to helping you find relief from chronic pain through personalized care and advanced treatment options. Our goal is not just to manage your pain, but to help you return to the activities you enjoy and improve your overall quality of life.

column40: If I could rate this office 0/5 stars I would. When I came to this office I told them I did not want any medication, just a nerve ablation. They started the process by giving me useless injections and then when the injections they gave did not help they put me on medication (NOT AN OPIATE). Then when I called and asked if I could speak with them about an increase because the pain was so bad I wanted to die.. they dismissed me from the clinic and called the police on me. They said that my MRI had nothing on it when they dismissed me and then called me back to tell me they did find something but there's nothing they could do for me. Don't waste your time or your money on this doctors office. The staff is rude and has no respect for people. They will treat you like a liar if you are suffering from pain they cannot see. Also, the whole place is decorated like a church and they constantly play Christian music, very ironic for a clinic that treats their patients like drug seekers even when they told you they didn't want any pills.|Buddy you are unprofessional you and your whole staff  your staff told me you could see me every 3 months then your nurse comes out and says the opposite you have wasted my time. Your nurse comes out with an attitude i need to know there names really i am a business owner do you think i will remember there names infact you should have that recorded  wow i miss over 2 hrs of work mabe i should bill you  again unprofessional|Absolutely phenomenal. My mother has lots of history in terms of pain management. She saw Dr Kramer and had nothing but good things to say. Absolutely phenomenal bed side manners. No rush for the first appointment. I seriously recommend this pain clinic. Keep up the great work!|The lady named Lisa that works in the office the answers phones and whatnot, well she thought she was on the other line with the business office talking crap on me saying that I'm getting on her last nerve, she is not very professional at all and this just happened a few minutes ago, and saying well she thinks that we're trying to get a lot of money out of her, because they are trying to charge me $109 instead of a $50 copay, as I had my insurance company on the line with me doing three-way and they hurt every bit of it as well, my insurance says there should not be an extra $59 only $50 copay and that's it, so I believe someone is pocketing some money or they don't know what the hell they're doing|Absolutely amazing staff. All of the PA's I've seen have been so kind & very personable. They don't rush you and they actually listen to you. Amanda Barritt is one of the very best. They have experience working with complex pain issues, I have a rare connective tissue disorder that can wreak havoc on my body & causes a lot of other issues that all stem from the disease. It can put me in significant pain, especially if everything flares up at once. Everyone from the check-in staff/reception, office manager, the nurses (I love Jodi!) PA's, & Dr. Cramer have been very kind to me and have treated me with nothing but compassion and care. If you are worried because of the negative reviews others have left- don't listen to them. I usually read reviews before meeting with a new doctor. I have to see a few specialists because of my rare complex condition. I know how scary and difficult it can be sometimes to find someone who will listen. They really do. I believe I've been with them for about a year now. They went above and beyond for me. I had an appointment on the anniversary of my fathers passing and one of the nurses gave me some really heartfelt advice that meant so much to me. These are really good people who work here. Don't let the negative reviews fool you.|I'm just baffled about the reviews I'm reading. The office is nice and clean. The reception area was nothing but kind. They went out of their way to make me feel comfortable. Jessica, the PA, was so thorough and listened to everything I said. She did a complete assessment and offered more insight into where my pain is originating from than most doctors. They obtained all of my records before my appointment and all I had to bring was my ID and insurance. They are comprehensive with their treatment. Not just throwing pills at people. Really trying to make your quality of life better.|I was referred by my neurosurgeon for epidural injections. I was told today my appointment was at 11:45 got there just to be told my appointment was at 12:45 and they tell patients to arrive 1 hour early for paperwork. After finishing my paperwork in less than 10 min while sitting in the waiting room, another patient walked in who was scheduled next week and was told they had time to do a walk in today and he was taken back before I was. After being taken back and providing a urine sample, I was told I needed to fill out different paperwork because I was given the wrong set. When the PA finally saw me (in fairness to her, she was apologetic and friendly), I was told that for the epidural injections BCBS was out of network and I'd have to pay cash price for them or I could be referred elsewhere. This is unethical practice and borderline insurance fraud to accept a patient whose insurance is only partially in-network just to be able to bill an office visit and get paid for that, knowing that you won't be able to accept my insurance for the pain management I was referred in for.|Cramer is good Dr helped me but unfortunately I had quit going there staff trying charge me every 5 minutes from one missed visit wow 25 then 59 I'm on SSI can't afford him so for all gl

column3:
Rita M. Hancock, MD serves Oklahoma City, OK with specialized non-narcotic pain management services. Dr. Hancock's practice stands apart through her gentle approach to pain relief, focusing on osteopathic manipulation techniques that avoid the traditional "popping and cracking" associated with some manual therapies. Her patient-centered care addresses a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions through evidence-based treatments designed to restore function and improve quality of life.

Dr. Hancock's primary treatment modality is Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment (OMT/OMM), a hands-on approach that works to normalize soft tissue tension, improve joint and rib cage mobility, and reduce pain throughout the body. This gentle technique has proven effective for spine pain, headaches, TMJ disorders, and various other musculoskeletal complaints. Complementing these manual therapies, she offers targeted trigger point injections for soft tissue pain that notably contain no steroids, providing patients with relief while minimizing potential side effects.

Diagnostic Expertise

Beyond treatment, Dr. Hancock specializes in electrical EMG testing to accurately diagnose nerve and muscle conditions. This diagnostic capability allows her to identify specific issues such as carpal tunnel syndrome, pinched spinal nerves, and other neurological disorders, ensuring that treatment plans address the root cause of patients' symptoms rather than just managing pain.

Practice Information

Patients seeking non-narcotic pain management solutions can visit Dr. Hancock at her practice located at 1601 SW 89th St, Suite E-200, Oklahoma City, OK 73159. For appointments or additional information, contact her office at (405) 900-5300 or visit ritahancockmd.com to learn more about her unique approach to pain management and diagnostic services.
column11: Dr. Hancock's practice focus is NON-NARCOTIC treatment with osteopathic manipulation (OMT or OMM), which is a gentle, hands-on technique that can normalize soft tissue tension, improve range of motion of the joints and rib cage, reduce spine and other pains, reduce some types of headaches and TMJ pain, and alleviate other areas of discomfort, as well. NO popping or cracking is involved! She also offers trigger point injections for soft tissue pain, and these shots do NOT include steroids. Her other area of focus is on electrical "EMG" testing to diagnose nerve and muscle problems, carpal tunnel, pinched nerves in the spine, and other nerve disorders.

I sincerely get it a no call no show but it was definitely not on purpose. I am not ranting just don't understand. I made a mistake and I even apologized!|Dr. Hancock's treatments are AMAZING!  After two (2) double laminectomies I was faced with the options of spinal fusion or "trying Dr. Hancock's services."  To say that she "specializes in trigger point injections and osteopathic manual manipulation" is an understatement in every sense of the word.  Her work ethic, capabilities, commitment to patient satisfaction and ability to deliver Best in Class soft tissue pain care and relief has given me back my life and provided me with the relief that takes surgery off-the-table for good!  I trust Dr. Hancock to give me the best there is to offer from non-surgical and non-narcotic spinal care that is NEXT-TO-NONE.  She puts a HAPPY tear in my eye, a smile on my face and a skip in my step after each visit.  Thank YOU, Dr. Hancock, for giving me the knowledge and feeling of a life that is pain free; that can be enjoyed by and as a direct result from the remarkable care which you deliver.  You're simply THE BEST!|For the last 3 years I've been dealing with pain and trying so many different methods of treatment for relief. Within 2 appointments Dr. Hancock has significantly improved my pain, I haven't felt this way in years. She's very knowledgeable and passionate about her work and cares so much for her patients. Dr Hancock went over all my scans and even called the surgeon who worked on me and the radiologist who wrote the report for my scans.

I'll be forcing my husband to start learning OMT himself, but until then I'll be seeing Dr. Hancock. column48: Do I need a reference  For service
column49: Hi Nette. It depends on a person's insurance plan! Some (e.g. Tricare/Military, HMOs, & some other plans) require a PCP to send us a "referral," and other types of insurance (Worker's Comp) requires an adjustor or case manager to pre-approve the visit, while personal injury cases (e.g. car wrecks) involve a different type of special paperwork. Your best bet is to call our office and we'll walk you through it.

column40:
Shady "pain" clinic capitalizing on prerequisite injections (maximizing their profits off your insurance) in order to prescribe your medication. When I refused injections the problems began with their willingness to help.

When I found a better doctor and switched offices they filed a lawsuit against me claiming I owed them thousands. I had insurance the entire time I was seeing them. Their lawsuit claimed I owed them $10k+, that's extortion.

The injections that many pain clinics offer are designed to be given 1-2 times a year, not monthly. Any clinic giving monthly nerve block injections are over using this medicine. Uncommon side effects are more the norm when drug guidelines are ignored by doctors.

It's sad how predatory medical clinics become when someone recovering from a near death experience owes them $100 and cannot pay because they didn't have a job and couldn't walk or stand unassisted.

Avoid these predators unless you're looking for a legal pill pusher and are willing to let them bleed your health insurance company on monthly unnecessary injection expenses.

The owners got booted from their last clinic for shady practices. The DEA should shut this place/person down.|Caring, actually trying to find a way to fix  this situation.   Both Dr.Brandon and Dr. Do are very knowledgeable about pain and options that that remedy my pain.  They don't just run me through the check list  and then they can't do anything more.
Their support staff also great.  They make feel comfortable about doctors and the plans that are being laid out.  John and Joel are easy to talk to and they update my file about everything I need to talk to Dr about.  Thanks for everything! 10 is my score:)
.|I've been going to Seva a couple years now. They help me with pain relief more than just pain meds, they offer alternatives to help with pain so I don't hurt as bad and need less meds. They listen so that theyre able to get the procedures best to help. Dr Do is amazing. The nurses right down to the people that take the phone calls seem to work together  to help me feel better. They listen when I have questions and take great care of me.|Seva Med Care, Providers and staff are exceptional!  The waiting area is never full, the wait is never long and the customer service is out of this world!  Dr.Brandon Bailey is exceptional!  Thank you Seva Med care!|Dr. Do is a Wonderful Dr. He is kind and caring.  He suggested for me to try the Peripheral Nerve Stimulator for my chronic Sacroilliac Joint Pain.  I did the trial and it helped about 50% so I'm looking forward to getting it permanently placed in December.  In February it will be 20 yrs since my injury to my Left Sacroilliac Joint so to finally got some relief after trying everything else is a Miracle.|I highly recommend SEVA Medcare and Dr. Do.. Dr. Do is a Very Good , Highly Competent Doctor in addition to being caring, patient and willing to work with you to get your needs met..The entire staff is very pleasant and helpful.. column40:
The reviews make sense now.  Spent 2 weeks attempting to return the calls to set up the appointment.  You can't even leave a message on the call if no one answers.  Finally get through and get an appointment.  However, after waiting for an hour past the appointment time no explanation or even a check in to let me know what was going on, I decided to just leave.  There are other pain management clinics out there.  No way they are as bad as this.|One of our most disappointing experiences in healthcare. I have been caring for my 95 year old cancer patient father for the past year and half. We've been to multiple hospital ers, attended over 50 doctors appointments and traveled out of state for second opinions. Never have we experienced this level of inefficiency.

We arrived at 9am. We were the only patient in the waiting room. At 10:15 we left. The nurse informed us the doctor would still need an additional 20 mins before he could see us. My father could no longer sit comfortably so we excused ourselves from the room.

I only wish I had read the other reviews before coming. We, like many of you were being referred here by an orthopedics office for a spine injection. If you find yourself in a similar circumstance, I would strongly urge you to select a clinic that has some measure of respect for your time.|The Dr is very rude and has HORRIBLE bed side manners. From yelling at patients to disconnecting the phone on them. My mom had been coming for over a year. There was always some type of issue with them getting her script sent out on time on top of the disrespect. Overall the way the doctor behaves is disgusting and despicable.|I have been seeing the Norman pain clinic for years. I was first referred to Dr Stidham by McBride Clinic because I had back problems and needed a hip in 2018.  I couldn't walk.  Dr. Stidham gave me precise back injections, which made it possible for me to walk with a Cain before the hip replacement in 2019.  Now in 23-24 have been seeing him again to deal with the back pain.! After several injections, he performed Discseel on my back which has worked excellent.  Highly recommend.|Had my first visit last week. The staff are all wonderful and have a great sense of humor, which for me is vital. The office atmosphere is comfortable even my Service Dog was comfortable right off the bat, she is usually kind of anxious when we go to new places. But they made her feel right at home, even had dog treats. So far I love this place.|First part of the experience was great!  Was evaluated in the first visit and offered a steroid injection, which we did.  A few days later, tried to call/email to talk to staff about other options since I still had immense pain.  No response, nothing from them for two days. After no response, I finally had to call to discussion other options and the woman who answered was not friendly at all!  Told me that they would NOT be giving me any pain pills, to which I told her I NEVER ASKED FOR ANY!  Didn't like how she treated me, no follow-up.  Won't be wasting my time with a clinic who doesn't return calls to patients and treats them like they are drug seeking.  I think I would rather deal with the pain than be treated as if I am 2nd class, even though I am a minority.  We are done....|The doctor didn't even listen to my symptoms, just gave me an injection that they didn't even give me a paper about the side effects. They didn't even tell me what was in the injection. Also, the doctor barely gave treatment and was super judgemental because I haven't been vaccinated yet, and was completely dismissive after I tried explaining that I'm wanting to get vaccinated|I didn't like the fact that I sat in the office for at least a half hour the window says do not open it as someone will help you and no one did so I left

Park Clinic - Pain Management in Duncan, Oklahoma serves as a premier destination for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our dedicated team of pain management specialists understands how debilitating pain can be, preventing you from enjoying everyday activities and diminishing your quality of life. We provide comprehensive evaluations, accurate diagnoses, and personalized treatment plans designed to address the root cause of your discomfort and help you regain control of your life.

Are you not able to live your life to the fullest? Do you find it painful to do the simplest of activities? Our professionals provide the proper diagnosis and treatment so you can get back to living. At Park Clinic, we offer specialized care for a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Neck & Back Pain - Including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and sciatica

  • Peripheral Nerve Pain - Addressing neuropathy and nerve compression syndromes

  • Pain Syndromes - Such as complex regional pain syndrome and fibromyalgia

  • Head & Face Pain - Including migraines, cluster headaches, and trigeminal neuralgia

  • Joint Pain - Treating arthritis, bursitis, and post-surgical pain

  • Abdominal & Pelvic Pain - Addressing chronic conditions affecting these regions

  • Myofascial Pain - Targeting muscle-related discomfort and trigger points

  • Cancer Pain - Providing relief for pain associated with cancer and its treatments

Our Approach to Pain Management

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to develop comprehensive strategies that address your specific pain concerns and improve your overall function and wellbeing.

Visit Our Pain Management Clinic

Located at 2434 Harville Rd Suite 300, Duncan, OK 73533, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at +1 580-252-1373. You can also learn more about our services by visiting our website at www.duncanregional.com/locations/park-clinic-pain-management/.

Don't let pain control your life any longer. The team at Park Clinic - Pain Management is committed to helping you find relief and return to the activities you love.

column40: I totally regret having become a Patient at this clinic! A little more than 50 years ago, I sustained a major spine injury that initially left me totally paralyzed from the waist down. Since that time, I have dealt with intermittent leg pains varying from mild to excruciating. My first appointment with Dr Gordon was on June 20 of this year. Even on that visit, I felt like he was not really interested in my situation. His first and immediate action, without any discussion with me, was to cut my pain medication! I was recently told that another cut is in the works, again no consultation with me! Meanwhile my sleep pattern has substantially deteriorated and my depression level has skyrocketed. I feel that he has HIS agenda and that the patient (me) is mostly irrelevant.|Saw Dr. Gordon for chronic back pain that has been panging me for almost two years now and have yet to get any relief from anyone else. He has been the first doctor to properly take a serious look at my issues and may have finally provided me a actual diagnosis of my problem. He has put together a plan to try and tackle my issues and it remains to be seen if it will work, but his friendly bedside manner and willingness to work with me is much further than I've gotten with any other doctor and provides me with a measure of confidence that I might be able to put this pain behind me in the near future. Would recommend paying Dr. Gordon and his staff a visit if you also suffer from chronic pain issues.|Was a patient. When I was asked about about other pain medication I was honest. column38: C B|Larry Tate|Isaiah Jobe|Deanna Pendergraft|M C|Matthew Overton|Alice Nysveen|joy bartlett
column40:
Doctor Claflin is the first Doctor to listen to me completely, to not scream at me, & to not put me on a medicine patch that eats through my arm and doesn't help at all. The Staff is amazingly knowledgeable and helpful as well, and my life is changing because I no longer feel like I'm birthing a chain saw out of my back for the most part. I have extremely rare diseases so I'm aged twice as what I really am, I have severe disc problems from lifting & moving things I shouldn't have but was forced to for my entire life, compounded by extreme sensitivity to pain and environment, and having EDS, so I'm literally falling apart, and gravity is often times stronger than the muscle strength I have to move my body or appendages.

Yes, this is confirmed by X-Ray, and I'm disabled and had to prove everything to endless lines of govt. professionals. I'm unlike most people who are the worst, I'm the worst of the worst and am lucky to have my body not give out yet like what happens to most males with my genetic, incurable diseases that have rendered my body useless and in pain that needs 24/7 treatment.

My last Doctor from a DIFFERENT CLINIC wouldn't give me needed referrals and literally said, "NO", when I asked. OK Spine has an entire suite of pain nullifying options, and after I just reviewed their website, I'm EXTREMELY excited to see remedies and trial procedures involving nerves and electrolysis.

I cannot stand needles nor the pain they cause, it's overwhelming, but I am signing up for every needle nerve procedure they have because I fully believe they can help me in the long run with the options they have.

They also offer options for pain during these procedures, which is wonderful news because needles cause me extreme pain. I am no longer afraid of needle procedures after reading what they offer, and I know this can be life changing and a wonderful experiment for them to see if the procedures can help me from feeling like I crawl out of a plane wreck without medications. I cannot wait to get needled for the first time ever!!

As for their professionalism, it's top notch, and you'd better be able to prove your needing of their services because everything is highly regulated and scrutinized, exactly as it should be. I completely put my life in their hands, and they are saving it, because I'm not stuck in bed crying everyday, and nobody has screamed at me for asking about a mobile assistance personal device like my first doctor at a different clinic did.

I was told by my EDS doctor I will be on pain management for my entire life, which I never thought nor considered this to be an option, I thought I had to live with pain for my whole life, I didn't know about this treatment; I didn't know pain could be blocked, so it's life changing, and the last two clinics and their treatment plans were non effective, traumatizing and the "doctors" had what seems to be narcissistic type egos.

This is NOT the case with the professional Dr. Claflin, whose bedside manner is an 11 on a 1-10 scale!! OK Spine with Dr. Claflin is where I should have been from day one. I highly recommend OK Spine if your current life means you can't have a life because of pain nobody should ever have to endure. It's simply not fair, debilitating and the scariest thing I've ever encountered in my life.

Dr. Claflin, his wonderful Staff and Oklahoma International Spine and Pain has completely removed all fears and all pain, and they have options for permanent treatment that other places do not offer. I am in the best hands medically ever, and I'm truly thankful, I'm no longer confined to bed or break down in tears everyday! Thank You So Very Much, Sincerely, CB.|I received ketamine infusions here from my lifetime major depressive disorder they have been life changing. It has worked better than any therapy or medication I have taken prior. Lavona the nurse anesthesiologist that administers the infusions is absolutely wonderful and I have the utmost trust in her professionalism is top notch and she is a kind compassionate caring woman . I would have given five stars if it were not for the woman at the front desk she is rude condescending and dismissive .|I wasn't dropped as a patient here but I chose to leave after a year of what was a wonderful experience with Dr Halsell. I was seeing him for Suboxone and doing great with my recovery I passed every UA and had no problems until today when I was 15 minutes late for my appointment coming back from my grandfather's funeral. I told them ahead of time I was going to be late and you would have thought the world was ending. Dr Halsell is often not there and has had to reschedule me around his life many times but if I do that once it's a huge problem. They said this isn't the first time I've had scheduling problems but I've only had to reschedule one time before in the whole year I've been there. I finally got there and because I was taking too long to pee (a whole 5-10 minutes) they wouldn't see me or let me wait to try again. A whole year of progress down the drain. It's too bad because I loved Dr Halsell himself hes a really cool guy and I would have hoped our relationship and my recovery were more important to him than to deny me one time for being 15 min late and not peeing fast enough but it is what it is I guess, I'm just a number to him for insurance billing. So I'm going to taper off what I have left I guess and stay sober for myself without help. Just disappointed, I didn't deserve that disrespect. They have no idea what mountains I had to move to drive 3 hrs through strong storms and hazardous roads straight from the funeral and miss the last half just to make it there, only to be rejected and scolded like a child by someone half my age for not peeing fast enough.|I had been seeing Dr Halsell for a few years and started having my UA's come back with FALSE positives for meth (I believe it's obvious when a person is on that stuff anyway) but like I said every time they sent it off it came back as FALSE but because I couldn't come in for the third time in a month he dismissed me. I'm a mom of four who Homeschool's my children my husband is gone approx. 9 months a year and it is hard for me to drive over an hour one way three times in 1 month. This facility does not care about their patients or he would have taken the time to help me figure out why my UA's were doing this, not just dismiss me halfway through the month with no warning.|Terrible service.  After 3 reschedules (due to my travel schedule and the fact that Dr. Halsell is only in the Tulsa office the 1-15th of each month, I'm in town later in the month), they refused to accept me as a first time patient. Avoid this doctor/provider at all costs, they're not interested in helping patients. Period. I'll be posting a formal complaint with the state board of Medicine.|My back has never been the same since one appointment here. I am having to see a actual professional for a few months to get this fixed. Zero stars if possible. You've been warned.|my husband was a patient of Halsell and was dropped after he had a flare up and had to go to the emergency room.|Assistance with Polio and accident injuries pain has helped quite a bit and with only minimal pain medicine needed

Pain Management of Oklahoma serves the McAlester, OK community with specialized pain management services designed to improve patients' quality of life. Located in southeastern Oklahoma, our clinic offers comprehensive pain medication management with a patient-centered approach that prioritizes your individual needs and comfort. Since our establishment, we have been dedicated to helping patients throughout McAlester and surrounding areas find relief from chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans.

At Pain Management of Oklahoma, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our experienced team works diligently to develop customized treatment strategies that address your specific pain concerns. We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms, which is why we take the time to listen to your experiences and work collaboratively to find solutions that work for you.

Comprehensive Services

Our practice offers a range of services including medication management, referrals to complementary therapies, and ongoing support for patients dealing with chronic pain conditions. We carefully evaluate each patient's situation to determine the most effective approach, whether that involves prescription management or connecting you with additional specialists and services that can enhance your treatment plan.

Our Mission

The mission of Pain Management of Oklahoma is to serve our patients with a patient-centered approach to the management of their pain medication. Our goal is to ensure your healthcare needs are met while your pain level is diminished, either through a referral to outside services or through the proper management of your pain medications. We want you to be celebrated, not tolerated!

Patient-First Philosophy

As our motto states, "Our goal is to better the quality of life of our patients in a safe, responsible manner." This philosophy guides everything we do at our practice. We recognize that each patient's experience with pain is unique, and we are committed to providing compassionate care that respects your dignity and addresses your specific needs.

Visit Our Practice

Pain Management of Oklahoma is conveniently located at 1201 E Wade Watts Ave, McAlester, OK 74501. Our office is designed to provide a comfortable, welcoming environment where you can discuss your pain management needs openly and honestly.

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (918) 794-6008 or visit our website at painmanagementofok.com. Let us help you take the first step toward effective pain management and an improved quality of life.

column40:
I was very nervous and scared to see a pain specialist.  They made me feel comfortable.  Everyone was very nice and professional.  Dr Wright answered all my questions. The shot for pain in my back was quick. I feel better today as it was yesterday,  when I had the procedure.  Thank you|I have been seeing Dr Wright off and on for about 3 years with three different issues. He is in my opinion one of the best pain management doctors out there. I have been seeing these kinds of doctors since my first of two back surgeries in 2014 as well as three ACL surgeries in between. Dr Wright is by far the best there is.|Dr. Wright is an honest, amazing doctor who really tries to help by using not just traditional methods but also cutting edge, new techniques. After years of lower back pain  and 3 herniated disc's, I was referred to Dr. WRIGHT. After reviewing my history, he suggested Amniotic fluid injections to actually CURE my discs.....all other doctors had said healing a disc was impossible, I needed surgery. Within 8 weeks of the injections, my pain has been reduced from a 9 (laying flat on my back not moving)  to about  a manageable 4 (I am returning to work after 3 years!!) Don't expect immediate results with this procedure. It does take time for your body to heal but this is the only thing that has worked for me and offers the possibility of actually healing herniated discs over time. I am so thankful for Dr. Wright and his wonderful, responsive staff!! Thank you for giving me my life back and getting me out of the bed/recliner!! You are amazing!

Also.. Dr. Wright and his staff understand financial concerns and are more than willing to work with your insurance company and you to get the new technologies approved and paid for by the insurance company. They will give you all the options and clearly explain the costs and benefits while helping you make a decision that works for your medical condition and for your wallet. They really care about helping you..... Other doctors could learn a few lessons from Dr Wright and his staff!|Dr Wright is an amazing doctor. On my first visit I was chatting with another patient and she told me she drove all the way from Ft Worth to see him. I thought then that he must me great. I was not disappointed. The tests he ran and the procedures he did just to find out my problem. When he discovered my problem needed a different type of doctor he referred me to the perfect doctor that is amazing. Dr Wright can figure it out for sure and it's thanks to him that I'm getting so much better|Dr. Wright and his staff were fantastic, they take care of you treat you like a human being and really look out for your best interest. They're not your typical pain management clinic they are a group that goes a bath and beyond Dr. Wright is one of the most compassionate caring understanding physicians I've ever had an account with. Anyone who needs to have pain management Don would be doing themselves a dis-service by not going to Dr Garrett Wright!!|I've been seeing Dr. Wright for10 months. I honestly don't know what I would do without him. He's concerned, he listens to his patient. I'm so glad he's my doctor|Dr. Wright injected my right lower back, and the pain was gone immediately.  I was suffering from weakness in my leg, which I attributed to old age.  I am going to get the left side injected as soon as possible.   Dr. Wright and his staff were great!      The only problem I had was getting an appointment.  The "scheduler," Neely would not answer her phone nor call me back.  I finally punched "O," told the person who answered what was happening, and Neely immediately called me back....and you could tell by her voice she was not happy.  (I had been trying to get an appointment for a week.)|I saw Dr Wright for the first time yesterday. I was extremely anxious and scared and he made me feel absolutely comfortable. Great bedside manner and he always told me before he did anything. He did my first Genicular Knee block on both knees and it was uncomfortable but definitely nothing that couldn't be handle. I absolutely would recommend him.

column40:
Dr. Andrea Fraley has been my doctor since 2009. I have only received the BEST quality of care since then. I trust her 1 million percent when it comes to my health and personal needs. She is so professional and kind and treats me like family and not just another chart number. It is my greatest honor to give her a 5 star review.|I know people can be scared off when a review is too long but it would take pages to explain all the ways Dr. Fraley and her staff have been our go to for so much more than pain management.  Dr. Fraley has been a real blessing to me as a patient and a person.  I have been seeing Dr. Fraley for years and her work and caring has never wavered.  That's a lot to say about a Doctor you have seen monthly  for years.  This is the only review I have ever written and it is only because Dr. Fraley is an exceptional dr and person and expects the same excellence in her staff.|Dr. Fraley is the best!  Not only does she take great care of her staff but also of her patients. She is focused on patient care that is right and specific for the patient and her team of mid levels, Dana and Jeana have the same passion. We are blessed to have them in our community! If you are tired of the run around and are in pain, come see The Fraley Clinic!|I've loved this place until my most recent interactions with them (3-4 year patient). Dr. Fraley, awesome! The nurses though, they used to be so nice here, but they've been extremely rude as of late, which is a surprise. These have to be new nurses that need some guidance on how to deal with their customers/patients.|Very unfortunate to have people in the Medical field that have no heart for those patients in need. Andy had us talking to the office for a whole month before being told that my husband was not accepted by Dr. Fraley. Why not let us know the first week or two? After that month they referred us to another clinic and Dr Fraleys office didn't even have the medical records you thought would have been obtained after a whole month. People don't understand that time is valuable and patients are hurting and need care. Hoping God can open people's eyes and hearts to care for others and be reminded why they chose the medical field to begin with.|I have a whole host of doctors due to severe rheumatoid arthritis and have never left a negative review until now. I fired this doctor because when it came time to renew my medication I called three days in a row to have the prescription renewed before I finally got a response. Her staff responded every single day, but the doctor failed to call the prescription in. When she finally did call the prescription in she miscoded it and it could not be filled. I called them back, advised them of the problem and the doctor advised that I should wait until my appointment the next day. I was  then 3 days past due to get my prescription filled and I was beginning to go through withdrawal symptoms. During my office visit that day the PA admitted that a big mistake had been made and was very sorry for the trouble and promised to have my prescription filled that day, it did not happen.  I called the after hours number to have Dr Fraley paged and left a message that the prescription needed to be filled, it was a Friday afternoon and no one ever called me back. That Saturday the prescription was finally called in. Unfortunately, my pharmacy didn't have the correct strength of medicine and paged Dr. Fraley to have her call the medicine to another pharmacy. She never called them back. I am now five days overdue for my medicine through no fault of my own. Dr Fraley is SO FIRED and is, by far, the WORST doctor I've ever encountered!|I, as a retired physician myself never denigrate doctors, but  Fraley cares much more about what "might" happen than the actual well being of her patients. I take my ill mother who has excruciating pain. And Dr Fraley does NOT care about quality of life. Here is a direct quote "No matter what happens, it will come back to her being on opiates". When asked if she cared about quality of life, she said "I am not going to argue about this".
So if you or someone you love has pain, I mean real pain, do NOT use this physician. She does NOT care. She would rather you or your family member die in pain.
Dr J Keith Killian, D.O., LADC-MH
Retired Psychiatrist and current professor|I have been a patient of Dr. Fraley's for several years now. I am so pleased with the way I've been treated and cared for. Her team works together, very professional.  Highly recommend her.

column38: Patricia Kelley|Cathy Smith|Rachell Harper|DeeAnn Snellgrove|Brent Cosby|Tonya Victory|Glenda Dick|Terri Watts
column40: I just started seeing Dr.Hackl due to my other Pain Doctor not taking Soonercare. I have only been twice now, But I'm very pleased with my experience and that of his staff! I'm still recovering from a Spinal Fusion I had done on April 18, 2018 of this year! I currently had a set of injection last week which have never helped much. I get to go Next week and have my nerves burned in my back so I'm hoping for some relief as I'm still under the care of my Nerosurgen also at this time! Thanks for being understanding caring and compassionate towards me!|I am guardian of my adult daughter who had a stroke 3 years ago. Our last pain doc's office never shared any alternative's to her pain, only narcotics, then acted angry when we'd get script re-fills. The office turn-over was tremendous, 1 of the docs claimed she'd never heard of CBD oil, & they did not like continuing her pain treatment after her neck surgery, which I am told was customary. They dropped us without notice; left my daughter high & dry. The St. John's Pain referral was a lady who was just nuts!! So when we met Dr. Hackal, it was so refreshing to meet someone who was well-informed, had options, really compassionately listened to my daughter, & had an immediate plan in place for her low back pain. No one would treat it or they had sub-standard ideas on how to. This office runs so smoothly; professionally. We did not have to wait long either! Dr. Hackl is the best ever!!|I have been a patient of Dr Hackl now for about 9 months I believe and I am  % surprised by the actual attention paid to me . I've been searching for help many years now just to be heard! And He Hears my Heart. That's not easy to say due to past issues that destroyed my life. I went through hell and back over the years and swore never to trust man again. But after praying for the right help, God pointed me in his direction. I am eternally grateful. The staff is not just courteous, but they all go out of their way to assist in my treatment. I'm finally starting the healing in my opinion. Physically and mentally. Thank you so very much. And may God continue to bless the hands you work with!Rachell, The voice of ONE crying in the wilderness!|Dr Hackl is wonderful! He is caring & conscientious; however, he's very busy & difficult to see. Been with him for 7+ yrs; followed from previous office. Haven't had consistency seeing rest of the staff so I can't comment on them yet.|Fired me after i asked to be REDUCED from opiods as they were making me sick. The pc refused and walked out of office. Have been rude from day on. One month they werent gonna see me for a $30 copay i didnt have before. Im fully insured. Thanka for treating a disabled vet up for 2 fusion surgeries trying to do right thing. Dr. Hackl is a great guy but access pain solutions totally sucks. Filing a complaint with the D.E.A.. In 13 years ive NEVER had a dr. or pharmacy problem until now!!!!|My first appointment with him was October 5th, I felt like he was genuinely concerned and willing to help. However, the medication I had been on for years, he does not prescribe. Which is fine, just something to take the pain away and not put me back to the 88 lbs I was at before I originally got treatment 2 years ago. He prescribed Gabapentin to take up to 3 times a day, as well as, Oxyado. A tamper resistant pain medication, I have Education State insurance and top of the line at that, Oxyado it was not covered by insurance and it was $900 out of pocket, which I refused to pay.  They had given me a coupon "pay no more than $25" the coupon would not activate no matter what you answered to the questions to activate it. I immediately called and they called in (24) pills of Tylenol 4 to take (2) 3 times a day, enough for 4 days. I have left several messages daily and the recording says they will return your call the next business day, I have not received any calls, the pharmacy has sent 2 refill requests now and they have not gotten an answer either. Unfortunately, at this point from the stomach disease I have, I will no longer be capable of eating until I can get a refill. Which I expressed numerous times I'm unable to eat due to the high tolerance of pain associated with it. He promised me he wouldn't let me get to the point of being unhealthy again, the pain medication took me from 88lbs to 114 because I wasn't having to skip meals weekly just to function. Im just sad to say the people who have abused these medications, have made it almost impossible for people who need it to actually survive. I'm a former nurse and I'm well aware of the DEA rules and regulations, I would also never jeopardize my health or his license by doing anything stupid. I just need help and after 10 days of being seen, I feel like my life is going in reverse. The staff is friendly, Dr. Hackl and his ARNP seem to listen, but promptness doesn't seem to be a priority unless you're in their waiting room. The only reason I was finally able to speak with a real person on the 14th, I called the referral person who originally setup the appointment and she told me they don't usually give refills in between appointments, which is fine, but I was just there on the 5th and the medication they tried to prescribe was $900 and she said that was excessive. She said she would make me a priority to the nurse and doctor first thing Monday. So, we will see what takes place then. I wish I didn't have to write this, but I don't want anyone else in the same position as I am. I've now gone 4 days without food and I'm afraid of the repercussions if it goes on any longer.|I love my doctor, love my nurse.  Front desk can be rude, and billing practice is alful.  Got my first bill after one year and I owed way more than I can pay.  How can this happen when they are suppose to be professionals?|APS treated me for over three years for spinal stenosis, fybromyalgia, many bone injuries and osteoarthritis. I never failed the urine monthly urine test. I always took my meficine exactly as prescribed.They asked me to stop taking a benzodiazepine I'd been taking 18 years as prescribed for PTSD. It was hard, but I completely stopped after 100 days. My sister in-law died so I called my regular physician and asked her to phone in a few of the anxiety meds with zero refills. She phoned-in 90. I only took 2. At my appointment with APS, the nurse did not test my urine. She sent in a very angry nurse who raised her voice and told me they wouldn't treat me anymore. She then became extremely defensive, raised her voice, screamed I "looked like a crazy person" and refused to hand me my prescription. This practice was willing to let me go through withdrawals because of their unstable employee. I had to beg another nurse and she , too, thought it was rash and unsafe to stop many years of opiod use and absolutely no abuse. She gave me my Rx. I complied by getting off a benzodiazepine.They are extremely rude and didn't do a UA or count the 88 pills I had with me.

Dr. Hussaini employs a multimodal approach to pain management, combining various therapeutic techniques to address pain at its source. Garrett Wright, M.D. serves Oklahoma City, OK with exceptional spine and back pain treatment services. As a board-certified orthopedic surgeon specializing in complex spinal conditions, Dr. Wright brings over 15 years of clinical expertise to patients throughout central Oklahoma. His patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge diagnostic techniques with both surgical and non-surgical treatment options tailored to each individual's specific needs.

At his practice located at 750 NE 13th St in Oklahoma City, Dr. Wright offers a full spectrum of spine care treatments. His expertise encompasses degenerative disc disease, spinal stenosis, herniated discs, scoliosis, and complex revision surgeries. Dr. Wright is particularly known for his minimally invasive surgical techniques that promote faster recovery times and reduced post-operative pain.

Patient-Focused Approach

Dr. Wright believes in exhausting all conservative treatment options before considering surgical intervention. His comprehensive evaluation process includes advanced imaging, detailed physical assessments, and thorough discussions about lifestyle factors affecting spinal health. This methodical approach ensures patients receive the most appropriate care for their specific condition.

State-of-the-Art Facility

The clinic at 750 NE 13th St features modern diagnostic equipment and comfortable treatment spaces designed with patient comfort in mind. The convenient Oklahoma City location offers ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility challenges. Dr. Wright's dedicated staff provides compassionate support throughout the treatment journey, from initial consultation through recovery.

For more information about Dr. Garrett Wright's qualifications and services, visit https://backpainok.com/index.php/home/doctors/ or call +1 405-242-4100 to schedule a consultation. The practice welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans.

caring,|IMO this office has always served a need in the community. Last year with the help of Dr. Espina and Dr. Tougus I was able to get my pain under control. I weaned down off from my pain meds and have been able to treat my pain with OTC's for the past 8 months. But, I assure you if I needed chronic pain relief I would not hesitate visiting Dr. Espina and Dr. Tougus again. Thank You St. Madron Clinic. From a chronic pain success story.|The hours are best told by reception. On wed they close at noon. May do the same on Fridays. I went there for couple of years, but now go just to allow them to follow care. Dr. Tougas I have known since he was my Chiropractor 10+ years ago. My health has deteriorated & I value his opinion! A majority of Insurance does not cover. But, if you are in true pain, & have documentation as to why, Drs. Tougas and Espina are a force to be reckoned with. I think it might be worth the time & the expense to have them in your corner! This is my opinion. They are NOT going to help unless you can follow their rules to the lettter!|I have had nothing but great experiences from them! They are very careful to make sure they get the right diagnosis the first time and they make sure that you get the best treatment for your situation! I moved here from Washington State where I was using the VA hospital for my treatment and meds but when I got here and went to my first VA appointment at Sparks hospital I felt like I was in hell!!! I have been through three doctors there and I was called a trouble patient and a problem just for asking to be put back on the same pain meds that I had been on in Washington!!! All three of the so called doctors there have been completely worthless, very disrespectful and very damn unprofessional!!! As a matter of fact I have turned them over to Senator Cotton which is a personal friend of mine so I hope they all three end up working at McDonalds!!! St.Madron and its staff are very professional, very helpful and they actually act like they care about me!!!|I love the Dr's and the staff.  I see the same people every 28 days so we have all become friends,  if one doesn't show up, everyone is concerned.  It has a real  comfortable feel about the office although the chairs are uncomfortable. Lol  love Dr Espina and Staff|I have been with Dr.T since he started in the field of chiropractor late 90s,..great Dr.! Listens and cares! With his help im able to continue to work,which im very thankful for! Thank you Dr.T for being who you are!

column40:
If you have pain do not go here.  That is his last concern.  One of his first are if you smoke it's going to kill you.  If you take Benadryl it's going to kill you.  Insisted I needed oxygen which I didn't per my lung doctor.  And even if I did I would have died before he got me some.  After 3 months of telling me I needed it I still hadn't gotten it.
Told me I had sleep apnea.  My lung doctor saw the results and said I did not.  When I first went to him I smoked three packs a day.  Last time I went to him I told him I had gotten down to one pack a day.  He started screaming at me that that was not enough.  Screamed I'm done with you and threw my pain pill bottle towards me.  I told him he had no right to talk to me that way and if that is what he had to do then do it.  If my husband hadn't been there in the room with me, I would have been scared to death.  And nobody would believe me if my husband wasn't in the room with me.  Not once in four or five months did he address my pain.  Unless you want a doctor that has temper tantrums and scares his patience I would not go here|Dr Nelson and his staff are the friendliest people I have ever met. Dr Nelson is a very good doctor. He takes his time evaluating you. And he also listens to all your problems. Best doctor ever|Dr. Nelson truly cares about your health.  He orders tests to find the issue and I haven't had any doctors hardly do that and am finding the issues.  He can be a little tough but I have come to understand his thinking and am lucky to have a doctor like him!  He is great!!|Dr Nelson always seems edgy and angry, you can't get anything done ! The P.A's are condescending and overly rude! They treat you like an addict and absolutely the most unpleasant doc I've ever encountered|Jeckle & Hyde? Threw the syringe on the floor in the operating room & screamed at me "I'm done! That can't be hurting you!"  I kept telling him he was hurting me & he just kept stabbing the needle in me over 20 times. I have pictures of the needle marks & brusing. I was crying on the operating table & he went nuts.  I never went back. He had yelled at me another time saying "My God! You're on too much medicine!" I had been on the meds over 10 years. 9 months of that, his patient, never seen him, always the PA unless it was for an injection. He yelled at me "You're on the same dose as cancer patients! My God! They have Cancer for God sake! You don't! You don't need that much medication!"
His behavior was scary. I was fearful he was going to hurt me. These outburst were violent & loud. Staff just looked down at the floor or turned their back to me in the operating room & the office when he started yelling. Nobody said a damn word.  Very terrifying experiences. I'm not a buttercup cry baby though. That's why he got to flip out on me a few times. The operating room was pretty traumatizing. I don't understand why the staff in both places don't say anything. He'll end up hurting some eventually. He's definitely got anger issues & delusional about people with chronic pain just wanting to get high. If we wanted to get high we'd be at the trap house getting high. Not a doctors office seeking pain relief. Brown Sequard is so rare there's no studies. There's not enough of us in one place to do studies. The pain is horrific. I can't believe I can handle this much pain with so little medicine. When the CDC lowered the limit on how much pain medication I can have, my health has been declining. People who don't live in horrific pain have no idea the mind & body can only take so much then everything begins to decline. Physically & mentally.  Walk a mile in my shoes Dr. John Wendell Nelson... you couldn't even make it 30 feet.|Dr. Nelson cares and takes very good care of his patients.|Dr Nelson was by far the worst Dr to see
His staff was awesome.
He wasn't how are you going to say that it didn't look like I was coming back .
And cancel my follow up without my knowledge
Hhmmmmm. column2: Mercy Clinic Pain Management - Edmond I-35
column3:
Mercy Clinic Pain Management - Edmond I-35 serves residents throughout Edmond, Oklahoma and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located conveniently off Interstate 35, our specialized clinic is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans and innovative therapies. Our team of board-certified pain specialists combines years of clinical expertise with compassionate care to address the physical and emotional aspects of pain management.

At Mercy Clinic Pain Management, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to treating various pain conditions. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, and rehabilitation therapies. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain, among other conditions. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, focusing on improving function and quality of life.

Expert Medical Team

Our clinic features a team of highly trained physicians and advanced practice providers who stay current with the latest advancements in pain medicine. We work collaboratively with other Mercy specialists, including neurologists, orthopedists, and physical therapists, to ensure comprehensive care for complex pain conditions. This integrated approach allows us to address the root causes of pain rather than simply managing symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. That's why we take the time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop treatment strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle. Our clinic emphasizes education, empowering patients to take an active role in their pain management journey. We strive to create a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected.

Location and Contact Information

Visit us at 2017 W I-35 Frontage Rd, Suite 130, Edmond, OK 73013. Our clinic is easily accessible from Interstate 35, with ample parking available for patients and visitors. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (405) 757-3630. You can also find detailed information about our practice on our website at mercy.net.

As part of the larger Mercy health system, our clinic maintains the highest standards of medical excellence while delivering care with the compassion and dignity that are hallmarks of the Mercy tradition. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options for pain management services.

Upon arrival I was told that I did not have an appointment scheduled, I explained to them that I did in fact have an appointment, and would not have drove an hour if I didn't. column3:
Neuropathy Treatment Clinic of Oklahoma serves Tulsa, OK and surrounding communities with specialized care for patients suffering from peripheral neuropathy. The clinic has established itself as a leader in non-surgical neuropathy treatment, focusing on providing long-term relief from debilitating symptoms that impact quality of life. Their patient-centered approach addresses the common complaints of pain, burning, numbness, tightness, and tingling that characterize this challenging condition.

At the heart of the clinic's treatment protocol is Combined Electrochemical Therapy (CET), an advanced non-surgical intervention that has demonstrated remarkable effectiveness. This innovative therapy utilizes electrical cell signaling technology to stimulate nerve regeneration and reduce inflammation. Clinical results have been impressive, with approximately 87% of patients experiencing significant symptom relief after completing the recommended treatment course.

Comprehensive Wellness Plans

What sets the Neuropathy Treatment Clinic of Oklahoma apart is their commitment to holistic care. Rather than simply addressing symptoms, their experienced medical team develops individualized wellness plans that improve overall health and address underlying factors contributing to neuropathy. This comprehensive approach may include nutritional guidance, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to support long-term nerve health.

Patient Success Stories

The clinic takes pride in helping patients reclaim activities and experiences that neuropathy had previously made difficult or impossible. Their focus on restoring function and reducing pain has allowed countless individuals to return to hobbies, improve sleep quality, and engage more fully in daily life without the limitations imposed by neuropathic symptoms.

Visit their website at www.neuropathyok.com or call +1 918-708-1816 to schedule a consultation. The clinic is conveniently located at 4636 S Harvard Ave, Suite 102, Tulsa, OK 74135.
column11:
The Neuropathy Treatment Clinic of Oklahoma is dedicated to providing long term relief from the symptoms related to neuropathy. Those symptoms are most often described as pain, burning, numbness, tightness and tingling.

The clinic's patient-first approach includes the innovative treatment of Combined Electrochemical Therapy (CET). This non surgical therapy utilizes electrical cell signaling to provide significant relief of symptoms in 87% of cases.

Our highly experienced team of providers provide a comprehensive wellness plan for each patient that will improve overall health, not just the symptoms associated with neuropathy.

We look forward to helping you regain the things that matter the most to you in your life.

I wouldn't go anywhere else. You would be hard pressed to find a better facility.|I've had a wonderful experience at this clinic. From the second I walk in the door, everyone knows my name and I feel so welcome every time I am there. Kara, Savannah, Chase, and Tory in particular are always so friendly and a joy to see. The staff members are all friendly and go above and beyond to be helpful. From greeting you by name when you walk in the door, to the effective treatments with attentive (and hilariously entertaining) staff, to saying "have a great day, Nicole!" on my way out the door, the Neuropathy Treatment Center has the BEST staff and is the BEST place to go for neuropathy treatments!! The clinic itself is always clean, sanitary, and well-maintained. I never have to wait for my appointment, unlike many doctor's offices. The Neuropathy Treatment Center has truly changed my life, and helped me to be a better mom to my kids, by helping me progress in my healing journey. I am so incredibly grateful!!

(The front desk manager, Megan, is absolutely an amazing person, who has been a huge blessing in my life. Always praying for me, and taking time to check in on me. Dr. Adam Savage implements a personalized approach to patient care that begins with a thorough interview, examination, and evaluation of radiographic imaging.
