column40: Staff very rude, I needed a procedure that doctor told me to my face I could have sedation for but then when it was time to schedule I was told by Jamie Spence that they would not do sedation for the procedure. I called the next day and asked to speak directly to the doctor which never happened but I got a bunch of other people I spoke to in billing and such and at first I was told my insurance would not cover sedation even though no one had submitted it for prior authorization. My insurance has paid for this procedure for the last 13 years with no problems with sedation. Finally Dr relayed through his staff that he didn't feel I would be comfortable enough with the level of sedation he was willing to do. I will be going to Sherman Do not recommend these people at all|BACK STORY: I have been dealing with back pain radiating down my legs for 6 years. I can't take and narcotics or opioids, as im allergic to almost everything. I saw a pain management CPA who referred me to another physician for injections in my back. My experience with them was sad to say the least. They didn't have compassion,  empathy, or a sense of how miserable I was. After 3 failed injections, I was referred to a neurosurgeon to have my back fused. Was told it would work. It didn't. He wanted to do more surgeries. I'm 44 and I have no life. I saw my GYN and had a complete melt down.  She referred me to Dr. Savage.  OMG, best referral ever.  His nurse is amazing,  she listened, she understood what I was going through. She understood I didn't want medications or surgeries. I wanted alternatives to relieve my pain. Dr. Savage came in after and he understood and listened.  I was very pleased with the visit. He did things, ordered things and offered other things to help with the pain. His process was on point.  Very impressed. I will continue to see him and follow his plan. Every person is different and require different plans. He is on point. I haven't felt this much relief in 6 years. I'm not 100% but I can manage with what pain I have left. I slept thru the night for the first time in 6 years. It was amazing.  I was able to stand up straight today and walk without my cane in my house. I will continue to only seem him and try to avoid the surgery that my neurosurgeon wants to do. I recommend Dr. Savage to anyone that will hear me. I see positive outcomes.|I have been going to Dr Savage every other month for 2 years.  He is the absolute best doctor  I have ever been too.  Every time I come in to see Dr. Savage or Jamie Spence they  make a valiant effort to improve your quality of life!  The entire staff is Very polite and professional.  I feel very Blessed to have Dr Savage and Jamie  Spence as my Doctors.|Such a caring team, along with the staff. Very happy with them!|I am a disabled veteran and was referred to Dr. Savage from OKC VA Neurology for Pain Management after three level ACDF surgery a year and a half ago and have experienced additional issues after successful surgery. Dr. Savage and his caring, excellent staff have ensured I understood each step recommended and ultimately  an implant will be done. I am grateful to have been recommended to his care .|Dr. Savage and his entire staff are second to none. I appreciate their customer service. Most of all I feel better! Don't trust me go and see what the will do for you!|After reading these reviews I DO NOT WANT TO SEE THIS DOCTOR FOR PAIN MANAGEMENT and my doctor just put in a referral for me today! Nope, not after reading this because he will just make me angry and im already in pain. I don't do well with people who don't have sympathy for those of us who have extreme medical conditions like myself. I'm 35, I can already see where this visit will go! I will ask around before I ever see this man! It says MD behind his name. All the good doctors are in OKC or Texas!!|This doctor has been a God send to me. After two back surgeries and 2 more attempted surgeries, i was no longer a candidate for more surgery.  But still lived with severe pain! After being referred to this doctor and having had 2 seperate sessions of back injections,  I was elated....i had to wait awhile due to my TKR for more back injections. When i finally waited the time allotted,  i called to reschedule more back  injections, i was informed that Dr. Savage no longer worked with the Mercy pain clinic... so I have been in severe pain and have searched internet for where he has moved. To no avail. So if anyone has his new location or phone number, I would be so appreciative. No one else ever got me out of my pain like he did!

God bless|Unfortunately the doctor is good but they do not know a thing about insurance. I have met my maximum out of pocket which means I am covered by insurance at 100%. I do not owe anything for medical services. Despite this, they continue to bill me a copay to be seen. I advised them of this, and my insurance company left them a voicemail (because they rarely answer the phone) letting them know as well. The claim for my last visit processed and I owe $0 but was charged $40. This is fraudulent billing and the provider is purposely doing this. I have reported the office to the Oklahoma medical board of licensure and supervision. I wouldn't go here if I were you.|I see them in Tahlequah! But due to some changes I am having to go see them in BA. The staff and Drs are amazing! I am truly Blessed they are a part of my health care team!|They don't care about their patients..  they aren't up to date on new diagnoses, therefore they judge what a person has to do or take to stay out of the hospital. Horrible facility|Don't waste your time trying to get ahold of someone through the website or the number they send you so you can text them.... they won't respond to anything unlike they they say they will!

They only see people on Mondays and that puts wait times and hour plus now....|The reason why there are so many injections being done is because the doctor get reimbursed almost 100% what they charge its scary stuff how many are being done|They have help me with my knee pain and my granny pain and really nice people

Joysree Subramanian MD in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, is a distinguished physician specializing in pediatric endocrinology at OU Health. With a commitment to providing exceptional care for children with hormonal disorders and diabetes, Dr. Subramanian combines clinical expertise with compassionate patient interaction. Her practice addresses a comprehensive range of pediatric endocrine conditions, including growth disorders, thyroid dysfunction, adrenal issues, and diabetes management, offering families throughout Oklahoma access to specialized care tailored to their children's unique needs.

At her practice located at 825 NE 10th St #2b in Oklahoma City, Dr. Subramanian provides comprehensive evaluation and treatment for children facing endocrine challenges. Her approach integrates the latest medical advances with personalized care plans that consider each child's developmental needs. Patients benefit from her expertise in managing complex conditions such as:

  • Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes

  • Growth hormone deficiencies

  • Thyroid disorders

  • Puberty-related concerns

  • Adrenal and pituitary conditions

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Subramanian's practice emphasizes education and partnership with families, ensuring parents and children understand treatment protocols and management strategies. Her collaborative approach involves working closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to provide coordinated care. Patients appreciate her thorough explanations and willingness to address concerns, creating a supportive environment for children managing chronic endocrine conditions.

Professional Background and Facility

As part of the OU Health network, Dr. Subramanian leverages the resources of Oklahoma's comprehensive academic health system. Her clinical practice benefits from cutting-edge diagnostic capabilities and research-informed treatment protocols. The office at OU Health's campus provides a child-friendly environment designed to put young patients at ease during consultations and follow-up visits.

For appointments or consultations, families can contact Dr. Subramanian's office directly at +1 405-271-7255. Additional information about her practice, qualifications, and services is available on her professional profile at ouhealth.com.

Keley John Booth, MD serves Oklahoma City, OK with exceptional pain management services designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. As the founder of ePain Health, Dr. Booth brings over two decades of specialized experience in interventional pain management to the Oklahoma City metropolitan area. His practice combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address complex pain issues that affect daily functioning and overall wellbeing.

At his modern facility located at 13100 N Western Ave, Suite 303 in Oklahoma City, Dr. Booth offers a wide range of advanced pain management solutions. His practice specializes in treating conditions including spinal pain, neuropathic disorders, joint dysfunction, and post-surgical pain through minimally invasive procedures and personalized treatment plans. Each patient receives individualized attention focused on identifying the root cause of their pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Expert Credentials and Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Booth's credentials include board certification in pain medicine and anesthesiology, complemented by specialized training in interventional techniques. His approach integrates cutting-edge medical technology with holistic considerations of each patient's lifestyle and goals. The practice emphasizes patient education, ensuring individuals understand their condition and treatment options for informed decision-making about their care journey.

Accessible Care and Modern Facilities

The practice can be reached at +1 800-781-1220 for appointments and consultations, with comprehensive information available on their website at www.epainhealth.com. column40:
I have never been treated so badly by a medical professional before. Dr Booth was so nasty to me on my first visit that I brought my husband with me to my follow up just to see if it was me. It wasn't!!!!  My husband got up and walked out with me following. Dr Booth should not be allowed to practice with patients!!!!!!!!!!|I've been seeing Dr Booth for my back for several months now. I have yet to be able to get my medicine through without any problems. Even though this is a Workmen's Comp. case, I will usually wind up paying out-of-pocket for it. His staff seems friendly, but I think they are incompetent, as I have yet to be able to get them to do the paperwork properly so Workmen's Comp. can pay for my medication|Best Dr. Out there. He literally has saved my life. Thank you Dr. Booth. You are amazing!|I have had 4 visits for my cervical spine. 1 initial consult 2 procedures (cervical spine injections) I have been to both offices. The Moore office was clean staff was friendly knowledgeable and their wait times are not long at all. It seemed like I just sat down and they were already calling me back. The nurse practioner was knowledgeable and answered all my questions. I never felt rushed or not listened too.
Fast forward to procedure day in the Edmond office. The office space decor was calming. It is utd and designed with patient care in mind. The reception staff were friendly and efficient during checking. Again, they called me back within 5 minutes. The nursing staff provided patient teaching that was informative and explained in easy to understand terms. I found Dr. Booth to be knowledgable, I never felt rushed. He explained my injury in easy to understand terms. Most importantly, I felt like he truly cared about me and took his oath as a doctor to do no harm very seriously. Recovery care was excellent both visits and although I was nervous the first procedure visit. I was at ease my 2nd because I knew I was in good hands. They take most if not all insurance. I know this because I am covered under federal worker's compensation. I have had great difficulty finding good care that takes OWCP as the payer. I definitely feel blessed to have found Dr. Booth and staff. They will be my go to for neck injections or any other procedure I might need. I pray that none of my family find themselves in a situation requiring these types of procedures. I will not hesitate to recommend Elite pain to my kids and close friends. I rate them as excellent.|I made an appt due to a 2 week old back injury that my chiropractor had not been able to provide any relief from. Following a thorough exam (no imaging) Dr Booth was pretty confident that continuing my current path of treatment would resolve my injury. 2 weeks later my chiropractor was successful in returning me to no pain. I will continue to refer my friends and family to DR Booth with first hand experience in providing the proper advice for a non evasive recovery from my injury.|I have been seeing Dr. Booth for a couple of months now. He has been nothing but amazing. He really takes the time to listen to you and get the root of the problem. I love the fact that I see him every time too. The office and staff have been fabulous as well! I have been extremely pleased with my experience and would definitely recommend Dr. Booth to anyone needing pain management.|I found doctor Booth because my previous doctor stop taking my insurance. He has been very kind and I have two back injections with him and he was very kind and did a wonderful job. The only reason for four stars though is because the follow up with his staff is not very good. They never call back or rarely call back and I have to end up calling a few times to try to get my answer. But overall Dr. Booth has been a great doctor.|Have had a disaster since first of many back surgeries. This is Something I wouldn't wish on anyone. I have gone to many doctors over the past several years and unfortunately most didn't spend the needed time with me, they didn't listen , and probably because I'm such a complex case didn't seem interested in helping me. I was referred to Dr Booth by a friend. I've never had anyone seem more sincere about wanting to help me. His bedside manner is the best I've ever experienced. I understand that no one can ever guarantee that treatment will work but as a patient having a Dr that shows you empathy and is willing to explore every treatment option as Dr BOOTH does is to me what a true Dr represents. I'm
both grateful and optimistic

Our Specialized Services

column40:
Does not care about their patients. High staff turnover and difficult to understand doctor.

This office will not allow my caregiver to go into appointments with me. I'm a 100% disabled veteran. I have issues communicating my thoughts, especially in pain and in a doc office..

I called before my appointment today, to avoid an unnecessary and painful car ride-- they ignored my concerns and told me to come in to discuss if my caregiver can go back to the appointment with me.
I had to cancel all appointments and injections and find help elsewhere.
The injection this clinic previously did on me, caused extreme increased pain. Very frustrating!!!! Would literally rather quit my medicine cold, than give them any more of my money.
I have waited over an hour on more than one occasion, sometimes the staff is friendly sometimes they're rude.
Dr. Soo's Office's claims about safety are not legitimate, the VA allows my caregiver to go into ALL appointments, as they understand it's appropriate.|Dr. Soo is an amazing doctor. He listens to your concerns and explains things so you can understand.
When I saw him for the first time (2009) I was having to use a wheelchair, walker and cane to get around because my back was in such bad shape ( I had already had 2 surgeries by another doctor that did not fix my problem). He did a 3rd surgery and after not being able to walk or work I was finally able to go back to work in 2011.
I highly recommend him!|Best Orthopedic Dr !  Dr Soo is a compassionate and understanding Dr. He will tell you the truth and is very knowledgeable!  His staff is very thorough and good!  Can't truly express My appreciation of the help I've received! .|After surgery I was scheduled a follow up 8 days later.  However, they only allow 7 days so now they say I owe a $40 copay.  Then still in severe pain I returned to see why I am not feeling better and was refused service.  Told I had a past due balance and would charge another  $40.  I AM SORRY I EVER WENT TO DR. SOO.  Still suffering and having to return to the ER.|I have had2 spinal fusions by previous surgeon's. Dr Soo recently did my C 4 to C 6 neck fusion.  I absolutely would refer anyone to him.  He not onalso is handling.my follow up care and pain management.  No need to have to go to yet another Dr.|I have seen Dr. Soo 3 times. Two of the times I waited for more than an hour past my appt time. One of the times, today even, I waited for 90 minutes without seeing the Dr. When I asked a staff member if I needed to be re-scheduled at a time more convenient for the Dr, she responded very rudely. All she would have had to do is say I'm sorry but instead got snippy. Only one member of their staff (Keisha) even had the decency to say hello. The rest barked orders with zero pleasantries exchanged. Aside from the inability to keep appointment times REMOTELY close, Dr. Soo himself is pleasant and good to work with but their staff is lacking. If you hate your job, find something better to do with your time.|Dr Soo did an ACDF C5-C6 on me. He is compassionate, patient, kind, and explains everything very well! The staff has always been wonderful!|I only wish I could of meet him much sooner!!!
Dr Soo took extra time to look at ALL my spine history and made me fill like I was finally being listened too. I know he is God sent to myself and family and I am extremely blessed to have him as my Spine Surgon.

Pain Specialists Of Oregon serves Eugene, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through innovative, evidence-based approaches. Located conveniently in south Eugene, our practice combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with integrative therapies to address the complex nature of persistent pain.

At Pain Specialists Of Oregon, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of your discomfort. We offer specialized treatments for back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our physicians are experts in advanced interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication management protocols.

Patient-Centered Approach

We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment plans that align with your goals and lifestyle. Our compassionate staff ensures you feel supported throughout your pain management journey, from your first consultation through ongoing care.

column40:
When Dr. Morgan was with the group, everything was amazing.  Now that she has retired I have had nothing but problems and the front staff are rude. It is truly sad that this has gone down hill so fast. If it was not for Marissa and her assistant I would leave. Unfortunately I am stuck with this pain management group. When you are scheduled and show up and are told you missed your check in time even though on line tells you the time you show up. They are not willing to work with people and treat us like cattle.|Edit! These guys are refusing to release my med records! When I called and asked for them I was hung up on! Guess I'll have to get them through the health department! My insurance has already written them up. Man they are treating lot of folks the same way. Karma is all I got to say! Hm funny they don't have any reviews! These guys are terrible! Front office staff are rude. I was not notified about dr Kemp leaving to open his own practice and I was told if I wanted to stay at pain specialists I'd need to start as a new patient! Even my insurance was like they can't do that! Almost every dr there has left or retired, wich speaks volumes! They jumped ship! Dr Kemp is great and I would recommend seeing him at oregon pain and spine. Nobody deserves to be treated like garbage! Aperently I'm not the only one who was never notified of the change! I'm sure they'll find a way to get rid of my review seeing as though they somehow got rid of all their reviews! Terrible business practices|Dr. Dunn is the greatest Pain Dr. I've ever had. I highly recommend him for anyone with chronic pain. He is not a pill mill. He takes pain management seriously.|Dr Morgan was wonderful, she retired while we were waiting for MRI results. We were rescheduled and the clinic moved. I used the link they sent and it sent us to Darlene Ave in Springfield not Darlene Ave in Eugene. Our Appt was at 11:00, we started calling at 10:40 called & called. All calls went to voicemail. We arrived 20 minutes late and was told by the front office people without checking with the PA that we could not been seen that day. I mentioned we were calling & calling and I was told "We were busy responding to voicemails". We were told they would call and reschedule which they did. They did call and set an appointment my wife had asked a few questions and the person from the clinic she grew impatient and rude. They called back shortly and said we need to find a new provider. My wife is awaiting results from an MRI ordered from Oregon Pain Specialist. To leave someone in the dark about an MRI that was ordered by the clinic is very unprofessional to say the least. I don't know what motivated the cancellation I hope not racism. I will be contacting the Oregon Medical Authority and Oregon Medical Association. I want to make sure the Doctors are aware of this.|Was between 1st and 2nd insurance-required tests when i caught COVID. Tried to reschedule several times but no one called me back. Then Dr Kemp left the practice (the doctor I was assigned) and, since I wanted to see Dr Morgan to begin with, I continued leaving messages to try to finish testing and have procedure done. So far no one has called me back. Guess I'll try to find another facility to have my pain dealt with. My back is much worse after the one test Dr Kemp did. It's very difficult that no one answers the phone and you have to keep leaving messages.|Unfortunately, I have been a pain patient for many years and I have dealt with several different doctors, physicians assistants, etc., some good, some not so good, but none as good as Marissa. She is very knowledgeable, which is always a plus, but more importantly in my opinion is her personality and how she deals with her patients. She is always pleasant and takes the time to truly listen, which I know can be difficult at times with pain patients. If you are a fellow pain patient, I hope that you are fortunate enough to have Marissa on your side.

Greg Wilson|I use the pump Clinic and have for years Marissa is an amazing Dr. And I trust her to always have my best interests  in mind. She is very caring and compassionate person. I would recommend  the Drs. at Pain Specialist of Oregon to anyone that needed them .|They have been managing my chronic pain for the last decade. Doctor Dunn and Marissa And the team are all highly trained and knowledgeable in the field of pain management and are always of the up most professionalism. They are also very kind and compassionate they care about you in a way that is unfortunately often not found enough in the world of medicine these days. With that being said. I would highly recommend that anyone struggling with chronic pain on any level give them a call or ask your doctor to get an appointment as there are so many treatment options available. They are up on all of the latest and greatest state of the art treatment options available out there as this is their field of expertise don't suffer they can help.

column40:
Amazing staff!  Dava is truly the nicest person I know. She goes above and beyond to answer questions and make you feel comfortable.
Everyone in the office is caring and supportive. They have helped me with my back pain. They will give you options for your care without being overbearing. I really appreciated all the knowledge they shared with me and let me decide what direction to go.  I would definitely recommend them.|Dr  J & staff has worked on me for a year now. I'm down to maintenance visits. Neck, back, shoulders and hands are all MUCH better. I'm 72. Been active my whole life. Chiropractic has helped me since my 30s. You can trust this group.|I've been amazed at the effectiveness of the treatments I've received at Advanced Pain Solutions.  In addition, the entire staff has been wonderfully warm and friendly. They also seem to have a very efficient system for moving patients through the system. You don't have to sit and wait for long periods of time. I'm pleased with my experience at APS.|The work I've had at Advanced Pain Solutions has changed my life!  I got the most relief from them out of any model of treatments I've had in the past 10 years. Including C6-C7 microdiscecromy .  I would highly recommend the team at APS to anyone who has been told by multiple Dr. That " this is as good as it gets for you, I can't help you " . And that not a acceptable answer.|Advanced Pain Solutions uses an holistic approach to pain relief. The team at Advance Pain Solutions are dedicated to providing the most innovation and realistic approaches to truly relieve pain. I love the fact that they are concerned with Identifying the source of the pain, the root of the problem and repairing it from all angles. They're into repairing versus a placebo effect of pain meds covering up the symptoms, but never treating the effects problem. The staff of well trained and knowledgeable  professional, are courteous and attentive!
I am personally sold out on Advanced Pain Solutions . Stop wasting your time suffering and go to the Best!|APS has been a game changer for my recent sports injury recovery. When morale was low and support from other PT locations was not enough I went in search of a different level of support than typical PT programs. APS excels with their professionalism, delivering relevant medical knowledge, support food planning, and lots of laughter all of which are critical towards my healing. Currently one month into my recovery and I can feel the improvements throughout my day, which brings me joy and comfort to know that soon I'll be fully recovered.|For more than 35 years, I've been going to different chiropractors and this is the first review I've written. Advance Pain Solutions has been wonderful in providing me with the best care. I am so pleased with Dr Jeffrey, Dr Kent and all the staff who treated me, encouraged me and taught me the correct exercises to keep my spine in alignment. Everyone is so friendly, professional and welcoming. I am so grateful for  the relief from pain, especially when I get up in the morning.
Going to APS is one of the best decisions I've made to improve my health and well being. I'm excited about my future and living pain free to hike and do everyday activities with ease. Thank you APS - you are all amazing!  Pat B|If you're looking for a medical office that feels like a spa day with a dollop of fairy dust, Advanced Pain Solutions is your place! I was cornered into surgery as my only option, but decided to give this place a shot before going under the knife. Boy, am I glad I did! From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed with open arms.

The providers here are like wizards with medical degrees. My nurse practitioner, Summerlyn, might look like your average blonde, blue-eyed girl-next-door, but don't let that fool you. She's got hands of steel and a knack for finding every knot and painful spot with pinpoint accuracy. Seriously, her little hands are the strongest in town! Every session with her leaves me feeling like I've just had a magical healing experience.

The Clinical Assistants (CAs) are like your personal treatment tour guides. Wyatt, with his fancy socks and awesome attitude, makes sure you're doing everything correctly and in the right order. It's like having a sock fashion show and a treatment plan all in one!

Cheyenne is the go-to for any question you might have. She's super helpful and knowledgeable, always ready to assist with a smile on her face.

From the front desk to the back room, the entire staff is welcoming and incredibly knowledgeable. They all learn your name and make sure you feel like part of the family. I'm so glad I decided to start this treatment plan. Now I can enjoy my day-to-day activities pain-free!

Thanks for making me myself again, APS !!!

column48: Hello, I am wondering what services your office offers to fix knee pain?
column49: Hi Angie, our office offers a variety of non-surgical, medication free services that may help with knee pain depending on the specific cause of the knee pain. Please check out our website at apsoregon.com to see a full list of services. While an exam would be required to determine the cause of the pain and what services may or may not be helpful, some of the services we offer include physiotherapy, bracing, chiropractic care, traction, and injections.

column3:
Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon serves Medford, OR and the surrounding communities with pioneering pain management solutions. As the first practice in Oregon to offer interventional pain management services with specialists in both anesthesiology and physiatry, they have established themselves as leaders in comprehensive pain care. Their multidisciplinary approach focuses on reducing patients' reliance on opioids by implementing personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's unique needs and conditions.

The team at Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon is led by board-certified, fellowship-trained physicians Dr. Joseph Savino, M.D. and Dr. George Johnston, D.O. Their combined expertise allows the practice to offer a wide range of advanced treatments for chronic pain conditions. Patients benefit from the latest technologies and methodologies in pain management, ensuring they receive the most effective care possible.

Advanced Treatment Approaches

Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon implements a multimodality approach that includes:

- Non-invasive surgical procedures

- Physical therapy programs

- Patient education initiatives

- Lifestyle modification guidance

- Cutting-edge pain management technologies

Their comprehensive strategy addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain, helping patients achieve long-term relief and improved quality of life.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit their website at https://painspecialists.com/ or call +1 541-779-5228. Their office is located on Lear Way, Medford, OR 97504, United States.
column11:
LATEST TECHNOLOGIES IN TREATMENT AND THERAPIES FOR CHRONIC PAIN CONDITIONS
Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon was the first in Oregon to offer interventional pain management services with specialists in both anesthesiology and physiatry. Our goal is to reduce our patient's opioid use by using a multimodality approach to treating pain. We implement the latest methods and technologies to treat each individual patient's unique needs including the incorporation of lifestyle changes, non-invasive surgical procedures, physical therapy, education and other treatments.
Board-certified, fellowship- trained physicians. Joseph Savino, M.D and George Johnston, D.O

column3:
Salem Pain & Spine Specialists serves Salem, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists focuses on nonsurgical approaches to treat painful nerve, joint, spine, and muscle conditions that impact your quality of life. We understand that chronic pain can be debilitating, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At Salem Pain & Spine Specialists, we provide a wide range of advanced treatments including:

- Therapeutic Injections to reduce inflammation and pain

- Diagnostic Procedures to accurately identify pain sources

- PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) Therapy for natural healing

- Botox Treatments for chronic headaches and dystonia

- Ultrasound-Guided Injections for precise medication delivery

Comprehensive Pain Management

Our approach to pain management is multidisciplinary, combining cutting-edge medical interventions with rehabilitative strategies. We believe in treating not just the symptoms but addressing the underlying causes of pain to provide long-lasting relief. Our physicians work closely with physical therapists, psychologists, and other healthcare providers to ensure comprehensive care.

Patient-Centered Approach

We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each case, explain treatment options, and answer questions, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care.

Contact Information:

- Website: [www.salempainandspine.org](http://www.salempainandspine.org/)

- Phone: +1 503-967-6771

- Address: 1100 22nd St SE, Salem, OR 97302, United States

If you're struggling with chronic pain, contact Salem Pain & Spine Specialists today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

column3:
Portland Pain Care serves patients throughout Portland, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a premier medical practice, our team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that minimize medication dependence. We offer personalized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, behavioral health support, and carefully monitored medication management when appropriate.

At Portland Pain Care, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs following thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their care. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to address not only the physical aspects of pain but also the emotional and psychological components that often accompany chronic conditions. This holistic approach helps patients regain function and improve quality of life while reducing reliance on opioid medications.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 9300 SE 91st Ave #400, Happy Valley, OR 97086, our modern facility offers a comfortable environment with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure patients understand their coverage options. For appointments or inquiries, contact us at (503) 775-6500 or visit our website at www.portlandpaincare.com to learn more about our services and approach to pain management.
column38: Peter Topazio|Ryan Deady|Eric Hansen|Nomad Surf Co|Christopher Wylie|Christina|anita schnacky|Agustin and Ashley Alvarenga
column40:
The lack of service and charges I incurred from this "business" are astounding. My frustration started when I was asked to fill out their questionnaire; normally not a big deal but the system they use made me do it multiple times. Okay, technology is hard sometimes...I get it. Every time I filled it out, the system said done and complete.
They did not show up for my first virtual appointment; when I reached out to the office, they told me they never received my information from their portal that I had filled out multiple times.
They didn't call, they just no showed after I had taken half a day off to accommodate the virtual meeting request.
so...I rescheduled.
In between my next appointment I received a call from their office asking how I would like to pay (er...prepay) for an injection?! A prepaid medical procedure; nope, that's not how it works.
I decided to cancel the in person appointment agreeing to speak with them on the phone to discuss what had transpired and why I wouldn't prepay for a procedure.
This "business" sent my Insurance company a bill in the amount of $568 for the less than 2 minutes I was on the phone (calling it an outpatient, office visit new patient), I was responsible for $50 of that. I would strongly recommend you look at other clinics than get jerked around and ripped off by this one.|All I can say is don't go. The staff there is incompetent. The nurse messed up the IV. When it came to the sedation they rushed it because they were behind. The sedation didn't work at all. Dr. Stapleton didn't care to fix it and went ahead with procedure. Left with more pain than going in. They also didn't call to let me know they were done. Really disappointed being sold pain relief and being put into more pain.|When the staff of ANY business or service is uncaring, rude, inconsiderate, and even threatening, and gets away with it, that is a direct reflection of the owners or managers feelings about their patients or customers.
NEVER AGAIN!

Edit after owner/manager comment, adding:
Oregon Clinic sent us to you for a CONSULT before 2 steroid injections were to be done in my neck. Filled out some paperwork, did $20 co-pay, and indicated on an anatomy drawing where the pain was. Shown to a room, wife sat in chair, I sat on exam table. Pleasant young lady took vitals.
Anup came into the room, sat in chair at computer, seemed rushed and as if his mind was elsewhere.
Asked where the pain was, and I told him that it was on the drawing. He then said, you know nothing is going to happen here until you have done physical therapy, and a physical therapist has signed off on it. I said Oh no, another delay, you don't know how much pain I am in and for how long. He said Yes I do know, I see people in pain all day long. My wife said Let's go and we got up to go to the door. Anup got up from his chair, rushed over, got in my wifes personal space, and said Don't you stand in front of me. I said to my wife, Maybe we should see a chiropractor, he said, Maybe you should. We left, both crying, down the hall and out.
On top of that, you get a message to my Primary Care Physician stating that we came in wanting an injection (not true. We knew it was for a consult). Also said my wife (74 years) stood up and walked towards him (just the opposite). We are now being taken care of by Cornell Pain Clinic. We still are upset by the treatment AND the false statements relayed to my doctor.
And your billing of $568.00 to my health insurance.
Post will not change.|Portland pain care has excellent in person customer service. My issue was with over the phone service.

I was treated rudely and pushed aside the person I spoke to even went as far to blame a missed first appointment on my but it was due to technical issues with med Locker that was later explained that their text message link for the service don't work properly.

I later missed a secondary appointment due to a health issue which should be understandable. When I called to reschedule, Andreas G. was rude abrupt and unkind. I understand if someone's having a stressful day, but after receiving such excellent in person care I was severely disappointed with that employee's way of communicating and dealing with me, after trying to explain the situation. I was ignored and treated unkindly. I wasn't afforded the opportunity to explain. I was told I missed appointments because my fault which wasn't true. I then asked to speak to someone else and was then hung up on. Was disappointed after everyone else at Portland pain care treated me so well.|The staff is very nice when scheduling apointments.. Dr Joseph Stapelton MD, which is my Doctor at the Clinic was very professional and clear in explaining what the steps of the procedure were. The video meeting was very convenient so I
Did not have to travel in my car.  My Lower back and siatica responded well, I will be having a second round of shots soon an we hope that will do the trick so I can proceed with my left hip total replacement. I would recommend this clinic to everyone.|I had a video appointment with Dr Stapleton to discuss lumbar & sciatica-like pain with neuropathy. The appointment itself was fine and he wanted to refer me to see a neurologist, stating he didn't think he would be able to resolve the issue. The neurologist's office was having a severe issue with receiving referrals and told me to call back in a week. When I did, they hadn't received anything from Dr Stapleton's office. I asked Dr. S's office to resend it, they said ok and 10 minutes later, called me to say they could not send referrals and I would need to ask my primary Dr to refer me to another office. I was also prescribed medication which was never sent to my pharmacy.

It's beyond frustrating to be jerked around when you're in severe pain with numb extremities.|I found the staff at Portland Pain Care to be bossy and have no consideration for the patient. I wanted to ask Dr. Stapleton a question and they told me in no uncertain terms that I could not. After the procedure I had a migraine headache and wanted to know what steroids were used. Again I was told that I had to do as they said and that I had to schedule another shot appointment. I walked out of his office and went home. Several years later I had another MRI and his office called for over a week daily and I told them not to call me again. after telling them that about 10 times they finally quit calling.|Getting answers for my migraines and arthritis has not been easy between education and navigating insurance. Portland pain care has helped me push through and figure out coverage requirements so that I can properly get treatment for my pain. Thank you!

column2: Columbia Pain Management P.C. - Milwaukie, OR
column3:
Columbia Pain Management P.C. - Milwaukie, OR is a premier pain management clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life through effective pain relief strategies, our medical practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address the unique needs of each patient. Located conveniently in Milwaukie, Oregon, our team of board-certified specialists offers multidisciplinary approaches to pain management, including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative medicine options.

At Columbia Pain Management, we specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our physicians employ advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain, allowing for targeted treatment plans that address not just symptoms but underlying conditions. We pride ourselves on staying at the forefront of pain medicine, incorporating the latest research and technologies into our practice.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects every aspect of a person's life, we take a holistic, patient-centered approach to care. Our team works closely with each individual to develop customized treatment plans that align with their specific goals and lifestyle needs. We emphasize education and self-management strategies, empowering patients to take an active role in their recovery journey. Our compassionate staff ensures that patients feel supported throughout their treatment process.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern facility at 6542 SE Lake Rd, Milwaukie, OR 97222 is equipped with advanced medical technology to provide the highest standard of care. The clinic offers a comfortable, welcoming environment designed to ease anxiety and promote healing. With convenient parking and accessibility features, we strive to make each visit as stress-free as possible for our patients.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 503-654-5636. Our friendly staff is available to answer your questions and guide you through the appointment process. For additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources, visit our comprehensive website at https://columbiapain.org/. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to those in need.

column38: Lisa L|James Yeaman|Jasmine Randall|Kathy Hollamon|Collene Reeves|Kimberly Patterson|Susan Tracy|Annette Simmons
column40:
I have been a patient of Laura Scobie for 4 years....treating my idiopathic progressive polyneuropathy. She has always been very professional, patient, understanding, and reasonable. She has an amazingly calm 'bed side manner' and you can tell She truly cares for her patients. There have been a few office personnel that I would say are not so good at patient care, but that is rare and does not sway me to give a lower review. At the end of the day, I am there for the doctor, and she is amazing.|I went in to discuss options regarding treatment for my bulged discs. The staff was unfriendly and treated me like I was a drug addict. They wanted me to take a picture for their records and to take a drug test. The doctor was reassuring and friendly but almost too friendly. When I was called to schedule, the lady on the phone was almost gatekeeping information from me about how the costs would be. The doctor told me one thing but the actual bills came up entirely different and they refused to clarify until AFTER treatment. The whole place seemed like a sales pitch overall, I was so uncomfortable that I refused to return for treatment.

At first I was not going to write a review, but a whole year later I got a letter discussing the greed between my insurance provider and their contract. Apparently they have decided that I care about their failing business deals even after the way they treated me. The hypocrisy and irony alone made me return and write a review. At the end of the day, it was greed and the personalities of 5 different people within the company made me scared of the quality of care that I would have been given. I felt as if I was better off in pain than to be made a sucker.|I've been receiving care from CPM for a couple of years now and I've never had a problem with them until my visit this week. I was absolutely heartbroken (I mean I cried) when I found out that my friend Miss Tricia was let go. I have never met anyone more dedicated to her job, patients, and coworkers in my life except my mother, she was what makes  The Dalles location my go to place. She remembers everyone whether they've met once or multiple times, she's always happy and remembers even the smallest goals that patients are trying to reach, she celebrates with them no matter how small a victory it is, and in all honesty for me SHE was what made the CPM The Dalles location both special and family. CPM did themselves a great disrespect by letting her go because I guarantee without a doubt that you will never find someone more dedicated to her job and the patients it sees.|I saw Dr. Yoon for a cortisone injection on my L4-L5 joint on the right side. I have suffered from nerve pain from a bulging disc there for a long time. Dr. Yoon was a really good provider, talked me through everything, and placed it very well. One day later I am already feeling relief.|I was previously treated at Columbia Pain Center for low back problems and I am now being treated for neck problems.  Each time I have been greeted and treated with the utmost respect and care.  I highly recommend this location to any and everyone experiencing chronic ongoing pain.  Thank you Dr. Khemlani and staff for the wonderful treatment you have provided to me.|I'm only allotting 1 star because it doesn't allow 0.

1. I've been a patient at this clinic for a few years. This year my insurance changed. I wasn't even allowed to schedule an appointment without having my ID number, despite their office having access to the insurance system to verify my coverage. I wasn't provided the option to speak to their billing dept, which has access to this system. I was completely denied anything until I had my ID number.

2. Once they confirmed my insurance information, I called almost daily leaving several messages, including urgent message and it took them a week to even call me back.

3.  I have occipital neuralgia, which causes debilitating stabbing head pain on the entire right side of my head. I'm not contacting their office for narcotics or opioids. Anyone with this level of nerve pain anywhere in their body knows this doesn't work. I was requesting an urgent office visit for nerve block, lidocaine with kenalog, injections into my scalp to alleviate my excruciating nerve pain temporarily while I wait to get on schedule for medial branch block. I not only couldn't get a call back, I couldn't even get in for an urgent visit for these injections. Our PCPs offices refer to these specialty clinics because the PCPs can't or won't do these nerve blocks and leaves it to these "specialists" to perform the injections. We don't know when these nerve flares will happen but when they do, it isn't an unreasonable ask to get in to our physicians offices immediately for some relief for debilitating pain. The clinics should have this built into their schedule for urgent appointments for exactly these types of situations. It is completely absurd not only I couldn't get a call back but also couldn't get in for an urgent appointment. It resorted to my mother driving me 2 hours from Estacada to Tillamook to get a nerve block yesterday.

4. I finally get a call today from the clinic to schedule an appointment. Soonest available for JUST an appointment, no injection because I hadn't been seen since September or October, is 4/9. Oh, and the request for nerve block was put in but of course is waiting for insurance authorization. Funny no one called to tell me that. But also sad I saw a provider to give me the nerve block yesterday before I was even given the common courtesy of a timely returned phone call, especially when left urgent message, let alone the PAIN CLINIC not getting me into their office on an urgent basis to perform the injections themselves. NO...I HAD TO GO TO TILLAMOOK FOR A NERVE BLOCK. We live in a metro area. If anywhere should provide quick and timely treatment it's here. But no, I had to go to a rural area for urgent and necessary treatment.

Needless to say, I can't even begin to explain the level of frustration and disappointment in this clinic, their lack of professionalism, lack of empathy for their patient and lack of ability to provide prompt proper, reasonable and necessary medical treatment for their patient. And given the type of patients they provide this type of medical treatment for, I'm very likely not the only patient that has dealt with these issues with this clinic.|I had a 7:30. a.m. appointment for an epidural injection procedure. All of the staff were so kind and professional. Mila (PA?) was especially nice to meet. She was compassionate, knowledgeable, and thorough.

The injection was so gentle (not my first), and my nerves told me it was right on target, but not painfully so. I was also shown imaging of the procedure, which I really appreciated. Regretfully, I don't remember her name, but she was really skillful and gentle in how she did the injection. Minimal discomfort for me, and I chose local only, not sedation.

This is a place of healing.  Highly recommend if you have a choice in PM providers, My back and leg thank you all for your help!  I especially appreciate that it will help me to experience some less painful time while I wait for my lumbar surgery to address the core problems.|I went in to Columbia Pain Care extremely nervous and came out a very happy camper . Doctor K was the perfect doctor for me . I have a pinched nerve in my upper back , had my injection today and felt marvelous afterwards . Will definitely continue to see the professional and compassionate people at this office. Would very highly recommend these people for back care to everyone dealing with back problems if you want the best , Columbia Pain Care is the place for you!.

column40:
Update: I received a call from the office to get it scheduled with another provider. Thank you for reaching out and addressing my concerns.

I was seen by Dr Prabhu for my very first appointment. I already had my medications figured out before coming here and hoping to get them reviewed. Dr Prabhu was on time and listened me and answered all questions however she was very pushy about getting injections. She told me if I opt to get an injection at a hospital her office will not continue to manage my pain because things get complicated. I did not feel like she was considering the cons having too frequent injections as I had my first one 2 months ago at a hospital. This was my first (and probably last) time going to a pain clinic, if this is how things are working, I could just use my own PCP which would be easier to get appointments at least. Then I had a medication question on the app, the nurse returned to me at the same day which is great however she does not sound like she knows anything about a simple pain killer I was using. Whatever I asked, she said "of course you can do it if you want to". It was one of the worst medical advice I have ever heard! Giving 2 stars because Dr Prabhu did her best to listen to me and answered all my questions. Everything else is just 0.|Dr. Prabhu has taken excellent care of me for quite a while. She listens, treats me with great respect and offers great solutions to my problems with my pain. I  am lucky to have been her patient.|Dr Yoo is very knowledgeable and answered all my questions providing excellent context for his opinions. My case is complex and I have a renewed sense of options. I am grateful.|Dr was in a good mood, very good bedside manner.  He seemed to truly care.|This is my initial review of Pain Care Specialists Of Oregon. I was very impressed with my first, and so far only appointment there, with their incredible professionalism and thoroughness. The doctors were prepared and had gone over my records and prior imaging and were patient and detailed in interviewing and checking out my body. The experience is very positive also because of their care and gentleness. I want to also give them a special praise, because of their multifaceted approach to healing, which engages the patient process. The online program that they encourage us to use is really helpful.|If you are looking to get your chronic pain treated the right way do go here. Nothing but injections that are not DEA approved and are banned in other countries. Opioids are made to treat pain. These young doctors don't know what there doing. To scared to prescribe pain medications that work. Chronic pain patients that take opioids to manage there pain are not the problem. Opioid medications are not the problem  street fentanyl is the problem|Very unusual health history with many factors complicating treatments with various specialists involved however I did feel that my health information was reviewed and all factors taken in to account and a very positive treatment plan approach was offered. I would have given 5 stars but I suffer from migraines that are triggered by fragrances and this particular office uses them in the waiting room.|I have experienced pain, on a daily basis, on the lower, back of my skull and neck since 1981.  Elliott Yoo, MD, with Pain Care Specialists of Oregon, put a couple of shots in the area of discomfort yesterday.  I've noticed a difference as the pain has lessened considerably, already.  I'm hopeful the treatment will continue to make it easier for me to move my head/neck for a long time to come.

Advanced Pain Management Center serves Portland, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. At APMC, our dedicated team of specialists focuses on treating chronic pain conditions through personalized care plans. We understand that living with persistent pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we offer multidisciplinary approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Whether your pain stems from arthritis, failed back surgery syndrome, cancer treatments, fibromyalgia, or an old injury, our experienced physicians provide evidence-based interventions to help you regain control of your life. We combine cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care to address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

Our Commitment to Patient Care

At APMC, we strive to protect our patients and help them maintain optimal health. Our comprehensive evaluations go beyond simply treating symptoms—we work to identify and address the underlying causes of your pain. Each treatment plan is developed with your specific goals and lifestyle in mind, ensuring the most effective path toward pain relief and improved function.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 10305 SW Park Way, Suite 300, Portland, OR 97225, our modern clinic provides a comfortable environment for all appointments and procedures. Our facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to deliver the highest standard of care.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit www.apmconline.org or call us at (971) 233-4199. Pain management is our specialty, and we're committed to helping you find relief and restore your quality of life.

column40:
I have been seeing Mr. Shore and Ms. Lahm for over a year. They are very friendly and care about their patients. I have had several procedures with Dr. Fiks and he is very good at what he does and the entire staff are friendly and caring.  I would recommend them for Chronic Pain care, acute pain and injections.|This place has been a life saver for me!  I feel blessed to have a team who offers professional care. I have had extreme pain that Dr. Fiks fixed in the surgery center. I am so grateful for his knowledge & skill.  I regularly see D. Shore PA-C.
who takes the time to listen to me & explain in detail why I am having symptoms & how to proceed to alleviate the pain.  All the staff is wonderful.  I highly recommend Advanced Pain Management and the surgery center.  I feel safe knowing I am in good hands.  I know I've said a lot but can't say enough good things about this place. Thank You APM!|While it's absolutely right in line with exactly what I expect to see from this office, I'm very surprised to see all of these positive reviews from patients who have only been with this office for a very short period of time. I urge you to read the negative views and the responses this clinic offers to them. They literally villainize the patients and refuse any kind of compassion or attempt to take responsibility. I was a patient at this office for YEARS! After the amazing doctor I saw retired and I was left to find a doctor who cared. This was my second attempt. Not only did I experience a complete lack of professionalism, but I  had to literally make sure they were constantly doing what they said they would do and found that they were not. I would constantly leave messages, telling them of issues with my insurance. That they would require a prior authorization, that they wouldnt cover a medication. I'd spend hours on the phone with insurance then immediately notify the office as to what was required of them to proceed. Every single time my messages were ignored and for days I would be out of medication because the medical assistants never told my provider. In another instance, when My medication was cut twice without even being notified. At one point My insurance wouldn't cover the medication I was on and the office refused to complete the appeal process, my provider  sent in a perscriprion for a new medication but they didn't bother calculating what an equivalent dose would be they just gave me the smallest possible dose and cut my MME by 80%. When I got the response  of. "Well there is nothing I can do about it now" from the provider I made an appt with dr fiks  and his response was "well I wouldn't have done it that way, but it's done now and we're not going back." He didn't give a crap that it was causing me complete agony.  I had been suffering for so long it was literally May and  I still couldn't put my Christmas tree or decor away. This doctor cares for profit over patients and I warn you, it may be happy and easy at first, but be aware that you will have to double check their work every two of the way and even then, they don't give a crap what they do to you when they drop the ball.|Since My first appointment, I have felt supported and understood. I finally have a team behind me all the way! I've never had such great care! From the fabulous team of Dr.Fiks, the medical assistants, and front desk staff... to the Fit Cam app and support from Nurse Barbara, monthly, and the surgical staff, it's just been a great experience! And definitely what I've needed!
I'm learning so much about how the brain and body are connected, in regards to pain. Even how we express our pain. Loving the exercises and music therapy for relaxation and calming. I've had two medial branch nerve blocks and now my ablation is coming up!  I haven't had a day without pain in almost 30 years! I highly recommend Dr. Fiks, and staff, at Advanced Pain Management Center!|Dr. Fiks is GREAT. He is knowledgeable. But the phone system is horrible. I'm only able to leave voicemails and half the time they don't get returned and I'm told they didn't get the voicemail. Their phone system needs to be updated as it gives the option for a text and it automatically texts you when you call them but I was told they no longer do the texts.

I'm adding an edit. I still think Dr. Fiks is a great doctor and one girl and the front desk and his medical assistant are great but if you have any issues don't count on the manager calling or assisting. I had my appointment cancelled and I wasn't notified, Karen claims she called and left me a voicemail but I didn't receive it and she only called once- you always call patients more than once when cancelling their appointment. Karen refused to come out and talk to me and said she would call me, this was 5 days ago. I also emailed her 2 days ago and no response.

Again, Dr Fiks is a great doctor, just be prepared for issues and no follow up by the manager.|Dr. FIKS himself treated me very bad. He only cares about how much money he can make off of a patient. I have been seeing another PA at this office for over 7 years. Unfortunately yesterday I had to see Dr. First, he tried 4 times to charge me for things I don't need. When I said No to each extra charge. He tried to get rid of me. I owe the office no money. But the way he treated me was absolutely terrible.  He should not be treating Anyone!|Dr Fiks and Bridget have been wonderful and caring to my issues. They take the time to listen and we work together to find solutions to my issues. The medical assistants and front desk are amazing as well.|Dmitriy Shore p.a. for dr. Fiks should lose his job for denying me treatment after over a decade of the clinic supporting my dependancy. His computer had faulty info, and rather than letting me explain he called me a liar and find some one else to give me meds.  No weaning me off the morphine dependancy,, just leave. I have proof of his error, but there was nothing but his mistaken attitude.  Be aware!!

column48: Does he treat fibromyalgia pain and osteo arthritis
column49:
Dr. Fiks does indeed treat fibromyalgia pain and osteoarthritis. Treatments vary for every individual, but common therapies that we offer here for fibromyalgia include:

*	Physical Therapy
*	MLS Laser Therapy
*	Trigger point injections
*	Cognitive behavioral therapy
*	Medications

Common treatments that we offer for people dealing with osteoarthritis include:

*	Steroid injections
*	Regenerative therapies such as platelet rich plasma (PRP)/Stem cell injections
*	Joint injections including viscous fluid supplementation
*	MLS Laser Therapy
*	Physical Therapy
*	Cognitive behavioral therapy
*	Medications

Visit our website to learn more about these therapies. Let us know if we can answer any more of your questions!

column40:
Dr. Oh and all the staff were very cordial, helpful and very caring.  My consultation with Dr. Oh was very helpful and encouraging.  He took extra time to explain my condition and his recommendations on treatment.  And Ashley was very helpful as well.  She provided me information on how I could review the doctors assessment and how I could share it with my family.  Just an excellent experience!|My visit was completed in at timely manner, the desk young lady was very professional in my contact with her, she explained what I need to do in completing my paperwork. My lobby wait was very short, and I was greeted by nurse who guided me to room and very professional in taking mu vitals and a few minutes PA Nash came into the room and discussed what my issues were and discussed several different ways I could be treated and he said he would discuss it with the doctor and they wood submit the paperwork to the VA. My total visit was very nice and professional with personnel who treated me. PA Mash was also very polite and caring during my visit with him.|The doctors here care about every aspect of my pain. They listen and quickly get to the problem. The women at the front desk are super nice and quickly get you registered.  The only problem in the beginning was getting approved for a surgery.  But because my insurance won't pay for anesthesia.  I have had to put my health a side to save $600 in order to get the trial done and then the final placement.  It's not the fault of the clinic. But I would suggest calling your insurance company to get the approval done in a more efficient timely matter.|There is about a month to two month wait period to get in. Then the doctor doesn't read any of your history and suggests treatments you don't want because you've already tried them and they didn't work. And then they do a drug test, which you're not allowed to go anywhere else to get done, it HAS to be through their office, and the results take 4 weeks to come back. And then two months later you get hit with a near $300 bill because they charge over $800 for a drug test. $800 for a drug test and I never went back because I ended up getting what I needed from a different doctor. Glad I never got the injections they wanted to do, who know what that would have cost.|These guys are fraudulent. They will only offer things outside what your insurance provides. Not tell you that and then your responsible to pay whatever your insurance won't cover. They refuse to do pain management narcotics contract even though I qualify and have passed there drug screenings etc primary care sent me for that reason and they refuse. They did some placebo to my spine and then charged me $160 for something that did nothing but invade my spine and make more tissues damage. Try to be patient and show them your reasonable and will try what they suggest and that's all they suggested was a freaking placebo. I have 2 back surgeries, 14 surgeries from cancer, a hip replacement surgery and need to be on a contract so I stand a chance to fight what cancer treatments did to my body. Absolutely have all the evidence but I'm 42 and doctors over prescribed in the past so now I'm treated like a drug addict when it's actually needed for some amount of time. But let's give the actual addicts free methadone and prop them up and give them chances... I want to vomit Oregon is ridiculous....
After posting this they called 5 times, replied that insurance covered everything in my account  and I have no balance meanwhile I have $160+ bill. And the app says I owe even more for a UA  then when I didn't answer the tried calling my husband. After reading through the reviews I'm not alone in feeling like this place is frauding people who are desperate and in pain. No insurance company covers experimental procedures. And no even though they claim they told me that I'd have a balance in the reply below... I never was told that my insurance didn't cover the procedure until a month or so after it was done. I'd have cancelled it had I know as living on disability and fixed income.|My appointments with David are always so comfortable & he always checks on my pain levels to see if I need another trip to  the surgery center for another injection.  He's a wonderful, caring man..|I have no complaints. Every single person that interfaces with me at the clinic is gracious, and does their best to help me.   Pain is the most common reason for seeking professional help.. it also is the most difficult to treat, and the recipients of care often expect too much. These folks do their best to try and help you, so it behooves you to be appreciative.. All too often we folks who suffer from chronic pain, expect too much from the folks who give us care. Instead of negative reviews it would be nice to see more thank yous, and less criticism over minutia. Jjk|The physicians are great and they explain everything. The Front desk people greet you immediately. However the woman with braces and black hair looks mad all the time. When you ask her questions, she looked confused but then would look for the answer.

column40:
Above and beyond in every way.

I want to give a huge shout out to Danilyn, Genesis, and Amber!

You three have made each visit exceptionally warm and friendly. I appreciate each one of you going above and beyond to treat with me with respect as we navigated my shoulder/neck issue together.

Never once did I feel like a burden, and you all explained the process so clearly.

I have nothing but good things to say, and I am so lucky to have been seen at this facility.

Lastly, I want to give some praise to the man Dr. Stapleton. You were prompt, friendly, and effective. This was a night and day experience that I was unable to receive from other providers like Dr. Ryan Thompson or Dr. Michael Hwang.

Keep up the great photography work, and thanks again for your efforts and attention to detail.|Immaculate vibes from the whole staff. Really nice people. They worked with me to get to the bottom of my pain when the initial diagnosis and treatment recommended by my PCP wasn't working. So glad I got referred to these folks!|I wasn't sure about this clinic at first, but I'm adjusting and they've done an excellent job.

Dr. Stapleton is experienced and knowledgeable, and always answers my questions. He's very efficient. The procedures are painless, so I am very grateful for that; they make sure you're comfortable. The first round of RFA L3-L5 and L5-S3 (I think) worked really well for about nine months or so. Some people experience pain relief after one treatment, but it can take three or four rounds for permanent relief. I'm starting round two in a couple of weeks.

Be sure to make a list of questions before the appointment. If you hang up too soon, you'll have to wait for another appointment to ask about anything you forgot. You can't call back to ask, even if there is time left in your appointment. Probably a billing thing.

If you get off to a rocky start, give them a chance and some time to work with you! Danilynn is friendly and kind, and the medical assistant asks her questions and gets you connected right away for video calls. Android and iPhone are both supported for video calls now! Woohoo!

My experiences with this team over the past couple of years has been life changing. For low back pain, it's been the only thing that's really helped me.|So my husband has suffered from what he  thought was SI joint pain. We scheduled appointment here & without talking to Doctor just Danilyn was  recommended to get lidocaine shot which only last 6 hrs tops,then cortisone shot 2 freaking weeks later.Went to Wilsonville to get shot, was not impressed didn't get info on  how long or if this shot would work He's been in extreme pain since he has seen this place hoping to get results & have not got any improvement. You do not see a REAL Doctor & they should not rely on your own self diagnosis. They don't return your calls or follow thru on doing what they say they're going to do following up on your medical insurance , as my insurance does not require a lidocaine  shot before as a test run it's  the docs decision which Stapleton said it was not his choice. So is it the $$ or what, if they could only see the suffering . Would not recommend this place!!!months later still in same pain NO follow up asking how I'm doing TOTAL waste of time/$$ plz don't go to this place!!|I have been under the care of Dr. Stapleton and his staff for the last year. The courtesy and care I have been given during this time has been outstanding. The associates in the office take great care in asking the right questions and decide on the solution. My injections have worked every time until I do something I shouldn't. I am thankful for the care I have been given and appreciate all of their kindnesses.|The staff were great - every one of them.  Pre-procedure prep right through the procedure itself.

The facilities were fine - except for that awful chair I had to use instead of a gurney.  It was uncomfortable and terribly unprofessional - especially considering the fact that you charge were the same as places like Columbia River Surgery Center.

I would use your facility again if my doctor requested it, but I would definitely lower my expectations - except for your staff.  They were wonderful!

Jon|Everyone is so nice to be around. It made an unpleasant situation easy to get through. I am so grateful for that, it helped me more than I can express.
Thank you!|My experience was very positive; all the staff at his office and the surgery center were very pleasant, competent and helpful.  The doctor was personable, chatting with me and my partner before the injection and obviously doing it well since I had very good pain relieve after.

Dr. Joseph M. Savino, MD serves Medford, Oregon and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. As a board-certified physician specializing in interventional pain medicine, Dr. Savino brings decades of experience to his practice at Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon. His comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care, helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions and improve their quality of life.

At his Bennett Avenue clinic, Dr. Savino offers a wide range of advanced pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. His expertise encompasses treatment for back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic conditions, and complex regional pain syndrome. Using evidence-based approaches, Dr. Savino develops personalized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 825 Bennett Ave in Medford, Dr. Savino's practice features modern medical equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. The facility is easily accessible from throughout Southern Oregon, with convenient parking and wheelchair accessibility for all patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Dr. Savino apart is his dedication to patient education and collaborative care. He takes time to thoroughly explain conditions and treatment options, ensuring patients are active participants in their pain management journey. His compassionate bedside manner and attentive listening have earned him exceptional patient satisfaction ratings throughout his career.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Joseph M. Savino, patients can call +1 541-779-5228 or visit his website at http://www.painspecialists.com/ for more information about services and appointment availability. The practice welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans.

I was so impressed with not only how well informed Dr. Savino was with my situation. I appreciate that he is a doctor who  sincerely  cares  about your health and seems to take pride in the work he does for his patients.

Thank you Dr. Savino for your care.

I felt very comfortable and confident in the plan we are moving forward with.|My appointment with Dr. Savino was terrific.  He explained my MRI results thoroughly.
