column11:
About the Practice

Corvallis Pain and Spine in Corvallis, Oregon, is a clinic that focuses on providing patients with cutting-edge treatment options for managing their pain, as well as treating other pain-related illnesses and conditions. The expert team at Corvallis Pain and Spine has extensive experience in interventional and medical management of neuropathic pain, cancer pain, spine-related pain, and in applying a multidisciplinary approach to complex pain conditions. Each provider is committed to developing long-lasting relationships with their patients and offers them personalized treatment options so their recovery process is effective and tailored to their needs.
column38: B Savage|mary crofts|Jon Dowd|tom demarest|Rock Ford|Scott Blair|Janet Woodgeard - Tolman|Richard Kapple
column40:
First, the office staff were all very friendly, professional and welcoming. Tommie then took me back - what a great personality to have representing your office! Very professional and cheerful, listened astutely and showed empathy.

I saw Dr. Rask and really appreciated him too. He listened, asked good questions. I walked out with an initial treatment plan and now the challenge is getting insurance authorization. As you might imagine, I wish I did not have these health issues. But it seems to me that the clinic is a good place to be a patient. Thank you!|The doctors and staff at CPM are awesome .  They're efficient and friendly all at the same time.  Dr. Rask puts me at ease when a procedure could be quite painful.  I've been his patient for about 7 years and  can easily say that these good comments are consistent.  I've been recommending CPM for years and will continue to do so.|Dr. Rask is unique and valuable in that he spent a good deal of time with me, ensuring I was well informed of my situation and efforted mightily that my insurer covered what he deemed necessary .|I was very pleased with my "encounter with Dr Rask. He was extremely thorough in his analysis of my symptoms and the uniqueness of my lower leg pain. I had no feelings of just being given a cursory evaluation.|First visit.   Very thorough.   Hard for me to do a REAL evaluation after ten minutes.  .   Staff was very nice.   I hope my insurance will agree to cover the injections.     Thanks for seeing me.    Sincerely....Rock|Staff was very friendly and proficient. Dr. Rask was also friendly, knowledgeable and professional. He asked many questions and listened and then reviewed to make sure I understood and knew the plan. I look forward to further visits to implement the plan that has been chosen.|Was 8 minutes late due to traffic, plus it took front clerk a few minutes to even find me in the system. She checked me in then after waiting five more minutes, I was called up and told he couldn't see me because I was late. Next appointment available is in a month. This is definitely not what I expected. Almost every other medical facility in Corvallis has been so great and accommodating. Lets scroll forward almost two months. I was able to get in, Insurance approved a procedure. I followed up a few weeks after approval.. and apparently their only scheduler was out two weeks ill.. so here I sit with still no resolve.  The Doc seems like a nice enough fella. The girl that answered the phone today was pleasant (nice surprise) We need a few more choices in Corvallis... or these folks need more staff.
I sure hope this place improves. I want to change my review to a more positive one... still waiting for something to turn around with these guys.|Letter to Patrick Rask:
Today I saw you for the first time in hopes to find someone empathetic to my pain, eager to find a solution, however you are the most rude and angry little man I have met yet in the medical field. To state that you are not going to be Salems "relief valve" as if the city or hospitals of Salem sent me to you. I knew from your demeanor you had no intent on taking me on as a patient after two minutes of talking to you. Have you seen your ads underneath your clinics website online? Look at the first one, is that how you treated me. Was it necessary to demean my PA? And as far as your comment to not knowing how to judge people's pain or learning that in school.....maybe you should consider a career change. I'm on the fence on reporting this to the OMB, maybe I'll decide after you respond or not. Interestingly as you told me you told your receptionist you weren't interested, you still made an appointment, charged my insurance and took my co-pay after you had decided weeks ago you had no interest. To drive over an hour and a half to your clinic the pain you put me in just to discriminate against me is absolutely shameful. I hope, that there are still a few decent dr.s still out there who wish to care for there patients.
Disappointed,
Rich Kapple

column3:
Donna Morgan, M.D. Pain Medicine serves Eugene, Oregon and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Dr. Morgan brings extensive expertise as a board-certified pain medicine physician dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with compassionate care, creating personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain challenges.

At our state-of-the-art facility located at 360 S Garden Way #230 in Eugene, we offer a wide range of pain management solutions. Dr. Morgan utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain, then develops targeted treatment strategies that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative approaches to pain relief.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Dr. Morgan takes time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. Our team strives to improve quality of life by reducing pain, enhancing function, and helping patients return to their daily activities with greater comfort and mobility.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Donna Morgan, please call us at +1 541-283-1844 or visit our comprehensive website at https://psopain.com/ for more information about our services. Our office is conveniently located in south Eugene, offering a comfortable environment where patients receive the highest standard of pain medicine care.

column40:
Donna Morgan is very compassionate and thorough. She took the time to really find out about my back pain history gave me so much helpful information. Best new patient exam ever.|I've been seeing Dr Morgan for... Gosh I'm not even sure, maybe 8+ years!   Honestly, as a person with multiple health issues, I have grown to reeeeally dislike going to the doctor. That said, I always appreciate my check-in's with Dr Morgan. She has ALWAYS been so respectful. She is a great listener and I think that my input about my health really matters to her.
Dr Morgan is VERY knowledgeable.  I appreciate it so much that she has always tries to do her level best to consider my overall health, meet my needs as much as she can, and help me understand any information I may be confused or concerned about.
The staff at Pain Specialists of Oregon is always respectful and kind. They are very " on it" , I have never had to wait long to be seen, or receive a call back. Overall the clinic is just an awesome, calm space with good energy and great people.

6+ stars for Dr Morgan and staff at P. S. O|This wil.ne kind of long but for everyone suffering with pain and desperate to get better, I wanted to leave a full in depth review.

Dr. Morgan is one of the very few doctors who will sit there with you and listen to you and then work together to find a solution to your problem. Most doctors just want to talk themselves and have zero interest in what you have to say and then they just want to present a solution that's usually a generic one. Dr. Morgan listens to you and then works with you back and forth, this allows her to find a solution that's unique to your situation and works best for you. Because of this we've been able to find pain management that has actually worked really well and has allowed me to have a fairly great quality of life whereas before I was so sick with pain I missed out on everything. Now there's a new surgery out that just passed FDA approval, or at least was scheduled to by Jan 2024 called 'Hydrafil', that literally seems like the perfect procedure to fix my issue and I will now be working on getting that procedure done.

Other doctors tried pushing me into the typical fusion of the spine so they can cut my pain meds and send me on my way and there's a great chance that could have made me worse off or have done nothing.

Since Dr. Morgan worked with me constantly and allowed me to be on pain meds longer since new procedures were always coming out and we were waiting.for one that made the most sense, it made it so I was able to make it long enough to get to this new procedure which seems to be a spot on best solution for me.

The procedure is minimally invasive, has an extremely quick recovery time, and appears to be a permanent fix. Other doctors wouldn't have worked with me on pain management as long as a Dr. Morgam has and would have had me do a procedure I more than likely would have regretted that wouldn't have fixed my issue, but Dr. Morgan worked closely with me until the right surgery came out and she never once made me feel guilty or bad about my pain meds like most doctors do. I never once was made to feel like a drug seeker and now here I am, more than likely going to have this new procedure any day now as soon as the FDA stamps the seal of approval and I will be living a brand new pain free life for the first time since Feb 2010 when I broke my back and my fractured my neck in a car accident and.since then have ruptured and lost 3 discs in my back due to poor doctors treating me like a drug seeker the minute you mention back and neck pain.

I can't thank Dr. Morgan enough and I can now see the light at the end of the tunnel and as soon as the FDA puts their final stamp of approval on this procedure, I'll be in and out within a few hours with a permanent fix putting and end to 14 years worth of agonizing pain. I can't recommend Dr. Morgan enough. She is by far the best pain specialist I've ever had and as far as doctors go in general, she is absolutely an incredible doctor. If you're suffering from pain and need help to figure out your problem so you can get yourself fixed and living a normal life again from pain, absolutely have your primary care refer you out to Pain Specialists of Oregon and to Dr. Donna Morgan.|Dr Morgan has been my pain specialist for over 15 years now & I wouldn't have it any other way. She's caring & compassionate without being too soft on you. She has your best interests in mind while she cares for you. Through her care I have a spinal pump that helps to relieve my pain & together we weaned me off all my oral opiate pain meds. Right now we're still adjusting my pump even after all these years trying to wean me down some more on my pain meds that have ravaged my gut. That's what I mean by having your best interests in mind. She is very knowledgeable about all manners of pain management & how best to treat it. I highly recommend her!|Dr Morgan has been taking care of me for 7 years now.  I absolutely love her and recommend her without hesitation.  Her right hand, Melissa is absolutely wonderful as well.Thank you both!|Dr. Morgan was very personable. She listened to what I had to say, and we made a game plan together for my treatment. She made sure to explain everything to me about what was wrong and what could be done about it. I would highly recommend.|See Morgan was very compassionate for my new patient visit. But when she ordered a test for me it took more the two and a half months and I still have not gotten the test!!!! River bend blames the office, the office blames river bend. I am just stuck in the middle, when I kept the appointment to go over test results that have not happened. She stormed out of the room and said she was done listening to|Dr Morgan was very considerate and professional throughout our appointment.  She quickly established rapport while focusing in on the reason I was there.  Dr Morgan explained the results of my MRI and helped me to understand why I have been experiencing the pain I have and what possible routes we can take to address it.  I have not yet done the follow up procedures that she recommended, but I am confident that I am in good hands.

column3:
Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon serves Medford, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by George Johnston, DO and his associates, our practice has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the Rogue Valley region. We specialize in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches that combine medical expertise with compassionate care. Our team of board-certified physicians works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At Pain Specialists of Southern Oregon, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional treatments for various pain conditions. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. We treat conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our goal is to improve our patients' quality of life by reducing pain and enhancing functionality.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in a collaborative approach to pain management that empowers patients to participate actively in their treatment journey. Our team takes the time to educate patients about their conditions and available treatment options, ensuring they make informed decisions about their care. We coordinate with primary care physicians and other specialists to provide comprehensive care that addresses all aspects of a patient's health.

Our Facility

Located at 825 Bennett Ave, Medford, OR 97504, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment of pain conditions. We have created a comfortable environment where patients feel welcomed and supported throughout their visits. Our convenient location makes us accessible to residents across Southern Oregon.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 541-779-5228. You can also visit our website at http://www.painspecialists.com/ for additional information about our practice, providers, and treatment options. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management care accessible to all patients in need.

column3:
Central Oregon Spine & Sports, LLC serves Bend, Oregon and surrounding communities as a premier sports medicine and pain management practice. Led by board-certified physician Dr. Philip Wallace, MD, a recognized leader in regenerative pain management, and skilled physician assistant Kate Berglund, PA, the practice delivers specialized care for current and former physically active individuals. Their philosophy centers on natural medicine approaches with conservative treatment plans designed to reduce dependency on pain medications while enhancing patients' quality of life.

The expert team at Central Oregon Spine & Sports maintains a distinctive focus on treating patients with active lifestyles or those looking to return to physical activity. Their comprehensive treatment protocols blend traditional medical services with innovative, cutting-edge techniques in pain management and sports medicine. This balanced approach allows them to address both acute injuries and chronic pain conditions with personalized care plans.

Services and Treatment Options

Offering a wide spectrum of both conventional and advanced medical services, the practice specializes in regenerative medicine techniques that promote natural healing. Their conservative approach prioritizes non-pharmaceutical interventions whenever possible, helping patients achieve sustainable pain relief without long-term medication dependence. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual's specific needs, activity goals, and lifestyle requirements.

Location and Contact Information

Central Oregon Spine & Sports welcomes patients at their conveniently located office at 2115 NE Wyatt Ct #101, Bend, OR 97701. For consultations or appointments, patients can call +1 541-205-7457 or visit their website at www.cospinensports.com for additional information about their services and approach to pain management and sports medicine.
column11:
Central Oregon Spine & Sports is an exceptional sports medicine and pain management practice that serves the residents of Bend, Oregon, and its surrounding communities. The team includes board-certified doctor Philip Wallace, MD, a leader in the field of regenerative pain management, as well as Kate Berglund, PA. The team maintains a special focus on treating patients who are or were once physically active.
The team of providers employs a natural approach to medicine and strives to be conservative in their treatment plans. They aim to get patients off of pain medications and back to a higher quality of life without them, offering a wide range of both traditional and cutting-edge medical services.

column40:
Dr. Wallace is an exceptional pain management specialist who truly cares about his patients. He's always listened attentively to my concerns and has provided effective treatments, including steroid injections and nerve ablations. His expertise and compassionate approach have made a significant positive impact on my quality of life. I highly recommend him to anyone seeking relief from chronic pain!!!|Being new to Central Oregon, I needed to establish with an office, so I did a google search and found Central Oregon Spine & Sport.  The scheduler I spoke with was very helpful, easy to talk with and had excellent customer service. My first visit did not disappoint. All office staff are kind and respectful and Christy Barlow is amazing. She is attentive and professional. When the conversation surrounded my issue, she provided a treatment option with an honest opinion of what else might be going on and her thoughts of what would be next if I don't get the results we are hoping for. Christy is "real" and laughed with me when discussing how I ended up in Central Oregon from the valley. She made my visit very comfortable. I am so thankful I chose a Central Oregon Spine & Sport to evaluate and treat my SI joint pain.|My doctor sent a referral there. They said they could get to my neck injection right away, When my saif Claim was approved, They would not even return my representatives phone calls. I have tried personally to call them at least 15 to 20 times with no answer and no return phone calls.
I have basically given up on these guys. I have no idea how they can run a business.  With the people they have in their main office very disappointed. I wouldn't recommend them to anyone.|My wife has been going here for a couple years now, so I thought I would see if they can help me with my back issues. Due to insurance requirements, they have to perform test injections before they can perform the nerve ablation. My wife has been through a few of these, so I am not completely ignorant of how it works. Unfortunately, the test only makes the pain much worse. When they contact me the next day, I tell them that the pain is much worse, but the person on the phone did not believe me when I told them it was worse. I chose not to go through the rest of the procedure. The primary issue isn't that the test injection didn't work. It seems like they have dumped me as a patient. I had some MRIs performed and was supposed to have follow-up appointments. However, I have heard nothing, and it has been two weeks since the scans. Sadly, this is where our health care system is going. The providers are being paid less and less, but they have to bring in the clients to pay the bills. If your body doesn't respond how they need it to, you are out the door.|Was on the phone with the receptionist for over 10 min 2 weeks ago to get an appt. She talked and talked about how good the doctors were and how they could help me with a herniated disc. I wait 2 weeks for my appt, during this time I can't lift anything and can't even sleep most nights. I arrive to my appointment 10 min early and they act like they have no clue who I am, I don't have an appointment. She actually sends me to another office to check with them. I come back and say I definitely have an appointment with Dr. Barlow. She just says well we don't have an appointment. I then ask if I was I their system. She says yes....I ask why would I be in the system without an appointment. She says something under her breath about referrals. I don't have a referral. She doesn't even try to apologize for her obvious mistake she makes just tells me I can come back next Monday if I want to be seen. Such a waste of time and so poorly handled, as though it was somehow my fault.|Can't recommend Christy Barlow enough. Saw her for a ruptured disc in my neck and she exhibited all of the characteristics you want in a health care professional: knowledgeable, patient, compassionate, personable, and articulate. Very glad to have found someone in sports medicine that I feel comfortable with and trust. I saw her a couple of years ago for pretty intense and recurring knee pain and her recommendation was spot on. Fixed me right up - haven't had an issue since!|Terrible place. If you want someone to see you soon go somewhere else this is not the place. I made an appointment for a knee injury in JUNE they cancelled it because of "something in the office" for a whole month later in july. so fine I'll wait. July comes they call for my insurance but I've been out of town and didn't have access to the card. I called them several times and left multiple voicemails and not a single person got back to me then they said they need to reschedule AGAIN and in AUGUST. So now I'm waiting a whole three months?? terrible customer service, at least offer me a sooner appointment for cancelling my first one. I'll be going somewhere else from now on.|I met with Christine Barlow today about some neck pain and nerve problems I must say she is absolutely top shelf Gave her a 5 star review only because they don't have 10 stars! I've met with doctor Wallace in the past as well and they are just the best plenty of time to talk not in a hurry answered all my questions Very professional Mighty fine folks!

column2: Pain Care Specialists of Oregon - McMinnville
column3:
Pain Care Specialists of Oregon - McMinnville serves the McMinnville, Oregon community with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists focuses on identifying the root cause of your pain rather than simply treating symptoms. We understand how chronic pain can disrupt your quality of life, which is why we've developed personalized treatment plans designed to help patients return to their normal activities and lifestyle.

At Pain Care Specialists of Oregon, we believe in exploring all available options for pain relief. Our practice emphasizes minimally invasive procedures that can provide significant relief without the lengthy recovery times associated with traditional surgery. Our state-of-the-art, on-site procedure center is equipped with cutting-edge technology that allows us to deliver the most advanced treatments in pain management.

Outpatient Procedures with Immediate Results

All procedures performed at our facility are outpatient-based, meaning you can return home the same day. Many of our treatments show instant results, allowing patients to experience relief quickly and begin reclaiming their lives. Our innovative approaches have proven extremely successful in addressing various pain conditions, offering hope to those who have struggled with chronic pain.

Visit Our McMinnville Location

We welcome new patients at our conveniently located office at 2700 SE Stratus Ave #401, McMinnville, OR 97128. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 503-371-1010 or visit our website at www.paincareoregon.com for additional information about our treatment options and approach to pain management.
column11: "At Pain Care Specialists of Oregon, we are dedicated to finding the source of your pain. Under our treatment, we want to help you overcome pain and return to your normal lifestyle. To do this, we want you to consider all options available to you including minimally invasive procedures in our state-of-the-art, on-site procedure center. These treatments are on the cutting-edge of pain management, and have all shown to be extremely successful in curing pain. All procedures are out-patient procedures; you'll be able to go home that day. Many of the treatments we perform show instant results, and are able to help our patients reclaim their lives."

column3:
Nerve and Pain Institute of Portland, Oregon serves the entire metro area with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain and neurological conditions. Established in 2020, this premier pain management facility has quickly become a trusted resource for those seeking relief from debilitating symptoms. The institute combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Under the direction of Dr. Ho, the Nerve and Pain Institute offers a unique advantage in pain management. Dr. Ho stands out as the only pain physician in the Portland area with specialized neurology training, allowing for a more comprehensive understanding of complex pain conditions. This distinctive expertise has earned Dr. Ho consistent recognition as a Top Doctor by peers in Portland Monthly magazine.

Advanced Treatment Options

The institute specializes in state-of-the-art interventional procedures utilizing both fluoroscopy and ultrasound guidance for precision and safety. These minimally invasive techniques effectively target specific pain sources for conditions including:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Sciatica and nerve compression

  • Chronic headaches and migraines

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Neuropathic conditions

Personalized Care Approach

What truly distinguishes the Nerve and Pain Institute is their commitment to individualized treatment plans. The team takes time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and specific needs before developing a comprehensive care strategy. This patient-centered philosophy ensures more effective outcomes and higher satisfaction rates.

Contact Information

The Nerve and Pain Institute welcomes new patients at their convenient Tigard location: 11930 SW Greenburg Rd, Tigard, OR 97223. To schedule a consultation, call +1 503-987-3707 or visit their website at nerveandpain.com for more information about their services and approach to pain management.
column11: Nerve and Pain Institute, established in 2020, is a trusted pain management facility dedicated to providing comprehensive care for neurological and painful conditions in the Portland metro area. Expertly led by Dr. Ho, known as the only pain physician with specialized neurology training in the area, the institute offers innovative fluoroscopy and ultrasound-guided pain procedures to address a range of conditions, including neck pain, back pain, sciatica, headaches, and post-surgical pain. Consistently recognized as a Top Doctor by peers in Portland Monthly, Dr. Ho and the team's compassionate approach ensure patients receive personalized and effective care.

I am now three days after radio frequency ablation. Pain is gone! Just a little site soreness, and a little stiffness.
I feel confident that with keeping up with PT, exercise, and the occasional treatment, that I can get back to being my real self.

Thank you!!!|The doctor and his assistants showed great care and concern for my problems. They started me on a path to relief right away. Very impressed.

column2: Columbia Pain Management P.C. - The Dalles, OR
column3:
Columbia Pain Management P.C. serves The Dalles, OR and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists provides personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life through effective pain relief strategies, we combine evidence-based medical treatments with integrative approaches to address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain.

At Columbia Pain Management, we offer a wide range of specialized treatments including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that each patient receives customized care tailored to their unique pain condition and personal health goals.

Conditions We Treat

Our experienced physicians treat numerous pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Fibromyalgia

Our Facility

Located at 3601 Klindt Dr #200, The Dalles, OR 97058, our modern clinic is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide accurate diagnoses and effective treatments. Our comfortable environment is designed to put patients at ease during their visits.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services:

  • Phone: +1 541-386-9500

  • Website: http://columbiapain.org/

  • Address: 3601 Klindt Dr #200, The Dalles, OR 97058, United States

Columbia Pain Management P.C. is committed to helping patients regain function and improve their quality of life through comprehensive pain management strategies. Our patient-centered approach focuses on creating individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while minimizing medication dependence.

column2: Center for Regenerative Orthopedic Medicine, PC
column3:
Center for Regenerative Orthopedic Medicine, PC in Medford, Oregon provides cutting-edge regenerative treatments for patients suffering from joint pain, sports injuries, and degenerative conditions. Serving the Rogue Valley and surrounding communities since 2020, our specialized clinic focuses on minimally invasive procedures that harness the body's natural healing capabilities to promote recovery without extensive surgery.

At the Center for Regenerative Orthopedic Medicine, we offer a range of innovative therapies including platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injections, stem cell therapy, and prolotherapy. Our approach aims to reduce pain, improve function, and accelerate healing for conditions affecting the knees, shoulders, hips, spine, and other joints. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and goals of our patients.

Expert Medical Team

Our board-certified physicians combine traditional orthopedic knowledge with advanced training in regenerative medicine techniques. This unique expertise allows us to provide alternatives to conventional treatments when appropriate, potentially helping patients avoid surgery while achieving significant pain relief and functional improvement.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 2850 State St, Medford, OR 97504, our modern clinic is equipped with the latest technology for diagnostic evaluation and regenerative procedures. The comfortable, patient-centered environment reflects our commitment to providing exceptional care and service.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in educating patients about their conditions and treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their care. Our team takes time to thoroughly evaluate each case, explain findings, and discuss potential benefits and limitations of regenerative approaches.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 541-842-7777 or visit our website at www.centerforregenerativeorthopedics.com. Our friendly staff is available to answer questions and help determine if regenerative orthopedic treatments might be right for you.

column2: Cornell Pain Clinic : Dr. Suresh Chand, M.D. Portland, Oregon
column3:
Cornell Pain Clinic in Portland, Oregon provides specialized interventional pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Suresh Chand, M.D. Our comprehensive approach to treating both acute and chronic pain conditions has established us as a trusted healthcare provider in the greater Portland metropolitan area. We combine evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce dependency on traditional pain medications.

At Cornell Pain Clinic, we focus on minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source. Our interventional techniques allow many patients to experience significant relief with reduced recovery time compared to traditional surgical approaches. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans based on thorough evaluations.

Advanced Treatment Options

We offer several cutting-edge therapies including:

  • Ketamine IV Infusion Therapy for treatment-resistant depression and chronic pain conditions

  • Regenerative Medicine including PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) and Stem Cell therapy for suitable candidates

  • Interventional Pain Procedures targeting specific pain generators with minimal downtime

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Chand and our clinical team prioritize patient education and collaborative decision-making. We believe informed patients make better choices about their healthcare journey, leading to improved outcomes and satisfaction with treatment results.

Visit Our Clinic

Cornell Pain Clinic is conveniently located at 15455 NW Greenbrier Parkway, Suite 130, Beaverton, OR 97006. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care in a comfortable environment.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (503) 376-9200 or visit our website at www.cornellpainclinic.com.

column40:
Have been going here the last two years for my chronic neck pain. Dr Suresh is thorough and helpful. I've had two neck ablations and two steroid injections with good results.|I will start by saying I have never left a review on any platform as I don't think that it is the most constructive way to give feedback, however,  in this situation and circumstance I feel that it is important to do so.
I was a patient over the last year, being referred to this clinic by a specialist. After over 5 visits to this clinic, the first one being extremely traumatizing after receiving an injection into my SI joint with no prepatory support beforehand or even discussing the options of support for the procedure. All and all I could spell out all the details of the experiences here and about how with each appointment I was disregarded and gaslit, but this is not the platform for all the details.  I maintained my care and treatment at Cornell pain clinic trying to be patient with the process, unfortunately leaving every appointment distressed and in more pain and feeling hopeless. I wish I would have trusted my gut after my first appointment.
I was finally referred to an excellent pain specialist (Dr Joseph Staplton) I have been properly diagnosed with SI joint dysfunction. I am now on the path to recovery.  I regret all the time (time being the most critical) and money that I invested with a team that does not listen or have respect for their clients and clearly do not care about you. I would not recommend receiving care here.|My experience with Dr. Chand and his staff was nothing but positive. I was having a difficult time even getting in at another office. Scheduling appointments and follow up appointments were always 6-10 weeks out and getting insurance approval was over 4 weeks. Follow up visits were with a PA.

Dr Chand's office got me an immediate appointment and after my appointment they got insurance approval for my needed procedure within 24 hours. No waiting 8 weeks for every next needed appointment. Scheduling was never more than 2 weeks out. Follow up appointments are with Dr. Chand himself and not a PA. With regard to the actual procedures, I felt like I was in very competent hands. The Cornell Pain Clinic staff were always very polite and friendly.  Dr Chand was successful in relieving my back pain and I'm very grateful to him and his staff. I'm back to enjoying life.

Randall Miller|I had severe lower back pain over 3 years ago and was referred to Dr. Chand by Oregon Clinic Neurology. I had steroid injections on both sides of a disc. Friends told me that sometimes you have to have it done every six months.
I have been pain-free ever since without needing to return.
I am about to see Dr. Chand again for shots between two neck vertebrae (pinched nerve). I was referred elsewhere but asked if it could be switched to here.
I never read Cornell Pain Clinic reviews until today. I am impressed by the doctor's response to all of the lower reviews. With understanding, compassion, and care. With genuine concern, unlike most businesses or services that are given a low rating. This is a good place to seek help.

Update:
Injections into neck vertebrae worked wonderfully.
Finally pain-free and able to resume normal functions.
Thank you, Dr. Chand!!|I was using a cane since November 2023. Since I've seen Dr. Chand and had injections. My hip no longer hurts. I don't use a cane anymore. I think he's wonderful. He cares and he listens|Timely and they hit the nerve bundle on the first attempt.  While I know the steroid shot only lasts so long I am so improved (beyond my expectations) that I almost can't wait till the next shot.

Staff is excellent and friendly and Doctor has a great touch.|I have been experiencing Sciatic pain. I received a referral for a from my doctor (March, 2023)  to Dr. Chand for an L5-S1 injection. I highly recommend him!
The office was very responsive, the procedure was efficient, painless, and the Dr verbally walked me through what would happen next during the procedure. It was very successful. The pain returned in December. I contacted Dr Chand's office. They scheduled me right away and I received a second injection,  again, very successful. The follow up visit was thorough and very helpful regarding future steps if needed.|Suresh, the main doctor was belittling, derogatory, unprofessional, and very unfriendly. He did not use a single medical document, he did not perform a single standardized medical test. He simply scribbled notes on a paper and called it good! This is after a 40 min wait, no one there but me. Only for the apt to be 10 mins and he escorted me out as fast as possible after the paycheck! Stay away. Himalayan doctor certs? Get the f out of here

column3:
Oregon Interventional Pain Clinic serves Portland, Oregon and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Located in the heart of Northwest Portland, our clinic offers comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain their quality of life and return to their daily activities with minimal discomfort.

At Oregon Interventional Pain Clinic, we focus on targeted treatments that address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our interventional approach includes procedures such as epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive techniques. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and specific pain condition.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that considers all aspects of a patient's health. Our physicians work closely with physical therapists, psychologists, and other specialists to develop comprehensive treatment strategies. We emphasize patient education and active participation in the recovery process, empowering individuals to take control of their pain management journey.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our clinic at 1849 NW Kearney St, 2nd Floor, features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, welcoming environment. The convenient Northwest Portland location offers accessibility to patients throughout the metropolitan area and beyond. Our facility is designed with patient comfort and privacy in mind, creating a healing atmosphere for all who visit.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 503-477-5205. You can also visit our website at http://oripc.com/ for detailed information about our treatments, physician credentials, and patient resources. Our dedicated staff is available to answer questions and guide you through the process of becoming a patient at Oregon Interventional Pain Clinic.

column40:
Dr Rosenbloom was awesome while I had him. Now I have Shea De Klotz. She cares, is smart and understanding. She sees the whole picture. Its not just about getting pain medication, its treating the body, at diff angles that add to pain, from stress, sleep, etc. Everyone there is nice and respectful.|I have been with Dr Rosenblum for 4 or 5 years. He takes the time necessary and very easy to talk to. I love this doctor for pain management. He cleared up daily disabling migraines with surgery and botox that allowed me to lower my meds significantly. Changed my life  Laura|Dr. Stuart Rosenblum has been treating me for approximately 12 years. I have a lot of issues in my back, spine, Fibromyalgia etc. He has taken the time to find out what was really going on with me. Due to him finding out what was really going on with me, he was able to pinpoint my pain and properly diagnose me.  That allowed me to be able to continue working at a job I truly loved. I contracted Legionnaire's disease a few years later & now I can no longer do my job. I am also treated by his physician's assistant, who is one sharp cookie. I feel so blessed.|After a decade under his care, I'd highly recommend Dr Rosenblum to anyone with a documented need of long term pain management.  His expertise and professionalism is unwavering, and has greatly improved my health and abilities despite living in constant pain.|I would give zero stars if I could. I missed my initial appointment because my father passed away, and the last thing on my mind was an appointment at the clinic. I forgot to call and cancel because I was busy trying to take care of my mother. I finally called to reschedule and they said due to their "no call/no show" policy, I would not be allowed to reschedule with them... EVER. I asked if she meant that literally forever, I would not be able to make an appointment even though they had ALL of my medical records as well as the referral from my PCP, and I was told "unfortunately yes, due to their policy, I could no longer schedule an appointment". I  asked about exceptions due to accidents or deaths in the family and was told that it didn't matter. A no call was a no call, period. Clearly they don't care about the well-being of their community. Absolute garbage.|I have been a patient of doctor rosen blooms well over 15 years at 1st they over prescribe me now because of the government they say they have to take it down about 95% which I agreed to he also told me to get out of my  relationship that that was caused me my home and my child.  Dr.Rosenblum told me if I didn't move out in the next 3 months he would Cut me off of all my pain pills .
I said I cant do that due to zero money . I said I was going to leave after my daughter graduated only 6months from then.  Dr.rosenblum said, I don't care what you have to do but get out within 3 months or I will cut you off all of your pain pills.  I was so stressed so scared of being in pain I did what was asked of me.  When I left I didn't know what or how I would find a place where my daughter and I could go. I lost my beautiful home and my daughter wanted to finish high school with all of her friends.  Had I known the out come doing this, I would have slit my wrist 1st be  fore leaving my living situation.  I would have gone through the withdrawals. Because I did what he asked  , I went from living in a beautiful home living with my daughter and all my animals to living in a 5th wheel.  After all my bills are paid each month I get $100. A week for gas and food and what ever.
There were times I waited hours for Dr.Rosenblum .
I've never missed an appointment , there has been times when he asked me to move my appointments for him , I did .
Along with the government is stepping in and making sure all pain patients need to be at a 80% or 95% lower level.  I have been making steps towards these requirements.
Some time after Dr.rosenblum forced me to change my living situation he put me under the care of his PA-C  Shea DeKlotz .
They continue to charge me with his same  billing rates quite a bit more than if I had gone to a nother office I would have been billed a lot less than the rates of  Anastiya Z ologist well well into his years of being a doctor she is clearly just been that a school. Now I am being charged his rates for a student , Basically doing what he told her. She didn't even have to think she just prescribe pills.
. To day I was late , very late 20 minutes past my wiggle room.  30 minutes past my regular time. I had called ahead 40 minutes  before and explained that I was indeed going to be late. I said is there any chance of Shea giving me a script  that would hold me over the weekend? At 1st they thought that was a ok thing.  After drove another 35 minutes in traffic they said Nope that shea couldn't do this for me . I couldn't believe it . She was still in the office and her Last patient left when I was still in the office.  They felt it was easier for them to  Prescribe me drugs that would help me through withdrawals I explained to them I didn't wanna do that in a scared me to death in could they please just give me enough to hold me over they wouldn't there was no sympathy. I went out in the hallway to regain my  Composer and they locked up shop well before 5 o'clock and I saw Shae and she didn't even look at me Or apologize I thought it was cruel ,I thought it was rude , I felt like she was pulling a power Trip . I would not wish withdraws on anybody.  The gal at the desk said,  it was easy for her to go through withdrawals that she her self had gone through it several times. She said it was no big deal.  Ok so no big deal going through with drawls and now along with these with drawls now I wasn't going to get any pain relief along side of that .
I think  what Shea asked me to go through was CRUEL BORTING ON
BARBARIC PUNISHMENT.
I think I was being picked on and Bullied.  I wish I could find a way to get out of this.  Today is Thursday, I think they could have done more for me .|I feel like I have received quality care from responsible professionals who genuinely care for my overall health and well being.  The truth is they are not there to fix you... they are there to help you manage your pain to a more tolerable level so you can have a better quality of life.  I would recommend trying whatever treatments are available to fix your underlying health issues, if possible.  If that did not work, I know It can be hard to accept that one's pain may not go away.  Some people do have more successs with varying treatments than others.  The lucky people don't need to visit a pain management specialist.  For the rest of us, we need to make the best of a bad situation.  Going into the clinic (or evaluating the practice),  I think one needs to understand they have a tough job.  With so many potential drug seekers, politics, regulations, and personal Ethics, one must understand there is a required protocol to ensure the proper care is given to their target audience.  I know how hard it can be to be patient when in extreme pain; however, stick with the process, communicate honestly and openly, and be open to their recommendations, and they will undoubtedly do their best to give you the best quality of life.  How that happens may or may not be different than what you had in mind.  Remember: They are the experts in the field and have good intentions -- trust them. Focus on being a good patient and take a level of ownership in your care and you will be in a best-case scenario.  People, situations, and companies are not perfect -- but, life can still be enjoyable and there are people who want to help you.  You just have to put yourself in position to let them.  Good luck!|These folks are beyond patient and deserving of recognition and respect especially as they're managing a very difficult form of care in a presently hostile environment. Last week I added to their stress and am absolutely embarrassed to admit this. We were at one of my specialists up toward Seattle and waiting for test results so treatment could be discussed and no one could figure out where the results were- i had one group of medical people barking at me (up north) and I was calling everyone in an attempt to find the results, no one was sure what was going on...and because the scan was originally requested from OIPC i melted down all over them, behaving like a 2 year old...as it turned out the error was at our internal medicine practice, near where we live, and they sent one set of info to the wrong place and also lost my bloodwork. Add to this a sick dog at home (ruined 3 rugs and neither of us slept last week, he had to he taken out nearly every hour) and we're in the middle of my husband's ongoing health crisis, I snapped and lost it, behaving like an A-hole. And yet they remained patient.
Treat others the way you wish to be treated...important to remember. Especially for me.

column3:
Pain Care of Oregon serves Salem, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Andrew Oh. Established as a premier pain management clinic, our practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why our approach focuses on individualized treatment plans designed to address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Dr. Andrew Oh, MD leads our clinical team with exceptional credentials and experience. Double board-certified in both Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology, Dr. Oh brings specialized expertise to complex pain conditions. He completed his prestigious fellowship at Oregon Health & Science University, where he mastered advanced interventional pain management techniques. Beyond his clinical practice, Dr. Oh maintains a passionate commitment to medical education and regularly participates in overseas mission health services, bringing quality healthcare to underserved communities worldwide.

Our Comprehensive Services

At Pain Care of Oregon, we offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments for acute and chronic pain conditions. Our services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative approaches to pain relief. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain among other conditions.

Contact Information

We welcome new patients at our conveniently located office in Salem:

2480 Liberty St NE, Suite 180

Salem, OR 97301

United States

To schedule a consultation, please call us at (503) 371-1010 or visit our website at www.paincareoregon.com for more information about our services and to access patient resources.

column2: Active Pain Relief & Medical Weight Loss
column3:
Active Pain Relief & Medical Weight Loss serves Tigard, Oregon with comprehensive pain management and medical weight loss solutions. Our specialized clinic combines cutting-edge treatments with personalized care to address both chronic pain conditions and weight management challenges. Using the latest ultrasound-guided technology, our experienced medical team delivers precise injections for joint pain, arthritis, neck pain, and damaged ligaments, ensuring optimal treatment outcomes with minimal discomfort.

At Active Pain Relief, we offer a range of non-surgical and minimally invasive treatments designed to provide lasting relief. Our services include hyaluronic acid injections that lubricate joints and reduce inflammation, PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy that harnesses your body's natural healing abilities, and alternative treatments for osteoarthritis that focus on reducing pain while improving mobility. Each treatment plan is customized to address your specific condition and pain level, with a focus on non-invasive approaches whenever possible.

Medical Weight Loss Programs

Our medical weight loss programs are physician-supervised and scientifically backed for sustainable results. We proudly offer GLP-1 treatments including semaglutide, which helps regulate appetite and blood sugar levels to support effective weight management. Unlike generic weight loss centers, our approach integrates medical expertise with ongoing support to address the complex factors that contribute to weight challenges.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that pain and weight issues can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we offer free consultations to discuss your concerns and develop personalized treatment strategies. Our clinic is conveniently open on Saturdays to accommodate busy schedules, ensuring that quality care is accessible when you need it most.

Visit our clinic at 9975 SW Frewing St #110, Tigard, OR 97223, call us at +1 503-336-3322, or explore our services online at www.aprelief.com. At Active Pain Relief & Medical Weight Loss, we're committed to helping you achieve a pain-free, healthy lifestyle through advanced medical solutions and compassionate care.

I would highly recommend Dr. Jones and Active Pain Relief!

column3:
Spinal Diagnostics in Tualatin, Oregon provides comprehensive interventional pain management services for patients throughout the Portland metropolitan area. Led by Jason Anderson, DO, our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating complex spinal conditions using minimally invasive techniques. We combine advanced diagnostic procedures with targeted therapeutic interventions to address chronic back and neck pain, helping patients avoid unnecessary surgery while improving their quality of life.

At Spinal Diagnostics, we utilize state-of-the-art technology to precisely identify pain generators in the spine. Our approach centers on evidence-based treatments including epidural steroid injections, facet joint procedures, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Dr. Anderson and our team of specialists work collaboratively with referring physicians to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Our Comprehensive Services

We specialize in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, facet joint syndrome, sacroiliac joint dysfunction, and failed back surgery syndrome. Our facility is equipped with advanced fluoroscopic imaging systems that allow for precise needle placement during interventional procedures. Patients appreciate our thorough consultations and our commitment to exploring non-surgical options before considering more invasive approaches.

Visit Our Practice

Spinal Diagnostics is conveniently located at 6464 SW Borland Rd, Suite A-2, Tualatin, OR 97062. Our modern facility offers a comfortable environment designed with patient care in mind. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Anderson, please call +1 503-885-1515 or visit our website at https://www.spinaldx.com/ for more information about our services and to access patient resources.

Rogue Valley Physical & Regenerative Medicine serves patients throughout Medford, Oregon and the surrounding Rogue Valley region with comprehensive pain management and regenerative medicine solutions. Led by Dr. Wruck, a dedicated healthcare professional with over 25 years of experience, the practice offers specialized care focused on improving patients' quality of life through innovative treatment approaches. Since establishing roots in the Rogue Valley in 2018, Dr. Wruck has developed a deep connection with the community, bringing his expertise from his early career beginnings in Maui, Hawaii in 1996.

As a highly qualified Nurse Practitioner, Dr. Wruck provides expert care in several key areas:

Community Commitment

Dr. Wruck and his family have embraced the Rogue Valley as their home, serving patients from Medford, Grants Pass, Ashland, and Jacksonville areas. Patient-Centered Care

At Rogue Valley Physical & Regenerative Medicine, patients benefit from evidence-based treatments delivered with compassion and attention to detail. The practice's modern facility at 845 Alder Creek Dr, Medford, OR 97504 is equipped with advanced technology to support optimal patient outcomes.

column2: Legacy Pain Management Center - a department of Legacy Good Samaritan Medical Center
column3:
Legacy Pain Management Center in Portland, Oregon serves the greater Portland metropolitan area with comprehensive pain management services as a specialized department of Legacy Good Samaritan Medical Center. Our multidisciplinary team of board-certified physicians, pain specialists, and healthcare professionals is dedicated to helping patients manage chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. With decades of combined experience, we utilize evidence-based approaches to improve quality of life and restore function for those suffering from persistent pain.

At Legacy Pain Management Center, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy referrals, and complementary therapies. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of our patients, focusing on both immediate relief and long-term pain management strategies.

Our Facility and Accessibility

Conveniently located in Good Samaritan Building 3 at 1130 NW 22nd Ave, Suite 345, Portland, OR 97210, our center provides a comfortable, supportive environment for patients seeking pain relief. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment, enabling our team to deliver the highest standard of care. We're easily accessible from major Portland thoroughfares and offer convenient parking options for our patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in a collaborative approach to pain management, working closely with patients to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Our team takes the time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that individuals feel empowered and supported throughout their pain management journey.

Contact Information and Appointments

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (503) 413-7513. Our friendly staff is available to answer questions about referrals, insurance coverage, and appointment availability. For additional information about our services and providers, visit our website at www.legacyhealth.org/doctors-and-locations/specialty/pain-management-center-good-sam.
column20: Good Samaritan Bldg 3, 1130 NW 22nd Ave Ste 345

column38: Nancy Despain|Sam Pham|Wendy Fisher|marne La Rue|Mickey Nuttall|Josh and Sneak Josh and Sneak|Melody Murphy|Cynthia Bennett
column40:
This if for my Med Assistant Jaime at  Good Sam & Salmon Creek Pain Clinics - Thank You!
The last 2 weeks she really went to bat for me with my insurance company. I know she went way above and way beyond what is required of her as a MA. I can not say enough good things about this angel. When you take medicine that you need to function like a normal human, and insurance is charging you almost $1000 for a month supply, your world is a little rocked, when you can no way pay that much monthly. I hope she gets an award, or a raise or both. Thank you Jaime!|After reading some of the reviews on other sites I'll admit I was a bit skeptical to come here. After my first visit I can't say that I mirror all the negative reviews as my experience went smoothly and without complication. I was referred by my PCP (yes, they require a referral) without any questions and was able to schedule my initial appointment within 4 weeks.

First off, it should be known that Oregon insurance policies suck, especially their Medicaid plans. I came back to Portland in early 2018 after living in California for several years. Medicaid (Medi-Cal) in California is amazing by comparison. OHP CareOregon is extremely limiting and often with long wait times for referral approvals, the other Medicaid programs like Providence and Kaiser are even worse. There is also some misinformation floating around about OHP, that they don't cover pain medications, when they actually do, just not all types, it depends on your diagnosis and where it falls into their priority list, so it must meet particular criteria to be covered, you can actually discuss this with CareOregon's pharmacy department. This Legacy center is the only pain clinic I know of that actually writes prescriptions (aside from your PCP), OHSU and Providence clinics do not unless you have a terminal illness. Way different than California.

The office is clean and the waiting area was dimly lit with only a couple of other people waiting. I was seen about 10 minutes after my scheduled appointment time, and was then seen about another 10 minutes after being checked in by the nurse. My condition is well documented over 3+ years, legitimate and currently requires ongoing pain medications. Dr. Schrattenholzer spent over an hour with me and was kind and polite the whole time. He was genuinely interested and perplexed by my condition and wanted to offer me the best options. At no time did he seem condescending, rude or treat me like I was an addict. We discussed alternate forms and possibilities of treatment and various medications and decided to go with a couple of prescription medications that would best suit me for the time being with the option to try other medications for long-term use. They wrote the prescriptions, did the pre-authorizations for insurance and sent me on my way. Scheduled a follow up for a couple months out. They also have an onsite Physical Therapist consultant and Pain Psychologist, who you don't actually need to participate with if you don't want to, just an option.

Highlights:
- Free parking, you'll need a validation slip. Building #3 is easiest. The main entrance is on NW Marshall. Oddly, the disabled parking spots are all on the roof level, which means if it's raining you're going to get soaked. There's another entrance on NW Northrup, I believe there are disabled spots on the lower level that are covered. The parking garages can get jammed during peak hours.
- Entrance to the building offices are on the upper and lower floors, the other elevators in the garage take you to those levels.
- Bathrooms near entry ways.
- Pain clinic is just a couple doors down on the left if entering from the roof of building 3, level D. If you park in building 2 it's the first door on the right after crossing the sky bridge.
- There's filtered water in the waiting area.
- There's also a bathroom in the offices just past the reception desk.
- The doctors schedule can be quite full, so scheduling can be a little hit or miss. There are other doctors there as well.|I have nothing but a great experience at the pain clinic. I have suffered from chronic pain my whole life. I have had a few accidents that have caused C7 vertebrae some problems and it affects my right arm. I also have Fibromyalgia, arthritis, and a bad back. I am 52 and have tried many things to help with all my pains. Going to PT's that don't understand chronic pain or doctors that think you are faking it to get the meds. I can't take half the meds out there because I am allergic to all of them. Here they listen and start out slow to help build up and find a pace to go so you don't flair up and feel defeated. So many place do that not understanding. Here I feel understood. They use everyday language and not doctor talk so you understand what they are saying. I also like that since I have learning challenges. I leave an appointment feeling confident and understood. It is not often as a chronic pain sufferer that you get that with doctors or PT.|My son was in a car wreck 6 months ago. After he came out of his first opointment I had never seen him like that, DR Price refused to look at his neck dispite him asking her several times. All she did was show him xrays and told him she is not interested in prescribing his pain meds. He is on a low dose but it was enough to get him out of bed. He told me he is done trying to get better and the clinic made him feel like he was a druggy. After looking at all these bad reviews and talking to my son I dont recomend this clinic to anyone.|BAD MISTREATMENT OF PATIENTS!!!

ENOUGH IS ENOUGH.

Was Sent there to get help to " Manage my Pain",,,
They/She/it. "Managed" to stress me out enough to put me in MORE PAIN!!!

THERE IS SOME SICK, TWISTED, UNEDUCATED DIMRODS HERE THAT THEY  TRY TO PUT A DR TAG ON!!!
START WITH PRICE,,,,
WHAT IN THE WORLD IS WRONG WITH HER?
SHE DOESNT KNOW A REAL PATIENT FROM A FRAUD,,,  UP AND WALKED OUT AFTER PRETTY MUCH CALLING US LIARS,,,
I NEVER FELT THAT WAY FROM A DOCTOR VISIT..,
Was a strange Visit, She basically kicked us out, showed us the Exit. Because I Laughed at her Stupidity... she spent 30min talking about a blow dryer??? Tried to Tell me that acupuncture would fix me?
SHE IS DANGEROUS,,,
I Have Photopenina from Radiation Damage, Among  other things, that burning incense and candles won't quite cut.
Just out in Left Field!!!
I Won't Be Back to this place.
She is a Loon & Should not be Allowed to Practice in ANY MEDICAL FIELD,,,,,

Legacy,
You are Better Then This!
Coming From,
A 61 year old patient with radiation damage after a Brain Tumor, Craniotomy for Correction, following Radiation damage
21 years Ago,,,,, that Legacy is Responsible for.

Go to an office in Hopes of some relief,
To then be Treated like a Criminal or Crazy Person!!!!

Look at all the Bad Reviews,,,,,
Why should patients go through this?

Never in my Life,,, What got me is the way I feel after fighting this for So Long,,,,

ENOUGH IS ENOUGH, THESE PEOPLE HAVE NO IDEA AS TO WHAT WE ARE GOING THROUGH.

Wish they could Feel My Pain, They would never doubt anyone Again.

SOMETHING HAS TO BE SAID AND DONE.

The Patient should be First!!!

Thanx,|Well, I would say that, barring any other reason, I have not received timely calls or emails back at all from Simon Klein, the Social Worker in the clinic. He is nice, but appears to be overwhelmed and it makes me nervous handing my life over to medical professionals who do not embrace the gravity of your situation being life vs. death. Also, being a terminal cancer patient, I'm not sure I should be doing this at all. I was heavily coerced to try this clinic again after a completely monstrous disaster about 10 years ago. That doctor is now the clinic director who supposedly my new doctor here, Dr. Price, is not controlled by in any way. I have come to realize through in person visits lately that my PCP may just be wanted to end his responsibility to my treatment, and with my pain medications, with everything. He writes things that are flowery, because they are in print. In person, he can be very cruel. It puts someone like me in a very hard position. Will I actually be one of the people out there with fibromyalgia, Stage IV Cancer that is terminal (slowly-but still terminal) and very aggressive pain neuropathy throughout my body (especial arms and hands). Will I be someone who is on disability and receives Medicare benefits, and has never, ever not followed my doctors instructions to the letter and point (with urinalysis reports to prove this, if need be) and still end up looking for relief for my pain. The only reason I came here was when my PCP was still being nice to me and begging me to try it. I trusted him, and that is exactly when he became very cold, and truly cruel at in person appointments. He is not able to be judged by what he does in private. His actions are not available to anyone but me. Dr. Price at this clinic seems very nice, but also quite clinical with point by point charts that are complex and I don't get any personal answers about how this change to the new wonder drug Suboxone will work for me, and if it doesn't work is a question that is simply not answered by anyone. When I asked my PCP, who referred me to this clinic if he would treat me, let me receive my original working treatment, if this program didn't work or the new drug didn't work, and he said:
"Absolutely NOT." I am being turned away in my time of need and asked to begin a program which I have bad communication from it's staff Social Worker who seem to only get connected with if he accidentally answers his phone without looking. (This is after 3 or more voice mails and hand written messages being passed to him through the front desk.) Also, email seems to be the achilles heel for all doctors at Legacy. They encourage the use of it and then are upset when you do use it. It's a strange position to be in and I wanted to make it public because with all of my insurance and being an educated individual who enjoyed a very full life until I had a cycling accident that nearly killed me, left me with a LOT of lifetime pain to deal with and then a terminal Cancer diagnosis and that came with a surgery and chemotherapy, which has forever long reaching side effects that are completely pain inducing. I honestly do not know how much time I have left, and neither does anyone else. Because I have insurance and good attitude people think you are fine and do not need medical care. But, the only reason I have been doing so well is BECAUSE of the good medical care I've received up to this point. Now, I honestly do not know what to do. I am completely uncomfortable being treated by my PCP of 15 years, also a Legacy doctor (I started with him before he was with Legacy...) and while I am okay moving forward with this pain clinic and new drug, I wish the Social Worker and doctor were more communicative. Or communicative at all, sometimes. I truly believe the downturn in my relationship with my PCP came with Legacy wanting to not provide pain medication at all, like so many doctors are doing now. I am hoping that I can find a new PCP within a system that this Pain Clinic will work with as I am very uncomfortable having any more sessions with my current PCP.|Weeks trying to get appointment scheduled. Finally did after they canceled and changed many appointments. Dr told me I needed a lumbar flexion and extension X-ray. She said I could go to any Legacy center. Went to Mt hood legacy today . She didn't submit the order. So tried calling the office. Got voicemail. Employee there tried several times to get ahold of them. Talked to a person once but kept getting back to voicemail. 2 hours of a waste of time! People at Legacy Mt Hood were great but they're hands were tied. Don't recommend this place at all!!!|DR. Schrattenholzer was the answer to my prayers, I in a wheelchair, suffering horribly, could barely breathe without back pain, let alone move. But Dr. Scrattenholzer was able to pretty much relieve all my pain, either through injections/radial ablation/ and medication, I have not needed any help walking, I'm extremely grateful for Dr. Scrattenholzer, he Saw me at my worst and was still kind and caring not to mention he was still willing to help me, and I thank God every day for him and his help ! He did something for me I can never repay , except to say Thank you from the bottom of my heart , and to write this review and tell everyone how much he helped me and he's one of the best doctors I have ever seen. And to tell people to give legacy good Sam a try, you won't be disappointed.

column3:
Pain Management Consultants of Portland, Oregon provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the greater Portland metropolitan area. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. Located conveniently in the Barnes Road medical corridor, we've been helping patients reclaim their lives from debilitating pain for over two decades.

At Pain Management Consultants, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and psychological support to address pain at its source. We treat conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia and myofascial pain

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that respect each patient's unique circumstances. Our physicians take time to listen, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop strategies that align with your goals for pain relief and improved function. We coordinate with your primary care provider to ensure continuity of care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at:

Phone: +1 503-292-7005

Website: www.painbusters.net

Address: 9155 SW Barnes Rd, Suite 934, Portland, OR 97225

Our office is conveniently located near Providence St. Vincent Medical Center with ample parking available. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans.
