column40:
Dr Kahr and Ronnie are so helpful, understanding and efficient. I've had lower back pain 30 years. After learning I have actual structural, genetic issues I found there are pain treatments without pills.It took a while for Ins to approve the procedure and boy am I glad I stuck it out, THANK YOU RONNIE for talking me thru the policies and keeping my mind off of the actual procedures,  you my friend are something really special!!! I had some fainting issues and Dr Kahr talked me thru them so I didn't feel like a dingaling, bedside manor is absolutely wonderful!|I have been going here for 10 years. They are one of the few doctors that will manage narcotic pain medications. They also do all kinds of injections and other therapies. Very friendly staff and procedures done on site.|Dr Kaur and her staff are not just professionals but concerned about their patients and their well being
Dr Kaur & Ronnie take the time to understand each person's concerns, area of specific pain and the causes of that pain
The knowledge they provide, as well as, their experience and resolution to my pain are the reasons I recommend their services|This place used to be good, I went here several decades ago, they were willing to prescribe controlled morphine or methadone for my chronic pain at the time.  I recently tried to be seen again, and they said they would only be willing to do a one time consultation.  Likely because of medicaid.|I have been a patient of Dr. Kaur since 2007.  I was treated for a congenital bone defect that surgery couldn't fix.  I have other comorbidities that further complicated my case.
From the beginning, Dr. Kaur was compassionate w/out being patronizing.  She managed my pain meds for about 2 years before my insurance changed.  Then I went back to her in 2015, once our insurance changed back.
I am happy to say that through her care, I was able to keep up with my toddlers until I could successfully get a total hip replacement.  As of 4/2023, I am off of the pain meds, and so happy Dr. Kaur was there to assist me.  Highly recommend!!|My initial experience was a positive one. The physician assistant Nadine was the most helpful person in my pain condition.  However I had some insurance limitations so procedures were sort of off the table. I went through a couple of medication switches  and after about the third one I was suddenly told very abruptly that I can no longer be treated by them. They refused to taper me off of opioid pain medication that I've been on for over three years. This sort of mistreatment should be considered malpractice. Horrible horrible clinic.|I have been seeing Dr. Jayaram for a few years now and he has been great.  He is no nonsense and has fought hard with my insurance company to get alternative procedures approved for me. The most recent they had been trying to deny for 16 months and he kept on them until they finally approved it.  I would definitely recommend seeing him, he is the first doc I've had in awhile that actually listens to me instead of making assumptions like most doctors|I was with Pain Management for 2+ years (specifically with Dr. Jayaram) and seemed to like the office staff.  Although, I seemed to get a new staff member at every appointment.  There seemed  to be a huge turnover which tells me that the doctors don't now how to run a practice.  Which brings me to this subject, I had done everything that the doctors asked, always made my appointments, passed UA's, paid my bills and did what was asked of me per the contract that I had signed.  I met Becky on my first ablation procedure and fell in love.  She was so helpful and professional.  With that being said, after a year of going to the office I asked her out.  We kept it very professional for a year.  When she gave the doctors 6 weeks notice to leave the practice as we were moving  I received a letter stating Dr. Jayaram could no longer be my doctor.  I was shocked that I had done nothing wrong, hadn't violated my contract, and even had a surgery for a Spinal cord stimulator scheduled.  The appointments were canceled and when I called to find out what was going on NO ONE could call me back. I did't realize I was dealing with a child.  He realized I wasn't going to play ball so he took his ball home.   It was very unprofessional!  When you are dealing with a patients well being it is professional not personal.  He took an oath to help people  and provide medical service but yet his personal vendetta influenced his professionalism.  Given the revolving door of employees and how he treated me as a patient speaks volumes on his character and how he treats his employees.  Becky had been a dedicated employee for over 17 years and he couldn't even wish her well and thank her for all of her years of service.  Think twice before making an appointment to be treated by this physician or his office.  Apparently, I have to give one star just to post this review.  I would give zero stars for the way I was treated.

column3:
Pain GPS Clinic serves Eugene, Oregon with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our mission is to empower you to turn down the volume of pain and suffering, while maximizing function, independence and quality of life. Located in the heart of Eugene at 1605 Oak St, our clinic has established itself as a trusted partner for those seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions.

At Pain GPS Clinic, we study each patient to understand the nature of their pain in order to provide safe, efficient and effective long-term pain management. Recognizing that pain is an individual experience, we create an open-minded and supportive environment where patients feel heard and understood. Our team of specialists works collaboratively to develop customized treatment plans that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

We offer a wide range of evidence-based interventions including:

  • Medication Management - Including Buprenorphine products

  • Injection Therapies - Trigger point injections, steroid injections, nerve blocks, and intramuscular injections

  • Specialized Treatments - B-12 shots and Lidocaine infusions

Coordinated Alternative Therapies

Understanding that effective pain management often requires a multidisciplinary approach, we coordinate care with various alternative therapy providers including:

  • Behavioral health specialists

  • Physical therapists

  • Massage therapists

  • Chiropractors

  • Neurofeedback practitioners

Accessible Care for All

Pain GPS Clinic is committed to making quality pain management accessible. We accept most commercial insurance plans and Medicare, with self-pay options also available for those without insurance coverage. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, contact us at (541) 246-3400.

Coordinated care for Alternative Therapy: behavioral health, physical therapy, massage, chiropractor, and neurofeedback.
Accepts most commercial insurance and Medicare. Self pay options also available.

column3:
Gregory M. Phillips, MD in Eugene, Oregon provides comprehensive orthopedic and sports medicine care to patients throughout the Willamette Valley region. As a board-certified physician specializing in physical medicine and rehabilitation, Dr. Phillips offers evidence-based treatments for a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions, helping patients recover from injuries and manage chronic pain to restore mobility and improve quality of life.

At his practice located at 217 Division Ave in Eugene, Dr. Phillips combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to address conditions including sports injuries, spine disorders, joint pain, and nerve compression syndromes. His approach emphasizes minimally invasive interventions and rehabilitation strategies designed to maximize function while minimizing downtime.

Services and Treatment Options

Patients benefit from a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Non-surgical spine care and interventions

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Regenerative medicine treatments

  • Electrodiagnostic testing (EMG/NCS)

  • Ultrasound-guided injections

  • Customized physical therapy protocols

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Phillips is known for his thorough evaluations and commitment to patient education. He takes time to explain conditions and treatment options, ensuring patients are active participants in their recovery journey. The practice offers convenient scheduling and prompt appointments for both new and established patients.

For consultations or to schedule an appointment, contact Dr. Phillips' office at (541) 780-6654 or visit www.pacificsportsandspine.com. The clinic welcomes patients from Eugene and surrounding communities throughout Oregon.

column38: Howard B|Chintana Antone Owens|Lynnette Kaschke|Mindy Hallmark|Christy Norman|richard palmer|B Eric Ivers|JG Patrick
column40:
Five stars for my first consultation with Dr. Phillips for a degenerative spine condition I have had for several years.

Also five stars for the first treatment -- a temporary nerve block -- of that condition.

For many months prior to the nerve block, I experienced extreme discomfort when standing or walking for more than a few minutes.  My treatment was at 9:00 AM on a Wednesday.  That same day I was able to complete three sets of standing exercises -- a ten minute walk on a treadmill and performing two Tai Chi programs, totaling about 30 minutes -- all without any significant discomfort.

I had been informed that this first treatment was diagnostic, and the benefit would be temporary.  The pain relief lasted throughout Wednesday afternoon and evening.  Thursday morning the pain returned.

The treatment plan calls for one more temporary block, an evaluation of results, and a decision whether to proceed with a longer lasting block.

Throughout my initial consultations and treatment, Dr. Phillips and his staff have been thorough, professional, and personable.  The facilities are modern, spacious, and immaculately clean.

So far, so good.

Dr. Howard Bandy|Dr. Phillips was very kind, professional, attentive, & thorough. He is patient & took time to listen so it made me feel like I was able to cover all of my concerns during my appt. He has great personality so it was easy to speak comfortably to him & his knowledge in this practice made me feel at ease during my visit because he knew exactly what I was trying to explain when speaking of my issues/pain & addressed them.
I would highly recommend him for anyone who needs to see this type of specialist.|Dr. Phillips was kind, attentive, thorough and respectful!
He offered options other than major surgery. He went above and beyond my expectations for an initial visit. I am scheduled to come back for a follow up to determine the next steps of my treatment.
I would definitely recommend him!|Doctor Phillips and his awesome Physician's Assistant, took the time to listen and patiently answer my questions while viewing my MRI and x-rays. I really felt heard and even detected genuine empathy - a difficult quality to find these days. I left believing that they will do there best to provide me with quality care moving forward. It was a very good first impression!|Dr. Phillips is kind, patient, respectful, and listens to his patients. Anyone would be lucky to have him as their doctor. I have seen many doctors before being referred to Dr. Phillips. He has been very resourceful in recommending treatments to relieve the severe pain I've been in the last year from injuries from car accidents.|Dr. Phillips is very knowledgeable and took the time to hear about my lower back problems. He talked to me in layman's terms and seemed very emphatic to my situation. I Highly recommend him to anyone who is looking at a spinal cord stimulator implant procedure. That being said some of his staff need to communicate with patients more often to avoid procedural confusion and unnecessary delays, especially when someone is in a lot of pain.|Dr Phillips has been taking care of my pain needs for over six years now.  Without Dr Phillips I would have missed out on a lot of life. I cannot express my appreciation for Dr Phillips enough to be worthy of the personal care I've benefited from him.  Thanks Doc|Dr. Phillips is great!  He genuinely cares about your well-being and wants to make you better. He always seems to be behind though, not sure if he has too many patients scheduled.

column3:
Stapleton Joseph P MD serves patients throughout Happy Valley, Oregon and the greater Portland metropolitan area with specialized pain management services. With over two decades of experience in interventional pain medicine, Dr. Stapleton leads a compassionate team dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. The practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address a wide spectrum of pain disorders, from spinal issues to complex regional pain syndrome.

At Portland Pain Care, Dr. Stapleton offers a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes both interventional procedures and medication management. The clinic specializes in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, arthritis, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Patients benefit from cutting-edge treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication therapies designed to minimize side effects while maximizing pain relief.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 9300 SE 91st Ave #400 in Happy Valley, Oregon, the clinic features modern medical equipment in a comfortable, patient-centered environment. The facility is designed to accommodate various procedures on-site, reducing the need for hospital visits and allowing for more personalized care. With convenient parking and accessibility features, Portland Pain Care prioritizes patient comfort from arrival through treatment.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Stapleton believes in developing collaborative relationships with his patients, taking time to thoroughly understand each individual's pain experience and goals. New patients receive comprehensive evaluations that consider medical history, previous treatments, and quality of life impacts. This thorough assessment forms the foundation for customized treatment plans that evolve as patient needs change.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.portlandpaincare.com or call +1 503-775-6500. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and is committed to helping patients navigate coverage options for specialized pain treatments.

column40:
If I could give zero stars I would. I saw David Klarberg for one appointment and it was one of the worst experiences I've had with any provider in years. He barely let me talk, asked almost no questions, and seemed to have his mind made up on what treatment I needed before we even met - despite me having new imaging showing a major joint issue in an area nearby but different from the area he wanted to treat. The whole experience left me feeling like they just hand out bandaid cortisone injections all day without actually trying to understand the cause of the symptoms. He definitely didn't give me confidence to allow this practice to treat me.|Dr Stapleton helped me significantly with remaingpain after spinal surgery. He's a very kind and caring physician.|Earlier this week I left a review of one particular section/person at Portland Pain Care. I had rated that as a 1. I want to leave this review for all other parts/persons at Portland Pain Care. They are fantastic thus the 5 star review. Dr Stapleton is so very dedicated to his patients and his work. He is always so thorough with each patient. Before any procedure, he personally comes out to make sure we understand what he will be doing and the location. The care by the nurses both before and after the procedures is also so amazing. They do all they can to make your visit comfortable and they are always in such good moods which is soothing as a patient. Empathy and compassion are so evident in Dr Stapleton, his nurses and all personal at the surgery center. He must be a great interviewer because in my opinion, he has highly qualified and exceptionally enthusiastic, compassionate personnel working there. I feel so lucky  that I am a patient at Portland Pain because it is so obvious they care about my well being. They listen attentively and are so good at helping me hear. I am very very hearing impaired and I never even have to ask them to slow down or speak loudly anymore. They know my needs and they address them so well. I imagine they know what every patient needs because they are truly good listeners and they want to help. I never feel hurried to quickly exit so another patient can come in. They want me to feel very sure that I am able and ready to walk out. They even walk me to the door. If you are in need of an excellent pain care facility, look no further. Portland Pain Care is the best in my opinion, and I have been to many others so I know good pain care!|Staff at his Johnson Creek office are absolutely wonderful. NP Barb and Nurse Angela always welcome you with smile. They both have very warm personalities and patiently answer all questions.
At the East Portland Surgical Center, the staff is equally warm and welcoming. I've had several different nurses and they are all very friendly.
Dr. Stapleton has great bedside manners and makes his rounds to talk to all his patients before their procedures. He makes sure you understand your procedure and answers all questions. He and his staff have worked very closely with my neurosurgeon, to find the best ways to manage my pain levels.
His staff schedules appointments in a very timely manner, realizing that alleviating someone's pain is important. They also return calls in a timely manner. I would recommend Dr. Stapleton to anyone considering pain management.|Dr Stapleton is top-notch. He has a calming voice and charming presence. He does all the procedures.

However, whether it's the doctor or other staff I'm not sure, but I feel that during the pre appointments I'm not listened to. Those appointments are short (15 min) and not enough time for discussion or questions. Because of this, I did not get the source of my pain addressed immediately but when I finally did, relief was complete.|My patient was referred to this clinic. He is arguably not the easiest patient due to Alzheimer's, but their staff was not helpful, understanding, accommodating or supportive. They treated him like a second class citizen. They were audibly and visibly annoyed, short, and frustrated when describing his concerns. In my follow up, they were degrading, rude, and argumentative. I will not refer any other patients to this clinic nor will this patient be returning.|I have been under Dr. Stapleton's for several years now and has included several injections as well as constant pain management. I have had telehealth as well as in office visits with the absolute best Hillsboro personnel including Danylyn as well as office personnel Always 100% personal and professional and helpful help. I could not possibly have had any better care controlling my constant pain. Dr. Stapleton has always been the most knowledgeable professional and patient doctor I've ever experienced. I've experienced always in both Hillsboro as well as Wilsonville, the most courteous and professional as well as understanding and empathetic help in all aspects of all visits.|From my first contact with Dr Stapleton's office, I was at ease.  When I arrived for my appointment, I rode the elevator with a lady who I could tell worked in the building.   She was very pleasant and then I discovered she worked in the office.  As I entered the office I was immediately greeted by the "superstar".    I was seen timely by Barb.  I was nervous.  Barb went through her questions to me with kindness and compassion.  She was so thorough in telling me what to expect, I  had no questions left.   Mary got the approval from insurance and had me scheduled with an appointment for my procedure.   Every person I came in contact with in this office treated me amazing.  What a delightful staff Dr. Stapleton has.

Our specialized medical team offers evidence-based treatments for chronic pain conditions, helping patients regain function and improve quality of life. Located conveniently in south Salem, our clinic combines advanced interventional procedures with integrative approaches to address the complex nature of persistent pain.

At Mid-Valley Pain Clinic, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our board-certified physicians develop personalized treatment plans that may include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

Our Commitment to Patient Care

We believe in a patient-centered approach that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. column40:
These people are amazing the yoga during and after the 10 week class is amazing also the classes offered afterwards are great.
They understand that people have pain and it's not going to go away but there are different ways to manage it and cope with it instead of being a druggie.

I have chronic and painful kidney disease and the nurse Rick is awesome worked with me and recommended some treatment plans to my family doctor that my doctor is respecting and working with me on.|The entire staff is awesome! Thank you, Melissa, for my introduction to yoga and thank you, Erica, for showing me the various ways to manage my pain, think about it differently, and live a fuller life. Mid-Valley Pain Clinic complemented all my other treatments to the point that I am no longer living in the chronic pain that I was experiencing for the last few years. I thank you so much!|If I could give them negative stars I would. There "therapy" is a joke the Dr.s there don't really know what they are talking about and are a bunch of frauds.  I just got a call from my PCP that they just got a call from Dr Steven Tackett Nelson and that he is wanting to change my medication because I'm severely depressed and that I'm going to hurt myself or someone else. I have never spoken to or seen this doctor but it turns out that he is one of the psychiatrists that works at Midvalley pain. So in short do not go here they are a joke and I would not recommend seeing this doctor out side of this practice either because you never know what he will do. And I'm going to be filing a complaint with the State of Oregon Medical Board for both Midvalley Pain and especially for "Dr. Steven Tackett Nelson"|This place is metaphysical hell. The 'orientation' that takes 2 hours involves a powerpoint presentation that illustrates the opinion that 3-6 months after an injury it should be completely healed and therefore any pain associated is all mental. There are NO MEDICAL DOCTORS that work in or with this office, nor can this office reccomend, authorize or perform any medical procedures. They provide a one size fits most approach encompassed in a 10 week GROUP THERAPY clinic where you do yoga, cuddle with service dogs and attend cognitive therapy (counseling). The only thing this place lacks was some asshat 'shaman' burning sage, waving about their magic vibrating crystal wand and preaching the gospel of magnetic bracelets.|As a mental health professional, I have worked with Dr. Brillhart, a brilliant and empathic clinician.  If you want to get to the crux, and thus the healing, of chronic pain, Mid-Valley and its outstanding staff is for you.  If you want to get away from the overuse and abuse of drugs, and take more mindful control, Mid-Valley is for you.

Michael H.
Salem, Oregon|This Facility Is A Joke.

Furthermore, the clinicians that work here are highly unethical.  I caught them trying to manipulate me, and they even admitted to it!  They refused me access to their program to benefit their own adgenda, and tried to spin it, so it appeared like it was my idea, and my fault also. I have been severely injured, I have been traumatized, and I have done absolutley nothing to warrant their actions.  I came to these people with severe pain, an open mind, and I asked them for help.  They abandoned me and tried to slander my character!   These people are liars do not trust them, they don't care about helping you.  I am an innocent victim who has done nothing, why are they blaming me?

At the first class, they make you watch random youtube videos that are not even theirs, they are charging people to watch something you can watch at home for free?? The video, (and the music) was so stupid that at break time, i just got up and left.  I called and apologized for leaving and said i did not think the time was right for me to be in the program.   About a year later I had a new Dr. and he referred me to the program again.  (I have had a half dozen specialists refer me here in the meantime.)  I had been to a lot of counseling inbetween, and I felt I wanted give it another try.

My 2nd assessment with Erika was both laughable and shameful .  She tried to manipulate me and treated me like a child.  Repeating multiple times.. "You didn't think our program was right for you before" and then she mentioned my folder? She said. "You brought this folder in with you."  (The folder contained legal documents that prove I have been malpracticed.)
She did not even ask what was in the folder.  She was happier to use it as an excuse to refuse me access to the program.  This seems like an extremely close minded approach for a trained professional?

After she wasted my time for 30 minutes, I simply told Erika,  "Look, it sounds to me like YOU'RE the one who dosen't  think the program is right for me, but you're trying to make it out to sound like,  I'M the one, who dosen't want to be in the program.  I also told her at that time that, I had a 141 IQ, and I knew when people were lying to me...

So then,  she actually admitted to it!! Erika said,  " OK, well, actually, yeah, I'LL BE HONEST,  I dont think that our program is right for you."!

Why did it take her 1/2 hour, and why did I have to catch her lying, for her to be honest?  It's because these loosers have their own adgenda.  They don't want me in their group because they don't want me talking about how I was malpracticed and undermining the doctors authority.

This is highly, highly corrupt and unethical behavior..  I have been severely traumatized, and these amatures are only traumatizing me further with their game playing.

I requested another consultation with a different intake person, and they had me meet with their 2 psychiatrists.  The lady was about 350 pounds.  I'm sorry, but I don't need advice from someone who isn't even smart enough to know when it's time to stop eating.  The other one, said 10 times, "I shoot from the hip, I shoot from the hip."  I said "Me too, and if you don't let me in the program, I'm going on google and I will leave a review that thoroughly outlines your highly unethical behavior."  Their reply was that, now they weren't going to let me into the program because I had made threats. HU??

These people are worthless, they also heavily misrepresented the facts when they called my PCP and tried to slander me, more blameshifting..  The morning of this appt, I got up early and started calling them at 8am because I did not know the exact time of my visit, and I did not want to miss it or be late.

I had to call 13 times before they finally decided to answer their phone that morning.

So, they called my Dr. and told him I called 13 times and I was phsycotic?

The people here clearly do not have much faith in their own abilities, if they need to lie, manipulate, slander, and refuse treatment when a difficult case comes along!

Brandon Haggas.|I have no way of contacting you as I know longer have phone service, I am afraid I have lost a day and no way yto make up that day, I was kind of counting on getting the funds at the end of the sessions, but it seems I have managed to screw that up along with everything else in my life. I do thank you for all the help and assistance you have given to to me, though I do not think it has helped me enough. I still have many of the same feelings as I have had when I joined the pain clinic, you have just helped me to understand why I feel this way. I will give you 5 stars for the assistance in attempting to help me as a person. I actually felt like I was wanted there. Unfortunately feeling wanted does not pay the bills as for the reason why I am writing a review and have np phone service. Thank you all for your support.|I do have the privilege of being a childless & single adult, but I was able to attend the full program & greatly benefited from the continued resources. You have to be open to it, but it really helps with conceptualizing & coping with chronic pain.

column3:
Pain PDX serves Portland, Oregon as a specialized Extracorporeal Shockwave Therapy (ESWT) clinic dedicated to providing non-invasive pain relief solutions. Located in the heart of Portland, our clinic has become a trusted destination for individuals seeking alternatives to surgery and conventional pain management approaches. We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why our team of specialists is committed to delivering effective treatments that harness your body's natural healing capabilities.

At Pain PDX, we utilize advanced Shockwave technology that delivers precise acoustic waves to targeted areas of pain and discomfort. This gentle yet powerful therapy stimulates blood flow, accelerates tissue regeneration, and reduces inflammation—all without the need for medication or invasive procedures. Our treatments are specifically designed to address a wide range of conditions, including tendonitis, plantar fasciitis, shoulder pain, tennis elbow, and chronic muscle tension.

Why Choose Shockwave Therapy?

Quick Relief - Many patients experience significant improvement after just a few sessions, with treatments typically lasting only 15-20 minutes.

Non-Invasive Solution - Avoid the risks and recovery time associated with surgery while achieving meaningful pain reduction.

Long-Lasting Results - Rather than merely masking symptoms, our therapy addresses the underlying causes of pain for sustainable relief.

Minimal Downtime - Return to your daily activities immediately after treatment, with no lengthy recovery periods required.

Visit our clinic at 2100 NE Broadway Suite #225, Portland, OR 97232 to discover how our specialized approach can help you reclaim your active lifestyle. Contact us today at +1 971-251-4336 or learn more at [painpdx.com](https://painpdx.com/) to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free future.
column11:
Pain PDX is an Extracorporial Shockwave Therapy (ESWT) Clinic in Portland, Oregon that offers gentle, non-invasive treatments that provide quick relief from pain without the need for surgery.
We use the Shockwave technology to harness the body's natural healing abilities to get you pain free and back to doing the things you love.
For those of you experiencing chronic pain, struggling with old injuries that inhibit your life or are looking for an alternative to surgery, Shockwave Therapy offers a way forward to returning to living the life you want.
column38: Jay Herrington|alison coffinbarger|Sita Walker|Taylor Tappin|Courtney Taylor-Gomia|MiscFilmFest Podcast|Laura Hadden|Emma Rose
column40:
I've been a patient of Dr Suzi for a couple of years and she has done a great job keeping my poor overused neck and shoulders in great shape.

Over the past few months she has included the shockwave treatment. I can't believe how much better I feel. Now I can go on runs without paying in pain. I can sit comfortably at the computer for as long as I need and I can use my shoulders without pain. 5 stars!|I was treated with the Shockwave by Dr. Levy. Ironically, there was no shock involved, only relief!  In my experience it helped dissolve a painful ovarian cyst. In particular I believe that having frequent treatments in a two week period made a tremendous difference. I was dealing with debilitating symptoms for about three months and considering surgery. I would also note that I was taking NAC as well and strongly believe that that combined with shockwave saved me from surgery or a burst cyst. I also can't say enough about Dr. Levy's ability to assess a patient's need and treat in a way with genuine care. On a another note, the treatments also had an immediate effect of reducing the intensity of the symptoms-so it was a good form of pain relief n the moment as well.|I had multiple ankle fractures along with ankle surgery to implant hardware about a year and a half ago and since then I've had persistent swelling and pain that would inhibit movement in the injured area and lead to plateaus in physical therapy. It wasn't until I added Shockwave treatments that I started to see consistent relief in the pain and swelling thus leading to significant gains from PT. It was so exciting to feel the pain start to go way after the first and second treatments and to be able to see chronic inflammation and swelling in the joint go down so I could move into more functional ranges of motion.

Pain PDX is an informed and welcoming option for Shockwave treatment for pain relief in Portland, Oregon. Highly recommend trying them to see if you can get pain relief too!|I am so impressed with Shock Wave treatment. After my first experience, I could feel an immediate response.
I've suffered from foot pain for years.
Now, having had 5+ treatments, I can honestly say this thing is doing miraculous work! I have been telling everyone about it.
If given the opportunity to try Shock Wave for pain management, give it a go.
It can be seriously life changing.
Thank you Dr. Levy!|Two decades of doing hair has left me with a body that perplexes a lot of chiropractors and care providers. I often hear I have the most hyper extended knees that they have ever seen and in turn people don't want the risk of messing with or trying to treat them. I can honestly say that I have had the exact opposite situation happen with Dr. Suzi Levy.

My knee was at a point where doing a physical daily job while also living in a fat body and also partaking in very recreational activities such as hiking, traveling, city walking, doing a single flight of stairs, sitting for long road trips, or even having a lazy Sunday couch day were not things that could  ever happen together. I was using lidocaine spray at minimum 2-3 times a day, and it didn't matter how I shifted my knee, or propped it up, or babied it, the concern of surgery was ever present. And we both had decided honestly I was too young for this route, and would make me less viable for future surgery's when I was older, which was also scary. Even after attempting rounds of PT and work directly on that spot, I was ready to throw in the towel and give up so much of my lifestyle and with such constant and chronic pain, I would have done anything to get some relief.

When Dr. Suzi suggested that this shockwave therapy could be an option for me, I was curious, nervous and honestly pretty skeptical. It's been such an interesting and very gratifying journey watching my body heal itself and being presented with a surgery alternative that was actually working. I almost couldn't believe it!

The sensation in the pulsewave machine was not invasive feeling and Dr. Levy was so awesome at constantly checking in with pain levels as we worked on the front and backs of both of my knees. Within just a few treatment appointments, which were also so quick and worked great with my busy schedule, I am not kidding when I say my life has changed for the better! When you are in a cloud of constant chronic pain, it becomes such a part of your daily life, that you just kinda learn how to sit with it, accept it, baby it and give up so much joy around things you were once able to do!

She has called my case a very difficult one in terms of not hyping up how much ease of pain we may have gotten, but I am down to using lidocaine as a preventative measure when doing very long and uphill hikes. Which is mind blowing!! Hiking 5-10 miles that involve uphill switchbacks, tree root systems and cases of stairs in one hike was something I thought I would never be able to do again, and I am back to doing them regularly! I am still being very mindful and slow and steady, using a hiking pole and taking breaks, but I am not in pain while doing so which is still constantly such a gift!!!

I am also back to working 45-60 hours weekly on my feet, standing and bending in weird ways, and where as again, I am aware and still being mindful, I am able to not even think about my knee anymore while doing my job!

This treatment has given me back so much of my joy of life and in my job! Makes me feel like I can continue in my lifestyle and career for more decades to come! Thank you for creating such a space of care and opportunity for such a huge gift to myself. I am so thankful for the opportunity to keep on living such a busy lifestyle and experience fulfilling adventures without pain!! You changed my life Dr. Suzi!! Thank you so kindly from the bottom of my heart!!|My Shockwave experience at Pain PDX was great! I've had plantarfascitis for 10 years. Tried everything: physical therapy, special inserts, tape jobs, anti inflammatories, massage, chiropractic. No matter what it still got worse. I felt helpless and scared. I love nature and hiking, but I couldn't even do a long shopping trip without consequence, let alone hike.

Dr. Levy suggested I try the Shockwave and the next morning I was able to get out of bed with no foot pain!

6 visits and 2 months later, I'm able to do day-to-day activities comfortably. I still have slight pain at the end of a long hike but it's tolerable, and at the rate I'm going I know I won't feel even this mild pain for much longer.|I got shockwave treatment with Dr. Levy for some ankle pain and, I'm not sure how all this sorcery work, but my ankle was pain free and back to normal within 48 hours! Not only does the treatment work, but Dr. Levy is a wonderfully empathetic and no-bullshit provider. I'd highly recommend for anyone in Portland!|I came to this clinic regarding a sports related shoulder injury that was previously surgically operated on. I was experiencing shoulder pain, limited range of motion, swelling, weakness, and a grinding of the joint. After the first few treatments, there was noticeable decrease in the amount of pain and swelling I was experiencing. After 5 treatments, full range of motion was restored and I could exercise pain free. Shockwave therapy was a fantastic alternative to a surgery and provided me the opportunity to move without pain. Dr. Suzi has always been incredibly attentive and supportive of my recovery goals. It's been 5 months since my last treatment and the pain hasn't returned. I am extremely grateful for the entire Pain PDX team for bringing me back to a pain free place!

column48: Is Shockwave right for me?
column49:
Most of the time the answer is a resounding YES!

Almost any part of the body can benefit from Shockwave as long as the injury is in a place that the device can safely reach and there are no red flags. 

Please reach out to our clinic if you need help determining if Shockwave is right for you.

Northwest Pain Institute serves Forest Grove, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services. Founded with the mission to provide complex and comprehensive care for individuals experiencing pain, the institute has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the region. Our patient-centered approach ensures that all patients—regardless of gender, race, or ethnicity—receive personalized treatment plans designed to address their specific pain conditions.

Northwest Pain Institute is led by Dr. Trevor Jorgensen, a distinguished physician with over 11 years of experience in private practice for pain management. Dr. Jorgensen's unique qualifications include training in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, complemented by an additional Pain Medicine fellowship through the Anesthesia department. This comprehensive educational background enables him to implement the most modern and effective pain management techniques available in medical practice today.

Collaborative Approach

At Northwest Pain Institute, we believe in a collaborative approach to pain management. Our team works hand in hand with patients as well as other local healthcare providers to ensure the best possible care outcomes. This integrated method allows us to address pain from multiple perspectives, creating more effective and sustainable treatment plans.

Services and Accessibility

Our facility offers a wide range of pain management solutions tailored to individual needs. Located at 2005 Cedar St, Forest Grove, OR 97116, we are conveniently positioned to serve patients throughout the Northwest region. For appointments or inquiries, patients can reach us at (503) 883-8297 or visit our comprehensive website at www.northwestpaininstitute.com for more information about our services and approach to pain management.
column11:
The Northwest Pain Institute was created to provide complex and comprehensive care for anyone experiencing pain. We welcome all patients and treat all genders, races, and ethnicities. We work hand in hand with patients as well as other local providers to ensure the best care possible.

Northwest Pain Institute is led by Dr. Trevor Jorgensen. Dr. Jorgensen has over 11 years of experience in private practice for pain management. He is a Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation trained doctor who completed his residency and an additional Pain Medicine fellowship through the Anesthesia department in order to treat pain with the most modern and effective techniques.

column38: LOSR|Anthony Fong|Raschelle Parker|Alaina Klozar|Alfonso Mendez|Ken S. (N7NJA)|Kathie McBride|Lissa Glidewell
column40:
Dr.Jorgensen did not listen to my concerns.  Jumped to conclusions and ignored symptoms that I brought up. I had a follow-up appointment and he did not show up instead another unprepared staff member showed up and she didn't even know how to answer my questions.  She recited what she was supposed to tell me. I was having an awful pain. That was the last day I visited the clinic.|The NW Pain staff and doctors are great at what they do. Love the small office with friendly atmosphere. Was a longtime patient with them until i had to switch insurance. They took care of my pain and usually had me feeling almost pain free after every procedure. highly recommend them for your pain management needs.|I visited Dr. Jorgensen today and my experience was less than pleasant. I was accused of being dishonest from the get go.  I was never dishonest in any of my answers. I went there for help and instead was accused of lying. I am not a liar! His bedside manner could definitely use some work and maybe even a little kindness and understanding of the patients that actually need help! I do not recommend this dr to anyone ever!|Avoid this place! I was referred by my spinal surgeon for "diagnostic" reasons but never received any pain relief. After getting my 2nd nerve block there I had a stroke 2 weeks later in my cerebellum, right where the nerve block had been injected. It had punctured an artery in the back of my head causing a dissection and stroke. Now while I can't prove that this was the cause 'legally', I know it was the cause because as soon as I left that office after the nerve block, I was in excruciating pain that continued to get worse. I was unable to sleep on my back or rest the back of my head on anything for over a month because of the extreme pain. When I called their office to let them know the problems I was having they told me not to worry about it unless there was redness and swelling at the injection site which was impossible to tell since it was in the back of my hairline. So 2 weeks later, at 43 I had a stroke and I blame this place completely. I just want to warn other people. This place is not a professional medical establishment and they do not  have a caring sense or compassion. It is not about helping people it's about making money. I wish I had never been sent here. Needless to say I was not able to get my neck surgery due to the stroke so I'm now finding a new spinal surgeon who hopefully won't send me to a horrible place like this. You have been warned!!!|I recently started going to the Forest Grove office of Northwest Pain Institute. At first, I was scared of getting a needle stuck in my neck, but the staff was very good at what they do. I felt no pain during the visit and had relief from the pain after the visit. Appointments were easy to make, and they answer their phones quickly as compared to other pain clinics. Now a 5 star review. All  billing issues were  resolved.  The have a patient portal that one can access by phone or computer.|My neurosurgeon referred me for steroid injections in a couple of spots that have been giving me some severe pain.
Everyone in the practice has been absolutely great, and the procedure itself was quick and nearly painless.

They can't control whether the medication works for me or not, so I will not be updating that. Sorry, I know I'd like to know as a reader too, but this is about them, not me.|Dr. J. has helped, post-accident, with my shoulder and back problems. His treatment for pain goes way beyond any medical or physical therapy solutions I've experienced. Relief at last!|The three stars are for the staff. If you are an internal medicine/immune disorder pt. this is not the clinic for you. I was referred here by my PCP, I asked before I made the appointment if they treated people with they type of needs I have, I was told yes. In person, after an hour+ drive and a missed 1/2 day of work I was told no. Unsurprisingly, since my primary complaint is an "invisible illness" they will not treat me here. Immune disorders and their related problems don't seem to be taken seriously anymore. There is no expiration date, they can't be exercised away, physical therapied away, or thought away using positive thinking, and because of this, legitimate pain isn't taken seriously or treated like it should be. The other troublesome part of this is that I said my main complaint is X and because of X I also have Y and Z. When they called me to tell me it was a no for tx, they said they couldn't treat me because of Z. On the scale of things, symptom Z is only there because of problem X. I don't think they even listened to what I had to say during the appointment.

column48: Does this clinic provide the option of a spinal cord stimulator as part of the pain management modality?
column49:
Yes, absolutely we do!
We offer comprehensive pain management options including Medications, opioid dependence treatment, procedures, including spinal cord stimulation, physical modalities management, and mental health management. 
We specialize in accurate interventions including spinal cord stimulation.
We also offer diagnostic testing in the form of EMGs.

column3:
Oregon Pain and Spine in Eugene, Oregon provides comprehensive pain management and spine care services to patients throughout the Willamette Valley. Under the expert guidance of Adam Kemp, M.D., our practice combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment approaches to address chronic pain conditions and spinal disorders. We understand that living with persistent pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why our team is dedicated to developing personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Oregon Pain and Spine, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and minimally invasive techniques. Dr. Kemp specializes in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to identify and address the underlying causes of your pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. During your visit, Dr. Kemp takes the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, explain diagnostic findings, and discuss all available treatment options. This collaborative approach ensures you're actively involved in decisions about your care plan.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern clinic at 360 S Garden Way #230, Eugene, OR 97401 is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The comfortable environment is designed to make your visits as stress-free as possible, with a friendly staff committed to providing exceptional service from the moment you contact us.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Adam Kemp, please call us at +1 541-844-7246 or visit our website at https://oregonpainandspine.com/ for more information about our services. We work with most major insurance providers and are committed to helping patients navigate their coverage options for pain management care.

column40:
Dr. Kemp was by far the best. He actually listened to me, didnt rush the appointment, explained the procedures in detail, and even helped ease my anxiety. His staff was amazing and super sweet. I would recommend this office to anyone experiencing pain and needs help. I am actually looking forward to my pain relief procedure. Thank you Dr. Kemp and Staff :)|Dr. Kemp seems to be a very caring and concerned doctor. The problem is...no one ever answers the phone. When he says he's sending in a prescription and two days later it still hasn't happened, and you've called and left messages. You start to worry. There are not a lot of doctors in this field, you just get a sick feeling and really just have to endure it or start over again. And as I read through reviews, nobody answers the ones that don't get a 5 star.|I was essentially abandoned by Drs Kemp and Morgan when she retired.  No return phone calls, no return emails, no records sent to my primary care physician
.  It is a horrible experience to be left with no medication for well documented pain conditions after receiving treatment for years.|I love Dr. Kemp, he is a compassionate doctor and listens to his patients. My only problem that I've had multiple times is getting my pain medicine called in before they run out. Today is another day that I've been trying to reach him for several days and all day long to get somebody to return my call me so I can get my opiate prescription refilled and nobody answers the phone nor has anybody called me back. I have had this problem in the past and it makes me believe that nobody understands what going through withdrawals is like. Just because I didn't get my prescription refilled I have to go through this. But Dr Kemp on a personal level is a really good doctor.|Dr. Kemp is very knowledgeable and is always in your corner. He makes you feel like you've known him for years and is easy to talk with. He will take the time to go over what options are available and does a great job of explaining them in detail. I feel very comfortable around him and his staff. I highly recommend Dr. Kemp to anyone suffering from chronic pain. One of the best out there!|I love Dr Kemp He's very professional.
Does great work And there's a very wonderful atmosphere.|I've been calling office to have no luck getting ahold of someone to obtain some information. I also send an email from their web page. I'm waiting patiently to hear back from someone at the clinic. Hoping all is well|I find the atmosphere to be very respectful. Inviting. And then I find Doctor kemp to be very detailed and understanding. And we go over the process that we need to do for the next appointment, I have a lot of anxiety and I think that Doctor Kemp and his nurses reassure me. Everything's going to be just  fine.

Gregory A. Moore, MD serves Eugene, Oregon with exceptional orthopedic and sports medicine care. As the leading physician at Pacific Sports and Spine, Dr. Moore combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate patient care to deliver comprehensive treatment solutions for musculoskeletal conditions and sports-related injuries. His practice has become a trusted healthcare destination for residents throughout Lane County seeking specialized orthopedic services.

At his practice located at 217 Division Ave, Eugene, OR 97404, Dr. Moore offers a wide range of treatments addressing both acute injuries and chronic conditions. His approach integrates cutting-edge diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. The clinic's state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment outcomes.

Services and Expertise

Dr. Moore specializes in sports medicine, spine care, joint replacement, arthroscopic procedures, and rehabilitation services. His extensive training and years of clinical experience enable him to treat conditions ranging from common sprains and strains to complex spinal disorders. Patients particularly value his conservative approach, exploring non-surgical options whenever possible before recommending surgical intervention.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

What distinguishes Dr. Moore's practice is his commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. He takes time to thoroughly explain diagnoses, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This patient-centered approach has earned him numerous positive reviews and a loyal patient base.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Gregory A. Moore, patients can call +1 541-780-6654 or visit the practice website at https://www.pacificsportsandspine.com/. The clinic offers flexible scheduling options, including same-week appointments for urgent cases, and works with most major insurance providers to ensure accessible care for all patients.

column38: Jason Cooksey|Sue Frazier|Nicole Leisner|Carol Truesdale|Janis McDonald|jennifer fairbanks|Liz Hartzell|Robert Boysen
column40:
Dr. Moore has been my doctor for many years. I have had several procedures that helped, but did not relieve all of my pain. Such as a spinal cord stimulator. On a visit, A year ago they told me I was a good candidate for the intercept procedure. My insurance would not cover it at the time. Here recently, we got approval from the insurance. They could only do two levels at once because of Insurance. I needed three. After the first procedure, it relieved approximately 70 to 80% of my pain. A week ago I had the third level done. I am almost completely pain free and do not take pain meds. The incision site is not even healed yet. This has 100% changed my life for the better. Every person that knows me is like, Wow it's so nice to have the old Jason back, we haven't seen you this happy in years. I've been able to hunt and hike without pain. I cannot thank Dr. Moore, Devin Parks, and their wonderful staff enough for giving me my life back. Anyone interested can contact me on Facebook Messenger. Jason Cooksey in Coos Bay OR.|I am very pleased with the care I get at Pacific Sports and Spine. Devon and Dr. Moore  have  always been very thorough with their exams as well as listening to my symptoms, and concerns. I trust them to do their very best with my care , they are awesome and Devon is so easy to talk with , takes her time to really listen to what's going on , very impressive.|Doctor Moore was recommended to me by my mom and with good reason. He is patient with you with all your questions and concerns. He really listens and explains things to you. I felt like he actually cared about my well being rather than just being another number and paycheck. I will continue only being seen here for my spine. I will continue to recommend him and this practice to everyone that needs this kind of specialist. Thank for hearing me out, and taking such good care of me and my mom.|Dr. Moore is a well-educated doctor who is willing to go the extra mile to insure his patients are well taken care of.  My back and body pain are no joke and he doesn't take my care lightly.  I can honestly say I am not in pain because of the alternative methods to drugs and with drugs that has been implemented in my care in the past 8 +/- years.|This is my 2nd time having L2-L5 nerve ablation done by Dr Moore. The first series was just over a year ago and the procedures were successful in greatly reducing nerve pain in my low back, hips and sides. As he recommended previously, I have also continued to do daily PT exercises intended specifically to strengthen core and glute support for my spine, which has enabled more physical activities beyond just walking. I think he is the best in his field, and is a perfectionist in his work. I highly recommend him and his very professional and knowledgeable staff; some have worked with him for 10-15 years, that says a lot about who Dr Moore is. It all started with an appt to see and discuss my xrays and MRI with him, so I understood what was causing all the pain and get his opinions and recommendations.|Running little late but to be expected. Trust Dr. Moore to offer best solutions to conditions. Epidermal ordered STAT. I hope this works. Next visit want to speak with Dr. Moore about non surgical alternatives to pain management. Thee is a lot of info in the patient waiting room I wish I would have taken photo of as reminders to ask him about.|Highly recommend Dr. Moore and any person he decides to train. Stellar group. I wouldn't go anywhere else for my spine care.

I have a chronic, long term spine injury that happened in my early 30's. As I age (mid 50's now), typical changes occur, but nerve pain and spasms foster further injury for me.

Dr. Moore and his team (I have worked with all of them over a number of years) are top tier problem solvers, with real solutions that help me keep walking, while enjoying as normal a life as possible. They always find a way to help me, alleviate my worst discomfort, and to be my best self.

Quality care starts with a quality team, and you will not find better than Dr. Moore .

Liz|I have been seeing Dr. Moore for a number of years. Dr. Moore is very knowledgeable about my problem and has tried a number of procedures to give me some pain relief-lower lumbar region. Unfortunately, though these procedures worked for other patients, they did not for me. I do enjoy discussing my problem with Dr. Moore since I think he is caring and sincerely wanting to help. I have talked with other back doctors and don't get the same feeling that I do with Dr. Moore.

Robert D. Heros, MD serves Tualatin, Oregon and the greater Portland metropolitan area with exceptional spine care services. As the founder of Spinal Diagnostics & Regenerative Medicine, Dr. Heros has established a premier medical practice dedicated to diagnosing and treating complex spinal conditions using innovative, minimally invasive techniques. With over two decades of specialized experience, Dr. Heros combines his extensive medical expertise with compassionate patient care to deliver personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of spinal pain and dysfunction.

Comprehensive Spine Care Services

At Spinal Diagnostics, patients benefit from a wide range of advanced diagnostic and therapeutic procedures. Dr. Heros specializes in interventional pain management, regenerative medicine treatments, and precise diagnostic evaluations that identify the specific source of spinal discomfort. The practice offers cutting-edge treatments including epidural steroid injections, facet joint interventions, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative therapies that promote natural healing and recovery.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 6464 SW Borland Rd A-2, Tualatin, OR 97062, the modern clinic features advanced medical equipment and comfortable treatment spaces designed with patient comfort in mind. The convenient location provides easy access for patients throughout Washington County and the surrounding communities, with ample parking and accessibility accommodations.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Heros and his dedicated team prioritize patient education and collaborative care. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific condition, lifestyle needs, and recovery goals. The practice prides itself on maintaining open communication with patients, ensuring they fully understand their diagnosis and treatment options before proceeding with care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Robert D. Heros, patients can call +1 503-885-1515 or visit the practice website at [www.spinaldx.com](https://www.spinaldx.com/). The clinic welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans. As of July 2022, the practice continues to maintain excellent patient satisfaction ratings and successful outcomes for those suffering from chronic spinal conditions.

2 Months Later:
I have never received such care, compassion, honesty, and professional ism from any one doctor. Dr. heroes has walked me through a very difficult time.  He has been very honest about my pain and the treatment needed to relieve it. He has been very encouraging all through my journey. I really have appreciated his honesty and care. I would shout my referral of him from the mountain tops. Thank you very much Dr. Heros.|Dr Heros is a bright young man with a great approach to his practice of medicine. He's most knowledgeable at his craft and has an easy to listen to method of teaching his patients about their symptoms and concerns and how to lessen their pain. I enjoyed talking with him today about my back pain and feel very confident that he'll treat my condition, when I next go in to have my procedure, with the skill and confidence of a true professional.|Dr. Heros has changed my life!
I was worried about my future ability to lead a full life, and now 6 months after getting the Reactiv8 device I'm doing so great!
Love him and his staff!
I can't say enough good things!|Dr. Heros and his staff are all wonderful. I was treated with much respect and dignity. I felt listened to, heard, and seen (which was so refreshing). My needs were met in a timely manner and I am already feeling better. It has been a long time since I could envision a less painful future. Thank you all. Dr Heros lived up to his name.

For those of you considering a Neurostimulator for pain control, I went with the one from Abbott. I just completed my 1 week trial and I had 85% + pain relief. It was like a miracle. Now waiting for insurance approval for the permanent one.|Dr Heros and his team are careful, competent and thorough, Dr Heros explained my diagnosis and pain treatment options patiently and with nuance.... I knew what to expect and the range of possible outcomes! He's awesome!|I'm so impressed with Dr. Hero. The entire office really. He truly cares about his patients & wants us to be as pain free as possible. He is trying as much as he can to help me with my pain. column2: Salem Health Specialty Clinic - Pain Clinic
column3:
Salem Health Specialty Clinic - Pain Clinic serves Salem, Oregon with comprehensive pain management solutions focused on patient safety and holistic care. Our specialized team at Salem Health approaches pain treatment through a multifaceted lens, beginning with a thorough evaluation of your medical history to develop personalized treatment plans. Located in the heart of Salem, our clinic has established itself as a trusted resource for residents seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions.

At Salem Health's pain clinic, our primary goal is to keep you safe. We'll start by doing a comprehensive review of your records to create a safe plan of care. Rather than relying solely on medication-based treatments, our philosophy centers on sustainable lifestyle modifications that address the root causes of pain. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop individualized treatment strategies that consider your unique circumstances and health objectives.

Holistic Treatment Philosophy

Our approach extends beyond symptom management to focus on overall wellness. We emphasize lifestyle changes that can significantly impact your pain experience, including techniques to improve stress management, enhance sleep quality, develop healthy eating habits, and incorporate appropriate exercise routines. This holistic methodology helps patients develop sustainable strategies for long-term pain control and improved quality of life.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 503-814-7246. Our clinic is conveniently located at 2485 12th St SE, Salem, OR 97302. Please note that phone hours may vary. For additional information about our services, visit our website at www.salemhealth.org/services/pain-clinic.
column11: At Salem Health's pain clinic, our primary goal is to keep you safe. We'll start by doing a comprehensive review of your records to create a safe plan of care. It's not only about using medications, but instead about changing your lifestyle. To help you improve stress, sleep, healthy eating habits and exercise. Phone hours may vary.

The doctor had his verdict made up before talking to me. Ive had 15 surgeries and have broken every bone in my body, and without any consult, he decided I have fibromyalgia. The doctor is a dismissive joke. If anyone deserves pain relief, its someone in my position.  These people aren't interested in helping people with real pain. It took me 8 months to talk to an actual person. They lied to me numerous times about sending me questionnaires and receiving referrals. Dont expect anything from them other than to minimize your suffering. A total disappointment from start to finish.|Seen dr coelho
Of course the reviews to this place are atrocious as I write this
There needs to be a policy in place where video visits are recorded to better protect patients
This man was wildly inappropriate with his commentary came into the video visit harsh and crude, saying things such as apparently as a patient we know nothing of our pain, and being obese I could absolutely prescribe something or refer to surgery, and of course y'all get to write whatever you want in the after summary like the corrupt way y'all approach your practice is the same way you summarize your patient to better fit how "good a dr" you are is just about equivalent to defamation of character ;
No wonder people are upset and you have the reviews you do
This man was discriminatory and there needs to something in place to protect the patients at this rate, y'all are absolutely awful and if your considering a "consultation" from this guy- Don't.|Edit,
I was reading other sites set to review doctors and clincs. This Dr. Coelho has over 80 1 star reviews says he diagnosis everyone with fibromyalgia leaving them crying leaving the appointment. I went to administration of this clinic and wasn't taken seriously as to how terrible this doctor is but he left notes that I have issues because of how he was acting? If you want belittled, mistreated, gaslit on medical files. Skip this clinic at all costs!  This was only a intake! He's a disaster!

I have a degenerate disease, he question my diagnosis. Gaslit me then laughed at me saying I'm dramatic that I have pain at my age. Dr Coelho has absolutely humiliated me, raised his voice and demanded I go to a clinic that doesn't exsist then put in my chart notes that I made up my condition causing issues in the future for my care. column3:
Columbia Pain and Spine Institute serves Gresham, Oregon and surrounding communities with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain and spinal conditions. Our dedicated team of pain management specialists brings decades of combined experience to provide comprehensive treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs. We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we're committed to helping our patients regain their quality of life through personalized care plans.

At Columbia Pain and Spine Institute, we offer a multifaceted approach to pain management. Our providers excel in providing thorough diagnoses of painful conditions, compassionate conservative medication management, and various types of minimally invasive interventional procedures and injections. Our primary goal is to help patients find relief while potentially avoiding open spinal surgery whenever possible.

Our Specialized Treatments Include:

• Diagnostic pain evaluations

• Medication management

• Epidural steroid injections

• Facet joint injections

• Nerve blocks

• Radiofrequency ablation

• Spinal cord stimulation

• Joint injections

State-of-the-Art Facility

We are conveniently located in Gresham, across from LA Fitness gym in a free-standing new two-story building with a dedicated parking lot. Our modern facility features a state-of-the-art procedure suite where we perform all interventional treatments on-site, eliminating the need for hospital visits for most procedures. This integrated approach allows us to provide efficient, coordinated care in a comfortable environment.

Insurance and Accessibility

Columbia Pain and Spine Institute accepts most major insurance plans to ensure our services are accessible to as many patients as possible. Our friendly administrative staff will work with you to verify your coverage and explain any potential out-of-pocket costs before treatment begins.

Contact Us

We will be thrilled to help you in your quest for a better, pain-free life. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Website: columbiapainandspine.com

Phone: +1 503-382-8100

Address: 689 NW Burnside Rd, Gresham, OR 97030, United States

We take almost all insurances. We will be thrilled to help you in your quest to a better pain free life.

column40:
Dr. Anthony is a very compassionate doctor and I am grateful for the care I have received. I am currently undergoing injections, which they had to fight my insurance to get. The injection caused me more severe pain for 10 ish days and then I was back to my baseline. I was being treated with a prescription to help the pain which at least let me do a little more than I can do now. However I was cut off a few months ago because I have OHP. I understand their reasons behind it, however it makes me feel like I am not worthy of help due to having state insurance. I am currently not able to work so I have to rely on help from the state at the moment. It just does not seem right to have to be in pain if you are lower in society. But like I said, I am grateful for what they had done.
Update: I am changing my review to a five star review. I had to call them today regarding paperwork that was sent to them that I needed returned. They are always on top of everything and I appreciate that they don't make me feel stupid or invalid. Thank you Danny (front desk) for your help!|I had issues of finding spine care due to my color.  I found Dr. Anthony and yall clinic.  Dr. Anthony was an absolutely the best , kind, caring an explained everything clearly.  I thank my Lord Jesus Christ   for letting me find Dr. Anthony and he has a wonderful staff. I want to thank Leslie for being kind when preparing me for surgery.  Thank you Dr. Anthony from the bottom of my heart|Clinic should call before if they can't take ohp for back pain.  Complete waste of time and gas.  60 miles one way.  They only wanted to bill ohp for new patient visit for the money. Thats why they didn't call to explain coverage.  OHP only works for hip and knees.  Yet this is a spine clinic that works on back issues.  If you have OHP this is not for you

I think they should send gift card for the extended travel time and more wasting my time|Dr. Anthony is great. Very personable and knowledgeable on the processes and procedures he does. The injections I've had here and the appointments I've had follow industry best practices and all injections are ultrasound guided. The clinic staff have even been helpful and knowledgeable when discussing the insurance and workers comp process. Very nice people and very good service. Highly recommend.|Dr. Oleg isn't just another cog in the healthcare system! He genuinely cares and is an advocate for us little guys.  Pain changed my life and his willingness to fight for me gives hope in an often hopeless battle with the healthcare and insurance system.

He's got a pretty fantastic team too! Give em a call and see for yourself!|My experience here has been pleasant. I've had injections done elsewhere that were painful and didn't work - not the case here!|Doctor was beyond rude. As I'm trying to show him my reports that show I have pinched nerves from an actual doctor at a chiropractor clinic he completely dismissed me and said those aren't real reports to have more studies done, as I'm telling him he doesn't have my current studies he's looking at old ones. He argued with me unprofessionally as I'm trying to explain my pain to him and he wouldn't even listen. Do not recommend.|This would be a 5 star review for doctors & NP they have all been great in the last 5 years going there I have never been humiliated like I was today by the guy at reception he's always been abrupt & slightly rude but today I mentioned I would not be at next appointment as I will be out of town & already worked it out with NP (Nickiel....spelling)she is also very knowledgeable, he still insisted I tell him where & what day I was leaving & what day to be back I didn't see why he needed to know but did give him the information.  As I was leaving he asked me to talk to him. He loudly stated that my doctor had no authority to make such a decision about me not having an extra appointment before I left. Had he not been so arrogant, loud, & rude telling a very full waiting room about my medical issues which I'm sure they all assumed I was a druggie trying to scam them. Had he been polite & kept the conversation quiet I would have not had a problem setting an extra appointment even if it had to be the exact day before I left. I'm not sure how long I've been going there but it was before this office was built, I have never abused or misused anything I go to my appointments, pay bills, treat everyone there with respect. Today he not only said he had the authority to over ride doctors & made sure the entire waiting room heard my medical issues & how I had to be there EVERY 28 days.  I agreed to the appointment but left before it was set everyone was staring at me & I didn't want to cry. Again EVERYONE  has been nice & respectful except this new guy so 5 stars to everyone else. Dr Maksomov even helped me understand a lot about pain management. Today I feel like a loser lowlife.  Sorry it's so long, I'm angry.

column3:
Pain Care of Oregon serves Salem, Oregon and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Elliot Yoo, MD, our practice delivers comprehensive care focused on improving quality of life through evidence-based treatments and personalized pain management strategies. Located conveniently in northeast Salem, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider committed to helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions and regain functionality.

Dr. Elliot Yoo brings exceptional credentials to Pain Care of Oregon. He is double board-certified in both Pain Medicine and Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, representing the highest level of specialized training in these fields. Dr. Yoo completed his prestigious fellowship in Interventional Pain Management at Harvard Medical School, where he mastered advanced techniques for treating complex pain conditions. His comprehensive approach to patient care stems from his firm belief in whole-person treatment—addressing not just symptoms but improving overall quality of life by restoring function and purpose in patients' lives.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Pain Care of Oregon, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our treatment philosophy centers on developing individualized care plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Dr. Yoo's extensive training allows him to offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures designed to provide lasting relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Visit Our Practice

We welcome new patients at our comfortable, modern facility located at 2480 Liberty St NE, Suite 180, Salem, OR 97301. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Yoo, please call us at (503) 371-1010. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at www.paincareoregon.com. Our dedicated team is committed to helping you navigate your journey toward improved function and reduced pain.
column11: Dr. Yoo is double board-certified in Pain Medicine and Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation. He completed his fellowship in Interventional Pain Management at Harvard Medical School. Dr Yoo is a firm believer of whole person care and improving quality of life through restoring function and purpose in patient's lives
