column3:
Touchstone Interventional Pain Center serves the community of Medford, OR and surrounding areas with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists is committed to providing personalized care that addresses chronic pain conditions through advanced medical techniques and innovative therapies. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining cutting-edge interventional procedures with complementary therapies to achieve optimal results for our patients.

At Touchstone, we offer a wide range of specialized interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. Our advanced treatment options include:

  • Neuromodulation Therapies: Spinal Cord Stimulation, Dorsal Root Ganglion (DRG) Stimulation, and Peripheral Nerve Stimulation

  • Diagnostic Procedures: Discography and Selective Spinal Nerve Blocks

  • Injection Therapies: Joint Injections and Medial Branch Blocks

  • Radiofrequency Treatments: Cervical, Thoracic, and Lumbar Radiofrequency Neurotomy, Sacroiliac Joint Radiofrequency Neurotomy, and Knee, Hip, and Shoulder Radiofrequency Neurotomy

  • Advanced Pain Solutions: Intrathecal Pain Pumps and Electroceutical Technologies

Comprehensive Approach to Pain Management

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our comprehensive approach includes Counseling and Behavioral Therapy to address the psychological aspects of chronic pain. Additionally, we incorporate a Network of Complementary Therapies to enhance traditional medical treatments and provide our patients with multiple pathways to relief.

Patient-Centered Care

Our number one priority is our patients' well-being. From the moment you enter our beautiful Medford office, you'll experience the Touchstone difference—compassionate care in a comfortable environment designed with your needs in mind. Our team works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that address their unique pain conditions and improve their quality of life.

We look forward to welcoming you to Touchstone Interventional Pain Center and helping you on your journey toward a life with less pain and more possibilities.

Contact Information

Website: https://touchstonepain.com/

Phone: +1 541-773-1435

Address: 1411 E McAndrews Rd, Medford, OR 97504, United States

column40:
I have been a patient of Dr.Sills and staff for about a decade, and have always been treated with dignity and understanding.I've had several procedures through the years, with careful diagnosis and follow up care. I've recently been under the care of Amanda Lewis, a highly educated and focused PA. She is a straight shooter, and immediately understood my pain issues. She has helped me with several problems, things my PCP has not done. I'm definitely feeling better. She has extensive education and training in some additional  areas that enhance her ability to take care of me and others like me,  and I feel quite fortunate to be seeing her at this time. Thanks, Amanda!
I understand the desire of the practice to discontinue prescribing opiates, given the many problems that the drugs have created in this country, and they are working on finding better ways to care for their patients aside from opiates. More modern and advanced care plans are changing all the time, and this modern practice is meeting challenging new methods in the world of pain treatment.
I wish them continued success in their beautiful new treatment building and surgery center as they continue stepping into the future of up-to-date pain management.|Dr Sills implanted a Spinal Cord Stimulator for me in June 2024. 12 days after the surgery I fell and x-rays showed that my leads moved.
He recommended trying to make adjustments using different programs, however, by the end of September my pain was still uncontrolled and I was having tingling and shooting pain down both arms.
I saw Dr Sills again, and without taking more x-rays, he told me he was confident that my leads didn't move. My battery is also very loose and uncomfortable, and he refused to do a revision claiming that the risk of infection is too high, but then proceeded to offer to remove my Spinal Cord stimulator....which would also put me at risk for infection.

I am changing Dr's and eager to get a second opinion.  I've had some intermittent relief from the SCS, so I'm not ready to give up on it.

Seems to me that a Dr specializing in the treatment of chronic pain would be much more compassionate

His staff is excellent. I'm not sure what happened, but he apparently got tired of treating me.

I wouldn't recommend him!! He seems unstable.|It took me a while to find a doctor who understood my pain and how best to control it.  But now, Sean Sills is abruptly dropping his patients.  Why?  A transitional period?  Due to what?  More expensive procedures and surgeries beyond what insurance allows with zero pain medication.  Making it hard for people to afford pain control unless they're rich and can afford expensive procedures and surgeries?  Also, when I first started going there, I would have an appointment with Dr. Sills every year to discuss my needs.  However, I have not seen him for about five years.  Maybe being dropped as a patient will be for the best!|My rating has to be at least one star. The fact that Dr. Sils considered himself Patient-Centered, his words not mine, is a mockery of what means to have doctors work for us and not the other way around. We spend our hard earned money just the same way they do, one bill at a time, so what makes him think that he can force us to pay for his choice in building a new lab, when his old one was sufficient. I used to be a patient until he allowed his manager of his office, Glenda to call me a liar in the front drive way of the office in front of other patients entering the building all because no one informed us we had had or appointment canceled on us. When we reported that we had actually been exposed to COVID, lo and behold, investigations later and we were telling the truth. You'd think a doctor who was patient centered, again his words not mine would be concerned with his other patients' health? Hmmm. Funny. You'd think, well here's news, Sils and Glenda, we do get telemedicine visits just fine. And yes our insurance does pay the bills, however you are now three more patients less, due to your very unprofessional ethical boundary breaking, and lying to us, multiple occasions, plus my husband's back was so bad due to his damage and yet you never referred him to a a surgeon who was capable and court him off his meds, for no violations!! None! How dare you Shawn Sils! How dare you Glenda!! No, thanks to you he's suffered for years, almost unable to walk!!  How dare you! Not only are you not ethical I'd argue you are negligent! Forcing a patient off the meds for no reason what so ever that you could legally give, because you gave him three different reasons why, why lie Shawn? Huh? At least be accurate Shawn! No more. We spend our money a lot more wisely, and now not for just pain blocking things that were temporary. That's your Patient Centered care in action when you come to Touchstone Pain Interventional Clinic, where you most definitely won't get any integrity what so ever. I've said my piece.|They discontinued prescriptions for pain medication. Patients were left with no options in most cases. Other providers were swamped with patients, leaving many unable to be treated.|Dr Sills
Was the most caring, compassionate and intelligent Doctor who helped me with unimaginable severe pain. He is Great!|First visit 12/18/2023 Dr. Tracy said she was putting in an authorization for the injection immediately coming out of the examination room, as she was walking away from us she held the paperwork up saying I'm sending it off now. We waited, never heard back. On 12/26/2023 I called them, I spoke with Michelle whom told me it was authorized just waiting on the Doctor's schedule to make the injection appointment. Again we waited NO call, I called back 1/10/2023 spoke with Deanna whom told me Michelle gave us incorrect information on 12/26/2023, that it was NOT authorized, and they just sent in the authorization on 1/10/2323. we wait & Again NO call from them, I called 1/17/2023 spoke with Deanna once again, whom said it JUST now went in on 1/16/2023, this is now 2-days shy of 1-month from initial visit, meanwhile my insurance denies the Injection but tells us we can appeal it, that the Touchstone didn't provide enough info, to have Touchstone call their Doctor
( peer to peer ) to see if we can get it approved, we called them on 2/5/2024 gave them insurance info & phone number to call. On 2/19/2024 Jamie of touchstone called to inform us that after relaying the peer to peer call info to Dr. Tracy, that Dr. Tracy's message back to us was she won't make the call to the insurance for us. WOW, here's our thoughts on this facility & how they chose to handle our case.. If they don't want to go the extra mile for their patients, which was clear to see ( they do not), and could careless to have wasted precious PAIN time, thus NOT allowing us the opportunity months ago to seek other facilities whom would care, was clearly a careless and disrespectful move on their part.  Bottom line even if the Insurance decided to approval the injection now, WE NOW REFUSE to go through Touchstone's facility. We spoke with our Insurance today and they agreed with our decision to look for another facility as well....|The office staff at the desk has wonderful qualities of customer service. A hideous person came in and they kept their calm. They continue to smile. I love the staff. Haven't met the doctor yet.

column3:
Natural Pain Solutions Portland

Natural Pain Solutions serves Portland, Oregon with comprehensive chiropractic care and advanced pain management techniques. As a full-service chiropractic clinic, we specialize in both cervical and lumbar spinal decompression therapies designed to provide non-invasive solutions for chronic pain conditions. Our approach integrates physical therapy modalities with cutting-edge movement science to create new pathways for your optimal health and wellness.

At Natural Pain Solutions, Dr. Grace utilizes state-of-the-art equipment including the ACCU-Spina decompression table and Cox flexion distraction table to effectively treat a wide range of conditions. Our expertise extends to treating:

- Disc herniations and degeneration

- Sports performance injuries

- Motor vehicle accident recovery

- Spinal stenosis

- Failed back surgery syndrome

- Facet syndrome

- Chronic back and neck pain

- Muscle aches and tension

- Sciatica and nerve pain

Advanced Therapeutic Approaches

Our treatment protocols incorporate multiple chiropractic techniques including SOT, Activator, and Diversified adjusting methods. What sets us apart is our integration of innovative physical therapies such as:

- Body tempering

- Customized strengthening exercises

- Movement re-education

- Comprehensive rehabilitation programs

We also provide specialized care for workman's compensation cases, ensuring you receive the attention needed to return to work safely and comfortably.

Contact Information

Visit us at 3007 NE Emerson St, Portland, OR 97211, or call +1 503-684-9698 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at [www.naturalpainsolutionsportland.com](http://www.naturalpainsolutionsportland.com/).
column11: A full service chiropractic clinic specializing in spinal decompression (both cervical and lumbar). We use physical therapy modalities and movement science to establish new opportunities for your well-being. We treat:disc herniation's, sports performance injuries, disc degeneration, motor vehicle accidents, stenosis, failed back surgery, facet syndrome, low back pain, back and neck pain, muscle aches, physical therapy, workman's compensation, sciatica, and nerve pain. Dr. Grace treats with an ACCU-Spina decompression table, Cox flexion distraction table, SOT, Activator, Diversified adjusting and more! Our cutting edge physical therapies include body tempering, strengthening exercises, movement re-education and more.

Lots of info provided as well as great coaching and advice...lots of "tools in the tool box", so to speak.  The space is amply laid out for any level of recovery/conditioning needed and he has great knowledge of the equipment and physiology to implement to a wide range of modalities.  Definitely one of the best out there.|Dr. Grace did a great job working on me after I ran two half marathons in two days and then was getting ready to fly back East the same night. The tempering and body work was just what I needed and my recovery was great! Professional, thorough and knowledgeable on just what my body needed. Highly recommend!|I can't say enough good things about Dr. Grace and how he has helped me work through very challenging lower back and sciatic pain. I herniated a disc in my lower back and tried a variety of treatments with mixed results that were not really moving things forward. Dr. Grace was able to get real results with his course of treatments and I'm now close to normal day-to-day activities and my pain is well managed. I've also learned a lot about ways to better maintain functionality and health and will continue seeing Dr. Grace. Highly recommend.|I searched for a Chiropractor and Jesus Christ my Lord Blessed me to find Dr. Thomas Grace. I highly recommend him as an excellent Chiropractic Physician who listens to you and encourages you to do the things you can do in order to recover from (in my case an auto accident and return to the way I was before which is a Blessing). He is very thorough and works with you to help you return to your whole self. His lovely wife Rachel Grace is his wonderful assistant. She's very kind and friendly to talk to on the phone and schedule appointments for you as well as doing the office work. I enjoyed watching them work together and allowing me to have my Mother Jewell be there with me too. They're a hard working team so if you need to see a Chiropractor, I say come to the Grace team. You'll be glad you did.|Dr Grace is the kind of guy who immediately makes you feel safe comfortable and welcome.  He has a vast depth of knowledge and is scientific and evidence based in his practice.  He's thorough and interested in genuinely looking at your problems from all angles.  He's honest and can help lighten the mood when you come in a little nervous and bummed out about what's going on as I did.  It's almost as if he gets you excited about the journey to recovery.  I highly recommend him|Dr. Grace is an excellent Chiropractor.  I came in with a lot of pain and with his help and the spinal decompression treatments, I felt better.  I've been to other chiropractors who do spinal decompression using different machines.  Dr. Grace uses the best equipment (which makes a big difference) and he is talented in quickly identifying a treatment plan that works and doesn't overwhelm.   He's a good person.  Also, his office is very careful with Covid precautions and I appreciated that a lot!  Good ventilation and cleaning.  I had a really good experience with this guy.  Among the Chiropractors I've seen for treatment, he ranks among the best.

Precision Pain Solutions in Bend, Oregon offers specialized medical care focused on treating both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Our dedicated team of pain management specialists combines years of clinical expertise with cutting-edge technology to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Serving the Central Oregon community from our convenient Bend location, we've built a reputation for compassionate care that prioritizes patient comfort and long-term wellness outcomes.

At Precision Pain Solutions, we utilize regenerative medicine techniques and ultrasound-guided procedures to deliver targeted treatments with exceptional accuracy. This precision allows us to develop highly effective treatment protocols customized to each patient's unique condition, anatomy, and medical history. Our comprehensive approach may include minimally invasive interventions, therapeutic exercises, and integrative therapies designed to restore function and improve quality of life.

Commitment to Accessibility

We firmly believe that quality pain management should be accessible to everyone in our community. Precision Pain Solutions proudly serves diverse patient populations with particular dedication to veterans and senior citizens. Our facility is designed for comfort and accessibility, and our administrative team works diligently to navigate insurance requirements and payment options to ensure care remains affordable.

Visit Our Bend Office

Located at 2542 NE Courtney Dr Suite 105, Bend, OR 97701, our modern clinic provides a welcoming environment for all patients. We invite you to experience our patient-centered approach to pain management by scheduling a consultation today. Contact us at (541) 208-8100 or visit our website at precisionpainbend.com to learn more about our services and how we can help you reclaim a life with less pain.

column3:
OHSU Comprehensive Pain Center in Beaverton, Oregon offers specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary team of pain medicine specialists, physical therapists, and behavioral health experts work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the complex nature of persistent pain. Located in Washington County, we serve patients throughout the Portland metropolitan area with evidence-based approaches to pain management.

At the OHSU Comprehensive Pain Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our integrated approach combines medical interventions, physical rehabilitation, and psychological support to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. We specialize in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and pain related to cancer treatments.

Our Approach to Pain Care

Rather than focusing solely on pain reduction, our team emphasizes improving function and quality of life through a combination of treatments that may include:

  • Medication management

  • Interventional procedures

  • Physical therapy

  • Psychological approaches to pain management

  • Complementary and alternative medicine techniques

Visit Our Beaverton Location

Our state-of-the-art facility is conveniently located at 15700 SW Greystone Ct, Suite 1100, Beaverton, OR 97006. We're easily accessible from Highway 26 and offer ample parking for our patients. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (503) 494-7246 or visit our website at www.ohsu.edu/pain-center.

As part of Oregon Health & Science University's network of care, our Beaverton location brings OHSU's world-class expertise in pain management closer to home for residents of Washington County and surrounding communities.

Patrick P Rask, MD in Corvallis, Oregon provides specialized pain management services to patients throughout the Willamette Valley region. With a patient-centered approach and extensive medical expertise, Dr. Rask has established a reputation for delivering compassionate care focused on improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. The practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address each patient's unique needs.

At our Corvallis location, we offer a wide range of interventional pain management techniques and treatment options. Patient-Focused Care

column38: Aaron Vaughan|Mary jo fletcher|Claudean Schaeffer|Janet Labrum|James & Debralee Marotta|debbie ferguson|Faith Panages
column40:
When I told him the purpose of my referral from my PCP regarding the medication, we waved the idea away and said that he and his colleagues had decided as a group to no longer prescribe opioids.  When I asked him why, his answer was "when I'm in surgery I want to have a clear head.  I don't want to have staff interrupt me every 20 minutes telling me that a patient was complaining that a dog ate their homework."

He discussed an operation whereby he implants a node at the base of the neck that sends a signal to keep the brain busy and in theory keep the pain at bay by giving the brain something else to focus on other than the pain.  He proceeded to say that that procedure is all he and his colleagues have decided to focus on and that he understood my frustration but that there was nothing more he could do.

When I asked him why he took the consultation and had me fill out intake forms regarding opioids, he ignored the question and kept talking about the surgery.  I probably shouldn't have said this, but I did anyways:  I asked, "are you doing the surgeries exclusively now just because there's more money in it?"  At which point he gave me a look of death and tried to end the consultation rather quickly.  He took a breath and denied the question, but the hesitation and reaction were clear and vitriolic.

All in all it one of the more bizarre consultations I've ever experienced.|Dr Rask was my anesthesiologist for my surgery with Dr Pennington and Dr Stenger. I explained to him how I always was sick after surgery and caught pneumonia afterwards and he adjusted my medication perfectly. I was so appreciative of his listening to my concerns and right now am trying to acquire him for a new surgery. Sincerely Mary jo Pinkerton Fletcher|I have delt with S1 pain for 11years.  The shots Dr. Rask does have brought my pain level down to a 3 at least.  He is kind and funny and I have never been treated bad by him.  Nancy Burgess in is office is AMAZING!!  She has been wonderful and made me feel like a real person.|FREEDOM FROM PAIN...
Dr. Rask is unbelievable!  I have had many years of experience with pain management.  I thought pain would always be my best friend.  Then God directed me to Dr. Patrick Rask!!!  Thank you Lord!!!  This is the first time I have been pain free in years!
Thank you!|My anger and frustration is based on their OFFICE  MANAGER who sent me to collections for $80 (2 "no show" fees) although disputed, with documentation.

My credit  score of 807 drastically dropped to 712 over two $40 fees including a letter terminating my patient right for treatment.

All of this during a PANDEMIC! I am appalled of the inappropriate action of their office manager. My credit report clearly shows my dispute against these two fees. Who does that?|He cares about his patients. I really have had great luck with him .|

column40:
Dr. Ford is exceptional.  I have say the office department is a bit confusing, Make sure you have your insurance pre approved even if the office tells you it is approved.  I had to pay for a shot of 600.00 out of pocket due to this.  I am not sure that things are billed correctly with diagnosis codes or even billed to the correct insurance.  And please do not have anything faxed there because they share their fax machine with another entity, which I am sure is a HIPAA violation.  I am not saying I had any bad care.  Dr. Ford is a lifesaver and has really helped me with my care.  I just want people to make sure they are covered before they get any treatment.|New patient to the clinic and based on my results from one procedure I regret not being referred over a year ago, maybe even two, that's how long I have been struggling with debilitating pain and mobility problems.
Dr Ford is a first rate listener, who zoned in, narrowed down the suspected problem in the first appointment.
He then used his educated, skilled and professional experience to give me options I'd not been offered by the other practicioners I'd seen.
My results have been promising and with 70% improvement I'm looking forward to treatment number two.|Dr. Ford has always been polite and attentive when my husband as gone there. The employees are polite and smiling and willing to answer any questions you might have. The office is clean and well lit with the restrooms just down the hall. Parking is plentiful with plenty of disabled spots available. We've never had a wait long than about 20 minutes for his appt.  While we don't look forward to making the drive, the crew there make it worth it.|Dr Platt and her staff are kind, caring, respectfully professional and organized. Very Best care I've ever had to address pain.  Dr Platt takes interest and time to listen and consider physical and emotional health.|Dr Platt has been great for me. She listened to me, and I appreciate that. I can call and the staff are always helpful and very pleasant. And for getting an appointment, I was able to do so easy.|The office staff was confused by the patient's name. Assumptions were made by the doctor. The doctor seemed to have a 'one size fits all' approach to diagnostics and treatment. When I called to cancel the appointment for treatment (patient was febrile in addition to other symptoms), the staff had no interest in the reason.|If you are really in pain DON'T BOTHER yourself even going here. It's an insurance racket where they try to experiment on one unnecessary treatment after another while you still suffer the daily grinding pain. They heap on verbal abuse to those seeking mercy from the pain yet expect you to return next month and pay MORE MONEY for them to blah blah blah..... I actually looked them in the eye and promised I would post this review and challenged with every option to change the way I was being spoken to as a patient there.  Just don't bother...  it's a waste of time and money.|The best doctor's office I've ever been too and the only medical facility that I don't experience P.T.S.D. when I go in. The whole staff is amazing in every way and they helped save my life, for which I'm eternally grateful. Thank you Bend Spine and Pain!!!

column3:
Oregon Regional Pain Center serves Portland, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Stuart M. Rosenblum, MD. Our dedicated team understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we've developed a multifaceted approach to treatment that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain management. We believe each patient deserves individualized care that respects their unique circumstances and medical history.

At Oregon Regional Pain Center, we offer a diverse range of treatment options designed to provide relief and improve quality of life. Our therapies include both non-pharmacologic and pharmacologic approaches, carefully selected to match the safest, most effective treatment to each individual patient. Our specialized interventional procedures include:

- Nerve blocks

- Epidural injections

- Diagnostic and therapeutic injections

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Spinal infusion therapy for pain and spasticity control

Personalized Patient Care

During your initial evaluation, Dr. Rosenblum and our clinical team will thoroughly review your medical history and discuss the spectrum of therapies available for managing your specific pain condition. We take pride in being recognized specialists in interventional pain management therapies, offering advanced solutions when conventional treatments have failed to provide adequate relief.

Contact Information

Location: 1849 NW Kearney St #201, Portland, OR 97209, United States

Phone: +1 503-477-5205

Fax: 888-972-4730

Website: [www.oripc.com](http://www.oripc.com/)

Visit our website to learn more about our services or to schedule your consultation with Dr. Rosenblum. At Oregon Regional Pain Center, we're committed to helping you regain control of your life through compassionate, evidence-based pain management.
column11:
FAX#: 888-972-4730

We are a full service pain clinic dedicated to compassionate, individualized care. Successful pain management includes a variety of approaches to treatment. Our goal is to match the safest, most effective treatment to the individual patient.
Our therapies include both non-pharmacologic and pharmacologic approaches. We offer specialized therapies such as nerve blocks, epidural injections and other diagnostic and therapeutic injections. We are recognized specialists in interventional pain management therapies including spinal cord stimulation and spinal infusion therapy for the control of both pain and spasticity. During a new patient evaluation we will review the spectrum of therapies available for the management of pain.

column40:
Dr. Rosenblum is the most compassionate and caring doctor I have ever had. He takes his time with you and doesn't rush. He truly listens to his patients and his entire staff are some of the nicest people I have met.|Dr. Rosenblum and his amazing PA, Shea Deklotz, have been treating me, a chronic pain patient for 20 years. Never have I left there discouraged or felt like a number. Dr. Rosenblum has gone above and beyond for me, knowing I need them. Arial, their assistant, she is a master at the task she's given and I appreciate her just as much! Thank you so much for all you each do! Misti|Six months ago I went to see Dr. Stuart Rosenblum MD PHD, after seeing two different orthopedic surgeons and my regular MD they all but one pretty much agreed the problem was in the right hip. Having this  right side pain since 2017 (same time I was diagnosed with multiple myeloma stage 2 with lots of lyric lesions in my spine) Everything indicated it was the hip. I would get a CT scan and take to different doctors, and they  would pretty much agree that it was the hip. Except  one orthopedic surgeon but he just recommend exercise. They all leaned towards the hip or I was imaging it. I went to an appointment with my wife as she a patient of his,  it was the last appointment of the day. I had my MRIs, CTs, and x-rays in hand. I knew Dr Rosenbaum as Connie has been a patient for years. So when Dr R came walking back with my wife I ask him if I could get his opinion on these CTs & X-rays Then man sat down a looked through them all, and stayed over a half hour  after everyone left. Then told me that he didn't think it was the hip at all, but was in my lumber spline. We scheduled an Floral guided injections. After that afternoon my hip felt better the next day my hip felt even better, and after about four or five days,   It been great ever since. The man stayed  past closing time to help me out when I didn't even have an appointment with him we need a lot more people like Dr. Stuart Rosenblum MD. PHD After having that pain since 2017 this man took his time to help. I am so grateful there are physicians like this.This Randy Watson, Portland, Oregon|I feel very lucky to have been referred to Dr. Rosenblum for my pain management. He seems to understand what it is like to live with chronic pain and I feel my needs as a patient are being met. So many pain clinics treat people as criminals, its a huge relief to be treated like a patient once again. The office staff is friendly and professional, I have had no problems with scheduling or insurance claims. I can't thank them enough for all the help they have provided.|I've been seeing Dr. Rosenblum & Shea for years and they are both truly brilliant, as is their entire staff.
In a time of government turmoil in pain management, they are both still doing everything they possibly can to uphold quality of life for people like myself. They are attentive, knowledgeable and do whatever they can to help me. The office staff is so kind and patient, I know from chats with them that a few are pain patients themselves, which gives me a lot of confidence that they truly understand my hardships and make the most compassionate decisions possible. Their office is busy and their policies are withheld strictly, but that's standard for all of the specialty offices I've been to. I am so grateful for this clinic.|Dr, Rosenblum has saved my life...after many surgeries I was left with nerve damage and in much pain. He helps those who are in great need. The office is busy because there are many who need him but do so with energy and efficiency with kindness. If you are lucky enough to call him your Dr. and are in need of his expertise- then you are one lucky person. Just follow the rules....|Dr. Rosenblum was one of the finest most thoughtful doctors I have ever met. I needed an injection in my back due to a ruptured disc and his help and excellent care changed my life. I would recommend him without qualification.|Dr. Rosenblum & Shea DeKlotz are THE BEST, bar none. They've always been on time or early for us. With multiple spinal injuries, surgeries, and pain issues between my husband and I, we find compassionate, skilled and effective care here.

Pacific Sports and Spine in Eugene, Oregon provides comprehensive orthopedic and pain management care to patients throughout the Willamette Valley. Our practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions and sports-related injuries. Our practice is led by Rishi Vora, DO, a board-certified physician specializing in physical medicine, rehabilitation, and interventional pain management. Dr. Vora brings extensive training and experience in treating complex orthopedic conditions, utilizing the latest diagnostic techniques and treatment protocols. His patient-centered approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply addressing symptoms.

Comprehensive Services

At Pacific Sports and Spine, we offer a diverse range of treatments including:

Visit Our Practice

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Vora, please call us at (541) 203-3310 or visit our website at www.pacificsportsandspine.com. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you with appointment scheduling, insurance verification, and answering any questions about our services.

help you with your pain. His character is kind, thoughtful, and considerate.
He answers your messages on the portal in a timely fashion, which is amazing. I will always feel confident knowing who to go to for treatment, and will definitely refer others to you without hesitation.Thank you so very much, Dr Vora!
Rhonda Dean|I had the first "test" before I have an ablation. Everything went great. The team that assisted Dr. Vora were all efficient and pleasant. During my regular appointments, I'm not rushed, Dr. Vora listens, really listens. He works with me. If I call in with a question, my call is usually returned the same day, by either Dr. Vora or his assistant.|Dr. Vora is an amazing doctor. He was very attentive and addressed everything I needed to talk to him about. Wonderful 'bedside manner' and isn't afraid to laugh along with you while, at the same time, taking your health very seriously. This guy is AWESOME!!!!!!!!|Dr Vora has given me some hope.  Right at the start he said " I have a lot of tools in my toolbox to help you with your pain.".  And each thing he has done has given some relief.  He is so good at listening and understanding the  pain issues .  He also is very good at explaining results of scans and why he thinks we should try a   particular treatment.  I felt I was in competent hands from the beginning. The coworkers and extended personnel were very conscious about safety issues during covid, and of  my medical/treatment wishes. They also are conscious of what the insurance will or will not pay, and have made me aware ahead of time. All the people there very efficient and kind.  At the surgery center, I counted at least seven different people that attended to me in different ways, including nurses, office personnel, anesthesiologist ect.  This is not counting those that made the appointments and sent reminders. I felt very well taken care of even though it was not a long procedure.

column2: OHSU Comprehensive Pain Center, South Waterfront
column3:
OHSU Comprehensive Pain Center in Portland, Oregon serves as a leading multidisciplinary pain management facility in the Pacific Northwest. Located in the modern South Waterfront district, this specialized center offers comprehensive evaluation and treatment for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The expert team combines evidence-based medical approaches with innovative therapies to address complex pain issues, providing personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

The center offers a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and psychological support services. Their integrated approach addresses not only the physical aspects of pain but also the emotional and psychological components that often accompany chronic pain conditions. Patients benefit from coordinated care between specialists including anesthesiologists, neurologists, psychiatrists, and physical therapists working collaboratively under one roof.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Housed on the 15th floor of Building 1 at 3303 S Bond Ave in Portland's South Waterfront area, the center features advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The modern facility provides a comfortable environment for patients while offering panoramic views of the Willamette River and surrounding cityscape. The center's affiliation with Oregon Health & Science University ensures patients have access to cutting-edge research and clinical trials in pain management.

Patient-Centered Approach

The OHSU Comprehensive Pain Center emphasizes patient education and self-management strategies as essential components of successful pain management. Their team works closely with patients to develop sustainable long-term solutions rather than quick fixes. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 503-494-7246 or visiting their website at ohsu.edu/pain-center. The center accepts most major insurance plans and serves patients throughout Oregon and neighboring states.

column40:
I see Dr. Mauer. She and her team are amazing. Her bedside manner is the best. She is approachable, knowledgeable and effective. Front desk, and schedulers are helpful. Nursing team is comforting. I am in better health because of Dr. Mauer and her team. This is a teaching hospital. Fellows and students help with procedures with support of attending doctor.|This department simply does not return calls. I used to work for OHSU as a master's level trainee / intern and from my experience it attracts substandard leaders who are incompetent. At least have the courage to indicate you are not accepting new patients.|Phone operator was rude and unprofessional when speaking to another healthcare provider and demonstrated disrespect and contempt toward this provider for trying to provide comprehensive patient care, as well as disregard for patients' and colleagues' time.|Hey, could you give them another chance? Perhaps share your problem directly before placing it in writing. They may be more responsive than you think. If not, ask for the supervising manager or nurse or call your provider. It is your right to use this system anytime, but think
about how you would feel if someone at your job bypassed you. These can't be removed and can leave lasting harm to a good clinic. If after you speak to them and you are still not pleased, perhaps you can write then and state you tried and got no help.
We could use a little more thought before we act at this grime time. Sorry if I sound preachy.|This place should just be shut down. It's a useless operation no one communicates no one call back. I've been trying to get them to respond for 3 months and nothing! I think the people that work there are inconsiderate unprofessional and uncaring. I'll totally wrong thing for a pain clinic. I don't know what the heck they're doing all day besides sitting around and drinking coffee I guess. Bad management!!|Honestly, I'm quite shocked by all these horrendous reviews. Having been a patient with this clinic for about 4 years, I find them so inaccurate as to question their authenticity. Their appalling accounts are such a dramatic departure from my own experience, I can't help but suspect many of these have been written by people who've never actually been treated here -- perhaps prompted by one or two disgruntled patients.

I've always found the staff to be notably polite and patient, even ensuring I don't forget to have them validate my parking ticket. I've never been made to wait longer than 15 minutes -- typically it's more like 5-10. When I call in to make appointments, they know me by name and work hard to schedule me, even when it seems there are no openings.

My pathology is quite complex with several overlapping diagnoses. As such, I see many specialists/practitioners here, including Amanda St John, Alena Guggenheim, Jordan Graham & Stephen Boyd. Contrary to what other reviews claim, I've experienced nothing but the most attentive, compassionate care -- from each and every one of them.

They take their time with me -- never rush through my appointments -- convey genuine concern and consideration. Not once have I felt they were being dismissive or skeptical of my many and varied structural, psychological and emotional complaints. Quite the opposite; I'm often amazed at their determination to help me understand and manage my pain rather than be utterly crippled by it.

I can't tell you what a relief it's been to feel so SEEN and HEARD after decades of being treated as though I'm exaggerating or over-reacting -- to feel as though I have a dedicated team of people who sincerely care about my well-being -- to know that I no longer have to carry the impossibly heavy burden of my chronic, debilitating pain on my own.

I've got nothing but the deepest gratitude for this clinic and those who work here. Please -- try it out -- I'm quite certain you'll agree.|I had an appt. Feb 9. I had an MRI on jan 31. At my appt they didnt have the MRI and it was a useless visit. I called for a trigger point injection but no longer needed it( shoulder pain that subsided). I made a phone appt. With Dianna Clapper. .she called and still didnt have my MRI results( 3 weeks after I'd had the imaging) she said she couldnt do anything until she saw the MRI.  She said shed call me early the next week. She never called. I've been in debilitating back pain. Fractured vertebra,severe collapsed disc,scoliosis. She sucks. Still haven't received call after my initial visit which was a month ago. Really disappointed in their service.|My appointment with who I thought was an active surgeon left me really disappointed and upset!  I was desperately looking for a surgeon who would give me a third opinion on lower back surgery.  I needed a pretty sophisticated surgery done on my  back and wanted a really good surgeon.  I drove from out of town for the appointment. After going over my MRI and my options I was told "Oh, I don't perform surgeries anymore."   He referred me to another surgeon to discuss my options.  So I was not only out the huge amount of money but my time and gas not to mention the pain I went through in the drive there!  Not happy AT ALL.  I suggest that these doctors should have it noted in their title if no longer performing surgery, otherwise is it not false advertising by referring to them and listing them as surgeons along with other active surgeons????  How about Dr. ?, Surgeon Inactive?    Oh my gosh, I just happened to look at the business card I picked up on my way out of this appointment it reads that the person I thought was a Surgeon and who I met with is listed as an "Instructor". hmm what happened to my request to meet with a Surgeon for a third opinion when I called?  Well OHSU?

Kaiser Pain Management Clinic in Portland, Oregon offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout the greater Portland metropolitan area. Established as part of the Kaiser Permanente integrated healthcare system, this specialized clinic provides evidence-based approaches to chronic and acute pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary team of board-certified physicians, physical therapists, and pain specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

column2: Cascade Orthopedics & Sports Medicine Center, P.C.
column3:
Cascade Orthopedics & Sports Medicine Center, P.C. serves patients throughout The Dalles and Hood River, Oregon as the region's premier orthopedic care provider. Led by distinguished surgeon Gregory Stanley, MD, MBA, FAAOS, and his dedicated team of specialists, this practice stands out as the only locally owned orthopedic facility in the area with its own ambulatory surgical center. Since its establishment, Cascade Orthopedics has built a reputation for delivering comprehensive orthopedic and podiatric care using evidence-based approaches that prioritize patient outcomes.

The center offers a complete spectrum of orthopedic and sports medicine treatments, with particular expertise in foot and ankle care through their podiatric division. Each patient receives personalized attention, beginning with thorough diagnostic evaluations that inform customized treatment plans. Whether addressing acute injuries, chronic conditions, or sports-related trauma, the medical team develops rehabilitation strategies designed to restore mobility and improve quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Cascade Orthopedics is their commitment to collaborative care. Patients actively participate in establishing treatment goals, with the medical team providing education about conditions and available options. This partnership approach ensures that care plans align with patients' lifestyle needs and recovery expectations.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

The practice's ambulatory surgical center features advanced medical technology and equipment, allowing for efficient outpatient procedures with reduced recovery times. This local surgical option eliminates the need for patients to travel to larger metropolitan areas for specialized orthopedic interventions.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.cosmc.org or call +1 541-296-2294. Their primary location is at 1715 E 12th St, The Dalles, OR 97058, with additional services available in Hood River.

It's the only orthopedics and sports medicine clinic in the region offering a locally owned ambulatory surgical center.The practice provides the highest level of orthopedic and podiatric (foot and ankle) care available. column40:
Appreciate the continued counsel and guidance from Dr. Stanley on my arthritic shoulder.  The treatment plan to decrease the inflammation and improve daily function has been slow but is working.  Also appreciate the time taken to address my questions and help me understand the big picture of where my body is at and what to expect at this stage of life for a "never ending athlete".  Many thanks!|All my visit with Dr. Stanley have gone smoothly. From exam to X-rays and surgical advice he is my go to surgeon in The Gorge.

He has been injecting HA in my wrist for years which is keeping my from life-changing wrist fusion.

Thanks to Dr. Stanley and his team for keeping me pain free and able to do the activities I love. Thank You!!!!|As a woman, it is appreciated when not only am I'm listened to but heard.  I am heard at Cascade Orthopedics and trust in Dr. Stanley's diagnosis and recommended treatment options but most importantly that I am included in the decision making process.  I also appreciate his straight forwardness with kindness.|Dr Stanley has been amazing.  Both of my kids and myself and my parents and in laws have all received the best care from him and his staff.  From broken bones to other injuries he is our go to!|Totally pleased with Dr. Stanley, Abby and the rest of the staff. They all strive to do their best. Pain-free and back to playing pickleball and snow skiing after two hip replacement surgeries last winter!|Dr. Stanley made my visit very comfortable. He explained my e- rays so I could understand. He gave me hope for a more painless future. Everyone in his work place was very friendly.|Cascade Orthopedics has always had my best health interest at heart.  I appreciate all that they have done.  If not for them I would probably be scooting around in a wheel chair (at times) or the least a walker/cane.
Thank you
Terry|Too bad this place tries to force medicine, instead of trying to look inside and see what the underlying problem is..
Kind of funny and doesn't make sense, for example how would a person that needs surgery even know they need surgery? They just say..Try this medicine..
I'm learning in general Healthcare is leaning strongly towards pharmaceutical and they think that should be the answer for everything before they try other things like even just testing even.
Before I had blamed Abigail Dumont and I apologize it is just the policy here, and how health care in general is nowadays. I begged her for a MRI and she couldn't recommend a MRI due to the policies. I wanted to see if I had trigger finger, before going to all these different specialists.
I've had pain in my hand and didn't want a steroid injection until I knew for sure what the underlying problem with my hand was.
Especially since 2 chiropractors said not to get the injections unless I absolutely had to because it can cause long term damage to the bone and joints.
But I've been in so much pain basically I'm feeling forced to get the injections now, since I want relief. And every person I've talked to won't even do a MRI or Ultrasound, won't even look inside. What if it's finger trigger for example how would you know it's nor? They don't know. They just say do this steroid injection, and see if it helps.
And thats how it is for a lot of things. You have to fight for any help. Just pushed medicine.
My cousin had to fight for testing because she felt unwell for a long time and her DR refused to do testing..I told her to fight for it, demand for it. Guess what she did listen to me and did just that, she finally got the testing she needed and they diagnosed her with a liver autoimmune disease..This is what it's like nowadays to find answers.
But I wanted others to be aware this is how it is nowadays, this is your healthcare. You will often be forced medicine, which often only masks the problems, and potentially causes more problems. And you have to fight to get any help trying to find a diagnoses. They will just send you to specialist after specialist and good luck for those specialists helping either as they seem to all just force medicine as well, before they will finally take a look inside.

I'm actually banned from this place, because I was upset and wrote another review how unhappy I was because I was forced to get medicine before a actual diagnoses.
But I do apologize to Abigail as it's not all her fault, for forcing me to get a steroid injection it's the Healthcare system I've realized. If you get help I'm happy for you, if you don't get help like me and are also being forced medicine, or not getting the help you need to get a actual diagnoses I'm sorry I get it. I fully get it.

column38: Gloria Pyeatt|Jennifer Parsons|Tracy Greig|Brandon Ebling|Josh Eaton|Mat Yeager|Angela Herbison|Laura
column40:
Went to see him last week and he talked non stop at me and over me when I tried to ask questions or correct his incorrect assumptions. At one point midway through the appointment I asked if I would get a chance to speak and he told me when he was done talking. By the end of the appointment when it was "my turn"  I asked him my question and he told me it didn't matter and I was wrong. I did not find the appointment valuable or helpful in anyway.|He is very intelligent but a jerk. Runs way behind and has no respect for his patients. He does not listen to you. If I could have given 0 stars I would have. Should have trusted my gut in the beginning.|Dr. Haber is an amazing physician who spends time talking with his patients to get to the bottom of their pain to provide a personalized treatment plan.|I do caregiving for an individual with SCA3, and we had an appointment this morning at 10am with Dr Haber at the Brookside clinic. We were referred to him by my client's primary care doctor for upper back pain that was occuring about a month or so ago. However, that pain subsided almost immediately upon prescription of propranolol for anxiety by my clients primary care at that same time. We expressed today during prescreening for the pain management that the pain is no longer there, that the medication did the trick, and that it was likely a pulled muscle or something. When Dr Haber came in, it didn't seem as though he researched my client's file at all, and the questions posed to us were often irrelevant given my client's medical condition and where he's at with it. When my client would ask a question, it would either be disregarded entirely, or we were unwillingly given unnecessarily long anatomy lessons. Diagrams, models and speeches are good when there's confusion, but my client already stated several times there's no pain, and what stopped it. Dr Haber went over the MRIs and said there wasn't anything serious in them, just a little arthritis which may or may not cause pain down the road. He suggested PT and stretching... My client does stretch, and has already done PT - it is no longer needed or desired given the state of their medical condition. Dr Haber seemed baffled that the pain went away with the propranolol, as if it's impossible that their severe anxiety exacerbated what may have just been a pulled muscle. Overall it felt like there was a huge lack of understanding and inability to listen from Dr Haber. The only real advice given was to potentially adjust/correct posture. My client felt disregarded and that their time had been wasted. I do not plan on returning to Dr Haber for pain management for my client.|Wonderful care from Dr. Haber. Compassionate and incredibly thorough, I knew I was in good hands from the start. The relief I feel is unbelievable...

Six stars if i could!|Will take on the whole patient, thoroughly works WITH you.||

Patient-Centered Approach

Her treatment philosophy centers on improving patients' quality of life and restoring functional abilities through personalized care plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications.

Convenient Location and Contact Information

Located in the heart of Bend at 815 SW Bond St, Bend, OR 97702, Summit Health Pain Management provides accessible care to residents throughout Central Oregon. Patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions can schedule a consultation by calling +1 541-382-2811 or visiting the provider profile at www.smgoregon.com/providers/ashley-michael/.

Professional Qualifications

Dr. Ashley Michael completed her medical degree followed by residency training in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, further enhancing her expertise with a fellowship specifically focused on pain management techniques and protocols. This specialized training enables her to offer the most current and effective interventions for managing chronic pain conditions while minimizing reliance on opioid medications when appropriate.
column11: As part of the Summit Health Pain Management team, Dr. Ashley Michael is a physical medicine and rehabilitation physician with fellowship training in pain management. Dr. Michael treats a variety of chronic pain conditions including back, neck, and joint pain, neuropathy, and chronic regional pain syndrome to improve quality of life and function.
column38: Erika catledge|Lisa Isley|judith brimmer|Robert Fuller
column40: I saw a PA that works under her who minipulated and misled me about suboxone in an effort to get me to consider going on it, even after I said I would never take methadone or anything like it again due to the extreme physically addictive properties. I told her I was forced onto it and she said she didn't need to hear that. She said it wasn't methadone but failed to mention it was very much like methadone with the same extremely physically addictive properties and severe withdraw symptoms if you go off of it, which include severe vomiting, severe diarrhea,  severely intensified pain, the jitters, and more. A nurse said this doctor who the PA's all work under, transitions all her patients onto it. Totally unacceptable. The PA said my back looked great and I said no it doesn't.  She read a image report, but somehow missed where it said advanced narrowing of the disk, and sloghtly less in another, which I pulled the report up and showed the nurse where it even said that, after saying it didn't indicate I was bone on bone which I am, and is why my former pain specialist, an orthopedic surgeon sent me to OHSU for it. The neurosurgeon there confirmed it. She also somewhat dismissed the moderate scoliosis both top and bottom of my spine. My spine is shaped like an S, and it is known to also cause serious pain.  Not happy with the outcome of my visit. I messaged my doctor about it because I was so upset about being misled about a seriously addictive med.|Where to begin? I just moved from WA to OR (where my pain was being managed by my PCP). My meds were stopped 4 mos ago b/c my doc there told me he couldn't prescribe me me any b/c he didn't have a license in OR ? It took me a long time to find a pain mgmt doc that took my insurance. So, when I was referred to Dr. Michael, I didn't have a lot of faith in pain mgmt docs b/c I was afraid she would just throw meds at me & I was so wrong! I was told (or so I thought) my appt was at 2:20 when, in reality, it was at 1:20! I showed up at 2:00 (40 mins late) and, b/c I drove 2 hrs for my first appt, they worked me in! Then, during my appt, she didn't immediately jump into prescriptions... she actually took the time to talk & listen to me. I've had pain for as long as I could remember & she actually came up with some great ideas on how to manage it with PT, injections, possible spinal cord stimulator, etc. The last thing we discussed was meds. She covered ALL the bases & I couldn't be happier and more thankful! THANK YOU Dr. Michael, assistant Lisa and the rest of the office staff!|Very nice dr explains everything .found her to caring how everything works .said 3 months to see her every month then go to other times|

column40:
I was referred here by my chiropractor after a car accident in September of 2024. I had two appointments with doctor Pierce and it was one failure after the next starting with the front desk. During my first appointment they downplayed my symptoms I described & asked why I was even there for an appointment. He told me he would be ordering MRIs for my lumbar spine & pelvis & to wait for Oregon Imaging to call me. 3 weeks passed & I received no call from Oregon Imaging to schedule my MRI's. I followed up with Dr. Pierce's office and they informed me that the medical assistant forgot to order my MRIs and that they would do that immediately & apologized for their error. Upon going to my follow up appointment I addressed my concerns with having to wait 3 weeks for my MRI's to be scheduled because of the negligence of his medical team. Dr. Pierce's response to this was "well would the three weeks made you any difference" and proceeded to laugh. I personally have never experienced such unprofessional behavior from a medical professional. The findings of my MRI has resulted in me needing surgery due to a false joint that has formed due to injures from my car accident.|I have had multiple  RFA treatments in multiple places on my spine. It has been such a relief to be able to sleep more than 2 hours at a time! I'm very thankful for the great care at PS&S.|I had a poor experience  with Dr Pierce & his medical assistant. Since I have the lowly UHC insurance, I wasn't allowed to change doctors and was essentially thrown out. They say a referral was sent to another pain specialist provider but that was more than a month ago with nothing recieved. It took me years to get care from a pain specialist but I have accept this immature & rude Dr, instead of having choices like other insurances? This is the stuff that makes me wish for death because getting care has been impossible & I'm hurting so much.|I have never seen so much disrespect directed towards a patient than I did when I attended an appointment with my spouse.  Both the nurse and the NP were thoroughly irritated that they had to interact with patients.  The amount of deep breathing, sighing, telling us "I don't have time to do this", etc. was as close to an adult tantrum as I've seen.  Both of us felt like we were being scolded the entire time we were there.  I am shocked to have seen this type of behavior from medical professionals.  We will be taking our care needs elsewhere.|I am writing this on behalf of my 79 year old aunt. She has had nothing but bad experiences here. She had a back procedure and her doctor recommended this place.
From the get go communication was a huge issue here. If they say they will call you back to reschedule or if you have further questions don't hold your breath for a response. Getting answers was frustrating.
I personally accompanied my aunt to one of her appointments and was struck by the lack of bedside manner demonstrated by her doctor. He seemed annoyed we had so many questions and was just distant/cold. My aunt is an older lady who was scared and feeling vulnerable. We concluded this was not the right place for her.|Took multiple test and missed a major problem in diagnosis causing the issue to worsen and the owner admitted multiple times he didn't send the test out for two weeks due to negligence he said he just forgot and that the other primary dr should of caught the issue  it if it's such a big idea although he is a specialist would not recommend it here if you care for health and want to be taken care of properly and not feel like your being brushed off|As I have aged Dr. PEIRCE has navigated the solutions to improve my life from shoulder injuries to hip and back issues. He is very involved in reducing the pain with solutions that are  effective.|I came in for a neck issue and mentioned low back pain. I was sent in for an mri.  It showed a cyst on my spine. I've been in pain for years and no doctor ever took it seriously or sent me in for imaging.  Waiting on next steps.  Still working on the neck issue.  For the first time in a long time, I feel optimistic.  I feel heard.  Cannot recommend them enough!

column3:
Columbia Pain Management, PC serves Tualatin, Oregon and surrounding communities with specialized care focused on pain relief and rehabilitation. Our comprehensive practice combines evidence-based interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system. Founded on principles of patient-centered care, our board-certified physicians bring decades of combined experience in physiatry, pain management, and rehabilitation medicine to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At Columbia Pain Management, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to treating pain conditions. Our services include non-operative spine care for patients suffering from herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and degenerative disc disease. We specialize in interventional procedures such as epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation trials for patients who haven't found relief through conventional treatments.

Diagnostic Excellence

Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic capabilities, including electrodiagnostic testing and EMG/NCS studies to accurately identify nerve and muscle disorders. These precise diagnostic tools allow our physicians to develop targeted treatment plans addressing the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Rehabilitation Focus

Beyond pain relief, Columbia Pain Management emphasizes functional restoration through comprehensive rehabilitation programs. Our physiatrists work closely with physical therapists to create customized exercise protocols that improve strength, flexibility, and overall function while reducing pain and preventing recurrence.

Patient Information

We welcome new patients at our conveniently located Tualatin office. For appointments or consultations, please contact us at +1 503-654-5636. Our practice is located at 19255 SW 65th Ave, Tualatin, OR 97062. For additional information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at www.columbiapain.org.

column40:
If you want to go to a clinic where you your lied to by both office staff and the incompetent Dr Russo then this is the place for you. I went 130 one way for my appt and got within 2 miles of the clinic when I was called by rhe clinic that Russo had an emergency and had already left the clinic was unable to see, I asked if there was another provider and was told there wasn't. Russo instructed the employee to lie to me.. obviously Russo was unaware that my sister in law works for the clinic and told me he had no emergency and had not left. Who does that? As a patient suppose to feel safe..If your physician will lie about something so stupid what else is he going to lie about. I never received any sort of communication in regards to this, not even a "sorry for your inconvenience "with that being said I have made complaints to both the insurance company and also a complaint with medical board.|I had a successful RFA procedure there performed by Dr. Russo, and I found him to be incredibly competent and caring, patient and thoughtful. After years of agonizing neck pain, he was able to reduce it 65%, this was life-changing for me and by would not hesitate at returning to his care.|I am unable to even give one star to Columbia Pain Management, as their ineptitude has carelessly caused irreparable damage to my well-being, career, and quality of life. Nonetheless, to post you must select at least one star.
My neurostimulatar, the generator that severely reduced the nerve pain I had been experiencing, died and after waiting approximately 1.5 years to get it replaced that date arrived.
Finally, June 21, 2025 arrives and we travel 2 hours to Wilsonville for the surgery and awakening from the anesthesia to learn they replaced the power unit. However,  they couldn't connect it as the "wiring and leads were burnt up." Clearly this never entered their thoughts that this could be an option and left the new unit in my back disconnected.
Does Columbia Pain Management follow or display any concern for their patient, "HELL NO!" The refer me to another surgeon an it takes an additional seven-plus weeks to see this new surgeon on September 12, 2024.
I have yet another waiting period for an authorization to fix the problem that Columbia Pain Management neglected to correct the first time.
Because they lack professionalism and appreciate knowledge to effectively replace what's already there, it has severely impacted the quality of my life, marriage, career, and the ability to get any form of quality sleep for more than 1.5 hours.
It taken me awhile to write this and my anger and desire to verbally lash out would have changed the entire tone of this message.

I leave you with an old motto "Used car buyer beware!"

John Bellman|Honestly, if I can get no stars, I would I came to this establishment about five months ago, my doctors re-recommended me here for a nerve test because I got an injection in my lower back and I got this seriously hard burn that was going from my eyeball and neck to my index finger thumb middle finger on my left hand honestly, it was weird because they said it was a coincidence but they played it off like I was lying. I guess the doctor basically said yeah man I dropped a bomb on your back. What do you expect, I went to another doctor surgeon at rebound and Vancouver and said I have a pinched nerve there and he needs a surgically fix it but when I was at coulbia Paine management , I felt as if they were treating me as if I needed more drugs that's why I was there making stuff up and I'm trying to blame them for something that went wrong after injection  and that's not the case.!! I was just explaining to them that I feel like I was flipped upside down all of a sudden all the pain in my leg is gone and it was gone for the 1st 3 days after injection after that it's all back to day one pain so now I have a lower back and neck problem and now all the pain is in my upper left chest behind the shoulder blade shooting down to my hand makes me very nauseous.when both of my neck and leg start shooting pain  Makes me wanna vomit. I can't even look up to make eye contact with people without shooting or being ""barbecued  it's just it's been very painful. It's affected me!! affected my work!!! it affected my marriage!!! affected my relationships even with my pets!!! Something just gotta give. I'm gonna get the nerve test done here, but hopefully it's a lot smoother and they've I don't know.grown up and  Hopefully just act more professional I mean they are doctors and I'm supposed to trust you with my life literally! They need to do a better job to listen to their  patience, not pick and choose who you want to help today don't treat everyone like drug addicts because honestly, I had a really really big problem and you guys told me that I was lying. I even got turned around from the ER in Hood River because it's something that you have to order for an MRI. You just can't come in for an MRI and YOU GUYS WOULDNT OREDER ME ONE WHEN I CAME UP FOR A  Referral they told me I will be fine , then at the ER I was turned down as well because like I said, I didn't have a referral from the doctor. I just went and saw because they didn't think I was worth their time. I don't know  I was still panicked and scared and stressed out and and above all, I feel like my pain migrated to my top of my left eyeball down my neck to my left arm down to my hand, so I was very scared and I wanted this to be looked at like something's wrong. You know there'd be no difference if you just lit my arm on fire with a gasoline and threw a lit match at me .
Until A neurosurgeon doctor told me a little trick that helps and scheduled a surgery to un pinch my nerve and the help for my primary care physician which he's been taking this more serious than any other doctors that I've talked to about this,
THANK GOD other than that guys I'm just really scared about coming back to this place and it's just darn it. If there was other places I could go to different doctors I could talk to in this profession I would!!  but I feel a little landlocked to you guys ,  I just really hope, it's a different experience the second time around and then the payment I paid you guys when I was there you guys called me back. Say I owe you more money so I paid it and then a couple months ago but I get another bill out of the blue I haven't been there and then I talk to a guy named Chris and billing and he tells me oh yeah you just got to keep pay so this is weird too. If you guys you know do business like that where I just have to keep paying and micromanage these payments with you guys and when you said I'm already paid up that is also ridiculous I do not trust this establishment and that really sucks. well it sucks for alot of us here in the mountains in the Pacific Northwest..|I've had multiple procedures with Columbia Pain Management, and each time I have come away glad I came to this place for help!
Both Dr Riggart and Dr Russo are very personable and professional, and they really do know how to help!
The whole office is very professional and friendly. I highly recommend this facility!|My husband made an appointment to see them and since we live quite a ways away he made the appointment for 9:30am. The day before the appointment he receives a confirmation for his 8am appointment.  When he called them to explain we live over 2 hours away they told him there wasn't anything they could do.  We left our home at 5:45am in order to get to the clinic on time and when we got here there was a sign on the door explaining they were closed until 8:40am for a meeting.  Not very happy, they don't seem to know what they're doing here.|Initially I loved the place. The admin staff is rude and not professional. Dr Rigert is great. I've had several back injections performed and two ablations. The last one however did not work. It actually made me hurt worse than ever. The pain meds they prescribed were only for a month. I called for an appointment to refill my prescription and they refused to book it stating I still had a balance because insurance hadn't paid yet. I paid my $1000 deductible yet they weren't going to schedule because insurance was pending?! I called my insurance company. Pain management billed incorrectly so they sent it back and it had already been paid on Sept 27th, almost a month ago! Still no appointment or call back or answers to repeated emails. My husband has the same issue. His dr referred him three times but they claim he has an outstanding bill from years ago. They claim they'd talked to someone he'd never even heard of! It truly is all about the mighty dollar for them.|At first, I was referred to another clinic in Hood River I was told to go home and take Tylenol and do sit ups!!!!!  First of all, I couldn't sit for more than 10 minutes at a time. and to do sit ups----whatever for????????  SO---I complained to the office in Goldendale and told them to PLEASE refer me to someone that will DO something for me. So that's how I got to your office. Everything has been great since. My pain is being managed very well and the office is very, very nice to go too. I wish I didn't have to be there BUT----since I have pain, your office is the of choice---- forever!!!! Years ago, my mom had severe pain in her back. She was sent to this very office and this very Dr., and she spent the rest of her life pain free. Thank you, Dr. Rigert. I am most thankful to each and everyone in this clinic. Thank you.

column40: Last time I was there I sat in waiting area for almost 4 1/2 hours past my 11 am appointment time, have not been back since.|Jack Berndt is the best pain management doctor I have ever had and he may very well be the best pain management doctor on the West Coast. You might think that's a big claim but Dr Berndt listens! He actually hears what a patient says. And he doesn't just throw pills at a problem. The man has changed my life. I will never be healed or cured. But I am able to enjoy some things that others take for granted. Like going to a concert. I was able to go to two this year. A classical music and a rock band. I started doing light exercises. Dr Berndt made that possible. My life was not so productive before I moved home to Oregon and found him.|I was so afraid to see a pain management physician because of all the negative things I had heard in the past from people I knew. (Not about Dr. Berndt, but about other docs in the same specialty.) First impression for new patients is always reception. The sweet gal with long dark hair was super kind and very helpful explaining the process regarding forms, insurance etc. Then I met Dr. Berndt's Medical Assistant. Another home run. She was knowledgeable, efficient, patient and empathetic. I liked her immediately. Then I met Dr. Berndt. Within the first three minutes I could tell that my fears and apprehension we're totally unfounded with this guy. He came in prepared with my X-rays and past medical history and was familiar with my condition that makes me have pain. He educated me on procedures that can potentially reduce my pain level a great deal. These were treatments I didn't even know existed. He was empathetic to my financial status and continued the medication that was way less expensive than some of the newer ones, and confirmed my Ortho doc's recommendation of surgery to fix some of the issues. He was a very good, kind, empathetic and more than competent doctor. I highly recommend Dr. Berndt and his stellar staff if you need a pain specialist.|I have been a patient of Dr Jack Burndt for over 4 years, unfortunately our insurance changed and left me out of network.  As I have been trying to get "IN NETWORK" Amber, their receptionist was very rude to my wife and brought her to tears and will "NEVER AGAIN DEAL WITH OUT OF NETWORK PATIENTS "  Well, Amber gets to go home and relax over a glass of wine or whatever while I have to deal with pain 24/7 and she doesn't care.
