column38: Brian Burke|Terri Wood|Natalie Prakash|Silvia Magana|GC|Frances Garcia|Pricilla Triplett|jeremy brock
column40: I'm uncertain that this referral was made in "Good Faith" . Finding the location was a bit difficult without clearly designated signs. A vinyl banner at the main intersection 2 blocks away  identifying Peace Health as a business practice operating in that location would have made finding the practice easier .  The choice to inform  the patient of the GUIDELINES SET IN PLACE was after the fact of sitting down with the clinician to review the practice and accept the fact that this facility only offers a limited scope of treatment and does not prescribe certain medications or at least specify the purpose of providing the service available was really vague . These notifications should be made plain and clear from the onset of the referral . This  practice of making these choices clear is rather deceptive along with what might be termed a TAPER DOWN PROGRAM for certain medications should be posted and made available before the patient is half way through the examination is deceptive and eluding to the nature and cause of the referral itself . Those 2 key points might be better reviewed by the joint commission along with the federal trade commission that oversees the insurance regulations. I'm certain that I'm not the only one to encounter this inconvenience and costly measure . I plan on disputing the charges accrued today based on the facts outlined above and encourage any of the readers to do the same by reporting these complaints directly to the Washington State insurance Ombudsman. The guidance provided as an option is not inline with policy procedures advised by the CDC, DEA, or Washington State Department of Health and Human services . Sorry to say that the choices for using BUPINORPHINE or any of its variant formulas Containing ,  Suboxone , SUBUTEX, or naloxone is now a part of a greater CLASS ACTION SUIT being litigated in courts across the nation . Peace Health organization should consider their contributory role in failing to counter the measure of epidemic proportion of fentanyl addictions compared to methadone programs being easier to access.  Take a careful look at what people are expecting as community standing together and looking for better healthcare program to be introduced using federal funding under  the SAMSHA  allowance .|Dr Platt is a incredibly empathetic man who excells at clinic and surgical skills both! The entire staff is professional while still wrapping you in compassion! Southwest Interventional Pain Center and Dr Platt are a life changing combination I personally could not survive without. Thank you all for the wonderful care and giving me back my life, YOU ALL ROCK!|Front is not the greatest, I've noticed every time I bring my mom in she stands for a long time to check in even if there is no patients in front of her. They don't even acknowledge she is there, they don't "say I will be with you shortly."  Dr Parker is great!|Have been taking my husband here for almost a year, his provider left the clinic 2 months ago and now they are not wanting him as a patient. WHAT CAN A PLACE IS THIS ????  WHY ARE YOU ON THIS LISTS TO DO SO ?? Quest Diagnostics !!!|My Doctor & his assistant were the best. Others I cannot vouch. column38: Bijan Ansari|Pamela Muir|Michelle Allen|Avelina Hernandez|Jesse O'Brien|Karen Grovom|John Maxwell|Shadow Fall
column40:
I visited this Doctor for pain on hip bone. After an initial consultation and filling 10 pages of redundant and repetitive questions which were mostly unnecessary. I was given another appointment for an injection in my back. He told me that this will either make the pain go completely away, or nothing at all or something in between! Well, the next day my pain got worse than before and is hurting me a lot.
This was he worst experience in my 79 years of life. He has an extremely unpleasant and rude demeanor. He did not appear to have access to my medical records and I was not given any summary of the procedure after my visit. This event does not appear on my medical charts and I have no documents to show me a record of his injection and the medication.
I would highly recommend to stay away from this practice and seek help somewhere else.|Found him to be an astounding listener. He puts great value in what you tell him and seems almost anxious to hear more from you. He is most sympathetic about any misgivings you might have  as to the course of treatment he suggests. You can tell that your relief from pain is of highest priority to him.He is impressed when His patients are extremely smart and can carry on an intelligent conversation with him. His staff is incredibly nice to patients and puts extra effort in help making sure you schedule all the appointments and treatments required. I kind of felt that they would even come get you if transportation was a problem for you. The benefits derived from the level of genuine care received there made it so I didn't have to keep a second appointment. I sleep better at night from their clinic's care. What a place.|August 2022 Update - after almost a year as Dr. Jayaram's patient I am changing my review.

The one treatment that worked fabulous was the injections he gave in my SI joint. That was a miracle of pain relief. His assistant Ronnie is a saint. That's where the good review ends.

His primary treatment for me was morphine three times a day. I thought about if I wanted to become dependent on morphine for a long time. It seemed kind of extreme and scary. Finally, I believe it was last October 2021, I decided it was worth trying. It did help some of course, arthritis pain in the winter was still an issue though. He wouldn't talk to me about my situation and experience. He only wanted me to take the morphine, period.

I truly thought I was taking it regularly and not missing hardly any. However, clearly that wasn't the case as I wasn't able to pick up my prescription in a timely fashion this July and found I had accumulated an extra week supply over the last several months. Maybe I was feeling better and just forgetting? Maybe I could take less and have another prescription on hand for flare ups which happened all along anyway?

He marched in the exam room read me the riot act and was extremely mad at me. Seemed to think even after 11 months of knowing me that I was only seeking opiates from him and told me I could find another doctor if that's what I wanted. He insisted that the treatment I've been using for the last 15-20 years wasn't effective based on studies. Didn't matter that my experience was different. I wonder if my vocabulary didn't accurately fit his pain vocabulary? Anyway, he stormed out of the room leaving me feeling shell shocked. The nurse assured me I could call in for refills and it would be ok. That he was worried about getting in trouble and losing his license. After processing this for about an hour,  I decided if I wasn't taking the morphine correctly anyway, I wanted to get off it. Called in asked how best to stop taking the morphine. The nurse said she couldn't tell me that the doctor had to do that. I HAVEN'T HEARD FROM HIM YET, THAT WAS AUGUST 3. I tapered down beginning that day for a week then stopped. Started feeling weird and sick then looked into officially how to stop and found the process is called going through detox and should be done under doctor care. It takes 4-10 days. Decided to continue on my own and am fine now but it was a miserable week or so. SHAME ON YOU DR. JAYARAM|I saw this doctor about 17 years ago for some lower neck pain that was bothering me for a long time.  He have me the pain injections twice and the pain that I had been suffering for years never came back.  I now have other pain that I would like to see if he can help with.  He was an awesome doctor.  I now live in Texas and will come up to Oregon to see him cause in Texas I can not find anyone as good as him.|Don't believe the negative reviews! This man, and his team save lives!|They have no soul or seem to care about the patient
He almost paralyzed my dad|STAY AWAY.  CALL OTHER PAIN CLINICS,
STAY FAR AWAY|Condescending drug pusher. Avoid.

column38: Larry Bumbar
column40: I was so hopeful that they would help me, but no... It took months to be told sorry can't help you... I injured my upper back in late 1999 and saw doctor after doctor, and had test after test with no resolve... I was put on Oxycontin and stayed on it for 10 years plus. After a decade I decided to go threw a medical detox in Jan of 2014 to see for sure where my pain level truly was. I'm in so much pain I do not want to continue to suffer. If I would have known I'd be made to suffer in  intolerable pain 24 hours a day I would have never gone threw detox. They say the are a Pain Management Specialist, but if that were so and there skilled they would have done more than see me for a total of 30 mins in 2- appointments send me out for a MRI than cut me loose suffering!!! I'm left in deliberating pain without resolve and do not know how much longer I can continue t go on like this... So much for helping someone in real crisis!!!!!!  I had such high hopes they could do something for my pain besides pain pills instead they did nothing except cost me money, time, and aggravation.... I'm left considering options I thought would have never entered my mind, but enough is enough being in this kind of pain is not worth going on suffering... I'm reaching out for help all over from the detox center, primary doctor... I'm going to continue to look for help for a little more time... Until I have exhausted all my options, but it's getting close to time out...

column48: Are you accepting new patients
column49: Yes.  All prospective patients must complete our multi-page application and sign release of information forms so we may get their medical records.  We request records from every provider/clinic seen in the last two years.  Dr. George personally reviews those records to make his decision to accept or deny a patient.  Due to the failure of those providers, clinics, and hospitals to respond in a timely manner, the application process can sometimes take a few weeks.

Our clinic combines traditional Chinese medicine techniques with modern therapeutic approaches to address acute and chronic pain conditions. Located in Southwest Portland, we've been serving the greater Portland metropolitan area for over a decade with personalized treatment plans that focus on restoring balance and promoting the body's natural healing abilities.

At Oregon Acupuncture & Pain Relief Clinic, we specialize in treating a wide range of conditions including back pain, migraines, arthritis, sports injuries, and stress-related disorders. Our licensed practitioners utilize various modalities such as:

Oregon Pain Center serves Portland, Oregon and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Portland's medical district, our specialized clinic has been helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions since 2005. Our multidisciplinary team combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address various pain disorders, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

At Oregon Pain Center, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy referrals, and complementary approaches to pain relief. Our board-certified physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain, allowing for more targeted and effective treatment strategies. We believe in empowering patients through education and collaborative decision-making.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. That's why our approach extends beyond symptom management to address the emotional, psychological, and functional impacts of pain. Our compassionate staff works diligently to create a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected throughout their healing journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 503-828-9569. Our clinic is conveniently located at 11750 SW Barnes Rd #270, Portland, OR 97225. We accept most major insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling options to accommodate our patients' needs.

column38: Richard Klingman|Stephanie McKee|Yogi J|Julie Sheehan|Kat Livingston, RDN|Laura W|Dave G|Edwin Y
column40:
Dr Jorgensen and his staff are true professionals with great attitudes and willingness to help their patients and have always treated me with respect. Dr. Jorgensen has been very informative and has always presented me with all the opportunities and let me choose my path.  This clinic is my third clinic in 15 years and it is significantly better than the others I've been to, both the doctor and the staff.  I'm not having injections at this point, but if I needed them in the future, I would have high confidence in Dr. Jorgensen's ability to treat me.|Dr. Jorgensen is one  of the few doctors I have encountered these days that truly seems to care about his patients. He takes the time to get to know your situation and you as a person. I'm so pleased that he's my doctor. I'm waiting to see if the injection works but regardless, I'm optimistic he'll be able to get my pain under control. I highly recommend him & his staff.|Dr. Jorgensen comes across as one of those doctors who are just in the business of collecting insurance money.  At my first appointment with him he came across as arrogant, unconcerned with me, in a hurry, and we talked for only about 5 minutes.  In the last 6 months since then I have only talked to him that one time--his assistant is the only contact I have ever had. Even when he does a procedure on my cervical spine, he doesn't talk to me before or after the procedure. Within minutes (after a procedure) I am sent out the door while still sedated.  At the last procedure he injected too much of the sedative and he still sent me out the door within minutes after the procedure. I was bumping into walls and falling onto cars as I made my way to my car. Thank God I brought a driver!  Once he prescribed a muscle relaxer that caused me to hallucinate.  I went online to read about the medication only to discover that it is not suppose to be taken with one of the other medications I am on. You trust a doctor to check into these things--isn't that the point of giving him a list of all of my medications at my intake appointment?  The procedures he has done for me have only increased my pain significantly.   You'd think that due to my pain being so much worse he'd want to talk to me, but no, I have still only talked to him once.  Lastly, I made a 2:00 appointment for today.  I received 2 or 3 reminder phone calls which said that I had an appointment at 2:00.  When I got there the receptionist said that I missed my 1:45 appointment and so it was canceled.   Even if my appointment was at 1:45, which is was not, the appointments at the Oregon Pain Center only last about 5 or 10 minutes, so why on earth couldn't they see me? I demanded my usual 5 minute appointment with the assistant so that I could get a referral for an MRI and get a referral for another doctor. I will never ever go back to the Oregon Pain Center.|I am 44 years old, I am an anesthesia provider, and a patient with degenerative disc disease.  I have had 2 spine surgeries and one ablation prior to meeting the team at Oregon Pain Center.  Caitlin, the RN scheduled all my appointments like a pro. Albert, the Physician Assistant, listened to every word I said, and treated me respectfully, as a patient with legitimate pain.  Dr. Mambalam did my injections and RFA beautifully and I got 90% relief (so far!) Even working in healthcare, I felt sometimes as though I was not believed.  I felt belittled, and as though I should just stop asking for help.  OPC made me feel welcome. They understood, and they treated me respectfully.  For that I will always be grateful. Don't give up.  Call OPC.|Dr. Jorgensen gets 5 stars for being very thorough and respectful to his patients. His assistant Sara gets 5 stars too, but the other staff gets 1 star. The communication between the lead MA, Receptionist, and other staff is not working well. I've had 3 different staff members tell me different things with no consideration to my schedule or how they are affecting my life and work. Every appointment is over 2 hours of time. That's 2 hours of overtime working and being away from my family. I'm sure that I am speaking for the majority of the patients there, we REALLY don't want to have to go! If I had a choice, I wouldn't be there. I've dropped everything I'm doing to get there and I've had instances where the traffic was bad and I called to see if I should reschedule and was told to continue there  (driving for an hour), only to get there and be told to reschedule. Or even better, drive for over an hour only to be told that it was changed or cancelled and no one told me.|OPC took me in when other clinics claimed I was an addict, and worked with me to get pain free in 7 weeks. Their staff is more than courteous; they're like a family. I love Dr. Mambalam and Albert's rapport, in working with me they did what other clinics couldn't.. give me hope for a pain-free life without lots of medications. The injections I had were the least painful I've ever gotten and I am glad to be on a minimal medication regimen. Thank you so much Oregon Pain Center!|Staff and PA are just fine, but the rot starts at the top I assume. Been in past few months seeking spinal injections. Used their portal to message and ask about payment, my share, etc. Never got a response. Had to reschedule my appointment, and the day BEFORE my new appt date, was called and told insurance wouldn't cover the injections, so I pay full price or do a different approved procedure (because insurance knows best apparently). Also their billing dept doesn't review this stuff until day of, hence the late notice. Their departments seem compartmentalized and disappointed. Icing on the cake is they probably don't pay/treat their employees well enough to retain them since they had several people quit and have been short staffed. This has management's dirty hands all over it, but if you can put up with not getting a hold of anyone in a short staffed office, I'm sure the medicine itself is at least up to standard|Now I know why Trevor Jorgensen has so many single star ratings. While I was in severe pain, I felt rushed. He glanced at his watch often. I shared how much pain I was in, but it didn't occur to him to address my suffering. I later told my PCP and he was shocked I wasn't given pain medication.

Jorgensen saw my MRI and confidently told me I needed surgery, possibly totally disc replacement. "It's pretty bad," he said. My heart sank. A month later, I started feeling better on my own. My surgeon told me I'd be fine with just physical therapy.

Not impressed, and perhaps even a little angry, with Jorgensen's incompetence and inability to engage with patients in pain. I'd think a place named the Pain Center would have expertise in addressing people's suffering.  Not so.

My sincere suggestion - go somewhere else.

Edit: look at your response, Jorgensen. Your words speak for themselves.  Now I am relieved I spoke frankly. May potential patients be aware.

Edit 2: it appears Jorgensen deleted his nasty reply.

column3:
Radiant Pain Relief Centres in Tualatin, Oregon offers a revolutionary approach to chronic pain management through their proprietary Scrambler Therapy technology. Serving the greater Portland metropolitan area, this specialized pain treatment center has helped thousands of patients experience significant, long-lasting relief from various chronic pain conditions without the use of drugs, invasive procedures, or ongoing treatments.

At Radiant Pain Relief Centres, patients receive personalized care using FDA-cleared Scrambler Therapy, a non-invasive treatment that uses bioelectric nerve stimulation to retrain the brain's perception of pain. Their comprehensive approach addresses neuropathic pain, CRPS, fibromyalgia, chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy, and various other chronic pain conditions that have often proven resistant to conventional treatments.

Patient-Centered Care

The dedicated team at Radiant Pain Relief Centres prioritizes patient comfort and results, offering a thorough assessment process followed by a customized treatment plan. Most patients undergo a series of 10 daily treatments, with many reporting significant pain reduction after just a few sessions. Their high success rate and commitment to improving quality of life have made them a trusted resource for pain management in the Pacific Northwest.

Contact Information

To learn more about their innovative approach to pain relief or to schedule a consultation, visit their website at www.radiantpainrelief.com or call +1 503-379-0790. Their clinic is conveniently located at 18747 SW Martinazzi Ave, Tualatin, OR 97062, with easy access from I-5 and ample parking for patients.
column38: Karen Andrews|Leslie VM|Cindy Brown|Viki Dyrdahl|Heather Dowdy|Arcadia Dyer|Vernon Wells|Manya Berekoff
column40:
My husband had terrible pain from neuropathy in his feet.  We tried every pain cream on the market but didn't really get to pain.  We did a lot of research into treatments that were pill free.  Scrambler Therapy was brought to our attention and it's reviews were encouraging.  We have been part of the program for a few weeks and his pain has decreased significantly!  With this decrease in pain he has been less depressed and sleeping thru the night.  No adverse side effects  and med-free us the best part.  Highly recommend Scrambler Therapy!!|Scrambler therapy at Radiant has been the miracle I needed.   Surgery and all types of injections did not provide relief and it felt as if my life was over. I spent my days and nights in a recliner with a heating pad. My physiatrist (an MD who specializes in physical medicine and rehab) provided a referral to Radiant and through their help, I got my life back! The care managers are well-trained technicians and problem solvers. They're also exceptionally kind and understanding.|I have had a wonderful experience with both Radiant and the staff. I have fibromyalgia and small fiber neuropathy that cause a lot of pain. The therapy through Radiant has taken that pain away and given me my life back. I am now able to get out of my house and do activities for the first time in over a year- with little to no pain. The staff at Radiant have been extremely kind, compassionate and nurturing. I would not have gotten through this process without their help and kindness. Thank you Radiant!|Radiant Pain Center has been a life saver for me. I have degenerative spine disease and really bad nerve pain in my hips, legs and feet.  Prior to going to Radiant Pain Center I was using a walker and sometimes a wheelchair due to the terrible pain. I was on round the clock oxycodone to control the pain but it still was there. I could not get out of bed in the morning until my pain meds kicked in. My husband had purchased me an electric wheelchair for when it was really bad. I started going and at first it worked for an hour or two then the next time a little longer and a little longer. Now I just go in for what I call a "touch up" when the pain starts to leak through again. I am on very little pain meds now, just when I really over do it. I own a business and can work full time again. I swear by this system hope it works for you!|I have a neuro disease CRPS -- this place made it worse. The person doing the treatment is not even a medical professional and she had no idea what she was doing. After almost a week she still spiked my pain instead of getting it to 0 on machine.

We demanded a refund and instead flew to Calmar Pain Relief Dr. D'Amato in Florida. He is the expert on scrambler therapy. He got me to a 0 every single day on the machine. And it helped me a lot.

He said the outcome depends on the expertise of the practitioner and clearly that Radiant Pain had no clue what they were doing. In fact, the woman doing it in Tualatin tried to put the leads directly on my pain area, which Dr D'Amato said was horrifying aa that is the opposite of how you use scrambler technology.

Avoid this place like the plague. Do not waste your time and money. Go to a dr who performs it like Dr D'Amato, or Dr Boese in Eagle, ID. Because this Tualatin place is a joke and will make you worse.|Scrambler therapy has changed my entire life. I thought it was woo when I heard about it, but the data supports it and it's FDA-approved. The therapy works with your own neuroplasticity and growth mindset to forge new neural pathways, so it's basically an entire mind-body rewiring that teaches your brain (with your enthusiastic support!) that your body doesn't need to feel pain where it's no longer injured.

I went in ready for change, and I am so grateful I did.|I was a little skeptical about this procedure when I first heard about it but a very reliable person told me it work wonders for their pain.  My trigeminal neuralgia was killing me so I tried a treatment at Radiant Pain Relief Center.  The results were amazing the throbbing pain was gone after one treatment.  The pain has returned a few times but follow up treatments are keeping it under control.  I recommend you try this.  It has sure worked for me.|After over 8 weeks of constant pain all over my whole body and 4 different doctors/ providers that said there's nothing wrong with me, and not being able to work.and having no one to sign off on my disability paperwork... I asked close friends and family for help. We researched ourselves and found that my symptoms were RSD/ CRPS.
Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) also  called reflex sympathetic dystrophy (RSD), while there is no cure, there is treatment that helps here. Its this scrambler therapy for this nerve disorder.  Thank you to this clinic and their staff for helping me and believing my pain. I felt a difference in my first 2 sessions.  And I have done over 20 now. And will continue with it because I  have so much help.  I'm very blessed and humbled and beyond thankful!

column40:
My old pain management Dr kept asking me to get injections and rhizotomy and tramadol. Didn't work. I had my first appointment with them yesterday and already taking my feelings into prospective. Would definitely recommend. I just don't understand why they don't work with all pharmacies. My insurance company never heard of it before.|Some of the absolute NICEST people ever! Dr Hites is fantastic! The Bridgeville office in particular makes you feel right at home. Shawn is the man! Brigit is so awesome we just love her! And Wilyn who just started is just as friendly as can be. Can't say enough GREAT things about this office! Always a pleasure to be seen at this office!|I have had a few visit now and dr hite is great and explains things well. Also has a great plan of attack so to speak for helping with my back problems and pain! Everyone at this office is super nice and friendly!|My first visit was today, what a amazing visit. The doctor explained all that was going on with my pain, what type of treatments were available. The explaination was through and in terms that I understood. Doctor took the time to draw what he could do and how it would be done and the relief it could give. Gave me all options to help me in treatment and make my choice to proceed in my care.
Also, the staff was efficient, friendly and caring. Appointment was on time.
So if you are looking for a excellent office to help you in dealing with the pain you are in by all means look up this office for your care.

Update 1/12/2025
I just wanted to update my care with Pain and Spine. I am still receiving care from them and it is still execellent. I am now getting ready to have a temporary wires to be inserted in my back one on each side of my spine for a pain stimulator device to be attached on February 3, 2025, to see if the device will stop my pain. If so then a permanet device will be implanted and attached to the wires. But, let me tell you prior to this decision there was injections and testing done to find out what was causing my systems.  And also to see if I were a canidate for this device.
My opinion is still the same these people care about their patients. If you are in severe pain like me then you need to see them and msybe they can help you to.|I've been coming here for several years. I've seen several PAs as well as Dr Hites. From the front end receptionist to the specimen collector and everyone in between- I've never had a bad experience. On my first visit, I was in so much pain!! It was wonderful to find a provider who cared enough to listen and treat the problem!! Highly recommend this place.|Absolutely love Dr. Hites! He's an amazing doctor and takes the time to listen to his patients!|Since I've been at passpa, I feel like I'm at home with my Dr Hites! He one of the best Dr's to have on ur team  He listens and he never judges you. column40:
I started seeing Tim Jones April 2024 and he has helped me to get answers to my ongoing neck/shoulder issues that I've had for over 20yrs. He listened to my concerns, has come up with a treatment plan to help me and also got me to the specialists that he felt needed to review my case and I finally got answers this year and am set to get surgery this upcoming Thursday to replace 2 discs in my neck that are pressing on my spinal cord. I am and will forever be grateful for him and his legit care for his patients. If you are needing someone that wants to take the time to listen to your concerns, come up with a treatment plan for you and really cares about his patients- Tim is your guy!|I have a great Dr and Nurses they are all very nice and answered all my questions.! They were very gentle when the Doctor was refilling my pump and he raised the medicine so I would be more comfortable. They helped me get up and down on the table, because I have a broken shoulder and it's still swollen and hurting so very much because it's still out of the socket. they both were very gentle with me!! I love them all they are all nice and understanding !! I would tell anyone if they need a pain Doctor !!|If you are looking for a good Dr.. look no further! The Dr's/Staff here are all amazing, they actually listen to your concerns,  they explain everything  in detail!!  Not pushing medication, which is huge! Dr. Gandhi makes sure at all times you are comfortable  for what  ever treatment you are receiving!!
Thank You all , you are a Blessing to me and my Family!!|Excellent Doc. & Staff. My Dr. is Dr. Gandhi & he is wonderful! He listens and explains things very well. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Dr. Gandhi is respectful to the staff he works with and the office has a positive family feel. He teaches staff that are interested in understanding what and why he is doing what he does. I find this refreshing and refreshing that the staff are interested in learning from him.  Pain can be anxiety producing, as can procedures to help pain relief. The staff, the technicians that assist Dr. Gandhi & Dr. Gandhi put me at easy and are enjoyable to talk to under a sometimes difficult condition of seeking pain management. Kudos to all the folks atThe Greensburg Main St. Office!|I had an excellent visit. I feel terrible for not remembering the doctor's name, but he did my ablations and took care of my pain pump. He is professional with an excellent bedside manner. The staff is on the ball and very knowledgeable. They are all respectful and nice as well.|If I could give zero stars, I would. I didn't necessarily have any issues with the staff at the office, but their billing department made an error on TWO visits to their office so it was not covered by my insurance. I've reached out to the doctor's office numerous times as well and all they say they can do is email billing. NO ONE has called me back, but I keep getting bills. I have NEVER had issues like this with a doctor's office. I would suggest going somewhere else.|All the staff is very professional and informative! They take great care of me and my medical situation.  Dr Ghandi is an excellent physician! I appreciate all the staff in this office! I am happy I have the opportunity to go here.

column38: Jeffrey Cohan|Thomas Huyett|Leo Scaccia|Frank Fasano|Zenni Lefti|Daniel Asterino|Florence McCullough|D M
column40:
In 1997, a large bone spur was pressing down on a nerve near my spine and causing pain which eventually turned into a 'dropped foot' The Orthopaedic Doctor I saw recommended that I needed a simple surgery to remove the bone spur. He told me that I would return to normal in two weeks.
The surgery was performed on May 21, 1997.
Two weeks later I developed a Hospital Infection that turned into Sepsis,
Since that time I have had 16 major Surgeries in the past 27 years.
Nine fusions, multiple Laminectomies and decompressions, both shoulders replaced and many more life changing surgeries.
I was in pain 24/7. I was in so much pain and so depressed, I was ' not a happy camper.'
Then luckily, I found Pennsylvania Pain And Spine.
From the moment I walked into Pain Clinic, everyone I spoke to, made me feel like they really cared about me!
The Doctors staff was both highly professional and compassionate about the level of pain I was feeling. Everyone in the office greeted me with caring smiles and began my treatment that immediately made me feel better.
If you are suffering like I was, I highly recommend you that you set up an appointment at Pennsylvania Pain And Spine.|I called to make an appointment and the voicemail stated we only take patients with insurance. I then got someone on the phone and told them I will pay upfront. They scheduled me for 2 weeks later. I get a call one day prior to my appointment saying they are canceling since I didn't have insurance. This is not only rude, but a violation of my rights and their oath! I will not fight this as I will be treated poorly even if I won.|I am in the middle of my back surgery care after surgery two years ago that did not go well. My surgeon discharged me with a good luck and I still had trouble. I found Pa Pain and Spine, read the reviews and am seeing the team and Dr Bozak presently. Currently being treated.
He said that he would not give up on me as others have. And I believe him. Friendly competent folks at both locations. I would recommend highly.|I was a patient at PP&SI From October, 2023 until April, 2024. I went there seeking some relief from intense sciatica and weakness in the hamstrings. Rounds of PT and chiropractic had provided no relief. After doing some research, I found that Dr Qu and the Institute seemed to have a fine reputation. And, there was obviously a lot of positive feedback from satisfied patients. I also viewed on-line videos and agreed with their conservative approach.

At my first visit in October of last year, the consensus was that I had spinal stenosis. I was given an epidural shot in November that did not have an effect. Then I had an MRI done in January and turned the disc over to the PA and Dr Bozak. It clearly indicated on the written MRI report that I had "anterolisthesis of L4 relative to L5."  My question is with this indication of spondolisthesis in early January, why wasn't a spinal fusion recommended right then? And, why did I go on to have nerve block facet injections (February) and then the MILD procedure (April) in which a laminotomy was performed? This also provided no relief.

I've since come to find out that this condition is almost always dealt with through a spinal fusion. Long story, short, I finally moved on to a top notch neurosurgeon who advised me at my first visit that I would need a spinal fusion. (Which I have had)
But, by the time I found the surgeon, saw him and then, unfortunately,  was denied coverage initially because I had to do another round of PT, finally having the surgery in early October --- I experienced an additional six months of pain and continually worsening symptoms.

I only wish that PP&SI had advised me back in January that they could no longer help me and recommend that I see a neurosurgeon. When I first went to the Institute, I didn't even own a cane, but by the time I left there as a patient, I couldn't do without one. I mailed a letter about my case to both Dr Qu and Dr Bozak in October, but got no reply. After a month, I re-sent the letters via certified mail. Still no reply, nobody reaching out.

I don't think that I was wrong to be disappointed with how my case was handled. Now, I'm additionally disappointed that I'm being ignored. This has been a sincere and respectful request for clarification on my part. Nothing but crickets...|I transferred from another very well-known pain management place in the Bucks county area, and I never looked back. Pennsylvania, pain and spine takes excellent care of all of my needs. It doesn't matter what I need to talk about, Tara, Dr. Bozak and Dr. Acharte Always take any time that I need to address my needs. I am a complex pain patient and have been for almost 15 years. This can be tiring for a practitioner as well as the patient, but you would never know it, considering the care I receive. I would recommend this practice to anyone who needs excellent, comprehensive care without receiving the side eye from their pain management office. I'm sure you know what I'm talking about.|My Physician Assistant, Jennifer Della Guardia is a phenomenal Physician Assistant and has worked with me for years through all my debilitating pain arthritis and recently in the last 3 years a horrible accident. She has been an amazing medical professional. When she did my trigger points she was very gracious she tried to do as much as she could for me as far as locating pain and giving me as many injections that she could to provide the best relief. She was always a good listener and give you as much time as you needed. I don't see her as much presently for insurance reasons, however I recommend her tremendously to anyone who wants someone with medical expertise and has the awareness in understanding the emotional impact of pain has on its sufferers. That is so important since it's not just treating pain medically, it's establishing a emotional rapport with the patient by displaying her compassion and comprehending the emotional suffering that occurs when someone suffers from chronic pain!

In my opinion, and I'm sure I'm not alone in the way I feel, Jennifer Della Guardia demonstrates this daily with all her patients daily, regardless of who she is helping!!! 
Thank you, Jennifer for helping me as much as you have!|The email I received asked my opinion of Lauren Bruce, Physician's Assistant, at Pennsylvania Pain & Spine Institute. Appointments with Lauren are positive experiences... very friendly, professional and sincere interest to help improve my quality of life. Definitely recommend this organization.|Dr. Acharte has helped to rule out my worst case fears for what is causing my pain. He always listens attentively and is generous with his time. Our appointments never feel rushed, and I'm able to get my questions answered. Most importantly I enjoy seeing him because he highlights my strengths in this situation, and inspires hope in me for a future with manageable to no pain

column40:
I was scheduled for knee surgery, walking with a cane because it hurt to put pressure on my knee to walk ~6 on pain chart.
THREE days after my injection by Dr Alli , I had ZERO pain and cancelled surgery. It has been a month and knee is still a zero pain level.

Also, I have two vertebrate slipping out of place. A few months ago my sciatica nerve hurt to walk. I was limping. Dr. Alli gave me two spinal injections and it was gone. Still gone after 3 months !

Highly recommend injections over surgery!!!!|The staff of PICPA is amazing. Dr. Ali is so thorough and will spend as long as needed answering questions. He genuinely cares and it is evident. I don't believe I have had an appointment that was under an hour long- he takes his time and never makes you feel rushed. I have learned so much about my condition, treatment options etc from him- he talks AND demonstrates things in a way that anyone can understand. The office manager,Nikkole  is a  gem. She  is always  so kind and helpful- she  has helped with many things  I've needed assistance  with or problems  I've had.  She is  definitely  an asset  to the office!  I am so thankful  to have found the   them and I appreciate  them more than I can  express!|I've been going here for the past year and a half. First off the staff is amazing. They always greet you with a smile and they know who you are. You're not just a patient. They give the best care and are very professional. Dr. Ali is also just as amazing. He to knows his patients and will talk with you. He explains everything very well and makes sure you understand what your situation is and what steps maybe needed for relief. I receive injections in my spine, at first I was afraid, rightfully so do to the nature of the procedure, but I wouldn't go anywhere else. He expects the absolute best from his staff and they preform their duties above and beyond my expectations.  All in all the dr and staff are welcoming, professional, caring and courteous.|I definitely recommend Dr. Ali- I really enjoy his personality! it makes getting my injections with his sense of humor much more relaxing! Thank you to Dr. Ali for giving me relief from pain and a few laughs along the way!|Dr. Ali is a true life savor! He truly cares about his patients. He has given me my life back. I can also say to other folks out there considering injections for their backs but are afraid of the pain well worry no more he will take his time with you and make your experience as pleasent as possible! And the staff are all such nice and understanding professionals! I'm so happy I found this place|Dr. Ali and staff made me feel like I really mattered. They took my concerns to heart and made me feel listened to and cared for. Dr. Ali was determined to provide me with much-needed pain relief. And he was as serious about finding the root of the cause as I was. I would undoubtedly put my pain management health in Dr. Ali's hands in the future. I would recommend PICPA to anyone dealing with undiagnosed/untreated pain. Dr. Ali was respectful of my referring physician and their recommendations.|I have always had a great experience with the Dr. he takes his time and explains everything in detail. Thank you Dr Ali for staying with me. A++++++++++++++ Dana Clark Roles|Dr. Ali is an amazing doctor. He listens to you and talks about your issues. The only way you would need to drive far is if you would need a procedure done as he doesn't do them in the Chambersburg office. They always seem to get me in pretty fast for an appointment. I have been seeing Dr. Ali for about a year now. I recommend him to anybody that wants a good honest doctor that will listen to you and he will truly do his best to get your pain down as much as possible.

column2: Pennsylvania Pain Specialists | Gene Levinstein, MD
column3:
Pennsylvania Pain Specialists in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania serves patients throughout the Lehigh Valley with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Gene Levinstein, MD, our clinic has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans designed to address each patient's unique needs and circumstances. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our team is dedicated to not just managing symptoms, but improving overall quality of life and functionality.

At Pennsylvania Pain Specialists, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management techniques. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, minimally invasive procedures, and rehabilitation therapies. Dr. Levinstein specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Using the latest advancements in pain medicine, we develop customized treatment plans that may incorporate nerve blocks, epidural injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other innovative approaches to pain relief.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and explain all available treatment options. Our compassionate team guides you through every step of your pain management journey, ensuring you feel supported and informed. We believe in empowering our patients through education and active participation in their treatment decisions, fostering a collaborative relationship that leads to better outcomes.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern facility at 163 N Commerce Way in Bethlehem is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. The clinic environment is designed to provide comfort and ease anxiety, creating a positive experience for all our patients. With convenient parking and accessibility features, we strive to make your visits as stress-free as possible.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Levinstein and the team at Pennsylvania Pain Specialists, call us at +1 610-867-7246. You can also learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our website at www.papainspecialists.com. Our office is conveniently located at 163 N Commerce Way, Bethlehem, PA 18017, serving patients throughout Pennsylvania with exceptional pain management care.

column2: Pain and Spine Specialists of Pennsylvania - Uniontown
column3:
Pain and Spine Specialists of Pennsylvania - Uniontown serves residents throughout Uniontown and surrounding Fayette County communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions affecting the back, neck, joints, and nervous system. We offer personalized treatment plans utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management approaches to help patients regain mobility and improve quality of life.

At our state-of-the-art facility, we provide a wide range of specialized services including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted physical therapy protocols. Our physicians work closely with each patient to understand their unique pain challenges and develop comprehensive strategies that minimize reliance on opioid medications while maximizing functional improvement.

Convenient Location

Our Uniontown office is conveniently located right off US-119 in Uniontown, Pennsylvania. Take exit 40 toward Main Street and travel one quarter of a mile. Our office will be on your left at 404 W Main St, Uniontown, PA 15401. The central location provides easy access for patients throughout Fayette County and neighboring communities.

Contact Information

For additional information about our services and treatment options, visit our website at painandspinespecialists.com. column2: Philadelphia Smart Pain & Wellness: Samuel Grodofsky MD
column3:
Philadelphia Smart Pain & Wellness, serving Allentown, PA and the greater Philadelphia region, offers specialized interventional pain management under the expert guidance of Dr. Samuel Grodofsky, MD. Conveniently located in the Park Professional building adjacent to Cedar Beach Park, our practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address both acute injuries and chronic intractable pain conditions.

At Philadelphia Smart Pain & Wellness, we believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our mission centers on promoting physical, mental, and social harmony through comprehensive pain management strategies. Dr. Grodofsky specializes in image-guided procedures that precisely target pain sources, enhancing rehabilitation outcomes while minimizing reliance on potentially harmful medications.

Specialized Services

Our practice offers cutting-edge, minimally invasive therapies designed to address pain at its source. These advanced interventional techniques allow patients to regain functionality and improve quality of life without the risks associated with long-term medication use. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual's specific condition and health goals.

Expert Care from Dr. Samuel Grodofsky

As an interventional pain medicine physician, Dr. Grodofsky brings specialized training and expertise to each patient interaction. His approach focuses on enabling patients to become mentally and physically stronger through precise diagnosis and targeted treatment protocols. This patient-centered philosophy ensures comprehensive care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

Visit Our Practice

We welcome new patients at our Allentown location: 2200 Hamilton St, Suite 209, Allentown, PA 18104. Contact us today at (215) 366-2803 to schedule your initial consultation, or visit www.phillysmartpain.com to learn more about our services and approach to pain management.

column2: Dr. Manish Shah, Pain Management Physician
column3:
Southeastern Pennsylvania Pain Management serves patients throughout Limerick, PA and the surrounding Montgomery County area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by the esteemed Dr. Manish Shah, this specialized medical practice has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The clinic's patient-centered approach combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Dr. Manish Shah is a board-certified Pain Management Physician with extensive training and experience in treating a wide spectrum of pain disorders. His practice offers specialized care for numerous conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Arthritis and joint pain (shoulder, knees, hips)

  • Nerve-related injuries and neuropathy

  • Whiplash injuries

  • Pain resulting from car accidents

  • Work-related injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Shah's practice is his commitment to truly listening to patients. He takes the time to understand each individual's pain experience, concerns, and goals before developing a personalized treatment plan. This patient-centered approach ensures that care is tailored to address specific needs rather than applying a one-size-fits-all solution.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

The practice offers a range of interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative approaches to address pain at its source. Dr. Shah emphasizes minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery with fewer complications.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Manish Shah, patients can visit the practice website at https://www.sepapain.com/provider/manish-shah-md or call +1 855-235-7246. The office is conveniently located at 410 W Linfield-Trappe Rd, Suite 120, Limerick, PA 19468, United States, with accessible parking and a comfortable waiting area designed with patients' needs in mind.

column2: Joshuason Rehabilitation & Pain Management LTD: John Wrightson, MD, FAAPMR
column3:
Joshuason Rehabilitation & Pain Management LTD serves New Castle, Pennsylvania and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services. Under the expert leadership of John Wrightson, MD, FAAPMR, our practice has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider dedicated to improving patients' quality of life through evidence-based treatments and personalized care plans. Since our founding, we have helped thousands of patients overcome chronic pain, recover from injuries, and regain mobility through our multidisciplinary approach.

At Joshuason Rehabilitation, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team specializes in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. Dr. Wrightson's fellowship training in pain management and physical medicine allows us to offer advanced interventional procedures alongside traditional rehabilitation techniques.

Comprehensive Services

Our practice provides a wide range of treatments including medication management, therapeutic injections, physical therapy, and minimally invasive procedures. We take pride in developing individualized treatment plans that address not just symptoms but underlying causes, helping patients achieve long-term relief and improved function.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We believe informed patients make better decisions about their health, which is why we take the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes in detail.

Visit Our Practice

Joshuason Rehabilitation & Pain Management is conveniently located at 3212 Wilmington Rd, New Castle, PA 16105. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to provide the highest standard of care. New patients are welcome, and most insurance plans are accepted.

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at +1 724-276-0695 or visit our website at www.joshuasonrehab.com. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey to recovery and pain-free living.

I have always loved Dr Wrightson.  He really cares about his patients.  I love him even more when he hired Christy Beer! She is absolutely amazing.  She has such beautiful hair and is just simply beautiful! You might hear her from anywhere you are but that's because she has a BIG HEART OF GOLD! She makes you feel like you've been friends from childhood.  Did I mention her hair?  it's as beautiful as her soul. I would do anything for her. Now onto Marni! Marni is one of my favorites! She may be little but she has a big heart too. Let's not leave out wifey! She is so nice. She even gave me her number just incase I ever needed her . This place has some pretty good people and I can say they have taken care of me for years! Thanks Doc, for always  being kind and funny when I need it most!|Called to make an appointment asked if they took my insurance, they said yes. I got my records, sent them then I got a call from them saying they don't take my insurance!?
The young guy on the phone was very helpful, but whoever he was asking definitely was not! I'm so desperate for relief from migraines, I've been everywhere for years. They told me they took my insurance i was so excited! Then they were rude. Get better customer service and knowledge of what insurance you accept before you get people's hopes up!!|Do not go here!!!! I know multiple people who have gone to BOTH practices and have experienced a nightmare.  They are currently cutting existing patients prescriptions down so they can prescribe to new patients. These people have followed all guidelines, done the injections(that they force you to do even if you know they don't work) and followed all the rules. They have cut their entire clinic down twice in 2 months time lying and telling them the DEA made them. (Do YOUR research there has been NO change in prescribing guidelines) they switched to their new castle office for their forced injections in which you can expect there to be DOGS in the "sterile" injection room. Then if you switch your insurance and no longer have an insurance that requires high co-pays, they will call you a month after you PASS a drug test and claim you failed it. On the topic of insurance, they are also charging their chippewa office patients $40 co-pays which my insurance confirmed is ILLEGAL because it's a copay for a doctor and never ONCE was I seen by a DOCTOR. If you go there and have been paying your DOCTOR copay, you need to call your insurance because you are owed money. I have confirmed with 3 other patients this was done to them as well. StAY away!!|From Dr Wrightson,to Kristy Beer, to the nurses, & office staff are not only amazing at their jobs, they are ALL wonderful human beings who honestly care about their patients, helping them live a better life. I have been a patient now for over 7yrs, & the few times I had an issue it was resolved quickly w the help of 1 or more of Dr Wrightson's employees. Wonderful Dr, caring treatment, &,  although I can't speak for every patient, anytime I've been in the office I have been witness to every patient there at that time is treated with respect and kindness. If you're dealing w pain, THIS is the place to go!|Both Dr. Wrightson and his nurse practitioner, Christy Beers, are amazing! They are a wonderful, caring team that truly listen to their patients and try to best assist them. I came to this practice by fate when my Dr passed away and am so blessed to have been taken on by such a caring Dr. I have been referring friends and family to this office for over 6 years now. They have 2 therapy dogs that work alongside the team as well! I cannot stress how amazing it is to have a Dr that truly cares and takes the time to listen, especially in this field of medicine and the treatment of pain management.|The entire staff treats you with respect and are very understanding to the treatments needed regardless of what they are. They work with scheduling as much as they can and have always been extremely kind. Very highly recommended as I've never been to a pain management facility with this much caring about an individual.|Absolutely the worst place to go to for your care and pain management!
They have absolutely no problem in getting you addicted to opioids and hand out pain pills like they are M&Ms. Then they knowingly will make up a arbitrary reason to stop your medication, " without as so much as give you a explanation!"
They are impossible to reach via the telephone and they mismanage your insurance billing to squeeze more money out of you. Very coincidental that they stop your prescriptions about the same time they can't squeeze more money out of you!

The whole originization is nothing more than a street drug dealer with a license from the state. They should have their main office in the Hil|Dont go here! Ive been on pain medication for 15 years. Im an older woman. They cut my meds down so much  saying it was the DEA's fault.  Im in so much pain it isnt funny. Now I have to find another doctor.

column3:
Advanced PainCare and BioHealth Institute in Camp Hill, PA offers comprehensive non-surgical pain management and wellness solutions for adults seeking relief from chronic conditions. Our integrative approach combines cutting-edge treatments with personalized care plans designed to address each patient's unique health challenges. Serving the greater Harrisburg area from our convenient Camp Hill location, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare partner focused on improving quality of life without invasive procedures.

Under the direction of Jean Santo, MD and Jamie Shirey, CRNP, our clinical team brings decades of specialized experience in pain management and functional medicine. Dr. Santo's background in innovative pain relief techniques complements Nurse Practitioner Shirey's holistic approach to wellness, creating a powerful combination of medical expertise that benefits our diverse patient population.

Comprehensive Care Approach

At Advanced PainCare and BioHealth Institute, we believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our team develops individualized treatment plans that may include advanced interventional procedures, therapeutic exercises, nutritional counseling, and lifestyle modifications. This multidisciplinary strategy helps patients achieve sustainable pain relief while improving overall health outcomes.

Patient-Centered Experience

We understand that navigating healthcare can be challenging, especially when dealing with chronic pain. Our dedicated support staff provides assistance with scheduling, insurance questions, and treatment coordination, ensuring a seamless experience from your first appointment through your entire care journey.

Contact Information

Visit our welcoming facility at 97 N 36th St, Camp Hill, PA 17011 to experience our patient-centered approach firsthand. For appointments or questions, call us at (717) 791-2860 or explore our comprehensive services online at www.advancedpaincare.org.
column11: Advanced PainCare and BioHealth Institute in Camp Hill, PA, specializes in wellness care and non-surgical pain relief for adults. Led by Jean Santo, MD, and Jamie Shirey, CRNP, our team creates personalized care plans to help patients achieve their health goals with dedicated support for scheduling and assistance.
